Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: clunkclick
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks at OMR,6-20 march.Fantastic weather,low humidity,breezy.Rooms are pleasant,with showers that work,and reliable aircon.The food is good by buffet standard,the themed restaurants pretty average.The pool area is very good,ample sun beds in a clean environment.Swimming in the sea is difficult,rocks,weed and heavy swell make it hazadous,red flag flying most days.Lobby bar a pleasant place to sit and have a few drinks,and play the odd game of scrabble(oops just given ID away).Yes would recommend this to friends and family,but the flight time of 11 hours from UK is a definite downer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: SusanneTD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed from February until March for two weeks. The vacation was great, and the staff is suberb. Fernie and Vincent, miss you guys!! The rooms are chic and new, unfortunatly we had to switch rooms from 1407 to 2002 because of a weard smell. We switched to 2002 in the middle of the night, and the hotel switched your loggage and we kept the new room the rest of the vacation. Thank you for your quick and good service:)! The food is amazing, they have 3 restaurants and the hacianda (buffet). You need to try all of them, they have amazing food on all of them. Book a table at the oriental restaurand, and sit in front of the chef while he makes the food and throw knives in the air!! Super fun! They have great shows in the theatre every night at 9. Be there! And the entertainment staff is always there to make your holiday more and more fun. Join the Ocean Idol, you will remember it!!! ;) If you want to have a quite day, lay down at the beach area. There you can only hear the breeze and the ocean... Lovely. And if you want some other day to be more fun, lay down at the pool and the entertainment staff will keep you busy with water aerobics, yoga and more fun.. There is also music and drinks by the pool. Great drinks:) If you want a great beach area, you need to look someplace else. The beach at playa del carmen was washed away in some hurricanes, too bad. But they have great pools, and you can take the local bus to some local beaches. About 30 min away you can fin a little beach called la playa xpu-ha. There thea have great food, drinks, live music, very chill. Just a handful of people.. Go there... Book an appointment at the spa, and come early. Sit in the relaxation room for 30 mins and you will be a new person. !! Oh so good. And book a photo session at the photo shop. The girls there take AMAZING photos.. Thank you everyone at ocean by H10 for an amazing vacation, thank you doctor for making me well again, entertainment staff, spa personell, waiters, bartenders. Everyone, i mean everyone at ocean is sweet and friendly. Hope to come back soon. Love Harald and Susanne, from Oslo, Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a quiet couples get away”
Reviews.Author: Robin V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ocean Maya Royale from January 3rd 2012 until January 10th 2012. We were greated warmly at reception with a welcome drink and friendly smiles. Check in was painless. We were given directions to our room as well as a map of the resort. We found our room effortlessly and it was perfect. We were 20 steps from the pool and pool bar and 50 steps to the beach. Couldn't have asked for a better location. The room was clean and comfortable. The shower leaked like I had anticipated after reading many reviews. But it didn't matter to us being that we didn't have to feel the long term effects of this. The restaurants were perfect. you did not have to book them as long as you got there fairly early there were no line ups. The buffet was also excellent especially the omlettes in the morning and the freshly cooked seafood at supper. Lunch we usually went to charos the mexican restaurant by the pool. It was a small quiet resort that I would recommend to any adults. it was nice to leave our young kids at home and have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: Great resort. We went for two weeks. This resort was our 2nd week. The staff was exellent and the service was also exellent. They treat you like you are their family. We are going next year for 14 days again. We are planning to stay two different resorts and this one will be one of them for sure. It was our 25th anniversity. They gave us a cake and the next day at breakfast Alfredo gave us a drink and put hats on our heads and the sax player played the theme song from Titanic. The staff wished us a happy anniversary eveywere you went. If you want a quiet and restful holiday, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: BrownOwl01
Reviews.Content: Ocean Maya is a great place to go for an Adults only. Its a long way of the main road so quite private except access from the beach. Most of the staff are very friendly, but found that when you are coming to the end of your 2 week stay they are not so interested in you the same as when new people arrive. Mostly staff always say good morning or hello and have a smile. Food - There is always something for everyone, even if on days there is something you don't like. Food is not piled high so consequently staff are always coming out of the kitchens to refill and therefore mostly hot. Tables are cleared as soon as you finish eating so not left lying around. You get shown to you table which is a nice touch. Rooms - Nice, clean and compfy. With dressing gowns and slippers a nice touch. Plently of clean towles every day. In a nice and quiet position and no noisy neighbours. Entertainment - The staff work extremly hard during the day entertaining by the pool etc then go and practice for the evening entertainment, which was always different each night (but not on a 2 week holiday as they repeat the first week again). They were very good, Overall, from the cleaning lady in the public loos to the beach boys who worked tirelessly everyday on the beach. To the garden gangs and the waiters/waitresses, everyone worked very hard to keep us happy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - pretty good”
Reviews.Author: acadia59
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our all-inclusive Mexico vacation at the Ocean Maya Royale. This was our 5th time to Mexico and while we have stayed in much nicer resorts, overall the OMR was pretty good. It's a small resort, and with that are pros and cons. The upside is easy access to everything and you can even get to know the staff. It has an intimiate feel to it, but still offers everything you would expect. The pools are great, it's clean, there's a spa and fitness room, security, and a la carte retaurants. Because of its smaller size however, there are only 3 a la carte restaurants - Japanese, Italian and Mexican. The main buffet dining room offers a different theme each evening for dinner, but they all seemed to blend into the same thing night after night. Food is ok. If you like seafood, there was fresh shrimp being cooked up on the grill nightly and they were fantastic. The Japanese restaurant was quite good - we went twice. We upgraded our room upon check in to what they call "priviliege". I wouldn't recommend the upgrade...I thought it was a waste of money and not worth it. The "privilege" building is located as far away as possible from the beach area, so if you're looking for a room close to the water, you won't find one in this building. It's located next to the main lobby buidling. The OMR has a very, very tiny beach. Most people hung around the pool or in a sandy area near the water. The beach is basically non-existent. It's not recommended for swimming and it would be impossible to snorkel. No one was in the water - it's just not conducive to any kind of water activity. We ended up going to another beach for our water activity. Weather, as always, was fantastic in Mexico. We hung out around the pool and service was excellent. Overall the OMR is a resort that offers a quiet, relaxing and low-key vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved OMR!!”
Reviews.Author: Jodi64
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and two other couples stayed at OMR the first week in March. We were very pleased with our entire stay. We did not upgrade to priviledge and were happy with our choice. We had beautiful ocean front rooms and our beds were great! One of the three rooms was musty smelling but there was not alot to do other than switch rooms and who wants to pack up after your all unpacked!! The beach was the only downside to the resort and we had been warned prior to our arrival. The buffet was great as well as all three restaurants. The animation team works hard and were fantastic! Javaier is by far the best "pool" bartender there!! He is ALWAYS willing to wait on you with the biggest smile! I was amazed how many people did not tip him and were so demanding! I'm guessing they are the same people that complain about this resort. The lobby bar is great with fantastic service also. Thanks OMR for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise! We will definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGrandma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived home after a 10 day stay at OMR from March 3-13th and would turn around and go right back if we could! What a wonderful vacation we had! It was fantastic from the moment we arrived at the resort, until the moment we sadly left. I cannot say enough good things about the resort and it's staff. The resort is gorgeous! It is not a huge spread out resort like some that you have to walk miles to get to things. It, instead, is more intimate with fewer guests and reminded me of a small gated neighborhood, where, when you walked around; you recognized your neighbors as you passed them by. It consists of several smaller two story buildings that hold 8 units each with beautifully kept grounds and lots of lovely landscaping and walkways....not to mention the wildlife....cute coati and racoons, lounging iguanas, and mischievous black birds that were always fun to watch. The restaurants were all great. My favorite were the Italian and the Mexican, but the tempura at the Japanese restaurant was mouthwatering, too, and the chef's show was very entertaining, so make sure to reserve a seat at the grill area. There was always a great selection at the buffet, too. Make sure to have them make you some garlic butter shrimp....wonderful!! Our room was great . I like a softer bed and they provided us with a foam mattress pad right away when we inquired about one. We always had lots of hot water for showers. Our room was always immaculately clean and the frig well stocked. The swimming pools are terrific. One has a deep section that is 8 1/2 feet deep and also neat shallow ledges to lay out and tan on. The other has a swim up/walk up bar and was used as the activity area for water-excercise classes, volleyball, etc . The water in both was crystal clear, and usually a perfect temperature to swim in. There were always lots of lounging chairs available either around the pools or on the sandy area with lots of shady areas available when wanted. The best thing about the resort, though, is it's staff!!! Everyone there, and I mean every staff person that I came in contact with....was wonderfully friendly and helpful and always had smiles on their faces. Many started addressing us by name after only a day or so and knew or preferences for drinks or even how we liked our coffee or eggs cooked.....unbelievable! I have a hard time remembering some acquaintances names that I've known for years! Everyone made us feel so very welcome! I actually kidded the general manager that they must be putting something in the water to have such a happy staff! You could never find a nicer, happier group of people to be around....anywhere! They definately kept the smiles on our faces, too! I had a full massage and facial at the Spa with Hector.....great experience.....well worth the money......my muscles are still relaxed! The only possible negative I could mention about the resort.....would be the actual swimming beach areas. The sandy beach lounging area is very nice, but the beach adjoining the water isn't the best for swimming due to seaweed and other natural sediments carried in by the surf.....which the resort can do nothing about....other than keep cleaning it up and removing it.....which they do a great job of. It was the same with any of the resorts along that general area of ocean front. The beach was nice to walk on for excercise, though, and there is a lagoon about a 10 minutes walk that has a nifty river that you can get into and float out to a shallow sandy area with clear, clean water where it meets the ocean. We did that several times and had a great time. It fulfilled our wanting to get into the ocean. We did take the free shuttle for a trip into Playa del Carmen and swam at a beach there one day, but we thoroughly enjoyed the pools at OMR the rest of the time. If having a perfectly pristine beach to swim in is a huge priority.....you may want to consider a resort in a different area.....but this one has it all otherwise and I totally recommend it!! My husband and I were celebrating our 46th anniversary while at the resort, so I booked us into one of the Romance suites....a little larger two room suite with a jacuzzi tub, which included the priveleged status for preferential reservations in the restaurants, top shelf liquor, and a reserved area on the beach area with padded tanning beds, etc......but we became friends with many other guests that weren't "privileged", and they were just as happy campers as we were. They had gotten into all of the restaurants that they had wanted to and were happy with their drinks, service, etc. and had always found a tanning lounge in the beach/pool area without having to get up at 6 AM to get one, like at so many other resorts. Would I do the "privileged" again.....sure. I enjoy a glass of Grand Marnier in the evening and like Bacardi or Havana Club 7 Rum in my drinks. Plus, at my age, I can use all the extra padding I can get on my chaise lounge! :) But, do I feel you need to be "privileged" to have a wonderful time at OMR....no. As I said before.....I HIGHLY recommend OMR. I want to personally thank their ENTIRE staff for making our vacation and 46th anniversary such a wonderful experience. A special extra thankyou to Claudia, Maria, and Suzanne who really went the extra mile to make sure we felt we were a special part of your OMR "family".

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in an instant.”
Reviews.Author: mwaggon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled during spring break. We have been to other resorts in this area. This place was very solid as a contender to the likes of Palace Resorts and Iberostar. Small atmosphere so if you are looking for the up all night drinking crowd this isn't for you. The food was very good, so long as you went to the Ala Carte restaurants. Good Food presentation and above average cuisine. Its not Ruth's Chris or Mortons but It is way better than anything at applebees or Lone star. Desserts are not the forte in mexico from my experience. The priveleged area is nice but set away from the pool bar. Standard fare liqours are absolute, bacardi, hornitos. Priveleged drinks upgrade to ketel one, havana club, tanqueray, and don julio to name a few. Be prepared to pay 40pp/day if not already worked into your fees. For us it was worth it. We loved the grounds, the proximity to Playa and the airport. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOLIDAY WITH FRIENDS”
Reviews.Content: Just spent a very relaxing 2 weeks at the first class hotel, we travelled and booked as 3 couples. The good points are: Rooms..Clean,comfortable, well equipped and spacious. Food & Drink..Good selection, Plenty of choice in the main buffet. Italian..excellent food, service & setting. Mexican..Very good. Japenese.. Did'nt think the food was that authentic and it lacked atmosphere. Big thanks to Rosalyn & Sarai for looking after us making sure we got the correct drinks and plenty of them. We found all the staff really attentive & friendly. Thanks also to Concepcion for keeping our room very clean & well stocked with towels & toiletries. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. The pools were very clean and lovely to swim in. The evening entertainment was ok and there was a good atmosphere in the foyer bar and outside terrace during the evenings. The bad points..The sea at the hotel was terrible, full of seaweed, rubbish etc. It was rough & smelly. The beach area where the sunloungers were was fine but the seaweed washed up onto the beach everyday and although they tried to clear it, it was an impossible task. We did walk to the lagoon on several occasions just to be able to swim, but you can see all along this part of the coastline how the sea has eroded the beach and sand bags have been placed to protect the beach areas in front of the hotels. We also felt it was not good that unless you were on the Premium package you could not book the theme restaurants and as there was 6 of us there was limited space anyway (ok for 2-4 persons). Even in the main buffet there was only 2 tables that could sit 6-8 people so we did ask if they could be more flexible and one night they did push 2 tables together. Apart from this it was a great relaxing holiday that I would be happy to recommend as long as you are made aware of the seaweed problem. We used the free shuttle bus once but book early the day before you want to go. We also got a taxi into Playa del Carmen one evening and that was good. We also hired a taxi to Akumal (great beach & snorkelling) and Puerto Morelos (more traditional Mexican local beach good for snorkelling trips & diving). We did'nt do Tulum as we went there before on a previous holiday but it is well worth a visit (Ruins & gorgeous beach) If you want a first class hotel and you don't worry about swimming in the sea go and have a great time like we did!!

Reviews.Title: “"Can't wait to go back again"”
Reviews.Author: Philip F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale for 2 weeks from the 21/02/12,it was our first visit to Mexico and to be honest we could not fault it. The entertainment staff (Jess,Omar and all the rest )worked so hard morning till night to make sure you enjoyed your stay I couldn't praise them enough. The restraunts were great especially the Italian, again the service was superb. Rooms were excellent,clean comfortable and well kept. Only down point was the beach which could have been better,but no fault of theirs felt sorry the the guy who spent the whole day clearing up the seaweed. One of the best holidays we have had

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation - no complaints, just fun!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: We were at the OMR from March 1st to March 8th and had a fantastic, entertaining and relaxing vacation! This was our first all-adult resort but trust me, if we are not travelling with our teenage children, it will NOT be the last! :) My husband and I arrived at the resort with no other guests on our shuttle so we had a very quick check-in followed by a private meeting with Helen, the VIP Concierge, who provided us with details about the resort, then a quick cocktail and a ride to our room by Alex, who smiled constantly and pointed out items of interest on our ride to the room. We were in 2806 which had a beautiful view of the pathways and other rooms. The sound of the palmtrees outside our door was an awesome welcome. Our room was spotless and looked exactly as the photos online do. We noticed right away that our bed lacked a foam topper, and, having read about them on Tripadvisor prior to leaving, we asked Helen for one as soon as we went up for dinner and when we got back to our room, it had been put on the bed. Yes, the shower leaked onto the floor, but this is strictly due to the design of the shower. We always kept our towels each day (and did not put them on the floor to be replaced) so that we had an extra towel to put at the base of the shower for safety - this worked well for us. As well, we also read about not getting faceclothes which we have also experienced at other all inclusives so we had packed our own to have on hand. On our second day our shower/toilet light switch went on the fritz...again, we talked to Helen and within 10 minutes we had this repaired. As we arrived at the resort after 5pm, we had time only to walk around the grounds, stop by the pool bar for a quick drink and a friendly smile from Javier and walk through the sand prior to darkness setting in. Our first impression was an overall gorgeous! The grounds are impeccably clean, lush and always have someone working on them. The Coati and Iguanas are always fun to watch. It is true, there is no beach to swim in, but for those of us who enjoy sitting on a beach and swimming in the pool, this was just fine with us. And when we wanted more lively fun, we sat at the entertainment pool and joined in whenever we wanted. The entertainment crew kept us laughing the whole week and we had a ton of fun with them! Suzanne, Amanda, Omar, Alejandro, Jess and Amy Jean appeared to never sleep but were always smiling, fun and great to chat with both at the pool and in the evening at the shows and the after parties. They always called us by name and a friendly hello whenever we saw them. These kids helped make our vacation what it was for sure! The evening shows were entertaining and full of so much energy by these kids. Alejandro started at the OMR the day we arrived and was in every show we saw - he spent each day practicing and learned the shows that quickly. The Grease show was very entertaining and my personal favourite...and our hubbies enjoyed being part of the show that night - lots of fun! The pools were always immaculate and constantly being skimmed and vacuumed each morning, the decks were swept and garbage picked up by the hard working "beach boys." The only day the cleaniness of the one pool was an issue was the day that the winds were so strong that the beach was encroaching into the pool area...if you were near the beach, you were being sandblasted so it was VERY understandable that they could not keep the pool and deck clean this morning. but as soon as the wind died, there were out there getting it back in order. Always a gorgeous welcome every morning to see the pools with the ocean behind them and to see the pools lit up at night. We did walk down to the Lagoon one afternoon but ended up getting rained on so we did not really experience it to the fullest. We tried all of the restaurants and thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Japanese restaurant (twice!) - Israel put on an amazing show and the food was delicious! The Mexican restaurant was also good, but not nearly as much fun and the Italian was delicious but WAY too much food! If we had any complaints about the restaurants, it was that the dishes were often too much to eat and we hated to leave the wasted food. It was always delicious. And yes, as Pat said, the white wine was actually very nice....just not in a plastic cup at the pool! We found the Bloody Caesars to be a great way to start the day as well. The buffet restaurant had excellent breakfasts and my husband enjoyed omelettes made by Aurora every day - always so many choices, I do not understand how someone cannot find something to fill them up to their liking. After being in Germany last year, it was easy to see the European touches at this resort including their selection of cheeses, cold meats and breads. It was a nice option to eat a sandwich at any time you chose to not have a big meal. As this was our 3rd time to the Mayan Riviera, we did not take any tours at all and spent all our time on the resort - which was perfect for us! A group of friends who had joined us on the 3rd did do a dolphin swim and absolutely loved it and could not say enough about the experience with the dolphins. The group of friends who joined us did not know we were at the resort and we surprised them by waiting in the lobby (for 3 hours as they were late arriving!) and Hector and another porter (sorry, cannot remember his name!) were so very helpful in watching for them and keeping an eye out for us so that it could be a perfect surprise - and it was! After their arrival, every time Hector saw us, he asked if we and our friends were having a good time. He was the sweetest man! You meet so many people from different areas during a stay at the OMR - the US, UK, Canada...and most have a smile and a friendly hello as you walk by. We met and chatted with many people from near and far and always enjoy talking to others - this helps to make the memories. Overall, our trip to the OMR was spectacular and we truly had no complaints at all. We were on vacation, there were palmtrees and warm breezes and we were with friends and making new ones...what more can you want? Every vacation is what you make it! Thanks OMR for helping us to make a very memorable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday - Enjoyed the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pat and bill M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from OMR, passing along our comments to travellers. We had a wonderful holiday. We understand some people had room or hotel problrms, but for us we rave about the service of the staff. The hotel grounds are beautifuly maintained. Kudos to the gardeners and cleaning staff. We did upgrade to 'Privilege'. The 'Privilege Suites' are in a 3-story building close to lobby and buffet restaurant. When we got to our room, there was robe & slippers, bottle of wine & chocolate covered strawberries. Room 214 was quite and everything worked. We even enjoyed the firm beds. The mini-bar had the usual, bottle water, pop, juice and 3 mini liquor bottles that was restocked every day. Yes, it was a 3 minute walk to pools and beach but everything can't be in the same area. Walking is good for you. The 'Privilege' section at the beach had canopy beds and lots of padded beach chairs with shade huts. An ice bucket at every table with bottled water & ice. Our own 'Yvonne' was always there if you wanted a drink. The little self-serve area had champagne, beer, fruit, peanuts, cold face towels, lotions and books. The whole hotel pools and beach area had lots of beach chairs. There was a very good selection of liquor. The 'Privilege' had another shelf with extra selections. Just don't let them pour from the bottles under the bar (I think it might be local alcohol). You can taste the difference. Maybe not by the 3rd one. HaHa. We had no problems asking bartender the brand we wanted and saw it poured from that bottle. The white and red wines were even good, I have been to some 5-star resorts where you could not drink the white wine it was so bad. The food at the buffet was good. You are in Mexico and cannot expect what you get at home.. It's nice to try different dishes. The 'Privilege' could make reservations at the special restaurants. The Japanese was fun sitting at the Tepanyaki table but the Italian was our favorite, good service, good food, beautifuly presented and served hot. Don't be cheap, give your server or bartender a dollar or two once in a while, they do appreciate it and they work hard with long hours and always a smile & greeting. All-inclusive does not mean you don't have to but your hand in your pocket. Other travellers report a lot of mosquitoes, but honestly I only got 2 bites and they usually love me at home. I did take bug spray but only used it once. We saw our room sprayed once and every night around 5 pm they sprayed the foliage and tree area around the grounds. We have been to many (20) all-inclusives in Mexico and Dominican and would highly recommend Oceans. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: CarolNiagara_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, both mid forties, stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale from February 21 - 28th, 2012. First impressions: Very quick to assign your room when you arrive. We did not wait in line, we went to the Privilege desk and they were quick and effecient. A very friendly group at this desk and quite helpful throughout our stay. The staff: Always helpful. We found from the front desk to the cleaning staff everyone was friendly and eager to please. Always greeted with a smile and very appreciative of any tips etc. We truly found the staff to be very helpful. Privilege lounge: WOW Cassandra is a young girl that is an exchange student from France. It is too bad for OMR that she will not be staying long term. She always greeted us with a warm smile, always asking if we needed anything and asking us if she could do anything for us. She knew what we drank only a day in and ensured that we had cold drinks in the room ( for me it was diet coke ). She was also very informative if she did not know the answer she was quick to get one. We were never mislead in anything she had said and was always helpful and sweet. We truly grew quite fond of Cassandra during our stay and hope that the OCM truly appreciates how hard she works with the guests. The Food: This was hit and miss. We found the restaurants quite good - some of the best we have had on our travels. The Italian was amazing, and they did not limit how much you ordered. We accidently ordered two entres at the Mexican and they served us which typically you are limited. The service was quick and the food was tasty - absolutely no complaints about the A La Carte restaurants. The Buffet: This is where the OCM falls a bit. The variety was quite redundant and not too tasty. We are not picky people but truly there were times that I struggled to find something that looked appetizing. The Pool: Great pool, clean no issues at all. There was limited service around the pool which is not a big deal just be prepared to serve yourself. Liquor: When you are in the Privilege section you are able to get top shelf liquor - Crown Royale etc. They do check bands. Great selection when you are in the Privilege - can't really speak to the regular alcohol as we were able to get what we wanted. Beach: This is where they fall in ratings for me. i know it is clearly noted on previous Trip Advisor reviews that they have no swimable beach but I really thought people were just being picky - no, there really is no where to swim. The beach actually stunk on a couple of days - it depends on the winds. You cannot swim in the ocean so prepare yourself and you will be fine. You are able to walk down the beach about 15 minutes and there is a lovely area that you can swim in and it is a nice walk and truly not too far. Privilege Section: Great service, Yvonne was just amazing - we spent time here and by the pool and she would even see us by the pool and serve us there - unbelievable. The sun beds were comfortable and you always had a bed, we never saw that they were full throughout out week. This is also true for the pool loungers. We never saved any spots and always had somewhere to sit or lay down. The Rooms: Nice rooms, clean with all the basics - well almost. There is no tub in your room - which was disappointing for myself. They offered us an upgrade at 50 dollars a day we didn't think we could justify spending 350 dollars for a tub for the week so we stayed in our original room. Our room was cleaned at various times throughout the week. At times it was just being cleaned when we arrived at our rooms to prepare for dinner and other times early in the afternoon. Could never figure out their system. There was always a variety of pop and alcohol in the fridge and we never had to make any requests. At times they did not give us facecloths but truly that was only 2 days other than that they kept everying replenished. They don't give you towel art on the bed but the rooms are clean and well appointed. Room Service: We used room service once and found it to be disappointing. Food was cold and not what we had ordered so we decided not to use this service again. We were given our romatic dinner for two as promised by our service provider - this was interesting. There were four couples in the Gazebo so not so romantic and dinner took over 2 hours to serve. It became comical and we did have a good time with the other couples but not a romantic dinner that is for certain - that being said we met another couple who said there service was quite effecient and there were only two couples that evening so I think it may be hit and miss. Grounds - they were very beautiful and well kept. Someone was always cleaning somewhere. There is an odour in some areas that you cannot miss and depending on the direction of the wind depended on how strong the smell was. Overall, you will have a good time if you have already booked this resort. We truly had a nice time. We decided to not let the little things ruin our vacation and they absolutely did not. We loved the staff, made reservations for dinner most nights, loved the pool, loved Cassandra, loved the staff at the Privilege desk - very helpful and friendly and the rooms were clean. We will not be returning as they just missed the mark on a few things but honestly if you have booked this resort don't be nervous you will have a good time just prepare yourself for the beach. I should also add that I am a beach person that is why I have rated this resort at a 3 but would give it a 3.5 if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rianne S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from one of the most relaxing vacations we've ever had. Usually when we vacation we do lots of tours and sightseeing, but this time, we just laid back and relaxed. Check-in was a breeze. I should warn you about the "welcome breakfast" though, as the resort is also time-share based, and they do try to sell you this for future trips. Avoid it if you're not interested, as time may be better spent soaking up some rays poolside. they do offer some resort credit though if you attend (if you seem doubtful, they do up the ante). We were in Villa 37 and this was perfect as it was right opposite the pool and close to two of the on site restaurants. The room had a partial ocean view and was gorgeous and well laid out, and our welcome wine and treats were awesome. One downfall was the number of towels stocked in the bathroom. Even when they restocked, it wasn't sufficient. The housekeeper dressed the bed with little paper flowers daily, a welcome touch! We were able to benefit from WIFI from the neighbouring hotel as our villa/room was close to the edge of the property, so we didn't have to make the trek back to the lobby to get WIFI (it was a good walk back) We were not impressed with the Mexican restaurant- El Charro. I expected highly seasoned and tasty food and was sorely disappointed. We ate here on our first night and did not venture back. The Italian restaurant was great and so was the Hacienda. We didn't get an opportunity to try the Japanese restaurant though as we didn't plan our meals well. Point to note: fancy/formal dress is not required at any of the restaurants, once you are not in swimwear they will serve you just fine. The resort has a nice booklet about their facility and it is a good read. They do state that you should not reserve lounge chairs at the pool or beach, but everyone does it, so don't expect to go and get a lounge chair after 10a as folks reserve chairs with towels, books and personal items before they go to breakfast. Join the crowd and reserve your chair if you want to spend some time in the sun. The pools were great! My husband and I spent a lot of time on the sun shelf just liaising around. We left with great tans! My only complaint is that there isnot enough staff around the pool to refresh towels or get drinks. You will end up doing this for yourself. If you are going into town, Playa del Carmen, for some souvenir shopping, it will be easier to take a taxi as the shuttle is usually full. It costs about USD25 one way. Arrange with the driver who takes you to pick you back up. This was you won't get scammed in taxi fare on the way back. CHECK THE HOTEL SOUVENIR SHOP AND POOL KIOSK FIRST. IT IS A BIT CHEAPER THAN IN TOWN!!! The sundries shop in the lobby has just about everything (except toothbrushes) so if you need anything you can get it there. Really and truly, the hotel is very self contained an there is no reason to leave except for sightseeing. Tip based on the service you receive. We received excellent smiling service. Walk with bug spray for mosquitoes as they are relentless. We will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation at the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20 year old daughter and I just returned from a week at this resort. The Cancun Airport is a disorganized mess, so just be prepared. It took an ungodly amount of time to get out of the airport to find our transportation. It is about a 45 minute drive to the resort from the airport. Check-in went very smoothly, and we were soon in our rooms. We were in villa 27 which was a perfect location in our opinion. It was close to the pools, beach and two of the restaurants, but set back one building from the main path so it was quiet. We were on the second floor which was nice. The rooms are quite spacious and nicely equipped as you can see from my photos. The towels were of good quality and my only complaint is that each day we would only get three bath towels for the two of us. Being in a beach setting, sometimes you need more than one shower a day. It was hit or miss as to whether we would get a hand towel or a wash cloth. The resort is very nicely laid out and is a smaller property, which we liked. The lobby area is pretty, and we very much appreciated the free wifi in the lobby. Normally I do not complain about the food at all-inclusive resorts but I have to say that the food at the La Hacienda and El Charro was just average, and boring after a few meals there. However the food and service at both the Japanese and Italian restaurants were excellent. As others have said, there is not much beach at this resort, and the area where you can swim is definitely not too attractive. However thanks to the reviews on TripAdvisor, we knew this when we booked our trip. We did walk down to the lagoon, which is more like a 20 minute walk not the 10 minutes that others have said, and it is definitely worth the trip. If you have snorkeling equipment, be sure to take it along with you. We used the on site dive shop several times. My husband and daughter both took the lessons and went scuba diving, and the snorkeling expedition we went on ended up to be the best snorkeling we have ever experienced. Truly like swimming in an aquarium - highly recommend! On the recommendation of the concierge, we hired a taxi to take us to Chichen Itza instead of one of the tour buses. Best decision ever! Not only was it less expensive, but we were on our own timetable and were able to see the ruins at Tulum as well as the ones at Chichen Itza. Additionally our driver took us to a small restaurant for lunch where we had excellent traditional Mayan food. For those who are interested, there was a nice mix of age groups at the resort during our visit and it was not all couples. Friends traveling together would not feel out of place at this resort. My last comment is that the mosquitoes are terrible. Pack your bug spray and some anti-itch medicine. I did not expect to get bitten inside the lobby, restaurants and area where the evening shows are held but I did. Getting out of the Cancun airport was worse than arrival. We stood in line for an hour and fifteen minutes just to check our bags and get our boarding passes. This may be a Saturday phenomenon, but be prepared if you are traveling that day of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya K
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's first trip to Mexico, we had an amazing time! The staff is wonderful!! Always smiling and always welcoming. The food was wonderful and our room was perfect. We took several day trips and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Also, hat off to the entertainment staff! They work their butts off! Early morning rehearsals, pool activities all day, and then the night shows. We were very impressed with how hard, and what long hours everyone at the resort puts in. The grounds were immaculate! Wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: ElenaKharitonov
Reviews.Content: We just came back from stay in this hotel in march 2012. Once we got there the hotel itself is very nice and beautiful . Food was alright , service was great ! Our problem was : on the 2nd morning we woke up to horrible smell of acetone ( paint) commimg from the AC . We could not breath . We started running around looking to see why we were chocking and throwing up . Next room to us was being painted since 7am and it was terrible ! We asked the staff to move us right away . ( our original room was a premier room , best there is ) so they moved us to much smaller room without any apologies . 2 days later we were coming to our new room around midnight and outside was smelling like a sewer badly ! We did not say anything and went to bed . The next night it got so much worse ! By 2am we could not breath . It smelled like dump in our room so bad . Once we called the staff they told us that they are watering the plants and they have been having this problem for long time . Since they are using septic and it's backed up they are watering the plants with stuff that is coming from the flushed toilets . Our night was ruined . None of the staff did not do anything to compensate us even though we paid for best room in the hotel but end up in one of the worst rooms in the hotel . Will never go back to this hotel . Beach was horrible and not clean and full of sea weed. We could not swim at all in the ocean . We asked conseirge for directions to the island and were given wrong directions on 3 different occasions and waisted all day on Cab and driving around.

Reviews.Title: “3 1/2 STARS”
Reviews.Author: FireChiefDunkirk_NY
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya is a very nice property, the biggest drawback is that there is absolutely no place to swim in the ocean at this property. The beach in the entire area is not very good, and there is sea weed built up along the shore. They do try to keep it clean, but it really is a never ending job. If you are looking for beach and swimming, stay in cancun or in Playa del Carmen. There are many nice things about this hotel. The grounds are super, very well kept. The rooms are very nice, cleaning service was good. The bars and bartenders are very good, no problem getting a drink. The beer was Corona on tap for our first two days, losey and warm. They switched to Modelo in cans, ice cold. Lots of choice at bars. Food in buffet was ok, nothing special, and they do need to do a better job on temperature control, cold foods should be colder, hot foods hotter. Japanese, Mexican, and Italian restaurants were all very good. Entertainment staff was good, no high pressure to participate. The evening shows were also good. Coffe shop at night was nice, though it could have been used more in the morning. If you are looking for a nice place, with no children running around, the Ocean Maya is certainly acceptable, and propably a good value for the price. If you are looking for that great beach vacation, continue to look. It is too bad they have no control over the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “paradise!!!!.”
Reviews.Author: jackichan15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ocean maya in january for our 25th wedding anniversary. after a long flight was checked in quickly and given a refreshing welcome drink. Our room was in block 26 near the pool area and the mexican resteraunt. The food was lovely to a high standard , look out for Alberto and Alfredo in the main resteraunt area 2 lovely guys really helpful and a couple of comics.The room we had was finished to high standard the bed was really comfy,. don't no why people complain about lack of pillows there was 6 to choose from on the bed, slippers and dressing gown left in the room for you aswell. Pool area was lovely but we chose to spend most of our time on the beach. The mexican resteraunt at night was the best we had and the waiters were helpful explaining exactly what was on the menu.. A 15 minute walk to the left takes you to a beautiful lagoon well worth a visit, snorkling . there is a a must...The gardens are immaculate and the wildlife is a amazing around the complex. The coffee shop is lovely the latte's are gorgeous..Will definately go back....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at Ocean Maya Royale and had a great experience. The staff were all very friendly and always had a smile. The entertainment crew at the pool were a lot of fun and kept things fun. Amy Jean was so nice. Loved the spontanious water volleyball games.Food was good, no complaints. We really enjoyed the Italian restaurant (Antonio and Jose great hosts). Rooms were nice, clean and we slept well. We have not traveled to many resorts, but I can't imagine finding much better for the money. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Highly recommend walking north along the beach to the "Lagoon". Great place to wade and swim. We would definitely go back. Very relaxing and enjyable resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome people, Great time”
Reviews.Author: Kerry H
Reviews.Content: Feb. 11 - Feb.23, 2012, Just returned from a fun and relaxing vacation at the Ocean Maya H10. If you researched and read the thousands of reviews like I did, you will find out that it was a waste of time. This hotel by Mexican standards is great. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is without a doubt the friendliest and most accommodating we have encountered in 25 years of traveling and the food (even the buffet if your not set in your ways and like a good butter hunt) was excellent. A lot of people on this site will complain about the seaweed on the beach. Well we traveled far down the coast by rental car and it was everywhere do to severe storms this winter. To there credit, the Ocean Maya had men out cleaning it every day. As far as privilege vs non-privilege. If your a snob and like to be isolated from the general public, Get it. Otherwise, it's a waste of money. We can afford it but choose not to because from experience we knew that people are not that friendly and we received premium liquor when requested anyway (sorry, can't reveal method). Maid service didn't mop some days, forgot to leave coffee or the odd face cloth or towel, but hey, it's Mexico and that's all part of the experience. You won't see a Vegas quality show here, but if you understand how hard these kids work to keep you entertained, you will appreciate them way more. If you have never been to Mexico, one thing you need to know. The people, especially the Mayans, are some of the warmest and friendliest people in the world. If you treat them with compassion and respect, they will do everything they can to insure you have a great holiday. If your there for awhile, rent a car and travel to the cenotes (under ground rivers) Playa del Carmen and archeological sites. Always felt safe driving around, highways are good and unlike a tour, you can take your time and enjoy. Just a few staff members to recognize. The Animation team; Jesse, Amy, Fernie, Omar, Amanda and Suzanne. The waiters, bartenders and chefs; Jorje, Alfredo, Rafael, Imelda, Mirabella, Javier, Hector (smile) and of course Aurora (Good morning) Sorry for any incorrect spelling. ALL OF YOU GUYS ROCK !!!!! Oh yeah, thanks to that invisible person in the background, Maria Lopez. From Kerry (Mr. Privilege), Yvette and Alistair (Mr. Iguana) and Sharon

Reviews.Title: “GREAT INTERNATIONAL FLAIR!!”
Reviews.Author: Swaneey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at OMR Feb 23-Mar 1 and just loved meeting people from Norway , England, France, Spain, Venezuala, Chile, Germany and of course the usual All-Inclusive Canadians and Yanks. This might have been my 16th All-Inclusive resort so if I say "standard", you'll pretty much find it anywhere. The long drive up to the lobby is your first sign of the immaculate grounds, very well cared for and expansive, a true joy on every walk from place to place. She loves "critters" and there are lots of Iguanas and the friendly unique Coatis. We did not do the "privlege" but got the wine, chocolate covered strawberries in the room AND the "Romantic" dinner. From what I saw the "privelege" isn't worth it. The staff is SOOOO friendly everywhere. Standard cocktail at easy checkin (easy checkout too). Stanard wait for room (got in @ noon), "time share" dude offered pearl necklace to have breakfast and 2 hour talk (not really time share, a complicated plan where you can travel anywhere), said standard "NO!", at bar he inticed with $100 USD, "NO!", then $150 plus necklace..."OK, but I'm not buying anything", we were to eat breakfast anyway, were going to checkout the lay of the land anyway and after the 45 min spiel I wanted my money and the beach. Got it in a couple of days, don't do it, I never did before or again...easy money though. ROOM-pretty standard, couch,hardish bed but a nice LARGE balcony.Yes shower leaks, ask for extra towel.Thought it was smoking room, even called to be sure, but NO indoor smoking, balcony is just fine though. FOOD- Buffet is standard with cooking stations. Restaurants are first rate. Can make reservations 1 to 2 days in advance up until 2pm, easy, no lines. Mexican and Italian great food and too much of it. Japanese, do the "show table", fun! food OK. I wish they enforced the dress code in the Buffet (long pants is not too much to ask). POOL/BEACH- sea wall built after hurricane,lots of soft white sand but little swimming area. Two standard pools(clean) one quiet one and one with standard "games" and swim up bar. Texas Holdem' @ 3pm (love cards but maybe not @ beach).Easy stairs into pools for us older folks.Take the 20min walk left to the "lagoon". SHUTTLE-free to Playa del Carmen, need to reserve day before (doesn't run on Sun). Taxi is $19 each way, mile walk to front gate gets you a $3 bus or a $6 taxi (still $19 coming back). INTERNET-lobby only. ENTERTAINMENT-not the standard silly stuff, Aztec show etc. HOUSEKEEPING- this is the bad part, never the same number of towels, some days coffee, swept floors but not mopped, rinsed glassware, these guys don't speak anything but Spanish so another call to front desk. BARS- pool bar closes @ 6. long walk to lobby bar after your 2 beer room allotment is gone (if you drink one, they bring you one, $ 3 to have them bring more) Ask @ pool bar for additional cans. SUMMARY-great place

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: MindilovesMexico
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and another couple Feb. 18-26th 2012. Overall, it was great. There are a few things that could have been better – and I explain below. Upon arrival, we checked in at the Privilege desk. We had wooden/fabric bracelets, which were way nicer than the plastic ones. Someone brought us a drink right away while we checked in. Since we had upgraded to privilege, expectations were high. Our bags were brought to our room and we opened the door to a very nice room with wine and chocolate covered strawberries – with a personalized note welcoming us to the property. At this point, I was pretty happy with the upgrade to privilege. The Room: Location, it was just off the main lobby/buffet. Nice location. It was a little walk to the beach, but not a big deal. The beds have a mattress pad on them which gives them a little more padding. Décor is nice, balcony is nice. Nothing outstanding but certainly nothing to complain about. The pictures posted by the hotel are exactly what the rooms look like. The mini fridge was stocked. Air conditioning worked nicely. There was a musty smell – but nothing that I couldn’t live with. Housekeeping was good, room was nicely cleaned. I didn’t ever get more washcloths after the first day, I just used hand towels. We had mints on our pillows a few nights when we returned to our room, slippers bedside. That was a nice touch. No flower or towel animals. I kind of liked that from our previous resort stay. The Restaurants: Buffet: Overall good food. The best time to eat here is breakfast where you can get a nice omelet made fresh. There is a mix-your-own Mimosa and bloody Mary station. Japanese: We made a reservation for the grill which was fun. The food was very good. The show was ok – I have seen more excited chef’s. I think he had a long day already and was getting tired. We ate there a second time because the food was so good. This time not at the show table. It was still very good food, each course! Mexican: It was good. Tortillas are good. Guacamole and salsa are great. We made an evening reservation and all the courses were good. We were brought a banana margarita upon our arrival. It was yummy! This is also a good place to eat during the day because it is right by the pool. Decent food during the day – AWESOME mint chocolate ice cream. Itialian: Food was good. I liked what I ordered. Nothing really blew me away about this place. Staff was pleasant. Mikes Coffee: Good coffee, weird that they don’t open until 4pm. The lobby bar has an espresso machine and can make most of the specialty coffees if you need a morning pick-me-up. Also, you can order coffee from room service. After 11 PM, in the lobby bar, you can order food. I ordered a chicken fajita, it was unbelievable. Probably one of the best things I ate at this resort! My husband got a club sandwich and he said that was good. Our friends had a pizza (which was very cheesy and huge!) and beef fajita – which was really tender and good. As part of the privilege package, we got a romantic beach dinner. Shrimp came standard, had to pay more for steak. The steak was not good. Tough and full of gristle. The waiter had too many people to wait on and had to go around the pool for each trip. They need to build a bridge for that guy and maybe have more than one staff on those tables! The food was good, nothing spectacular… except the 4 cheese soup. I cannot get over how good that soup was. I need to find the recipe, so anyone from the hotel who can get me a recipe, I would be overjoyed! (Maria Lopez, can you pull some strings?) The Entertainment: Pretty standard resort entertainers. Good looking dancers trying to get everyone involved. We played bingo one night; our friend won a small bobble head turtle.  We saw a nice performance of some traditional Mexico dancers. That was fun. There are venders most nights around the fountains selling things. They don’t harass you nearly as much as the vendors on 5th Ave in Playa. The pool/beach: Pool drink service was spotty. Sometimes there was someone available. The bars closest to the pool were sometimes wonderful (Jairo rocks) and sometimes you can stand there for 20 minutes to get a beer. The pools themselves (2 of them) were very nice and seemed clean. Remember this is an adult’s only resort, so there is some topless exposure. The privilege beach section was good for my husband and I as far as service. The waitress there was very attentive. I really liked the beds, being able to put the curtain down and cool off or stay out of the sun for a bit was nice. Our friends said that they waited a long time for her to come by and were more satisfied by the pool. Privilege: Overall, not worth the cost. I liked the chocolate strawberries, I liked the bracelet, the romantic dinner was nice and being able to make reservations was nice but….. eh… Plus, we were told tales of a VIP area that had TV’s and air conditioning. We found what we thought was this area, but the doors were always locked. I asked around (H10 guy in lobby, privilege desk, front desk) and no one was really sure when it opened. We were told “afternoon”. Tour desk: The guy at the desk owes my friend and I each 2$. He kept telling us he would bring it “tomorrow” which never came because he never had the money. How hard is it to have 4$ in US money? We booked our Xel-ha excursion through him. It worked out fine, we however paid 2$ each couple more than we needed to. I think he took that as a little tip. Anyway, the free shuttle to Playa is a nice service – but it is super inconvenient to book. You have to be at the tour desk at 8am the day before you want to go and the shuttle fills up within an hour. Might be an easier option to just take a cab into town. Upon check out, our friends had a charge for a steak on their room tab. My husband and I paid for the steaks in cash for all three of us (one was happy with shrimp). There was no charge for our 2 steaks on our bill, but still the charge for our friends. I assume the person who took the cash just entered it for our room and should be an easy fix, but the worker was not available when our friends checked out and it might still be something we need to work out. We were getting the stink eye from the privilege staff member as we waited for our shuttle. Overall, this is a beautiful resort with clean well-manicured grounds. The food is good enough, with a couple stand out dishes. The staff was pleasant and for the most part very helpful. I would stay here again – but not upgrade to privilege.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the OMR from Feb 8 to 18. We had a great experience from check-in to check-out. Our check-in was flawless and we were on our way to fun and relaxation. **I will start with what made our vacation the most fun...THE ENTERTAINMENT GROUP. From "crazy games" pool volleyball, dance lessons, texas hold em, and the Amazing Shows that this great group of hard working young men and women put on it, was a trip to remember. Thank You to our Favorite Fernie, also Suzanne, Amy Jean, Sergio, and Ricardo. ROOMS are very clean and spacious. Housekeeping did an amazing job and our fridge was always restocked. It was very warm/humid when we were there. The AC worked great. FOOD was great. There is always something to choose from at the buffet and you will get the friendliest greeting at the omelette station from Aurora. The A La Cartes are great. We especially liked the Japanese (at the grill) and the Mexican (best chicken fajitas). The Italian was OK but the food lacked flavor. By far, out favorite waiter at the buffet and the Mexican Rest was Vincente. He greeted us every day (remembering our names) and was always smiling and singing. GROUNDS were beautiful. There was always someone working/grooming on the grounds and it shows. I was in awe of the landscaping and beautiful flowers. BARS..excellent service. Always a smile and a great drink. Our favorite bartender was Javier and he was always up to making us a "Javier Special" of the day/night. Even at the pool bar at very busy times, they had your drink for you right away. BEACH was nice to walk along but water not so nice, but take a 15 min walk to the left of the property and you will reach a beautiful lagoon with crystal clear water to swim in. Take your camera...its beautiful. POOL is where it was at for us. We never swam in the quiet pool but it is huge and very nice. We enjoyed the activities, music and company of all of our new friends that we made from all over the world at the pool with the swim up bar. We loved the fact that the property was adults only. We would definitely return to OMR if travel brings us back to this area.

Reviews.Title: “first time in mexico”
Reviews.Author: colin1234_12
Reviews.Content: was an excellent vacation the food was to die for the late night fajitas alone made the trip i would recommend taking the tour to the coco bongo with the staff but wander on your own as soon as you get in dont go where they try to put you. the only blackmark on my trip and why i did not rate excellent was a number of people in our party had moneyy missing from there room safe and luggage included

Reviews.Title: “First time to the Mayan”
Reviews.Author: Tammy S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Mayan. We were there from Jan 20 - Feb 3 2012. We have stayed at Ocean Properties before and so thought this would be a good choice. FIrst off the front desk staff and all the staff working in the restaurants and the grounds are vey friendly and helpful. The buffets and a la cartes - The Breakfast buffet was amazing. THe omelettes and eggs were great. I am not sure her name but she was always smiling and greeted each guest with a smile and a greeting. She was the reason breakfast was good. The lunch buffet at the poolside was great as well. Burgers made fresh while you waited and the food was hot. The chili on the nachos and fries was great. The evening buffet was ok. Food was not always hot ..usually warm if that. The selection was ok..lots of seafood (for those who like it) The Italian A la carte was my least favorite of them all. I did not find much selection or taste to the meal. The best part was the spinach/cheese soup. The Mexican was good. Again not alot of selection but food was good. The servers there were awesome as well. They remembered you from day to day and even knew what you drink.The Japanese was by far the best there. The servers were awesome and the show is great too. Had some of us sitting watching get up and try there tricks. Was a lot of fun.Highly recommend going to this restaurant while there. The one dissappointment i did have with the 3 a la cartes was the dress code.There really wasnt one and so you had people in shorts and tank tops. To me I dont think this should be allowed. The ground - Immaculate and amazing. The grounds people take very good care of the grounds and it really showed. The rooms - the rooms are nice. had what was supposed to be two double but was more like a super singles. I was looking forward to a king bed but none were available. We had our kids with us (18 and 20) and they shared a room which they accomadated us and had our rooms facing each other. The room was kept clean. The shower does leak and the door to the bathrrom is a 3/4 frosted glass door so not sound proof. The fridge was stocked somewhat and had to ask for coffee a couple times and there was a musty smell in the room. As long as the ac was on you couldnt smell it as bad. The beach - well there was a beach but it was covered in seaweed and the staff worked endlessly on removing it but it was a never ending battle. The ocean was rocky and not nice to swim in. IF you walked down the beach to the left for about 10 minutes there was a beautifl spot for swimming at Tres Rios. If you walked the other way as well you came to nicer beaches and water that you could swim in. THe Pool - was great place to be. The swim up bar was busy most of the time and you got better service from the walk up bar. The entertainment staff - Suzanne, Fernie, Amy Jean, Amanda.Omar, Jes and (the sexiest man in the Mayan) Ricardo were the hardest working people there. From keeping us all busy during the day with activities and games. beach volley ball water volleyball,texas holdem and aquasize to the endless hours they put in rehersing for the nite shows and then the evening entertainment with Bingo and Karoake. I know that these 7 peopls were the best thing about this vacation. They really put themselves out there for all the guests. And after all the fun is done in the resort its off to Coco Bongo which we did one nite with Fernie..she is a great hostess outside the resort as well. They truly made this trip for me. I am not sure i would go back for the food or beach but aside from that its a great place to relax. Tammy S Saskatoon Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Vacation at the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Ocen Maya from the moment we checked in until the end of our vacation. The rooms were very clean and spacious, we were on the second floor and had a view of the pool. The ala carte restaurants were great, our favourite was the Italian, but the Japanese was also very good. The staff that work at the resort provide excellent service, in the buffet restaurant, want to make a special mention to Vincente, who is always smiling and singing and takes the time to greet you. Aurora at the Omelette station is also very friendly with a "good-morning, how are you greeting" each day. Also a special mention to the entertainment staff who go out of their way to get you involved in various activities, they also put on the evening entertainment, which was very well done. The pool areas are very well designed with one for relaxing and one for activities if you want. We did not use the beach area. We will definitely return to this resort, are already planning for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “9th All-Inclusive Trip”
Reviews.Author: Savin_4_My_Next_Trip
Reviews.Content: I have been on 9 all-inclusive vacations, and Ocean Maya Royale was a nice resort and a good value; I would stay there again. In addition to the answers to my Trip Advisor ratings, here are a few more of my opinions: Friendliness - very good. Ocean - pretty, but rocky, much seaweed, and murky, so not great for swimming. Pool - very good. Entertainment - very good. Talum (Mayan Ruins excursion) - excellent, one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. Playa Del Carmen - fun for shopping, walking and a chance to get outside of the resort. Snorkeling - hired the outfit located on OMR's beach; it wasn't incredible but good, fair priced, and fun. Bar - good service, good variety, but beer was never very cold. Tipping - when a little extra service was needed, a tip helped immensely. I expect this and budget for it. I hope you have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to mexico”
Reviews.Author: crazycanadians2740
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying all of the staff, from the front desk to the entertainment staff are all very friendly and eager to help. My husbad and I stayed here from Feb 5-15, 2012. This was our first time to Mexico and we chose a great resort. We also extended our stay to 10 nights which was as well the first time.So we were happy the resort was so good.There were only a couple of disappointments to us and one of which could actually be corrected quickly and easily. (the reservation process for shuttle to Playa Del Carman). The weather could have been a little better at times, nothing you can change about mother nature. I will speak about each area seperatley. Pools- Beautifu and refreshing! The pool with the swim up bar was our daily hangout and is as well where all the entertainment staff do daily activities.You can join in or just watch, they don't pressure. They were all so much fun and easy to get to know. They love to entertain and give the guests a laugh. You can also get some daily exercise with them. They hold Pool aerobic, yoga,beach vollyball and pool vollyball. They have different games daily that they call crazy, and believe me some are pretty crazy, and hilarious! They all work very,very hard and we need to realize just how hard and long hours they keep. Take one of them to lunch, they'd love it. So please say Hi from us ( the crazy canadians) Look for Suzanne,Amy,Sergio(the baby) Fernie and Ricardo. They are ALL great I don't know all there names. One more thing you should know about the entertainment staff. They have talent and you'll see that when you go to the night shows. A lot of practise and again long hours goes into it all. The drinks are made really good at the swim up bar. They are not over owered by alcohol unless you state otherwise.Say Hi to the best bartenders there, Javier( beautiful curley hair) and Ebar.They make the best mojitos. Beach_ Not Good!! The beach with the white sandy area to lay on the loungers is georgous! There just isn't the sandy, turquoise water to walk into. Murkey and rocky, hard to even walk into the water if you wanted. Best advise, bring water shoes. There is a beautiful lagoon 10 mins up the beach going left from the privilage section. Bring bread from breakfast and feed the fish. You can do some snorking there or take some great photos. Enjoy, its beautiful! Rooms- Clean and a great size room. The bed wasn't very comfortable so we asked for a pillowtop mattress pad and after asking 3 different people at guest services we finally got it on the 4th day and it made a world of difference. The toilet and shower area, GREAT!! We are Canadian and can't follow the direction of no paper down the toilet. We just don't do it that way like Im sure most of you don't. Just flush beginning, during and end. It has proven to work, we never had a problem with leaking or backing up toilets as I have read in previous comments. Grounds- AWESOME!!! They work very hard at keeping the landscape beautiful and it shows. You see the people working and maintaining each and everyday. The animals are part of the landscape, its pretty cool and they don't bother you at all. They even let you take a picture with them. lol. Restaurants- They are all very good! They feed you a lot of food, so go hungry. Not needing a reservation to get into the restaurants and can repeat as often as you want is a really, really good idea and it works as far as we could see. They do this really well!! It was always an inconvenience at other resorts to stand in line to try and make reservations to only be turned away when it was finally your turn. They have a mexican, Italian and Japanese. Take note. They all take a turn closing one night. The Mexican restaraunt is located beside the pool area and serves lunch as well.Good food! The buffet as well is good. Its smaller than what we were use to with other resorts. I would imagine the amount of verity is probably determined with the size of resort. The verity was just fine for the size of resort. Theres lots to eat! Say Hi to Aurora! She is the friendliest omlette maker we have ever seen. Every morning she has the biggest smile on her face and manages to say hello to each and every guest in her line and on top of that always makes eye contact. I work in a customer service envirorment, I look for that stuff. She speaks pretty good english and understand well. Overall we think this resort is an excellent choice. We just couldn't honestly give it a 5 due to the beach water and some inconvenience we experienced with trying to book the shuttle to go to Playa. You could only book day before and you had to make sure you were at the desk by 8:00am.There were a couple of days we went over to book after breakfast, 9ish and it was full. The day we finally made it at 7:50am there were only 2 spots left on the sheet.Something was not right about that! We were told he starts at 8 and we weren't allowed to book until the day before you want to go. So you can't book it a couple of days in advance and that is what I think should change. Adults only resort is nice. Not as rowdy but a little. Depends on the group at the swim up bar. You can always go to Coco Bongo with the entertainment staff from 11:00pm-3:30am into Playa. We could never make it that late.I think if we were to go back to Mexico it would be further up by Tulum. We love the sandy turquoise water and there is plenty of it in Tulum. One last thing. This was our first H0 hotel and we will stay at another. Your treated quite well and looked after. HAVE A MASSAGE!!!!! We had a couple's 50 min, it was amazing! you can go into the hot tub first, its included. Have a great vacation at the Ocean Maya, we did!!

Reviews.Title: “go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: travelalot65
Reviews.Content: The sun is great and the pools are nice, but that's it. The beach is covered in sea weed that never ends. It's thick brown, stinky and disgusting. The poor guys working down there with pitch forks shovel it all day in to wheel barrows and drive it away in dump trucks. All day, every day, and they never make a dent in it. We've walked miles in either direction and you can not swim in the ocean anywhere near here. The buffet food is awful, even when they cook meat to order it's tough and tasteless. We paid for the Privelige jr suite and they stuck us in building 21 which must be built on a septic tank because the stench was horrendous. The whole place has bad plumbing. You can't flush the toilet paper, you must put it in a trash can or your toilet backs up. The amenities seem to be here but they are just unavailable when ever you need something. We tipped our room maid $20 the first day and got dry towels. This morning we ran out and didn't leave her cash, so our wet towels were left in the room. The only evidence that she was in was that the bed is made. We've asked for a clock that works (our fancy iPod docking station does nothing) and we just want to know what time it is without having to wear a watch. They say 'you don't need to know the time" and laugh, like it's funny. I'm sure it's hysterical to them as they screw you out of your vacation dollar. Like everyone else has said YOU GET NOTHING FOR THE UPGRADE, and it's true. Premium booze is stacked behind the bar, and they won't use it unless you specifically ask and remind them to put bacardi in your drink. Even then it's all watered down. We've been to many Mexican resorts, and this place would be lucky to receive a 3 star rating. It could be great but the staff and services are just poor. Even when you tip the bar staff it's inconvenient for them to serve you. One pool bar services the whole resort, pool and beach with 2 bar tenders. Needless to say, you pour your own water or coke, or just go without. Go to the Iberostar Grand Paraiso if you want a great beach vacation. Go to the Barcello if you want a good beach vacation. Go to H10 if you want bad food and bad service. We're here with a group of 10 people and we've all experienced far better places than this for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Group Holiday”
Reviews.Author: millbilly
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ocean Maya Royale from Feb 3 to Feb 10. This is an adult’s only resort, the majority of the guests are 30 and over. The resort is on the smaller size but beautiful! The grounds are kept very nice and they do a wonderful job with the gardens! The food was good both at the a la carte and the buffet. We didn’t find the buffet at dinner very good they had a good selection but we preferred the a la carte. They also do not have any 24 hr snack bar, so you can’t get food whenever you would like it. There is a restaurant at the pool which is a buffet at lunch so a cover up and dry bathing suit is what the dress code is for lunch. You can request a plastic plate that can be taken outside the restaurant if you would like to eat at the pool or beach. The rooms in the villas are nice they are 2 storey’s and have 8 rooms in them. We had a king bed and the mattress was fine (it did have a mattress pad on it). I believe the hotel section which is the 3 storey long building is the preferred section. I’m not sure what these rooms are like but they are located close to the lobby and main buffet. The entertainment staff was great they do activities at the pool during the day had lots of fun with this and we don’t normally go for that sort of thing but they were great at encouraging everyone to get involved. They took no for answer though if you didn’t want to. The evening shows were actually really good we normally don’t even bother going because they are normally kind of bad with them bring guests up and playing silly games, but they did a Grease show, a Madonna show, Fiesta show which was dances of the Caribbean. They had acts come in 2 of the nights and they were very good! After the shows it was normally a little live music and then into the karaoke till 11 pm. The lobby bar closes at midnight and that’s the end of your night NO DISCO at this resort so if you’re looking for night live you will have to leave the resort. They do go to Coco Bongo some evenings you can book it at the hotel and someone from the entertainment staff goes with you. We didn’t go but I’ve heard it is very good. This is the big one for me the beach…. I would not return to this resort as the beach is not good. It is not the resorts fault nature cannot be controlled but it is very murky. Looks like mulch that you would put in your flower beds. It keeps the beach guys busy cleaning it up which they do a great job at. You will want to take water shoes as you can’t see the bottom and it’s rocky in spots. You can walk for distance to the right of the resort. If you go to the left you can walk for about 15 min and you come to a lagoon area which is really nice. When we did go in the water this is where we went! Enjoy your holiday it’s a nice resort and the staff in all departments are friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of better soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Milli78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya Royale in the beginning of January 2012. We stayed at the privilege building because there was no other rooms left. First the positive things: The hotel room was stylish and the hotel area was beautiful. Everything was really clean and there were bathrobes in the rooms. In the beach there is a special area only for privilege quests and it had double sunbeds which were really nice. Also the service in the beach was really good. Food was average and the service in the restaurant differed a lot depending on your luck. Sometimes it was really good, sometimes not that good... Then the negatives: The quality of sleep. There seems to be no soundproofing whatsoever in the hotel rooms. We used earplugs and still had trouble sleeping. We discussed with other guests and they all said the same. One couple had had 3 room changes in 3 days and still they couldn't sleep. The hotel was also located in the middle of nowhere and it was quite small, so there wasn't that much to do or see in the hotel area. We also thought that the service at the check in and out was arrogant. They also tried to charge us for phonecalls we hadn't called. We refused to pay and finally they gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacay”
Reviews.Author: krista m
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the OMR from feb 3 -10...I have mostly great things to say about the resort. It is a very compact resort. All the villas are close to everything. I would suggest an upper corner room as the balconys and the rooms themselves are bigger. we arrived in our room to find a welcome letter, bottle of red wine and a plate of treats....so nice. The rooms are great, spacious, updated, free safe, well stocked mini bar, great shower , the only negative comment would be there is no door on the actual sink/vanity area, and the noise from the hair dryer is extremely loud. The food at the morning and lunch buffet was good, supper buffet not that great, but the ala cartes were great. Huge portions, no reservations and never waited for a table. Japanese was our favourite. Drinks were excellent, alot to chose from as far as brands of liquor. My husband grew tired of the Corona, and wished he had the upgrade as they get Budwieser.Still not sure if thats worth the upgrade, as we did here from a few privilidge people, that they ran out of Bud quite often. The pool area was alot of fun with the entertainment staff, lots of games etc.. I could have done without Omar copping a feel during the water areobics, which we heard happens quite often from a few other female water areobic participants. It was reported during our stay, so we didnt feel the need to say anything. Havier and Ebner at the pool bar were great.We had lots of fun with them.
