The beach is not in the greatest condition, but the sand is beautiful and if you walk 10min down the beach you will find the most fabulous lagoon area....its definately a must see. My only real complaint is that there is no night life....it does state that there is a disco...there is not...They have nightly shows which are good, then they have karaoke in the outside lobby area and cuban band...And everything is shut down by midnight.They are nice enough to leave the beer tap open for selve serve . Overall another great holiday in Mexico. I would definately recommend the OMR.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Grounds shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: catsmum654
Reviews.Content: We Stayed for 2 weeks from 25th Jan 12 in villa 7. We had 2 large single beds classed as doubles by the hotel. Our room was clean and in a very good location but felt very damp with a musty smell coming from the air conditioning. We reported this to reception and nothing was done for a few days until a French university student on work experience at the hotel spoke to us at breakfast one morning asking us what we thought of the hotel. We mentioned the problem to her and she had it was resolved that day.The room maid did her best and kept our room very clean but her supplies of clean towels seemed very limited on some days, speaking to others this seemed a general problem. The food was our main disappointment, whilst there was a very good selection in the buffet restaurant it was always only luke warm with no checking of temperatures by the staff. The Japanese restaurant was ok if you could get in but spoiled by very loud over the top American guests who appeared to have no manners what so ever on the evening we visited. The Italian restaurant was a bit better but still nothing special. We found the food at the Mexican to be the best and the staff were always very attentive. The beach was a further disappointment the hotel had made an artificial raised beached following the hurricane damage which was very well done and pleasant to sit on but had no access to the very dirty looking sea. Sun beds were never a problem always available.The swimming pool with the swim up bar was very noisy but the other one was fine. The evening entertainment was very good, the team worked very hard to produce different shows each evening. We were lucky to meet some very pleasant like minded people during our stay which made up for some of the shortcomings of the hotel. We would not return to this hotel or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One amazing honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnandTracey
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that we used Tripadvisor religiously before we booked our trip and did our fair share of research. We stayed at OMR from Feb 11th through Feb 16th. Our stay was amazing. As with any review, there are 'goods' and 'bads', but we can say that the goods definitely out weigh the 'bads', if you can call it that. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and well maintained. The staff is always friendly, and work very hard to make you feel welcome. The Room: We stayed in a Privilege Suite. Yes, they are located at the back of the resort, but we found this only to be a positive. It was very quiet and serene. You do not have a view of the ocean, but the grounds are breathtaking. It is closer to the main lobby, which is convenient. We scoped out other rooms while we were there and found the oceanfront rooms to be right by the pool, which can get a bit loud during the day. It is a popular place during the day so it will not be quiet until at least 6pm if you every feel the need for a nap. The room was very large, and very nice. The robes and slippers were a very nice touch. One reviewer complained about bathroom size, but we did not find this to be true. The shower and toilet is separated from the vanity area, like most hotels, and is quite spacious. Our room was very well maintained, with a fully stocked fridge daily, and turn down service at night. We found the pillow menu to be a great thing, as I suffer from neck issues and was able to order a neck pillow. Sweet! Room service was always friendly and pretty punctual for the most part. The exception being, the last morning we were there, we ordered and it never arrived so we went to the buffet. We preferred to wake and immediately order a pot of coffee (which was very good) and pastries to enjoy while we were getting ready for the day. We would then take our walk on the beach and come back up to the buffet for breakfast. The Food: We found the food in the buffet to be very, very good. It was always different, and always hot. We are confused by the reviewer that stated the food was always cold. We never found this to be the case and were very pleased. The Mexican, Japanese, and Italian restaurants were also very good. The Japanese was amazing. The one thing with Privilege, you always get a reservation, no questions asked. We found this to be nice and helpful. As long as you make the reservation before 4pm that day, you are guaranteed a seat. The food in the Italian restaurant was very good as well. The Mexican was wonderful. We had grilled shrimp kebobs that were amazing. We have nothing bad to say about the food at this resort. Even the room service was good. (Room service is part of the Privilege package). The bars offered very good drinks. We have no complaints. Our glasses were always full. The liquor selection is superb, even without the Privilege bracelet. The good liquor is on the shelves behind the bar, you just have to specify that you would like Bacardi instead of rail rum etc. As others have stated the staff work very hard for very little so please tip. We took a lot of one dollar bills just for this purpose. Beach/Pool: The pools are very nice. One pool has activities and loud music and the other is more relaxing. There are two bars by the pool, the pool bar and the bar for the buffet by the pool. Privilege has its own section on the beach, if you prefer. The cabana beds are so wonderful, and the staff is always offering to refill your drink. We were at the beach by 10:30 or 11am and never had a problem getting a bed. The ONLY downfall of this entire vacation was the water in this area. The beach sand is so nice, but the water is a bit dark and murky. We were hoping for the crystal blue water, so this was a bit disappointing. Regardless, we were able to walk north by about 10 mins and find a beautiful lagoon. The entertainment at OMR was very good. In the courtyard in the evening, there was a live saxophone player which was very relaxing. The hotel offers shows every night as well. We only watched one or two. The first one was the entertainment staff at the hotel that did a Caribbean show. It was not really to our liking, as it was very amateur. But in their defense, they do work very hard and it was still enjoyable. Heck, we are in Mexico....on a beach....how bad can it be? The following night they brought in other staff that did a Madonna show. This was really good. It is hit or miss with the shows. All in all, if it wasn't for the beach/water, we would for sure visit this resort again. It is just gorgeous and we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobcatTraveler
Reviews.Content: When I go on vacation and return we ask ourselves these questions: did the AI make us feel special, was the food good, and did we come back much more relaxed than before we went? To these questions then answer is a High Five Yes! From the moment we arrived we fell in love with the grounds. The villas where we stayed (Villa 8) felt like an oasis. The room was modern with plenty of closet and drawer space for our clothes. Everything in the room was spotless. Every day the maid came in and had flowers in an arrangement on the bedspread, and the refrigerator was well-stocked with bottled water, soda , and beer. As others have said, the bed is very firm almost like a rock. It did bother us the first couple of days but we slept well. Be careful to close your sliding glass door at all times to keep the mosquitoes out. We forgot one evening and paid the price. Remember to bring mosquito repellent. Ocean Maya felt like our own community. I liked it because it is compact. We met people from all over -- Canadians, British, and our own Americans.There are two pools that are situated so that you can walk to either one and relax. The smaller of the two was the activity pool where Amy and her crew worked gathering us to participate in activities like volleyball, exercise, dancing, even a race over a surf board. There is a swim up bar and service at both pools. I never found the drinks watered downed and if you want top shelf liquor if not on Privilege just ask. What made this area so great was not only the pools but lunch was next to the quiet pool in the Mexican Restaurant only a few steps to walk. If you wanted to sit and eat by your chaise lounge there was a grilling station with Kabobs, hamburgers, chicken and even steaks. I agree that the beach was not in top condition but to walk to the Lagoon, turn left and take a small hike along the beach and see a beautiful cenote with azure water so pure looking with fish and soft sand. It was a field trip so picturesque. When finished sun bathing and returning to the room all made up we looked forward to activities in the evening. I have to say since I have been to other all-inclusives, Ocean Maya's entertainment had great shows overall. The Madonna, Mayan show, ballroom dancing and Mexican dancing with a full live band and a soloist really stood out. There were also two fantastic Cuban magicians that performed before the Mexican show. Before the show one could sit in the lobby where there was drink service in their comfortable couches and chairs and do people gazing or play cards. I never felt there was a dull moment. Before the main show there was a saxophone player who did a variety of favorites outside by the fountain. Imagine star gazing and having music and recognizing people you have met or striking up a conversation with someone new. We did that. Everyone we talked to couldn't believe the level of fun at this resort. The employees from Maria the sub directorate, the front desk people, and Yuritzi at guest services made our stay wonderful. How can I put the food. It is not 5 star but it is way above what we thought when we arrived. In the Morning the breakfast buffet had stations with a huge variety. We have to give kudos to Aurora at the Grill station for omelets and eggs. She had always a smile and asked how are we? She really whipped up a big omelet that my wife and I could split in two. There was always champagne, wonderful bread, traditional cold cuts, hot cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt and breakfast sandwiches. I have to admit I liked being seated and not having to look for a table when arriving. One nice added touch was the sax player who also played the flute. It was so relaxing. Dinner as other reviews have stated there are 3 ala cartes. Of the three, we went twice to the Japanese ate at the Hibachi Table and I was amazed at the amount of food and how great the cook was with his flying act of knives and utensils. The Italian restaurant faced the ocean and with music piped over speakers it felt so laid back. The quality of both was super great. The Mexican Restaurant was not anything special and I was a little disappointed. If you read this far you must want to know were there any cons? I guess if I was knit picky I could mention one or two. There was never any butter to be found for the bread. Not important to some but I like it in the morning with toast. And the only other complaint is the beds felt too firm. Also, we had to call and request that the maid leave us hand towels and wash cloths. These are minimal drawbacks. In summary WOW the grounds, the people who work so hard to make your stay special, and the ambiance of the Resort makes the review of the Ocean Maya a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Overall experience of property o.k. - people wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Baxtero
Reviews.Content: We decided to try an H10 property in Mexico this year. This property was purchased by H10 and "retrofitted", so to speak. The Privilege building is in the very back (furthest from the water) of the property and clearly was built as something else. The rooms are large, but bathrooms are pretty small and the balconies small with a view of just another building. Food at this resort o.k., but the coffee is terrible. Bring your own! Alberto ( waiter) and Ivonne (Privilege beach area) were great! I wouldn't go back to,this property, though, as the beach is also very small.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Louise S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale from 30th January - 13th February and it was by far the best holiday i have ever had. As we had delayed our honeymoon for 5 months, i wasn't expecting any of the honeymoon extras as normally it has to be with 30 days of the wedding, however we were surprised to find a bottle of wine, chocolate covered strawberries and a voucher for a romantic dinner on the beach and a room service breakfast in our room. We stayed on the upper floor in villa 7, which was perfect. It was to the quieter side of the hotel ground, but still close to the beach, pool and lobby. We tried all the a la carte restaurants and the food was excellent (the Mexican was my personal favourite, if only for the Lime pie dessert), even in the buffet restaurant, the food was excellent with lots of choice. We were never disappointed. The staff are very hard-working and their attention to detail is fantastic. The room was always clean, the mini bar always restocked and the grounds and gardens looked amazing. I simply cannot rate this hotel high enough, it has to be experienced. The romantic dinner on the beach was certainly a highlight, it can be booked and paid for in resort and i would highly recommend it if you are staying for a speacial reason or simply want to indulge in the perfect romantic moment. Aurora was our waitress that night, which added a special private touch for my husband and i, which the hotel couldn't possibly have known about. The entertainment team our fantastic, whilst they are out and about trying to get you involved in things, a polite No is all it takes and they will leave you alone. Take lots of change or small bill notes as the Mexicans rely on tips to make their money and it is certainly deserved. I, personally, rarely tip but even i did here. The beach was beautiful and clean as were the pools and we always found an available sunlounger.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzi250367
Reviews.Content: Just got back two days ago, the hotel was lovely and the staff were all lovely... namely Ignacio and benjamin who were the bar staff, Mary in La Hacienda restaurant. Just a quick review, we originally were in a ground floor room but asked for a first floor which was great, they couldnt do for two days but helpfully they moved us with no problem whatsoever. the food is okay but after the first week we wanted something alot spicier. look out for the Coarti, Raccoons and Iguanas.. absolutely fantastic. Tip: remember to take extra money for tips, these people do not earn a lot of money namely £5 a day, so please tip them. I didnt realise that you can take US dollars also so take a bit of both. Cocktails are great and you wont go hungry as there is plenty of both. Take the hotel bus to Player del Carmen, fantastic 4 hours and have a trip into Senior Frogs by the ferry to Cozumel. We would definately go back.... only one drawback was a certain noisy nation they dont talk they shout!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MathT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya Royale from January 29-February 5. I contacted Maria Lopez at the hotel prior to our arrival to inquire if we were eligible for the honeymoon upgrade (at booking it said it was only valid for 30 days after the marriage and we were about 6 weeks after). I also requested in advance an upper floor room in a quiet area of the hotel, with a mattress topper on the bed. We arrived at the hotel in the early morning and had to wait until the afternoon for our room to be ready. No problem, our luggage was stored for us and we were shown to hospitality rooms with showers where we could change and get ready for the day. Once we were shown to our room...well thanks Maria! We did in fact receive the honeymoon upgrade (and didn't have to show proof of marriage even though I brought our marriage certificate). The room was exactly as requested (upper level in block 18, very close to the lobby/restaurant but far enough away that noise wasn't much of an issue). A flower heart on the bed and rose petals on the floor, champagne and goodies, as well as certificates for a romantic dinner on the beach and room service breakfast. We really appreciated this after our long travel day and the wait to check in! As others have said, the beach isn't great but what there is is well maintained. We never had trouble getting a lounger, and we never made it to the beach or pool much before 9 or 10am. You might have an issue finding something around the "party" pool but otherwise there is always something somewhere. I don't think people really reserve the beds, it's more that they come down and sit for a while then go for breakfast or lunch or to play volleyball or something, then come back later. Another thing we noticed was how well the grounds are maintained...and the beaches are always being raked of seaweed. There was always a security guard on duty all day and night as well. The food was great, we tried all the a la cartes and were not disappointed. Even the buffet was good, there was always a good selection, the food was hot, and they have stations where food is prepared on the spot for each meal (omelettes in the morning, stir frys, etc at lunch and dinner) The romantic dinner on the beach was awesome as well...I believe privelige upgrade people may get this option as well, you should definitely take advantage. If not you can pay extra for the experience as well...I think $50-$100 depending on menu...would also be worth it. The drinks were great and DEFINITELY not watered down here! The staff was amazing. Always a "hola" in passing, and great service at the bars and restaurants, we especially like Imelda in the lobby bar and Victor for our romantic dinner/Italian a la carte. The entertainment staff were great also, Fernanda, Amy, Amanda and Omar always had things rocking at the party pool and tried to get people involved. Also they handed out surveys to see how your trip was and one of the managers went around with a book to ask about your stay, concerns etc, and made notes. So they really seem to care about how they are portrayed and how they come across, they really want to do a good job. Bring lots of small bills for tips as change is hard to come by at the reception desk and you will want to tip the staff for their great work. The room was always cleaned well, as others have mentioned the shower leaked (but we just mopped it up with a towel, no problem). Also facecloths were an issue for us as well, if we didn't leave a note we didn't get any. The TV remote didn't work but we weren't concerned enough about it to complain. We weren't there to watch TV anyway! As for the toilet paper issue, this seems to be the way things are in the entire area, the first thing I noticed in the bathroom at the Cancun airport was a sign asking not to flush the paper. So it's not just this resort. Yes it's a bit gross but you get used to it, and they are very good about changing the waste baskets. One thing I didn't like was that the resort has street type vendors that come Tuesday/Thursday/Saturday and set up in the courtyard. I didn't care for this, as they were quite aggressive and I felt like I had to run the gauntlet with them if I wanted to get to the lobby, the theatre, or the restaurants. If I wanted to shop I'd go to Playa or Cancun. But I can see how some people would like this. We were delayed on the trip home due to weather at home and flights not arriving to pick us up. Transat put the whole plane full of us up at the Moon Palace for the day. I have to say it was a nice hotel but didn't really compare to Ocean Maya. The staff were not friendly, it was HUGE (we got lost finding our room) and the noise in the restaurants and pool was CRAZY because of all the kids. We really realized how much we appreciated the quiet ambiance of Ocean Maya after the day at Moon Palace! On the whole, a very good trip and I would return here for sure. Bring extra sunscreen (it costs $30 in the gift shop!!) and bug spray (mosquitos in the rooms at night will eat you alive). Also I would say the average age of visitor was 40+ so definitely not a young adults only type scene.

Reviews.Title: “A great relaxing break in warm and friendly Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Russ G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from two weeks at the Ocean Maya Royale and we had a very relaxing and enjoyable time there. Check in was a breeze accompanied by a nice cold drink and the room in one of the garden villas was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The gardens around the resort were immaculate and there were always gardeners around trimming, tidying and planting. All of the communal areas were also clean and tidy. The facilities were good with free wi-fi in the lobby area. There were 4 restaurants The Hacienda was the main buffet restaurant for breakfast lunch and dinner. The Mexican restaurant was located by the pool and was available for lunch and dinner. The Japanese and Italian restaurants were available for dinner only. These two were the best and the Japanese just edged the Italian for quality and service. Both the Japanese and Italian restaurants were great and even when they were busy Hector at the Italian or Ulisses (apologies for the spelling) at the Japanese could always find you a table within 30 minutes and waiting at the bar with a cold drink while they found a table was really no problem. The buffet restaurant was also excellent and even the fussiest of diners would be able to find something to eat. They regularly cooked fresh seafood (particularly fresh prawns) to order and frequently the meat station would have chicken and beef or pork available to be cooked to order. The cold meats and cheese selection always had a massive choice and in the morning eggs and omelettes just as you like them were prepared to order. I am sorry to say that we found the Mexican restaurant to be the worst for food quality and unfortunately for service while we were there (and I love spicy food) but the other three restaurants more than made up for this mild disappointment. An added little bonus was Mike’s coffee shop; this was part of the all inclusive and a great place for a speciality coffee after dinner or for a coffee and a pastry in the afternoon. The Italian restaurant had an excellent bar attached to it. The pool bar and the lobby bar both operated all day and there was also a small bar attached to the Mexican restaurant. The guys at the lobby bar work non-stop in the evenings and cope no matter how many guests are around. We never found ourselves waiting for a drink for longer than a few minutes. Thanks to Rafael for always making sure my gin and tonic did not run too low and for all the cocktails that my wife enjoyed. The odd tequila shot was also welcome (when in Mexico….!!). Imelda was often our waitress in the evening and she looked after us superbly too. We met some great people while we were there and enjoyed many a day by the pool or evening by the bar having a chat with new friends Bob and Diane from Canada and Dave and Yvonne from Nottingham. Special thanks go to Maria Lopez who arranged a special occasion dinner for us with the executive chef and also organised a romantic dinner for us out by the beach one evening. Maria, as I said when we met at the hotel the staff are a great credit to the hotel and we felt very spoiled while we were your guests. We would happily return to this hotel. One minor negative was the quality of the sun loungers on the beach and by the pool some of them were old and worn and they could all do with being a higher standard to match the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD RESORT, GOOD STAFF”
Reviews.Author: sun-sampler
Reviews.Content: i liked the food, the drinks, the rooms....it was all nice. the only negative thing i found was the beach. it was rocky / muddy. if ocean swimming is your main activity this might not be the resort for you. the pools were kept clean and are beautiful at night all lit up. the barstaff quick and friendly. we enjoyed the entertainment more than most resorts. had no problems finding loungers. the place seemed to be very well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florence020
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negative out of the way first - the beach was disappointing - but the hotel isn't responsible for the hurricane that spoiled it and I'm sure it will be rectified as soon as possible. I personally would have liked a better mattress but's that's probably due to my age (65+). We also had a leaky shower and the dates are right for Berlin Dublin to have followed us into the room (2704?). That said everything else was wonderful. The accommodation is in villas consisting of 8 rooms set in beautifully maintained gardens. We were in a basic room, that is Premier as opposed to Privilege, and it was very well equipped. All of the staff - reception, catering, housekeeping, gardeners and the animation team were very friendly and helpful. The food was good in all of the restaurants but especially the buffet where there was so much choice and they never seemed to run out even on the few occasions when we were late. The pool scene was pretty lively and the evening entertainment quite good - what we saw of it as our days were so active we were shattered. The beach wasn't so bad that we couldn't swim in the sea and we did so almost every day. A couple of times we walked along the beach to where the underground river emerges and runs into the sea. This was great fun. You just lie back and the current carries you out towards the sea (there is a barrier to stop you floating away) or you can 'ride' it and pretend to be an olympic swimmer. This being our first trip to Mexico we did several excursions, Si'an Kaan, Chichen itza where we were able to swim in a cenote and, finally, the Dolphin Push. We took the bus to the beautiful Akumel. Sadly, Playa del Carmen was not the chic boutiques and restaurants we were expecting, in truth it was a bit scruffy. (Nice beach though). This was the first time we had stayed in an adults only hotel and must say it was lovely and quiet apart from a party of very noisy Americans who, fortunately, had only come for a long weekend. All in all a wonderful holiday, great value for money and we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING~!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWalsh
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. My husband and I had a fabulous time. I truly think there are some people that can't be pleased! We ate at the buffet for every breakfast and lunch and then tried each of the 3 restaurants...all had there on perks and all were great. No, food is not always going to be the perfect temperature at a buffet...you try cooking for 100's of people!!! The entertainment was fun...I can honestly say the Madonna show was MUCH better then the super bowl halftime show. If you are so pampered (LAZY) that you need to be waited on hand and foot, then spend 3x as much at Sandals and leave us to our fun at Ocean Maya Royale. We didn't do privilege and with the exception of the beds that isolate in the special area, didn't see a need. I can't WAIT to return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing holiday, welcoming staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BerlinDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks from 26th Jan. The hotel is a 45 min transfer from the airport and check in was smooth and fast. The grounds are exceptionally clean and well maintained, beautifully landscaped, with lots of cute coatis and lizards, neither of which bothered us. We had some difficulty finding our building even with the map given to us, but that may be as we were tired after the long flight. Room was clean and exactly as in the pictures on the website, bed very comfortable and air con very effective. Only negative was that the shower door leaked and soaked the bathroom. Bring mosquito spray and turn the air con right down - or the mosquitos will attack you all night!!! Food was fantastic, vast range in buffet restaurant at breakfast, lunch and dinner, beautifully presented and well stocked, amazing salads and fruit selection. The Mexican restaurant was nice, the Italian fantastic and the Oriental amazing, do try the tepanyaki table. The staff are first class at the resort, exceptionally friendly and helpful. You can see that so many truly love what they do. They don't solicit tips, but we tipped 20 or 50 pesos to those who gave outstanding service. Taxi drivers and coach drivers expect tips and ask for them! The pool areas are clean and the toilets regularly cleaned and checked by the maids. The entertainment pool was lively, but you can get peace and quiet at the larger pool. There were plenty of sunbeds on the beach and by the pool, unfortunately lots of people reserved them and then sauntered down at midday, but when we arrived at the pool at 10am-ish there were still plenty left. The beach was small and the water a bit murky, but we swam anyway and it was lovely. The beach at Tulum is breathtaking, white sand and clear light blue seas. The beach at Playa Del Carmen was fantastic too. We took the free hotel shuttle to Playa del Carmen, but didn't enjoy the town, off the main street the vendors were a bit seedy and the souvenirs we found were mass produced and over priced. We would recommend the hotel, fantastic value for money and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Week!”
Reviews.Author: JonesBurner
Reviews.Content: I had a great week with 3 other girlfriends, week of Feb. 5 - 12th. I had been to this resort two years ago when it was still a family resort. Now it's 'adults only' and it's great! Check in wasn't the fastest, but it was accurate. We had to wait for our room, but it was ready by 1:30, and by that time we'd spend a few hours poolside after enjoying a delicious lunch from the pool buffet. Accommodations: Rooms are decent size, newly updated, and immaculate. Each has a little deck/balcony with two chairs, and all the amenities you'd expect. Face clothes are hard to come by, but we had loads of larger towels. Grounds: Very well maintained and clean. Lots of walking and that's a good thing with all the good food. Food: Excellent! Main buffet & pool buffet both had a variety of items each day. There are the standby's... fresh bread that is out of this world, fresh guacamole, chips, and salsa, fruit etc.... Mornings offered great omelettes and many interesting Mexican dishes. Lunch always a choice of a few meats - fish, chicken & pork...sometimes even buffalo chicken wings. Dinner buffet was good, and the a la cartes were all excellent. The most disappointing was the Mexican restaurant. It was good, but nothing to write home about. The Italian had a few excellent pasta dishes - cooked perfectly to a la dente. I do not like mushy pasta! We did try a seafood casserole that was a little odd... pretty much shrimp in tomato sauce and too salty. Everything else was great. We went to the Japanese restaurant twice - one with regular seating, the other at the tapenaki table and both were very good. Suffice to say we all came home in tighter clothes. Moises made sure we were looked after with seating and greeting, and Benjamin was an excellent server... so gracious. Thank you boys! Bars: Havier at the pool bar is a genius with margherita's and all were attentive and did their best to keep up with the crowds. I think the longest I ever had to wait was maybe 5 minutes and that was the exception. The entertainment staff was a lot of fun. The evening shows were a bit of a joke. It's dancing and lipsinking and not very good at that. The dancing outside after the show was fun though. So nice to dance outside in fresh air instead of a dark stinky disco. Ricardo, aka 'Sexy Boy' was their ringleader ... very sociable and interacted with all the guests constantly... not in a pushy way either. Suzanne was also very social and friendly. We did participate in a few aquatics classes, and afternoon games, and everything was done in a fun way. The activity hut also housed a lending library... always good to know you can find another paperback on a lazy holiday. I think Ocean Maya is very close to their 5 star rating... I'd still rank it as a 4.5... better communication in some of the areas would be helpful... many struggle with even basic English. Bottom line we had a great holiday and I'd certainly keep this resort in mind if I was to go back to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this resort!”
Reviews.Author: devonalberta
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Ocean Maya Royale and can honestly say this was the best holiday out of 5 in the Mayan Riviera yet! The staff were unbelievable - Dulche (Sweety), Luis (who never ever went home), Fernando, Jobina, and all of the entertainment staff were just the best! The grounds were kept in immaculate condition by the hard workers. And I am not sure what the rest of you expected with the food but we felt it was the best out of the 4 resorts we have stayed in and really enjoyed the food - every night!!! The fact that there was no children at the resort (thankfully) this kept the hot-dogs, hamburgers and pizza to a minimum - thank God!! The drinks were stupendous and I honestly can't find one thing that I could complain about at all! The rooms were very large and kept so very clean. As for the beach - the staff were up before dawn trying to keep it clean and in case no one mentioned it the wind was relentless but to the best of my knowledge - the hotel can't control that!! If you had walked down the beach - some of the hotels were much worse than this!! We had booked a "Ocean View" room to start with and weren't really impressed with the view when we got there and all we had to do was ask for a better room and we were moved immediately - can't say this has ever happened before at any other resort! Thanks to Dulche aka Sweetie!! I believe the fact that this is an adults only resort makes it much friendly and we met so many wonderful people there from all over - the UK (Chris & Linda & Lorraine & her husband), Steve and the group from Iowa and of course my new pool buddies from Sarnia (Larry the cable guy & John Candy & Stacey and the rest of you - way too much fun). And I particularly glad I didn't meet Marissa from wherever as she has a pretty lousy attitude as well as lousy spelling and grammar! There is just no pleasing some folks! We would return to the Ocean Maya Royale in a heartbeat and probably will next year! The weather was not really the best but who can order that up! As one of the pool guys said - it's all inclusive that means the weather too!! It's all in the attitude folks!! And please try and remember - you are not paying the same price as you would at Secrets or a Rui hotel!! And as for the plane "malfunction" - something else we can't control! And kudos to Transat for putting us up at the Moon Palace - not the type of place for me but entirely lovely just way too big! I honestly feel that if you aren't happy at the Ocean Maya Royale resort - you just aren't a happy person and stay home!! Wonderful people, staff and resort in general!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon paradise”
Reviews.Author: geeceetje
Reviews.Content: We went to a touroperator and asked for a luxurious, all-in resort, adults only, and a outdoor temperature around 30° C, no matter where. And so w went to the Ocean Maya Royale in Mexico. We got what we wanted and so much more. The OMR hotel is simply paradise. What to say? Let's start with it's very friendly and professional staff. All personnel is very helpful. They do their job with joy and pride. The site is perfect. The hotel is situated near the coast, between Cancún and Playa del Carmen. In the lobby is a nice bar and some shops - with acceptable prices for fashinable jewelry. The cocktails are ok, the coffee is superb. There's even a special coffeebar, called "Mike's", with exquise mocha frappé and delightful vanilla latte, thanks to the lovely and skillful Karolina. The toilets are very clean - turn your back and a lady pops up cleaning the smallest spot. It's necessery though with those drunken tourists ... Just outside the lobby is the theatre, where shows are given (there's also a pool table). Don't expect broadway, but you will have about an hour of good entertainment each day at 9:30 p.m. You will meet the performers (especially Amy and Daniela) at other occasions too: it's the entertainment team that keeps you busy near the pool! Two pools are available, not heated though. Since no children are allowed at the premises, there's no splashing, no running, no shouting ... Unless some noisy Americans checked in - but, hey, if it aren't Americans, some other group of noisy people will spoil a fraction of the splendid atmosphere. The facilities are plenty, so you can always look for a quiet place. The beach itself is not lengthy - about 30 metres - but that suffices to get in and out the caribean. There are enough seats for everyone to find a place to sunbath, read, sleep ... under palmtrees or parasols, on the sand, near the pool. If you happen to get bored, you can jetski, have a massage, learn Spanish, ... Or take a tor to a cenote, Chitzen Itza, Ek Balam, Playa del Mar, Villadolid, ... what we all did. Take a day per visit, booked inside the hotel. At the hotel you can go to the spa into the hot tub (reservations needed). The restaurants serve good food. There's El Hacienda, with a grand buffet, sometimes thematic. At Yokooso you can eat 'teppaniaki': you sit around a grill with 8 while a chef cooks on the spot. The Mexican-Japanese cook does his best to give a entertaining performance with his knife abd fork, but the food he prepares is better. We also choose à la carte', and that was very nice: artfully served and honest flavours. The new Italian restaurant 'La Dolce Vita' is situated at the end of the premises, near the beach. The dishes aren't big, but they're very, very good. El Charro is located next to the pools. It's genuines Mexican food. During the afternoon you can have a snack there. Try the splendid beef hamburger with cheese and fries with cheddar on the side. The rooms are located in two level villa's. If you have the chance to book with ocean view, make sure you are on the second level. The rooms are in perfect condition, the cleaning ladies are the best. Leave the airco on at a perfect 22°C. The boxspring beds are exactly what you need. Don't forget a walk on the beach at sunset. And experience moonrise out of the sea. For honeymooners like us, it IS paradise. We for sure will go back to Ocean Maya Royale (5 years from now...).

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a "Rock Star"”
Reviews.Author: TAGJR_11
Reviews.Content: Traveled with two other couples. The entire staff made us understand what "privileges" are all about! Thanks to Luis Castillo, Claudia Espinosa (guest services), we felt Very Special. We had a private dinner with Executive Chef, Deyanira Gonzalez that was Fantastic! Ivonc served our drinks at the "Privilege Section" of the beach and was the perfect host. It's true she did know our names after the first day! I would tell everyone to advantage of the "Privilege Package." Thanks again to everyone and General manager Giovanni Gil for a pampered holiday. Just a note to all travelers, "a Smile and a Thank-You," goes a long way. Will recommend this location to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!! Not what it seems!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marissa1976
Reviews.Content: This resort looks great but it is no 5 star. My husband and I whent Privalege if you are thinking of this option save your money. I had read reviews of previouse guests bad and good and thought we would take our chances. We had simalar problems like the other guests. 1. They didn't have our room we booked we had to downgrade we had seen this in a few reviews. 2. The bed was hard as a rock 3. The beach WHAT BEACH!!! It is not like they advertise 4. Water was an isue they are very cheap with the bottle water remember to use it when you brush your teeth. 5. Food is o.k not great no 4 or 5 star 6. The spa is a joke save your money and tip. I don't think they have any training my 13 year old can give a better massage. No pampering at this place. Not worth it. 7. We would of liked a nice fancy drink you know with the fruit and stuff , no such luck 8.I think we had a drink down on the beach 5 times waitresses are scarce. You have to get them yourself. oh ya and no food on the beach. You can't leave the Buffet with a plate and take it to your room. or any of the other restaurants. You can get room service but it has a very small salection and it was always cold when it came (NOT GOOD) if you get the pancakes make sure to ask for syrop if you don't you won't get any same with cream for your coffee. Also they do not give it in your room with the coffee maker just coffee. 9. the front desk staff are no help what so ever don't try to get change because they never seem to have any or if you have a problem they will push you of to the next guy and the guy after that or the guy that will be in the next day. They play dumb. 10. We asked for bug spray and was told they don't keep it incase people are alergic to it. But she offerd to get my room sprayed. Does that make sence????? There are some bugs that live in the sand kinda like a nociam very tiny my husband got bit like crazzzy they didn't seem to like my blood. I was fine. 11. The gift shop/candy shop I left my camera in the gift shop when and sat down for breakfast and noticed I didn't have it. I ran back and asked if she saw it, the girl held out her hands slapped them together and shook her head no then proceeded to read her book. She didn't even offer to look with me. As I left I yeld at her, THANKS FOR ALL YOUR HELP!!!!!! I have to say this as a big big let down. Not as it appears we don't travel much and have never been to Mexico this was our first time. I guess I was expecting what all our friends have expierianced good and great things and they go twice a year not to this resort. After what we told them they will not be trying the Ocean Maya Royal. Just because they put Royal in the name doesn't make it Royal service NOT A 5 * maybe a 3 or 4 . When you book a trip that looks like they offer high expectations they should live up to them and deliver no less. We didn't expect caviar dreams, but we didn't think we would get sardine dreams. The good things I can say is they have hard working general staff I feel bad for them they have to work at a place like this. I think we ended up tipping about $300 in 7 days bring a lot of $1 bills remember the front desk won't give you any. And if you have a drink you like at home that isn't on the menue the bartenders will try to make it for you. We gave $1 every drink. I asked one guy how many hour he worked he said 8 yet I saw him there from morning to night. They work hard. Can't say the same for the privilege staff.. Walk down the beach for about 15min and you will find a nice lagoon. Don't stay in the privilege building it is the farthest from the beach. Take Care and hope you have a great trip....

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: COstorga
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to this resort for her 50th birthday, as her first ever trip to Mexico. She was so excited as we made our way to the beach the first morning...only to find that the water was a nasty brown. While this isn't the resorts fault, it is a definite turn off. There were many things we liked about the resort, but also many things we didn't like. As this is not my first stay at an all-inclusive, I can say that I wouldn't return here, or refer my friends here. First, the good things. The staff are exceptionally friendly, and are always there to lend a helping hand. The resort, and its grounds are beautiful, and all of the wildlife is so exciting to see. Almost every drink we ordered was wonderful, and if we were in the lobby, or out in the plaza area, or by the pool, we were waited on hand and foot. The shows the entertainment staff put on were great and it was nice to have something to do in the evening. I told the resort it was my mom's birthday and they had a cake and wine waiting in the room for us! That was super exciting for her! The bad: We never got sick from the food or water, but I would say the food is average at best. Nothing really wowed us. There was no service at the beach, unless you were a privilege customer. If you aren't a privilege customer, don't count on eating at the hibatchi table in the Japanese restaurant unless you wait until 9:00 pm. Unless of course, you get lucky and there is a cancellation while you're there, which we did on our last night after we were seated at a regular table. The restocking of towels, especially washcloths in our room was subpar. We went three days with only one wash cloth and when I asked the staff for more, she told me to press zero and ask the front desk. I called the front desk, and by the next day, still no wash cloths. And no coffee. We stopped by on our way to breakfast, and finally more wash cloths were delivered after noon, and we had already requested more by the cleaning staff that came in that day. My biggest complaint about the resort is the lack of water. We were given three bottles of water in the room. One for coffee, and two in the mini fridge. When we requested more, we were told we would have to pay for it. You can't get bottled water anywhere, only glasses from the dispenser. On our last day, we decided to skip breakfast to get in some beach time before check-out at noon. I couldn't get water from anywhere until the bar opened at 10:00 am. I was told they were closed, and they wouldn't even give me water. You should not have to go without water, at any time at an all inclusive resort. I have stayed at much better places, particulary the Valentin Imperial Maya. While it may cost a bit more, I would return there before returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!”
Reviews.Author: dwirick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from Jan 24-Jan 31. I am going to write this review in two sections. The first section will cover the "not so good qualities of the resort," whereas, the second section will highlight the "good qualities of the resort." I am reviewing in this way, because I want to demonstrate that the good does outweigh the not so good. NOT SO GOOD QUALITIES OF THE RESORT: The beach, or lack thereof, was disappointing to say the least. However, with that being said, it is not to be blamed upon the resort itself. Mother nature was in definite control. Food: The food quality was average. Of the four restaurants, the Japanese, was our favorite. TIP: please make a reservation, as you will have to wait, depending upon how full the resort is The opaque glass on the boardwalk prevented us from actually enjoying the view of the ocean. The boardwalk was a nice touch, just seemed odd that those in the privilege section couldn't even see the ocean. And, the most obvious downfall of the privilege upgrade was that our room was the farthest away from the beach/ocean. That made no sense whatsoever to us! .GOOD QUALITIES OF THE RESORT: Staff: The staff is definitely the number one asset this resort has to offer. They were friendly, hard working, attentive, and went above and beyond. I would like to know in an email reply from someone on the management team, how these staff members are recognized when those on Trip Advisor write specific positive comments about particular staff (please advise). Ivonne in the privilege beach section definitely needs to be recognized for her hard work. She made us feel right at home. Grounds: The grounds were plush, green, and highly aesthetic. Once again, the staff members were always working to maintain superior quality! Keep up the good work. Bathroom around the "quiet" pool: The women's bathroom was spotless. The female staff (sorry, I did not get her name) was constantly cleaning and replenshing paper towels, etc. She worked nonstop! Spa: I had a deep tissue massage and reflexology--OUTSTANDING. The spa was immaculate, and the 90 minute massage was less expensive than a comparable one in the U.S. The spa staff was outstanding. I would definitely visit the spa again if I were going to return to this resort. Housekeeping (Anna)--room 106, was outstanding. She did a wonderful job with our room. The linens were clean and the bed was comfortable. In summary, we would not recommend this resort to those who desire a large beach as a requirement for the ideal vacation. If, however, you are looking for excellent service, you will definitely find it at this resort. Service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “oceana maya”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews on trip advisor prior to our trip jan.24 thru feb 2, i will say the hotel was noticebly adressing the concerns which we had read about. For example, they had workers on the beach shoveling seaweed from the beach from sun up till sun down, i actually felt really bad for those poor guys cause some days it was just a losing battle. Also from the reviews, we knew to ask for the mattress topper too, which i dont think i could have taken without...literally felt like you were sleeping on a box spring alone without. There were animals everywhere which i didn't mind but some poeple were complaining about, but this is through no fault of the hotels, guests insist on feeding them constantly i observed, one lady practicly had a racoon in her lap one morning..idiot! I observed many guest with their own thermal mugs which i wish i would have thought of...would have been great for the beach. The bar was occasionally a wait in the day, my husband and i were happy with the selection of corona on tap, mojitos, and captain and cokes. My husband arranged a 2 day trip for us during our stay in which we rented a car and stayed over one night in a charming little city. i would highly recomend this we were able to visit Coba which was amazing, chitzen itza, 6 different cenotes, and akmel, which we never would have been able to do so much had we gone by tours only and it was a third of the price from what they were charging for the tours. ***BRING BUG SPRAY*** you will need it. and over pack on sunscreen, it costs a fortune there. Also it downpoured about 30 minutes at least every night, so pack a travel umbrella, it will be nice to have if you get caught in. We loved that it was adults only and will never do anything other than, there was a huge hotel next door that was packed with screaming kids and every last square inch of their beach was covered with people, we would not have enjoyed. Only complaint about hotel was that the food was not consistent, it was good one meal, horrible another. And i know this is terrible to say but my husband had a sneaking suspicion that the steak served one night at the buffett was re-served a different way the following day... but this is only speculation. Overall we had an amazing vacation, the weather was beautiful and thats all we needed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: jtournour
Reviews.Content: Great resort. We stayed there from Jan 26-Feb 2. We loved everything about the resort. Nothing to say negative. We really loved the size of the resort. It was on the smaller size, very compact has everthing you need, but we Iiked how the pools were right beside the ocean and beach. It was the best of both worlds. You could take a dip in the pool or ocean it was all right there. Our room was right in the middle of everything which was great, not too much walking. The entertainment staff were awesome. Ricardo, the best!! Friendly, approachable, made everyone feel at home and having fun. All staff were great. Others include: Fernie, Amy, Amanda with the enteraintment and Vincente and Mary at the buffet. Food: Great food and selection at the buffet. We also went to the Italian restaurant twice and loved it. Room: Very nice and clean Staff: Everywhere was very nice and helpful Loved the adults only. We will definitly do that again Grounds: Lovely and well maintained This resort does not have a disco but I actually like what they did instead. Most resorts have a disco and you are either in the mood to continue partying and dancing or not. Well at Ocean Maya after the evening's entertainment show everyone spills out onto the courtyard and lobby bar the entertainment staff have music themes every night where the dancing continues in the courtyard. You can either sit and enjoy with a drink or take part in the dancing. I really liked how it was outside in the lovely caribean evening air rather than a dark stuffy disco. As many have mentioned the beach is not the greatest. I found that that there were red flags up several days and people in general were not going in the water the other days. The water was murky. We are not beach walkers so that is not a problem for us. I like to take a dip in the ocean and the pool so the layout with both right together was perfect. We went to Playa del Carmen 5th Avenue twice. We did not take the hotel shuttle as it was at 10am and we did not want to miss out on sun shine time at the beach. Instead we went around 5pm so we had a bit of daylight and then the evening energy. It is a MUST do. It was a 20 USD cab ride about 10 minutes. I could not believe how much fun it was. So many people, shopping, restaurants. Lots of tours to choose from in the area but one that is not so common is the half day trip to Akumal to snorkel with the giant sea turtles. Ask about this one. Very cool and worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, friendly, top-notch!”
Reviews.Author: 12talbot
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here from Feb. 12th -19th, our holiday was more than we had hoped for. What made it particularly enjoyable was the totally hospitable and friendly, warm feeling we got from all of the staff. Because it is one of the smaller hotels everything is more personal and we both felt comfortable and part of everything right from the start. The staff were very professional and everyone we encountered made us feel like they cared very much about making our stay a terrific one, and it was! The food was excellent and an extensive variety to choose from. The rooms were fresh, clean, spacious and beautiful. Our balcony was near the pool and ocean, we were in villa #36 and it was great. Room 3605. A fantastic saxaphone player played each night in the main courtyard and it was so enjoyable on a warm night to sit outside with a drink and listen to the music. I had a massage by the beach and it was one of the best I have had. There were two pools which was nice, a smaller one with a swim up bar and music and one just down from it which was larger and quieter in case you didn't want to have all the action around you. The best coconut ice cream EVER. We liked that it was adult only as everything was geared towards us, a nice change. There were games around the pool with the bar each afternoon if you wanted to partake. You could put your beach chair by the pool, on the sand, and even off by yourselves for a quieter day. The beach was small but the bottom was sandy and the swimming good. We walked a few hundred yards and swam at the neighbours beach a couple of times but the bottom was much nice at our own. Drinks were excellent and the food abundant. In the morning you can get cappuccino or lattes at the bar in the lobby, each morning we were warmly greeted with a big smile by Ignacio, we loved him. Quiet at night for sleeping. If you have any questions or to confirm what you would like e-mail Maria Lopez before you do, she will get right back to you and is a fantastic help. An absolutely perfect holiday at a perfect place. Thank you so much to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Entertainment Staff was the Best!”
Reviews.Author: sunneydayz
Reviews.Content: Amy, Ricardo, and many of the entertainment staff were wonderful. They went out of their way to make me feel at home. Funny, beautiful people!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Bjbing
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 girls, travelled Nov-28/Dec5/11. I have travelled to many all-inclusive resorts and have to say I was quite impressed with this resort. I prefer a smaller resort and this fit the bill. Everything is close walking rang, walkways clean and well kept. Rooms nice, but with the weirdest glass swing through door for the bathroom. Was nice, but sounds aren't very private...lol We did have some minor issues with rooms. One room the locked patio door could be opened from the outside, and the other smelled overwhelmingly of sewer gases. Reception was great both times and moved us with no hassles. Food was very good, with lots of variety for all types of eaters. The entertainment staff was fantastic and it was obvious they loved their job. Ricardo was our very favourite. The only thing stopping me from giving this resort a 5 * is the beach. There is no beach! The walkway goes across the front of resort and to both sides of resort the beach has been completely washed away. Many dead tree stumps in the water and nobody trying to clean it up like at the resort next door. But just walk over a small rocky terrain and you'll hit good beach for walking. We got a good rate for this resort and feel we got way more than our moneys worth. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayer
Reviews.Content: We were three couples in our forties who enjoyed a one week vacation at this property Jan 13 through 20. We chose this property based on the size, proximity to Playa Del Carmen and it offered something for everyone on our group wishlist. The property is smaller than many we have stayed at in this area. No trams required and I think we actually walked more due to this. This was not a bad thing as the grounds are nicely kept and as you are walking to the beach you can admire the exotic plants and interesting wildlife. We saw many iguana's, tropical birds, coati, capabara and monarch butterflies. I love photography and this region of the world has so much to photograph. I was dissapointed upon arrival because we all paid for the priveledge upgrade and I would have liked to see a bottle of champagne at the check in desk.I have enjoyed this at many resorts and think there is something special about finally arriving at your destination and being greeted in this way. The rooms are nice and it was nice also to have a decent bracelet for a change instead of the usual florescent plastic one. Our rooms were nice and upgraded. All priveledge rooms are in a 3 story building tucked close to the main lobby area. We all thought that the upgraded package would include beachfront rooms and it does not. We met people who downgraded their package to be closer to the beach. The room has a nice shower, comfortable bed and nice linens. The garden view from the patio was interesting as far as wildlife and pretty. I loved the sounds of the tropical birds.We had to call maintenance to adjust our water temp and they were right on it. Our door lock was broken and our room smelled musty upon arrival. Again they were there within an hour and had fixed the door and fumigated our room. Service- bar service was great. Ignacio at the lobby bar is great as well as Javier at the pool bar. These guys keep you laughing and are always quick to serve you. Waiter server Alberto in the priveledge buffet room was always excellent as was Aurora the omelette lady. When these servers were not present there was a difference in the level of service. Not terrible but not as good as with the regulars. food- not a huge buffet like larger resorts but a nice selection anyhow. There was a lot more food prepared fresh just for you than I have experienced at any other resort. In the main buffet there are 2 cooking stations daily. At dinner there is a seafood station which includes raw muscles, shrimp, tuna, grouper, sometimes squid and salmon. You choose what you like and they cook it for you and add whatever you like into the pan which can be simple with wine and garlic or sauces if you prefer, the meat station directly across has chicken, beef, pork, lamb, sausages etc. and the same thing. You choose and they cook it to order. There are prepared dishes also and everything was tasty and very nicely presented. There are no reservations for meals unless you have the priveledge package. You can walk in and depending on how busy get a table immediately or wait a bit. We never waited once with our package. All the restaurants were enjoyed by all. Decent wines are served and champagne with breakfast etc. A sax player plays softly at breakfast and then every night pre-dinner with a different theme of songs nightly. He is very personable and very good. Activities- Amy and her group were fantastic. There is a fellow from Venezuela and a girl that works with Amy all day and I am sorry I cannot remember their names but these people were fantastic. Loved the pool games, their sense of humor,and all of the shows at night. We would have rather not had the talent night which was comprised of guests of the hotel but rather would have liked to see another showed put on by the animation team. A free shuttle from the hotel goes to Playa del carmen daily but sign up a day ahead. Leaves at 10 the next day and comes back at 2. A nice perk. Priveledge package upgrade- we paid $300. each for the upgrade. I would definitly go that route again. Even though I was not met with a glass of champagne it flowed freely all day and everywhere. Loved the free wifi in my room, and the separate beach area with fabulous service. Those beds were fantastic and something so decadent about laying there with a lovely view. Towels were as many as you wanted daily. They provided free books, magazines, sunscreens in this area. The package includes any drink you may want so we enjoyed grand marnier, nice tequila's etc. They gave us a free beach dinner with our package also. we went as a group and they set up a special table for us in a beachside gazebo. It was lit up with candles and pretty lanterns and the meal was a set menu that you choose in advance. We had a great time. Many people have said that they did not feel priveledge was worth the price but if you can afford to spend the extra dollars it will make your holiday more special in my opinion. I forgot to mention room service- 24hours. One thing we only received once was turn down service. would have liked to see that regularly. Beach- o.k. there has been much discussion on the beach at this property. Our initial look at the beach was dissapointing. The point of land where this hotel is situated stuck out somewhat and was therefore hit hard by the last hurricane. There is approximatly a 20 meter piece of beach missing. They built a boardwalk and have placed the priveledge beds in this area. It is gorgeous but that section has no beach. To the right there is a small section of beach. You can walk to the right but as you walk you will come across some sandbags and some palms that are now in the water due to erosion. It is not like a traditional beach walk if you are dreaming of long walk.To the left you can walk for about 20 minutes. Yes you will come across some sandbags in certain areas but the beach is wide and at the end there is a beautiful Lagoon where you can snorkel. Once you hit the lagoon you cannot walk further. The first day we arrived I was expecting to see nice clear carribean blue water but instead the water was muddy and full of seaweed which made it look worse. I asked about this and there is no control and it just depends on the weather and currents. A few days in there was no seaweed, no mud due to calmer seas and the water was a nice blue. a few people were out swimming this day as well but it is not huge. My husband craved the rolling waves to body surf on and he was not able to do this here. the pools are nice though and fairly warm. one quiet and one with activities. We all had great time on our holiday. I will mention that we travel a lot and wanted to take advantage of the H1 resort loyalty program so we could try some of their other properties worldwide. We inquired at the H1 desk and although Helen was very nice it was a timeshare scam. We declined the offer of a rep joining us for breakfast and never did end up with the card. We spoke to a couple that decided to take the information breakfast that was offered and said they had a hard time getting out of there. It was definitely a timeshare presentation. It's too bad H1 that you are not more forthcoming with this loyalty card since we would have been very interested to try your other properties but have no interest in any timeshare. Please feel free to email me with any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest resort we have been to!”
Reviews.Author: atvbragg
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Stayed from Jan 26-Feb 2. Room was super clean. Grounds superb. Pools were cleaned by a guy in scuba gear daily. Corona on tap. Lots of food options, no reservations required for the a la cartes. Italian was good, ate here twice, Mexican was disappointing, we had way better in Playa, Japanese was good, ate here twice too. Entertainment staff were a lot better than I had read on here. No children is a bonus too! Cabs are easy to come by, security the best I have seen. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone. One word of caution, in general during our stay it was not a party resort. Typically a 40+ crowd. Not saying that is bad but if you are looking to.party at all hours of the day, I suggest you go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A fair and honest review of a charming resort *Privilege Stay*”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with my wife and 8 members of my family (ages 22 to 60) from January 3rd to January 10th, 2012. We arrived at approx. 4pm and were checked in very quickly by the staff at the Privilege desk. (Note ** if you pay for the Privilege upgrade and require anything, you always go to this desk. They may not always be there. Ask at the main desk and they will page a Privilege rep for you) The Privilege rooms are situared in a three floor complex very close to the main resort buildings. If you have mobility issues, this could be a good option for you, although it does make for a longer walk (5 mins) to the pool, beach, Mexican and Italian restaurants. The first floor rooms are not as private as the balconies back onto a main green and walkway. If possible, request a second or third floor room. We also noticed that the air conditioning units in the Privilege complex had possible moisture issues (read: mold/mildew) and my allergies were acting up so we left the a/c off for most of the week and chose to keep the door to our balcony open instead. Here's another good tip: My spouse and I brought quite a bit of $1 bills with us for the week (tipping begins from the minute you get on the shuttle to your resort). It should go without saying that Please and Thank You or a smile go a long way. We say this because we noticed that not all guests at this resort had this attitude. Yes, you pay money to stay somewhere and you want to be served ... but you should still treat people with respect. This is probably why we feel like we got such great service from the staff at Ocean Maya, because we were very polite and respectful of them and the work they did for us. The resort staff are very accomodating. I asked for fluffier pillows and a privacy sign for the door ... no problem. We wanted extra water in our room fridge ... no problem. The Privilege option allows for free room service from a (somewhat limited) menu which was also nice when you are hungover. The premium alcohol selection is also nice if you are a big drinker, which I am not. Our room was always very tidy. They do ask you not to flush your toilet paper, but that is common (I believe) for places with low water pressure. No biggie. If you are young, or into the nightlife ... the resort may not offer what you are looking for BUT the entertainment staff will help you find a great deal on Coco Bongo tickets or a Pub Crawl in Cancun. We spent $65 each for a Coco Bongo ticket which included pick-up/drop-off to our resort and table service/unlimited drinks/Coco Bongo ticket. It was by-far ... the best night out I have ever had. The resort also has a free shuttle into Playa twice daily. I may stand corrected on that. You can also cab into Playa for $20 one way. You can also walk out to the main highway and flag down the bus for cheap. (Like less than 20pesos) both to Cancun and Playa. It's 15 min walk to the highway though. The resort also has nightly shows starting around 8:30pm. The entertainment staff work very hard and some of them were very good. Around 10pm they try to get the guests into games, or dancing. I think we were there ono a quiet week as most people were not into it. The lobby has free wi-fi. Privilege rooms have free wi-fi in the room. Good if you have business to do while on vacation. Food: I loved the breakfast buffet. Privilege has their own area in the back which is quieter and the waiters are excellent back there. You can also ask for a menu and order a la carte as well. Lunch was always served at the snack bar. We didn't realize until half-way through the week that we can ask for fresh grilled burgers or freshly grilled tortillas for fajitas. Due to the nature of the building - breezes flow through - which is why people will complain that the food is cold. Once I figured out that the burgers could be hot, or my fajitas could be hot ... solution solved. Also, even though you are Privilege, it's still a good idea to make reservations at the a la cartes. Especially at the japanese tepanyaki tables (which are a MUST!) Large parties are harder for them to accomodate on short notice. Just call the Privilege desk and they will handle everything. I love Japanese/Asian cuisine so that was my favorite restaurant. My spouse loves pasta, so hers was the Italian. Beach/Pool: Ocean Maya is smart. They are reinforcing their beach walls so along most of their property line is a boardwalk to prevent shoreline erosion. If you take a walk along the beach, you will see sad stories and palm trees being held up by ropes at other resorts. They do have smaller sections of natural beach still which you can lounge on as well. We spent a few hours in the Privilege beach area but dealing with the "self-rightious" attitudes of those who haul all their crap down to the beach and reserve the white balinese beach beds for four hours while they are off doing other things was a turn-off. TIP: If you want a beach bed and it's reserved ... go talk to a staff member. Everyone reserves beds, pool chairs, etc. We didn't. However if we found two empties ... we moved them where we wanted. There are two pools. One has the beach bar with music and is a little rowdy .. the other is quiet. (It was cold and cloudy when we were there I wasn't in my bathing suit much at the pool) We would have loved to have met more outgoing people at this resort, but it is not a party resort and there were not many Canadians there. The resort staff are very gay positive and did not even bat an eye when I explained that my spouse was not my sister, but my wife. If you want to party ... this is not the resort for you. The company that owns Ocean Maya is H10 and is European which would explain why there were so many people from Europe visiting. I know not every European is this way, but the ones at our resort didn't seem too friendly ... to us, or the staff. Some were just down-right rude. I suppose if you feel you paid a lot of money to go somewhere you have the right to also be an jerk sometimes too. I would definately stay with H10 while in Europe. I would not upgrade to Privilege however. Whever you choose to stay, may be it sunny and HOT. That was one thing that we missed while in Mexico and no one could fix that for us :(

Reviews.Title: “BEST TRIP EVER”
Reviews.Author: Taaryn
Reviews.Content: This past December my bestfriend and I stayed at this resort for a week, we had an amazing stay and have NO complaints at all. The beach, food, pools, hotel room and just the overall resort astonished us. What stood out the most to us was the entertainment staff, from the first day they had our names memorized and we were greeted every time by them, each one of them made us feel welcome and always made sure we were enjoying our stay. I loved the nightly shows, they all are really good dancers and we could tell how much effort was put into the shows. Fernanda, Amy and Amanda were always so nice and fun to chat with, they tought us the basics of how to salsa and took us on walks down to the lagoon many times. Omar was such a sweetheart and was so much fun to talk too. Thanks to polo, for taking us to coco bongo, best club ever we had a BLAST! My two favorite entertainers were Jess and Ricardo. Thanks to Jess, for keeping us in shape and burning off all the calories from the amazing food and drinks we had by doing aqua gym, he really knows how to get people into it and have fun, he always came to visit us by the pool to make sure we were enjoying ourselves! Ricardo was always getting us involved in all the activities.. Day and night! He was constantly making us laugh and he even came up to sing Britney spears with us during kareoke. He had great English so it was always easy to have a conversation with him, he really does a great job. Overall, we could not have chosen a better resort to stay at and "it is not a question".. We will forsure be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better than this hotel”
Reviews.Author: StorminNorma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks in January 2012 and we have to say that we have never, ever met staff as wonderful as the ones in this hotel. Nothing is ever too much, they are always smiling and happy to oblige. They even say hello to you as you are walking around the complex!! The room as as better than any suite we've ever been in, and the food choice was really, really good. The only downside we found (mainly because we were a captive audience with not really anywhere else in the vicinity to go) was that the evening entertainment was not as good as we would have expected for a hotel of this calibre. All in all, would recommend this hotel to anyone and it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: M_f_B142
Reviews.Content: I was there with my boyfriend and our two daughters from January 24th to 31st. Overall, this resort was amazing, you wil not regret your time there. This resort has the bester entertainement we've ever seen. We've been to many resort in the past and this one is amazing. The entertaiment at the pool is extremly fun; always different games organized at diffirent time of the day. The two best entertainers are RICARDO and AMY JEAN. Many thanks to both of you! You are AMAZING and have by far the greatest personality. They are a big peice for this ressort. Each night there are activities or shows at the theatre and the lobby, hosted by the entertainment staff. After, if you are interested to go to clubing to Playa Del Carmen, the entertainment staff will organized it for you. A bus pick you up at the ressort and bring you back.Very well organized. At the entrance there's always a security gard that takes your room number on your way out and takes it again once your back at the resort for safety purpose. This place is very clean and well maintain.The staff is exteremly polite and they make you feel very welcome. Whenever we pass by the staff members, they always have a nice smile and say Hi to us. As for the restaurent, I will have to say the Japaneese restaurant is the best. You must try it!!!! The only thing, if you're a beach lover, you will be desapointed, because it's very small and has a board walk in front of it. However, if you walk a few minutes to your right, you will find the beach much better. Overwall, I recommand this adult resort a 100%!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very little beach, not pretty water”
Reviews.Author: VZ S
Reviews.Content: There is very little beachfront. It is instead a boardwalk without access to the water. Below the boardwalk is a black murky water filled with dead organic material that washes up on the 30 feet of beach to the left of the boardwalk (facing the ocean) and it smelled very bad. It is a natural area where dead organic matter washes into the boardwalk and beach area. They have workers with pitchforks working on it all day, but I did not enjoy having them toil nearby. Working while I'm relaxing... To the right of the boardwalk is a beach portion where they have the kayaks and hobies but very limited seating... you'd have to camp all night there to get a spot the next morning. if you're inclined to go to Mexico to lay by the pool, this is your resort. The service was fair. There were a couple of waitresses who I felt I was being a bother. Once they fill your coffee and water, they don't come back. It's not a bad drive to Playa Del Carment shopping area... It's about 20 minutes away. The landscaping was immaculate, the courtyard was nice, there is a charming little waterfall that is a nice photo backdrop, and the natural mangroves all around. The odor of the mangrove natural area to me is a fair trade out for the conservation of the natural area. The food was as expected for an all inclusive...nothing special but worked. Coffee pot in room never worked and I tried to communicate that with the maid, who took it and brought it back later???oh well, we were close to the buffet... twice no hot water. I liked our suite very much...the porch faced the sun which was enjoyable (would have been nice to have a cup of coffee in the mornings though. It's also nice they have wifi in the lobby for free. The hammocks were nice to have some time in the shade.

Reviews.Title: “Group of 6 from WISCONSIN....We had a GREAT TIME!!!”
Reviews.Author: ktkanaman
Reviews.Content: My Husband along with our Daughters and Son-in-Laws just returned from a weeks stay at The Ocean Maya Royale and it was Wonderful!!! A Good Time was had by all. We would return to this resort,. The Resort was so beautiful, the food was awesome, the drinks were Great and the Entertainment Team was the BEST!!! Thank you Ricardo, Fernie, Jesse, Amy, Amanda, and the Rest of the Entertainment Team for making the time by the pool FUN..(I'm sure you will not forgot your group of 6 from Wisconsin) We enjoyed the Water Volleyball to Surfing and just all around fun entertainment. The shows at night were nice....we liked the Grease show the Best. As other have wrote the beach is not the best but you can walk down to the left and swim no big deal.
