The View from sitting by the pool or in the pool you could see the Ocean.....the pools are really close to the Ocean. We stayed in Villa #30 it was close to the pool. The rooms are Big and very clean. Very nice patio with a table & chair to sit on. The beds are hard like everyone writes...but we slept really good. We tried all the Restaurants and all the food We would have to say was Great!!! Remember your on Vacation or Holiday and you can make of it what you want. If you want to complain about every little thing you can find wrong then thats your choice....but if you find all the rights in this Resort like we did you will have a WONDERFUL TIME!!! And a Very Big THANK YOU to Maria Lopez...We Miss your BEAUTIFUL SMILE that we saw everyday whether it was by the pool or lobby area....from Kevin,Tammy, Mandy, Travis, Melissa and Joshua.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Great Staff, had a really good time!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpoochie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 2 weeks holiday at the Ocean Maya Royale, from 10-24 Jan. This is our honest review about the First Choice flight / staff, and also the actual Hotel. We have travelled to lots of 5 star hotels in Dominican Republic and Cuba, and will base this review on comparisons to those destinations. Flights The flight left Manchester on time, and we found the leg room on the aircraft to be fine. It has the same amount of leg room as the BA flight to Cape Town we did last year. The food and entertainment was fine, we upgraded the entertainment for £5 per person each way, this gives you additional films, games and a vast selection of CDs. You can create your own playlist from the huge selection and then just sit back and chill out to the music you want to listen to! I personally think the entertainment upgrade is well worth it. Drinks and snacks on board are pretty expensive, as they are with most airlines. The flight home was fine too, much quicker with the tail wind, we made it back in 8hrs 45mins. The food on the way home wasn’t great, but then I’m pretty fussy! First Choice Rep We thought Carlos the FC rep who is based at OMR, very approachable and helpful. He did not give the hard sell at the welcome meeting, in fact almost the opposite. He is more than willing to help you book attractions in the way that offers best value. i.e. We bought Tickets for Xplor from him, but made our own way there on the Collectivo bus, saving around $40. If we had any issues, he sorted them out straight away when reception staff proved difficult. The Hotel We arrived late afternoon, and check in was reasonably quick. We were greeted with a drink and left our luggage for the bellboy. I had e mailed in advance to request an ocean/pool view room but we did not get this. We were given a 2nd floor room in block 35. This block is to the far left of the resort as you look to the sea, and is overlooked by the hotel next door which is about 5 stories high. The patio door on this room was faulty, so we immediately went back to reception to request a room change. Within about 15 mins we were allocated a new 2nd floor room in Block 5. We enquired about upgrading to a sea view but these were all fully booked, so if you absolutely want a sea view pay when you book in the UK. Block 5 is right next to the Lobby / outdoor lounge area, we checked the room which was spacious and modern but had 2 queen beds rather than a king. The view wasn’t great but it was more private than block 35. We decided to stay in this room. That night we went to bed at around 10pm absolutely shattered after the flight and time difference. It was then we realised our mistake! If you are a light sleeper and not a party animal DO NOT STAY IN BLOCK 5!!! The music from the Lobby echos right into this block, and the music does not stop until 2am. So, we asked Carlos about moving and he explained that the disco is not on every night, and see how we go on tonight. Next night…same again… Now I’m not boring, and I love dance music, but hardcore dance at 2am after only 3 hours sleep in 2 days is not good! My husband went to reception at 7am to request another room, but was told they had nothing available and they couldn’t move us! The reception staff were very unpleasant and unhelpful. We ended up going to see Carlos the Rep, who spoke to the manager and surprise surprise they had a room available at 3pm that day. So we packed up from block 5 at 12 noon and moved into Block 23 at 3pm. This room was right in the middle of the complex, and like all the other rooms it was spacious, clean, and modern. All 3 rooms we saw looked exactly like they look in the website. We could not hear any noise in this room at all, except from above. Try to get a 2nd floor room if you can. I have a map of the complex, if you want a copy send me a personal message and I can e mail it to you. That evening we received a bottle of wine and some Chocolates with a personal message from the Manager to apologise for the room issues. Which we thought was a nice touch. There are very few true Sea View rooms at this hotel, if you want one book it in advance, and the Privilege Building is right next door to the Main Buffet Restaurant at the side of the Lobby. Not the best location in my opinion. With regards to the Privilege Upgrade, I wouldn’t waste my money. Yes you have a designated area of the beach with a waitress, but they bring drinks to everyone every so often anyway., and the pool bar is less than a 1 minute walk from anywhere around the beach or pool, and is self service for soft drinks. Yes you have an extra spirits available…i.e. Jack Daniels, but they use Bacardi and Absolute Vodka if you specifically ask for it. They had a separate area in the Buffet, but we never waited than 1 minute to be seated anyway. So really, I guess it just depends whether the extra alcohol and a larger room is so important to you? Rooms The room was lovely and clean, and had all the expected amenities. Walk in shower, which was fairly powerful and always hot. Flat screen TV with a few American channels showing movies at night, and BBC News. There is a hairdryer, but I didn’t use it. Iron and Ironing board in the wardrobe along with the safe which is Free of charge. They provide shampoo, shower gel, mouthwash, but we always take our own. There is an alarm clock with MP3 connection, and a coffee machine. The fridge was restocked every day with 2 beers, 2 Coke, Water, Sprite and Tango. The beds are firm, but it didn’t affect my sleep, and there are loads of pillows. Overall we were more than happy with our room. The Hotel gardens are absolutely spotless, there is not a single blade of grass out of place. Yes, you will definitely see wildlife in the gardens. Coatis, Racoons, Lizards and Iguana wander freely around the resort. They do not bother you if you leave them alone. The two pools are very close together, the activity pool is the smaller shallow one, and the quiet pool is larger and deeper. They play music around the pool from about 11am, yes it can get a bit repetitive, Adele, Michael Jackson, Bob Marley… you can hear the music around both pools, but If you go to far left hand side of the resort on the beach it is pretty quiet there. The Entertainment staff are great, they work so hard from early morning to gone midnight. They are there to help you have a good time, so join in or just spectate, they do fun games in the pool at 11:30, aqua aerobics at 12:00, Volleyball on the beach and in the pool, Salsa Dancing lessons, Poker games. There are also Kayaks and catamarans to use at the water sports centre to the right of the activities pool. They also do snorkelling trips, Scuba, and Parasailing for an additional fee. Food The choice and quality of food was very good. We tried all of the A la Carte restaurants, and the Italian was our favourite. I like the fact that you do not have to book, and can just turn up. The longest wait we had was half an hour, but you just get a drink and chill out. The main buffet had a large choice of food, some of the hot dishes were not always hot enough, but the salads and fruit were exceptionally fresh and always chilled. The cooking stations will cook your beef/chicken/pork/fish exactly how you want it so I would advice going for that option if you want really hot food. The A La Carte’s close one day per week each. The Italian is located right next to the beach, and the food there is lovely. I can recommend the steak, chicken and salmon dishes. The ambience is nice, but can be a bit breezy down there at night. Its hard to get a spot at the Teppanyaki grill in the Oriental restaurant, I think Priviledge guests book this up. However, the food we had at a normal table was good, and the service was very good as it is in all the restaurants. The Mexican is based in the snack bar by the pool. If like me you expect Crispy Corn type Tacos like in the UK, you’d be wrong. In Mexico Tacos are Flour Tortilla wraps. They do a starter which is the crispy ones, and if you ask for these as a main dish, they will make an extra large portion for you. All the staff at this hotel, with the exception Reception in our case, are really friendly, helpful and courteous. They get on with their job very efficiently, yet you don’t really know they are there. In the restaurants everything is very calm and organised, which ensures a relaxed atmosphere. Some hotel buffets can have a canteen feel to them, but I didn’t feel like this at OMR. The food does get repetitive after 2 weeks, but every single All Inclusive resort I’ve ever been to is like that. If you don’t eat everything that is on offer, every single day, you won’t run out of choices. On the whole I’d say the food is a good 4 star standard. We found that the buffet restaurant was often better at lunch time than in the evening. So make the effort to go back up there from the beach at lunchtime. The snack bar by the pool is good, but its nice to be in the air-con, and we had some delicious food in there at lunch. Beach – The beach in this area of Mexico has suffered extensive erosion in recent months due to Hurricanes and storms. If you want the picture perfect Caribbean beach you will not find it here. The beach has a boardwalk to protect the beach area directly in front of the hotel. The sand itself is spotlessly clean, fine white sand, and there is plenty of room on the beach to feel like you have your own space. You can access the sea at each end of the boardwalk, but when we were there, the sea was quite choppy most days, and a bit murky. We would not have been able to snorkel directly in front of the hotel. If you want to walk on the beach, you can do, but you will see that in both directions the neighbouring hotels have a really poor beach due to the erosion. There are lots of sandbags trying to keep the waves at bay. This is when you realise that erecting the boardwalk is the best thing that OMR could have to done to protect their stretch of beach. If you walk to the right the beach does improve, and you can walk a fair distance. We also went to Playa Del Carmen and the beach there has been badly eroded too. There was actually a 5ft sandbank at the beach there. Evening entertainment – We did not see many of the shows in the evening, but I know they do not get great reviews. All I will say is that I watched the Hollywood show, and I really enjoyed it. Yes, they mime, but remember these are the same people who do your volleyball, aerobics and dancing in the morning. They work really hard, and do their best. If you want Vegas shows…. Then got to Vegas!!!! The entertainment here, was comparative to that in DR & Cuba. There is a saxophone player around in the evening, which can get a bit repetitive. There was always music of some sort after the show, whether it was Disco, Band or Karaoke. The waitresses in the Lobby will bring your drinks regularly, so you don’t have to move from your seat if you’re too tired after sunbathing all day! Other facilities – There is free wifi in the lobby, which is reasonably fast, providing its not overloaded with people trying to access it. The Gym is well equipped, and the Spa looked nice. The prices in the spa were very expensive though… There are Tennis Courts which have just had a facelift located 5 min walk down the main drive. There are a couple of shops selling souvenirs in the Lobby area, and I thought the prices were reasonable for gifts. However, if you want imported snacks like Pringles, Lays, Haribo then expect to pay for them! Pringles were about £6 per tube and Lays £8 per large bag! They also sell Ice creams like Cornetto, but why anyone would pay for ice cream when you can get it in the restaurants is beyond me! Mike’s Coffee shop opens at 4pm until 11pm, and the drinks are really good. They also have cakes, biscuits and small sandwiches in there too. It is a shame its not open for coffee in a morning, but the staff at the Lobby Bar will make you an Espresso or Cappuccino. Out and About – We went into Playa Del Carmen using the Collectivo Buses on the main road. The hotel drive way is very long, about ¾ mile, so it takes about 10 mins to walk to the road. We felt very safe using the Collectivo and it costs about £1.00 each to go to PDC. We used this transport to go to Xplor Adventure Park too, and the Mexican People were very helpful in directing us to the correct buses. On the way back we just stood at the exit of Xplor and within 5 mins a minibus pulled over for us. The Hotel also offers a Shuttle bus to PDC daily, but you have to book the day before and spaces are limited. Summary – Overall we had a great time at OMR, despite the room issue, which they put right. The hotel is spotless, rooms are clean and modern, food is of a good standard and staff really are this hotels best asset. Everyone, with the exception of Reception went over and above their duty to ensure we had a great holiday. We did not feel the need to tip anyone to get good service, the Waiters, bar staff, gardeners, maids, entertainment team, every single one of them was so helpful, friendly and efficient. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and I would definitely return to this resort in future. To compare with resorts in Cuba & DR, I thought this hotel was more contemporary, with communal areas such as toilets near the pool and in the lobby being much cleaner and smarter. I think the fact it is Adults only helps with the cleanliness are there are obviously no children to make a mess, and most of the people staying respected the environment, and didn’t leave litter on the beach etc. I hope you have found my review useful in helping you to decide if this resort is for you. If you want to ask me any questions, send me a personal message and I will do my best to advise you.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Pat0511
Reviews.Content: We were in the Ocean Maya late November early December 2011 for 2 weeks holiday to celebrate my husbands birthday. The hotel was great and staff could not do enough for you. Wonderful selection of food in the 4 different restaurants and lovely coffee and cakes in the coffee shop. We have travelled extensively and have never seen staff work so hard from the pool staff (special mention for Xavier who was great) and the main bar staff (Rafael deserves a special mention here too) the cleaners (think ours was Jobita who did a fantastic job), waiters, chefs, entertainment staff and gardeners all kept everything tip top and the place was spotless. Special thanks to Maria Lopez for arranging decorations wine and cake for my husbands birthday and being so helpful before arrival with information I needed, she even replied to an email on her day off. Our room was oceanview and was beautiful with lots of room , had no problem with the shower we thought it was great, and the bathroom was kept fully supplied with toiletries and towels, face cloths etc, everything you could possible need. The beach is not huge but is kept very clean and all this area has suffered over the last few years with the hurricanes and storms, reducing the beaches and they have done the best job possible to protect the beach here. There was a problem with sunbeds (not enough) the first week but we did see new ones arriving the second week and I would suggest that you should always have more sunbeds than visitors as it should not be necessary to get up at the crack of dawn in order to get one, but this is only a minor complaint and is one of the few things I would like to see improved. I have to say from our own experience that we could not see the point of the upgrade and would prefer it if this distinction did not exist. All in all I would say that the hotel was great value for money and the service from all the staff could not be better. Thank you for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't please everyone...”
Reviews.Author: LondonWillamS
Reviews.Content: i spent alot of time on trip advisor prior to staying at the resort, so the first thing i would recommend is (if you have already booked) don't read to many reviews. You will only confused youself and wonder if you have made a mistake. I will break my review into sections that i was most interested in and hopefully it will help some people in their decision. But myself and my partner had an amazing holiday and thought the resort was fantastic. Food I must say that some of the food is not amazing. The buffet is mediocre, unless you use the fresh preperation stations in the middle, they always have a selection of meats and seafoods.( i would recommend telling them when you would like to have your food as they can over cook things). The mexican restaurant was our favourite as the food had the most flavour and the staff were always bright and cheery. The japanese restaurant was also really good but getting a show table is virtually impossible before 9pm unless you are privilege. The italian is lovely, if you have to wait i would choose to have a drink on one of the tables on the beach as it is so beautiful. Rooms/ grounds Our room was always clean and towels were replaced daily, thanks to Patricia who was incharge of our rooms. There was not one day in two weeks that our minbar was not replaced, even when it was torrential rain. Don't bother taking a hair dryer as the one in the room is amazing! We had a few little lizards outside our room, they never got in but if you dont like things like that i would be cautious. The groundsmen work insanely hard and keep the gardens and areas in meticulous condition. Beach/ pool Im not going to lie the beach was a dissappointment. it is a much smaller area than we expected, though this is no fault of the hotel (they cant prevent mother nature). The water was often murky but you are free to stroll up the beach and find a nicer patch to swim in. in addition there is a lovely lagoon about a 10mins walk left, take your snorkel as there are hundreds of fish and even a few crabs that you can look at if you can with stand the current. The loud pool is hardly loud, well unless you have a huge inconsiderate group of americans or canadians causing unnecessary noise that is. The music can become repetitive after the first 5 times you've heard the CD though. The smaller pool is better to be around for sun bathing and having fun but the larger pool is deeper and much better for swimming. Also get up at the crack of dawn if you want a good spot as sunloungers are ALWAYS reserved past like 930am. Upgrades We considered upgrading after reading that is was well worth the money. I would have to disagree. the privilege beach area has no direct access to the beach and is away from the pool area. There is a bar in the area but there is always a member of staff walking around taking drinks orders at the pool/ beach anyway. Unless you are planning to drink your spirits neat i dont think it is worth it for the drinks either, the vodka they use is smirnoff and the rum bacardi so unless your particular. The best perks for privilge that i saw were being able to reserve at a la carte restaurants and room service. i may be mistaken but it is what i thought. Just to add the Entertainment staff work really hard and are amazing at what they do. I would recommend going to see at least a few of the shows, especially the cultural ones as they are fantastic. If you dont like bad kareoke i would skip that night, but if you want to have a laugh its not too bad ( Ricardo is really bad though haha). Carlos for first choice and thomson is really helpful and answered alot of questions that we had in regards to which excursions to go for. COCO BONGO is a must for a good night out, as is Isla contoy if you want a day of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ReginaChad_W
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the mayan. Stayed at two different resorts. One being the Ocean Mayan. The food there. Is actually quite good. If you go hungry in Mexico, you are going to lose the Darwin battle. This resort has really good food. I like the fact that they seat you at a table and not have a free for all for the buffet. Ive been to other places where your tables gets taken on you while you are up getting food. They prevent that. The service is a little slow at times. But again, you are at a buffet. How much service do you really need. The ala cartes are un-real. Great service. Better food. The bartenders and servers around the complex are pretty good. they do get busy. Mainly because they actually use alcohol in their drinks, and they taste good. I have been to a few different resorts, thus place has the best food and drink of the ones I have been too. You may get something better at a 5 start, but really it is pretty good. The villas are well spread out, and it isnt a major walk to the beach, pool, or the lobby. If you cant make the walk at this place, you shouldnt really be going anywhere. The pools are clean, and a decent size. The spa is really nice, and you do have access to the hot tub for free, just have to book it. And it too is clean, and not hot, just perfectly warm for Mexico. Where the resort lacks is what you make of it. The beach isnt very big, but it is seperated. One side hosts the marina and is not all that pretty. The other side is cleaner, but much smaller. The water is murky, but its from the sand being displaced. Keep in mind, in Mexico the beaches are owned by the government, so you can go to the beaches to either side and you have access to miles of white sand. and you can get access to it with a 30 second walk. Being recently renovated facility with old infrastructure. This means... yes you have to put your toilet paper in the waste basket and not flush it. This is very typical in a certain areas of the world. Not a huge concern as long as the baskets are cleaned out everyday. Which in this case they are. Only issue about it, is some people.... not the resorts problem.... ignore this rule and flush it anyway. This causes the plumbing to back up. Can't blame the resort for this part, but how they treat you when it does happen is where they can improve. I read one review. They said 4 calls and 1 hour to come to fix it. 1 hour is not a long time to wait in any hotel for anything. To call every 15 minutes is rude and won't make the staff rush to you. We had the same issue. Within the hour they had come out and fixed the problem. Only thing being it still smelled in the room. They originally didnt want us to switch rooms, but eventually we were able to stay in another room for the night. In the end I wont return to this place, but I also wont return to any other resort. I dont like seeing the same thing over again. In fact I probably wont even do all inclusive again. So I have no preconceived notion to put this place in a positive or negative light. From what I noticed the Priledged upgrade isnt worth it, we didnt have it, but it didnt look like it was any better. Other than you get some top shelf booze, which only matters if you drink it straight. Its a nice place, a different atmosphere than a family resort, so depending on what you want you may or may not like it. In the end you are on a holiday, if you are a complainer stay home. If you want to relax and have a good time, you can do it, but its all what you make of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy T
Reviews.Content: Do Not Believe All the Reviews You Read!!! Just returned from this resort January 23, 2012 and had a great time. The staff were generally welcoming and eager to please. We found this especially true of Yvonne who worked tirelessly in the privlidge area of the beach. The activities team entertained anyone who wanted to participate in a variety of activities and evening shows. Special mention has to go out to Fernie who always had a pleasant smile and was prepared to go out of her way to make you feel engaged. She does a terrific job!!! Al a carte restaurants were enjoyable and there was always something for everyone at the buffet. The food was very good, well prepared and lots of variety. Some of the negative reviews of this resort only make you wonder if some people are EVER HAPPY? Landscaping is excellent, to say the least. Our experience with maintenance to address an air conditioning issue was answered and rectified within minutes. Priviledge upgrade was worth the value as we received a suite, special seating at the beach with upgraded loungers and server, upgraded liquor and other ammenities. Friday afternoon at 1pm the General Manager of the Hotel along with every department manager were poolside, publicly introducing themselves and available to answer any concerns. Please feel confident in booking this hotel as it provides a great venue for people open to enjoying themselves. Sandy T. Canada

Reviews.Title: “FERNIE”
Reviews.Author: 115idol
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 wonderful days at this resort with friends Sandy and Bill and my wife Lynn,we had a great time, we stayed in the privileged section and have no complaints. The room,food ,grounds and pools were great, the staff were friendly and helpful. What we really enjoyed was the entertainment staff, who did there best to have good entertainment every day and to get the guests to participate, especially (FERNIE) who was so friendly,always a big smile on her face,regardless of the long hours she worked.She was a real pleasure to talk to. You have a real Treasure there Ocean Maya Royale. I would hold on to her, she's a real asset to your resort. Thanks again Fernie for making our vacation so memorable. Hank you Ocean Idol

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the europeans!”
Reviews.Author: 17Canada
Reviews.Content: We were recently there at this resort from jan 3 -10 2012. The staff was amazing! All the servers, bartenders and entertainment staff really added to our experience and without them it would of only been a so-so trip. The rooms and resort are nice however the air conditioners smelled like mold and we had to air out our room often. We had the priveledge package however it's only worth it if you like room service or drink alot of premium alcohol otherwise we wouldn't upgrade again. The breakfast buffet was by far the best of the day for buffets. The grill staff is really good at making fresh food for you at any time so don't be scared to try it, however make sure your wait your turn or keep your elbows out to hit those line jumping europeans. The italian and japanese a la carte were great and the staff were awesome. They are unlimited so make sure you take advantage. The beach is small on both sides of the resort as the erosion from the storms was easy to see up and down the beach for all hotels. The blue lounge chairs are pretty comfortable however same as all resorts people leave towels on chairs and don't come back. Just address the staff and if people are doing this they will help you find a spot. All the bad reviews we read from mostly europeans did not do the place justice. This resort is linked to a european hotel chain hence the very european feel and customers. Most of the europeans we encountered on the resort were very arrogant and rude to the staff. They acted as if they owned the place and should be waited on like a paid butler. This resort is also pretty mature and tame at night so if your ages 18-35 look for another resort as you won't find the fun you want unless your not into that scene. The pools are nice but they are not heated and it gets chilly by 4pm. If you like to keep to yourself and don't really drink or socialize this is the resort for you. However it ain't cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what you look forward to”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a seven night stay at the Ocean Maya Royale in Playa del Carmen Mexico. We booked our trip through Marlin Travel in Delta BC. We decided to get the Privilege upgrade, mostly so we would have a better selection of room, en carte dining privileges, and early check in and late check out. Of the things we were hoping for we got only late check out. We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 at night and the only food available was a limited room service. Our room was a junior suite that was too close to the main loby. There was kareoke going on and it was carrying to our suite. The suite was nice with a king size bed and a spacious suite. Problem was that the room wasn't close to the beach and you couldn't see anything but the solid wall when sitting on the deck. I had a shower and the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. I mopped it up and my partner had her shower and we mopped it up again. The toilet leaked around the base onto the bathroom floor also. Next morning, we asked for a different room, only to be told that there were no more rooms in the Privilege section available. We would have to move to a regular room and there would be no rebate for our Privilege status. Later in the afternoon our new room was available for us. It was a nice room with a king size bed and a railing that we could see the garden area and other buildings. We no long had premium service with juices and hard liquor in our fridge, beach towels etc. The cable connection was torn out of the TV so there was no TV reception. It took three days to get a new TV and the new one didn't turn on. I didn't try to get another one as we only had a couple of days left and who watches TV in Mexico? For all our trouble the concierge gave us a romantic dinner on the beach. An hour before we were to have dinner they phoned to cancel because it looked like rain. After we had our regular dinner we went for a walk and there were couples having their romantic dinners on the beach. This was very disappointing for us. Next day we asked the concierge about this and she arranged for us to have our romantic dinner in the restaurants wine cellar as it was raining cats and dogs. The food in the three a la carte was adequate but selection was minimal. The pictures on the hotel on their web site show a beautiful beach in front of the hotel. There is very little beach left as it was destroyed by a hurricane 4 years ago and they have replaced it with a wall and a board walk. This hotel claims to be a 4 1/2 star hotel. In our opinion it was 3 1/2 to 4 at best. The girl that worked in the Privilege area of the beach (?) was the best thing we ran into during our stay. Her name is Yvonne and she was so sweet and helpful we couldn't have asked for more. Weather was warm approx.76 degrees during the day, and we only had one day of rain. Our stay was from Jan 7th to Jan. 15th 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Kits88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for a couple of days in January 2012 as a "vacation orphan" after my travel companions left on an earlier flight. We had been staying at a different hotel but I chose to move to this resort because I had a fantastic time there when I stayed for a week with friends in November 2011 and found it great value for the price. I arrived at 10am, checked in and spent some time at the pool, and my room was ready promptly at 3pm. Same when I checked out, they had no problem holding my luggage for a few hours while I spent some extra time on the beach while waiting for my airport transfer (which was included in the price of the hotel since I booked directly on the website). The rooms here are beautiful, just what you see in the photos on the website. I did not pay for the "privileged" upgrade, because for me it wasn't worth the extra money for the balinese beds on the beach, the upgraded rooms or the better alcohol. As many have mentioned, this is not the place for you if you prefer long stretches of sandy beach but there is access to the ocean (although the bottom is rocky) and you can choose to hang out by the pools or on the sand. The food suited me just fine, the quality and variety at the buffet is great, although I remember from my last trip that the food in the specialty restaurants was not great (other than the Mexican). To me, the best thing about this resort is the service and the staff. Every person working there will say hello to you as they walk by, and everyone is happy to accomodate your requests (granted I am not a demanding guest). The entertainment staff is really the best, super friendly and engaging, very hard working and they put on good shows in the evenings. They will make your stay, and in fact it was because of them that I felt comfortable staying at this resort alone. So big shout out to Jes, Ricardo, Omar, Amanda, Amy, Fernie, Suzanne, and Gamma, thanks for making my stay great!! Can't wait to go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to visit but 2 weeks are too long”
Reviews.Author: Grant D
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying We have many years experience at all inclusive's, We are fairly easy going. We were their 2 weeks Jan 8 - 22 PRO'S Rooms - are modern with LCD TV, 2 doubles or king bed, glass enclosed shower (no tub), balcony and free in room safe. Grounds - are beautiful, well kept, staff are always working hard. A la carte's - Mexican 4 stars, Italian 3.5 stars (never got what we ordered but stilled enjoyed it) Japanese 3 stars (if your not seated at the entertainment table the food is average). Buffet - 3.5 stars. the first week the food was good sometimes hot / worm but week 2 they seam to be short staffed not all the food stations were full or replenished once depleted. Guest services - will help you in every way they can. Bars - fantastic likely best I've had, Friendly fast service, engaged in conversation with everyone who wanted to talk I learned a ton of Spanish from all the bar tenders. Entertainment - fabulous, If you want to get involved or not they will keep you laughing, If you can stay awake until the late show take it in you wont be sorry. Check in - was fast friendly, we were first placed on the main level, we requested a second level room and got it day 3. Spa - we took advantage of the beach massage hut for a 90 minute massage, I felt like soft butter for two days afterwords. Security - My wife and myself usually take taxis to get around. Security records where you are going, your room number, the taxi's plate number and drivers licence number both at the hotel lobby and at the resort's entrance gate every time. Cons Resort - lobby looks dated, late 70's could use an upgrade soon Beach - maybe a bit small, but very clean. A la Carte's(3) - adequate for a 1 week stay but for longer stays would like to have another choice or two. Specialty coffee shop - opened at 4:00 PM ??? I like my latte when I wake up. I spoke to guest services they said they had several complaints about this and may open in the morning next week. Premium Group - (Points / Timeshare) I have been to many of these over the years, no problem. but this time the reps were rude and would not except no as an answer. so we walked out, they followed and continuing to badger us. I had to tell them off at a point when they caught up to us in the lobby. I have an issue with a resort this having 2 classes of guests as a non Premium guest you are treated like you are a lesser person in several areas at the resort. Overall I would not return to this resort mostly because of the size, we always stay 2 weeks or longer, otherwise I would recommend for a fun relaxing stay

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Bobharder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya and were very disappointed. Let me say first that the staff were fabulous, however the buffet was definitely below average for an all inclusive. We opted for the privilege upgrade and had access to the private beach. This was great except the beach ended at a boardwalk. Difficult to take long walks on a non existent beach. The Privilege room was average, but there was a constant sewage type smell occsionally forcing us to open both the balcony & front door to get air flowing. The bed was rock hard and on day 4 they found us a pillowtop. It helped, but we were surprised that an upgraded room wouldn't have a decent bed. The worst part of our room was the bathroom. Very pleasing to look at but the shower and the toilet are in one spot and with tile floors, it was dangerous to walk on. When you did go to the bathroom, you couldn't flush your toilet paper...Disgusting. The A la carte restaurants are average at best. Consider renting at another resort as there are ,any great ones in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fab way to spend Christmas & New Year”
Reviews.Author: Keith&Maureen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 21st December to 4th January and had a really fantastic time. Our holiday started when we left Gatwick for the 11hour flight with Thomson. I am not the best flyier but the flights both ways were great and passed really quickly. When we arrived at the hotel we were immediately checked in and were in our room within minutes. We were in block 5 - nearest to reception and bar but close enough to pool and beach. We just had one night that we could hear the karaoke until midnight, but this did not bother us as it gave us a good giggle - sorry guys you were terrible, but you know who you are!! We attended the welcome meeting with Carlos and there was no hard sell whatsoever - and really informative, and just over half an hour! We ate at the Japanese, Italian and Mexican on a couple of occasions and had no problem getting a table although we were extremely happy with the buffet - there was so much choice! We went to the poolside snack bar for lunch on a couple of occasions, but felt the restaurant at reception had much more choice, and you can have a pre-lunch 'vino tinto' at the bar beforehand! We were treated to a fantastic party on Christmas Eve - with Santa and his Donkeys, and again on Hogmanay with fabulous food, live band and fireworks. We booked a trip to Coba and we also took a taxi into Playa De Carmen which were both fantastic and also gives you a day out of the sun. All in all, we loved our trip and although we do not tend to go to the same place twice, we could easily consider this one! I can easily go on about how fantastic this hotel and staff are, but if you have any questions in particular I will be happy to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: SzilardVarga
Reviews.Content: Hi, we went there last march (2011) for two weeks. A very nice hotel, good value for money. All about the hotel (staff, garden, cleanliness, etc..) is very good, except 2 "small' things. 1. Beach: the hotel has no direct water beach. Even if it is very nicely built, the beach is just for the pool, if you would like to go into the sea you will have to walk until the near lagoon or other resort to have a nice sea. Due to the building of the embankment to protect the beach, the sea water in front of the hotel is ... no comment :). However, if you don't mind that, the beach area and the pool is very nice and you can enjoy a very relaxing time 2. Food: there are 4 restaurants, so you will enjoy a very good food and a good variety. in most of the cases. However, in the morning and for lunch you must choose the main restaurant, which has great food, but after 2 weeks, you kind of eating the same over and over. Apart from the above two, and excellent choice, good entertainment, great theatre, excellent staff, very nice and friendly people, ... you're in Mexico ! :) I have to mention the diving centre, great stuff, excellent location, you're in a good hand. I would like to thanks especially to my instructor Anneleen, who help me get my open water certificate. You definitely have to make some trips, there is a very good agent in the hotel, which can guide you to what's best for you. I would recommend this hotel, if you don't mind not having a nice beach. (as a tip; there is an exquisite lagoon 'Tres Rios laguna', so you can do snorkelling or swimming just there,and it is 5 minute walk). we had an excellent time, however we found bit fulfilling the lack of a proper beach and sea front.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya Royale”
Reviews.Author: andydani21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 15th Dec-29th Dec. Had an awesome time. Staff are amazingly helpful and friendly. The place is spotless and the restaurants are great. The villa rooms are well designed kept exceptionally clean and the fridge (mini bar) is stocked up daily. Ideally located (nice and quite) although the entertainment is satisfactory (if that's what you want). Not too keen on pool based fun activities so spent most of the days on the beach. As an adult only complex I believe that the entertainment could be batter organised!! On the whole we had a great time and met some really nice people during the stay. The Italian restaurant is definitely the best. Christmas Eve was sensational and the hotel staff really did push the boat out.. and the buffet meal was amazing, only criticism on the food - lobster and more seafood would have been nice. This place is definitely worth a stay, quieter than Cancun so not really for the younger adults (the 18-30 crowd). Would definitely return if heading back to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Go! You'll Love It”
Reviews.Author: W C
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec. 22-29. Staff are wonderful. Food was very good. Beach is not the best, but check out the spot everyone talks about, about a 10 minute walk to the left (when facing beach) down past a number of other resorts. Nice clean, clear water with lots of fish. We had an amazing view of the ocean (no more than 100 ft from the beach and the pool). Pay for the Ocean View and ask for building 12. So many of the comments already made by other travellers are very accurate. Trust their advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: travis_arnold11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec. 18-24. The hotel was a great bargain for what you get. We got assigned a room in the large hotel building and it smelled musty and had two double beds. We immediately went back and asked for a different room. They obliged and got another room for us although it took a couple hours to get ready. No worries, we went to the bar. We ended up getting a room in one of the smaller buildings and the room was much bigger with a queen size bed. The staff was all very friendly, although they do ask you to attend a time share meeting for a 100 dollar voucher. We declined, and they never bothered us about it. I liked that it was adults only. The pools here were great, although the ocean front is not great for swimming. However you can walk down the beach to other beaches that you can swim in. If you walk down the beach about a mile, you get to a place where there are some little freshwater streams that flow into the ocean. It was really awesome and we did some snorkeling there and there were lots of cool fish. The only complaint we had was about the food. The Japanese restaurant was quite good, the Italian restaurant was pretty good, but the buffet was sub-par at best, and the Mexican restaurant was awful. However the bars were good, but they could use more of them, another one down by the pools and another in the lobby/restaurant area. I would recommend this place to friends, but I like going to different places when I vacation for variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: 81fern
Reviews.Content: I was there for new years it was a great experience over all. Great food,rooms were beautiful. Big thanks to Ricardo and Amy from the entertainment crew you guys were great keep up the good work! My only dislike was the music around the pool needs a little update which we expressed before leaving and they started to make changes. I definitely refer anybody to stay there you will have a great time;) thanks again to all staff!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: fairday_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 2-9. We have stayed at the Gran Bahia Principe and the Grand Palladium, both in the Mayan Riviera. The Ocean Maya is significantly smaller but everything they have is on par with other 4-5 star resorts of this nature in the area. Of course there are fewer restaurants and bars, but we found in the larger resorts we frequented the same ones over and over anyway. Everything is close by - a walk from the beach to the reception is 10 mins at the very most - therefore pretty much any room location leaves you convenient to everything, and no golf carts or trains to wait for. The pool areas run along the beach, similar to the Bahia, which is lovely and convenient. You can walk for miles in either direction along the shore, keep in mind that past hurricanes have wreaked havoc on beaches in this area and some resorts are definately having difficulty maintaining their beach - therefore some areas for swimming are better than others. The Ocean Maya is further along in their restoration than others and have done a commendable job in building the boardwalk and protecting two separate swimming areas. Food quality is excellent at both the a la cartes and the buffets - buffets definately better than the Palladium. Although there are only 3 a la cartes, the menu on each are quite extensive, so going back 2 or 3 times still leaves lots of choices. Very large pools and lots of choice of different areas along the beach to relax. Adults only is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Small...nice...we had a great time....no frills yet not basic..has lots of potential.”
Reviews.Author: needtovacation
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the OMR (adults only) property for our week stay in early December. WE had a lovely room that was super close to the beach in building 37. There was a jacuzzi on the patio, nice patio furniture, a white leather furniture set in the room as well as a king size bed. I believe we got these upgrades due to the Orbitz package we booked. Nice perk! There was also sparkling wine and treats in our room upon arrival. We booked a dinner under the full moon out on the beach complete w/ our own waiter! Highly recommend this ..very romantic and fun! We had a super waiter. Wish I could remember his first name. He works also at the Mexican Restarant at night. Steak, Shrimp, great service, yummy desserts, appetizers etc...well worth it for a special night. Inquire at Guest services each menu level has a price. The beach as we all know is "different" and is not the fault of the OMR just mother nature taking back via Hurricane a few years ago. They lost 30' of beach front and I can imagine at one time it was an outstanding stretch of beach. They did a super job with what they had to work with take a quick walk to your left down to Tres Rio's...gorgeous river system on the mangroves that meets the ocean. Refreshing, beautiful and a wonderful spot for photo opportunites. We walked to the right one day down the beach for about 45 minutes and yes you have to walk up over a golf course etc for a few steps and then back down...but no worries...nice to get a good walk in. Even tho we are huge beach people and this in not anyway as nice as say the beach at the Catalonia Royal Tulum or say Punta cana we did still enjoy our time on the beach reading and people watching and napping each day. Ahhh vacation can't beat it. We did feel the saggy , old fashioned beach loungers in the area where we laid each day just off the activities pool really really really need to be upgraded. It was like you were laying right on the plastic. Ouch. And I think they should have a few more of the little tables so your stuff, kindles, books, sunglasses are not sitting right in the sand. Did a nice side trip for a day to Isla Mujeres via the hotel and it was a full long day but well worth it. Nice sail on a catamaran, snorkeling, lunch, shopping in isla etc... catch a collectivo out on the highway for $2.00 a person to PDC but you have to walk out to the road from the lobby. There is a shuttle that runs from 10 till 2 that you book at the guest services one day in advance. It's free but the time was not worth it to me to give up my beach and sun time. A taxi will run you about $15.00 to PDC the bellman can summon one for you as they are waiting out at the security gate. the staff was lovely. Our maid was spot on each day. All toiletries refilled and towels etc...the water soda fridge guy did a great job each day and we would leave a little tip and request more beer instead of say tonic water and we always got it. There was in our fridge orange soda, coke, sprite, diet coke, tonic water, and 2 different juices, beer and water. SCORE!!! xaiver at the pool bar is hands down this properties best waiter. He could run the bar taking care of 6 people at a time seriously all the time with a smile and he had a way of keeping guests under control when they had too much to drink or bringing a smile out of newbies etc..he is great. Drinks were good...yes, the are going to offer the bottom of the line stuff but polietly request the other level you are entiteled you and you will get it. You will only get the stuff on the cube shelf that says privelege if you have paid for privelige. And we didn't see anything on that shelf that was really, really worth paying for. We found lots on our level that we liked. The bartenders that filled in for Xaxier while he was on break or off for the day just didn't have his level of bartending and it wasn't the same vibe. The lobby bar is where it's at in the evening as well as the little courtyard outside the lobby. Lots of people playing cards, on their computers and smart phones etc...just winding down and socializing. They staff does put on a show and they do have a coco bongo's trip for a fee etc...but we were always too tired to partake. We really enjoyed the talented sax player that played there most nights. you can order off the menu while sitting at the lobby bar after 11 p.m. if you got in late and the restaraunts were closed etc...simple menu, burgers, sandwiches etc.. most of the food was really good. Not exceptional but good. We wished the mexican night at the buffet on the thursday nigth were more "mexican" we wished there were more choices. Mashed Potatoes to me are not mexican. lol loved the italian. The japense was fun at our show table. mexican by the beach was good. Loved the ordering off the menu. during the day we never managed to venture to the main buffet to see what they had we just made our way to the Mexican restarunt by the beach that was a buffet at lunchtime. There was a gal that was chef while we were there and she was always busy keeping the variety going fresh fish, burgers, beef, chicken etc...loved the guac and pico. They had ice cream that everyone seemed to enjoy. Self serve cones. Loved the Sparkling wine. It was free flowing at all bars and also at breakfast with mimosa's. the grounds are lovely, lovely, lovely. Colorful, and well taken care of. We liked that our room was way down by the beach because during the day that is where we like to be and at night it was a pretty lit walk to the lobby. We felt the young gal that served at hostess at breakfast and in the lunch buffet could probably use a lesson in smiling. The one with the long hair pulled back in a pony tail I don't think we saw her smile at Anyone in the 7 days we were there. She would just point to where we were to be seated and never friendly, never a HOla or welcome or how is your vacation. I don't know if she was shy or snobby but either way..she needs more training. One day she pointed to a section where she wanted us to go and we asked nicely if we could sit in a section where our favorite waiter was...she seemed almost huffy that we messed with her routine. Sorry but he was good to us and we were good to him with the tips. After all we are the customer we should be able to have the waither we wanted. The lobby bartenders meh! they also need a lesson in friendlness. not once in one week stay of us being up there each and every night did they say hello, how is your stay, how are you ...nothing...nothing nothing. They wouldn't even say "how may I help you" they would just stand there and wait for you to say what you wanted"...for me the "little details" of customer service are what makes a resort whether it's big or small and it's these little details that get the repeat customers. They need to work on this area imo. And yes for the record we did tip them. There were two gals at the front guest services desk that we really enjoyed. Sussana and Judith both are in training and will do well for this resort. There was also a friendly gal from Germany that was in training that did a good job for us when we had questions etc.. We find that this resort after recently being converted to to adults only has soooo much potential and to me it falls in the little details. We had a great stay we totally felt we got our money's worth but had we spent top dollar on this resort we might have felt like we got gypped. We originally were going to the Catalonia Royal tulum but got a better price on this so we thought we would give it a try. As I said we did have a great time and there was lots about it that we did like but it's not "quite' where it needs to be if they are going to cater to adults only. There is a nice book exchange at the towel hut. The bathrooms everywhere on the property were clean and well maintaned. Bathrooms close to the beach which we like. The E team did a great job of getting people that were interested in the games and contests involved at the big pool. We didn't participate but we did enjoy watching them from the beach. They had a fun variety of games each day and they also had a texas hold 'em tourney every few days that was popular as well as showing you how to make drinks etc...at the tables set up. they get an "a" for effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesleyOntario
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks from 26th dec, 2011, rooms are small but adequate with shower only. Food very good in buffet and a la carte very good when you can get in, no reservations required but sometimes too busy to get in. The grounds are immaculate and well maintained. The best thing about this resort are the staff they are wonderful and will always try their best to accomodate you. New Years eve was wonderful, they had an ice bar out in the courtyard and food was amazing, would return here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We found a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: StLuciaRM
Reviews.Content: Are you thinking about Cancun for February or March? Usually I wait till I get home before I write my review but for all of you who are thinking about booking holidays consider the Ocean Maya Royal in Cancun. Let me start with the check in, perfect! Then one thing this year that I must comment on, the grounds; plants and trees fantastic! Well manicured and they have signs near all the gardens about the natural flora and fauna and how they are preserving the natural habitat. The animals, there are Iguanas, there are these sort of Racoon like critters but they are out during the day not at night, they have a brown bear kind of face and a long stripped tail wonderful to watch. Let me tell you about the rooms, LARGE two double beds, beautifully decorated and the washroom are lovely. Those of you who follow my reviews or know me know that I am picky about the washroom situation. These washrooms ticked all the boxes! Separate water closet, great sink, great shower head and all honed limestone, enough said. I know you are now thinking “what about the food” well friends GREAT, yes GREAT describes the food. The restaurants, Italian, Japanese, and Mexican plus the BUFFET! The Italian was by far my favourite. But the Japanese and the buffet were great too! If you don’t like the food here you are just plain way to picky! But most noteworthy is the staff, yes I just said the most noteworthy is the staff! From the check in, to the bars, to the restaurants, and the maids friendly yes friendly and helpful and they all really wanted to know how you are doing and how they can make your stay better! “The Now Jade” you have some competition!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't spend a lot...”
Reviews.Author: M Y
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort from Dec 15 to 19. We did not dot he "premium" deal. The resort is clean, landscaping is gorgeous, and the staff is very friendly. We've stayed at a few "budget" all-inclusives, and this was by far the best of the bunch in terms of drinks. The rooms are clean, new and comfortable. We were initially booked in a double-double by mistake and those beds seemed more comfortable than the King bed, where we eventually transferred to. There really aren't that many activities to do here at night, so if you are a "night owl" type, you might find this place boring. The only bar that's open late night is the one in the lobby. It's not a huge resort, but during a high season, it might take a while to get your drinks. They work really fast, tho! They do have good tequilas, vodkas and gins, and will pour them if you ask. Otherwise you get the generic bottom shelf kind. We didn't try any of the specialty restaurants. The Buffet dinner/lunch is OK. Nothing special. Surprisingly bad Mexican food on "Mexican Night"... The cooked-to-order seafood section is your best bet. A lot of the dishes were over-seasoned in my opinion, but then it could just be me...Also, there is no food option after midnight, so if you plan to drink up with your friends at night, don't count on late night Pizza or anything! The beach is pretty sad. It's really small part of the resort. So if you are expecting miles and miles of white sand beach, you will be disappointed. The sand is really smooth, but as people have said, the currents make the water look really muddy - it's not dirty, just muddy. It seems to clear up every now and then, and for us, it cleared up on our last day. The beach is a tiny section of the oceanfront. Most of it is that boardwalk like structure. There are lots of sands and shady areas - just not wave crushing, shell collecting, swim-able type. The gym has two rickety treadmills, couple of elpticals and a stair master. Also so free weights and weight training machines. Nothing to write home about. If you are a runner, and not a fan of beach running, just run from the Dive house up to the resort gates...that's about 0.9 miles (I had Garmin). Do a little loop inside the resort and you'll get a mile out and a mile back. I recommend this place for a short R&R, but won't recommend for anything over a week, unless you are a type that's happy to sit on a lounger and read all day. We rented a car (Erica's fantasitc) and went out to Akumal to swim with the Turtles and Tulum. It seemed like while there were many tours to the Eco Parks, there were none that did Tulum and Akumal in one day. Renting a car for a day turned out to be the best thing we did. Cheap Turtle swim tour in Akumal, delicious dinner at a taqueira in Playa del Carmen for pennies, and we did this without speaking any Spanish, other than "Margarita Por Favor".

Reviews.Title: “A Standard All-Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: BubblesNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel and property was immaculate - well taken care of and the staff was very friendly. We were there over the New Year holiday and on January 1 there wasn't a chair to be found on the beach or at the pool so we upgraded to the "privilege" area which had plenty of chairs and a waiter who brought drinks, etc - this was worth the extra $40/person (which also entitled us to a room upgrade to the privilege rooms). Our waitress, Azucena, was fantastic - she didn't miss a beat for the 3 days we were under her care! The rest of the trip there were ample chairs outside of the privilege area. Also, the hotel property has only two small beaches - most of the waterfront area is actually on a sea wall and the water churns a lot so it makes it brown versus the clear blue that you want in Mexico. And, the privilege area is bound by the sea wall and not on the beach (although there is sand) and goes right up to the sea wall. The pools were great - they started activities @ 11am. One thing I didn't figure out from any of the reviews on this site is that the hotel lobby and main dining areas and most of the rooms were actually about a 2-3 minute walk from the beach/pool. The rooms are all (with the exception of maybe 10) set back on the property and there are no ocean views. The views are all of lush greenery, etc. So, if you want a hotel where you get an ocean view when you wake up in the morning, then this isn't it. The privilege rooms back up to the parking lot where all of the service trucks and various buses pull in early in the morning so we heard the reverse beeps of every delivery truck each morning starting at 7am. Probably would not stay in privilege rooms again for this reason. The spa was fantastic - they have a really nice relaxation room as well as showers, sauna and jacuzzis. The ambience in the service rooms is great - book Diana for a deep tissue if that's your thing. Incredible. The food was good and there was plenty of variety for everyone. The hotel is only @ 5-10 minutes from the city of Playa Del Carmen. We went in for dinner one night and spent some time wandering through shops before dinner - really festive and fun even on a Tuesday. All in all, this hotel is fine but I think I prefer their sister property Ocean Coral & Turquesa even though my review of that hotel isn't completely positive either. I think if you can afford a higher price point, then that's the way to go. If not, then this would be a great destination.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, not great for the beach though...”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: Ocean Maya was a great place to visit. The beach was just steps from the pool. Food was great. The ala cartes were also very good (although I wasn't sure what we were eating at the Japanese restaurant). We were there in March of 2011. The entertainment was just ok. Our room was beautiful. Very clean, and very modern. The staff was great. We talked about drinking Budwiser at home, and they brought us a 6 pack in a bucket right to our patio. The beach was my least favorite although it was okay. It was my boyfriends first time south and I was a little bit disappointed as the water was very rough, it wasn't that beautiful tropical colour that you would expect, and the waves were huge everyday we were there. We went deep sea fishing (which I would recommend to ANYONE), we took a tour on a catamaran (great day trip, however it was VERY rough when we went snorkeling), and we went on an ATV cruise. All were a ton of fun. I would recommend the Ocean Maya

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay thanks to Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aidan M
Reviews.Content: The hotel on it's own is much like many other all-inclusive resorts. Where this hotel shines; however, is with its phenomenal entertainment staff. These awesome and talented people devote all their time and energy to making sure every guest has the best stay possible and all it takes to turn a good trip into a great trip is to talk to them. Shout out to the great staff: Omar, Jess, Ricardo, Amy, Amanda, Fernie, and Danny much love from Alberta, Canada!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Service, water at the beach so so”
Reviews.Author: grunf911
Reviews.Content: We have booked Ocean Maya Royale through Tui's website as a destination for a nice and relaxing vacation over Christmas and New Year, and I am very happy that we did so. It is a Blue Couples hotel (meaning no kids, adult only), which we saw as an advantage. When we arrived after 12hr flight and few hours of transfers we were greeted with swift check-in, and our baggage was taken care of accordingly, as is to be expected from a five star resort. Our initial room was 1307, and it was very nice and spacious, with a nice view over a walkway leading to the pool area, and it was quite close to the reception and the main restaurant "Hacienda" where all the evening events are held. Rooms: The room was very nice, but since it was close to the main area, and we were a bit jetlagged so we went to sleep first days quite early, and had some problems falling asleep due to the evening program that would last until cca 23:30. We requested a different room, and were moved the next day to 2407. This other room was very quiet but was close to several ponds, and had a bit of mosquitos. It was not really a deal-breaker so we kept it. Beach & Pool: The staff is very nice and will politely greet you every time you pass by with a smile. We did not spend too much time in the hotel's beach and pool area, but the time we spent was nice. The entertainment staff approached us and took us to play beach volleyball which was nice. The pool area is nice, and so is the beach. Note that there is a special area of the beach which is reserved for "privilege" program, which we thought was not worth it, so we stayed on the regular beach. The main benefit of privilege (at least in the beach area) is nicer sunbeds, and regular waiters coming to attend to your needs in terms of drinks. My only comment is about the sea quality in front of the beach, that was so so, since there was quite an amount of seaweed in the water, so do not expect beautiful turquoise swimming area in the sea in front of the hotel or any adjacent hotels (we walked on the beach to check). It would be nice if they could clean it somehow. But since we only spent 3 days (out of 14) at the resort, it was not a big issue. Restaurants: There are 3 main restaurants, and although both the Italian and Oriental was superb, we chose to stick with the main one "Hacienda" as it had buffet with the best selection of food. There is also a snack bar "Charro" by the pool, which is decent for a snack, but the food was much better in other restaurants. The restaurant staff is quick, friendly and unobtrusive and in our opinion deserve every credit. Even if the restaurant was closing at 22h and we stayed until 22:15 and requested a waiter if he could bring us an espresso from the cafe bar, we were greeted with a quick service and a smile. Regarding the New Year's Eve the hotel staff have really outdone themselves: Ice sculptures in the main area, food buffet that beats Maldivian buffet hands down (meat, seafood, lobsters, salads, gourmet, you name it), and the entertainment program that created a great atmosphere. We did not feel we missed out anything by choosing to stay at the hotel for the New Year. The spa is nice and we have booked 3 massages, and did not experience any problems i have noticed in the previous reviews for this hotel. Also the water-sports center allows you to take out catamarans (as a part of all-inclusive offer) as long as you know how to sail them. If not, the course will cost approx 30 USD and lasts 30 min, and after that you can take it any time you like. Events / Tours: The tour desk offers a variety of tours to explore the surrounding area, and some we have already pre-booked, and some we took, but overall we were very happy with the tours (Isla Mujeres, Cozumel, Chichen Itza). We especially recommend to check out Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve with Jeeps. It was truly an unforgettable experience. Our last night we went to Coco Bongo club (arranged from the pool area guys for 65 USD / person), which was a good deal, since we had no waiting in queues, all drinks included, and we had Omar from the entertainment staff joining us to ensure we get good service. Coco Bongo is a night club, but they also have a show that would resemble a cabaret which we thought was spectacular, and money well spent. To sum it up, we had an amazing vacation in Ocean Maya Royale, and would gladly return, our only comment would be if they could clean the sea in front of the beach a little. The Good: * Beautiful Hotel Premises * Friendly Staff * Clean Rooms * Excellent Food * Great Tours * Coco Bongo was great The Not So Good: * Few rooms close to reception prone to noise * Sea at the beach is not the nicest

Reviews.Title: “royal?”
Reviews.Author: trysoccer63
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Ocean Maya,it is an adult only ,nice hotel . Not a 5 star but, good if you pay less than 900 a week . Service is ok ,drinks fine ,food not to bad. The complex is very well maintained so rooms and pools are fine, but... if you are expecting a nice beach ,forget about it. It is not the hotels fault ,that the water is dark, but for us, the seethrough ocean is a must !!! A little lagoon is 12 minutes walk from the hotel(beside Tres Rios Hotel) or you can just go to Mamita beach in Playa Del Carmen(Go north off the Ferry station, it is empty!!!) The hotel has a free bus every day at 10 am to Playa; you can come back with a reguler mexican van any time of the day for 20 pesos( drop off in front of the entrance from the highway) Playa is wery safe and no worries. Don't waste you money for the Premium upgrade it is a joke... If you want to buy a cheep Tequila just go to Wallmart,it is the same as everywhere and Don Roberto is only around 188 pesos for 2 bottles of 700 ml. It is 8 minutes walk from 5 avenue on the 8. street north. We go to Mexico every year and this hotel was probably not the best of our expectations but it was a nice and We did relax. And yes, we got bitten by mosquitos. If the price is wrigth ,go for it ,otherwise, just choose something on Maroma beach or south of Playa Del Carmen. If you want , a room go for villa 21 it is not a ocean view but very close to everything. Have fun it is your holliday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable all-inclusive hotel with good food options”
Reviews.Author: Heybigtuna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week in May 2011 and had an enjoyable trip to Mexico. We were greeted with a cold, fruity cocktail on arrival to help us get through the wait at the check-in desk and were offered help with our bags to the room. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and very clean and well-maintained. There is a vast selection of wildlife that you will see walking to and from your room throughout the stay. The room was spacious and clean, the bed large and fairly comfortable. The bathroom had a walk in shower and again was very spacious. The mini-bar was kept well stocked for us and the maid did a good job of tidying the room, although some days this would happen quite late on in the afternoon. The restaurants (buffet, japanese, italian, mexican) were all excellent considering that it is mass catering. The pool has a quiet area and a more active area where they play tequila volleyball etc. Unfortunately the quiet area is where the pool bar is and they play loud club music throughout the day and people stand there for hours drinking cocktails getting progessively more raucous which doesn't make for a peaceful swim/sunbathe!! It also makes it hard to get served if you want to take drinks back to your place on the beach although they have serve yourself soft drinks dispensers which helps. The beach area was beautiful. The only issue was getting a sunlounger. This hotel has a rule for not reserving loungers but it is in no way enforced. People were leaving their sunbeds for hours at a time leaving their towels and books behind so that others didn't use them. If you don't get up at the crack of sparrows to reserve a lounger you won't get one (certainly not at the time of year we went anyway). There are hammocks but no shelter/shade in that area and a limited number of padded beds for Privilege guests only. In my opinion, Privilege is not worth the extra money. These beds are the only tangible bonus you really get and there are so few beds I imagine you could well end up without anyway! We found the staff to be friendly on the whole - especially in the little on-site shops. Some in the Mexican restaurant were quite abrupt as were some of the bar staff in the main lobby, at the pool bar, and the towel shack. Most however offer you an "ola" whenever they see you and a lovely smile. Take PLENTY of money for tips - a lot of all-inclusive resorts have a strict no tipping policy but not this one. They play up the tips here big time. We boarded the free transfer from the airport to the hotel and were actually asked as a group for a tip for the driver and host before we had even set off! Our rep also told us to make sure to leave plenty of money for the housekeeping staff at the beginning of the holiday and to tip the barmen well each time we ordered a drink in order to get good service.I have to say - I have travelled a fair bit but this was the first time I had been recommended to tip BEFORE getting any level of service in order to make sure it was good, but there we go. Things work differently in different places. The evening entertainment and themed nights were great - particularly the mexican night! The other guests very sociable and supportive...thinking back to karaoke :-). Only one guest in the room above ours created any trouble during our stay by having a punch up with a couple of other guys in his room and crashing and banging about. They ended up outside our front door and we called security but by the time they arrived the guys had scarpered. We didn't hear anything else from them after that - put me a little on edge though! We booked this last minute for a good price and considered the holiday to have been a success. We were there for a week and both decided that had it been two weeks we may have started to have gotten a bit bored with the food options and activities etc. despite the excursions we did every other day to local sights such as Chichen Itza etc. Other couples we met felt the same. You are really tied to the resort in the evenings which wasn't a problem for our stay but might be something for others to consider when booking. The one thing our agent didn't tell us about until we got there was that you have to pay 700peso each departure tax in cash at the airport before boarding your return flight. This works out at about £35 each so if you are keen on budgeting before you go - don't forget this. We only took what we intended to spend on tips and souvenirs so when we were told about this it was a bit of a shock and used up a fair bit of the spending money we had put aside. Also it was tricky to get hold of peso in cash once we were out there because we were so tied to the resort or were on planned group outings. Oh and don't book with Thomson like we did - the rep was a guy who was absolutely shocking. His welcome meeting lasted TWO HOURS! People were falling asleep. He was suppsed to clear up a problem with some excursion tickets for us and never did leading to embarassment on our part when we arrived for the excursion. He also asked that we give him a high score on the customer survey as he really needed it...hmm...Ten minutes before our coach was due to return us to the airport he sloped off somewhere which meant that the group of us with Thomson kept trying to get on to the wrong bus etc. as ours was late and didn't really know what was happening! We sorted it out between us in the end and it's quite funny when we look back on it really, I suppose, but my advice would be to steer clear of Thomson and book through someone else if you can. If you must book through Thomson though, whatever you do, DON'T GO TO THE WELCOME MEETING!! Read the binder at the Thomson desk instead - all the info is there for you :-).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this vacation!”
Reviews.Author: StanwoodBlick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya December 26 thru January 1. There were four of us and we all had a great time! We have been to many all inclusive hotels and this one did not disappoint. I read many reviews before going and found that reviews were up and down in opinion on this property. This is a strong 4 star resort. All the staff was very gracious and did a fabulous job. I will not bother with describing the hotel and grounds because this has been covered extensively. I will say the negative reviews have left all four of us baffled. This is a beautiful adults only resort. It may not be perfect, but they are really trying and we all think this is a place to return to. A very good value for the cost. Ocean Maya Royale put on the best New Year's Eve party I have ever experienced! Everything from terrific food, great entertainment, lovely decorations and fireworks on the beach. A special mention goes out to John Talin, their sax player in the evenings and weekends. A talented and gracious man. Mexico has another fine resort to offer and people need to remember that traveling requires some flexibility. There are many types of people coming and going from the resort that the staff is doing their best to please. They certainly pleased us!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts we have been to!”
Reviews.Author: snow741
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before picking this resort. We knew that we wanted an adult only resort that was not too big. This resort was awesome. We went from dec 28-jan 4- it was quite busy until new years and then it was really quiet Food- there are three a la carte restaurants to choose from, you can go to the restaurants as often as you want. The italian was ok, we only went there once. The Mexican was delicious, I wish we would have gone more often. The Japanese blew our minds- best Japanese food I have ever had. The buffet had a lot of options also. There was a pool side restaurant for lunch that I thought was very good- hamburgers and fries as well as classic Mexican cuisine. The one negative my husband found was that they said there was a midnight snack bar, but every time we tried to go it was not open, so after 11pm there was no food. Rooms- the rooms were good, quiet. We paid extra for an ocean view and although we couldn't really see the ocean it was worth the money as we were very close to the pool and the beach. The rooms were spacious and clean- the cleaning staff did a great job every day Entertainment- the entertainment staff were great, and quite funny. There are tons of options for activities during the day. The activities start at 6:30 at night- normally with some music, then a theater production at 9:30 (these productions were good, there were the typical cultural ones mixed with some productions I have not seen anywhere else). After the theater there was always something that went on from 10:30-12:00. If you wanted, a shuttle went to the bar every night. also, they have a free shuttle to playa del Carmen which was awesome. Bars- were great. They had a drink menu which was always helpful, and had many options for drinks. Spa- worth the money. I got a great deal on a massage and pedicure. Be warned, the staff must get paid on commission as they are often coming around the pool asking if you want a massage or a free 5 minute massage which is always followed by a proposal for their services- they are not pushy, if you say you are not interested they leave you alone.
