Previledge- on the website we has the option to book as a priviledge package as you got perks at the resort. We did not get this package and once we were there we did not think it was worth it. You get the chance to reserve at the restaurants- this would be beneficial if you went with a large group. There is a special section at the buffet as well, but the restaurant was huge and there was no lack of seating. There were some alcohols that were privilege, but we found they had everything that we would drink in the normal section. There was also a roped section of the beach with a waiter- the beds looked comfortable, but we didn't see it as a anything special Overall this resort was awesome. I would recommend it to anyone. I have been to 7 all inclusive resorts and this one would rate as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FIVE STAR, YET NOT REALLY A THREE STAR, SOMETHING IS MISSING WITH THIS RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Blue62
Reviews.Content: We always book two wks in 5 star resorts, and usually return if it is wonderful. We booked this resort as a 5 star only for the xmas week, left 25th returned 01 january. We already had booked our winter vacation at el Valentin Imperial, in riviera maya for two wk stay jan.18 2012. Second time we are returning at Valentin. The resort is super clean, spacious, and extremely quiet, I m canadian, and don t fancy the westerners rumbuctious and loud behaviour. This resort was very quiet with baby boomers of same mature age. A lot of nice folks from U.K and some Québec and Ontario. I enjoyed the atmosphere on the pool side and beach area. You never have problems looking for beach chairs. One thing that particularly ticked me off the very first day is that they have signs prohibiting chair reservation, but the resort has a section on the beach side roped up reserved for PRIVELEGE guests. In there you have lawn chairs, and beautiful beach beds, with a waitress waiting on those 20 beach chairs and beds from 8am till late evening. I noticed a regular guest like us request a lawn chair from in that reserved area, there were a lot of unoccupied chairs in the reserved section at that time....she was refused to take a lawn chair out of that area. So the hotel has double standard regulation. While this reserved area was waited on at all times with drinks fruit and fresh water, the rest on the beach area were not. They had one waitress come around taking drink orders, in the entire week we were there, we saw her twice, the only time we ordered drinks on the beach. They are very limited in staff. And something is just not right with the staff s attitude. They are not the usual happy waiters and waitresses, I got the impression they were not happy, and it rubs off on the tourists. Even though we always tip, they take the tip but ....so what!!! no big deal. When we arrived the mini bar was bare, when I asked the house maid, she told me to call the reception. OUt of the 7 days we were there our rooms were made up five times, I would go back to my room at 4 30 ish, and twice it was not done, when she came knocking at 5. had to send her back, as we were showering and frankly was not the time to have the made in our room. The morning buffet was in my opinion not very good, we could sit outside, for they had about 10 tables set outside, ...no salt and pepper , and you had to ask for your utensils. The waiter would bring your coffee, but neghlect to provide utensils, we are talking about 7:30am now. We would ask for ashtray the waitress would say yes, and never come back. Like i stated earlier, something is missing here, and the staff is not quite there. The breakfast and lunch buffet, were soso, definitely not five star either. The same meals day after day, they pile up fried eggs, and do not provide the proper laddles to pick them up, so you have to take them with prongs..... It s the little details that are missing with this hotel that does not make it a five star resort. The restaurants.....TOTALLY DIFFERENT FROM THE ABOVE. The japanese restaurant had wonderful service, wonderful delicious, beautiful presentation , and again great food. The italian Dolce Vita....THE SAME AS THE YOOKOOSO, food, service , presentation definitely a 5 star. The Charro, mexican....well consider this one like the buffet, service was poor. NewYears eve, we were spoiled. They gave it all on dec. 31st, They had arranged a ROYAL BUFFET SUPPER, all restaurants were closed, and the entire guests were at the buffet, They had ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING, from lobster tails , Tbone steaks, salmon steaks, sushi, godiva chocolates, white and dark chocolate fountains, Loads of fruits , smoked salmon, smoked fish, prosciutto, and i can go on and on, They had arranged white tables, with all the party favors, live band, mariachi, and at midnight fireworks.. DEFINITELY A SUCCESS, AND WORTH FIVE STAR. So this hotel , hovers over 3.5 to 5 star, would not take much effort for them to get up to the five star. Staff needs to be happier and more at guests service. Breakfast and lunch buffet could be improved. They would pile up about 5 lbs of bacon on the grill, and grill it all at once, hence bacon usually not fully cooked. You see, it s little things like that. I paid the price of a five star resort, probably because of the holiday season, I was told it was a five, but definitely not worth the price nor the stars they advertise. If you have any questions , feel free to write. I ll gladly answer.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Ocean Maya Royale in Playa del Carmen 12/24/11 - 12/31/11”
Reviews.Author: Sue509
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice resort. There are definately more pros than cons. But as with any property there is always room for improvement. One of the first things I would like to comment on is the fact that this property is located along a stretch of the beach along with about nine other resorts north of town. It is located an honest 15 - 20 minute drive north of Playa del Carmen, so if you think you will be able to walk out of your resort and down 5th Ave visiting the different shops - you are mistaken. It cost us $20.00 one way to take a taxi into town. I was told you could also take el cheapo for around 30 pesos but I did not try it. The resort does have a shuttle that goes into town twice a day at 10:00am and 2:00pm if you want to go at any other time, you need to pay your own way. Also, this resort has a very small beach area if that is important to you. It has the same amount of ocean front as most properties, but being the way the land curves they had to build a retention wall along most of their waterfront in order not to lose any land. There is a nice glass wall & boardwalk along the retention wall to walk on. Another question I've heard ask is it worth paying the extra money for the privelege area or not. Personally I felt like it was worth the extra money. We never had to wait for dinner seating, while we saw some people get turned away and told to come back as much as an hour later. We had a private area on the beach and never had a problem with chairs. Our server on the beach was the nicest person I've ever met. If everyone was like Azucena the world would truely be a better place. Everytime she came to ask us if we would like something and bring it back to us she would curtsey and say "my pleasure". There was a "romantic" dinner at poolside or beach that had a special menu that was wonderful. In the main breakfast area there was a private dining area that was much quieter than the main dining room. The main server we had in there, Alberto, was awesome. If he is not the head waiter he needs to be promoted. Although there were many good waiters, Alberto surpassed them all. His expertise should be used in training new waiters. Staying in the privelege area also allowed you to order off of the menu if you did not want to go through the buffet. We personnally never did order off of the menu. I heard some people comment that some of the food on the buffet was not very warm. We never felt that was a problem because Aurora would always make you an omelet on the grill for breakfast or chicken, steak, or fish for lunch. Always with a smile. Another benefit of the privelege section is a selection of pillows. The pillows they usually put on the bed are rock hard. We forgot this was a benefit the first few nights and I slept on my travel pillow because the normal pillows on the bed are so hard. The Dive It! Scuba and Fun Center is great! They have catamarans free to use. They also offer scuba, snorkeling and para sailing for a fee. We felt they were very reasonable. The biggest disappointment was the price for massages at the spa. The spa manager, Dulce Santana, did not have a very good grasp of marketing concepts. She would rather charge exorbant prices and see her massage therapists stand idle 50 - 75 percent of the day. The cheapest price we were given was $150.00 for a couples massage for 50 minutes. In Playa del Carmen at Veronica's Massage you can get a couples massage for $50.00 for 50 minutes. When we talked with other people staying at the resort. This was the opinion of every guest we spoke with whether they were from the United States, Canada, or Europe. So if massages are one of the main reasons you are going to Mexico for a relaxing vacation I would go to a different resort actually located in town so you can walk to a cheaper place. I emailed the spa twice before leaving asking for prices and packages for the massages being this was one of the main reasons we chose to go to Mexico. After talking with friend who had gone this summer, they had commented on how good and cheap the messages were. Reading on Trip Advisor we read how cheap and good the massages were in Playa. We felt like we were held captive and ripped off at this resort being they advertised they were in Playa del Carmen. One wouldn't think you would have to look at a satellite map to see how far they are actually located outside of Playa del Carmen. If you don't ever want to leave the resort this is a great place. If you want to do anything outside of the resort you will feel like you're being held captive. If the General Manager, Giovanni Gil, is aware of the pricing structure at the spa then he is aware of people getting ripped off at his property. If he is not aware of the pricing structure at the spa he is not doing his job properly. Next time we will choose a different resort souly because of the location and pricing structure of the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Fab,Relaxing,Holiday”
Reviews.Author: gemloo
Reviews.Content: After booking this in May after looking at lots of hotels the reviews were excellent but a few weeks before we left they got worse and worse and wondering what we had let ourselves into. Our advise ignore them, this was the best all inclusive we have done. The hotel is exceptionaly clean and well maintained, staff are always smiling and attentive and say hello whether its the gardener or a waiter. The food was wonderful and always hot. The mexican and oriental al a carte were excellent but italian not to same standard and what they offer you can get on the buffet anyway so we didnt see the point. The bar service in the lobby was a bit slow and normaly a wait, not enough waiters wondering around to see if you wanted a drink which we felt for a hotel of this standard could be better. The pool and beach area are lovely, yes if you postiton yourself the end of the pool where bar is and entertainment its noisy which you would expect. The beach also this side is a little rocky with a lot of seaweed. If you go the other side by massage area its fine loads of sunbeds as well. The one thing that does need sorting out are sunbeds as on shabby side and not enough parasols by pool. Rooms are excellent only complaint was bed being a bit hard but nothing else. We stayed over Christmas and New Year and the celebrations were amazing the hotel pulled all the stops out and all section managers mingled with guests and wanted to know if they were having a good time. We thought that this was a lovely touch. Our only complaint is the spa staff who during the day by the pool and beach are always hassling you offering a free massage to see if you like it. Dont as you will be hassled even more as someone we got chatting to made that mistake and treatments are not cheap and being noisey we had a look at spa and compared to rest of hotel it is very shabby and tired looking. If they sorted that out and prices made more reasonable they may get a few more takers as in our second week they were around in evening too so must be struggling is our opinion. Thomson rep Carlos was excellent there if you needed him and always helpful, didnt push you into buying trips either and advise at welcome meeting very good and brief only 20 minutes so not a morning of your holiday which has happened before. We got chatting to a couple of english people and we came to the conclusion that the Americans seem to have something to complain about but we all loved it. If you are less able we would not recommend this hotel as lots of steps. Would we go back yes.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya has Award Winning Staff”
Reviews.Author: bluangels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from this wonderful week away without stress and the hotel has no children on the property under 18 staying. No screaming, running around the pool causing havoc at 7a.m. when your choosing to lay in for a bit before breakfast. We travel at least 3 times a year and do love Mexico. This hotel staff is so dialed into the tourist industry. From the smooth check in with complimentary cocktail and a smile. The only road block came when we asked real nice for a ocean view or pool view and were told they were sold out which they were not sold out at the ocean views. It was much better to understand when a manager stepped in and apologized for the miss information that the rooms were pre booked upon booking from our end ocean front for extra money. Our room was with a garden view and that was fine. Your never in the room except to sleep. The bed was better then most hotels and the air conditioner was not that bad, had allot worse on our travels. However our room had a very musty smell when we stepped in. Which we were tired, only 2 hours sleep night before and let it slide. We got use to it I guess. When your room is assigned please take a good strong wif and change room if not happy. The smell came home with us and took 2 laundry tries to get smell out of all clothes, even the ones not used. Fabreeze for all the luggage and a good night to air out. Now onto a better note the food was fantastic for Buffet and again staff amazing all dialed in. Enjoy the several cool looking raccoons on the property. They will follow you and greet you at your room in the morning. Some people feed them so they are very trusting of you, not suppose to. The Al Carte was a little hard to get into around the grill Japanese. Tried 3 times to book the Grill spot for the 2 of us, always ended up at the tables. Taking pictures of the wonderful talented chef. The Italian Restaurant by far is the best and no limits of how many nights you can go. With salad bar, soup and pasta appetizer you don't need the entree and the dessert, it's way too much The Christmas Eve presentation of the grounds near the buffet was fabulous. 200 men and women put together Ice figures and also a full ice Santa Chair and Ginger Bread House. An Ice display that the wine was displayed on. Fantastic Horn player he did many walk around requests and came right over and played for you. Felt like you were the only 2 there. This is by far one of the best staff we have ever seen anywhere. They treat you like royalty from the gals offering you mini neck massages daily to entice you to use facility on property. Which is top notch. Again we travel allot and were told to go to Playa Del Carmen by cab not the hotel shuttle your only there in town for 1 and half hours to 2 max. We used one hour for 2 massages for $50, instead of hotel $150 for 2. Fantastic, clean well trained gals downtown to cater to you as a special guest. We would not go to Mayan Rivera this time of year too windy. We much prefer the other side of Mexico Puerto Vallarta. We also own 4 weeks of Time Share and still prefer this style of travel the best. We would however tell other people we know to give it a try. Clean Hotel, Excellent Management, Excellent Rep for Transat Holidays, take the 15 minute intro to the area and hotel next morning. No time share pitch just straight forward information. If you like night life and have ever been to Vegas this is as close as you will get to it at Coco Bongo. With show and music and Tributes artists to the stars. Worth the $40 a person leave at 10p.m. come back at 3:30a.m on bus from hotel, nap in the day time. Where ever you go, have fun. The Hotel is one of the largest properties in the area. Great tanning areas. Just don't make the mistake of laying on the white beds in the preferred area like we did not knowing. Was asked to move they are extra $50 a day a couple. Take the 15 minute walking trip down to the Lagoon. Take a bathing suit. Happy Vacations to all

Reviews.Title: “Value Priced all inclusive trip!”
Reviews.Author: Trayson H
Reviews.Content: We loved the Ocean Maya. It wasn't the biggest property around, but it had all the ammennities that we needed. We were spoiled there and enjoyed the pool, the grounds, and the area. While it isn't a place where you'd go do a lot of swimming in the ocean, it's fine to walk on the boardwalk and do your swimming in the pools. We asked for a Mattress Topper and they brought us a pillow-top and that helped a great deal. They also had our room decorated for our honeymoon and gave us the Romantic Dinner which was amazing (2nd story beachfront gazebo and a multi-course dinner with all the trimmings). The kid free environment was great for us going as a couple to celebrate our Honeymoon. We loved the shows they put on nightly. They were entertaining and we tended to be impressed with the local/cultural talent they were able to bring in. The staff was absolutely wonderful. We had a blast with the activities staff but they were cool enough to let us pick and choose what activities WE wanted to do. They weren't pushy. The food staff took excellent care of us and we felt like between them and the activities staff, we had made some friends by the end of our week. There was a mixup between Loco Gringo and the property where the ocean view room we booked wasn't given to us. H10 said that Loco Gringo sent the reservation wrong, and LG said they did it right. Regardless of whose "fault" it really was, there wasn't a room of this type to give us and we had to settle for one of the many garden view rooms. It was fine and L.G. refunded us the difference in price. Next time we'll make sure we get this part right and confirmed w/o question. But we loved the size and character of the property and would go back again. We were able to do it on a budget--no massages or other expensive add on's. I did do a couple of dives at the Dive It onsite center, and they were great. It ended up being $115 for the two tank dives. We were going to do CoCo Bongo, but my wife slipped and fell hard the night we were supposed to go, so we had to cancel. We'll have to do that if we can get back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonya t
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Ocean Maya. We wanted a completely chilled out R & R holiday and thats exactly what we got. After reading some of the mixed reviews before we left we were a little bit unsure that the hotel was going to live up to what we read in the brochure, but we can without a doubt comfirm that we have no complaints at all. On our arrival after a very long 11 and half hour flight we were greeted by very friendly hotel staff who gave us a drink whilst checking in, we were then escorted to our room which was lovely just like the picture in the brochure. The hotel grounds are immaculate as we found the rest of the hotel, the staff work very hard in all areas and always have a friendly smile and greet you with "hola" when you see them. The hotel restaurants are all good especially the Japenese, we highly recommend sitting around the grill to eat the food it's amazing and the entertainment whilist its being cooked is great fun!!! The entertainment staff are very hard working, during the day there are crazy games by the pool, beach volleyball and a daily holdem poker game that you can join in with. If you dont want to get involved and just relax by the pools or on the beach theres no pressure you can just watch. I had great fun watching whilst my other half took part in a couple of the ball games by the pool and won a coco bongo cup! We would give a big thumbs up to all the entertainment staff especially Ricardo who was great fun and again we would like tho thank him for sorting out our night at Coco Bongo which was by far the best club we have ever been to, if you get chance please go you will not be dissapointed amazing night!!!! Alot of people were moaning about the beach but to be honest we went on it everyday and thought it was ok, the sea is not the best but thats because of tropical storms they had a few months ago and its upset the sea bed a little but hey thats nature not alot you can do about that, we walked along the beach both sides of the hotel and to be honest we found our hotel to have the best spot. If you do want to swim if you walk along the beach to the left about 15 minutes you will come to the fresh water lagoon which is lovely loads of fish to see if you want to snorkle. There is so much more we could probably say about Ocean Maya we had a fantastic time and would definately return, again a big thankyou to all the staff for making our stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya Super Relaxing Place- No kids”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Ocean Maya Royale (December 23-30 2011). We really enjoyed our week at this resort. If you want a nice relaxing holiday without kids screaming all day long then this is the place to book. I will review each area of the hotel. My wife and I travel 3 -4 times a year and have been to a lot of nice places all over the Caribbean, Canada, US, Europe etc.. so I think our opion should hold some weight for a review. I hate people that rate places badly because of one or two trivial things they had go wrong on their vacation. This resort is a real 4* but not a 5* RESORT : Very nice grounds, impeccably maintained by very friendly staff. This resort is low rise buildings, which I prefer over hi rise buildings. Every area of this hotel is very clean. People had mentioned a lot of mosquitos in other reviews and bed bugs but we did not find this to be true at least the week we were there. ROOMS :We were in a Privledge suite which was clean and very nice and also a good size. Beds are a lot more comfortable than most resorts in mexico and they also have a pillow selection that you can pick a nice pillow. The only issue was the air conditioner. The system stays on all of the time and even on low fan speed it is very noisy, although you do get used to the sound it has an effect of blocking out any noises outside. Sort of a white noise filter. Room staff were excellent and cleaning was prompt and thorough each day. POOL and BEACH : The pool area is very nice with lots of seats. The resort was pretty full over the Xmas week and it never seemed busy around the pool or beach area. The beach is nice but be aware that the beach is small where you can swim in the water. There is a boardwalk for most of the area that you can't access the water. We were also in the Privledge area that was blocked off just for these guests with personal service. This was really nice and the service was excellent. There was one young server who went out of her way to take care of all the guests and should be given employee of the month for sure. I forgot her name but she was expecting a baby in a few months. There are also lots of watersports you can do including Scuba Diving ($$) If you like pool games they do this everyday, but it was not crazy loud like a lot of resorts with a bunch of drunken people yelling and screaming. FOOD : Food was pretty good if you chose carefully. Lots of fresh meats and fish that they would grill for you in the buffett but as all buffets go, they get to be repetitous after a week. They also had a great Japanese restaurant, Italian was OK and the Mexican had a nice atmosphere and good kebobs down by the beach. Drinks were fine except for the wine. They only had wine from Mexico that was included but you could buy full bottles from different countries. I don't understand their thinking for the wine. If you had the Privledge option you could get premium drinks but not premium wine. Maybe management will pick up on this and include it. Premium wine by the glass should be included. SPA :My wife and I had several spa treatments, which I usually don't do but they have a great massage therapist (Diana) who was AMAZING. This added to the overall stress relieving week that we were at the resort. My wife had a facial that was so good I almost had to carry her out of the spa. If you negotiate you can get some pretty good couples packages so don't pay full price if you don't have to. OVERALL IMPRESSION: We had a nice relaxing week at the Royale and the staff are great. My only complaint is they advertise late checkout as part of the Privledge package but it was not available because our room was needed for an early checkin. It would probably not been a big deal for the manager to give these guests another room and our room for a later checkin. Sometimes little things can @#$# you off , but that would not turn me off for a return visit to this hotel. Don't worry about any of the lousy reviews. We have friends who complain about every place they have been too so that is just the way some people are. Book this place and enjoy a week of peace and quiet. PS : If you are a young couple looking for a party place you probably would be better off at one of the bigger places in the Mayan Riviera. This resort is pretty quiet after 10:00 PM

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for the price. (some small details lost or overlooked)”
Reviews.Author: Nathanboh
Reviews.Content: Resort was nice and kept up well. Close enough to Playa Del Carmen to go to 5th street quickly. Had issues with Mosquitos in room and swarming outside of room door. Also house keeping was spotty at best - 10+ dead Mosquitos on mirror for 4 days. Besides that it was worth the money and was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Liked my stay and wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: No problems at the airport, the shuttle bus was ready for us and it was a fairly quick trip to the resort where checking in was quick and handled by a very pleasant lady called Judy. Definitely liked the layout of the villas, there are 30 odd spread out on the property with 8 rooms in each. A second floor room made a difference for me as I had a nice view from the balcony. The rooms are clean but of course have the smells that all resorts have in a high humidity area, air conditioned and on the beach. Easy to get used to, after the first day you don't notice it. Beds are harder which again I have found is the norm everywhere and the pillows are rocks. For sleepers like me they might consider a special store of softer pillows available on request. Food was good and plentiful, lots of variety. I did the 7 day bit because no matter where you are more than 7 days you can get bored with the menu. The buffet was probably the best with lots of fresh fruits and salads. Two pools and a swim up bar abut the beach area. The pools were clean and the water well mauntained. I did find the loud speakers for getting people up for games and other entertainment was a little bothersome. I was doing a good impression of a slug on a lounger but others wanted to a little more so why complain. Just tuned it out. Definitely a lack of beach area and not enough loungers. The beach was washed away recently and they have had to rebuild a small section. For anyone who wants to plunge into the ocean, this isnt the place. The beach is brutal with many hidden obstacles underwater like rocks and mangrove stumps. A one click walk up the beach was about the only place to go swimming in the ocean. The grounds are lovely and well maintained. Lots of wildlife and the coatis (raccoon looking) were so funny at night, especially when one squared off against the local cat. Good stand off there. This resort is definitely for couples only. Would not recommend it for a solo traveller looking to have a party type vacation. I did ok because I wanted R&R and got lots as it is quiet after 10 bells. The staff work very hard to make sure you enjoy yourself. Yes it is advisable to throw a few good tips out there early to insure that you are attended to but who can blame these folks. They are not paid all that well and do rely on tips to get by. A special mention to Francisco who worked in the Mexican restaurant. He is so personable and fun at all times. Also Sashkia (aka Training), lovely lady with a wonderful disposition, Yvonne ( thanks for the loan of the cell phone) and Loudres who took good care of my room. Miguel and Manuel also in the Mex restaurant ( killer banana margaritas). Honourable mention goes to Daniel the night security guard, what a character! One area that the resort could work on is transportation. Since you are 7 km north of Playa a cab ride is $20 one way so it gets expensive. They should consider two daily shuttle bus runs into Playa. It was a good experience and I feel that I got my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced "starter" inclusive resort!”
Reviews.Author: UTHogboy
Reviews.Content: I titled this review the way I did because had we not been to other inclusive resorts in the Riviera Maya we would say "This is the nicest place we ever stayed!" and the rate was very reasonable. We especially enjoyed -- the beautiful, quiet setting. The resorts sits about 2/3 of a mile in from the main highway right on the beach. The grounds are beautiful, if somewhat simply landscaped. The room we had was good sized and updated with a modern style. The resort does a decent job on energy/water conservation. The resort has two nice pools -- one essentially a giant wading pool from when the resort allowed kids, the other deeper with jetted loungers. We also enjoyed the local wildlife -- Coati, racoon, iguana, and a variety of birds are common. We liked the fact that you didn't need reservations at the restaurants (although one busy night found it difficult to get into the Italian restaurant and that those with premium or "privelege" status could evidently make reservations). Finally, the resort has a really nice exercise room and spa. The sauna and hot and cold jetted soaking tubs in the spa are included in the room fee on a reservation basis and were very nice. The staff without exception are friendly and helpful! Things that were good but could have been better? The food is good but... Unlike other all inclusives we have been to the restaurant menu is same every day and the choices somewhat limited. That said we enjoyed both the Japanese and Itailian restaurants. The main buffet up by the lobby has a good selection, but much of the food in the warming trays was barely warm. They do have a grill though with cook to order that serves up your choices hot and fresh. The restaurant poolside is smaller with less selection but the food seemed to be more fresh and hot. They also cook to order. Overall the quality of the fruit was just fair to good in comparison to other resorts we have been to in the area. As mentioned the room was nice, but the beds characteristically (for Mexico) were rock hard. We take a foam pad for the bed and vacuum seal it to compress it so it fits in our luggage -- it really helps. They have a "pillow menu" but only for "privilege" guests. The bathroom is nice, but the shower is small. Also, our room was very nice, but we talked to several other people who complained about their rooms -- that they smelled musty, like mold or like the sewer -- so if you get a room like that don't hesitate to ask to be moved. The hotel provides a free shuttle to Playa del Carmen, but has very limited space. If you want to take advantage of that service you need to make a reservation with the tour director the day before, and be at his desk when he arrives just before 8 am. Make arrangements for transfers to/from the airport/hotel before you arrive. If you just rely on taxi's you will find it very expensive (i.e., a taxi from the hotel to the airport is $100 -- made through a private tour company reduced our cost to $40 for non-stop ride for my wife and I). The beach is...non-existant. That's only a slight exaggeration. If you are looking for a traditional beach to swim from you'll have to wander next door to the next resort over. Ocean Maya only has a small beach from which they launch water activities. That area is also where the topless sunbathing seems to be concentrated (this is to the right of the two pools)...the adjoining beach is to the left of the two pools. The pool and nightly entertainment is OK -- the staff work hard to make it fun. The evening entertainment doesn't start until 9:30 pm which is a little later than some places. The only other annoyance we experienced was the continual hawking of massage services. I think we had more people approach us asking if we wanted a massage as we had asking if we needed another drink.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations !”
Reviews.Author: natalie b
Reviews.Content: We had a very diferent experience to some of the people who have Reviewed recently. It seems that some of the guests staying were misinformed about some of the benefits with upgrading to Premium as all of the aforementioned benefits came with Standard, so if you are considering upgrading, ask them to list the advantages. The negatives sadly outway the possitives for our holiday experience the only possitive for us were that there were no children, the main reason for choosing this hotel and in a nutshell the negatives were, too much pestering on the site by the massage team, be it beach, lounge, terrace, lobby areas. Baring in mind this is a hotel for ‘ couples’, the seating arrangements are set for 4 or 6, lobby/terraces/eating tables, therefore making it feel a bit awkward and forced. The quality of the food was nothing special and on several occasions we opted to eat out of the resort. Dissapointing that the shuttle runs only once a day at 10am and returns at 2pm, very limited space so need to book well in advance. Oh and on Christmas Day at 5pm we thought we’d have a glass of champagne while waiting for a taxi to be told they had run out earlier !! The fact that we were not informed at time of booking that most of the beach had been washed away in an October Storm., together with the Italian Resturant We found it hard to relax around the pool with the loud non stop music being played so had to go the furthest part of the beach early in order to ensure seats. The evening entertainintment – Not really sure who or what the target audience would be for this, all to confusing. Its not somewhere we would choose to go again, it was an average experience to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great review of Oceana Maya recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Cory V
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic honeymoon destination for my wife and I. The absolute best thing about this resort are the employees who I call "friends" now. They are so accommodating and want to make it your best and most pleasurable vacation experience. They helped us to book all of our excursions and our trip to Coco Bongo which was amazing thanks to Polo. Ricardo is the "rock star" entertainer who makes all the shows fun and humorous and keeps everybody on their feet. Jess kept everybody in shape for the water aerobics and fitness classes. The women Amy and Fernandina were extremely nice and entertaining as well. They teach basic dance lessons and make sure everybody has drinks. Above all their manager Miguel is one of the best. He keeps all of his staff on the same page and makes sure everybody is having a great time. One thing that blew me away is how they all remembered our names and made our stay very personable. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody who isn't looking at spending a fortune, but wanting to have an amazing romantic couples getaway. Also, I've seen negative comments about their shows, but I guarantee you everybody there works their tails off to make it entertaining. Nobody is perfect and if you can do better than good for you. Awesome group of staff, great service, wish the rooms smelled a little better, excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: pyllis
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip at last minute for our 40th anniersary. We have been to the area many times, always a different resort. We loved our time here. Everything went smooth from arrival (at airport) to departure. We were greeted with a friendly smile and prompt service at breakfast by Alfredo each morning. I left my purse in lobby on couch when we checked into our room. About 2 hrs later, I realized it was missing. I traced my steps, and there it was...right where I left it at our arrival. That said tons to us about the whole place. I would have given it a 5, but the beach area had been washed away. We did spend some time in the Ocean, but it was not what we had hoped for (certainly no fault of the resort) Really loved the grounds and the relaxing pace. We like the smaller size,and quality that we felt everywhere. We stayed at resort the whole time. LOVED IT, and the whole staff

Reviews.Title: “Need to fix the bed bug problem!”
Reviews.Author: Byron B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale by H10 from 12/9/11 to 12/18/11. We have stayed at many other all-inclusive hotels in the Riviera Maya part of Mexico but this was our first time at an H10. First I will list the things we liked about this hotel. The food was very good. There were four restaurants to choose from in the evening and we liked the food at all of them. Everything was located within comfortable walking distance from the rooms. The staff were all very friendly, polite, and helpful. The daytime entertainment around the pool was good. We met a lot of great people from all around the world. If not for these fellow vacationers we would have been pretty bored. We actually had a great time, but only because of the people we met and made friends with from all around the world. Now I will list the things we did not like. The rooms had bed bugs. We noticed as soon as we got there that some people had some real noticeable red puffy sore looking insect bites on their arm and legs. We asked a couple of the people what they were from and they didn’t know. They said they didn’t see any bugs but got bit sometime while staying at this hotel. One lady we spoke with was covered with bites. She had to have had at least 100 bites all over her body. She told us that she actually went to see a doctor while there and he put her on some antibiotics. We also saw some of the workers that laundry the bed sheets and they were covered in bites. Needless to say, we didn’t sleep very well. My wife ended up with about 15 bites and I only got bit twice. They are very nasty bites and seem to be taking a long time to heal. Hopefully they will not leave scars. The hotel management does not seem to be concerned about this problem, probably because they either don't know how, or do not want to fix it. Watch out for Dean. He will be one of the first people you meet upon check-in. He has a desk in the front lobby and his job seems to be to try to trick people into attending a time-share presentation for H10. As soon as we checked in and we not even to our room yet he greeted us and said he would like to have one of his staff give us a tour around the property so that we would know where everything was during our stay. We thought this sounded like a good idea so we agreed. He introduced us to Christine. She started asking us questions about our kids, previous vacations, income, and ect. I was suspicious so I asked if this was a time-share presentation which she admitted to. We said we were only interested in a tour of the facilities, not a presentation. Her answer was “ok then” and she walked away and never did show us around. Kind of comical really. The tour was not needed anyway because the place is not very big and it is easy to find everything on your own. There are only two actual bars on the property. One by the pool, which always seemed to close at about 6:00 pm. We thought it closed way too early. Then the only other bar was the one in the hotel lobby. It was open until 1:00 am, which was better, but still a lot of people would have liked to stay longer. The Mexican restaurant had a little side bar but very limited drinks we available there and they closed early, so we didn’t use it much. The nightly shows were very poor. These were the worst shows we have seen in our traveling experience. There just didn’t seem to be much talent there…sorry. In conclusion, if the hotel would admit to, and fix the bed bug problem we would stay there again. That was the biggest problem with our stay. Get the bed bugs out of the hotel and we will be happy to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Elenaliny
Reviews.Content: We (young couple) stayed at the hotel for a week in March 2011. The rooms are clean, the stuff is friendly, and the kitchen is good. It was simply amazing. It is a quiet, relaxing place with great entertainment throughout the day at the pool. The beach area is not that good though. Overall, it is the best price-quality deal. Absolutely worth what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fernie, Amy, Amanda, Daniela, Polo, Ricardo, Jes, Omar (The entertainment team) - Thank you for a brilliant holiday xxx”
Reviews.Author: RobinGB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (Robin and Angela) had a great holiday at Ocean Maya Royale from the 6th to 20th December 2011. I like to be active on holidays, I'm not a big drinker, nor a big eater but I like to make friends, have fun, do sport/games during the day and dance by night, so the entertainment staff at Ocean Maya Royale were perfect (xxx). Make the effort to get to know them, they will transform your holiday if you are at all outgoing. Five stars for them. The hotel itself is very nice, very American in style which suited us. Everything is well laid out and no one we spoke to complained of being out on a limb. We stayed in Room 806 which wasn't perfect but still very comfortable and quiet being an upstairs room. It wasn't perfect because the tap was wobbly and like others have said the shower door didn't close properly but there was no major leaks for us, just a small (1/10 of a cup) amount of water made its way out on to the floor and was immediately soaked up using the floor towel. The room was clean comfortable and everything worked so no complaints. Next to the entertainment staff the food was the BEST thing about this hotel. I read so many complaints on here about cold or luke warm food that I had concerns BUT.... The style is mainly high quality buffet. There is a large and varied choice in the main restaurant at every meal time, food is mainly kept in hot trays warmed from underneath so take the food from the bottom of the trays and it is HOT (with the exception of the chips). You have to pounce on a freshly fried batch of chips to get really hot ones which is 11am at the pool restaurant and 12:30 at the main restaurant. Also at the main restaurant there are two huge cooking plates and four woks manned by staff ready to cook for you there and then. What is on offer on the cooking plates/woks changes daily but every three days or so it cycled around steaks, tuna, chicken, large prawns, pork chops, burgers, omelettes, pasta etc. Take any of these freshly cooked options and it is hot hot hot. So apart from the lack of a continuous supply of hot chips we have no complaints. We did however avoid having lunch at the pool restaurant because the selection available is much smaller and due to the air flow in the restaurant the food was not as hot. The drinks were good but not great in my opinion, because the mixers used are mainly from the gun, so orange/cranberry juice is a Schweppes type juice, not carton (except for mango) or freshly squeezed. Mikes coffee shop was great, like having your own inclusive Starbucks; the Mocha Frappe is to die for! I have run out of time to say more, other than this was one of our top holidays (after the Maldives, Phi Phi Island and South Africa). I thoroughly recommend it, I know it won't be for everyone, nowhere is, but we had a great time and would love to go back NOW! Glad you enjoyed your birthday Fernie :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: NorthWalesSpike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks from the 3rd December. Very quick transfere from Cancun airport. When we arrived it was a very quick to check in and had a lovely arrival drink. When we got to our rooms, they were very clean and spacious, we had an Ocean view room which was fantastic, i would advise everyone to have this. the hotel was aware it was our honeymoon and we were given champagne and cakes in our room and were given a romantic dinner and breakfast in bed which was lovely! Unfortunatly the buffet food is warm or cold, and i was extreemly ill on the 3rd day, but i found if you stick to the foods that are freshly cooked it was really nice and there is pleanty of choice, and the oriental and mexican restautants are fabulous. The grounds are wonderful clean and very well kept. All staff are extreemly helpful and friendly. Even if you dont upgrade to privilidge, you still do get some international alcoholic brands,champagne and cocktails, waitress service round the pool, and even though we couldnt pre book the restautant we found there was no need to, every night we were able to walk straight in! They do have a beach and a sandy platform, perfect for sunbathing, maybe not the best place for swimming in the sea but if you walk 2 mins to the next beach it is lovely! ( i was a little dissapointed with the beach) and the water is cloudy. This is a lovely hotel, and dont be put off by the bad reviews, we met pleanty of repeat customer where would stay for 3 weeks at a time!! We did have a fantastic time, and would like to thank all the staff at the Ocean Maya for a fantasic Honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Buffets beware”
Reviews.Author: Jan W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at Ocean Maya Royale. Our ocean view room was amazing! The pool staff was a lot of fun and the entertainment in general was good. However the buffet food was not so good. The hot food was cold or luke warm at best.We tried hamburgers and pizza,thinking that was safe ,but the hamburger was under-cooked and the pizza was cold.Breakfast is ok ,but hot food was not so hot. My husband got sick on something he ate on our last night and is presently taking antibiotics. The Japanese restaurant was very good and the cook was very entertaining. The Mexican and Italian restaurants were good as well. I suggest eating at these places rather than tempt fate at the buffets . Other than the food,we had a good time,lying in the sun,playing in the ocean and relaxing. The staff is very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework...no suprises for us...we liked it.”
Reviews.Author: MARYANN H
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our Mid 40's to early 50's. We have traveled the Rivera maya area each December for the past 10 years or so. We like ...clean, secure, a smaller property, with a good beach and preferably adults only without spending a pile of money. We do not need over the top pampering. We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale Adults only property for 8 nights in Early December. We read all the reviews prior to going and felt pretty well informed on what to expect. We booked thru orbitz and our shuttle was Gray line. No issues with either company and would recommend them. When we arrived the front desk area was prompt and shuttled us over to the guest services desk where a beaming and friendly Susanna checked us in. She then escorted us to our room and explained along the way where everything was. Due to the package we purchased with Orbitz we were given an upgraded room upon availablity. WE got it! Very nice Suite with beautiful white leather furniture, king size bed, Sparkling wine in the fridge and a nice touch of sweets on a platter. The patio has a nice patio set and a Jacuzzi tub for two. We did not have an ocean view we were however a whopping 100 steps from the pool and beach! How can you beat that! Ahh..great way to start out our vacation. We loved the Italian Restarant best! Very good food. Friendly waiters and a very pleasant Maitre de. The Japanese was fun. We were able to get a show table and Nick did a great job including all of us in the "show" we had us from the U.S. a couple from Sweden and another couple from Argentina? and he did a great job of melding us all together. Fun! The buffets, plenty to eat here nothing to go Amazing about but good, and plentiful. The breakfast omletes were my fave. Hot and fresh and the gal was always smiling. The Mexican was very good I just wished they offered either at this restaurant or on the buffet more "mexican choices" more Tostada's , and sopa's etc...we had an amazing candlelit dinner on the beach under a full moon. Yummy shrimp and steak. Inquire at guest services about setting this up. Wonderful! Our waiter was exclusive to us and did a wonderful, wonderful job! I highly recommend this. We loved our room it was spacious. The bed comfy. A full dresser for storage along with a few drawers in the closet. Inquire at the front desk for a lock and key for the safe. It's big enough for cameras, cellphones,wallets etc...but will not hold a standard laptop. Wi fi available in the main lobby. Everyone seemed to be on their laptop or cell phones etc. There is an internet cafe albeit a bit pricey in my opinion and that is when you could find them open. Luis is a wonderful on site photographer. He does an amazing job. We didn't have pix taken but I admired his work and wished I had time to do a session. Take a short walk down the beach to Tres Rio's. (Three Rivers) what an amazing natural area! It's worth the walk. The beach. Ahhh, as we are beach people and really don't care about the pool this is important to us. Unfortunetly for this resort Hurricane Wilma took back about 30' of beautiful beach. Due to erosion they had to build a concrete wall. They did a great job with what they had to work with. The only thing is you are sitting "above" the ocean and looking down from the beach. This is not your typical "beach sand then ocean view" it is however still pretty. There is an area near the pool that has alot of trees along with a board walk and easy access to the pool and then an area on each side that is closer with water entry. It's an odd situation but again, it's what they had to work with due to storms and I think they did a great job and we hung out on the beach the entire time. The beach and pools are very close together, a quick walk to the clean bathrooms and the bar area. There was a gal that would scoot across the beach and take a drink order at various times but it most times was quicker to just get up and get your own. Javier, javier, javier! the best bartender! He did a great job at the pool. He could mix up drinks and send you on your way in no time and always with a smile. He was our favorite of the whole trip. There were a few bartenders in the Main Lobby at night that we could not get to smile for anything! geesh! The waitresses in the lobby did a great job and were always zooming back and forth from the lobby to the bar. Speaking of the lobby it is very pretty and at night it is where pretty much everyone just hangs out, plays cards, has drinks, there is a sax player that I thought was very good and loved the ambiance that he added. We liked stopping by the guest services desk at night and chatting it up with Sussana and Judy at and learning of the area and things about the resort. They are great gals and an assest to the guest services area. I witnessed several guests storming up to the desk being demanding and rude and they painted on a smile and took care of them with great patience. We also got to meet Maria the Assistant Manager. Very lovely lady and a pleasure to get to meet her. We loved our stay at the OMR. Our room was way near the beach and the pools and we liked that as that is our favorite place to be and also because we liked a little walk to breakfast and in the evening to walk off our indulgences . haha. The area of improvement I could see is: Better loungers on the beach. They were the old fashioned white resin ones with super, super, saggy blue backing. Ouch. I do see where they are slowly implementing new ones here and there but if they are catering to adults they need to speed that up just a bit. Also, I would suggest more of the little "tables" in the beach area. I saw only maybe three total on the beach. One other improvment was the few certain bartenders that just were not "friendly" ...hey if you are in customer service you should at least deliver a "hello, how may I help you" and a smidge of a smile. There were a few that were scowly. And it had nothing to do with tipping because trust me ..we are generous tippers where deserved. And lastly my other suggestion would be more music choices near the pool. We hung out on the beach and I can tell you each play list each and everyday. Kiss I was made for loving you and Michael Jackson Thriller 8 days in a row , many times a day. Mix it up. We love all kinds of music just not the same 30 songs over and over. Maids, and lawnworkers etc..there was not one that you would pass and they wouldn't offer a "hola' they did a a great job and their pride shows. OUr room was always clean and well stocked. The beer was fresh and cold. The alcohol was very good and good choices. They have a "privlege shelf" with even more "top shelf" but we found plenty of very good brands on our level. Yes, they had some bottom brand but just ask specifially for say, Barcardi or Captain Morgan's. etc... We didn't take the shuttle to PDC as it was offered from 10 a.m. till 2:00 and for me..that is prime time for the beach. I kinda wish they would offer it from say 3:00-7:00 or something of that nature. But we just took a cab. $20.00 each way. Split it with another couple if you can and it's not so bad. Or take a walk out to the highway and catch a collectivo. We did not do that as it was dark out and lots of traffic and road construction going on we didn't need to get hit just to save $20.00. The ugly...not sure if they were American or Canadians (we are from the US) but where ever they were from I was embarrased for them. There was a group of about 8 ladies that pulled 8 beach chairs together on the beach, tossed their stuff on them an hogged them but never once returned to the chairs to use them. Others were walking up and down the beach hoping for a chair to sit on and they and many others play the stupid towel game. Anyway, this group of ladies were beyond loud, beyond obnoxious the more they drank. Screaming at the top of their lungs about their sex toys, screaming to the bartenders get them this or that, dropping f-bombs like they were the only ones there. Sad. Hey I like to have as much fun as the next guy but not when you act like you are the only ones who paid for their vacation. Oh well, we moved further from the pool beach area so we didn't have to listen to them "as much". This is of no fault of the hotel just a reminder that others are there to enjoy themselves too. I know I have been all over the board with what I am remembering while I am typing but I am trying to remember the things that were important to me in planning my trip. I hope that the info has proved helpful feel free to send me a pm if you have more questions and we will try to help. We would return if the price was right. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort.”
Reviews.Author: JRS54
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, clean and good for the price. The beach is very windy, but that's normal for Mayan Riviera. The pool is great but didn't have enough pool chairs. The food is good and staff is very friendly. Great place to go to with your friends and relax. Would recommend this resort. J.S.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: jan0908
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel set in lovely grounds and the staff are amazing nothing is too much trouble for them cant wait to go back The entertainment staff keep you amused but are not pushy if you dont want to join in the rooms are fab spotless and the maids do a wonderful job All the staff are so friendly

Reviews.Title: “just a regular 4 star”
Reviews.Author: JACQUESGAGNON
Reviews.Content: To begin i am a travel agent. It is not a 5 star ! the site is perfect, the pool is to., the beach is find but the water color is trouble most of the time very windy. The room is big enough and clean. The bed big but matelas hard a bit lot of pillow but no soft one. The restaurant are good ( asian the best ) the buffet is a regular good one. But nothing that will go in your mind to say ( WOW ) The animation is a big 9 , Perfect for couple, it is for adult only and this is wath is for. The bar are good pool or looby, of course they cant serve all of us in the same time ! The coffee at the looby is perfect, esspreso, latte any one. The red wine that is serve in your all inclusive price is one off the worst one in all inclusive that i know. Go for the buble one at the lobby, very good. Animation at night done by the regular animation staff is a regular one, but dont miss the mexican nigth( outsider) Was there for two week from 21 nov to 4 dec. Want to relax and have a fair vacation,do have a open mind if you think it is a 5 start !!!! Jacques

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel/resort.”
Reviews.Author: Surrey_BCLorena
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Maya Royale. Would stay there again. Went from November 20 to 27/11. Very clean and quite. We really like that this was not a resort with tall high rise buildings. Two levels except one building. Only a few buildings with ocean views but the time we spent in our room, this was a minor detail. Adults only! Loved that part. The staff there were very friendly and accommodating. The water sports included hobie cat sail boats and kayaks. We enjoyed para sailing as well. The entertainment group keeps you going. Water volleyball, morning walking tour, poker by the pool, pilates, salsa, sushi making lesson, bingo etc. Very impressed with the towel lady who would come by and ask if you would like a dry towel throughout the day. We also couldn't believe the service. The girl around the pool continually asking if we needed a drink. Just remember to tip as these people work very hard, in the heat. Music playing throughout, saxophones was a nice touch. The only negative was not enough sunbeds and the condition of the ones they did have. Also, people would put their towels to reverse these seats and not even be around to use them. Shame on them as there were signs stating not to do this. The resort did not want to remove the towels as they did not want to make anyone unhappy but would try to find you seats. Overall not a five start but well worth what we paid for. We were totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Animation Staff-Ricardo,Jess,Amanda,Fernie,Omar & Amy-Jean & The Entertainment Manager Miguel”
Reviews.Author: StaceyHibbert
Reviews.Content: Date of travel-21st November-5th December 2011. I'll start by saying myself and boyfriend booked this holiday through Thomson Holidays.It was a good price,but mainly because it was a newly refurbished hotel and converted to adults only. I myself have been to Mexico twice before but to the Iberostar chain and had no problems,so trying a H10 hotel was a new experience and also another part of Mexico. So i will give my review as honest as i can be.Must warn you I have a feeling it may be a long review it was that good :-) but you will appreciate it as it gives you a lot of good facts. Arrival-Monday 21st November: After a 10hr and 40mins flight from Manchester Airport we arrived into Cancun airport with the Thomson rep there to greet us with a few staff to take our cases to the coach-must i say make sure you have some $1 notes as these come in handy at the airport and places around Mexico to tip the locals. The minute the cases was on the coach we was asked by the guy for a tip. I didn't mind as I expected this before from previous experience travelling here,so you can't really refuse them, but they accept in any currency. A $1 bill is plenty to give them. The coach transfer to this hotel is approximately 45 mins and we was the first drop off which makes a change as we are always last everywhere else. I suffer really bad travel sickness and this coach transfer was the best I've been on with fully air-conditioned coach so I was fine. As soon as you set of the rep starts to talk and try and sell you drinks on the coach-its not worth it as what you are charged is really expensive and its worth waiting for your all inclusive to start. It was $5 for a bottle of Corona(we don't really drink)but the cans of coke was still $3 so it isn't worth it. The rest of the coach transfer the rep goes through the different hotels and excursions thats you pass on your way. Arrival at the Ocean Maya Royale Hotel.: First impressions when you arrive at the Ocean Maya Royale, are really fantastic. The outside landscaping of the hotel is really tidy,and very clean. The gardens are well maintained and you can see this throughout the hotel. The lobby is beautiful too,again very clean and tidy. We was greeted with a drink on arrival but it was very watery so didn't bother with it. Check in was so quick and easy here,your Passport details taken and your room key/safe key and towel keys are given to you. You must treasure your safe key a it is $50 to replace. The staff are all very friendly and didn't have a problem with any member of staff,and what is good they all speak a number of languages and surprisingly the English is fantastic. Rooms: When we arrived we got given a room in block 27. When we got to it, it turned out to be at the back of the block and on the bottom floor with the view being bushes/trees. I had requested at the time of booking, a balcony room so I was not happy with this and my boyfriend said he could not stay in that room due to the bushes and trees as he knew it would be bitten even worse than what he gets bitten.(which is a lot)Impressions of this room was not so good anyway,so I went back to reception and explained we do not want a bottom floor room and straight away they gave us a room in block 32 with a balcony. This was a much bigger and better room from the first room and we was happy with the view on this one. The beds are hard but I found these to be comfy but my boyfriend never likes the beds abroad anyway. The first night was the worse night ever because of the air-conditioning. It didn't work,and it kept getting warm. I wasn't too bothered during the nights but my partner is so he wasn't happy. Then the worse came the next morning when he went to take a shower. As nice as the bathroom looked, i spent the whole time mopping up the floor as the shower flooded most of the room. Straight away onto reception-they sent someone up within an hour but I said I'm not staying in this room any longer as it had to be mopped when we first arrived to it as well and there was too many problems with this room. Last but least we got given room 606. I have to say this was the best room ever-the size of the room was fantastic,the bathroom was perfect and the view was still nice. Everything worked too which was the main thing and it took about an hour for the air-conditioning to get sorted but when it was it worked like magic. We only had one problem over the 2 weeks we stayed there and that was some ice had formed so it was leaking but someone came to fix this within 15 mins. The position of this room was excellent too as it was near the lobby and eating areas and also ideally located near pool/beach. We was happy with this room. The bed was much more comfy than the other one. Word of warning-when the maids come to clean your room they leave your door open and this is a major issue as loads of mosquitoes get in to the room and although you cannot see them or think they are there they are worse when you are sleeping as they bite you more at night. The doors are left open for about 15 mins when they clean your room and this can be anytime from 9am-6pm they can clean your room so beware of this. Also the mini fridge is great if it worked.ours didn't work,but we wasn't too bothered as we both waited till the morning for drinks. We just used the water even if it wasn't cold but you get 3 cans of fizzy beverages,2 bottles of water and 2 cans of beer. Ideally more water would be beneficial and somewhere near by to get some ice if required. Oh and the television in the room is a Samsung LCD flat screen TV-this is not very load at all,as my partner is hard of hearing he really struggled with this even with assistance. Beach/Pool Area The first few days we went to the beach as this is the area I love when going on holiday. My impressions was mixed because to me the beach is like a triangle with three different angles to it. You have the far left hand side,where you can play beach volleyball and can get into the sea,this part of the beach was ok but was full of seaweed and the ocean was very dirty. Then the middle section of the beach is actually on a man made boardwalk-which was different,but still very nice. This section was fab and the sand was white sands. This is where we sat for the first few days.but then you have the far right hand side of the beach where all the water sports are done and this is the side shown on Thomson website,and believe me it is nothing like the brochures. Ive seen this for myself and I was very disappointed. It was very very dirty and littered with potentially feet cutting rocks and debris. Also in the middle of the beach is the privilege area. Well this to us was just a chance for them to make some money. They shared the same beach with us except it was roped off and raked every morning-the sand being raked. On the main beach it was done every other morning but there is nothing special as the sand is sand. What was an issue with this area is that by 9-930am you would find no sun beds available whether you are at the beach or pool(which are footsteps away from each other)and in the Privilege area you would find 3/4 of the area empty and you are not allowed to use them and you are expected to lie on the beach. The difference was that they got cushions on a sun lounger and a pillow too,and they are meant to get there very own butler but all we saw was one lady(who was pregnant too)dealing with everyone in this area. This is not how it s advertised. Thankfully we didn't pay the extra as we didn't feel it was value for money for the special beds/butler service or premium alcoholic drinks. As I mentioned above we are not really drinkers. We didn't have a problem with with sun beds as i got up at 630am every morning anyway and reserved them. There are signs to say not to reserve them but everyone ignores these. But I heard that if enough people complain they bring some in a van. After these few days on the beach we decided to sit around the pool. The pools are fantastic,cleaned every morning. There only 2 pools,one smallish pool and one considerably bigger but with a shallow section. The smaller pool was used for the activities that was done by the entertainment team along with a Jacuzzi section and Jacuzzi Mosaic beds in the pool too. They feel extremely weird as the pools are freezing and take a bit of getting used too. The pool bar is located in the smaller pool,again very nice bar staff and always happy to help. Entertainment Staff Well where do I begin here?? It was the best entertainment staff I have ever met.They are all so friendly and just didn't want to leave them behind. They start around the pool between 10-1030am with activities such as water volleyball,yoga,water aerobics...then as you get toward lunchtime it goes into the crazy game which was my favourite so funny,beach volleyball and dance lessons and then in the afternoon you have Texas Holde'm Poker :-) this was the one thing I played every day and night if it was on.It was a different member of staff that played it every day but my favourite was playing with AmÅnda and Ricardo :-).The Staff would come round and get you involved with the activities and if you didn't want to you just say no and they would leave you to it although myself I get involved in a lot of activities so no really wasn't an answer for me to them lol :-) they self voted me into some things and I wasn't aware until like 15 minutes before but I didn't mind. The Entertainment didn't stop there as it went into the night too.It would restart in the lobby about 630pm with the Saxophone player and then by about 8pm the entertainment staff would be back out getting ready for the nights show. The shows was great especially the ones with the staff in,but some nights they would get other groups or staff to put on shows. All of them are brill dancers and singers and are great at what they do.(Jess please don't put your white contacts in again doing your acrobats-it was freaky :-S)Then after the shows there was dancing in the lobby,again I would dance as i love to do this.My favourite was dancing with Ricardo :-) as he used to do this little side to side dance lol :-) it was cute. But his dancing was the best and his enthusiasm too. Then after that you had a choice to go into Coco Bonga-this is $65pp and I don't drink so it wasn't worth it to me. I had just as much fun at the hotel with the staff anyway. Some nights they had Karaoke too. I got up-well kind of forced to get up by Ricardo and AmÅnda but I did it a few times and so did they but in Spanish :-( would prefer to hear you all in English guys!! There is nothing more I can say about these guys except I had a fantastic time with you all and you will be missed very much but I'm sure we will all keep in touch. :-) Make sure you do! Restaurants/Food To begin there is 5 restaurants if you want to include Mikes Coffee bar :-) First one is the Main buffet-La Hacienda-Located near the lobby. This gives a variety of food but a bit you have to do a bit mix and match on your plates. The problem is with myself I only eat Beef on holiday,my partner will eat everything. The beef is really nice but I could never find something nice to go with it like potatoes/chips when I wanted it at night. It would be there at lunchtime but never in the evening. There is fish(which isn't a fish that has been tasted in England before)there is chicken,seafood,pork,pasta and soup. Like i said a variety but the tastes and the way it is cooked is very different. My partner said a lot of the foods was nice in this restaurant just need more choice. Second Buffet restaurant was El Charro-this is located around the pool area.This was used for lunchtime buffet,we used this a couple of times but found the food quality in here isn't as good as the La Hacienda at lunchtime. There is only a few things on offer here like hamburgers and chilli. Beware that the burgers are not advertised as hamburgers or beef burgers. Like i mentioned earlier i only eat beef and i ordered one of these and i knew it wasn't beef but couldn't put my finger on what it was. Its ok for a quick snack or the ice-creams as they are to die for :-) yummy. Next restaurant is the La Dolce Vita(Italian)this was originally located on the beach but due to a hurricane had to be moved to the lobby area. Apparently the one near the beach is due to open in 20 days. La Dolce Vita is a A La Carte, and when open is sectioned of from the La Hacienda. We tried this restaurant twice as it was nice. Only problem is that from the menu you choose 2 main courses(pasta/meat dish) then dessert and they are main course portions that you would find in England so we was always full and had to skip dessert each time although they did sound nice.Highly recommended this restaurant. Next A La Carte is the El Charro (Mexican). Now we didn't try this restaurant and I wish I did but my partner said he didn't fancy the food in there but some friends we met in resort said that the food is fantastic.Sometimes spicy but really nice. Last but not least is the Yookoso (Japanese) i don't like japanese but I decided to give it a go for the sake of my boyfriend.The setting is really nice inside and the decor too. This again you don't choose much from the menu is very much set for you apart from you choose your meat for the main course. Sushi/skewers/soup/main/dessert is how it works. Of what I tried I enjoyed and my favourite was the main course which was Beef Teriyaki. Mikes coffee bar is fab if you fancy a snack and coffee in the late afternoon.The mocha is the best mocha I have ever had-highly recommended. I think I have just about covered everything here,but just a tip-take Mexican pesos,as we took Dollars as that was what I had taken in the past and obviously all change is given back in pesos and we found out that twice we was short changed. We also did 2 excursions while out there and booked them through a company based there.The excursions was COBA and XEL-HA. They was fantastic. $119pp but for each tour you got all your transport/food/drinks/excursion included. Very good value for money. Coba you visit a tranquil cave with chemical free waters-it is magical. Then you go to the local town and do the zip-wiring/abseiling and walking.Then you do lunch and then Coba itself which is very cultural but still very interesting. Xel-ha is a watermark where you can snorkel,swim with dolphins if you wish,cliff jumping,lazy dingy river,zip-wiring and lazy on the chairs/hammocks. We loved Xel-ha but it is a long day as it leaves at 735am and doesn't get back to the hotel until 715pm as it only leave the park at 6pm. We did the park by 4pm so really there should be no reason why the coaches couldn't leave at 5pm which would be better for most people. I think I should of given enough information here for you to want to go to this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as we enjoyed the whole holiday. A big thank you to Ricardo,AmÅnda,Fernie,Jes,Omar,Amy-Jean and Miguel for a fantastic holiday and for giving me plenty of memories that will not be forgotten. Also to all the staff in the restaurants and reception and the other parts of the hotel. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me. Thanks Stacey Hibbert ,ENGLAND

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kit52349
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel, we had an ocean view and it was well worth the extra charge. The room was beautiful, the food was great, the staff were friendly. the Japanese restaurant was great along with the Mexican one. the Italian was nice. all in all you can't go wrong by staying here if you want a beautiful location. the only drawback is that they need to upgrade their mattresses. They were old. they have a thick padding on top so we had no problem sleeping but once they do that they will indeed have a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: flyfishmt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ocean Maya. Had a great time. The landscaping is absolutely gorgeous. The staff were great. The hotel absolutely spotless. We had an oceanfront room (seems there is only one building that is actual oceanfront). We never had to wait in line for the Ala Carte dinners. Have a great coffee bar and smoothie bar. Everything was top notch. I would stay there again. Playa seems to be losing ALOT of their beaches, which is a shame, but still a gorgeous place. Loved it was adults only.

Reviews.Title: “American version of Benidorm”
Reviews.Author: yorkshiredave1981
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya (Royale)! lol! First impressions where good we received a drink on arrival and the staff are very polite and appeared accommodating. As it was our honeymoon we thought we might upgrade but the hotel wanted an extra $100 a night and we simply did not think it was worth that for a bath in the room. The reception staff also explained that we would get privileged treatment if we pay the $100 a night extra, we enquired as to what this was and they explained it meant we would get name brand drinks and separate areas to eat and sunbathe. Still we though this an unnecessary luxury at an inflated price as we had paid £2500 for the holiday in the first place. Pro's Some of the staff where friendly and genuinely wanted to help. The waitresses around the pool and at the reception bar where great. The Bar staff where good also and where tipped accordingly. The grounds where well kept The wildlife around the hotel, iguanas, coatimundi, praying mantis and raccoons to name a few. Staff in the ''al a carte restaurants where great. Tapanyaki restaurant food and chef ( This guy was fun really entertaining) Good water sports centre ( Sergio was a great help cheers Amigo!) Nice white sand so your feet don't burn The burgers! Now I never thought I would say that being a foodie person but see below. Con's Most of the main Buffet staff apart from the lady fresh meat chef and a couple of the waiters. Example: one morning myself and my wife were getting picked up for an excursion and the buffet is meant to open at 7am so we went in at 7am and explained that we needed to eat before we left due to us going on an excursion the petite lady who we fist spoke to said no five minute even though we had explained our situation. Then the manager I believe his name is Ulysses more or less shooed us out of the restaurant. So we did not get to have breakfast before a two and a half hour journey with no guaranteed food source on arrival. 365 rooms and about 150 sun loungers!!!!! You had to be up at 6am to get a spot although there are signs all over telling people not to reserve loungers they still do!! This is so frustrating and I'm sure we all know who the culprits are... Outside of the rooms there was a dead Praying mantis and cockroach for 5 days! Rank! This is not a chill out hotel. We chose Riviera Maya as we wanted a more chilled out holiday otherwise we would have chosen Cancun. The entertainment staff are forever on your back, the same 3 CD's are on all day I could tell you the order of every song and what time there on! Being showed to a table you don't want to sit at when there's next to nobody in the restaurants and being looked at like dirt when you ask if you can go to a more favourable spot. Luke warm food. We did not get to try any traditional Mexican food in the hotel! Why??? Doctor charged us £286.66 for a diarea cure (I hope our insurance will cover this!) Quit allot of loud mouth obnoxious people around the pool bar all day long trying to out do each other on who's having the best time.
