Flat disgusting beer ( Although the cocktails where ok) Thomson excursions are twice the price of external operators go to Playa Del Carmen and see Sergio down near the ferry port he's trustworthy and very helpful. The entertainment shows where funny and not because they where good Saxophone music everywhere!!! Why! Why! Why! It did our heads in and the reception plays elevator music all day I don't know why they would think anyone under 90 would like it?! Very small resort Massages $99 each!! Every time we left the hotel we had a great time, but a bit of advice for you if your thinking of going to Coco Bongo (Playa Del Carmen)...it should hold around 2500 people they cram in around 5000 and at $65 each plus the bar staff want tipping all the time it's rather expensive. The show was good and the music banging but it was like being in a tin of sardines. If you want an 18to30 type holiday experience crossed with a retirement home at night then this is the place for you. Mexico we love you! Ocean Maya Royale we hope we will never see you again. (Unless its at a seriosly discounted rate!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility, Excellent Staff, Meticulously maintained”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week for a Closet Factory business trip and had a wonderful time. The Staff was very friendly, attentive and spoke excellent English. The landscaping was beautiful and it seemed like every day the staff was manicuring a different part of the grounds. We had a great room that was in one of the two-story, 8-room outbuildings near the water. Ours was between the watersports area and the pool and afforded us a great view of the Carribean and the huge pool. Others in our group had rooms in the hotel type rooms and it seems as though those are older and not quite as nice. I would recommend only staying in the outbuildings (sorry, not sure what they are called). There are four restaurants on premises. Asian themed, Italian themed, mexican themed and a multi-ethnicity buffet. In the off season, one of the themed restaurants was closed each day. The food ranged from quite good to excellent, with the asian themed being the favorite within our large group. (BTW, if you are travelling off season, it is still in the Tropics and you still need to wear sunscreen, no matter the month!) There are a few shows, etc on premises and while the production values are not great, the same staff that runs the poker games, spanish lessons, scavenger hunts, swimming lessons, dance lessons, etc, during the day, also participate in the shows at nightly. On a decent length stay, you come to know the friendly entertainment staff and it is nice to see (and support) them in their shows. (Expect a lot of lip-syncing, but still see a show at least once.) A trip into Playa del Carmen is an easy and inexpensive bus trip away, coordinated by the concierge and well worth it. The hotel also brings outside vendors into their central plaza area a few evenings and they do have a lot of the same things you will find in town, for suprisingly similar prices. And just like every other vendor in Mexico, you can negotiate/haggle. If you are prepared to walk away, you will get your best price. The standard alcohol available is of lower, but still drinkable quality (The house tequila is actually a low-proof "licor con tequila"). I didn't ever get a bad drink, but I don't remember many stiff drinks. To be honest, with the heat and activity, I didn't mind being able to drink 20 drinks during the day with no ill-affect. They do offer an upgraded liquor package, which will afford you access to the normal top-shelf items. That's a personal call. All-in-all, it was one of my wife and I's favorite vacation to date!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice all inclusive just a couple hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Sweetdeesignz
Reviews.Content: Rooms:: Bathroom~ Pros: Nice walk in shower Nice toilet with self shutting lids to reduce noise lots of provided toiletries: toothbrush, toothpaste, shaving kit, show polish kit, shower cap, soaps, lotions, shampoos, comb Cons: Leaking shower, made the entire bathroom floor soaked each night. Absolutely no counter space, which sounds trivial but trust me two women need at least moderate counter space. Very small vanity area Poorly laid out bathroom, no privacy in the toilet area since there is a fogged/glass door with about 3 inches of open space top and bottom. And for some reason the hotel only gives you washcloths on the first day. The remainder of the 4 days you get nothing. Sitting area N/A we were in a 2 doubles which doesn't have one. Counter space: Basically none in the bathroom and or the room. Only 3 pieces of a furniture, with absolutely no depth, that could possibly hold anything. The provided luggage stand is completely useless for larger bags such as mine. Beds: Hard initially but I slept like a rock. Patio: Very spacious and patio furniture for two. Security: Safe in the room did not work even after we had them come “fix it” still did not work. Hotel Amenities Pool: 2 large beautiful pools !! Customer Service: Pros:Very very very nice people, English language is widely spoken Cons: This is where the real problem came in. Despite the hotel being super nice we had a slight fiasco with out membership bracelet. Each guest will get a bracelet at check in. When we checked in we received a bright neon green bracelet and was told since we were Privilege H10 members we would get exclusive accesses to the beach, special rooms, and allowed to make reservations . On the third day of our vacation, after spending 2 of the first days on the private beach section, we were told we had to leave because our membership/bracelets were not the correct one. Mind you I had asked the front desk twice about our bracelets and the difference between the other guest. So after gathering all of our things and taking the lengthy hot walk back to the main hotel we had to discuss it with the front office. The entire ordeal was very embarrassing and very inconveniencing. Also even though they advertise change service, a needed service in a foreign country, the two days I asked they didn't have any change available. Atmosphere: pros: adults only, very calm an relaxing environment, and lots of old and out of shape people running around topless and in speedos making me feel great about myself in my more conservative swim suite. Shops: There are only 4 very over priced shops. Beach: Very clean, lots of beach loungers and umbrellas, a nice bar with music and all kinds of drinks. Overall cleanliness: The hotel staff was always cleaning. The hotel was very clean and nice. Hotel activities: Cons: Expensive, a very rude 3rd party activity vendor, cash only which is a nusiance, and most are off site. Pros: The hotel did have a couple of activities: Jet skiing (which was awesome), para-sailing, and windsurfing Food Quality: It was a average. Two buffets and three restaurants. The food is NEVER hot as it should be Or as fresh, on ALL days and at ALL times of the day. For example I even waited for some fresh hash browns and they tasted cold and old. How does that happen if they just supposedly made them?! Variety: Plenty of variety way more than I could have imagined. Asian, Italian, Mexican, American, lots of vegetables for vegetarians, Wait staff: Super accommodating and nice! And no need to tip. Bar: the best place there. 4 bars total

Reviews.Title: “Great mini vacation!”
Reviews.Author: PJsamson
Reviews.Content: My husband sent my best friend and I to this resort for four nights 10/2-10/6. The resort and rooms were very clean. No musty smell in the room. Just keep your doors shut and air conditioner on and you will be fine. The food was good and lots of variety. My friend is a very picky eater and she was happy with the food. We spent most of our time at the pools. Relaxing and activities if you want to participate. We did spend some time in the lobby when it was raining and the activities staff kept us entertained. We would definitely go back to this resort. Thanks to the entertainment staff, Polo, Ricardo, Amy and Jess.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: Zoe S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 1 week from 20th - 27th Nov looking for a relaxing holiday away from children in a hotel that promised to be something a bit special. We were not disappointed. Although the hotel bills itself as 5 star, it is definitely more 4 star as rated by the travel agent. The grounds are beautiful, lush green grass, trees and flowers every and are kept immaculate. The wildlife that roam around the grounds are so cute, coatis (so curious of humans and almost tame), raccoons, agoutis and iguanas, loads of them! The rooms are modern, spacious and the housekeeping staff are excellent, cleaning the room, changing the towels and re-filling the minibar every day. One day we returned to the room around 5pm and the bed was unmade. Assuming there was no maid service that day we made the bed ourselves, however, the maid showed, stripped our poor handywork and re-made the bed properly. The food is ok but we found, as with any all inclusive dining, it becomes a bit samey, samey towards the end of the week. We went into Playa Del Carmen to eat one night and for 2 trips out during the day, just for a change of scenery. 5th Avenue is a good mix of bars, restaurants and gift shops selling the usual holiday souvenirs. It was nice strolling down there with all the vendors trying to entice you into their shops, all promising something different (although it isn't). Taxi costs about £10 each way. Getting a sunbed around the pool is difficult unless you get up at the crack of dawn and reserve one with your towel. Although there are signs around the pool asking for this not be done, everyone does it to guarantee a bed. The beds are shabby, and really do need replacing. Come on H10, this is a good hotel, good sunbeds are required! The staff (despite some other reviews on this site) were always friendly, pollite and curteous and willing to provide you with whatever you needed. All in all a great holiday, relaxing, value for money (about £850 all inclusive each for a week).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax with no children”
Reviews.Author: Trigib
Reviews.Content: Took a much needed, last minute trip to OMR from November 12 - 17, 2011. Our travel was booked through JetBlue.com directly and we scored direct flights from Boston each way even though we booked one week ahead of our trip. Let me start by saying, I have been traveling to PDC for 16 years and have only stayed at the same resort twice (Sandos Playacar). I arranged our own transportation to/from Cancun thru entertainment-plus.net as I always do and still highly recommend them. R/T transportation from Cancun airport is $80 for 2. They take you directly to/from your resort with no other stops or traveler's in your van. We arrived at OMR at Noon and for the first time ever, were told that our room would not be ready until 3pm. Front desk offered to let us change into swimsuits, but would not let us check in to our room. This was a bit disappointing since the resort was clearly only around half occupied. We grabbed lunch, some cocktails and toured the grounds. Headed back to front desk at 2:30 to find our room was ready. We received our key and were sent on our way...they said our luggage would follow shortly and it did. ROOM: No complaints here. Clean room with well stocked refrigerator every day of our trip. Room was 1608 which was one row of rooms in from the pool/beach and a 3 minute walk in the other direction to the lobby and dining area. Room was cleaned everyday by 3pm. Only minor inconvenience was that we only had two towels each day. I prefer to have two but we never called for more we just dealt with it. Beds were the same firmness as we have experienced at every resort in Mexico, pillows were foam ~ no feather pillows. A/C worked perfectly and there was plenty of hot water for showers. FOOD: No complaints here either. If you have traveled all-inclusives then you know what you will be getting. Note: Best food I have ever had was at Iberostar Tucan in Playacar. We never went to specialty restaurants but spoke to a few guests who were happy with them. Oddly, this resort only offers room service to Premium guests. Coffee bar was nice every afternoon and lobby bar had better drinks than the pool bar. EXCURSIONS: We went to 5th Avenue on two separate days (Apx.10 minutes south). Once on our own via a taxi due to a cloudy afternoon. Second time via the free shuttle bus from resort. You must sign up for this at 8am the morning prior to when you want to go. No problems with this free service but the bus only holds around 20 people and it fills up early. Shuttle leaves resort at noon and returns at 5pm. It was extremely hot the day we took the shuttle and felt the 5 hours was just long enough since we have been there many times over the years. Exchange rate when we were there was $13 pesos to $1 us currency. If you charge a purchase this is the rate you get. If you pay cash, most vendors will only give you $10 to $1. Felt a bit cheated, but what can you do? I do recommend 1921 tequilla creme if you want to purchase alcohol. They sell it at the airport and it was something different that was a big hit when I brought it home to my family. It is like a 'Baileys", drink it refrigerated in a shot glass...kind of a sipping desert drink. My son put it in his coffee. I checked when back in MA and would need to drive an hour to Albany NY to purchase in the states. Not sold in MA. As this trip was for pure relaxation, we did not take any other day trips. POOL/BEACH: This is why I had to drop a bit in my score of this resort. The pools were very clean (no children!) and they were certainly large enough. BIG problem is the lounge chairs. They all need to be replaced as they are sagging very low and offer no support. Note to management...this is why we come to relax at the pool/beach and these chairs were the worst I have ever seen. BIGGER problem, I would rate the beach at this resort a 2 out of 10 at best and that's pushing it. 60% of the beach is just a boardwalk that the waves crash into, you cannot go in the water in front of this boardwalk. Facing the water, there are small cove like beaches to the left and right of this boardwalk. I saw very little difference between the two of these except the chairs to the left are a bit better. Sadly, this beach water is not the beautiful turquoise color you expect to see. I was not inspired to take out my camera at all on this beach. Maybe it was the time of year, I normally travel to PDC in May but there was also a seaweed problem and the beach was very rocky. I have gotten used to the beach in Playacar...10 minutes further south makes a WORLD of difference. Playacar beaches have sugar fine white sand, no rocks and that gorgeous turquoise color water that I pay for and expect to enjoy. On a positive note, we walked to the left as others have suggested to see where a river forms a good snorkeling spot just past the Blue Bay Resort. That beach had a 2 foot wide band of brown/black slime on the shore and as the waves hit the sand the color of the water there was dark brown. NO ONE was swimming in it. We have far better beaches up north in CT! When compared to that area, our beach was better but still a disappointment to us. We never sat on the beach, we just stayed by the pool. The drinks at pool bar lacked alcohol, nothing special to write about. You are better off sticking to beer. Overall, the resort is pleasant. Grounds are immaculate, palm trees and fun wildlife everywhere you look. We met some of the nicest people on this trip and the staff was friendly. If only they had a better beach!! This May it's back to Playacar for us.

Reviews.Title: “Vey Nice and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Weluvdr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Maya 11/13-11/23, Very nice and relaxing. met very nice people from all over the world. Very good value for the price here. Staff were very friendly and attended to your every need. Food good with lots of choices. We had a privlige suite and loved the service at that level. WE WILL BE BACK! We honestly could not find anything to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: bargainbetty
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at Ocean Maya Royale in October 2011 and then again in November 2011. Rooms: spacious, recently renovated, comfortable, updated, AC works great, clean! (our maid did a great job but some days the room was not cleaned until very late afternoon) Rooms contain a safe, but there is a key to keep track of. We would have preferred a combination safe Our big complaint about the room is that we could never get washrags. We had to call and then wait everyday. we even left the maids tip folded in the dirty washrags to give her a hint and that did not work either. Food: Food was good, variety of restaurants at night, good service but the place was understaffed and so service was not as good as it should have been for this type of place. It was not because the staff that was there did not work hard - they worked very hard - they just had to cover too much of an area to provide good service. Beach: Beach is ok but not the best. Part of the beach area has a boardwalk and so you are not walking along the water. there is access on each side but one side was rocky and the other side was a small area boardered by a pier. The water was not too clear when we were there. Very little service at the beach unless you walk up to the bar or do the upgrade to privilage. We did the upgrade to Privilage in October and because it rained all week it was a waste of money. We tried to get our money back but were treated badly by the lady at the Privilage area when I asked for a refund. We understand that they could not control the rain, but they could have met us half way rather than treat me bad! Other than good beach service, you do not get much for the money. We did not pay for the upgrade in November nor would we advise anyone to pay to be upgraded. We would have liked better beach service for the non-privilage area. again, understaffed. We were there in low season and our last couple days guests were scrambling for beach chairs. There were also very few tables to use on the beach so you had to hold your drink if you did not get out early enough to get a table. Pools: two great pools, one swimup bar, very clean. They host many daily activities by the pool. Javier and Ebber provided great service at the pool bar. They worked very hard and made us the best Mojito's!! Gill and Marciella were also very helpful and friendly when we had questions or needed assistance~ The resort did provide a very nice beach party/luncheon one afternoon for guests. Lobby is a great place to hang out at night or when raining. staff works hard to serve guests. Overall - it is a decent place, grounds and rooms are kept very clean and nice. I would stay there again if the price was right. if they are striving to become a Botique Hotel, (as a manager told me) they need to step up thier game and definately hire more staff and make some improvements to the service and beach upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “The honeymoon we never had... just happened!”
Reviews.Author: Rob E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Ocean Maya for our 10th anniversary from 11/16/11-11/21. We could not have had a better time! The ocean is beautiful, with the beach being groomed every morning. It certainly makes for a beautiful sunrise. The entire resort is peaceful and serene, and you cannot help but to relax and enjoy. We spent a lot of time in the hammocks (where my feet got sunburned)! There was some construction going on due to a recent hurricane, but it did not disturb us in the least. The pools are well maintained, and always seemed to be crystal clear. The swim up bar is awesome. There is a local named Roberto that gives henna tattoos located in between the two pools – make sure you see him. He does wonderful work, and is fun to talk to! The room was always kept clean, and Josephina did a wonderful job during our stay. Thanks!!! The rest of the grounds are professionally maintained and groomed. There are coatis (don’t feed them unless you want 20 or 30 of them swarming you!) and also iguanas. There is one particular iguana that suns near the stairs going to the restaurants – he’s a big guy. Don’t touch! All the restaurants are top notch! Hats off to chef in La Hacienda!!! Awesome buffet for all three meals. The other restaurants have equally high caliber – you will not be disappointed by the food here. We also took a day and visited Chichen Itza (a must see if its your first time in Mexico) and took another day to take the ferry over to Cozumel for some serious haggling and shopping. If you love to haggle, Cozumel is the place to go! Great fun. The smallest Hard Rock Café is located in Cozumel as soon as you get off the ferry – must visit! The only drawback on our trip would be the Mexican transportation. You might make several stops on the way to your destination, which really delays your fun. This is no fault of the resort – just the way it is in Mexico. The system needs re-worked. Thanks to all the staff at Ocean Maya Royale – you made our stay wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “wow,what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: just returned home from our two weeks stay at the h10 ocean maya royale.we stayed in a honeymoon suite,therefore we received the privilege package.the hotel was fantastic,really well kept grounds with amazing wildlife.our room was superb,we had a hot tub on our balcony,overlooking the beach.the choice of food and drink in the restaurants was excellent.all the staff were very friendly,they worked really hard, especially our privilege area beach waitress Azucena,she was a star.we can't wait to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisabeach_10
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say we let our Travel Agent choose hotels that she has either been to or heard good things about. We have gone to Mexico for the past 5 yrs and I like to stay in a different hotel each time and not the same one over and over. From the time our hotel is booked, I go to the hotel site and read reviews, look at pictures and check out everything there is to know about the hotel. I've read good reviews and bad reviews about this hotel and let me tell you, this hotel was probably the best we've stayed in so far. First of all the whole staff is very friendly and will certainly go out of their way to help you with anything you need or want. We had upgraded through our Travel Agent for an oceanview room and I emailed them to make sure we got one because it was our anniversary. They emailed me and said they would make sure we had the room we wanted. We had an awesome room with the beach, pools and the Mexican restaurant steps away. The walk to and from the lobby is a little bit of a walk, but the grounds are just gorgeous with animals and iguanas roaming about that we enjoyed it. Not one single worker at that hotel would walk by without an "hola". The pool bar has by far the coolest bartenders, Edgar and Javier. They are fun to talk to and watch. The "premium" upgrade is so not worth it unless you want the beds on the beach and, they say, the best liquor. We still got the best liquor because the bartenders are awesome. This was just my observation as far as upgrading, but we didn't seem to get any less than the premiums and we saved that upgrade money. I will say that if you want to go into Playa, the cab ride is $20 each way. They have a free shuttle that leaves at 12:00 and comes back at 5:00, but we went and came back when we wanted, so we paid. If you get money from any atm either at the hotel or on 5th ave, their cost is outrageous, but when you need cash, you'll pay it. They are in the process of building a new restaurant and it was by our room. One reviewer on trip advisory said the noise from the building and the noise from the machines clearing the beach woke them up at all hours of the night and early in the morning, but we slept like a baby. The beds are firm and very comfortable. Also mentioned was the water leaked onto the floor when taking a shower. It does, but instead of griping about it, just put a towel down. I think people that have these little gripes are too nit-picky! I will say the food could have been better, but the food is pretty much the same at all the inclusive hotels, so I wasn't expecting anything out of this world, but you won't go hungry! This is my first review and I would definitely go back to this hotel, and have never said that about any other hotel, and they've been really nice. Whether it is a special occasion or just a regular vacation, they will go out of their way to make it as wonderful as possible.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Judy10008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this resort-11/12-11/19/2012. The staff was friendly and the food was good, sometimes warm but good variety. Room with seaview was great. Our villa was quiet at night since we are early to bed, early to rise people. The entertainment at the pool was very good. Had lunch with Fernanda ,one of the entertainers that got people involved in different activities at the pool. She made us feel special. David & Susanna at the guest relations desk were very helpful & had a special dinner arranged for our anniversary by the resort as a surprise with a bottle of champagne brought to our room. They really go out for their guests. We feel this resort is really a 5 star. They have benches along the path to the resort from the villas which for us were helpful since my husband has a bad back and these were good resting places on our way to the resort to eat. Recommend this resort since it is small and if you enjoy being pampered-this one is it. Only negative thing-small- the housecleaning crew forgot a couple times to replace towels-bath mat-washcloths-coffee. Would recommend that they have a list and check it twice to make sure they replace the items needed before they leave the room. We did call the front desk and they came up within 10 minutes. Just an annoyance that one has to do that. The pillows were firmer then we like but bearable. All in all this resort was fun and we felt like their special guests. Judy from Michigan

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing.....”
Reviews.Author: rosief92
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there! Amy Jean and Fera and Omar and other girls are very friendly! Amy made sure we were good and comfortable at the beach and pool. My husband and I met Amy first, she wanted me to play bocca. And then the rest of my deaf friends met amy and omar and fera. they told me that we were the first deaf group in Ocean Maya Royale hotel! So now they will never forget the deaf group. we taught Amy and others our sign language. they loved it! we were treated very well there. the buffet was the same over and over. there was a waiter his name is Alberto. we like him. he was very friendly and helpful always made sure we had enough coffee and food. The Italian restaurant was very good. the service and the friendly waiters were excellent! the only thing i didn't like was the sewer smell. it was horrible. I wish they would take care of it in the future. the entertainment shows were very good.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOLIDAY EVER !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jademin
Reviews.Content: 23.10.11 - 6.11.11 This was the most amazing holiday that we have ever had. The hotel was lovely and the staff were friendly and lovely. the entertainment staff were fab, friendly and great fun, they made our holiday more amazing than ever :) the food was amazing and so much to choose from, you have to try the cheese sauce (only at lunch) its amazing :) our room was lovely and cleaned everyday :) lots of drinks to choose from my fave was electric lemonade :) .... whilst over there my then boyfriend proposed, he spoke to someone from guest services to organize something special ... we had a lovely romantic dinner on the beach by candle light and we were looked after so well it was a perfect evening ( i said yes) ......... it was our most amazing holiday and we are going back for our honeymoon :)

Reviews.Title: “This is what you need to know!”
Reviews.Author: sn315on
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from our 1 week stay at this resort (November 6-13, 2011). Someone in our family gave us a week, we just paid the daily rate and our plane tickets. We arranged our airport transportation through TraficTours through email and it was $18 a person round trip. It's about a 45 minute drive to the resort from the airport. Just so you know, since we were guests of a premium member, we were given gold bracelets and had all the same amenities as a premium member. We arrived via van driven by someone from TraficTours. They unloaded our luggage, we were checked in at the premium desk. We then were taken to the place in the lobby for us to sign up to take a tour. We declined, they want you to go to a "VIP breakfast" to give you the pitch for buying a timeshare. From what we've been told, it's about 1 1/2 hours. Once we said no, they didn't bother us again about it. Our luggage was brought to our room. The room was very nice, a suite with a king sized bed, a fold out couch, TV, fridge, chair. We had a banner on our door, Just Married as it was the honeymoon we had never gotten to take. We also had an invite to dinner with the executive chef on Tuesday night, a card saying that we needed to make a reservation for breakfast in bed and dinner for two on the beach. We ate at the Italian place on Sunday night. It's been temporarily moved from the beach to a partitioned part of La Hacendia. The food was ok, nothing special. As we were premium, they put us in the wine cooler, which is where they set the privilege area. It was a little chilly, but nice. The service is great, all the staff is wonderful in the restaurants. We went to Mike's coffee, which is near the bar restrooms, before the steps to the spa. Great service by Karolina who is usually in there. They are open from 4-11 pm. Smoothies, iced tea, lattes, coffee, espresso, sweets for your tummy all the time too. There is a cooler with cake goodies, little sandwiches too. Cakes and sweet breads on the counter. Monday we went to the buffet at La Hacienda for breakfast, it's a buffet, but if you are privileged you can order off of a menu...its kept in the podium at the entrance of the doors to the privileged seating. You have to ask for it, or just get one. I think it should be handed to you or even on the table as we didn't know we could do that until Wednesday. Tuesday we went to the chefs dinner at the Oreintal restaurant, Yookoso. Very good food, the chef doesn't speak very much English, so she had a translator, Amy. Amy speaks excellent English and is part of the entertainment crew. One way to become more fluent is to get practice! (Wednesday we had a thank you gift when we returned to the room, chocolate covered strawberries and a note to review the dinner on TripAdvisor.) There were vendors out in the plaza by the lobby. Most are mass produced made in China, I'm sure. Some were definitely made in Mexico though. You can talk the t shirt guy down, he started at 1700 pesos ($17 USD), exchange rate with most vendors is 10%, easy to figure out. Just move the decimal point to the left. I bought a shirt for $15 USD, although hubby thought I could have gotten it for $10 usd. One of the vendors is pretty rude though, the guy with the necklaces and bracelets. You can buy the bracelets in the hotel lobby gift shop (more on that later), but, you don't take the item someone wants to purchase out of the person's hand and be rude about it. I didn't even walk by his table the rest of the time we were there. Wednesday we went on a trip to Tulum. Gerry at TraficTours set that up for us. He's great, very knowledgeable and has pretty great English! He's in the lobby every day from 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. taking an hour for lunch at 1 p.m. I think. We went on a bus, we picked up a few passengers in Playa Del Carmen, it took a while to get there, but, there was a/c on the bus. After going to another hotel, near Tulum, we switched buses. After arriving at Tulum we were split up into two groups, English speaking and Spanish speaking. We had a great guide, he's Mayan through his mother and knew a lot of history and information about all the ruins and the area. We were able to go on our own after a while. We didn't go swimming, there were a LOT of people down there, but, we had our suits on underneath. There's no restrooms in that area, just in the town before Tulum, so wear your suit and bring some clothes and a towel. Also bring sun tan lotion and mosquito spray. The bus driver will try to sell you water for $2 and mosquito repellant for $8. We didn't need either, there were very few mosquitoes in November, but, there's a lot of standing water. If we could have, we would have rented a car and driven ourselves. It would have taken half the time and I think that the cars are around $80 for 24 hours. Thursday morning we had our breakfast in bed. We had the American breakfast. Even though I had asked, there was no syrup for the pancakes and the eggs weren't cooked the way we had asked. But, it was nice and filling and we didn't eat until dinner. Thursday night we went to a show. There was a Mariachi band, singer and dancers, it was awesome! Bring your camera to this show, you will want photos during and after as well. There's also a Mayan guy that the photographer brings around so you can get a photo with him. Wait until Saturday night, they bring in Mayan dancers, you can pose with them for free. The vendors are back again, but, there's a Mayan lady that hand paints Mayan calendars and other Mayan things on leather. Find her and talk to her, she's awesome and her work is great. I bought a 10 x 10 square with the Mayan calendar on it and a bookmark as well. She burned my name into the bookmark. She's full Mayan and has a LOT of information for you if you want to ask her questions. All the other vendors are the same as the other night though. We tried the Italian place again on Friday. We went with another couple, sat in the main part of the restaurant vs. the premium section. There's a waiter there that's a joker, I think his name is Romy. Then we did another show, it was a circus show, very scary but good. Scary as there is no padding or anything under the performers at all. It was amazing! Remember to bring your camera, you will want to take photos during the show. Saturday we had our "romantica" dinner on the beach in the two story hut. It was awesome. It was 5 courses and the moon was out on the water, very nice! We went to a show afterwards, the Mayan dancer show…it was incredible and I'm glad I had video on my camera to get everything!! You can get photos afterwards with the dancers if you want. There was a band that did a few songs that I recognized, like "Sweet Home Alabama". We were leaving early the next day, so we didn't stay too long. Things that bugged us: Trying to charge us for a phone call we never made at checkout. Make sure you only use the phone in the room if you need to call the front desk. It's really expensive to call from the room. We didn't have our cell phones on at all. Who would we call? I think that the maid called someone on our room phone! Marabella was the stand in for Azusena "White Flower" on Azusena's day off. She didn't even roam around after a few hours, she was at the pool bar with her friends. I went to the bathroom by the pool bar and she and two other friends were in there talking away. She was lazy and I wouldn't suggest that she be a server at all anywhere on the grounds. She just stood around and didn't ask you if you wanted anything, you had to FIND her to get ice, water or anything. The food didn't really bug us, but, it wasn't really great either. It was just okay. I found that I liked most of the food after a few days. I tried new things, but, I mainly ate fruit, bread and salad. There was a variety if you went to the different places for dinner, but, for lunch, it was just the two choices: The Mexican place near the pool or the buffet near the lobby. The hotel gift shops take USD or Pesos, but, only gives back change in Pesos. What? If you take USD, you should give change back in USD. That happened in the lobby too, we paid with cash when we arrived and we got back some Pesos and coins. No biggie there as it was just $2 and change, but, with the gift shop it was like $15. They put the Premium rooms near the kitchen. Early morning and in the evening you can hear the clanking of plates from the kitchen as that building is right there. The hotel is a little removed from everything. There is a free shuttle through the hotel that goes to the shopping district in Playa del Carmen daily, but, it's way too long from what we've been told, to stay in that town. It's close enough that you should be able to go and pick people up after an hour. Seriously, 5 hours for shopping? Who does that? Things we liked: The grounds are gorgeous! Don't even look at the photos on TripAdvisor or on the actual hotel website, they will not do the place justice. Just laying on the beach all day on the chairs or sun beds, looking at the water. The premium section has pads on the chairs and there are sun beds. Also there's books, sunscreen, water, water bottles, fruit, beer, wet wash cloths, and a great hostess/person that brings you drinks, unless it's her day off. KID FREE!! This resort just went adult only this summer. We love kids, our kids. We wanted a vacation that was for adults and we got one. Our kids are grown! It was a little quiet at times as it was just adults everywhere, but, it was nice. A safe in the room. They give you a key and lock when you check in. Don't lose it, or you will be charged I think $60 for it as they have to drill the safe. It's small, but, we put our passports, watches, my Nook, wallets, iPod in it. I think that a tablet would fit in it. We just locked our suitcases if we were leaving our computers in the room. The A/C worked really well, we turned it off during the day and had it on at night to block out the noise of neighbors. People that were great: Rudy in the water sports shack. He does a great snorkeling trip for $35. My hubby went on it and he's been snorkeling before. They go about 3-4 miles out and you can see the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef, which is the second largest in the World. It's about 1 1/2 hours and you see a lot if you pay attention to the guide. Javier at the pool bar. He's so fun and works great with the other bartender whose name is Eber I think. If you give him $2 or so the first few days, he will always serve you quickly! Besides we always tip for good service. Isabel who is a hostess at the buffet and then the Mexican restaurant. She's awesome, so polite and smiles a lot. Azusena "White Flower". She works every day with a smile on her face in the premium beach section. She's pregnant and due in February, so, if you go after that, I don't know who will be there. Take these things with you, you will need them: Sun screen! We went in early November and the sun was really hot. We took 3 bottles of 10 oz. each and used one bottle and started on another one and we were there 7 days. In the gift shop it's $30 USD per bottle. Mosquito spray if you are doing any tours at all. A jacket/sweater as it was pretty windy when we went, on the water and a little chilly in some of the restaurants. You may want some jeans/sweats at night. I contacted Maria (the asst. manager) after reading a few of the reviews. She hooked us up! Thank you so much!! :) The vacation was awesome and I can now say we've had a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hannaht1985
Reviews.Content: I am going to make this a quick one as and get to the point. I am a travel agent so have stayed in a lot of hotels over the years!! After reading reviews on trip advisor I was actually concerned that the hotel was not going to be great, but was pleasantly suprised The hotel layout was great and the rooms lovely Best thing was the food quality and drinks/cocktails I have never had so much choice!!! Entertainment was good Def visit coco bonh=gos

Reviews.Title: “Worst guest service i have ever had!!”
Reviews.Author: pat083_028
Reviews.Content: We came with a big positivity to this hotel but we left it deeply disappointed. The only positive things about this hotel are the great variation of food and the nice hotel complex but the service and the contact with the guests was absolut terrible. Moreover the beach and the equipment on it was very old and dirty so no suggestion for going to swim in the sea at this area. After the first day we wondering that our room wasn't clean up. No problem, we called the service to ask for clean up but nothing happened. On the next day again nobody clean up our room we called again and asked why no one will come and asked to clean up our rooms continuously and they told us only: Ok, if you want. Our mini bar also wasnt't filled up so we havent got any fresh water and mostly every day we had to dial the number for the guest service. After some calls nobody answers us anymore at the phone and every time we had to go to the reception to ask again to get some bottles of fresh water. We got no excuses for such brassiness. We have never had such a rotten guest service. Allover the staff in the restaurants was very friendly appart from the staff at the lounge bar they were very brazen. I have nothing against music and animation at the hotel complex but not in such a loudness and after 12 o'clock in the evening. We heard the music up to our room which was far from the hotel lounge by closed windows and it was hard to get sleep. The worst thing was on our arrival day. The day before we asked for a wake up call, a taki and someone who will take our luggage because we had to go to the airport at 2.30 am but really nothing happend. No wake up call, no luggage service and no taxi so we had to organize it all on our own and had a lot of stress. I only can recommend to spend the had earned money to an other hotel because this was terrible and my girlfriend and i will never come back to such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Mexico itself.... But Ocean Maya on the otherhand...!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferFryatt
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this holiday at the end on January, this year! We waited nearly 10 months for this beautiful break...and by the time it came round we couldn't have needed the break more..... We got back this morning and although my holiday was okay... I can't help but feel let down and dissapointed in Ocean Maya Royale. Let me explain in further detail.....starting with the good points. 1. The grounds were beautiful. They were lovely and well looked after. Absolutely lovely. 2. The pools... Were enjoyable to be around. The entertainment staff - Omar and Amy in particular were great and couldn't do enough to keep you entertained. A joy to be around. 3. Our room/ rooms (explain later on) were kept clean and tidy everyday. No complaints there. 3. The beach. It was okay. In comparison to the other beaches either side of ours... we defiantly had the better one. However the pictures in the brochures looked alot different - werent quite what we were expecting! 4. Our holiday Rep was fab and very helpful. Gave us lots of info and was always available. Very friendly. 5. The spa was excellent! We both had a full body massage it was amazing! Definitely worth it's money! Edwardo who worked at the Spa was exceptionally friendly and everytime he saw us around the pool...he remembered our names and made the effort to approach us. He was a delight. Now for the not so good.... 1. The food! One word - DISGUSTING!!! Theres there no other Word to discribe it. The same thing was served every single day in the buffet restaurant. The Italian, Mexican and Japanese food was equally Vile! If you are looking for lovely food this hotel is not for you. The money we took with us for excursions was spent on meals in playa del Carmen because the food became unbearable to eat. Never did I think I would come home a stone lighter from a holiday than when I left!!!... It's a first!! However Alfredo, one of our waiters in the buffet area was very friendly and nothing was to much trouble for him. 2. Don't bother paying extra for a ocean view room. Only do so if your an early bird and don't mind being woken up at 5am every morning by a large truck/ tractor which evens/ cleans the hotels sand. I addressed this issue with reception who told me they'd sort the problem out & look into it for us. Next morning at 5.20am... what do you know!!! Again at reception I address the issue again as different staff were on duty. They told me they'd sort it out and after a heated discussion, I asked for a manager. After the staff speaking amongst themselves in Spanish for a good 5-10 minutes amongst themselves, A gentleman appears and then informs me that in regards to my complaint there was nothing he could do in regards to the wildlife noise!! WHAT?? So not only was I tired but annoyed that the staff had fobbed me off for the past 2 days and not understood what I said from the beginning. I must have explained the situation at least 8-10 times at the minimum! They told me another room would not be available until the following day- promising somewhere quieter. Next day... My partner and I go to reception again and they inform us that there's no need to move us now as they had arranged for the tractor/ truck to start on the otherside of the beach first. The beach is only 100 yards long so instead of being woken up at 5 it would now be 5.15! How considerate of them! After kicking up and after 4 day they eventually moved us to a privileged room... which wasa little quieter but the room was not much better than our previous one. If I'd payed a large amount extra to be a "privileged member" I would not have been impressed to say the least. 3. The smell of sewers lingered around certain parts of the hotel which smelt disgusting! Especially when your feeling queasy as it is. 4. The evening entertainment was poor, it was embarrassing to watch...we found ourselves in bed by 9pm most evenings watching a film instead as that was more entertaining. 5. The "Margarita Lounge" advertised on ocean mayas website which looks very picturesque is actually in the process of being built. Nothing like a bit of false advertising!!!! 6. As much as we loved the pools the music. My god! The same CD was played over and over again! I think if I hear Adeles, rolling in the deep one more time... I'll shoot myself. 7. The Walls at this hotel are redicilously thin!! We could hear absolutely everything to doors being slammed, clear conversations in the corridoor outside our room, Upstairs walking around sounded like they were actually walking around in our room. I didn't sleep all the way through.... Not one night due to the noise..... The best bit was being woken up at 7.30am to hear next door being violently sick! Lovely!!! 8. The shuttle bus. Ran once a day and held only 20 people! 20!!! The hotel holds the capacity for hundreds so to get a place on that bus was practically impossible. And a pretty pointless service to be honest with you. The points above could have so easily ruined our holiday... And it so almost did. We meet some lovely people at the resort...went in to playa del Carmen, which was lovely! We swam with the dolphins which was an excellent experience which made our holiday. If it werent for these reasons I would have wanted to go home by day 4! My advise to you is go else where, we spent the best of 3k on this holiday and it unfortunately wasn't worth it's money!!! This hotel is no way a 5*... lucky to be classed as a 3 if that. I'd definitely come back to playa del Carmen... But to Ocean Maya - Never Again - overal very disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “All in all = Very good”
Reviews.Author: bigdogohle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days here, at the end of October. It's was a pretty affordable trip, and well worth it. Nice, clean grounds. Rooms were nice also. For the most part, the staff was good too; especially the pool bar. The weather was not very good, but that's no one's fault. The food was average. Not bad, but just nothing great. Not complaining. It was fine for us, but some people get worked up about that. They put coffee out early before breakfast, which I liked. The lobby bar staff = I didn't find as accomodating as others. At check-in they tried to put is in a building that is one of the furthest from.....everything. That took some haggling. Especially since they were only half full. The beach was pretty nice - lagoon a short walk north. Pool area was real nice too. Big pool. Obviously, the best part for me was no kids. All in all, I probably would return.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon bliss”
Reviews.Author: Juliaheartsu
Reviews.Content: Japanese and Mexican restaurants were excellent for food and service. The sports & entertainment team were such fun and so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenSherwood
Reviews.Content: We went here expecting a lot less because of the cost, but were pleasantly surprised to find beautiful grounds, very friendly staff, good food and great entertainment. I would certainly recommend this resort to anyone looking for an unforgettable vacation experience in Mexico. Thank you Amy Jean, Recardo, Omar, Polo and the rest of our new friends. We miss you already. -Lauren S., LeRoy, NY

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Valemafa
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Playa del Carmen! specially staff of animation & sports, Polo & the manager Miguel (cool dude) great people & great food! And the garden is really lovely! I can't wait for my next time! Congrats! Val from NY

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: scdemers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week of Oct 29th-Nov 5th at the Ocean Maya Royale. We got a terrific deal on the hotel's website that included free transfers to and from the hotel. Probably due to the hurricane scare a couple days before we arrived the resort was not very busy. This may have helped us to get such an awesome room right on the beach in building 12. The staff was one of the friendliest we have encountered anywhere. Service was always quick in the restaurants and bars. Standouts for us were Alfredo in the buffet and Rony in the Italian restaurant. The food was average. The beach was perfect for long walks in either direction. The grounds were beautifully kept and our room was always spotless. We are early risers so didn't catch much of the entertainment at night but what we saw was good. Loved the coffee bar but don't understand it opening so late. Our only disappointment was that the Italian restaurant and Margarita lounge that were damaged by fire were not open yet. It looked like a great location for both. The Italian restaurant is now in a makeshift blocked off area at one end of the buffet. Well maybe we'll just have to go back. :) Overall we had a great vacation! If anyone would like to contact me by a PM for a specific question I will try to help.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is great.”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon21
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from 10 nights at this resort. It is lovely. It is painted so bright & cute & the grounds are just terrific. Pools/beach are exceptional clean. The room is a good size & also clean with the maid service one of the best. The mini fridge was always refilled daily. The people that work at this resort are great, friendly & will do what they can to make you stay a great one. We esp. liked Benjamin a really good bartender at the lobby bar and we appreciated Dean, the concierge. The breakfasts were great, lunch so-so, and the evening dining was good with some dishes being really tasty. The Orential grill was fun & the food was good. Drinks was as good as the bartender you found. The only reason to "upgrade" at this resort would be to get an ocean view room. We did not do the massages but heard from quite a few people that they were awesome. We met some great people, shout out to Lovee & Ernesto & to a great group from Spain that were tons of fun. The only thing that I really can say was bad was the poor shape that the pool lounge chairs are in. They really need new ones. Also I dont think the beach is the best to get out in the water but it didnt bother us because we dont do that anyway. The beds in the room were hard but I slept pretty sound most every night. We would come back to this resort, it is small enough that you get to meet everyone around but large enough you can get away by yourselves. We did the free shuttle onto Playa to shop but took a cab back since we finished early. This is a very pretty resort. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip 2011.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I go on a girls trip every year. Our travel agent chose the Ocean Maya Royale for us this year as it was a small resort and a safe resort. We we amazed from the moment we arrived to the moment we left four days later at how "spoiled" we felt. I can not even believe any negative reviews for them. Our room was near the ocean and the pool but still only a short walk to the lobby. Our favorite time of day was our breakfast outside with mimosas every morning at 7:00 am. The grounds were beautiful and the wildlife "fun". Anything you asked for, they provided. The 1 hour massage on the beach was wonderful since we had just returned from Salvatica Extreme Adventure (zip lining....FUN). Best girls trip ever........

Reviews.Title: “relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: xmazx2000x
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed here for 2weeks for my 40th few months back (only just got round to writing review!!!), anyhow, first impressions, BEAUTIFUL. from the entrance lobby, right to the beach. the gardens and pools were immaculate. our room was lovely, clean and spacious, and we were greeted with a bottle of wine and some sweets when we arrived. the bathroom had a huge walk in shower with constant hot water and the towels were changed daily. the only small complaint would be it smelt a bit musty, but it wasnt worth mentioning since we only changed and slept there really. what can i say about the food? stunning!!, we never had a bad meal in any of the restaurants. my partner loved the mexican so we had quite a few meals here, very nice lunches and right next to the pool so suited us. i had the best ever steak dish at the italian, and we had .one of the best nights at the japanese where we were entertained while the chef cooked our meals in front of us!!! buffet restaurant was lovely too, the mini gateaux were the best. the staff all do a fantastic job, very polite and very helpful, some people complain about queing for drinks? if you are polite and tip them a couple of dollars your glass will never be empty, and remember manners don't cost anything!! learning a few basic phrases in spanish, good day, please, thankyou, goes a long way too. the pools and beach were spotless, yes some days there was quite a lot of sea weed near the shore, but thats not the hotels fault. they did there best to remove it all the time. the boys at the pool bar and waitresses that often took your orders from you on the beach were fantastic. we mostly went to the beach near the quieter pool, we didnt find the music loud as others have said, and we always got a sunbed without putting towels down at the crack of dawn. we did a couple of trips that thomsons offered and i think they were value for money. i did the swim with dolphins trip, FANTASTIC, included was swimming with sting rays and sharks approx 90 pounds. we also did the mini speedboats(snorkelling included) in cacuun, in what can only be described as being in a huge troppical aquarium (i had fish taking sea weed from my hand), we also did the jet ski's from maya's own beach.you can also get a taxi from reception to playa del carmen if you fancy an afternoon or night out, cost about 10 pounds each way. they have some nice souvenirs, you will get a little hassled, but a stern no-thankyou will see you right! the weather was very hot and humid, so the odd storm was very welcome, theyd last about 20mins then it was back to sunshine again. would i recommend ocean maya? YES absolutely, we would go back tomorrow, thankyou for an amazing holiday, it was the best!!!! xx

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: barnaclejo
Reviews.Content: No idea why the negative reviews on here! just came back from a week's honeymoon yesterday, and the whole week was perfect! resort is beautiful, location is amazing, staff lovely! the shuttle bus to playa doesnt matter. take a short walk off the resort, cross the road, and get the public transport for 20 peso each. or stay on the resort side for cancun for 30. the local wildlife is amazing. take a bread roll from the buffet, just to feed bits to the coatis and racoons! thank you ocean maya royale for my perfect honeymoon. xx

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great entertainment staff Polo and Ricardo”
Reviews.Author: BrianWanda
Reviews.Content: We are premium members, We stayed Oct 1-15 2011. The staff at this hotel make the vacation worth it. From the time we arrive you are met by Lois Miguel he is great. The bar staff benjamin will get your drink right every time. In thr Hacienda restaurant you have Alfredo at in the main restaurant and Rubi Esmeralda in the privlege they enjoy there job so much and it shows. At the beach you have Azucena she is great. If you are going to Cancun please bring baby cloths for azucena as she is expecting a baby girl in feb. As for the entertainment staff they make your day, Polo and Ricardo are the best the hotel have they spend time getting to know you and you get to know them. They say they are not brothers but I tend to think otherwise. The food was great lots to pick from allways left happy. We foundthat the wine at supper was not very good but all the rest was great. Beach was warm and sand was great very clean.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic overall holiday experience”
Reviews.Author: glendkan
Reviews.Content: You do expect some rain at the end of October! not a tropical storm! The hotel was finominal with the time and effort to make us safe from an expected Hurricane. This was one of the many highlights. The last two weeks of October gave us sun, beach and good food from restaurants without a visit limit. The food could have been hotter in the Buffet, but then that's the same throughout the world. Entertaining at the Japanese, and Mexican...ask for the Mayan Coffee there and you get a demonstration of flamed liquers from jug to jug and into glass!! Rooms were large, two 4ft beds, but only an outlook onto the jungle! But very quiet. A great selection of sunbeds on the beach, by two pools or under the palm tree; near the entertainment or quieter parts of the seafront area. The Entertainent team did a fine job, but did not perform every evening as Gerald R intimated. On several nights there were shows from local professionals of Mexican dancing, Astec and Mayan traditional dancing. Franie and Omar were very friendly and great entertainers, working very hard all day and night as did all the waiting and bar staff. Day trips from Thomson seemed very expensive at £60 - £70, but were all inclusive and with excellent guides who were freindly and very knowledgable about their subjects. best trips were: Chichen Itsa, Coba and the Mayan Village and Tulum and snorkelling in Turtle Bay. The hotel needs to look at a shuttle bus to Playa de Carmen as one small bus leaving at 12.30 and coming back at 5.30pm is not enough for a large hotel! We shall certainly go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and value”
Reviews.Author: WTBONE
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale (OMR) last week. The entire staff was pleasant and anxious to keep us happy. Just to name a few, Hosea at the buffett, Omar at the activity desk, Javier at the pool bar and the girl that serviced our room Anatolia. Everyone met us with smiles and enjoyed serving us. Everyone was great. We have stayed at "fancier" resorts but this resort was a solid performer and gave us a very comfortable vacation with a very reasonable price. We paid $1634(USD) for 7 nights and that was with non stop flights out of Atlanta. I would rate the OMR a solid 4 out of 5. The resort could improve by replacing the worn out beach/pool loungers, some of the food was not kept warm, and the beer in the room was lousy. Not much to complain about and for sure did not ruin our vacation. When I read the bad reviews I just thought those people were expecting too much and probably impossible to please. The gardens are beautiful and well maintained. Be sure to take some Avon Skin-so-soft for the misquitos. The mangroves (natural areas) harbour the pesky creatures. The pools are crystal clear. The resort was only at 40% occupancy. Not sure if it was because of Rina or the end of the hurricane/rainy season. The weather was very good, 80's in the day and high 60's at night. Only had one rainy day. We really enjoyed the racoons. They will approach you in search of food. Do not be afraid. They will take the food gently from your hand. There was one racoon that camped out at the restaurant at the pool and looked like he was well fed. Please show respect for them. They were there long before the resort was. We did not join the Privilege Club because it sure would not have been worth the extra expense, in our opinion. We politely declined the Privilege and the offer to the time share presentation and was not approached again. The food was more than acceptable. We did the Italian and the Japanese and enjoyed both. The buffett had a decent variety and was good every meal. Look at the "special" at the buffett. It is different every night and was very good when we tried it. I must say that we are not picky eaters. We would not hesitate to stay at the OMR again. It was a comfortable, relaxing vacation for us. We had no problems with the resort and its offerings. The new no kids rule made the stay even better. If you are lookin for a nice resort for a ,in our case, reasonable price the Ocean Maya Royale is for you!! A very nice resort with a pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “OCEAN MAYA ROYALE”
Reviews.Author: swift33
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel, although 5* rated I would say a good 3*-4*. All the staff are excellent, friendly, well mannered, polite and happy!! The rooms are large and fairly well equipped, eg fridge, coffee maker, large flat screen TV, some toiletries, and iron + ironing board! If you don't like wild life then book a first floor villa as the animals roam around although we enjoyed seeing them. The swimming pools are kept clean, you use the hotels beach towels, so, no need to bring any. Three choice restaurants - Oriental, Mexican, Italian plus the Hacienda -the self service. We tried them all and I have to say in each the hot food was only luke warm, which was ashame as the choice was magnificent. Probably would be better if they provided less choice but made it hotter. The animation team were superb great shows in the evening. Yes, this hotel is quite isolated, so no where else to go in the evenings without getting a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie L
Reviews.Content: I spend the last week of october at this hotel and I had the best of times. Everybody there was amazing especially when we were about to face a hurricane. Everything was done to make the place safe and enjoyable for everyone. The entertainment teams was great and fun. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M
Reviews.Content: On September 9th 2011 we travelled with First Choice to Playa Del Carmen, Mexico and stayed in the Ocean Maya Royale by H10. On arrival to the hotel our luggage was carried straight from the coach transfer cabin to our rooms. Check in was fast and easy and a hotel representative showed us around the resort and took us to where we were staying. Our immediate impressions were fantastic. Having never been to Mexico before, we didn't know what to expect. It is true to say that we were pleasantly surprised; the grounds were spotless, kept well and beautiful. The resort is enshrouded in lush gardens and waterfalls and is inhabited by exotic birds, iguanas and racoons. All of which are very friendly and cute. On arrival to our room we were impressed with not only the cleanliness but also the standard of the room itself. The bed was huge, comfortable and spotless. There are plenty of conveniences such as towels and toiletries and there's also a large plasma TV. The marble floor does well to keep the room cool in the hot, humid climate and the air conditioning was faultless. We were staying in room 3032 on the ground floor, which has a balcony with table and chairs and is only 2 minutes walk from the pool, beach, restaurants, bars and nightlife on the resort. Finally, the shower was great, plenty of hot water. In terms of daytime entertainment or relaxation I think this hotel has the perfect balance. There are two large pools, equally as well kept and inviting, one quiet with a relaxing atmosphere and another for daytime activities with music and a swim-up bar. Being a young couple in our twenties we opted mostly for the activity pool. The staff were very entertaining, we played water volleyball almost everyday and sometimes tequila volleyball (not for the faint-hearted). The swim-up bar was great with plenty of staff and amazing drinks even for non-premier customers, you must try their gin fizz and mud lights cocktails. However, if you wanted a quieter, more relaxing option then the other beach was perfect. Situated at the rear of the premium beach and still only one hundered yards from the poolside bar, it is quiet and peaceful. As well as this, the beach is merely 10 steps away from the pool. We experienced the idyllic white sands and turqoise waters of Mexico's coastland and often took bread into the sea to feed the jumping angel fish. The beach was clean and the waters warm, when we walked along the stretch of sand past other resorts to visit the lagoon we found that ours was certainly the best maintained, others laden with sandbags and seaweed. In terms of the food on offer we were slightly hesitant and anxious given some of the poor reviews on Trip Advisor. Given this, we truely don't understand what expectations these people had before going here, the food was fantastic. I have never had so much choice and variety as I did on this resort. For breakfast there is a buffet in the main lobby. There are cereals, yougurts, fresh fruit, smoothies, pastries, omlettes, english breakfasts and any drink you could desire. There are four restaurants; Japanese, Mexican, Italian and a buffet. On our first night we went to the Mexican, we were greeted with banana cocktails which were constantly topped up and we chose from an extensive menu of tarditional Mexican dishes. The food was served quickly, looked great and tasted even better. During the day we mostly ate here, simply because the food was great and it is situated so close to the pool. However, on evenings we ventured to the others. The Italian was nice, but the Japanese was our favourite with a more adventurous menu. We only stayed one week in Mexico, regrettably, therefore we were limited as to what excursions we could take. Our main trip was to Xtreme Adventures Cancun, an adventure park about 40 minutes drive away from the resort. This is great for active people, the visit includes zipwiring through the jungle, quad biking, jumping from a cliff into a beautiful lagoon with trpoical fish and concludes with an underground cave; the most idyllic place of all. Evening entertainment was superb. There was professional salsa dancing, a history of Mexican culture night, karaoke and we were fortunate enough to be there during the week of Mexican independence day. On this night there were food stalls, decorations and a dancefloor, all outdoors. In conclusion, we thoroughly enjoyed our week in Mexico. Above all else, what made our stay was the people. The staff were fantastic, attentive and more than happy to help with any enquiries. On one occasion I had lost my ticket for an excursion we were going on. We were really disappointed because this meant that we couldn't go, but, at the very last minute one of the waiters from the breakfast service ran over to us with the ticket. This demonstrates just how great they were. We met many people from all over the world and some from closer to home. We couldn't have hoped for better people, staff, rooms or amenities than we had. For this reason we are already booking up for next year, and this time for two weeks. We look forwards to a truely faultless and memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: Casey R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there the first week of October for our 5th anniversary and had a great time. I read a review which complained about noise from the pool but we were staying in the room closest to the pool bar and all of the pool activities and we weren't bothered at all by any outside noise. If you decide to go you will meet many delightful people. Alfredo, Susanna, Rudy, and Amy Jean were a few of our favorites. I'm not good with names so I have forgotten a few but I was suprised by how far the staff would go out of their way to make us happy. Susanna gave us a staff umbrella when all of the other umbrellas were gone and another girl booked us a romantic dinner for two without us giving her proper notice because we decided we wanted to do it our last night there. The staff was great and I just wish that I had more money so that I could have tipped tham all. You can't book an ocean view room online but they were more than happy to give us one at no extra charge when we got there. It was actually considered a downgrade from our priviledge suite but it was more than adequate for us. If you want to go shopping I recommend going to Cancun which will cost you $90 - $100 round trip in a taxi and you can rent a car at the resort for about the same price for 24 hours. Make sure you let your bank know that you are leaving the country if you don't want your debit card frozen and I would still take an extra Visa or Mastercard just in case. The only thing we didn't like was the timeshare presentation. They gave us $100 to sit through it but it wasn't worth it to give up our vacation time. I advise anyone going to Mexico not to take any special deals or money at the airport or the resort to sit through a presentation or "resort tour". Other than that it was a great experience and I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gerald R
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Ocean Maya Royale where we stayed for two weeks (last two weeks in October). Having visited Cancun before, we wanted somewhere quieter and more relaxing and we were influenced in our choice by the claim on the OMR's website that there was a 'calm and exclusive atmosphere'. Nothing could be further from the truth thanks to the incessant racket coming from the poolside bar which effectively ruined our holiday. We were not aware in advance, but the theory here is that there are two pools - a 'quiet' pool and a 'crazy' pool. The further theory is that the noise and activities are restricted to the 'crazy' pool. What absolute nonsense. The two pools are less than five meters apart and the dreadful music can be heard - loudly - fifty meters away on the beach! So, 'quiet' pool - not a chance. And, this stuff is not background music. Example, 'Boom, Boom. Come Up To My Room' was one of the staff's favourites. This is the root of the problem. The two poolside bar staff and the animations team are allowed to play this rubbish - at 1,000 decibels - because they think that it is 'cool' and clever. The average age of the guests during our stay would have been mid fifties, the average age of the 'poolside crew' would be mid twenties. Unfortunately, there was also a hard core of younger, typically American guests who hogged the poolside bar. The hard core changed every few days as they were usually there for 2-3 days to 'party' (not sure why they didn't go to Cancun?) but there was always this handful who seemed to give the 'poolside crew' all the encouragement they needed. Not that the poolside bar staff or the animations people needed much encouragement. We complained repeatedly about the volume of the music and occasionally got a half hour's respite but that was about it. There was one corner of the beach, about 100 meters away from the two pools, where it was just about possible to escape the racket but that was next to the construction site of the 'Margarita Lounge'. (To be honest, construction noise was actually an improvement on 'Boom, Boom. Come Up To My Room'). This incessant racket quite literally ruined our holiday. It is utterly beyond belief that a small group of junior staff can be allowed to dictate so much of the customer experience - and destroy that experience. This is complete self indulgence on the part of these junior staff - however - they are being allowed to get away with it by the Management of the Hotel who really should get to grips with this issue. The Management need to make up their mind about the customer base they are pitching at. Is it Club 18-30 or 'calm and exclusive'? Right now they seem to be caught between two stools. It is a real shame because the OMR has a lot going for it, not least almost all the other staff, who are great. We say 'almost all' because there is one really sleazy guy whose job is to try to sell massages and spa treatments but who is a real pest and won't take 'no' for an answer. Other than this really sleazy guy and the 'poolside crew', though, the rest of the staff can't do enough for you. They are always cheerful, friendly and obliging - and extraordinarily hard working. Never more so than when the resort was hit by a tropical storm for two days during our stay and the staff had to 'batten down the hatches'. The staff could not have done more to ensure our safety and well being and that is greatly to their credit. (Mind you, listening to 75 mph winds for a couple of days was eminently preferable to listening to 'Boom, Boom Come Up To My Room'.) So, the staff, for the most part, were great. The Hotel's location and grounds are also huge assets. The grounds are lovely and beautifully maintained, again, by a cheerful and hard working group of grounds staff. Our room was OK, other than its location didn't have much of a view or get much sun but that's the luck of the draw. It was well appointed (though only one mirror - in the bathroom - and not full length - should be addressed) and clean, thanks to our charming and very obliging maid. Our other big issue was the food, which ranged from bland to downright awful (two successive 'Chef's Specials' completely inedible). Superficially, there seemed to be plenty of choice, with a large range of food on offer in the Main Restaurant, and the further options of the Italian, Mexican and Japanese a la carte restaurants (though they were occasionally closed) but, again, the food was awfully bland and repetitive. The two best meals we had in the fortnight was lunch in Playa del Carmen at an authentic Mexican restaurant and dinner in Cancun at a fabulous Argentinian restaurant. Also, the standard wine on offer was undrinkable but we overcame this by insisting on getting the wine on offer to 'Privilege' clients. Unfortunately, this has affected our 'drinks rating' as it otherwise flowed freely and some of the cocktails on offer were great. Two other minor issues. First, only one shuttle bus per day to Playa del Carmen, taking a maximum of 20 people, was not enough. Given that the Hotel really is in the middle of nowhere, this service should be round the clock. Second, the evening entertainment is of a very rudimentary nature. Basically, it is the animations team dressing up in different costumes every night and making a lot of noise (which is their core competence.) Overall, therefore we were terribly disappointed - we did not get the 'calm atmosphere' which we had expected and we thought that the food was poor. This Hotel is not 5 star. Thomson's (the UK Tour Operator) are right to rate it 4T - and that's maybe even a stretch). It's a shame because, as we have said, the Hotel does have a lot going for it - not least (most of) the staff and we feel sorry to be so scathing as most of them work so very hard - BUT - they are being let down by their poolside colleagues and the standard of the food. We will not return and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “the staff work so hard and the place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a ten day stay at this amazing hotel. All we can say is the staff did their best to make sure we were well taken care of. The food in the three restaurants was excellent and the buffet was always good. No complaints about the drinks and we never had to wait long to get served. There are kayaks, sailing catamarans, wind surfing and good entertainment at night. When tropical storm RINA arrived the staff did a wonderful job of battening down the hatches so to speak and afterward it was cleared up so fast we were hardly aware that all this preparation had even taken place. The landscaping around the whole hotel grounds is immaculate and meticulously taken care of. We will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jandslee
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous, with clean beach area and plenty of sun beds Food is varied and excellent Staff are friendly and eager to please and always smiling We stayed in one of the honeymoon suites, only because this was the best room available, which I have to say was rather disappointing and on the small side compared to what one would expect for a suite Priviilege area is standard for all suites and is a lovely touch especially when gaining access to the 4 restuarants, which can be rather crowded at times and require standing in a queue on some nights, but I would like to point out that there are only 7 balinese sun beds and 43 privilege suites on the privileged beach area, you do the maths. There are however, plenty of other single sun loungers with large comfortable cushions There is the option to up grade your stay to privilege without the necessity to upgrade your room at a cost of approximately 25 USD pppn I would recommend if you are planning on visiting Chichen Itza to choose the flight option, it is more expensive, we travelled in a group of 4 people and had our own guide and were whisked through the small regional airport without any fuss or queues This is an adult only hotel for the moment however there was talk of reverting back to a family hotel if the adult only option is deemed to be not as lucrative This is wonderful hotel and I would recommend to future guests without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “magic holiday”
Reviews.Author: patsy62
Reviews.Content: We were here for a family wedding, it was superb, several restaurants with great food. We had gone all inclusive , so it was like a dream lying by the pool and having a range of cocktails offered. Staff were friendly and entertainment every night.
