It is a little like a compound and you do not get a feel of being in Mexico , tho there is a small town near that you can get a taxi to, but it is really for the tourists. If you want a relaxing time and to get away from everything this is an ideal place.

Reviews.Title: “Friends' Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JonnyLancaster_PA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 1-week stay at the Ocean Maya Royale. The resort is clean, modern, and full of happy employees. We stayed October 22-29. The resort was not full so we didn't have any trouble finding empty recliners on the beach or by either pool. The food was good but got boring very fast. There are plenty of options for a few days at the buffets (breakfast and lunch) but the options never change so by day 3 or 4 it starts getting old. The dinner restaurants are alright, but nothing to write home about. The coffee shop is pretty slick...Mocha Frappe por favor! If you are traveling as a group and booking online you might want to get private transportation to and from the airport. With a group of 4 or more this is usually cheaper than going with the generic cattle vans most of the websites recommend. We used Famar transfers and got a private Suburban for $35/per person round trip. We didn't do the privlege upgrade and from what I could tell - it wouldn't have been worthwhile.Then again, the resort wasn't full so maybe in busier seasons it would be worth it. All in all - a great trip! This place is dirt cheap compared to other all inclusives in the area. We didn't pay a lot and didn't go in with 5 star expectations and we weren't disappointed. It's a great "bang for the buck" resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, lovely staff, amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: LoubylouRochdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya from 8/10/2011- 23/10/2011 and enjoyed our stay very much. The room was clean and we booked an ocean view which was more than worth the extra money we paid. The view was beautiful. We had thought we would upgrade to privilege once we arrived but decided it wasn't worth it so we spent the money on some fantastic trips. We rarely waited for a restaurant table and even when we did it was no more than 15 minutes. The staff worked tirelessly to keep the place clean and the bar staff made sure we had drinks, especially worth a mention is Imelda who constantly smiled and kept the drinks flowing. The waiting on staff in the dining areas were good some better than others, another mention is Alfredo who always smiled and made us feel special. The food was varied and plentiful but a little on the cold side sometimes, depending on what time we ate. My favourite restaurant was the Mexican, mainly because of it's decoration and location. I loved the saxophonist in the dining room, he always had a smile and a wave for me and what a joy eating breakfast to the sultry tones of the sax and the haunting tunes on the flute. We read a lot of negative reviews about the beach......all I can say is I don't know where they came from. The beach was clean, plentiful sun beds and the sea was lovely. The evening entertainment was exceptional, the animation team worked really hard day and night to make sure there was plenty to see and do. Especially Ricardo.....the small pool had something going on all day, volley ball, aqua aerobics, games etc and the swim up bar was fab. The cocktails were amazing especially the banana margueurita and strawberry daiquiri. The gardens were immaculate and the wildlife was a joy to see every day. All in all Ocean Maya was a lovely resort, I would definitely recommend it to anyone who want to visit Riveira Maya. We would definitely go back for a return visit. It was great not having children around as well. We had a couple of little niggles about the room which were dealt with instantly when we commented.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Vacation”
Reviews.Author: druannehall
Reviews.Content: The OMR was an outstanding resort. In my opinion it is at least a 5 star. We stayed 10/15-10/22 and despite the first 2 days of rain,had a great vacation. The staff and hotel grounds were beyond our expectations. From the buffet Alfredo and Alberto were the best. The lobby bar Nacho and Benjamin worked very hard to make our drinks special.The beach/pool waitress(name?) gave exceptional service. We got room service a few nights and I would recommend the veggie wraps.Omar brought our food quickly despite the downpour with friendly service. We ate at the mexican restaurant and loved the beef filet. At the italian we had cheese ravioli and liked that as well.We did not have reservations at either place and got right in.The buffet had a variety of food that was delicious. We miss our new friends Alberto and Alfredo at the buffet.We do not have service like this in the U.S. The shuttle to Play Del Carmen was nice for an afternoon of shopping. You need to make reservations the day before at the tour desk. We met people from England, the 4 friends from Canada, anniversary family from Canada, Gary and Michelle from PA, and hey U.K and many more. It was nice talking with all of you! This was my 6th time to the area and would love to return to the OMR.We liked the adults only aspect.The ocean water was not clear due to the storms that they had. They worked hard daily cleaning the seaweed and debris from the beach and always with smile.Take a 15 min. walk to the left of the beach to the lazy river lagoon.It is worth the walk.Seeing resorts along the way,OMR was the nicest. I did not see the need to upgrade to privileged. Our room 3608 was an ocean view second floor.They are rebuilding the italian restaurant so the construction was a bit noisy but not enough to spoil our vacation.Our friends had ground floor ocean view in 3601. They got alot of wildlife on their patio from coatis to raccoon.Our building was right by the beach and pool area and quiet at night. We traveled through Apple Vacations as I had in the past and were very displeased with the service. We spent much time looking for our rep at the tour desk as he was never there during posted hours.However this does not reflect on the resort itself as we will not use Apple in the future. We would definitely return to OMR or go to any of the H10 resorts.It was a wonderful much needed vacation. I was leery going after reading negative reviews but all resorts have those.Some people obviously can not be pleased. Feel free to email me with any questions at druannehall@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Mexican Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Aaron C
Reviews.Content: Over all the resort was lovely, it was clean friendly and well appointed. Highlights are the beach and pool area as well as the proximity to downtown Playa. I would go back to this resort but I am all about balanced feedback ... so here it is. Did Well's Transportation to and from airport Building and landscaping Rooms and pool area Staff was very social and friendly After walk the beach (in both directions for about 5 resorts) this resort was by far the best Easy cab (20$ USD each way) or shuttle to downtown Playa Free Wi-Fi in the lobby Areas of improvement Food! The 'Mexican' restaurant was bland and nowhere near as good as you can get in town. Yet again the resort is catering to the lowest common denominator of travelers to Mexico. I've had better Mexican food in Vancouver - is all I'm saying! The 'Japanese' restaurant was really just a Chinese restaurant with Japanese styling - the food was good for what it was, rice and veggies! The 'Italian' restaurant, well, do I need to say anymore - good but come on, who goes to Mexico for pasta! Pool chairs - they are in desperate need for new seating around the pool - go early to get a good spot! Swim up bar - Let's put aside the fact that there's always someone sitting there who can somehow not move from their seat all day while drinking (you know what I'm talking about). The reason to avoid this particular swim up bar has less to do with the urine count in that part of the pool and more to do with the fact that it's too loud and bar staff are never there. If you’re choosing this resort please bring some CDs with new poolside appropriate music ... they need to update their playlists!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation is what you make of it”
Reviews.Author: milaurie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just recently returned from the OMR our stay was Oct 5th- oct 11th. We enjoyed our stay and met some great people. We were in cube 9 room 903 that had ocean view. I had wrote in advance and let them know that it was both our birthday and aniversay and they set us up in a wonderful room. Within 45 min of arrival a plate of little pastries and bottle of tequilla showed up for special day and on my actual birthday a cake and bottle of wine. My husband and I both loved the property very much in our room we had the stock fridge, great selecton of toiletries (razor, toothbrush, comb, mouthwash, bodywash, shampoo, shoe shine and sewing kit) couch and chair balcony chair and table and roomsafe. We booked throught delta vacations so we recieved orange wrist bands which did give us the opportunity to make reseveration at the special resturants, we never did. We never had any problem to getting in if if we wanted to go. We were not huge fans of the food but we did not go hungry, however we did not gain weight. I did not find it warm in the resturant so they may have fixed that. I really don't know how to say this but I have to, I have been to mexico six times and I have not read so much as I have here on the poor behavior of americans and canadians. Really lets get past that this is vacation and the party team runs around and gets ppl involved in lots of games and fun. In six years of comming to in all inclusive have I have seen the hotel manager and hotel security come down to the pool, but this did happen for a group of people from across the pond, I am not going to get into details because it would not be fair to them. What I am trying to say is this is a vacation spot and set up to cater to having fun. We had a great time with our freinds we met from everywhere and never once did I sit back and think anything diffrent with the good time brought to a hault because of an incident that was not americans or canadians. We did however say that if he had to pay for what he had done we would help him out because I was unfortunate. With all that being said I would like to say on the most part this is a fairly calm place and yes they do have tequila vollleyball, contest in the pool and loud music and they do allow women to sunbathe topless. It is what it is and that is why this is a vacation and why we have trip advisor do your research and know before you go. The grounds are awsome I love the sidewalk that go all the way through this place we were almost as far as you could get for the resturants but that was great. We had the beach right off our balcony. The wild life is great too. My husband and I would like to thank the staff and hotel management for the wonderful time we had. Javier at the bar and edwardo the spa guy you to need a vacation, you guys have great people skills. For the price I don't think you can go wrong, I came here for 1 reason and 1 reason only to relax have a good time and meet great people Success

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: goedike
Reviews.Content: Just came back and can't wait to go back! The most beautiful beach, beautiful vegetation, amazingly clean inside and out, great food, good entertainment, friendly staff, they really cover everything! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, awful food”
Reviews.Author: Brimberly
Reviews.Content: I visited the Ocean Maya Royale in September 2011 on a girls trip. We found an excellent deal - 3 nights for less than $200 at this all inclusive resort. When we arrived to the property, we were greeted with smiles and cocktails. We instantly knew this would be a great vacation. The staff were pleasant and eager to serve. The grounds were immaculate and our suites were fabulous. Unfortunately the food was less than desirable (and there was something weird about the juices - kinda had a nutrasweet after taste). Of course since it was all inclusive and in the middle of nowhere, we were stuck with the resort food. We dined at each of the property's restaurants - japanese, italian, and mexican. They just couldn't get it right at any of the restaurants. We resorted to dining on french fries for most of our stay. Another negative was the location. The resort is sort of in the middle of nowhere and a taxi ride to most nearby locations are $20 per person each way. I recommend this property, however, be prepared for less-than-desirable food and funny tasting juices. And be prepared to spend some dough to venture off the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me???? This is an excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jordyn1
Reviews.Content: First, let say that I have been traveling to the Riviera Maya area for almost 25 years now. Long before the Resorts started to pop up everywhere. I have therefore stayed at quite a few of the long list of Resorts along the strip and I can only say that this Resort is one of the finest I have ever stayed at. So much so I am coming back next week for another week! I met the second in charge, Maria Lopez several years ago while staying at The Ocean Coral up the road towards Cancun and stayed there several times over the years and was always treated with the best care, service and kindness anyone could expect! I found out that Maria was promoted to The Ocean Mays and wanted to try it out. There are no disappointments with this Resort at all! There are always going to be the people that have bad things to say, and quite frankly I will say this. I agree with some of the complaints but for a reason! Folks, this is "MEXICO", not The Turks & Caicos Islands or St. Lucia! I have always felt that that people just want to compare this to their 'Best" vacation ever and forget to realize that in Mexico things are a little different! I will tell you this, I don't care if you stayed at Secrets, The Iberostar chain or any other Resort, they all have their issues. As they should. They employ hundreds of people and with that comes things that just happen. I however have found the staff and management at The h10 resorts to bend over backwards for everyone! If you need something, just ask for Maria! I will guarantee she will do whatever she can to make your stay warm and inviting! Food complaints. Listen. Try cooking for 1200 people or more and hope you satisfy everyone all of the time. Not going to happen! However, I am a picky eater and always found something to fill up on and 9 out of 10 times it was always very good. The drinks are not watered down and further more, I felt they were better than most places. If ytou go with an open mind and don't expect this to be Sandals, you will have a great experience! The rooms are great, the pools are wondereful, it's adult only, the beach is supurb and the entertainment staff are always fun! Just be realistic and you won't find many down here that compare. remember everyone has an off day or week. All Resorts no matter what the cost fail to meet to everyones expectations all the time. Besides, look at the majority of te reviews and you will see most poeple agree with me, not the nay sayers...... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Mexican Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Capital Scot
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the glorious heaven that is Ocean Maya Royale. I read reviews before I went and have only one thing to say....where were you staying???. This place was beautiful and the staff without exception were so warm and friendly and so helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and the Spa girls looked after me supremely well....especially Diana who worked her magic on my injured shoulder. The Restaurant staff including Manager Pedro Pech and his boys Alfredo, Jose Ramon Perez, Manuel and Alberto. The Bar staff inc Nacho, Jorge and Benjamin. Also the Animation Team especially Amy Jean and Fernie. Dulce at Reception was fab too and they all helped me practice my limited Spanish. Claudia V our room maid did a supreme job of keeping the place spotless despite the intense humidity. I truly admire that lady. The patience of all the staff in dealing with loud rude and totally lacking in respect from visitors from North America and Canada was to their great creditability. I very nearly had to point out to some people just how ignorant they were...however I am a proud Scot and know how to represent my Country and not let it or myself down. Also I have to mention the "wild animals" which some North Americans complained about...these were little racoon type creatures which were timid and just came round by the restaurant area at the pool.They never bothered anyone except stupid people who should have known better. There are also some iguanas at the stunning water feature and all they do is sit and bask in the sun or hide when it rains. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and am not easily influenced I may say. I intend to return there soon but this time take my friends to share what a piece of heaven I found in Mexico. Please read and enjoy my review. I am happy to give more info if you contact me. Take care everyone Happy travelling

Reviews.Title: “Defo be going again”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: What a warm and welcoming feeling when you enter this hotel, the staff are excellent, smile and very helpful. The room was wonderful, clean, bright and in a nice area of the grounds between the sea and main buildings. The food can not be faulted in any way, beef/chicken/tuna etc cooked right in front of you to your choice, the buffet just overfaced you there was that much and the puddings were lovely. Mexican at El Charro was wonderful and make sure you try the Maya coffee the display from the waiter was wonderful (make sure you take your video camera to film it) we had a romantic meal out by the pool for our honeymoon just outside this restaurant and it was a fantastic meal and the chef came out to us to chat as well. The Italian was nice as well, I cannot comment on the Thai restaurant as we did not go into this one as we don't eat fish, but after talkin to other people near the end of our holiday about this, they said we should have gone in to see the show as there was other things on the menu as well and it was well worth it for the experience (next time we will). The staff in the whole place smiled all the time which made you smile and they all said hello to you, even the gentlemen doing the gardening stopped to say hello to you as well. We cannot fault anything with this hotel and will be coming back here again one day.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “So much promise, such poor follow through”
Reviews.Author: JosephNancy
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that We're comparing this to Secrets Capri which is the resort right next door. We spent our honeymoon there and our first anniversary at the Ocean Maya. Five nights with airfare to Secrets $2100, to Ocean Maya $1700. Just as a basis to start. The rooms are nice. They are in square two-story buildings with four rooms per floor. This means fewer shared walls, and some appreciable seclusion. We never once even heard our neighbors. Rooms are clean for the most part, but when we tried to get soiled stained towels exchanged, we found them hung back up instead. The bed was comfortable and came with a huge assortment of pillows to pick from. Very important since I think a great pillow can make up quite a lot of the difference with a poor mattress. The restaurants. Honestly the restaurants are the bane of this resort. And it isn't for the staff. The staff and servers are hospitable and attentive. They just aren't given much to work with. The food was decently prepared but frequently lacking in signature ingredients. A Margherita pizza with no basil isn't a Margherita pizza. It's just bread with slices of tomato and in this case some funky substitute for mozzarella. Same think goes for a Caprese salad. What's odd here is that my ministrone soup had fresh basil floating in it. The Japanese restaurant was a crushing disappointment. After 5 nights of phenomenal sushi next door at Secrets, the restaurant here is like the truck stop of sushi. Not for the atmosphere, which is really quite nice, as is the Teppanyaki station and service. But the sushi is really, really poor. On top of that we couldn't even order it. If you choose the sit down service it comes as a variety sampler. None of it can be reordered, and the sashimi and nigiri on the menu just aren't available for some reason. This would be something you could overlook except that it was their best restaurant. And somehow still closed 2 days out of the 5 we were there. Mike's coffee shop is great and has a pretty good barrista. The bars are understaffed though. The pool itself is great, as is the deck, and the beach is perfect. The shockingly awful problem here is that guests tend to "reserve" lounges at 6-7am with property or pool towels and not return for most of the day, and the hotel management does nothing to dissuade them. So at 10am, good luck finding anything at all with even some shade. I managed to find one lone lounge in the shade and while pulling another over to join it, had someone claim that since the one next to the original was his wife's, so was the empty one. They put towels and personal affects on it and didn't come back for SIX hours. This was never the case at Secrets. The jacuzzi is part of the spa, and is available for all, but only until 6:30 and has no shade whatsoever. 85F outside, 105 in the jacuzzi? Sounds appealing right? Next door, it's available all day and night and tucked up against the south side of the beach-side restaurant. I was happy to see that H10 has taken this over and made it adults only. Our room at Secrets overlooked the property, and every morning last year the sound of kids running about was unwelcome when trying to leave the world behind. The events put on by the staff every night are fun, and the staff is very passionate about the place, but it seems horribly managed. We had no notice until the day of, what activities were offered, so those were typically missed because we found out too late. You can't get people to participate if they don't know. And you can't shut down half of your restaurants every night and keep a resort full of people happy if they're waiting a full hour for a poorly executed meal. Until I read here that these problems are fixed, I'm not going back. Here or another H10. Oh, as an aside, very European crowd. We didn't meet another couple from the U.S. while there. Which meant that the place felt resort-like rather than like an extension of a Florida/Texas weight-loss center. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: 71Kay
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel, immaculately maintained hotel,gardens & beach. The staff were all lovely & worked hard to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. Our room was great, very close to both the pools & the beach. Great choice of food, nice not having to book for any of the 3 a la carte restaurants. Loved the wildlife in the hotel grounds, especially the racoons that were tame enough to feed. If you like horse riding & care about the welfare of the horses, a visit to Rancho Baxaal is a must. All their horses have been rescued & are very well cared for & loved, book by e-mail before you go, it costs around £45 for an hour & a half ride through the jungle & onto a beautiful beach. Coba is a great trip, if you go this year you"ll still be able to climb the tallest mayan pyramid in the yucatan. We loved our stay at the Ocean Maya Royale & wouldn"t hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Joanna A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 1-7 2011 for our honeymoon. It was absolutely gorgeous. Our room was always cool and kept clean daily, the grounds were immaculate, and the staff were super nice. The food was great too. I loved the fact that this was an adults only resort. We love children, but not when we are vacationing.You also have a choice between a quiet, relaxing pool, a fun activity pool, and of course a great beach. There's something for everyone. Javier at the pool bar is so much fun! He makes the best drinks, we tipped him well (by the way, be sure to tip your waiters and bar tenders! We were appalled by the amount of people who didn't tip) We highly recommend taking a trip to Tulum as well! Pretty cheap, and you'll never forget it. So much amazing history. The only thing we thought it was lacking was an night life. They have fun shows at night, but it would be nice if there was just music and dancing a few nights a week. Other than that, it was an absolutely perfect honeymoon. :) P.S. If you're like us, and on a budget, the place is still totally fun without the privilege bracelet. Either way you go, you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mikey777icc
Reviews.Content: We have very high expectations. The staff at the Ocean Maya were brilliant which set the whole tone for our trip. This started the moment we arrived when my partner was asked about an email enquiry he had sent. The entertainment team were great, especially over three days of bad weather, so thank you Jess, Paolo, Omar and the rest of the team. Pool bar Emer and Javier were entertaining and always smiling. Thanks too to Gema and Azucena at the beach and Alberto and Pedro in the restaurants. Antonio in the Italian was great, as was Manuel in the Mexican. Claudia and the Privelige team were fantastic. rooms were comfortable and kept clean, as were the rest of the hotel grounds. Highly recommended and would look forward to staying here again. The one and only gripe is that Antonio and Benjamin in the main lobby bar were miserable and would have been better as cleaners or in none customer facing roles, both totally unsuited to working behind the bar. Unfriendly and surly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jade B
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Royal Maya was beautiful I went 7-14th of ootober 2011 with my boyfriend. Very clean and the rooms are very modern. Me and my boyfriend stayed in a villa right by the beach so it was east access. There are a few lizards around so if you don't like that type of thing don't go there. The staff are so friendly they make your stay even more better. Do not use pasos american dollar are strongly recommended, also be prepared to give out a lot of tips, it seems to be the way of life in mexico more outside of the hotel then in. 5th avenue was lovely but be prepared to be hounded by guys from the market to get you into their stores, which did become annoying. The only complaint I have is the buffet could have been a little bit better but the other places to eat like the italian one was lovely. Also when u arrive in the airport carry your own luggage to your transfer or exoect to pay a tip and there will be people that offer you package but it is all time share stuff so don't go for it. Me and my boyfriend made that mistake but one of the tour desk staffed helped get our money back so we were lucky. Overall a brillant hotel defo a 5* but even better were the staff

Reviews.Title: “Could not of asked for a better holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lornaforns
Reviews.Content: I dont really know where to start with this all i can say is wow!!! We were a bit sceptical before going to this hotel as some reviews were awful all i can say is that they are a bunch of wierdos ! I have not got one bad thing to say about this hotel. Food was amazing and drinks are plenty,corona on draft is also another beauty. Rooms are fantastic and spotless also very spacious. I always judge a place on the bathroom which was once again spotless. The staff here are superb and can not do enough for you wether that be grounds keepers management or entertainment staff. Entertainers are brilliant Amy,fernanda,nelly,ricardo,omar,miguele and ofc the wonderful polo. Dont listen to the bad reviews this place is incredible, so good infact weve booked to go back in july for three weeks !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday :-)”
Reviews.Author: SC300888
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write a quick review on here as when i had looked on here before going to Ocean Maya Royale some of the comments made me a little nervous however I have just had the holiday of a life time and do not understand why some people feel the need to moan..... ?? The hotel is lovely the grounds are impeccable, as well as the Rooms, Pools, Restaurants and beach which i must say is the best one along the stretch by far !! For what we paid we really couldn’t have asked for anymore , I would defiantly recommend that you do the Jungle Boat Tour it was so much fun along with the "Fat Cat" trip where we snorkelled and saw sea turtles :-) All in all we had did have an amazing holiday and if you are thinking about visiting Mexico I would defiantly recommend you stay at this hotel. Can not fault my holiday one bit I LOVED it !!

Reviews.Title: “Adults Only in Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: PoolSideClub
Reviews.Content: Travel dates 5/29/2011 - 6/4/2011 I'm going to review the resort, not the entire travel experience as some people do which I don't think is a fair assessment of the place in question. My girlfriend and I traveled here for my 30th birthday the end of May 2011 into the beginning of June. When we first pulled up to the hotel lobby we were greeted by the bell boy who took our bags aside while we checked in. Check in was speedy and two fresh made drinks were brought to us immediately. Neither one of us could get over how amazing the inside of the lobby was. Fountains, sculptures, and other decor that was top notch!!! It looked as if it was right out of a 5 star hotel in a movie. We couldn't believe our eyes... I've been to many upscale hotels around Boston, New York, Miami, Napa Valley, Killarney and Dublin Ireland and this one was in its own class. Albeit not really a hotel, the lobby could be compared in that category. Once you exit the lobby you walk by a long infinity edge fountain that is in a courtyard type setting. It is flanked by restaurants and tables and chairs on either side with a set of steps leading down toward the pathways to the "villas" at the end. In between the sets of steps is this gigantic and beautiful set of ponds and waterfalls. It appears as if it is used for weddings and or photo shoots. Very relaxing just to sit and listen to the water and amient music playing around it. Room We arrived at our room and immediately noticed the decor, a mix of modern and what appeared to be traditional Mexican art. Very well staged. The fridge was stocked with beer and soda. The patio had a table and chairs on it. The shower did leak out of the bottom like other people have commented on. Not a big deal, I'm not there to shower all day long. The bathroom sink was a vessel sink which was very modern and easy on the eyes. Overall I wish my master suite at home had some of these amenities. Again, very well thought out, the use of marble tile, glass, and simplistic lines and colors make it very appealing to the senses. The AC was great. The bed was so so. It was a hard bed but I never once complained of my back hurting. We had an upstairs unit so noise was not an issue. We were somewhere in the middle of the ocean maya campus between the beach and the lobby. This actually made sense from a traveling perspective as we never had a long walk to either the pool/beach or the restaurants. Sure the beach was nice to look at but I didn't miss looking at it. If you want to stare at the beach, take a walk there and stare at it. No one is stopping you. The villas aren't tall enough to get that WOW factor of the view of the ocean like a high rise on the beach. Pool/Beach My two favorite places. Before I left I bought my girlfriend and I Bubba Kegs at Wal-Mart. If you don't know what they are google it. I would give it to Javier or Eber at the pool bar and ask for Bacardi and diet coke "muy fuerte" which means very strong! Honestly, I like good alcohol and we didn't do the privileged upgrade. The only thing I was missing out on was some JW Black label, and a couple of other high end scotches. I didn't see any Grey Goose like someone else said they saw. Who cares, absolute, Bacardi, Sky, Smirnoff, Sauza Hornitos, and all the other "premium" liquors were available. Just not the "ultra premium". Ok back to the pool and beach, I got sidetracked. The pool bar was great, I wish there were more seats at it and sometimes it was a little hard for Eber and Javier to know if you were down there, just give a friendly shout up to them. No problem. The pool was nice, the half submerged loungers in one end of the pool bar pool were neat. They have massagers that come on during 30min rotations with the Jacuzzi pump. You'll understand when you see it. The non-pool bar pool was more for relaxing. The beach was awesome. There was service no matter where you sat. The privileged area was no big woop. In fact the whole privilege thing was no big whoop. We never had to make a reservation, wait for a table or the hibachi at the Japanese restaurant. Back to the beach. I was slightly disappointed when I thought I could take the hobie cat out for free as part of the all inclusive. They guy wanted $30 for a one time training fee. I thought this should've been included. I skipped it cause the gf didn't see herself out there for whatever reason. She planted herself under a palapa for most of the days and it was very relaxing when I was under it as well. We never had trouble finding a place to sit on the beach or the pool. Some of the chairs were busted but we just didn't sit in those, obviously. OKAY here's what you should know about the beach, it's a SECRET so don't tell. If you walk towards the ocean and then left down the beach, about 15min later you come to this cold water lagoon that kicks butt!! It's filled with fish and sea life. It's blue and green and fast moving out to the ocean. Once you see the red/brown foot bridge your there. I think it was by Tres rios or a little past it, don't quote me. This was the most scenic place I saw in the Riviera Maya. It's breathtaking, words cannot describe it. There are these dead trees sticking up on the shore line that make for nice photos. You'll see, I promise. Back to the resort beach. There was crud in the water, I know they try hard to keep the seaweed out of it but it’s an ongoing job 24/7. The boardwalk is actually a nice touch, it breaks up the horizon line with a place to stand and admire the beautiful paradise you are currently finding yourself immersed in. Water was warm, drinks were cold, sun was hot, palm trees were swaying, and the vibe was spot on at this beach. The pool was really warm, pool bar was a place to meet people both in and out of the water, and the activity crew worked hard to include everyone. Food Food at the buffet was decent. You have to get creative to find something you'll like. I was on a diet before I went so I stuck to mashed avocado and made a salad with lettuce and some tomatoes. It was very fresh and kept me going. There was lots of fruits, and Mexican dishes like taquitos and chips and salsa. I don't remember everything but I'd give it a solid C+/B-. the restaurants were decent. The Japanese place was lots of fun, food was good too B+/A-. We met a couple there that we still keep in touch with and hung out for the rest of our trip with. The Italian place let me down on one dish they said they would have the first night we were there and neglected to have the rest of our entire trip. Oh well. The food there was good too, B+/A-. Never got to the Mexican place so I can't judge. Coffee place was nice, they had desserts and espresso which was nice after dinner. Charros was more like fast food and fried food. Never ate there, can't comment. It was right next to the pool. Overall experience It was our first time to Mexico. This place impressed the heck out of me. Being an all adults place, I don't think I will ever go anywhere else where kids are allowed when I travel to the Riviera Maya. We met lots of people on their honeymoons and anniversaries. Everyone you talk to who's visiting is enthralled with the place. And to that end so were we. My hat goes off to the staff and their warm hospitality and "hola's" everywhere you go. These people are genuine as it gets. If you didn't like this place you've failed at life already. One last note I'm writing this review because I just booked another trip back here yesterday for next week to celebrate our one year anniversary. Short notice I know, but after doing research of other resorts, my girlfriend and I couldn't find anything to outclass this place. I need to give this place the propper review it deserved several months ago when I should've done it. The Ocean Maya hits all the categories we desire with knockout punches like a prize fighter!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John477
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two weeks at this hotel and it was one of the nicest holidays we have had. The food in all the restaurants was of the highest standard and we looked forward to every meal whether it was in the buffet, Mexican, Italian or the Japanese. Well done Pedro Pech for ensuring all the restaurants were well managed. The hotel must be the cleanest we have ever been in, from the foyer, the grounds, the pool and our room which was cleaned every day. The management and staff were some of the friendliest we have encountered and nothing was too much trouble. The beds in our room two doubles were superb, excellent air conditioning and shower. Two other members of staff need a mention for their dedication and duty - great assets to the hotel, they are Azucera on the beach and Karolina in Mick's coffee shop. Thank you for your excellent service with a smile. We have just two comments to make; change the music now and again. Mexico is famous for its guitars yet all we heard a meal times was background funeral music; Also when taking people to their table in the buffet restaurant please walk round the outside and not through the centre where people are walking with food. The only real downside to the holiday was Thomsons two hour delay going and six hour coming back all Thomsons fault.. and Danny the rep was of no help, but thank you Ocean Maya Royale for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “this is a very good holiday resort pity about the flight over”
Reviews.Author: liftman1
Reviews.Content: we spent two weeks in august at the ocean maya and agree with the other reviews .We found the buffet and 3 al acarte retaurants excellant ,we had tbone steak one night.The only minus is the lack of air conditioning in the main restaurant at night.It was no where near full when we where there so enough sun shade and beds on the beach.The water in the pool was actaully hot so people were lying in it and reading books.The staff on the beach came around in the afternoon replacing the beach towels Rooms were ok and bed comfortable.The staff were very helpful ,and if you ask they will give you proper tea bags at breakfast.A great thing asfar as we were concerned there were no children in the hotel.Cocktails at the bar we varied. The trips cost a minimum £75-£80 each ,the best we went on was the maya village where we climbed the tallest pyramid in mexico.The trip to tulham was a like a trip to the park ,nicely laid out,a bit too tidy and you could not get near the ruins .We combined our trip to tulham with the water park trip were you snorkled, swam into caves ,and a lot more .Didnt like to see the dolphins in captivaty. Weflew with thomson and this is my only complaint .We were given seats on row 47.These must be the most uncomfortable seats on any plane,and after 9 hours we were in agony We await to see what thomson say.If you get these seats at checkin try and refuse them.

Reviews.Title: “READ THIS IF YOU ARE GOING FOR A RELAXING HOLIDAY!”
Reviews.Author: maldives-refugee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two weeks at Ocean Maya. I fully agree with all the good reviews about this hotel. Rooms very nice, Grounds fantastic, food and drink very good, Staff could not be better. Special thanks to the Thomson rep Noe (aka danny devito) he was very helpful. All i would say in warning to anyone looking for a quiet time this is probably not the hotel for you. The hotel has two swimming pools. 1. the small pool with the swim up bar where the majority of the activities take place. The loud rap music starts at 10am and goes on until the bar closes at 7pm, by which time the noise level is increased by the addition of the alcohol fuelled guests (ususaly American) who seem unable to have a conversation without shouting at each other even when the music is not playing. 2. The large pool is supposed to be the quiet poll but unforntunately this is only 10feet from the small pool and there is no escaping the the rap music. In addition this pool also has a speaker system which plays different music to its small relation and only suceeds in increasing the noise level. In my opinion this hotel is bordering on the club 18 - 30 type, so if you like that type of thing then it is probably the perfect place to go. If you want some peace and quiet I suggest you look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cjdLanarkshire
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we were wowed by the fantastic grounds and lobby entrance, it looked amazing. The staff are all fantastic especially Alberto, Viscente and the lovely Acuzena at the privilege section of the beach. To begin with we were upgraded to privilege guest system which meant we were put in privilege accomodation block which was near the kitchen and could be very noisy. Louis Castillo was fantastic and helped secure a move to the honeymoon suite which had a jaccuzzi on the terrace for which we were very grateful. The only complaints we had was that there was a lot of building work being carried out on the privilege section of the beach which did curtail or relaxation somewhat, the food in the buffet was often cold if you did not manage to get there when it was being placed on the counter, however the staff were always willing to bring hot food if you requested it. My personal opinion is that the hotel should ditch the privilige system it does create a two tier system and some people we spoke to said they felt like "peasants" as they were not in the privilege system. The staff also fail to recognise the privilege bands and you need to request the air conditioned areas in the restaurants and the premium drinks. If I was to return to this hotel I would definately not pay the $700 extra to upgrade to privilege for 2 weeks. I do not believe it is good value for money and would not reccommend it. There was a welsh couple there with us who actually requested and got their money back. All in all the staff were fantastic including young Felix and all the animation team, however Alberto our waiter at breakfast and lunch was fantastic as was Acuzena on the privilege section on the beach nothing was too much trouble for her. The manager of the hotel should be very proud of all his staff. Unfortunately he has a very male chauvanistic attitude towards female guests which left a very bad taste in my mouth. A word of warning to guests heading out this month, building work has started on the beach spa and Italian restaurant near the beach and may be noisy with the demolition of the old building and sounds of heavy machinery being heard during the construction of the the new one. Overall had a great holiday and met some wonderful people with whom we hope to meet again. Hotel is in need of air conditioning in public areas as it is very humid, apart from needing new sun beds on the beach and the pool area smartened up its a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this place GREAT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: L W
Reviews.Content: Well, I just returned from the Ocean Maya 2 days ago and I have not had one bad thing to say about it. I was hesitant at first to book our trip b/c I had seen some very mixed reviews. Couldn't be happier that we chose to stay at this resort. It is a smaller resort so everything is close. Buffets are close, pool is close, beach is close. It is not your typical 15 minute walk to go and grab breakfast in the morning. The resort wasn't full when we went, so that made our trip enjoyable as well. It is an adult only resort, so if you have a problem with women being on the beach topless....then you should probably stay somewhere else. We went with a 22 year old, a 31 year old, and a 55 year old.......and we all enjoyed ourselves. We all found things about the resort that we loved. I do not enjoy spending my time in the pool when I go to a place with such a stunnign beach, but others that I went with were in the pool non-stop. The pools are very clean and the temp is awesome. They have activities in the pool every day. Aquasize, water polo, tequila volleyball. The activities that the staff put on are a lot of fun. Polo, Ricardo, Jess, and Omar are fabulous!!!! They are bound to make your trip extremely enjoyable. Always have a smile on their faces and always making it fun for everyone. The swim-up bar is a hot spot and the bartenders are great. javier made our time there so much fun. Again...always smiling. The beach is fabulous. Clean, well maintained and the water is crystal clear here. Nice sandy bottom that you walk out on forever. There are fish that swim up to you while in the water and they are amazing. I am a beach lover and this beach for me...was top notch. It is fairly large for how small the resort is and if you upgrade to priviledged (we did), you can have your very own cabana for the day on the beach. Food was good. I am a failry picky eater and I always found something to eat. The buffets have a wide variety of food and it is always warm and fresh. You can always have fresj meat cooked for you, stir fry's, omelettes in teh morning, eggs.....the sky is the limit. Rooms are fine. Nothing spectacular, but very nice and clean. We had to switch rooms b/c our air conditioner did not work.......but this was no problem at all and they were very apologetic. The grounds are immaculate as well. Anytime of the day you can see someone cleaning, gardening, wiping, etc. They take great pride in the place. The spa was nice. We had a pedicure and massage...both were great. A little pricey, but worth the relaxation. There is wildlife around the grounds as well. Monkeys, iguanas, and coaties (super cute). Entertainment at night was always really good. Something different every evening. We really enjoyed the shows. We were never approached by anyone to buy into timeshares or anything silly like that so I am not sure where those reviews were coming from. All in all, we loved it here and had a fabulous time. I think sometimes people just have one thing set them off and then get into a rut and view everything as bad. Some people are too picky for their own good. We liked it so much that I am planning on going back in December.......if that tells you anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: FranDav
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from an amazing week at this fab hotel, weather was perfect, staff couldn't be more helpful, food was good, really don't know where the bad reviews come from (do these people work for rival resorts??) The gardens are beautiful with plenty of wildlife roaming free, snorkelling was excellent, had some fun at the pool bar and the best massage ever, loved Xel-Ha and Tulum was stunning really didn't want to leave, the atmosphere is very relaxed and we made some really good friends (you know who you are!)

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: hannah-leigh
Reviews.Content: me and my partner and are 2 friends went on the 15th till the 27th off sep was ment to be lotts of rain we only have a cupple of showers it was so hott was amazing food lovely. staff work so hard for so littlr amount off money. staff are so frendly!! we went to barcelo last last year in mexico ocen maya was so much better!! all the staff walk round with a smill and say hello all the time. allways offering drink out. theres so meny activerties you can do there. the grownds are amazing. i would 100% go back agen !!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beleive people where saying bad things about Ocean Maya royale”
Reviews.Author: katy A
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just come home from two weeks out there this morning, i have been reading all those horrible reviews about this hotel well let me tell you all it was pardice never had a problem or a complaint about this hotel, We flew with first choice, they were amazing company and very helpfull, hotel was lovely and couldnt do enough for you, no begging or wanted money all the staff etc were very freindly, it is a lovely country, it is there raining season out there but it only rained 3 times out of two weeks at that was at night it was lovely and hot. so all those people writing bad reviews you must of been at a totaly different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: Returned last week from Ocean Maya Royale Mexico. My partner and I had an exellent time what a chilled out holiday from the moment you walk in we found it so relaxing, informal but very organised. Grounds are beautiful and the wildlife! All the staff work so hard and are really friendly, helpful and always happy to go out their way to assist. Food was a very good standard and plenty of choice. We did manage to go on a couple of excursions which we also really loved and saw a bit of the real Mexico which was a really interesting experience again the guide was fantastic and highly organised. Will definitely return to both Ocean Royale and loved Mexico in general.

Reviews.Title: “A honest review”
Reviews.Author: Nicki D
Reviews.Content: Before i visited this hotel i saw a lot of mixed reviews about the hotel and therefore decided to write my first ever review. On arrival we was greeted by staff with a welcome drink. Check- in took less than 10 minutes and we were at the back of the queue. The porters did take quite a while to bring our suitcases but maybe it just felt like ages because we wanted to get to the beach as soon as possible. I could not fault the room..It was spotless! Our fridge was refilled everyday and the maid done a brilliant job of cleaning our room. The pool was lovely we tended to stay round the quieter pool however you do have to get up early if you want sunbeds with an umbrella as they are limited. The food was good except like most all inclusive some of the buffet was cold however they you can have items cooked for you which we opted for or just get there early. The A la carte restaurants were lovely especially as you do not need to book. By the end of the two weeks i did feel the food was getting a bit samey however i don't know what else they could have provided maybe it was just because i ate so much and had tried basically everything. We went to the spa for a couples massage (it was really good) however probably best to book when you arrive as you are given a 30 percent off voucher. I also had my haircut which i was really impressed with and we used the jacuzzi and steam rooms. My boyfriend used the gym on quite a few occassions and said it was really good. I couldnt fault the hotel at all and the staff were so friendly the only issue i had was the rudeness of some of the tourists. I hardly heard any please or thank you's and felt really sorry for the staff. All in all i loved the hotel, except it is quite a way from cancun and a 15 min taxi from playa del carmen. One day we decided to get the local buses to cancun, it was definately an experience i wont forget. The bus stopped right outside the hotel and we got onto this cramped minibus which was carrying the local mexicans to work and then when we had to change buses to get onto the bus for the hotel zone the locals could not help enough despite the fact we could not speak a word of spainish they showed us where to go and told us which bus to get. It only cost about £5 for the two of us to get to cancun and a cab charges at least £25. I would recommend swimming with dolphins however book this direct with dolphin discovery as it is much cheaper and you still get transport and lunch depending on the programme you pick. Another trip was Xplor if you like adventure and sian Khann was also brilliant. I would definately recommend this hotel and mexico! Hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: elba001
Reviews.Content: The place and staff were absolutely amazing... we are already plannning our trip back. The staff made you feel at home and made it a point to get to know you.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WORRY BE HAPPY- LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: TAMMY I
Reviews.Content: My husband, another couple and another friend just got back from the Ocean Maya Royale and we ALL absolutely LOVED it! I have to be honest...when booking I was skeptical because our other friends chose to go to the Excellence- a 5 star resort but the Ocean Maya Royale was just more affordable for our pockets. The people, the food, the grounds, even the beach was fantastically amazing! I would like to brag about the staff because they did such an amazing job which made everything that much more enjoyable...the bar tenders were awesome and Amy Jean was so cute! And as others have mentioned, it's so neat to meet all the other people vacationing at the resort...everyone was just so cool. Hope to see some of them again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Polo, jess omar n ricardo are stars!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of mexico and it was brilliant, the entertainment staff were fantastic and made us feel at home were a superb laugh and did their best to help! i thought the variety of the shows were very good and found them very entertaining, there was never a dull moment and i would would love to go back again in the near future! i would recommend this place to anyone and would like to say a massive thanks to polo, jess omar n ricardo for making our holiday truely brilliant! i think someone needs to hide ricardos whistle ha!

Reviews.Title: “People and Polo Make the difference”
Reviews.Author: Trevor C
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Playa and we had a blast! I took my GF and our favorite part of the trip was hanging at the pool and interacting with the rest of the hotel community. The coolest thing was how their entertainment staff got the on lookers involved with the games and contest at the pool. My favorite part of the trip was doing water polo, water volley ball, and mexican water aerobics! Its one of those things you have to be there to know how much fun it was! I love interacting with other people and the staff at Maya especially Polo was exceptional! My only complaint was the hard beds, the drinks were sometimes a little too stiff for this texan. See you in a few months! Trevor www.ifbcs.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip to Ocean Maya Royal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: William E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night vacation and wish it could have been another 6 nights. The property was beautiful, the food was good- especially the Italian restaurant. The pool bar was a blast. Bartenders Javier and Eber were awsome. The entertainment staff manager- Miguel was really a great guy, with a great staff trying to keep you busy, relaxed and entertained. They had lots of activities designed to get everyone to know one another. And we met a lot of great people. If you need a good excursion, see Rudi down by the pool area and he will set you up. My wife and I just had the best vacation ever and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Cibils
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel from 9/16-24/2011. Had a pool ocean view room it was beautiful. The staff was great from check in to check out, every thing was clean and the grounds were well kept. I have been to Cancun 4 times and this was one of the best. The only bad thing was the mosquitoes, got bite up bad even with bug spray. The resort needs to spray more. This was the first time I used Book-it to book this resort and everything was perfect no problems at all. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about bad comments”
Reviews.Author: kevet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 2 week trip at the ocean mayo. At first we were worried with some of the comments that were put on here and even considered changing hotel but i am so glad we didn't, we have been all around the world and stayed in some really nice hotels and some not so nice hotels...this was nice, lovely manicured gardens, wild life everywhere, friendly staff. From the day we arrived until the day we left we did not have a bad thing to say about the hotel or the staff, all the staff were so happy and friendly and bent over backwards to make our holiday special. The entertainment staff were remarkable, Amy, Omargh, Jess are the names I can remember but they were all great, all day they were entertaining the guests by the pools and then some in the evenings six days a week. The food was great and plenty of it we were not to keen on the mexican restaurant but everyone's taste is different, the oriental and italian were very good, limited menu choice but very good food none the less. Don't bother taking the bus into playa del carmen unles you want to be hasseled by shop keepers (worse than egypt) go in to cancun well just outside cancun, bubba gummps, o'briens plus many more, much better. Usually we don't bother going to the rep meetings the next day but this one is well worth it and quite entertaining. When you arrive at the airport, be prepared for a lengthy delay to get to your transfere bus, nearly 2 hours it took us getting thru immigration, collect our bags then all bags are xray'd before you leave for your hotel, also there is a charge when you come to leave mexico of £40 or $60 each airport tax... The one point I can say which is not so good in our oppinon is that we enjoy a walk into towns and shopping areas bars etc when we go on holiday but this hotel is quite isolated and doesn't allow you that freedom unless you take a bus or cab. Take a small umbrella it does rain and some times in the evening especialy when your dressed for dinner, the wife was caught out and didn't half make a mess of her hair lol Don't bother upgrading to privelage people we spoke to said it is not worth the $25 each per day. If you have any questions email me and i'll do my best to help.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star....3.5 or 4!!”
Reviews.Author: staffman81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from 9/17 to 9/23...Overall we were very pleased with the property. This being our 4th trip in two years to Cancun area this was our first experience with the Playa del Carmen area and we found the Ocean Maya a good value for the price. The food, grounds and view were good, but the greatest asset was the staff....from the waiters to the bartenders to the entertainment staff these people were excellent! The adluts only aspect is great. As with any property if you look for something to find fault with you'll find it, but for my money, I got what I paid for and more.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise ..... please someone send us back!”
Reviews.Author: Dmn33
Reviews.Content: Daniel & Nicola (Wales, UK) This is our 2nd time staying in Mexico and our 1st at Ocean Maya Royale, for those of you considering staying here both my husband and myself would highly recommend it. Prior to booking this hotel we read both negative and postive reviews on trip advisor and having stayed here for the last 2 weeks (8/9/11 - 22/9/11) I am amazed that people have negative points to say about this hotel. Upon arrival we were met with a very warm reception and given a welcome drink (Island Cooler), had a very quick check in and escorted to our room with our bags very swiftly. The room was very clean and comfortable with a huge bed and kept immaculate by the hotel staff each morning. There is a mini fridge in the room which is restocked daily and is part of the all inclusive package. There are 4 restaurants to choose from (mexican, italian, japanese and buffet) we liked all 4 restaurants always found something to eat and each had something special to show you such as the mayan coffee in the mexican and the japanese show table. Regardless of where we went the food was always excellent. Privilege upgrade - not required as in our opinion not value for money. The beach is fantastic and there are plenty of parasols on the beach in the mornings for you to laze around on all day although we did put towels down each morning but most people were doing this anyway. The beach boys work tirelessly keeping the beach immaculate for every guest to enjoy. The best part about this hotel is the staff each and everyone of them are fantastic people who greeted you with a smile and "hola" all the time. They pride themselves on making your experience in the hotel an enjoyable and friendly one and nothing is too much trouble. The entertainment staff (Omar, Jes, Amy, Nelly and Fernanda) are fantastic and really try and get you involved in the activities but dont push you into them either. The night -time entertainement is put on by the entertainment staff who work incredibly hard organising each show and i throughly enjoyed the Grease night! We only went on 1 trip to Xel ha as we have done everything before on our 1st holiday to Mexico. The trip was well organised and we were taken care of throughout the trip (booked through Thomson rep - Noe AKA Danny Divito who is absolutely fantastic!) The hotel also has a photography centre and you can book a photo shoot which we took full advantage of. Our photo shoot was with Evann who is very talented and we had ours at Sunrise which was amazing and so worth getting up at 05am for. We would like to thank the staff at the Ocean maya royale for making our holiday a truely memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paradise Ignore Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Trudi H
Reviews.Content: Before leaving to Cancun my Boyfreind and I had very mixed reviews about going to Mexico during so called 'Hurricane Season' and to this resort after reading some of the harsh reviews people had left! I found that I constantly checked the weather forecast as it said rain rain and thunderstorms on a daily basis, however most of the rain that we did experience was throughout the night and a few down pours on the beach apart from that I wish we stocked up on Factor 30 as we had to buy some out there as it was soo hot! My first impression of the resort itself on arrival was 'wow' I dont know what people expected but the people and service at this resort were nothing but freindly! The open lobby was amazing and a great atmosphere to go with it. We were greeted with a cold drink and directed to our rooms which again the first impression was great! Although during our first week we had some problems with our rooms so had to move twice this was sorted but we felt there was some lack of communication and that we could have been compensated for this but we didnt want to let that ruin our holiday! :o) I also had mixed reviews about the beach and what to expect lets just say that you dont get white sand like that in many places and although some rainy nights washed up a bit of seaweed the BeachBoy worked Very Hard to clean this up! We watched him daily and couldnt believe how hard he worked! Also 200 yards to the right of the beach there is a lovely place to swim and the fish just swim up to you (as people feed them).I wish we had walked up to the left of the beach past the sand bags as people said there was a lagoon that way. Anyway the staff at this resort could not do anymore for us thank you to Fernadas in the main restaurant who was there breakfast and lunch time- always smiling and doing his best to go out of his way to make us comfortable :o).. we did not need to lift many fingers on our relaxing holiday as the service was amazing from waitress service on the beach, to making sure we had clean towels, i even tried to help myself to my own drink in the main restaurant whoops and I was told that they would bring in to me and to sit back down, thank you to the great Chefs who cook in front of you one Chef even brought my boyfriends steak to him and cooked him a few extras as he had to wait for some more to come out. Thank you to Oskar for looking after us during independance night, ( the tequillas were not so great-ha)! The best thing about travelling to Mexico were the many excursions you can go on so many to choose from, would recommend the FatCat for snorkelling and a great guide too, the dolphin discovery and manatees and shark was a great experience, also meeting such nice people on the trip to Coba made it worth while, the pick up point was also great buses were always on time and guides very helpful which didnt make it a chore to tip. Lastly thank you very much to Danny! (Noel) our rep your welcoming meeting was fantastico! and it was a pleasure coming to see you to chat and book our trips to also learn about your family and your love of parting (famous in birmingham ;o) ) food, and watching fighting! ;o) also the freindly people that we met on the beach! We will certainly be heading back to Mexico one day and I wish it was tomorrow!! Trudi & Paul (Hereford)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GiGiPalmBay
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed ourselves very much. Front desk clerk Anna was so helpful with any situation I addressed to her. Pailo (spelling) all around host/pool/shows was not only adorable but very friendly, talented and you can tell he throughly enjoys working at this resort. Our only complaint was only 1 mirror in the room which was in the bathroom. Japaneese dining experience was awsome, food overall was good and a wide variety. Loved the Mikes cafe and lobby bar area.

Reviews.Title: “2 WEEKS OF PURE PLEASURE AND DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: SIMON H
Reviews.Content: Have stopped all over Europe,Africa and Caribean and have to rate this hotel in the top 3 for all round pleasure-Spotless Hotel,Plentifull supply of food and beverages (must try the Mud Slide cocktails) Excellant Staff,Pool and Beach spotless...forever cleaning...only 1 slight downside is the overall location..once outside the grounds there is nothing so you can be isolated if you like a wonder round shops and bars at night, but to be honest in the 2 weeks vacation we did 1 trip and was quite happy and entertained within the hotel

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jankeat
Reviews.Content: Can only describe our 2 weeks at Ocean Maya as excellent, apart from no hot water in pool resterant for our tea/ coffee seems they have to go to the main resterant, which didnt seem a prob for the staff especially Alberto who was such a darling and Vicente. We celebrated a birthday at the itialian resterant and they pulled out all the stops to make it special with a bottle of bubbly and a special cake. The staff are so friendly and helpful and thoroughly enjoyed our 2 weeks there. A special thank you to Pedro Pech an amazing manager who always had a special welcome and was so helpful.. The only downside is the location you need to get a bus or taxi if you want to leave the complex as they is nothing for the strollers.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: michelledismukes
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Ocean Maya...We have stayed at several different resorts in the area but, the staff at the Ocean Maya exceeds any and every expectation we have ever had. We have hopefully made life long friends. Every person there went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. The excusions are wonderful (see Rudie for an inexpensive snorkle trip). The pool/entertainment staff (Miguel, Polo, Nellie, Fernanda, Amy Jean, Jesse, Omar and Edwardo) will do anything to keep you entertained and they work their butt's off. The two pool bartenders Javiar and Edmar are funny, cheerful and great behind the bar, as are the wait staff. The maid/cleaning staff is so discreet we actually never saw them. Our only issue was the lack of variety in the restaurants/menu and the matress is Hard. Not much of a price to pay for being in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: benjamin754171
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time and also met some of the coolest people ever. The staff was very helpful and nice everyone helped out with any thing I needed. The shows were fun and the energy kept me entertained even when the show wasnt my favorite, food was good drinks were fast and good, I can only think of good things to say. And on a last note fernanda roldan was the best staff member by far at ocean maya and deserves to be complimented or awarded in my opinion in front of everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerrilynn
Reviews.Content: Went to Mexico for the first time and stayed at Ocean Maya with 2 other couples. We were treated like royality. Refrigerator was stocked daily, clean rooms and outdoor areas were to die for. We have decided to make this a yearly vacation spot. The food was good, not EXCELLENT but good. We have vacationed all over and this was by far the BEST vacation we have ever had. Met a lot of really great people.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ellclfc
Reviews.Content: Arrived back from the Ocean Maya Royale this morning (18/09/2011) and had an excellent time. Food was superb, the grounds were always kept spot less and clean. Rooms were always clean. A special mention goes to the entertainment team, Polo, Amy, Nelly, Fernanda, Riccardo, Jess, Omar and Miguel ! They worked so hard day in day out whether it be to get people involved in daytime activities or to get to know people in general and make them feel comfortable with getting involved. Always on the go an of an evening always produced a great show. Could not fault any of them in the slightest and I thank them all for making it such a tremendous holiday. Another special mention goes to Luiz Castillo, who was always very helpful to us, he organised for us to go to Coco Bongo's at very short notice an be a gold member. If i knew everybodys name at the hotel I would give them all a mention because every single one of them deserve it from the bell boys to the bar staff to the cleaners to the entertainment staff they always had a smile on their faces and made it such a special holiday. The A La Carte restaurants were beautiful, especially the japanese an no need to reserve unless to do the Tapin Yaki (unsure about spelling) Will definitely be travelling to this hotel very very soon again, holiday blues big time. One thing I would give advice to people travelling to the Ocean Maya Royale is that their is no need to upgrade to be a premium guest, its not real value for money because at the end of the day alls you really get more is the balinese beds, a seperated section of the restaurants and a selection of other drinks. Dont get me wrong the balinese beds look nice but their is so much going on round the pools throughout the day that you'll end up round there. But saying that, that doesn't take anything away from the hotel had an absolute scream, and would like to thank everyone that made it so enjoyable ! Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know !

Reviews.Title: “First visit and last!”
Reviews.Author: OlaSenora
Reviews.Content: Our vacation in Mexico was disappointing. We spent the Thanksgiving holiday through December 2010 in the Riviera Maya. We got through the airport in Cancun pretty fast. Our Lomis Representative met us at the curb. We had to wait for quite a while to load into the van though. As we drove from the Cancun Airport to the resort, we saw police with guns pointing at our van as we drove past. We were told that there was a world conference in Cancun so security was tight and present. It was intimidating to say the least. We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale, an H10 hotel. We booked the all-inclusive trip through our travel agent - the vacation was a "Funjet" vacation. When we arrived at the hotel it took a while before we could get our room. While we waited, the hotel staff gave us a delicious, tropical drink to enjoy. The trip started out good, but we ended up very disappointed. Funjet's representative was Lomis Travel. The Lomis Representative who drove us to the hotel was polite, engaging and very nice. Unfortunately, he was only dropping us off at our hotel. We had a different Lomas Representative at the hotel who we didn't find to be helpful. We had no orientation to the hotel or to sight seeing activities. We had to find out on our own what activites and amenities were available. We found that there was a language barrier - we do not speak Spanish and it seemed that most of the people at the resort only understood bits of English. Although the hotel grounds were very nice, I found the hotel staff to be less than accommodating. Some of the problems we encountered were no beverages in our refrigerators (other than 2 bottles of water) - I asked the hotel to be sure we had at least 6 bottles a day because that was the only thing I could drink (I do not drink liquor) - it took them a couple days for us to get the water, but we finally did. The water falls outside of the hotel lobby was dry, I guess it was under construction. Service was less than desireable in the restaurants. We sat for 2 hours in the Italian restaurant before our dinner was served. I do recommend the Japanese Restaurant - the food was very good and our waiter put on quite a show as he cooked our food for us. It was the highlight of our eating experience. Highly recommend the Japanese Restaurant. The buffet had the same food, which gets boring after a week of eating it. I do recommend the chips & salsa and guacamole - delicious! I would make nachos for lunch each day - it was the only thing I ate fromt he buffet. The drinks were very good. All the drinks were refreshing and the bartenders were generous with the liquor. The entertainment was good. It seems that all the hotel workers do it all. We saw our waiter in the show - he was one of the dancers. We saw one of the dancers at the breakfast buffet the next morning helping to clear tables. Some workers were great. We had one waiter who was very social and liked talking with us and hearing about Chicago. He said he had an uncle in Chicago and was saving his money to move to Chicago. Our room was okay - nothing plush, just a place to sleep. We had a constant water leak by the bathroom sink. The floor in the bathroom was always wet - we had to place towels on the floor to absorb the water. We called building management and they sent a repair person out twice to fix it, but it was never resolved. One thing you want to watch out for is wristband discrimination. Before we travel, I always read the TripAdvisor forum and there were many posts about wrist bands, but my travel agent told me that there shouldn't be anything to worry about. We received white wristbands at the hotel that gave us access to the resort, drinks and restaurants. However, we did feel discriminated against because we did not have a black wristband. The guests wearing the black wristbands had preferred service. In fact, there was a segregated area on the beach at the hotel that was roped off so that only people wearing black wristbands could sit there - in beautiful lounge chairs with canopies. We could not sit there because of our white wristbands. We friended some Canadians who were wearing the black wristbands and they said they didn't know of white bands - and they paid less money for their trip than we did, as did some French people that we met who also had the black wristbands. Obviously, the TripAdvisor comments were correct. We took a couple trips which were awesome. We went to Tulum. I highly recommend Tulumn - it is an amazing historical place to visit. It was very hot, so make sure you dress for the heat and bring a swim suit - there is a beautiful beach that you can enjoy. Lomis Travel arranged our trip and didn't tell us about the beach, so we weren't able to swim in the water. The ancient ruins are beautiful - if you like history, you will love Tulum. We took an Outback ATV and Cenotes trip and visited a Mayan Village. The trip was wonderful until the end when my son had a very bad ATV accident and ended up in a hospital in Playa del Carmen. He suffered a concussion, hematoma, neck/back strain and deep tissue bruises to his hip (of course, cuts, abrasions and bruises). Please be very careful when you take these tours. The tour driver was unable to help us. There was no medical services provided, no ambulance, no precautions whatsoever out in that jungle - we never felt so helpless. We had to bring our son back to the hotel and call a doctor to come to the hotel. The doctor then called for an ambulance who took him to the hospital. Please note that drivers do not move to the right side of the road in Mexico for emergency vehicles. And, ambulance drivers stop for all red lights. It felt as though it took forever to get to the hospital. We were so happy to return home. Our family had some good times and enjoyed parts of our vacation, but we've decided that we will stay away from Mexico in the future. It was our first visit and our last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: supergirlteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocean Maya last March Break (sorry a little slow on the review!) and had a BLAST!! Met up with a great group of fellow Canadians and we were all treated amazingly by hotel and bar staff!! Spent most of our days by the swim up bar and loved every minute!! The pool bartenders were super fun and always wanting to try out new creations on us! :) Hotel grounds were immaculate and there were always people working on them. Buffet was always full and never had a problem finding something to eat. Tried out a few of the a la cartes and they were good too. One of them was taking extra long to seat us but the bar staff there entertained us and let me join them to play at my bartending skills! Beach was smaller but still really nice. Entertainment staff always had something going but weren't too pushy if you wanted to just chill. Resort was close enough to Playa so we could always go into town to change up the pace. Rooms were super clean and nice....maid service was awesome! I've been to many resorts in Cancu and Playa and this one was one of my favourites!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: jstewart79
Reviews.Content: We went to Mexico for our Honeymoon and were both unsure about what to expect as it was our first time here! The flight with Thomson was very long and because we hadn't pre-booked seats my wife and I had to sit apart, which wasn't a great start to the honeymoon. For such a long flight you didnt really get that much without paying for it, so just be aware take plenty of drinks and snacks on-board with you otherwise you will be penny-less. The hotel was absolutely brilliant, the service was magnificent and we both felt pampered and looked after for the whole holiday. The cocktail on check in was very welcome especially when wearing hot sticky UK clothes. The hotel gardens are exquisite and was comparable to walking through a zoo with lizards, butterfly's and birds every where!
