The villas and suites were amazing, a good size, Huge bed, Amazing air conditioning and constantly topped up free mini bar...very good! The only issue was the shower which kept flooding onto the floor and needed mopping up after every shower. The restaurants were of a very high standard, the mexican restaurant was our favourite due to the quality of food, the service and the AMAZING Banana margaritas they bring you! The buffet had a huge selection of foods from all over the world and was plentiful! The Oriental restaurant was good, but a bit confusing as there was a set menu of Sushi and Chinese mains. The Italian was average food was ok but not brilliant! Enough said about that one. The breakfast buffet again was plentiful and the freshly made omelettes are very tasty! The hotel also gave us a free romantic meal and breakfast in bed and a bottle of wine as we were on our Honeymoon which topped off the holiday! The pools and beach are beautiful and if your an early bird you can go for a swim in the sea on your own if your there about 6 am ish. The thatched parasols on the beach and coconut palms are simply idyllic and swinging away in the hammocks with a Mojito is pure bliss! The pool bar staff are brilliant and work so hard, the waiters who bring you drinks are great and do a wonderful job! The range of cocktails is HUGE and we worked through the 25 on the menu, plus a few of their own concoctions too! Also we found out you can hand feed fish in the sea with seaweed which was a brilliant experience and if you walk left on the beach for about 10 minutes there is a very beautiful lagoon which is cold water and surrounded by mangrove. It is certainly worth checking out and you can get good pictures of pelicans sitting on mangrove stumps! The evening entertainment was OK, quite chilled and finished early but if want a relaxing, chilled holiday then it is fine! A few cockneys were moaning about the lack of night life in the hotel but they didnt seem keen on the art of conversation which was really interesting meeting people from all over the world and chatting! All in all coupled with a few excursions, definitely worthwhile (Xel Ha & Coba) this was a magnificent and beautiful Honeymoon in a picturesque resort with great food, drink, service and scenery!

Reviews.Title: “First timers in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: ohnojojo
Reviews.Content: I booked a vacation for a friend & I for this resort from 08/11-08/17. Absolutely loved every minute of it!. We were picked up at the airport by "Best Day Travel" & dropped of at the hotel. After we checked & had received complimentary drinks we were shown to our room. Only downer we were on the 3rd floor with no elevator, so lots of steps...no big deal we walked off all those yummy drinks Room was nice & clean. Yes the beds are firm but so is my bed, so felt no difference. Poolside was awesome! We had no problem finding a spot by the pool, even later in the morning. Entertainment staff had us laughing & even tried tequila volleyball. Drinks were good, even if a little weak, but hey that way you can drink more right? Restaurants & service was good. My fav was breakfast buffet, loved the choices. Never had to make a reservation or wait in a line. Enjoyed the Mexican Restaurant by the pool for both lunch & dinnertime. Our waiter can't remember his name was so hardworking & great. In fact all the staff was friendly & very hard workers. We took three excursions - 2 already pre paid with Best Day. Chichenitza & Xplor both all inclusive & all inclusive fun fun fun! Amazing! Our Best Day Guide David was so knowledgeable, highly recommend Best Day, & will book with them again. We also purchased at the front desk Snorkling at Porto Moralos. Highly recommend especially for beginners. We saw Baracudas, Turtles, stingrays This is all inclusive to, food was nice & spicy! My friend & I plan to go again, we really enjoyed our first vacation to Mexico. My only suggestion to the hotels is the wrist bands should also include colors for Singles, Gay, or Married, not just privileged black bands... haha

Reviews.Title: “best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: fern010
Reviews.Content: one thing to say ..... perfect! the people are so nice and really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Absaloutely Amazing!! We will definitly be back - - ROBBIE & CHLOE”
Reviews.Author: 43Chloe
Reviews.Content: Wow! where to start! We arrived on the 26th August and were greeted vy our very funny and friendly rep Noe (Danny) who was brilliant from the word go! Transport to the hotel was swift and we were greeted with drinks and friendly check in staff Ana and Jorge to name a couple! The brilliant Maria Lopez despite the fact she wasnt there made sure we were taken care of as soon as we arrived! We met some great friends and enjoyed the brilliantly kept grounds and pool especially the bar where Javier was probably the best bartender i have ever met! Al the staff are excellent!! Luis Castillo was exeptional he really made sure ran smoothly very helpful and friendly and always on hand! It may seem like im name dropiing but i dont care these guys work their backsides off and deserve a huge pat on the back! OK...so i can understand the entertainment may not be to everyones liking but people have to understand they have to try and cater for everyone and anyone with normal vision can see how hard they try!! the staff...JESS, OMAR,POLO,RICARDO,NELLIE,FERNANDA AND AMY were all top class and soo funny!! i actualy miss seeing them on a day to day basis..lol The food i thought was great the resteraunts were lovely with great service from oscar,luis,.fransisco to name a few. On our last night we had a romantic dinner!! Captain Aberlay was great with the service and Perla from guest service made sure everything was perfect!! I have nothing but complete respect for these guys. They work so so so hard they really do...by the look of some of thses reviews people need to more appreciative of what they have at there homes. I would come back tomorrow if i could .....# i have no doubt we will be back very soon x

Reviews.Title: “skip this place I know there are better resorts in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: dkdiva2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ocean Maya Royale from 8/27-9/3 for our 4th year wedding anniversary. My review is going to be very long because I am going to be very detailed about my entire experience so bear with me. I read all the reviews before picking this place, some good, some bad but I went any way because I wanted to experience it for myself. Boy, I should have listened to the reviewers. First of all, let me warn you that Cancun is very, very hot and if you are not use to hot weather beware. I'm from the Midwest and was not use to the heat. It's because they are closer to the equator so the heat is there. As soon as you make it through customs, timeshare ppl at the airport are trying to get you but keep walking until you make it outside to see your shuttle service. Upon arriving at the resort no one greeted us to get our bags, nor did we receive a warm towel (like at the other resorts the shuttle dropped other guests at), nor did we receive a welcome drink. We arrived around 1pm so we couldn't check into our room. They have a writstband system which sucks to me, colors: white-basic, orange-apple vacations or other vacation sevice and blue-privilege. I dont want to ever vacation again at a place that put ppl in different catergories. I dont like to be treated differently because of my wristband. The lobby is very hot no air conditioning. So we walked the grounds and ate at the buffet until we were able to check into our room. The grounds were very beautiful you can tell they take pride in keeping the place looking great. Our room was very nice, very clean and the air worked perfectly. My husband tried to sit in the chair and almost fell because it was broken. The TV stations are in Spanish and they have a few English channels. But I was able to watch a football game and the MTV award while we were there. Food: there are 3 resturants and 1 buffet. the Japanese was the best by far. If you have the privilege band you can make reservations for all the resturants if you dont, you have to try and get a reservation. The Italian was just ok tons of food. You would think being in Mexico you will receive true Mexican food oh no, the Mexican resturant has Tex Mex food but they have the friendliest ppl working there Ingrid, Alberto and Eduardo were all great and made sure we were always well taken care of. The buffet was so freaking hot that you could not really enjoy your food. They did have plenty of food to chose from for breakfast lunch and dinner. pools: There are 2 pools on the resort. You have to get up pretty early to put your towels out to make sure you have a spot. Swim up bar was always rocking. Javier was the best bartender there. If you go, ask for the Javier special or the ticket to fly. oh my, ticket to fly is my new drink. I saw the entertainment staff I think after our 4th day there. I didnt even know they had an entertainment staff. I believe they need to work harder at getting ppl involved in activities. The pool closer to the Mexican resturant is very quiet and laid back. They do have a section roped off for the PRIVILEGE guest. The spa ppl are very pushy, no means no stop harassing ppl while they are on vacation. There was no photography on grounds but then I was told you had to make an appointment for them to take your pictures WHAT?? drinks: if you have the PRIVILEGE band you can get top shelf like sky blue, grey goose etc.. all others get house brand. I really didn't care just make me something that's going to get me drunk. The night before my anniversary, they were working on the roof of the Mexican resturant all night until the next day. My husband and I didnt get any sleep because of all the banging. I called the front desk and was told other ppl have called in and complained about the noise. Went to the front desk and spoke to the manager Fabio Tesser about the noise we experience. He rewarded us with a PRIVILEGE band wow!! I also had to sign a waiver that I wouldn't sue them in the future!!! Our anniversary dinner was very romantic, it was held pool side by the Mexican resturant. The food was not enough so we had to end up ordering an entree off the menu. We were well taken care of by Ingrid and Alberto. The banana margarita was to die for. I did not have any telephone service while there. So I had to purchase a phone card from the lobby gift shop. I went there 4 times and was told each time they didnt have any. I was started to get fustrated because I needed to contact my kids. So I was speaking to some other ppl on the resort, I had one of the ladies go into the shop and asked for a calling card and she was told they had them. I had just left out of the shop asking for the same card. I went back in and asked for the card again and was told oh yeah we have them. I went directly to the front desk and spoke to Dulce who stated maybe she didnt understand what I asking for. I went off and stated she knew exactly what I wanted maybe she just didnt want to sell ime one because of my color. I did experience racism there and did not like it. We did do the shuttle to Playa De Carmen which is a 5 hour tour. They were trying to sell us everything from legal to illegal items, go figure. I believe the tour is a little too long. It can be done within 3 hours. Every night was a different themed night. I meet some great and friendly ppl. It rained 4 out of the 8 days we were there. We could not do any beach activities because the water was bad the entire time we were there which means there were red flags on the pools. Would I return to this resort? The answer is no and I do not recommend this place to anyone. They need to work on so many things I will not list them all. Customer service is everything and they lack this at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Rotten Customer Service... never going back”
Reviews.Author: Jack999_10
Reviews.Content: Okay, so don't get me wrong... the hotel, staff, and food were good. However there was an aweful sewer smell in one area of the property. Anyway... the real reason I am writing this is because of the after the vacation customer service we received with regards to the hotel chains H10 Club points. We stayed in the hotel with two other couples the first week of March 2011. For ever stay you gain points on their H10 Club cards. Well, at least you are suppose to, that is if the hotel does it's job and sends in your membership number for your stay!!!! Now that we are thinking about re-booking our two vacations a year with the same hotel, I have been notified that my points were not sent in, and no one from the hotel chain can do anything about it as it is their policy that your points have to be sent in within three months of your stay. Something the hotel didn't do. So the customer loses in the end. Great customer service on the part of the hotel and the chain. As for me and my friends... we will be spending our money at another hotel chain this coming year. Customer Service is everything Ocean Royale Maya and H10 Properties!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, great everything, other people are just too picky!!!”
Reviews.Author: livelaughlove19
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a great resort, and people who write bad reviews probably don't enjoy anything in life! I will outline the things at the resort for easy reading. Staff: Amazing. Very friendly. Always ready to help you, and never were rude. The beach staff was so upbeat and tried to get everyone involved. Room: The room was great, very big, and clean when we got there. The bed was comfortable, never had a problem sleeping. Shower was amazing, and very big. Beach: Very clean water and sand. We always could find a hut at different times of the day. Pool: Lovely, 2 seperate pools, both were nice. The pool with the swim up bar had seats that had jets, they were AWESOME!! There was almost always someone at the swimup bar to serve us drinks. Restaurants: Very very very good food. Something good all the time. The breakfast at the buffet was always good. Loved having them make omlets to our liking. Japanese show was great, very exciting and cook was very nice. Mexician restaurant also very delicious! The wildlife animals were very cute. Javier was always very helpful by the swimup bar area. NOTE: you do NOT need to exchange your money into pecos, EVERY place accepted American money, even the trip to Playa del Carmen. Any questions feel free to email me: bowlingsoul10@sbcglobal.net

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, Not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: ljlantrip
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Cancun, and our first at this resort. Out of the three places we have stayed, it was 2/3. It was not great, but it wasn't terrible either. I would like to say, that if you are going with a comparatively inexpensive all inclusive resort, you should keep that in mind! It is not going to be fine, gourmet food or lavish accomodations! So, I am strictly comparing it to similar all inclusive resorts. First off all, I definitely recommend the upgrade. The exclusive beach area has personalized service, great chairs, and american beer in cans! You also get to sit in the ONLY air conditioned areas of the restaurants, which you really come to appreciate. Other than that, not much benefit as far as we could tell. You can order expensive brands of liquor, but we saw others doing so as well, and it seemed to be working! What I did NOT like was that even with the upgrade, you were only allowed 2 cans of beer (Montego) in your room refrigerator per day. Extra cans are available for $3 each!!! That is ridiculous! Another reason why I liked the cans at the priviledge beach area... You also have to pay extra for the "romantic dinner" ($50-$90 per person). Other resorts include this free of charge with the upgrade. Note... You only get 2 bottles of water, 2 cokes, and 2 sprites as well. Extras are charged to your room! The rooms were always "damp', but were very cool. The only complaint about the room was the bed. There is no box springs and the mattress was very thin and hard. Otherwise, it was clean and comfortable. As others have said, there is a lot of seaweed in the ocean. Still, the beach was decent and nice for sun bathing or taking a stroll. If you don't mind the seaweed, the water is great. The pool areas are very nice, but not enough chairs. People have them all spoken for by 9am! The worst part was the food. Again, I do not expect gourmet at a reasonably priced all inclusive resort. The specialty restaurants were good (Italian and Japanese) but the buffets were not appealing to us at all. There is a large selection at all the buffets and you shouldn't starve by any means, but the food is sub standard. Mike's Coffee Shop in the evenings is very good though! The best part was the staff and the drinks. Javier the pool bartender was fabulous. There was also a guy who worked at Mike's Coffee Shop at night who was totally awesome! I regret that I didn't remember his name. The beer tastes better than other resorts we have visited, although I'd say it is still about 50% the alcohol of the beer I drink at home. The mixed drinks do not appear to be watered down, but I am generally only a beer drinker so I am not sure. The shows at night are similar to other resorts and fun to watch. Most of the staff are very friendly. The only one who was not was our "concierge", when I declined the breakfast meeting where they try to sell you membership! He became bvery defensive and rude when we would not agree to attend. Others told us it was a 3+ hour presentation!!! NO THANKS!!! Overall, we had a good time, but we would not return to this resort. There are better places for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel and a brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: Patrick T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya in August 2011 and had a fantastic time. The resort is set in fantastic gardens with exotic plants and manicured lawns. The accommodation was low-rise and discreetly built so as to avoid the stereotypical hotel block and this made the site enormously attractive. In the gardens there was a wide range of wildlife from tejons to iguana, a range of birds to see and excellent views into the sea to spot a myriad of fish and ray. The rooms were large, well furnished and air-conditioned with servicing daily. Water was proved as were a range of free drinks in the mini-bar. The beach and pool areas were excellent and kept clean by a team of good humoured staff who took time out to teach us a few Mayan words and the bar service at the pool was first class especially Ivonne, Azucena (thank you ladies) and the barman Eber but not forgetting Maricena - the lady of the towels and books who excellent good humour was fantastic. the food at the resort was excellent too with a wide range to suit all tastes from Mexican to Italian, Japanese to European - the waiters were all great! at the bar at reception i can only say a massive thank you to Imelda, Shaday and Marbella who kept us stocked up in cocktails especially mojitos! - the staff throughout the hotel wore tireless and invariably friendly and pleasant. we had a great time at this resort - this part of Mexico is not for everyone because it was very hot and humid but if you don't mind that this is the place to relax and enjoy yourself - we recommend it unreservedly!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything that you read!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in August. Before travelling to Mexico we read the reviews and couldn't believe the difference when we arrived. We had a fantastic time and would definately return without a doubt. The hotel is set on beautiful grounds with staff working non-stop to ensure that it is always looking its best. The local animals that you see wandering around add to the delight of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean and offer everything that you would expect in a hotel room. Yes the shower leaks a little but its not a big deal as other reviews had suggested. The air conditioning is a welcomed relief as well as the restocked fridge. The hotel has 4 restaurants and our favourite was the Mexican. We tried all of the others and althought the buffet was good we were fed up of the food by the end of the second week. Breakfast was always good and the service in all of the restaurants was excellent. The staff at the hotel are always smiling and helpful whether they are waiters, cleaners or maintenance. They go out of thier way to say hello and smile. The pool and beach areas are excellent. Staff work hard to keep it clean and tidy. Some of the sun beds could do with being replaced but as long as you are at the pool/beach early enough you can easily find a decent one. The privelage area does seem a bit pointless as you are far from the pool and can't access the sea easily but you do get a personal waiter and the lovely double sunbeds. Overall we had a fantastic time. The entertainment staff are friendly and enthusiastic working through the day providing activities such as water polo, beach volleyball and a walking tour to the lagoon. This walk we would recommend. At night you can expect shows such as Grease, a Mayan Show and karaoke as well as many others. It was our long haul holiday and although we have had horrendous jet lag since we have been back we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Scenery, Snorkeling & Service, but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Kri H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an eight-day trip that was wonderful in some ways and disappointing in others. Reception/ Arrival: When we first arrived, the hotel did not allow us to go to our rooms for about an hour because 3:00 pm was official check in time. However, a man named Luis who introduced himself as our VIP concierge immediately whisked us away to a concierge desk. Luis seemed nice and got us drinks, but immediately proceeded to try to get us to spend more money by booking appointments at the spa. When we told him we would look it over, his tone dropped a little of its "silkiness" and he proceeded to tell us that we were "invited" to a VIP breakfast tomorrow at 9:00 am. When I asked what this was about, he told us that we would lose out on a $100 if we didn't go and that it was a showing of the privileged section of the hotel. When I flat out refused, because based on other reviews I knew where this was going, he became downright obnoxious and asked, "Well, I guess you are okay with loosing $100 huh? You can afford it?" However, we quickly concluded our meeting with Luis and proceeded to our room. Another thing to bear in mind while you are down there, the current exchange rate from dollar to peso is approximately 13.5 pesos to a US dollar. The front desk trades at 12 pesos to a US dollar while the gift shops and the vendors that come twice a week deal at 10 pesos to a US dollar. You might want to change your money into pesos in order to get what you pay for. Also, they often do not have change in your currency and use that as a way to give you your change in pesos and you lose money that way. Room: The room was really nice and clean. Our air-conditioning worked beautifully and there was not a bug in sight. Our villa was feet away from the pools and the Mexican restaurant El Charro. The bathroom is spacious and pretty and the shower is big enough for two people. (giggle) However, we ended up using all of our drawers and closet space and still did not have a lot of room left over. Even though this was not a problem for us, if you are traveling as a couple with a lot of stuff, there may not be a lot of room for your things. The other issue was the television. While we were away, our home state of New York was among several other states getting hit by hurricane Irene. When we tried to turn on BBC or CNN, or any other channel for that matter, most of them simply do not show up on the screen. Many of the channels are like regardless of whether they are English or Spanish. There were only a handful of channels on the television that worked constantly. The other problem we had with the room was housekeeping. Even though the housekeepers are very helpful, efficient, and friendly, they do have a fixed schedule for cleaning the rooms. Even when we tried to schedule a time for the housekeepers to come and clean, because they do not even try to clean if you are in the room, they came an hour early while we were sleeping. We had a king bed in our room, which was fairly comfortable, but the sheets were a little scratchy and if you keep the room pretty cool, the covers may not be adequate. Pool/ Beach: I am not going to lie; I did not set foot in the pools because I love the beach. However, they were very clean and lively. There is obviously a difference between the pool with the pool bar and its nearby part of the beach and the shallow pool by the Mexican restaurant and its nearby part of the beach. We preferred the part without the bar because we are not heavy drinkers and enjoyed the quieter side more. If you love activities, drinking in the pool, and ping-pong, and corn hole there is all of that in the middle of the two pools. Our part of the beach was beautiful. Even though there is some seaweed, which increases and decreases according to the weather, if you love the ocean and sand it is not going to bother you. There are no sharp rocks or anything dangerous. In the morning there are schools of fish and sometimes, if you are lucky, sea turtles in the water. The only downside is the lack of seating under shade. There are workers who are building more tiki huts but there aren’t always enough and you have to wait until someone leaves, which is not very often. Food: In our opinion, and we are people who take our food very seriously, the food at the resort was subpar. The only food that actually deserved the adjective tasty was the cuisine at the Mexican restaurant and a handful of items at the buffet. The Italian restaurant, La Dolce Vita, is a hit and miss and the Japanese restaurant is a disaster. However, there is Mike’s coffee shop, a hidden jewel where delightful smoothies and delicious coffee is brewed; the woman who works there knows what she is doing. The food at the Mexican restaurant is not the best Mexican food around, however it is the best food on the resort. At whatever you do, stay away from room service except for the hamburgers and fruit plates. In the end, you cannot except great food from this resort, just edible and occasionally tasty food. Regarding water, there is bottled and filtered water in the restaurants, the bars, and the mini bar in the room (it is restocked daily). However, the water from the faucets, and showerheads in the room and the taps outside are unfiltered. This was not a problem for us. Service: The staff, especially the people who work the most tedious and lower jobs, are the friendliest people around. They will stop whatever they are doing to help you. They always have a smile on their face and try to be as helpful as possible. Be warned, some of the do not speak more than 2 words of English. Everybody at the front desk, at the restaurants, and the shops speak English. It is the staff that does the cleaning and other tasks who may not speak English, but they are all as helpful as possible. Activities: We did not indulge in any activity besides snorkeling. I went twice because it was $35 per person for an hour and twenty minutes through the resort’s dive shop. That was a great value compared to the other offers. The dive shop is very friendly and they do their best to make the trip enjoyable. Other activities such as windsurfing, jet skiing, and Parasailing all came with a price, but some of them could be haggled down. Weather: The weather while we were there was absolutely gorgeous. We had rain only once in the middle of the night. The bugs were not nearly as bad as everyone made them out to be. You definitely need to pack a bottle of bug spray, but you will not need more than a bottle. In addition, sunscreen is essential. Overall, I enjoyed the ocean, the beach, the friendly staff, and certain meals.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning in buffet only for privelaged class”
Reviews.Author: weekendwarriors1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were excellent. and the A/C worked well. Beautifully decorated and good amenities. The buffet and lobby were very uncomfortable. The A/C in the buffet was for privelaged class only. Not very nice. We were so uncomfortably hot that our eating was only 10 minutes maximum. The food was very bland in the buffet as well. The selection was not very good and seemed to be the same every morning. The pool and grounds were beautiful. The beach was not very nice. Along the shore there was a lot of seaweed especially by the adjacent hotels. The entertainment was pretty poor. Same saxophone player nightly. The theater was also without A/C. Liqour was average, unless you have privelage class.

Reviews.Title: “great kid staff”
Reviews.Author: Roxana B
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband with our son went there last January. We had a fantastic time over there. Because of my son (4yrs old) I was looking for the kid playground, they didn't have any playground at resort for kids, but at kid center (room). They have a very nice staff (Suzanna & Lauren). Both of them were very kind & nice. My son could learn how to count in Spanish up to 10. Every time that I went to pick hime up, he was asking to stay more over there, they made couple of crafts and painting. Every time that we are talking about our vacation he is asking to go back there :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful site, Exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: MichelJoseeVaudreuil
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, bed is perfect, food is excellent but service is extraordinary! The ocean is not as blue as I expected but this can vary with the season I guess. The beach is clean and the sand is good. Beach service on Privilege section with Azucena is very friendly and quick. Perla, at guest service, is always there to help. Hernan Vicente waits for you for breakfast at la Hacienda. Polo, Ricardo and all the G.O. will entertain every evening on the site. Not to forget Maria which directs all these operation as a master!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - would recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Jayne & David from Fakenham We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale in August 2011. Looking at one or two of the other reviews, I cannot believe that they were staying at the same hotel as us. The hotel is set in very attractive grounds which are are looked after superbly. The whole complex is very clean and tidy and has a very attractive waterfall and pools which is well lit at night The rooms were a good size with a huge comfortable bed and were very clean, although it would be enhanced with a full length mirror. The shower is very good and you have plenty of room. The minibar is included in the all inclusive (coke, sprite, fanta and beer) and is very welcome when relaxing in your room on a hot afternoon or evening. The restaurants served very good food and the staff were very attentive. The only issue we would have is that the food is not always kept hot enough, but this is not an issue if you mention it to the chefs. We would like to mention Vincente Arias Hernan who was absolutely fantastic and looked after our every need. We found that the all inclusive included all cocktails and premium brand alcohol and all the staff were extremely helpful. They really couldn't do more for us and we cannot praise them highly enough. We especially liked the wildlife at the hotel which gave an interesting edge to our stay. The Koti, racoons and lizards could all be fed by hand, although they wouldn't let you get too close. We had a lizard every day on our balcony basking in the sun. We would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing stay and like to walk along the beach, although there are more strenuous activities available if you want them.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: sunandfun247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here back in June. we enjoyed almost everything, but with a little more effort this could have been a great trip. the good, food we didn't have any bad food the entire trip, normally you get some bad, but everything tasted good. the Japanese was the best. the activities were the only "not great" part of the trip.they advertise beach volleyball, but the staff always had an excuse, "it's too hot, it's raining, not enough players" well we would get the ball and gather enough people to play. the resorts on both sides played every day when our activity staff didn't. we are active people and like to stay that way, would have made it great,instead of just good.

Reviews.Title: “Good times, even better memories!”
Reviews.Author: Aimee W
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Ocean Maya................a fab time that I will cherish forever!!! Having just returned home from our trip, I am so sad to be back to reality! After reading some of the reviews I am confused as to whether I was at the same hotel. I have nothing but fond memories of my trip and cannot speak highly enough of our experience. Mexico totally exceeded my expectations and the all inclusive experience was completely foreign to me. I thought I might get cabin fever but with a few trips out to local towns, historic sites and beautiful oceans I could not complain!! I would recommend hiring a car if you want to see the historic Coba (well worth hiring a bike and climbing the pyramid for stunning jungle views!). Chichen Itza is also well worth a visit, although the magic is slightly stolen by the market stalls, but be prepared for haggling for a bargain if in the market for some souvenirs. Other tours on offer or places worth a visit, Xel-Ha for snorkelling and some amazing fish. Swinging through trees and quad biking through the jungle to Cenotes was brilliant if you enjoy eating dust!!! Playa Del Carmen has a great tourist vibe if you enjoy a haggle in the day, massive white beach or a boogie at night, Mandala's was good fun and of course Cocobongo's....what can i say?! Brilliant! Back to the hotel experience. The food at the restaurants, were rarely disappointing, so much choice, if a little random at times but amazing fish!!! The Japenese was our favourite completely delicious and they put on a great show, well worth it! The staff are a mixed bunch, as with any large company and we all have our bad days! On the whole they went out of their way to please and greeted you with a smile. These people work such long hours and in pretty tough conditions, I take my hat off to them! Polo, Emanuel, Ingrid, Alberto and Felix were among those who I cannot speak highly enough of! The entertainment team in particular made our holiday. A young team who go out of their way to make you laugh and smile, to make your holiday a memorable one! Not sure it is in their job description to babysit you if you drink too much at the pool bar though!!! They have a jam packed program of events to keep those interested, busy throughout the day and evening. I went home singing 'Hola Senioras' a song which becomes familiar if you like a bit of water aerobics!!! Special thanks to Polo, such a genuine and endearing person who always had time for you. A real credit to the resort! He remembered our names from day one and always came to see if we were ok. He is a natural entertainer, who clearly enjoys getting dressed up and strutting his stuff. His energy and enthusiasm is amazing and he took his role seriously to achieve the highest ranking 'No 1 entertainer' title with some pretty nifty magic skills! He also went over and above the call of duty after a heavy night out at Cocobongo's, forever grateful. Although I am thinking the late nights may be affecting his volley ball skills!!!! My only suggestion for the hotel is to get some more mats and a gym ball in the gym!!!!!! To summarise in a sentence, I would definately recommend the hotel, great food, great people, great times!!!! Thank you to those who helped make it that way!

Reviews.Title: “wishing i was still at ocean maya!”
Reviews.Author: janet g
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned back home from Ocean Maya last night. We had such an amazing time.. After reading many reviews on trip advisor I thought I'd mention a few things that some people left out and comment on the negative reviews. It takes about a half hour to 40 min to get to the hotel from cancun. Check in: Prior to checking in I had emailed Maria Lopez informing her that my boyfriend and I would be celebrating our anniversary and that I wanted to set up a romantic dinner. I had also emailed her requesting a room near the pool/beach on the second floor with a terrace. Upon checking in and meeting with guest services we were informed that we had gotten the room I requested and we received orange bracelets that allowed us to make reservations and have room service. Everyone welcomed us with a smile and an "hola" , and we were given any drink of our choice.. You must try their margaritas and strawberry daiquiri. Room: The rooms were wonderful. When we entered our room we were given a bottle of wine with a plate of desserts. I must say that the plate was not cleaned up until the second day of our stay. The showers are great, others have stated that it takes a while for the hot water to come on but this is not the case. Water does however leak out of the shower glass doors; but all you have to do is put a towel on the floor. Bring q-tips, shampoo, and conditioner - although they provide you w/ shampoo/conditioner it leaves your hair feeling knotty. The AC works very well; our room was always nice and cool. We stayed in room 907 and it was amazing! Try to request that room because it is closest to the beach and pool and the mexican restaurant. The sink in our bathroom had a leak and when we went to the front desk to notify them they sent someone up immediately to fix it [btw this was at 10pm]. The beds were okay, spacious however every morning we would wake up with back pain; this went away once we walked around a bit though. Food: The Japanese restaurant: [Yokooso]- We went their on our first night; sadly it was closed on Sunday so we were not able to go there on our last night. Def do the hibachi! the workers provide great entertainment and get all guests involved. The food was delicious. We did not go to El Charro for dinner because it was simply way too hot in there since they did not have an AC or fan. There lunch was okay; they had burgers pizza salads etc. The buffet had a wonderful breakfast- they had everything from fruits, yogurt, cereal, make your own omelets, jello in martini glasses, pancakes, hash browns, bacon, sausage..so yummy! I do have to say that the dinner at the buffet was not good... Great breakfast place and lunch.. but it lacked in dinner. The Italian restaurant was nice I would have wanted more sauce, bigger portions of pasta but it was good. Pool/Beach: I'm not sure why everyone is complaining about the beach. There are some areas in which the water is murky but all you have to do is swim further in. The water is nice and warm, the sand feels like mud.. Sand on the beach is so soft and white.. The chairs by the pool do get filled up quickly. Take advantage of the walking tour, we didn't get to do it but you are taken to a wonderful lagoon filled with tropical fish. The lobby does not have an AC and it does have free wifi which is not provided in your room; so bring your laptops! If you want to use the computers in the lobby you have to pay for it. Bring mosquito spray [OFF!] with you because there are many mosquitoes at the resort. Take advantage of the trip to playa del carmen as well. If you have any questions feel free to email me. A special thank you to maria lopez for making this trip so memorable and for our special dinner by the beach. Can't wait to return. Privilege: Personally I would not upgrade to the privilege; it seemed that most people were wearing either white or orange bracelets.

Reviews.Title: “The NOT SO all inclusive resort in the Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: oufinny
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... let's start with the good and then get to the bad. Good points: 1 - Room was clean and house keeping did an adequate job to keep it that way. 2 - Other reviews say the A/C does not work well, it works very well in fact. 3 - Bar tenders (with the exception of a few, see below) are very good and will ensure you have a good time. I will get back to this later though, it has its downsides too. 4 - Pool bar is excellent, we met a lot of great couples there and made fast friends. The actual swim up bar does not always have someone there so you have to be patient at time or just call up to Javier or Jairo (good guys for sure). 5 - Hotel grounds and beach area are all kept very clean. It was nice but by no means impressive. Bad Points: 1 - Time share was UN-FREAKING believable, the biggest waste of time. Unless you want to be told spending $39K USD is a good idea and almost forced to stay to get some BS $120 credit, don't bother. 2 - There is no all inclusive in this resort. You will see a selection of mediocre alcohol, ok booze and some premium choices. Unless you are part of the Privilege area you don't have access to it and it is not even offered to the Privilege people unless they ask. I call BS on that and we, along with other couples, told the hotel management staff who seriously could care less. Also, that $120 credit I mentioned above, I could hardly use it for anything at the hotel and when I didn't use it all, I couldn't even get a credit with the difference. I swear, these people don't understand fourth grade math and won't do anything no matter how logical you are with them. 3 - Customer service with the hotel staff was abysmal and they care nothing about even the people who pay for the highest dollar packages. Why do I know this, we met a couple in the honeymoon suite (saw their room too, same as ours just with a Jacuzzi on the balcony) and they had all kinds of problems with the staff their whole trip. 4 - The wrist bands, here is the breakdown: White - base level, get the least, no international drinks just cheap mexican knock offs and cannot make reservations in the restaurants. Orange - Maya deluxe package per bookit.com, this gives you SOME international drinks, reservations and a dinner by the pool. Oh don't think they will work to schedule that or even mention it to you, half the staff doesn't even know the difference and will do nothing to explain it unless you force it out of them. Black/Privilege - Best of the best, top shelf drinks, beach dinner, the rest I cannot say for sure as we had orange. Rooms are the same as what the we stayed in so it is really $150/pp for better drinks IF they give it to you. 5 - Restaurants are adequate at best and breakfast is the best. Each meal after that gets increasingly worse. My GF and I both got sick, me being VERY SICK at that, and they would not even own up to it when I know there were multiple complaints all given the same day. Japanese - 2/5 Italian - 1/5 Mexican - 1/5 (I can get better in Houston with my eyes closed) Really all that can be said is if you want to know what it must have been like to be on the Titanic where a very few are privileged and the rest are just fodder, this is the resort for you but don't expect to get more for paying more either. There are so many beautiful resorts in the area I say spend less and go to them; you will be happy you did as we heard from people we met in town and on some excursions. Excursions: Rio Secreto is spectacular though the food at the end is a let down, besides that I would say it is totally worth it. Met some great couples, had an absolute blast and saw some unbelievable sites. Don't pass this up given the chance. We also snorkeled with the hotel dive shop, reef is nice but the equipment is CHEAP. Do it elsewhere, you get what you pay for, simple enough. Bar and bar tenders revisited (the bad) - These guys over serve to the point one lady almost drowned and had to be dragged out of the pool before she died (yes this happened, I met her and she was not pleased it was allowed to happen and just plain embarassed). The day before that, a girl had to be carried out though she was conscious this time but ended up falling and about smashing her face in two if she did not miss the side of the pool. The "lifeguards", so ironic in this case, were responsible for getting both completed smashed and should be fired. Watch yourself, there are no limits here and they get a kick out of watching you make a fool of yourself. Exercise some self control and you will be fine; you have been warned. Final thoughts - We had fun mainly because we got lucky and met some fun people we spent a lot of time with. Others we talked to did not and all were met, conversed with, got to know well or had a drink with said they would not go back. There is a saying here in America that is very fitting, "you can spit-shine s**t but it is still s**t," well ladies and gentlemen of trip advisor, that is in a nutshell the Ocean Maya. Oh yeah and the fact they have no information about the not so all inclusive levels on bookit.com, here and the hotel website should tell you all you need to know about this shaddy place. Keep in mind I got back today and all of this is fresh so I put all the detail I can to help. The area is great, tons to do and not too expensive, find another place to hang your hat and throw back a cold one with friends and loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “JUST AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: DOCDRAPER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got back yesterday. The hotel is wonderful, the staff are very hard working and extremely friendly. The rooms are superb, the fridges are full of beer, fanta, sprite and water which you can help yourself too as part of the all inclusive experience. If you are going all inclusive, the hotel also includes room service in the basis. However, the firstchoice website does not mention this. We had aproblem with the room on the second day, in that the sink unit would not seal properly (it has the pop up closure system). I went down to reception where the staff were only too happy to help. In fact by the time we got back from lunch, an hour later, the sink was fixed! I thought this was a one off, but no! At the end of our first week the patio doors stopped opening. I went down to reception again and told them about the problem (about 12 midday). By the time we came off the beach at 3pm, the door was working and had clearly been fixed. The location is excellent for the beach, with the sea so close. However, if you want clear water you need to walk onto the beach and turn right and walk about 200 meters and the water changes and becomes clear to the point that you can see fish and sting rays if you're carefull and quiet. In connection with beach, the sun loungers need a bit of work, they don't currently have matresses on them. However, this is being actively improved, before we left on Saturday afternoon, matresses were being added and new loungers were being rolled out. The pool is good, but a word of caution, the deep section is only one side of the pool furthest from the restraunt, at 8 feet deep. The rest of the pool is no deeper than 4 to 4 and a half feet. However, in the warm dry weather the pool feels like a warm bath wich is lovely. The wildlife in hotel grounds is just lovely. There are all sorts of diffrent sized lizards and birds. At lunch, a Koti (look this up on google images) comes to visit. There are also racoons as well. Russ and Lea Draper

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, a credit to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevejeni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 2 weeks, the staff are very warm and friendly and we never had a problem with them. The whole place is kept immaculate . If I had any moaning todo it was the food, on the whole it was good with plenty of choice, but not always HOT enough for my liking and I'm talking temperatures not spice's and sometimes not cooked thorough but if you tell them to cook it alittle longer it wasn't an issue . My husband on the other hand likes his red meat alittle on the rare side. The mexican restaurant was quite bland food, the Italian was pretty good and the Japanese was fair but most people you spoke to rated it highly. The other moaning issue is although the SAXOPHONE player is a very talented man it does get alittle boring to listen to every night , alittle more of the mexican feel would have been much more appreciated. There are two pools one of which is where most of the games are played should you wish to join in, the other abit quieter . We did find you had to get there early in the morning to get a bed by the pool with an umbrella . Mikes coffee bar is great with little snacks in the fridge you can help yourself to. The rooms are of good standard, could do with a full length mirror though. Trips are plentiful if wanted, we booked one trip through our rep Wendy, she was very good at her job. we went on little speed boats through the mangroves and out to sea where weather permitting you can have a snorkle. We got our own taxi to Player del carmen , a very busy place , if you like shopping I'm sure you'll love it , but you do tend to get hassled along the way. On the whole we enjoyed our stay at the OM and thought it was good value for money. One last thing the weather was very very HOT and we were lucky and saw very little rain.

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing”
Reviews.Author: keith a
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just got back and we had the best holiday ever. The hotel is excellent we can't find a single fault . The rooms are first class the food is first class and the staff were also first class. The entertainment staff were exceptional racardo,nely,polo,and ramon just to name a few . We went to CoCo Bongo with nely she looked after us all night it was fantastic we had our own space and bar waiter the show's were great. All the staff were very friendly claudia and alfredo were our favorites we would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: mom2boyzX2
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice, just like it appears on the website, the Privileged Jr Suite . Our check in experience was wonderful. I can't remember her name but she provided the BEST service we received during our stay. It was my husband's birthday while we were down there and she gave us complimentary wine and cake during our "special dinner" to celebrate his big day. We arrived late afternoon and were starving after traveling all day so we ordered room service, it was okay, however it took 2 days for the maids to remove the dishes from our room. We did choose the upgrade to Privilege and thoroughly enjoyed the Bali beds on the beach as well as the variety of drinks for us to choose from (including Crown Royale, Skyy Vodka, Sapphire Gin, Jager, Jack Daniels, among others...no redbull). Upon touring the grounds we did notice a beautiful waterfall, plants and flowers. There was also a family of some sort of lemur living outside our room. Daily the mom, dad, and babies would come out to play in the yard and they were very fun to watch! We also passed a few lizards on the walk to and from the beach and pool. The food is good, it's not 5 star so as long as you don't go with super high expectations you will be satisfied. Our favorite meal was at the Mexican Restaurant, El Charro, the guacamole was pretty fantastic. We also enjoyed the Japanese (a touch salty) and Italian, the buffet was our least favorite, although there is a lot of variety and made to order options. It seemed as though they were reusing the fry oil because things that were cooked in it just had a weird taste to them. The beach is nice!! I was so worried based on other peoples' reviews that it would be disgusting however it wasn't at all. The water was warm and we swam in it, along with others. We took walks along the beach to the other hotels as well. We didn't do any of the water sports but it appeared others had a great time sailing and renting the jet skis. One day there was quite a bit of seaweed that washed up however both our hotel and the ones on either side worked diligently to clean the beach for the guests, early in the morning. Don't let the boardwalk/wall of the Privilege Area bother you. It is a beautiful view and a VERY SHORT walk to the open beach area. There is also a pier. Our favorite thing, hands down, was the pool. It had a nice swim up bar with friendly bartenders who showed everyone equal attention and we never waited long for a drink (make sure to bring your own cup from home...I recommend the Turvis Tumbler). We played pool volleyball daily and my husband played corn hole on the pool patio. There is also ping pong, water aerobics, water polo and dancing to participate in and around the pool. There was entertainment nightly and our favorite was the Grease musical. It was very entertaining and I sang along with all of the songs. The only small concern is that there isn't any AC or even a fan in the auditorium so it was quite uncomfortable by the time the show was over. Finally, our one and only issue. We purchased a transfer to and from the airport through bookit.com for Best Way Travel to shuttle us back and forth. While neither of these companies have anything to do with the hotel, there is an employee of Best Way Travel that frequents the hotel to assist with travel arrangements. Our representative didn't show up on multiple occasions when we had scheduled appointments to meet with him. This would in no way reflect upon the hotel however the hotel staff lied to us and told us that he was there and we just missed him, basically accusing us of being crazy and that we had sat in the lobby for over 45 minutes, with another couple, and he was there the whole time. When we finally got in touch with him he admitted that he hadn't been there on the previously established time frames and he did apologize. It really wouldn't have been that big of a deal if 3 different members of the staff at the hotel hadn't tried to cover up for him. This hotel was definitely worth it for the value and I would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ashlandite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Ocean Maya Royale for 6 nights. We really enjoyed this resort and would likely visit again. The rooms are in individual structures, 8 units to a structure. We lucked out and were in the 900 block so the walk to the beach was only 50yds. If you stay, try to secure a higher numbered room(closer to the beach!!) The food was above average to good with the oriental restaurant being the best. There is not alot of selection for eating, Oriental, Italian or Mexican. What wasn't explained to us is the limited beach areas. The property that fronts the ocean is blocked by a man made concrete pier with a wooden walkway across. Access to the ocean is on either side of this pier. The railing does not obsruct your view of the ocean but does hinder access. There is a nice area to the right side with palapas and lounge chairs. We are not big on swimming pools, figuring we can swim in a pool anywhere. There is alot of seaweed washed up constantly. They have an employee, whe every day would work with rakes and a wheel barrow to remove this. His name was Carlos and he was very nice but spoke limited english. I tipped him on two occasions and he was thrilled. Would we return to this resort, yes, but, there are so many other places to experience. A nice resort for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: MBD82
Reviews.Content: Where to start! My wife and I went to the Ocean Maya for two weeks for our honeymoon and from the moment we arrived to the minute we left, we loved it. Check in was swift and we got given a cocktail while we were waiting and once we were checked in our suitcases were taken to our room. The food was brilliant, we ate in each of the resturants twice (Italian 3 times) and the buffett every other night. We generally ate about 7.30pm and never had to queue. The staff are amazing - they work so hard, such long hours for around 8 Euros a day so really do appricate being tipped (personal desiscion whether you do or not - it's not expected) The entertainment in the evening wasn't the best but thats not what we came for, the staff that do the shows are not employeed for that so do the best they can. Occasionally they get in outside entertainment whcih was good. There are lizards around but don't be scared of them! If you get too close they just leg it! We did get a tiny gheko in our room but he was no trouble - again, soon ran off if we got too close. The sea was a bit cloudy the first 2 days we were there but this is due to storms, and once the rain stoped it soon cleared up and became cyrstal clear. We walked up and down the beach and the beack here is probably one of the better ones! The drinks were great to and we tried our best to get through the cocktail menu but I got stuck on uppercuts and XYZ's! They certainly don't skimp on the alcohol depsite what some may have said! All in all, I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and would certainly go back! I just wish Mexico was closer than the 10 hour flight!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed but needs improvement in some areas”
Reviews.Author: CoupleInLoveWales
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon and found they went further for us knowing this. We Had a privileged book in, a bottle of champagne and handmade sweets in our room. We got an orange band that meant we could book the specialty restaurants which was a massive bonus and even got the honeymoon room for the last 2 nights of our stay which was lovely. Rooms- Great size room, very large bed which was really comfortable, good tv, mini bar which was filled up most days with 2 x waters, 2 x coke, 1 x sprite, 1 x fanta and 2 x beer. Great shower, sofa and 2 chairs on the balcony. Specialty restaurants- The Italian was amazing. Great choice, amazing flavors, really enjoyed. Went many times. Recommend. The Japanese al-la-cart and the show were again both amazing. Gorgeous flavors and great atmosphere. Chefs who do the shows are fantastic. The Mexican was unfortunately disappointing. The meat was cooked nice but there was no flavor. There was no spice, no seasoning just plain. Buffet restaurants- There was a wide range of choice for breakfast. Lunch was the same thing and found it was cold in the snack bar. Evening meal was standard, and we found there was a long cue between 8 and 10. We usually went around 7. Drinks- A fair choice and full of alcohol. Staff- Very friendly. Found they would do anything for you and constantly smiling and happy. Never moaned and so so polite. Dressed very smart. A*** Entertainment- Some of the entertainment was fantastic. The had professionals in to do a Mayan dance which was great. The had a band in one night and put glow sticks on everyone. They had a DJ and decorated the courtyard in blue and pink lights. The entertainment staff worked so hard and all day. The evening entertainment they provided was ok. You could tell they didn't have much time to practice. Swimming pools/pool area- There are 2 swimming pools. An active one with a pool bar and a quieter one. Never over crowded. Sometimes difficult to get a sunbed around the pool but we always managed. Umbrellas are like gold dust. The sunbeds weren't very comfortable unless you were in the privileged section. They had a big dip in them and you sank in them when you sat down. Cleanliness- The hotel was very clean. The cleaners worked all day and did a great job. Room service- Had a small menu to choice from. When it came it was cold unfortunately. The spa- We had a couples massage. Was nice but average. There was a quiet, silent room which was amazing with some beds in there and a meditation section which was lovely. Air con- The bedrooms had great air con. The buffet and Italian restaurant was hot unless you were in the privileged section. The Japanese was cool. The Mexican had no air con. The lobby had some fans. Sometimes it was too hot and put you off your food. The mosquitoes out there are a bit of a pain. Got bit bad early morning. Overall, nice hotel but needs some improvement in certain areas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the Negative Comments...unless you are expecting the Waldorf Astoria!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTeacher80
Reviews.Content: I am currently still at the ocean maya but took the time to look out for all the people just like me who stalked trip advisor daily to decide whether I made the right choice or not...I did!! This place is fabulous...the rooms are clean and nice, the grounds are impeccable, the pools are awesome, the food is soo yummy, the staff is awesome!! This is a perfect vacation for everyone for any reason-stress, get away from the kids, etc it doesnt matter. Now to address all those ludacrious negative comments, alot of the issue are things the hotel cant handle-the heat is unbearable but they cant control that, the wildlife and insects-we ran into iguanas, raccoons, etc and I was running for my life, the mosquitoes helped themeselves to our whole bodies, but once again, not the hotel's fault, the sheets could be softer and smoother but we slept like babies EVERY night!, I'm not sure what the complaint was on the food, everytime we went to the buffet, there were different choices, and about the breakfast complains, u can only eat so much for breakfast so whats the problem? My suggestions: take alot of sunscreen/sunblock, insect repellent even the off for outside, place it in your room so u dont get bit when you're sleeping, if you dont care about selected areas on the beach or premium drinks then dont bother with the priviledge option-we came in regular and get the priviledged for the last 2 days and see no big difference. The staff is awesome and will work to make your stay beautiful. If you have time take the $20 taxi ride to playa del carnen for an awesome day at the beach, shopping, good food and drinks, and the best $25 massages-dont forget to bargain! Take my word for it...just go!

Reviews.Title: “Very nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Spent the first two weeks of August at the Ocean Maya Royale, and had an excellent holiday there. The staff were all very friendly without exception but particularly Claudia who looked after us in the restaurants and was always smiling, Ivonne who brought us every drink we could want whilst at the pool and Hector who seemed to be everywhere. There were loads more who gave that little bit extra to make our holiday special. The accommodation was clean and spacious with air conditioning in the room that worked extremely well and we had no problems with the servicing. The grounds were beautifully kept and we enjoyed seeing the variety of wildlife in the gardens. We visited all three themed restaurants and found the food quality to be very good as well as the main buffet area which had a very wide selection. The coffee bar in the lobby was also first class. Our only slight issues were the lack of air conditioning in the main restaurants and the lobby bar which meant spending time there was uncomfortable, and the quality of the sunbeds and the lack of mattresses does not match the otherwise excellent facilities. Unfortunately these reasons would make us think twice about returning so hopefully the management will rectify these small issues. Finally thanks to Jeff and Janie from North Carolina for the good time we spent together.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: Alysonanderson
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had a lovely time In Mexico and would recommend any one as a couple to go here x

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort and staff !”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusVacaygirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I who frequent Mexican all inclusive resorts stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale resort from 7/30-8/6/11. I first want to recognize some of the staff who made our stay particularly enjoyable, though I am somewhat reluctant to do this as EVERYONE was wonderful and I hate to leave anyone out ! Prior to arriving to Ocean Maya, we had some difficulty arranging our airport/resort transportation. Maria Lopez was instrumental in taking care of these arrangements so we wouldn't have to worry about it. She also called while we were there to make sure everything was fine and I had an opportunity to meet her. We decided to add the "privilege service" and felt that it was worth it. Much thanks to Claudia who took care of all our daily privilege services ! We were able to make dinner reservations, have access to a wide array of top shelf spirits and my favorite, the beds on the beach with the attentive service of Azucena ! She was amazing, anticipating and taking care of all our needs. The food was very good with the Mexican restaurant, Charros, being my favorite and the Japanese one a close second. Italian restaurant was good also(stick with Italian selections). Claudia at the Italian restaurant always had a big smile along with the wait staff. Alberto and Ingrid in Charros were very sweet . Imelda and Isabella were also great staff. Our personal favorite was Vicente. He provided us incredible service every morning and sometimes later in the day always remembering what we liked ! Spent much of our time on the beds however, we did go on a katamaran ride with Douglas - it and he were amazing ! We loved talking with Douglas as we coasted in the beautiful blue waters ! Also took an hour long snorkeling trip. Can't remember the staffs' names but it was one of the best snorkeling trips I've ever experienced - all kinds of fish and coral- well worth it ! Daniel from Italy was also a pleasure to talk to and share information. The pool/entertainment staff, along with bartenders, and towel staff in the pool area were great ! Enjoyed the water aerobics-leader was very funny ! Had a good time talking with Fernanda who was very friendly and personable. We both had the deep tissue massages in the gorgeous spa. Receptionist, Mercedes and Vienna did a fantastic job ! Just about every evening, hearing Juan the saxophonist/flutist was a treat ! As we are early risers and crash early, being able to relax with an after dinner drink and be entertained was nice. With regard to the nightly shows, we only attended one as we retire early. Staff worked really hard but the lack of air conditioning made it tough(we talked to staff about this and they are working to resolve this problem). We have heard people complain about the beach. I have no complaints. Yes, there are some dark spots close to shore on a short stretch of the beach, but all you have to do is walk about 5 minutes to the right and the water is incredibly clear. All in all it was a great vacation, particularly for the price and I would highly recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & A Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjkreading
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a fortnight at the Ocean Maya with a family of 6 (youngest was 18 as the hotel has stopped taking children from this year which is a shame). The entry to the hotel is impressive as when you come off the main road there is a long drive through almost sub-tropical jungle. We had a speedy registration and were taken to our villa block (the rooms are all in similar villa buildings housing about 6 bedrooms). The rooms were all in very good condition (recent refurbishment). Large beds, sofas, flat screen cable television, very efficient air conditioning, patio overlooking the immaculate gardens. The bathroom was large although no bath and shower only. Cleaning standards were very good throughout our stay. The hotel beach has attracted criticism from some reviewers. I could find nothing wrong with it. There were 2 entries to the sea (a decking has been built over part of the sea). No rocks to speak of, although plenty of seaweed! There were 2 good size swimming pools (one with a swim up bar) that appeared to be very clean. Sunbeds availability was no problem (although rather uncomfortable). People did seem to get up early to place towels on them but we normally hit the pool / beach area about 11.00 and we always got 6 beds by the pool or on the beach. There were plenty of umbrellas for shade from the sun. The all inclusive package was very good. It was 24 hours and covered the restaurants, bars, room service and all non-motorised water sports. We also had a free mini-bar in our room which was restocked daily (our travel rep said that it was only UK tourists that received this service?). There was an active entertainments team with plenty of beach sports and shows every night. Food was good. The main buffet restaurant had plenty of choice and also 2 cooking stations. One was for pasta and the other was to cook any food of your choice available (usually steak, pork chops, fish, chicken etc). There was a Japanese restaurant where you could have a small table or sit around the cooker with show cooking going on. Japanese food is not to my personal taste but it would be enjoyable for many. The Italian restaurant (the original Italian by the beach burnt down earlier in the year and it is now a sectioned off part of the main buffet restaurant) was good (although my daughter was disappointed that there was no pizza on the menu!). The Mexican restaurant by the swimming pools was excellent. The service there was top class and make sure that you experience the making of their Tequila coffees (a lot of flames are involved). There was no need to book for the a la carte restaurants and you could visit them as many times as you like during your stay. There are a few down sides. No air conditioning in the main restaurant or lobby made it somewhat uncomfortable. We had a couple of problems with room service. My daughter’s television was not working when we arrived and it took to the next day to have it fixed and this was after I went to reception to get an explanation for the inactivity. Same daughter also found that her towels had not been replaced one day and phoned reception to inform them. They were not provided until the following day (had I known at the time I would have paid another visit to reception myself). The common factor with the service issues was Reception but in general the service at the hotel was very good especially in the restaurants. They did struggle sometimes to find a table to accommodate a party of 6 and I did have to demonstrate a couple of times how to put 2 tables together! Some reviewers have complained about the smell in the grounds. There is an occasional sulphur type odour but the hotel and travel rep assured everyone that it was the mangroves and not sewage. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay at the Ocean Maya (apart from the mosquitoes so take plenty of spray) and I would certainly recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, badly let down by poor management. Could be GREAT with the right management and upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this resort in late July. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves, and our stay, however there were many small issues which, if corrected would make this an INCREDIBLE resort. Lack of onsite management seems to be the main problem, presumably compounded by lack of interest from corporate management. Room was very nice, clean, comfortable bed, good shower (which leaked onto the floor if the water was allowed to spray against the glass door), airconditioning worked well, and we slept well - once that is we had dealt with the clouds of mosquitos which invaded our room everytime we opened the door. Our request for the hotel to do something about the mosquitos was responded to by them sending an employee with a large spray; he sprayed the room, and not a single mosquito was killed, clearly the bug spray they use does not work. Frustrated, later in the evening we drove to the Oxxo store on the main road outside the hotel and bought a can of Raid - came back, sprayed, and 20 minutes later we had solved the problem. We continued to spray the room ourselves every day, and kept the mosquitos away. Yes, it is mosquito season - we live in Yucatan, and are very familiar with this fact - our big complaint however was the failure of the hotel to have effective control in place. I requested to speak to the duty manager in the evening around 8pm, to discuss the problem, however was informed that he had 'gone home' and would be back tomorrow. What kind of hotel of this size has no manager on duty at 8pm?? The pools and beach areas were pleasant and well maintained; as many other reviewers have noted, the sun beds are terrible, and badly in need of replacements. We enjoyed the pool bar, and drank mojitos there each day... Food - we found in general the food to be average, and it seemed to be bland and uninteresting, presumably to attempt to cater for the rather diverse nationalities represented in the guests. By so doing, it basically meant that none of the food was very good. We ate one evening in each of the restaurants, and were unimpressed with the Mexican or Italian a la carte options. The Oriental restaurant was the best of the three, rating slightly above average... Table management seemed poor, at times there was a wait for a table when the restaurant was half empty; it seems to me that this was due more to lack of staff than any other reason. We did not participate in any activities or night entertainment, so cannot comment on them. Staff in general were friendly but detached, we did not get a 'wow' feeling from anyone, despite the fact that we both speak Spanish (and my partner being Mexican). The best thing about the resort is the fact that it is Adults Only - makes for a lovely quiet atmosphere, with no screaming kids or babies! A big plus in my opinion... Overall we had a good time, but were disappointed in many aspects. I will be contacting H10 headquarters with my suggestions for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise awaits!”
Reviews.Author: RoseyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Maya Riveria yesterday!! We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale which is an amazing resort!! We had an ocean view room right by the pool which was great for getting to and from the pool area as well as the beach which is within footsteps of the pool!!! The grounds are lush and beautifully tropical and the food was enjoyable! This is a wonderful resort if you are looking to relax and have a good time!! The staff at this resort were friendly and wonderful. In particular, Jose Manuel Perez MDZ was always smiling and offerred impeccable service! He made us feel very comfortable and was great to see him every day! Hector was friendly and always had a kind smile! The rooms were comfortable and very clean! The grounds and pool areas are well kept and always clean! The only two recommendations I would make are to please install air conditioners in the restaurants (only the Japanese restaurant had a/c) and to put screens on the doors to prevent the mosquitoes from entering the rooms. Despite this, we had a wonderful time!! The rooms were quiet and always clean. I would definitely go back to this resort and recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover18
Reviews.Content: Visited for my birthday at the end of July. Hotel was excellent location and not overlooked or crowded by other hotels. Staff were excellent and friendly. Weather was very hot, clouds one day which we were happy to see as cooled it down slightly. Food good, not 5* in main buffet restaurant or lunches but good 4*. Japanese and Italian restaurants very good better quality with waiter service. Mexican restaurant in evenings also good. Standard hotel rooms big enough for 2 and were very clean. Only real criticism would be sunbeds as the standard beds were really poor quality - basically they were White plastic with old blue plastic webbing which was all out if shape and really not the 5* quality as I would expect wooden with decent foam mattresses (that type you get if you upgrade to premium which I think is poor for standard 4* rated hotel). 2 decent pools which were welcomed after the heat. Evening entertainment was average, expect to have early nights as we could not bring ourselves to watch as it was rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend to friends and absolutely go back.”
Reviews.Author: mousie1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided at the last minute to change our local beach trip to a resort in Mexico. After checking out prices and many trip advisor reviews, we decided on Ocean Maya Royale and believe it or not, the price of the stay was comparable to our local beach trip. We stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale for 5 nights from July 30th -August 4, 2011. The resort was great and met our expectations, especially for the price. All the pictures on the resort web site were true to form, very beautiful. Upon arrival, we got upgraded to a Privilege room as all the deluxe rooms were filled. We were asked if we wanted to purchase the privilege package(which includes room service, beds on the beach, air conditioned dining in the buffett etc) but once we said no, we were never asked again. Our room had a view of the villas which although not a sea view, was nice. The bed itself had a foam mattress topper and was not comfortable to me but it was tolerable for 5 nights. The fitted sheets were like sand paper. We found it better to sleep on the top sheet as it was not as worn. The room had a mildew odor which I understand can be common at many beach resorts. We requested an air freshner in the room but never received it. As soon as a left the front desk for the request, I knew it wasn't going to be taken care of as the staff was friendly but didn't seem to take my request for an air freshner seriously. I just bought some inscents when we went on the shopping trip into Playa del Carmen (which was very hard to find) and that seems to help a lot. So you may want to pack your favorite air freshner plug ins or scented candles from home in case your room has that issue. There was great AC in our room and the shower always had consistent hot water. The mini bar stocked with water, beer, sodas and liquior was nice. We had to ask a few times for it to be refilled but it was always done promptly. Unlike some resorts we'd been to, where there was constant harrassment to buy things and purchase excursions, we did not experience that at Ocean Maya. You may be asked to purchase your excursions through your travel agency or airport transfer company. If not, there is a tour agent that is always in the lobby 7am to 5pm that can book you on a tour of your liking. We purchased the Tulum tour for $43 per person that included our transportation, entrance fee and guide. I read on trip advisor that others just took a taxi to Tulum and paid for the entrance fee and a tour guide when they arrived. I can't imagine the taxi being cheaper as it was a long trip. The Tulum beach area was great. After being taking the tour in the scorching heat, it was nice to get into the clear blue water- so wear your bathing suit. There is nowhere to change once you enter the ruins. We also took a wonderful fishing trip at Maroma Paradise and were very pleased. The food was good at La Hacienda, the buffett restaurant, with different varieties for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
