The a la cart speciality restaurants were very nice-Mostly the atmosphere than the food. But as far as the food, I enjoyed the Mexican and Japanese restaurants the best. There were plenty of iguanas and racoon type creatures roaming about but none of them bother you. Take some bug spray as you will need it especially at night if you hang out anywhere on the resort (your room, the lobby area, the entertainment theatre) but that is to be expected- just be prepared! The staff throughout the resort were friendly. Do remember to bring cash as it is just necessary, although the resort states that tips are included, to tip those that provide good service. There were a few that on our last day/night we sought out to give a tip to because they were consistently friendly to us. The tips although just a few dollars seems to be very appreciated. You will need your cash on the excursions for tipping the bus drivers and excursion guides. The resort offers free transportation into Playa del Carmen for shopping that you must book a reservation on a day in advance. The shopping trip had a tour guide to give you history on the area and lead you to a store to hear about Tequila making and give you samples, if you wish. There were nightly shows and events. The Coco Bongo staff work hard to get you involved in activities at the pool and in the evening at the shows. It's kinda funny to see the pool volley ball leader dancing in the show at night but it was entertaining. Two pools were always warm and very nice. One quiet and one lively most of the day. The beach was nice to look at but not clear blue. In fact, it was very not blue at all, more brown. I never got in. The gym was small but nice. It had everything in it that you would need for a workout. I regret not utilizing the spa services as it seemed to be a lot of services offered for great prices like the couples massage for $160 US dollars. Sure there were things that could have been better (better mattress and sheets, no mildew smell) but overall, Ocean Maya is a beautiful resort with great atmosphere, good food, friendly staff and reasonably priced- It has a lot of potential to be a five star.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent time, but still came away disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Andy-T-87
Reviews.Content: With it's 5 star rating and new refurbishment, my partner and I expected a high quality hotel which we had obtained a two week holiday at for an excellent price. I many areas this was the case as in the first week we were very happy with the hotel. It wasn't until the second week that cracks started to appear and we noticed that the hotel was lacking in areas although it has the potential to be a quality hotel. Location: We felt the hotel was located in a great place. It is a 15-20min taxi journey (which only costs 200 pesos/£14) to Playa del Carmen centre. It is also only 35-45mins away from Cancun which has many attractions and the airport (the first stop of the airport transfer). Front desk service: We thought the guys at the front desk were excellent throughout our holiday. They have a doorman system where when you leave the hotel (unless you have checked out) they take down your room number to ensure you return. The reception team are there 24hrs a day and the few times we had to deal with them, they made sure we were seen to asap. Main hotel area: This part of the hotel we never really understood. We called it an open planned lobby (don't know the correct term), but basically the hotel doesn't have a front door and only has large sliding doors on the beach side for when there is wind and rain. Now in Mexico it is usually around 100% humidity and 30oC, coupled with this open plan, there is no value in using air conditioning. At night, when you just want to chill with a beer/cocktail, it is impossible as it gets so hot and unbarable as there is no respite from the humidity. We felt that if they could find a way to cool that area down, then the place would be perfect as if has many comfortable seats and a great bar service with guys willing to do most drinks you like as well as running a nightly snack service between 23:30 and 6:00. There is also a shop and free wifi which comes in handy from time to time. Food: Attached to the main lobby is the main buffet restaurant (which is also temporarily home to the Italian a la carte). Here, we were greeted every morning and night by a host/hostess who were always helpful and friendly, we would be seated and then greeted by a waitor/waitress who would get you anything at all. We met a couple and one of them was gluten intolerant and a veggie. Everytime they came in a waitor would show them what they couldn't have so they didn't eat anything they shouldn't (they were also provided a printed piece of paper explaining this in Spanish so there wouldn't be any confusion). We felt that the food was great to start with but we found that by the second week, we had already eaten everything at least once before and therefore got very tired of hotel food by the time we left. They have some great ideas, but again, we felt that the hotel isn't meeting it's potential in this area. We found that we ate some of the best food we have had, but also the worst which shouldn't happen in a 5 star hotel. Highlights included, fantastic beef from a barbeque, great selection of fruit and salad and also terrible, processed cheese (I like my cheese) and 'cuts of meat' that was definately from a Tesco Value pack. (6-7/10) There are 3 'a la carte' restaurants (Italian, Japanese and Mexican) we only managed to try the Italian and Japanese. We were not impressed with the Italian what so ever. When I eat Italian, I expect, tomatoe, cheese, garlic etc. Like I said before, processed cheese, not much of a tomatoe taste in the bolognese sauce and no taste of garlic in any of my dishes. We tried this once, never again. However, it was always really busy, so maybe it is the liking of others. (4/10) The Japanese al a carte however is fantastic. It runs on a Mon, Wed, Fri and Sat. We went there twice and we would have done it every night if we could. Sushi, rice, meat, soup, all tasted fantastic and the 'ambience' was lovely. I would recommend this to anyone going to the hotel. One tip: get there before 19:00 otherwise you won't get in, it is that busy. (9/10) Lastly, there is a lunchtime restaurant that is open from 11:00 - 17:00 which is good for a late breakfast and for lunch. Much like the main restaurant but has chips, pizza, nachos etc. We liked this restaurant as it served something different everyday and when we got peckish we could go there easily as it is right by the 'quiet' pool. (8-9/10) Room: When we arrived we were very happy with the room, it was cool due to a good air con. We had two double beds in our room which wasn't entirely to our liking but there are ways to make them into one big bed which we ended up doing. The shower and toilet are in a separate room, shower was lovely although the hot water was tempermental at times. One scary thought was the toilet. Because they haven't updated their drainage system yet, they ask for you to put as little toilet paper down the toilet, instead providing you with a bin?!? I hardly fulfilled this request. There is then a door which doesn't have a lock, more a divider on a hinge to my partners 'prep area' where there was a big mirror and a sink. This was never a problem for us. We had a perfectly sized wardrobe (take some of your own hangers), which has a safety deposit box in it which is locked with a key. It also houses an iron and board. There was a TV which had cable channels which were mainly in Spanish but had some English speaking programmes on. A fridge was in the room which was stocked up daily with soft drinks, beer and water (which is free to use for all British guests only). An alarm clock, telephone and dressing gown with slippers were also provided. We went on our anniversary which my partner had informed them of and they provided use with chocolates and sparkling white wine (which they classed as champagne). We only experienced two problems, the sheets, like others have mentioned can be like sleeping on sand paper. My partner is quite fussy with what she sleeps on and she had to discard them everynight and sleep on another (you get 3 per bed). It was only because of this that we came across our 2nd problem. One night she noticed blood stains on the sheet which was new and supposedly cleaned. We were gutted by this so we informed our rep this following morning (who was fantastic by the way) and they were changed instantly. All in all, very comfortable and to our liking. (8/10) Pool/Beach area: There is a towel service which you get a towel card each and you can swap or collect between 08:00 - 18:00. There are two pools in the hotel, one is the 'quiet' one, the other not so. The not so one is where the pool bar is (which you can swim to and sit at) and where all the music is played. This was great for the first couple of days when you're adapting to the heat and wanted to bathe in the water with a beer. However, you do have to put up with the party go-ers, they 'own' the area and we found were very loud, so wouldn't recommend that area if you're trying to relax. The second pool is a lot quieter and where you find most couples chilling in and the one we usually used. Both were pretty clean although they collected sand from the pillocks who walked straight into it from the beach. Beach area is ok, the sunbeds need replacing as most of them don't have support, so if you have back problems, I would recommend an early start each day to select a good bed. Sand was pretty much as clean as it could be but many ants are around that bite so I would watch out for them and maybe wear repellant. I wouldn't recommend going into the sea, this area of Mexico has been hit hard by the BP oil spill and visible oil is still washing up on the shores all the way down the Riviera Maya. If you want a beach holiday with a nice sea, go to Cancun, doesn't seem to be that affected. (7/10) Entertainment: There is a hotel entertainment team who are brilliant. The guys who mix in with everyone are all great and will do anything to make sure you enjoy your hols. During the day they provide beach and water volleyball, water polo, football and drinking games (e.g. beer drinking contest, which weren't too 'spring break-ish'). They also take guests to Coco-Bongos as they have their own VIP area but we didn't do this. At night, the entertainment lacks substantially. There is saxophone player that you will hear the first night you get there and every night after. If he isn't performing that night then he is in the restaurant providing background music and it does grate on you after a while. After him there are also acts from professional acts and the entertainment team. All shows are good but it seemed they didn't have any real structure as two shows were performed twice when we were there. They have a big theatre with a stage and we felt that this was another huge disappointment as it wasn't reaching its potential. (6/10) Misc: The most bizarre thing about the hotel is the Priviledge service. This is an upgrade split into two sections, a room and service upgrade or a service upgrade. We did neither but for what we could see, for $50 per person per night you can get a suite and the service, for $25 per person per night you can get the service which just didn't seem worth it. You get padded beds on the beach, branded drinks and pre-bookable options for the a la carte restaurants. The annoying thing about the presence of this service is that the hotel feels they have to find things to make it worth the money, which also includes air conditioned rooms in the restaurant. Why the hotel would want to include this for just Priviledge customers is beyond me. Don't understand the service and why it is in place, for £250 each for two weeks, it just ain't worth it, I hope they get rid of it soon. Overall, this hotel is good to very good. With help from the travel companies and customer feedback, this hotel could be one of the best in Playa del Carmen, the bits I have mentioned could be easily rectified, hence the reason for our disappointment. I wouldn't go out and about and recommend it (yet!) but I certainly wouldn't want to put people off the hotel because it helped us have an excellent two weeks in Mexico. (8/10) Tips: Take insect repellant and apply liberally every evening and when going on coach journeys. Take an extra beach towel Take a small bottle of high factor sun cream as it is difficult not to burn Gents, don't take trousers!! Not needed for restaurant as shorts are allowed and it is far too hot and humid to wear them, even at night, trust me! Ladies, my partner suggests, do not take long dresses unless 'flowey' as again it is too hot and humid to withstand wearing them. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok”
Reviews.Author: KPall
Reviews.Content: We went as a group of 4 couples for our 30th birthdays. Upon getting to the hotel, impressed with the beauty of the grounds and all the plant life and colors on the building. The facility is just breathtakingly gorgeous. Disappointed with the front desk staff though as they did not place us near eachother as they promised when we first arrived. Rooms were great but there was only air conditioning in one of the restaurants, made it so you weren't even very hungry bc you were so hot. Hibachi grill at the Japanese restaurant is a must! Delicious, we went there twice bc yummy and air conditioned. :) Hosts and hostesses were rather irritated that we had a group of 8 and that we all wanted to sit by one another, seemed like a reasonable request to me. Food was ok, nothing to write home about, poolside grill blah unless you like fajita meat and cheeseburgers everyday. Upgrade wasnt even offered to us but would only really be worth it for the air conditioned room you could eat in at the buffet. Liquors were good, a few more options with the upgrade. Seating at the beach not worth the upgrade either in my opinion. Pool bartenders were fantastic. Always very nice and smiling!!! Free tram to downtown Playa del Carmen also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: LOOBYLOU3
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Gatwick on 16th July. Took about 40 mins on the coach. We was the 1st to be dropped off. Check in was quick. Cool drink given to us on arrival. Had to take own case & find our room. Fine with us tho. We found a bottle of cava & a plate of small cakes in our room. It was our 1st Anniversary. Fridge was filled daily with water and a few cans. Room very spacious. Needed a long mirror in the room. I found the bed comfy. Air con very cold. Food I had no complaints. If u skipped brekie u had the snack bar by the pool or the main dining room. Drinks were strong. No complaints there. Evening entertainment was ok. There not pros but do a good job & put a lot of effort into it. Many a eve I went to bed about 2 ish because we met lovely people who enjoyed a good chat. We got the local bus into town was 30 pestos. Had to cross the busy highway outside of hotel. Ask at the front of hotel. They will guide u to nearest bus stop & explain how much a taxi is to Cancun etc. I wasnt privilege. I don't think u need to upgrade. I would go back. Enjoy your holiday & hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Please believe this review, this hotel is extremely misadvertised!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzychoo
Reviews.Content: Ok so first I'd like to say I'm not a picky traveler, I've stayed in hostels, cheap hotels, expensive hotels...everything! My boyfriend and I book a 5 night trip and upgraded to the privilege package. DONT DO IT! I have so much to say that I will just list it. 1. When we first arrived we were taken to the privilege check in and were brought a class of some really good juice concoction. Then we began the check in process and of course I began asking questions about the extra perks we were supposed to have. When I did this Claudia-the VIP check in chick acted like she had no idea what I was talking about. She gave me a 30% off coupon to the spa which I had to book within the first 24 hours. I asked her about the resort credit and she sAid that was it. She continued to look very confused when I asked her about the special dinner we were supposed to have. She basically gave me no information and actually acted a little perturbed that I asked her questions. Bad experience. 2. We were then wisked awAy to the VIP concierge who was named Nina or Dina. She seemed nice At first but I was already pretty annoyed by the false advertisement and check in process. She began asking us questions but her ultimate goal was to get us to a time share breakfast. We let her know we were interested and she said WHY? umm because we arent, she kept going and kept going and then rudely said "it's fine I can't offer u the 120 dollars anyway since u aren't married" Wow Terrible customer service! 3. The rooms are kinda as advertised, there aren't uprgrAded liqours or beers In the fridge. In fact the only kind of beer they have on the property is budweiser and some beer in a blue can. No corona no dos equis no modelo. The bathroom ammenities were also not upgraded and were terrible. Ohhh and the room service... We ordered in one night and I almost threw up! The pizza was worse than a frozen pizza and the French fries tasted like they were cooked twice! Disgusting. 4. The food, if u have any kind of taste buds you will not find this food edible! My boyfriend is an ex marine who will eat anything, and he couldnt even stomach the food. Unless your trying to lose weight this is not a hotel that values food, it puts more into the presentAtion than actual taste. Oh and al a carte here means they bring u what they want. Every single restaurant is disgusting and I found myself spitting out my food multiple times. 5. The drinks are mediocre the bartenders were friendly but they are using the cheapest liquor possible even if u bought the privilege package. 6. The pool was awesome and this is what we enjoyed the most. The beach was not crowded but it's also not clear. It's not like tulum or cancun, more like a CleAner version of the gulf. 7. There is no entertainment at the hotel we went back to our rooms early each night. The entertainment staff tries but it's really kinda boring. We Did catch one cool show with Mayan dancers. 8. Go to tulum or isla de mujeres!! We loved those places the water is beautiful and the people are lovely. 9. All in all this hotel is at best a 3 stAr the food is truly terrible and the people In the lobby are not friendly. As u get closer to the pool the stAff gets friendlier. 10. I will not stay here again nor recommend this hotel. The majority of there advertisement is false, I wish I would have listened to the reviews. We heard from another couple that excellence was good and from another that tresrios was terrible as well. Spend the extra money and stay in a true 4 or 5 star hotel. Oh the bag of chips in the lobby were 14 US dollArs.... That's all :) don't do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “brill time.all staff so friendly.good value and no children!!!”
Reviews.Author: gordon14
Reviews.Content: From what i saw no need to go privilaged...,main brands,bacardi,smirnoff available just ask,you need upgrade for jd,absolut,and pernod,so if you don't drink those 3 no problems..beds are plentiful at pool and beach,again if you want a nice white canopy in a ringed of beach area upgrade,but i did not see much reason to do so..if you are an average person looking for good holiday then you will have no problems here......if you want a black armband and like to be a top notch for all to see by all means upgrade but personnally no need!! Food...buffet choice varied and good,italian excellent,cooking demo in japanese great fun,mexican was probably3 out of 5..the midnight munchies very handy if you have night out... Entertainment staff,they all work very hard,get involved if you want, if not no problem,night shows vary,we enjoyed some nights but usual holiday stuff has to suit everyone,live band on sat night excellent. All staff very friendly and helpful,from" ola" in the morning to the smiling happy faces till last thing at night wonderful i wish i could be so happy at my work.. General all round happy place to holiday Wendy thomson holiday rep there if req but no pressure to take trips,although bit on the exspensive side the half day dolphin trip is a must.there is a fee bus to playa daily must be booked early though,taxi fixed price 200 pesos want break the bank if bus full.This is a small more friendly set up than some of the bigger hotel groups.. The gardens and areas are all very clean as are the rooms,any problems seem to be dealt with very quickly. The area seems very secure and safe and did have no worry reg safety or personnel belongings Slight negatives...the food on occasions could be hotter,they are a bit slow in refilling the hot plates,and the location is a bit far from playa about 10 miles,but good for transfers. Overall this hotel with a few tweeks will be a very good high standard hotel and i will be returning.i will also try and pass the positve feel about the place to my line of work,highly recommended.......Thanks to all for a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating- So much promise, such poor execution”
Reviews.Author: SteveColarossi
Reviews.Content: You arrive into a beautiful lobby and think all those harsh reviews can't possibly be accurate. Then you realize that the lack of clarity about the "privilege" and the high-pressure and less-than-up-front disclosure of the "H10 Premium" sales pitch leave folks frustrated. You know it's not Sandals when you book it, and you definitely know why after a few hours there. You are wisked from the check-in desk to the H10 Premium desk where you are asked about your travel plans-- she's wearing an H10 shirt so you assume she's an employee of the hotel. You will be offered an incentive (they start with a free spa treatment)-- if you hold out, you can get at least $160 for use on tours (although one couple was offered $300). You will be told that the rep will talk to you over breakfast and then give you a tour-- the sales pitch starts AFTER BREAKFAST and takes at least 2 hours. You will be given no brochures or price list for this VACATION CLUB and they will refuse to stop the pitch even after you've explained that there is just no money in the budget for it. After nearly 2 1/2 hours, I explained that they were getting very frustrating, that we had been told that the "tour" would only take about an hour and that we had had enought. If you are interested, here are some bottom line numbers--- they will sell you 20,000 RCI points (they call it a 10,000 point plan that they double), one free all inclusive week at the Ocean Maya every other year (starting the day you pay for your package) and at least 2 weeks worth of room as tthe Ocean Maya every year as well (but you will need to pay the per diem rate for the all-inclusive features). This package will cost about $7500. They will look for a 25% downpayment, but will play with that as well. Now for the actual resort-- it's tough to be entirely objective when your vacation has started with a bit of deception and some high-pressured sales tactics, but here goes some objectivity: 1. The beach is fine-- if you walk up and down the coast, you'll see that the Ocean Maya beach is fine. The Ocean Maya beach is as clean, if not cleaner, than most. 2. The pools are large and clean (although the tile could use some scrubbing and there were tiles missing at the swim-up bar). 3. Staff is great-- very friendly, all have fair skill with English and seem genuinely kind. 4. The restaurants are o.k.-- nothing great, but adequate. None of them, except for the Japenese, is adequately air conditioned-- they dont even have ceiling fans. As a result, avoid the Mexican (which has no A/C at all). 5. There is no outdoor snack bar-- which is odd for an all-inclusive. So, if you want a quick burger, or something to nibble on, you need to leave the beach or the pool, put on your sandles and shirt and trudge over to the un-airconditioned Il Charro restaurant. This, in my opinion, after the heavy-handed sales pitch, is the biggest shortfall of the Ocean Maya. And, they will stop you if you are leaving with food. As a result, and this is only my hunch, lots of folks skip lunch, which leads to a fair number of inebriated guests at the swim-up bar. 6. The "special" bracelets: The "privilege" bracelets can cost about $25/person per day. You get to sit in the air conditioned part of each dining room which is a plus and for breakfast, they wait on you (if you don't want to go to the buffet). Just because you have the privilege bracelet doesn't mean that all your drinks are necessarily made with the upgraded alcohol, so caveat emptor. Also, they "privilege" part of the beach includes padded chaises, waitress service (for drinks) and they have fruit at that part of the beach. We upgraded for our last day and it was worth it. But, if you add up a week's worth of upgrades ($300) I don't know if the Ocean Maya is as good a bargain as the other resorts. 7. POOR COMMUNICATON: The front desk is understaffed. They do not provide good written information about the privilege program and when you check-in, you'll be taking yoruself to your room (with your bags to follow). It's just not the sort of treatment one would expect from a resort. 8. ROOMS. The rooms are fine-- clean and neat. The beds are not as comfortable as most people would expect and they are actually a little short (king size width, but not length). We stayed in the standard room which would have been fine. As for the allegedly "stocked" minibar-- that is a bit of an overstatement as it included a few cans of soda, two beers and bottled water. BOTTOM LINE-- I got to spend a week on the beach with the girl of my dreams for our honeymoon. Heavy-handed vacation club sales pitches and lousy air conditioning weren't going to prevent me from having a great time. But, would I book there again-- almost definitely NOT.

Reviews.Title: “OK nothing amazing”
Reviews.Author: An_Idiot_Abroard
Reviews.Content: Just returned from H10 Ocean Maya and concur with some of the earlier posts with a few exeptions: 1. The staff are amazing and not rude in the slightest, sometimes they did struggle to pick up my accent but don't forget that they are 6,000 miles away from us. I struggle to make out what a Liverpudlian or Geordie says and they are much closer to home! 2. The rooms are of a very high standard although the beds aren't great If you have booked then don't worry!!!! The hotel is very good and we had a great time although the beach is rubbish considering the condition of nearby stretches of sand. The main problem with this hotel is the number of American p1ss cans who create an 18-30's atmosphere at the pool bar. If I wanted to see people spew on themselves in the daytime I would goto Falaraki! Food is about as good as All inclusive gets and the drinks are better than most places. The restaurant does need air con but other than that it is clean and well staffed The grounds are immaculate and so are the pools. The communal areas could do with a bit of snagging as the tiles are chipped etc. On the whole it was a decent place 4 star at best, for the older traveller it wouldn't be recomended but otherwise its a good hotel and you will have a go holiday but I doub yu'd want to go back. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LaurieL2011
Reviews.Content: me, my husband and a couple of friends stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale the week of July 24, 2011. The place was clean, staff was very kind. The food was wonderful and the entertainment was very good. A talented group of young people. They not only did a good job during the shows but were hands on during the day for all activities. We would go back there again. The only concern we had was some of the restaurants did not have air condition and it was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: doglover924
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our vacation at Ocean Maya. We both agree that we can't wait to return. From the moment that we arrived for check-in until our departure, the staff was incredibly friendly, efficient, and exceeded our expectations. The resort is beautiful and well maintained and our room was always great. The mattress was firmer than I prefer, but my boyfriend loved it. We both fall under the category of "picky eaters", however there was always something we could find to eat. The Italian restaurant was our favorite. A very sincere and heartfelt THANK YOU to everyone at the resort for making this a relaxing and memorable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: murfsmom9
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Riviera Maya seven times and we have stayed in five different resorts. We would gladly return to the previous four, but NEVER to Ocean Maya. There are far better hotels for the same, or slightly more money. We received NONE of our promised (in writing) amenities such as liquor in the mini-bar, ice in the room, bottle of Tequila, and lobster dinner to name a few. ROOMS - Feel like Motel 6. Small, one sink in the bathroom. Mis-matched furnishings. The night tables were wooden cubes that were spray painted shiny blue. There is no full length mirror in the place and I had to stand on a chair to use the make-up mirror in the bathroom. You need to be at least 5'6'' to even have a peek. The beds have no box springs - that is why they are so hard, as others have stated. They are mattresses placed on a plywood box. Yes, the sheets feel like sand paper. They would have been made into drop cloths at my house. Renovation = flat screen TV and new paint. However, our cleaning person did a fabulous job keeping the room spotless. We left her a tip every day and received plenty of towels. FRONT DESK - Forget it. It took us over two hours at check-in to receive the type of room that we had confirmation for. Confirmation from the H-10 management and Continental Vacations. Our "personal" concierge was useless. Our thermostat for the A/C had to be re-programmed two days into our stay. We called/visited the front desk four times. The nighttime room temperature was 86 degrees. The next day it was fixed by dumb luck when we ran into our waiter from the night before who asked why we were so upset as we walked back from the front desk. He promised to send a maintenance man ASAP. Less than fifteen minutes later, a nice man showed up and it took him less than five minutes to fix the problem. People at the front desk smile and nod - that's it. GROUNDS - Beautiful and well maintained. The waterfalls and flowers are exceptional. The grounds keepers are always busy, there is no trash, no empty glasses; the resort is wonderful to view. However, that beauty does not save the experience. POOLS - Beautiful as well. The entertainment staff also does a great job at making everyone a part of the fun and the activities were well received by all. BEVERAGES - We were forced to upgrade to "Privledge." As another reviewer stated, if you want to drink any alcohol that you have ever heard of, you need to upgrade. Mexican liquor was used in all of the many varieties of sweet, fruity drinks that people ordered. There is Corona on tap, if you only drink beer. We are middle-aged grown-ups and we avoid most blender made concoctions. The top-shelf stuff is right there for all to see, but unless you upgrade, it will not be yours. You need that precious black bracelet. Even Absolut Vodka is considered top-shelf. There are signs saying "Privledge" on anything that is worth drinking. Yes, we did try small bribes before we made the decision to upgrade - to no avail. FOOD - There were some above average dishes, but these were few and far between. What is listed on the menu in the Italian Restaurant as filet of beef, is actually chuck steak. Chuck was the best cut of beef served anywhere. I don't even want to know what the hamburgers were made out of. As others have said, the buffet was the same thing every day. It was difficult to even make a salad at lunch. The best choice was a grilled chicken breast with Fast Fries. Much of the food is unrecognizable. However, if you want to fill up on desserts and bread, it could work out for you. Yes, there was a lot of "slop" at the buffets. BEACH & OCEAN - We got to lay on the padded chaise lounges overlooking the Caribbean because we upgraded to Privledge. We also had waitress service that was fabulous, though we only asked for bottles of water and ice. We had our own personal ice bucket that was replenished throughout the day and snacks. It was unfair to us that all guests are not afforded this luxury. The sand is white and powdery. Some of the beaches in Playa have coarse, brown sand. There was some seaweed wash-up, but the workers did their best to rake it up. The water was cloudy throughout our stay, which is unusual for the Caribbean. We walked about two miles in each direction, and this was one of the nicest beaches. It was not small when other resorts are considered. However, whether it be oil or mangrove deposits, the water was stagnant and BLACK just 1/4 mile away from the resort. Perhaps that is why the water is cloudy - UGH. RESTAURANTS AND RESERVATIONS - We sat in the air-conditioned sections of the restaurants. The dining room was sweltering for others - even at breakfast. This is appalling, as there were some older guests who did not upgrade. We walked out of the the Mexican Restaurant. Never have we seen such poor quality Mexican food in Mexico. They actually took nacho cheese sauce and mixed it with macaroni (just picture that) and called it Macaroni and Cheese. Even Kraft out of a box looks better. The table cooking at the Oriental Restaurant was a wonderful show, but the shrimp looked and tasted like the mini shrimp out of a can. The chicken and beef were better, but everything was very salty. Minestrone soup in the Italian was wonderful, but thank God we were sitting in the air-conditioned section. We watched others fan themselves as they ate. We were allowed to make dinner reservations; every restaurant is not open every day, though. Other guests waited in line. SHADY DEALINGS - OK we upgraded to save our vacation. We were quoted two different prices to upgrade $40 or $50 per day per couple. However, we went on a time share presentation (first ever) and got the cost reduced to $105 each for eight days. The time share is not really the type of time share that we are familiar with, but a points program to use at various places. The price went from $40,000 to $7,000 as time went by. Let the Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, relaxing, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PtownKT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week & found it to be very relaxing & easy. The rooms, the grounds & the pool were all exceptionally clean. Staff was very friendly, remembered us each day & greeted us warmly. The food was good, but nothing super special. We thought the resort was so reasonable that we didn't feel bad at all about going into Playa del Carmen for dinner. The Italian restaurant is in a beautiful setting, however. The spa is beautiful. The evening entertainment did not appeal to us at all, but we weren't there for the nightlife. The only disappointment was the beach- it was very small. If you are looking for a getaway to a safe, clean, beautiful location for a sun & water getaway, and don't expect gourmet food, this fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “This group of 10 won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: hgbryson1
Reviews.Content: Breaks my heart to give a poor review - but I don't want to have someone else disappointed. Had a great time however that was b/c of the awesome group we went with - not b/c of the hotel. We knew we booked a 'budget friendly, all inclusive, adults only' resort, and didn't expect the world by any means. We're all in our 30s and 40s from North Carolina...4 couples and 2 single gals....It wasn't a horrible place but we definitely were disappointed in many areas. We've stayed at other spots (like right next door at Secrets Capri) and felt this didn't live up. Definitely would not recommend it. If you're broke and just wanting to go to Mexico, then it's fine. If you want to not have to stop at McDonalds on the way back from an excursion b/c you'd rather eat there than the resort, book another spot. (and yes we did that) Food/Restaurants: Was like a bad K&W cafeteria experience. We weren't looking for anything super exquisite, but we did expect the food to be good...it wasn't. We have all been to many all inclusive resorts and I get the whole 'mass production' idea, but this wasn't acceptable. We had one decent meal at the Hibachi Grill the final night (sitting AT the grill), but other than that, the best item was the Club sandwich from room service, which wasn't gourmet by any means. All of the restaurants were very unwilling to accommodate our group (to sit together); even after 2 left and it was just us 8. None were air conditioned which made it almost unbearable at times...and no fans might I add. No breeze either b/c of the placement of the setup...plus mosquitos also joined you for dinner. The drinks were weak, but a couple requests for extra liquor shots was never an issue - they were happy to do so. Staff: a few were very nice; some were extremely rude. Polo, Jess, Omar, Eber, Javier, Hector, and Amy = all AMAZING!!!! We would FB you if we knew your last names! Some of the staff should be fired. Very surprising as we had never had this issue before on vacations abroad. All in all, most did nothing to go out of their way to make sure you were happy or to assist you or to accommodate your request. The pool/entertainment staff were by far the friendliest (named above). When we arrived the front desk was irritated b/c we didn't have some 'ticket' we needed with our hotel reservation info on it. They found it an oddity to just simply look up our names in the system. They got irritated which of course made us irritated as we bickered with them in 100 degree temps upon arrival. Not a great first impression by any means. We got it worked out. All rooms for our group were very close to ea other which was great (requested prior). Resort seems very understaffed, which is prob why some of the ppl are so moody - they are very overworked perhaps. Room: Nice, clean, modern, spacious room. The beds were like bricks but we knew that going in. We all seemed to wear ourselves out enough during the day to sleep well with no complaints there. The showers leaked water onto the floor and our hot water went out several times but we made do. AC in the rooms froze us to death....which was fabulous! it was nice knowing we had that to come back to after sweating to death at dinner. (seriously dripping sweat) Pool: 2 pools....the one pool bar was only one sided and usually only staffed by 1 or possibly 2 bartenders; extremely difficult to get a drink - again, we made do with our thermoses we brought from home. (DEFINITELY BRING YOUR OWN THERMOS) We didn't see a need at all to upgrade to the black band privilege status. The boys wanted it b/c of the nicer liquor, but again, we made do. The only other benefit we saw was the ability to use the cabanas - which were in a place with no breeze, and you could eat in a separate room in a couple of the restaurants....again, not a big deal for us. We grabbed chairs before 8AM ea morning and no one ever messed w/ our stuff or tried to take the chairs. Beautiful view of ocean from pool. Beach: Water was dark and dirty - we stayed at the pool. Sand was white and pretty but the shore wasn't spectacular by any means. Grounds/Vegetation: Beautiful. Very manicured, beautiful plants and paths. Loved seeing the iguanas, raccoons, and lemurs around the place. Night Entertainment: We enjoyed it b/c we made friends w/ the entertainment staff and it was comical to see them do the shows. We visited Isla Muheras (the island of beautiful women)....catamaran tour, snorkeling, shopping, buffet, etc.....fabulous excursion. $80 (all day, all alcohol/drinks/food included) We also went to Selvatica for zip lining, ATVing and swimming in a sink hole....SO much fun....best part of the trip. Would recommend to everyone. $110 (approx 6 hrs) DEFINITELY GO!!!! You also get a buffet there (included) and it was by FAR the best meal of the trip...the staff there completely goes above and beyond to make sure you have a great time. So all in all, it was an excellent trip b/c of our group - we could have fun in a hole!....however we would never return here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: CM2-1106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took this trip with another couple. A fun week long all-inclusive getaway!! Right? Wrong. Day 1: Pool bar ran out of ice. OK... we waited about 15 mins, gave up, ordered a beer and swam away. A few minutes later, I hear a blender. I swim up, ask for my drink and am told that I can not have it b/c "We are closed." I said "No, I have been waiting on this drink for over 30 minutes and I want it." He made me (and my friend) a NON-alcoholic version of the drink we'd been waiting on. 2nd full day - We are having b-fast with the sales person (This is a vacation package kind of place... sort of like a timeshare) to hear the pitch to join H10. I asked for champagne. "We are out"... OK, I'll have bottled water "I can't give you a bottle"... "Well, what can I have?" So he brought me water in a glass. Less than 5 minutes later, a man walks from the back with a large bowl FULL of ice and champagne bottles!!!!! After touring the property, the sales person takes us for the sales pitch. He orders us a round of Strawberry Mojitos. Server leaves and returns with regular Mojitos and tells the sales guy that "We are out of strawberry." He says, "What? I get strawberry everyday. Please try to find some." Server says, "OK' then goes and sits in a booth with another server!!! 3rd day - my husband was sick with diahrrea and vomiting presumably b/c he drank a bottled water from our mini-fridge that had been refilled with tap water and returned to our fridge. That is speculation, of course, but the seal was broken on the water and he assumed that I had opened it... which I hadn't. In any case, around 9am I went down to find meds and get waters for him to keep him hydrated. I asked the front desk "No, we can't give you water. That person arrives at 10" I say, "OK, please send that person to my room with water." "Sure" was my answer. I went to bfast to get my husband some food to try to eat and I asked the hostess for waters to take to the room. She did look for waters in the back but was unable to produce any. At 12:30pm, we still have NO water. I went back to the front desk and asked again. She said that the manager said that I can not have extra waters in my room. I said that I'd need to talk with the manager. I went to have lunch in the buffet and the manager came to my table. Accusingly he asked, "Why do you want so many waters, maam?" (I had asked for 6-8 bottles) I described my husbands' conditiion and said that I wanted the waters to have in the fridge so that I didn't have to walk down and have this conversation everytime he needed more water. The manager said, "Well, you can't have 6 waters. You can only have 3." He suggested I give my husband coke. Coke? Really? That turned into a heated discussion and I ended up BARGAINING with this man to get WATER for my husband. He said the waters would be brought up "right away". I am sure you can guess that these waters did not arrive right away. It was more like 530pm AND I had to argue with the worker to get the extra water promised by the manager! When I returned to the room from lunch, my husband had a fever. So, it is 1pm - he's had NO water b/c I couldn't get anyone to give me any and now he has a fever. I called the medic. I didn't know what else to do. $315 USD later, my husband did start to get better. This particular day, it took me BARGAINING with a manager for water, our friend PURCHASING water in the gift shop of an all-inclusive where we've paid to be and the medic ORDERING the staff to get us more waters for his medicenes. Absolutely ridiculous! As the title reads, the grounds truly are beautiful. They do a great job keeping the plants and wildlife up and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive at all!”
Reviews.Author: jennimulrooney
Reviews.Content: Unless you have a black bracelet, don't go. This was our 3rd time vacationing in Mexico and we were not impressed. Our room was very hot, it was only cleaned every other day, and our mini fridge wasn't restocked, even though we asked several times. The entertainment staff was wonderful, especially during the day around the pool. The food was average but nothing really stood out. The drinks were of very poor quality. We will definitely NOT be returning to the Ocean Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: tenn84
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful, relaxing resort. Great, friendly staff. Clean. Loved the hacienda style buildings. Beautiful beach. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, can't wait to go back, loved every second.”
Reviews.Author: lisa-ad-jenkins
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here between the 8 th of july till the 19 th july. First thing anyone who moans about this hotel are obviously hard to please or shall i say impossible. Service - was fantastic everyone is so friendly and will bend over backwards for you. Ana on the front desk was lovely and helpful, our maid in block 26 was brilliant our rooms were always spotless and vry vry clean, our mini bar was always filled, claudia the waitress at breakfast and serving drinks round the pool is amazing so so so nice and funny and a bloody hard worker, there are many more but il be here all day so last but not least our favourite the brilliant George the waiter in the mexican restaurant 3pm till 11pm is one of those guys tht would bend over backwards for you, example i asked him if there was any chocolate icecream as it was not in the freezer and he said give me a second, i left the restsurant to go back to the pool as george was busy, half an hour later he found us by the pool with chocolate icecream in a cup with a cone that he went out his way to get for me :0) tht is service. Say hi to george from adam and lisa thanks. Rooms- all decorated modern and all vry clean and well maintained. Pools- fantastic - There ars two pools one thts fun and lively and one thts quiet and chilled. Beach- Was ok, some days clearer then others which did not bother us as if u walk 5 to 10 mins up the beach to the left u will find a lagoon crystal clear water its beautiful. Food- was good and my boyfriend is a vry fussy eater and he enjoyed the food. Two things to try tht was our favourite mexican restaurant have the fillet steak and the japanese tapeyake restaurant. Well I hoped this has helped u, I hope u enjoy ur holiday as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE TAKE TIME TO READ!!”
Reviews.Author: HackNJo
Reviews.Content: The Grounds - great very nicely kept. Rooms - Very Nice although the floors beware when wet VERY slippery, we came in after they made our room and the floor was wet and slipped, which we had experienced when we had got out of the shower. Also if you like a rock hard bed you will love this place. Food - The same thing day after day for seven days. They would have different nights like Mexican night BUT it's the same thing we had been eating. Rice, Stirfry meat, cold fries, WELL DONE burgers, flies over the fruit and vegetables, cold pizza and that is kept under light, breakfast is a whole nother story - SLOP!!! Restaurants - VERY HOT WITH NO A/C OR FANS Bars - The one at the pool stunk so bad everyday that you could not get out of the sun to enjoy a drink to save your sole because you couldn't breathe. The main bar in the lobby - POOR bartenders and VERY cheap alcohol to the point it tasted bad. Iguanas - EVERYWHERE even in your room and don't bother to call the front desk to come get them out they will just laugh at you - that is if they can understand you. Mosquitos - Worse than flies could ever be!! in you room in your clothes in the restaurants. Staff - this is interesting. When you check in they will meet you with happy faces and then send you to someone that if there is anything you need during your stay (Luis Miguel) - please come see him he will help you out. LMFAO we went to hime with two main questions "he said I don't have time right now can you come back later?" Hmmm so we went above his head to the manager and he was so so but at least he listened although after the conversation he did mention that there are MANY other hotels to stay at. Let me mention something here to you readers, My husband and I vacation alot and we had never experienced such a low life hotel as we did this past week. Now hey we have had other trips that were not all that great but we made do and had fun, this hotel NOT SO MUCH. On the plane ride home we looked at each other and all we could do is laugh and shake our heads. The only thing that we came up with is that the bell boy that took our bags to our room was the MOST happiest friendly guy. Oh yes and keep in mind this is an ADULT only hotel so at the pool Boobs everywhere....LOL that is great to those that have not hit gravity. :) Hope you enjoy your stay IF YOU GO (don't do it)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs some small improvements”
Reviews.Author: jayelkay123
Reviews.Content: We returned just over a week ago from the H10 Ocean Maya Royale. This is an adults only hotel and although it is officially a five star hotel, First Choice give it four stars which is probably more accurate. The grounds are incredibly well kept and absolutely beautiful. The pool area is lovely but there are not enough parasols around the pools so, even though the hotel was nowhere near full, there was always a bit of a rush to get a sun bed with some shade. The beach area is nice (with more sun beds with shade there than around the pools). Some of the sun beds have seen better days but, hopefully, as the hotel has only recently been upgraded they will replace them in the near future. Also, the supply of beach towels sometimes ran out during the day. The refurbished rooms are excellent and look as attractive as they do in the photos; the bathrooms are very good with a big walk in shower. We found the bed quite hard, as were the pillows, but everyone has different requirements so what was hard for us would be OK for others. One criticism was that we sometimes found the cleaning was done very late in the day (once as late as 5.00pm which is ridiculous as we wanted to start getting ready for the evening around that time). However, the rooms were kept very clean with frequent linen changes. The restaurants were good; there are four in total (buffet, Oriental, Mexican and Italian) but as the weather was not as good as it could be and the hotel was not full, they occasionally closed one or two in the evening which meant that the choice was not always there. This was disappointing and they should stop doing it unless they want to be inundated with complaints. After all, one of the considerations in booking a hotel is the choice of la carte restaurants. However, the food overall was very good and most members of the staff are helpful and friendly. Having free wifi in the lobby is a nice bonus; it whiled away some time when it was raining to sit checking emails with a strawberry daiquiri by my side! There’s also a coffee shop just off the lobby which served very good coffees but – again – frustratingly it did not always open. Another negative was the hotel frequently ran out of drinks - there was no tonic for the first three days we were there, then they ran out of tonic later in the trip; they also ran out of sparkling wine on at least two occasions. The hotel was nowhere near full and this just should not have happened. Someone needs to be managing the stock better, methinks! There is a free shuttle to Playa del Carmen which has to be booked the day before and there are a limited number of places. We did not take this opportunity but used a taxi so that we could be more flexible with regard to timings. It’s a lovely town and well worth the visit. At the hotel, there is an option to upgrade (at a cost of £20 a day) to the ‘Privilege’ option. This gave guests better rooms but what we – the non-Privilege guests – saw was a small offshoot of the dining room (although they still chose their food from the same buffet that we did!) and premium drinks. The other obvious benefit for them – and the thing we did not like - was the fact that there was a roped off area on the beach for Privilege guests, with beautiful sun beds and other benefits. Wonderful! BUT, it should not have been right in the middle of the beach used by everyone else! If the hotel wants to get a five star rating EVERYONE should get the benefit of the Privilege guests, even if we all have to pay a little more for it. There should not be such an ‘in-your-face’ ‘them and us’ scenario. Most of the people we spoke to had the same view. Apart from that – and apart from the abysmal weather – we had a wonderful time and I’m sure you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Holiday, but two weeks was to long”
Reviews.Author: naomigriff
Reviews.Content: Just got home from the H10, me and my bf stayed here for two weeks. We had the Privilage Upgrade which meant you get the branded alchol, beds on beach and better room. In my honest opinion it is not worth the money at all! We used the beds a few times, we made a reservation a few times but preffered not to as felt we had to rush to get ready in the night. Hotel has lovely pools with the entertainment team doing activities throughout the day,they were great. The staff in this hotel are SOOO lovely they cannot do enough for you. "Ingrid, who works in the resturants greeting you as you arrive was lovely. During the first week I loved the food however after a week I was getting sick of it, it was Very repetitive. The a la carte resturants r very nice exspecially the Italian and Japanease. NNot all the resturants had air con which i thought was a bit mad. I really did not enjoy the breakfasts here i could not wait to get home to have a nice one. The room service was TERRIBLE.... Im not fussy but the first time we ordered we had a pizza, it turned up and it was not cooked proparly. Secound time we ordered the chips were nice again the pizza was not cooked. Third time we ordered our food never turned up. In the mexican resturant in the daytime the pizza there again would never be cooked enough. I did not like sitting in the privilage section of the La Hacienda Resturant I would always ask to sit with everyone else. Everytime I sat in the privilage section there would be lots of bugs around. and flys in the nets, i just didnt find it very clean there. The hotel suprisingly had lots of young couples staying here and there was a lively pool which was good to be around as it had a holiday atmosphere, but dont think it is full of young people getting drunk because it is not, we noticed it was more the 30,40 somethings being the loudest. I was soooo dissapointed with the hotels beach, we went to playa del carmen for the day which we loved and the sea and beach there is AMAZING, it had crystal clear water and white sand- a proper carribbean beach. Unfortunately the beach at the hotel is just as good as somewhere like cyprus/greece. :-( During the two weeks we had 3/4 days of rain.... On one of the days we went to Cancun, reception recommended we catch a mini white bus that will pass the outside of the hotel and then go onto the R1 bus in Cancun, we did this ourselves and it total it cost the two of £9.00 return , which was fab. The Locals are just soo helpful. I loved mexico, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel however if i were to return I would stay in Playacar or in the Sensatori or the El Dorado Seaside Suites. I also heard someone talking about lots of women topless, that is crazy. You would probably find 2/3 women a day topless and none of them you would see walking around they would be lying on a lounger. And so what your're on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for our Honeymoon <3”
Reviews.Author: littlebirdDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! Don't know where to start! This hotel is absolutely amazing a well worth the 5 stars! After a swift check in we were greeted in our room with champagne and chocolates, very yum! We stayed in a deluxe room with a walk in shower and a huge comfy bed. All the staff were very attentive and did everything in there power to make sure we had a honeymoon to remember! Claudia, one of the waitress from the buffet restaurant and the pool bar is an absolute gem and always had a smile for everyone. Our Thomson rep Wendy was brill and the entertainment staff were always making sure everyone had a great time. We did two trips during our stay, the dolphin swim adventure and the the love cat. Our time with the dolphins was incredible and created some wonderful memories. The love cat sails on a Thursday afternoon and is exclusively for adults! Free food and drinks and snorkeling with some amazing fish and sea turtles, what more can you ask for??? We will never forget our stay at The Ocean Maya and would like to thank all the staff for helping us have such a wonderful honeymoon <3

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: squonk9
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a holiday in Mexico, staying at the H10 Ocean Maya Royale in Playa Del Carmen.Fantastic hotel ,spotlessly clean, good food with a great selection for everyone.The staff can't do enough for you and are allways happy and smiling.The rooms are set in what they call villas, 8 rooms to a villa ours was about 300yards from the beach with great views. While we were there because the hotel was only half full due to it being low season,they decided to close 2 of the 4 restaurants on a nightly rotating system, bad move !!! that only lasted for one night as the complaints came flooding in . The shuttle bus (free) must be booked the day before, best to book early. We did 3 trips Chitzen Itza, Swimming with dolphins and Coco Bongo night club (which takes a couple of days to get over ) as you don't get back to the hotel until 4am. Any questions don't hesitate to e-mail Andy

Reviews.Title: “I have only good things to say!”
Reviews.Author: annedust
Reviews.Content: I spent one week there (all inclusive) with my sister and we just loved it! The food is great, the entertainment fun and varied, the staff is always smiling and attentive and the daytime activities made us work out some muscles that were almost dead! Omar is a great Pilates and Wateraerobic teacher. You can change US or Canadian money at the reception desk where you always find an answer to your questions. We absolutely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “An honest review of Ocean Maya Royale”
Reviews.Author: smiler40
Reviews.Content: This hotel changed from a family hotel to an adult only hotel on 1st May. We booked through Thomson holidays on the standard A/I 7 nights holiday. In our experience, the grounds area beautiful, the room was more than adequate although they were sometimes a little slack on re-stocking your mini bar with water etc but we just used to fill our water bottles up at the pool bar. Water and soft drinks were easily accessible at all bars and restaurants. No reservation is required to dine in any of the al la carte restaurants. We ate in alternative ones each evening with sometimes a maximum of an hour wait but if you prepare for this then a pre dinner drink with new found friends is always pleasant. If you really dont want to wait then the buffet restaurant is available with a walk in and eat option. Unfortunately neither tthe Mexican or the Italian restaurants have airconditioning currently but i believe that is something that will be changed fairly soon. In summary: Beautiful gardens, tasty food in al la carte restaurants, although buffet not bad, we just enjoyed the waiter service and menu options in al la carte. Pool bar sometimes a little slow on service, but good variety of drinks available and many cocktails to try. Staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and courteous. Comfortable rooms. Many trips available to book, but suggest you ask about for other guest feedback as some trips sound fantastic and others really not good value for money. Currently it is Whale Shark season but i really do not recommend this trip as it cost £140 per person and we spent 10 minutes in the water with the whale sharks. Too many boats out there and really big swells (open sea) Journey takes 2 hours to get to. If you would like more info then please feel free to email me. I am a diver so used to open seas. Would i go back... Yes, i found the holiday very good value for money and if the restaurants were all airconditioned it would be near on perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck, SUPER clean”
Reviews.Author: sufusimz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya May of 2011, sorry for the delay in writing this review. We wanted to make sure and let everyone know about our stay. I believe that you must know the reviewer before you accept their review. A homeless person would give this resort a 5 star rating, but a prince from Egypt would most likely give it a bad rating. We are a young couple from the states, middle class, and love to travel. We have stayed in this area of Mexico twice now, as well as many resorts and hotels all over the United States. We are not hard to please, and not generally very picky...but we absolutely do not tolerate dirty hotels and bad food. This resort has neither. First of all, the entertainment staff are truly special people. My wife and I wanted to stay much longer just to get to know them better. Yes, some of the stuff they do is a bit silly, but they worked incredibly hard to make our stay more enjoyable. If you don't know this, those guys live at the resort 24/7, and they work some insane hours. I would say this was the best part of this resort, and if any of the hotel management is reading this, they all need a raise!! We booked the Privilege package, and it was nice to have the upgraded room but if you are wondering whether to spend the extra money or not, I would say it's not a big deal. If your budget allows it, go ahead and spend the extra...we did get a few perks like a reserved area at the beach which was very nice. The chairs and beds fill up super early, so this was helpful. Rooms: Room was clean and very nice. Beds were firm but we slept just fine. After being out in the hot sun all day, had no troubles sleeping. Again, cleanliness is a big deal for us, and there were multiple mornings that I walked by a room being cleaned and I was impressed. They had a huge floor scrubber and polisher that they were using to wax the floors!!! At first I thought this was just a once a month deal or something, but I saw it almost every morning at a different room, so this must be their standard cleaning checklist. The rooms are definitely clean, nothing to worry about here. Beach: To all those writing bad reviews on this beach, honestly I am not sure what beach they went to, because this beach is one of the better beaches along this stretch of resorts. Don't believe me, discover for yourself. Take the beautiful walk up to the fresh water streams that flow into the ocean, some really cool fish in there! Along the way, you will pass some resorts that have pretty awful beaches, and then you will realize how nice Ocean Maya keeps their beach up. Pool: There is a couple pools here, both very large in size....so plenty of room to swim around. In the mornings the entertainment staff will do water aerobics, fun stuff! My wife roped me into this one of the mornings, but it was fun. Water is clean, and I always saw staff cleaning and tending to the pool. Food: This is always make and break for a lot of people, including us. If there is a weak spot at this resort, I would say it's the food. If they took a little more time, effort and money into upgrading the quality and presentation of their food, this resort might jump into that 4 to 4.5 star category real quick. Let me say that the food was not bad at all, my wife and I always found something to eat. The food areas are very clean and we never felt sick eating anything from this resort. The fruit was very fresh and the meets always fresh. The Japanese place was by far the best, make sure to eat there one of the nights. Staff: This goes both ways for me. Some of the staff clearly are over worked and under paid, and this shows in their service. The bartenders were always working hard, and I was impressed. Some of the other staff seemed to be fatigued or tired, probably due to the 16 hour days they are required to work. My suggestion to the hotel management, your staff reflect the quality and service of the resort as a whole....even a few bad apples will ruin the whole carton. I must mention the entertainment staff again, big shout out to Jess and Ricardo who took us to CocoBongo one of the nights! Wish we could get in touch again, we definitely miss you two!! Final Verdict: I give this resort a 3.8 rating, again for the money that we spent we got an incredible deal. We were NOT expecting this resort to be this nice, I was pleasantly surprised. It has a nice, small intimate feel to it, the flowers and vegetation make the resort absolutely beautiful. The walk to the beach every day was my favorite part. You do catch the sewer smell along the way, but it wasn't bad...I honestly am not sure what people complain about...I wouldn't have even noticed if I hadn't read everyone complaining about it. SUPER clean resort, VERY nice, GOOD food, and AMAZING vacation, would definitely go back to this resort in a heart beat. Got a great deal on this. Please feel free to contact me if you have any specific questions, would love to answer them. Blessings, Andy & Beth, South Dakota

Reviews.Title: “FOR YOUR OWN SAKE, DON'T VISIT”
Reviews.Author: Guest123_11
Reviews.Content: To sum it all up, the food was just shameful. We spent two weeks here and I wish it was far less. Hotel was pretty and the staff were lovely. Actually the room wasn’t bad either. But PLEASE pay heed to this warning - The food is cold, undercooked and just nasty!! We wish we listened to the reviews before we left….. once again , THE FOOD IS DISGUSTING – DON’T VISIT THIS HOTEL, TRY ANOTHER ONE IF YOU LIKE EATING ( i'M NOT TRYING TO BE MEAN TO THE HOTEL - IT JUST IS...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable birthday and 25th Wedding Anniversary break”
Reviews.Author: mas22
Reviews.Content: Visited the H10 Ocean Maya Royale 25th June - 9th July 2011 with my husband. We celebrated both his 48th birthday and our 25th Wedding Anniversary whilst here and enjoyed both very much. We arranged to eat in the Italian restaurant for my husbands birthday and I had arranged a bottle of champagne for the table. The restaurant staff had been pre-warned and arrange balloons and confetti for the table. They also provided a small birthday cake and this was carried in by the restaurant manager (Cesar) and all of the waiters, who sang happy birthday (much to my husbands embarrasment). Our wedding anniversary was spend on one of the tours - the Columbus Cruise at Cancun. This was a couples tour with only 5 couples on each tour. This was a very enjoyable evening with great company and food, taken on one of the bays in Cancun and provided us with some great opportunities for photographs, including the setting of the sun over the bay. As mentioned previously, the grounds are fantastic and are always being worked on to keep up the appearance. There are various resident lizards, racoon type animals and even land crabs that make the odd appearance - none of which are dangerous if left alone and not bothered. The room was quite large and was fine. Great aircon, large shower, large bed and fully stocked room fridge. As previously mentioned, it is the staff that really make this hotel worth a visit. All staff were very good and attentive, but special mentions must go to Imelda (one of the drinks waitresses in the lobby bar area) and Cesar (the manager of the Italian restaurant), both of whom were always friendly and provided great service always with a smile. We chose to upgrade to the Privilege service. This provided us with access to the reserved beach area with the great Balinese beds, reservations at all restaurants with access to the air-conditioned areas and top-shelf drinks. This is a little expensive but we were happy to upgrade to ensure access to all restaurants and air-conditioned areas. We would rate this hotel as a high end 3 star hotel and is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the Doctor ordered!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tohottie
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not a "PARTY" resort. This was my first experience at an all inclusive resort and unfortunately H10 has set the bar high I figure with this one. To begin with the receptionists were friendly, the place look very welcoming. Our room wasn't ready for a few hours so they took care of our luggage and we went to explore. The beach here is VERY small but plenty of lounge chairs. 2 pools to cool off in. Yes they are right beside the sand so, ... YES there is sand in the pool. There are only 1 main bar at the lobby, a swim up bar at the pool and another small bar beside the pool side restaurant. There is a fair amount of strolling from the main building to wherever but the exercise never hurt me and there was always friendly people out to chat with(hint:as long as you are friendly too. A smile goes a long way). There is no bath tub in my room just a shower but big enough for 2 ;). the room had slightly stained and cracked walls but there was always work being done around the resort so it didn't ruin my day. the balcony was great, after a day out we always came back to a restocked, cleaned room. If they didn't reload the fridge with what I was looking for(water or beer) a quick call and it was delivered very quickly and guaranteed the next day it was full with that. My only complaints were that the shower floors were too smooth and needed some kind of texture in them, and I would have liked a lounge chair on my patio for after a day out we sat there, talked with other guests, and watched the wild life. There are 4 restaurants and all were first come first serve. The only one with any kind of line up was the Japanese but we accomodated for it. If I found something I didn't like, I didn't scream and holler, I got something else next time. Thats the fun of trying new things out. The gym was very small so if I couldn't get a machine I just went for a nice walk down the beach past other resorts. The beach water was very cloudy and rough not the best for swimming during my stay due to a storm that came by but it got better by the end of my stay. Leaving the resort to go out to the road to catch the bus to go shopping is quite a hike so take water or catch a cab from the main entrance. The main problem experienced the whole trip was the yelling from other guests who "EXPECT THIS, or DEMAND THAT" and the things they were whining about were very minor. Needless to say I will go back again but next year it will be somewhere else, maybe Cuba or Jamaica. But eventually you will find me there again lying in a hammock with my shades on, my drink beside me feeling the heat of the sun and enjoying the day.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER go back! Beware of Lizards and Cockroaches! Terrible Food!”
Reviews.Author: bbaaher
Reviews.Content: Let me start by the positives: The grounds are beautiful. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. The Italian restaurant had pretty good food. Negatives: The room- the bed was very hard and made a crunching sound every time we moved around. The bed sheets did not fit on the bed and kept bunching up. I woke up with a headache and backache every morning. We had a saw a small lizard in our room that was in the blinds. When we saw it we called the front desk and I told them and asked them to have someone come and get the lizard out of our room. The lady LAUGHED at me and said they would send someone over but after an hour no one came. We realized they would not help us and we slept with the lizard in our room! We also had ants in our room. The couch in our room had a nasty brown spot on it. The Food: TERRIBLE- most of it was cold, greasy, undercooked, raw or half cooked! My husband and I were eating at El Charro and a huge cockroach was on him, he flicked it off and it ran into the kitchen area. At La Hacienda, I ordered Salmon. IT WAS RAW and slimy in the middle. When I told the waitress, she said that that is the way that they cook it. I told her I would not eat raw fish! The last day that we were there the food was the worst and I only ate a few things off my plate. When the waitress came, she turned her back to me and said, "You didnt finish". I was in shock she talked to me like I was 5! The food was terrible. I lived on cheese, bread and dessert the last two days. Drunk People: For some reason there were a lot of people from England. A lot of 20 something’s. Most of the time they were drunk, loud and obnoxious. We met a nice British couple who actually said they are ashamed of the way their fellow country men and women are acting. Breasts and more Breasts: Lots of women sunbathe and swim topless. I got so sick of seeing women's boobs. This is NOT the place to go to if you or your spouse has pornography issues or has a wondering eye! We will NOT go back to the Ocean Maya Royale! 5 stars? NO WAY, more like 2.5 stars! I suggest you stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Luxury Hotel with good food!”
Reviews.Author: pikesteve
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya Royale hotel on the Riviera Maya in Mexico is situated 45 minutes south of Cancun and 10 minutes north of Playa del Carmen. We booked this hotel through Expedia and booked our flights separately with Thomson Airways from London Gatwick to cancun, the flight time was approximately 10 hours. The hotel itself is situated just off of the main highway from Cancun to Tulum. We took a limo from the airport as we were celebrating our honeymoon, for this we used Lomas Travel (you can read my separate review). The hotel itself is owned by H10 who have a selection of hotels worldwide, there is another just north of the Ocean Maya. Once you have made your way from the highway to the hotel you will be welcomed by a large modern hobby containing several shops, a bar, lounge area, excursion desk and coffee bar. There is a general shop selling cigarettes, drinks, sun cream etc all at your usual over inflated prices. There is also a craft shop, jewellery shop and leather shop. A free shuttle bus runs everyday to Playa del Carmen but you need to book the day before. It leaves around 1pm and comes back at 5pm.Above the lobby is the spa which has various treatments, watch out for the daily specials. There is also a hot and cold Jacuzzi situated outside-something I am sure not too many guests find. To get to this you need to go through the spa centre. On the first floor with the Spa is the gym. As you move out through the lobby you find an outside seating area. In this area there is now the Italian, Japanese and buffet restaurants (the Italian which was down on the beach burned down on the first night we stayed at the hotel). In the evening they also have some evening shows and a disco but they are not the best I have seen. The rooms at the Ocean Maya are of a good quality, as you would expect for a recently refurbished hotel boasting 5 stars. We booked a honeymoon suite which included the privilege upgrade (you can also pay extra for the privilege upgrade when you check in. This allows you to book In ai the a la carte restaurants, premium drinks and an exclusive area on the beach and in the buffet restaurant. When we arrived we were told that these had been over booked and that they were upgrading us to a Romance suite. The difference between these rooms was that the Jacuzzi should have been outside on the balcony but in the Romance suite it is inside, there is also a lounge area in your room which is great for chilling out in. The draw back is that the balcony is very small, it only has enough room for a small table and chairs. This didn’t bother us too much as we liked the room to escape from the heat and there were quite a few mosquito’s about. Down by the beach there is a very limited beach area, if you are looking for an amazing beach this hotel does not have it. What it does have is hammocks, 2 swimming pools (one of which has a swim up bar ), water sports, the exclusive area for the privilege guest with Balinese beds and luxury cushions. The Mexican restaurant is also located here and is open for snacks at lunch. The food at the Ocean Maya Royale on the whole was good. We stayed for 2 weeks and we were just starting to get bored with the selection. The quality of the a la carte restaurants was good and the buffet restaurant is one of the better ones I have been too. There are international foods available during lunchtime and the evening at the buffet restaurant near the lobby. El Charro at the beach does burgers and nachos at lunch time and Mexican in the evening. Another thing you can also order pizza from the bar in the lobby late at night. On the whole I would definitely recommend this hotel to people, we had a few problems with the room and issues with room service but apart from those minor set backs we had a very enjoyable stay at the Ocean Maya Royale. I don’t think that you will be disappointed if you visit this hotel. The shuttle bus to Playa del Carmen is good, there is plenty of shops selling the normal tourist things and plenty of bars and restaurants. Expect to pay around 100 pesos for 4 beers. Regarding trips and prices for things I wanted to finish off with some information about that. There are plenty of trips available at the hotel and as you have probably guessed they are somewhat more expensive then outside of the hotel but be warned. We took the shuttle bus down to Playa del Carmen and booked some trips down there, we used 2 separate companies. The first was OK but we had a guide who didn’t speak much English and they switched the new bus halfway through the trip for a bus that misfired and the second was a disaster. After paying a deposit that day they collected us from the hotel, we paid the balance but then we were told that the trip had been cancelled, we were left on the curb side. We went to the shop and asked for a refund but they did not have enough money to give us it back because the man with the money had gone on another trip, we are only talking $120 not much. After arguing for 45 minutes we negotiated a private tour so not all was lost. You can catch the local bus to Tulum, Coba and Cancun and it costs around $5. Entrance to Tulum and Coba is around $5 so if you feel brave you can save yourself a lot of money. We only found that out after we had already been. A taxi to Cancun is about 900 pesos, on the way back haggle and you can get it for around 700 pesos or take the bus from the end of the road. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect couples hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard250611
