Reviews.Content: When we arrived to a champagne reception we went to our room which exceeded our expectations when we got to the room we had a bottle of champagne and cakes for an anniversary. We really enjoyed the italian (the beef main course is fantastic) and Japanese (jackie chan from cancun was fantistic on the tapanyaki grill) but the buffet restaurant was good too they cook the meat or fish for you fresh but if you want there is pizza, chips, beef burgers, and other dishes plus salad daily we really didnt have a bad meal over the two weeks we were there (don't know how people can complain because we always found lovely food to eat) Staff were fantastic working from early morning till late and still smiling especially the waitresses serving in the cocktail lounge!! we enjoyed the activities and entertainment on a night from the entertainment staff although as being the start of the season some shows were repeated. We went to swim with the dolphins on my birthday and when we returned to the hotel we had a cocktail in the lounge and when we returned to our room there was a cake and champagne with the compliments of the hotel. Anything in the mini bar is free for Thompson/First Choice customers. We had a few days bad weather but overall the holiday was fantastic. If we go back to Mexico we would go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LSyfert
Reviews.Content: The best family vacation we have had so far. We played a lot of beach volleyball as a family and many others activities with Polo, Ricardo, Fernanda, Omar and the rest of the best Entertainment team we have encountered in Riveria Maya. Thank you also to Eber, Javier and Ivonne for great service and ALWAYS with a smile. We met some great people from all over the world. England, Spain, Ecuador, and nearby Chicago and Wisconsin. Great world experience for our kids and for us as well. Finally a special shout out to Polo,Eber, Fernanda and Ricardo. You all will be in my heart forever. I wanted to take you all home with us. Thank you to all mentioned above and to all the great friends we made for some wonderful memories. Lisa Syfert Bettendorf,Iowa

Reviews.Title: “Perfect couple hotel”
Reviews.Author: lIONHEART952
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend (23 and 22) went on the 18th June 2011 for 11 nights. When we arrived they were giving out glasses of champagne to enjoy while we checked in, which didn't take long and the staff where very friendly. Are room wasn't ready for another half hour so we went to the bar and enjoyed the all inclusive, the bar and lobby are beautiful, and there is comfortable seating in a very spacious area. You can get almost every cocktail imaginable even if it isn't on the menu (recommend the 'Miami vice') big selection of spirits but if you want the well known brands such as southern comfort, jack daniels and dissarano you have be one of the 'Privileged' guest's. Luckily am a big corona lover cause this was really the only beer you could get on tap, god knows what you do if you only like cider cause I don't think you can get it... We ended up staying around the bar making friends with other couples and sampling the different cocktails for a good 2 hours before we headed off to the room. To get to the rooms you walk out into an open seating area with a big water feature, this is where 3 of the restaurants are (Italian, Japanese and the main buffet restaurant) past this you head down steps that surround a very romantic waterfall area (lots of pictures of this on the website). The grounds are beautiful and on our short stroll to the room we noticed plenty off wildlife, iguana's are easy to come by and if your lucky you can get a visit from the white nosed raccoon. The room was more then I expected, we had 2 double beds, mini fridge that was filled with water, beer, coke, fanta, sprite (this got refilled each day), aircon was awsome, dont know what i would have done without it. The hotel has 2 pools, only really spent time in the one with that bar and was lovely to just cool down and have a beer when you got too hot from sun bathing, we never had a problem getting a deck chair, even one with a parasol (but we would put our towels down on the way to breakfast about half 8), the only thing I can fault was the beech, its not the beech you would go to spend the day snorkelling and swimming because as alot of people say their is alot of seaweed, but if you walk to the left past the volleyball court and keep going down the beech for about 15 mins you end up at a stunning lagoon with clear water full of fish and golden sand (it does have beds, deckchairs and stuff but this is for the local hotel guests) don't forget to take some bottles of water with you know because its a bit out of the way if you get thirsty and in mexico you are always thirsty lol. I found it really hard to understand how some people could not enjoy the food? Their was so much choice which changed daily, some people must eat in some pretty fancy places if they thought the hotels food was not up to scratch. Our favourite restaurant was the Italian, even when we struggled to finish the dessert after the previous 3 courses left us bursting haha. If anybody is going this time of season you might be worried what the weather will be like seen as the forecasts on iPhone's and the like say thunderstorms everyday. No need to worry, there might be a 5 minute downpour in the middle of scorching day. Some days will be cloudy and a bit miserable but your looking at maybe 2 out 7 days. When the weather is bad the lobby tends to be really busy because everybody is just chilling at the bar and taking advantage of the free internet, the animation team provide games to keep people entertained, got roped into a hardcore game of 'Jenga' which involved tequila shots, cheers Ricardo! Playa del Carmen is well worth a visit, its got so much to other, you can get a free shuttle bus at 12:00 and pick up at 5:00 but make sure you book the day before as its first come first serve and it only takes about 25 people. 5th avenue is the tourist hotspot with loads of shops, bars and restaurants, be prepared to get harassed by the local's showing you their stalls. When you get to the beech you will be amazed, the nicest beech i have ever been on, so clean and spacious. In my opinion I don't think it is worth going privileged, $50 a cople a day is no way worth some beds on a beach and local spirits, the standard services are more then good enough. All the staff and TBH all Mexicans just seem to be happy all the time, very friendly people. Overall we had a fantastic holiday, and the hotel went beyond all expectations. Would defiantly go again and I think it would be hard for any couple to not enjoy themselves at this hotel. I will be posting some pictures soon when I get round to getting them off the camera, but feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best holiday & WE WON'T BE GOING BACK!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: colette1992
Reviews.Content: Hate to say this but we feel that we have been let down by First Choice holidays with this resort. The hotel itself is very basic unless you are a 'Privilege' customer. If you were then you had your own part of the beach with cushioned sun loungers & the big double loungers that were shown in the First Choice brouchure. You would also be entitled to air conditioning in your own part of the restaurants & you also could book a reservation, otherwise you would have to wait up to 40 mins. You also had better accommation with a bath/shower. We enquired about the cost of upgrading to this but it was $55 per person per night. When you look at the brochure you are lead to believe to have all this. We would also recommend that you ask for an umbrella when you check in as you are going to need it with the tropical thunder storms. The food in the restaurants is ok, especially the Japanese but the main buffet is a bit basic.. We only stayed for 11 nights & we glad to get home!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff and the guests are AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: SyfertFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya for 6 days and we've met so many interesting people and made more lifetime friends than we can count. Special thanks to the bartenders Aber and Javier, and the entertainment staff Omar, Polo, Jass, Fernanda, and Ricardo. We love you guys!

Reviews.Title: “BEST trip EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: POR2GZ_QT
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip last minute and I must say, choosing the Ocean Maya, was the BEST choice we made. Why? The service was EXCEPTIONAL, FRIENDLY, WELCOMING! With four buffet resturants to choose from, we never got board and the food was DELICIOUS! The Ocean View room was BEAUTIFUL, and housekeeping was FANTASTIC. The ENGERY at the poolside and on the beach was SUPERBE! There was music, drinks, dancing, games. And you have to get a message at the Spa, it put me in heaven! We ABSOLUTLY had the most AMAZING first time trip to Mexico. We have already said that we will definilty be going back to the Ocean Maya!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little too disappointed”
Reviews.Author: quspork
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Mexico within the last couple of years and the first time we've stayed at an H10 resort. Admittedly, for our last trip to the area we stayed at a 5-star property and this time, we were looking for something more budget-concious. And I guess that is exactly what we found. All in all, you really do get what you pay for. Pros: -the rooms were clean and spacious -the pools were very nice -landscaping at the resort is lovely -most the service we received was courteous and helpful -good availabilty on chairs by the pool and ocean Cons: -the beach area. It wasn't swimmable at all the entire time we were there. There was so much seaweed/grass that the ocean was black, although we did see workers come through once or twice a day to try and clean up the beach area as much as possible. -drink service on the beach. Several days we were laying out by the beach for 8+ hours and only had someone come by once or twice per day (even with tipping). At the last resort we stayed, they had waitresses come through for drink orders every hour or so-- much more convenient. -the food. The food is just not great. Don't get me wrong, it's edible and if food isn't all that important to you, I'm sure won't have a problem with any of the restaurants, but I enjoy good food and this wasn't. The buffets are typical bland hotel-catered food. The Italian restaurant offered overcooked meats and fish. The Mexican place was alright, but not a ton of variety. My favorite was probably the Japanese restaurant, but even there the entree was a disappointment (though do fill up on appetizers, those were great!) -following through on offered services. When we booked through the hotel website, they claimed they were offering free shuttle service to and from the airport, however we discovered upon arrival at the airport that no such service existed. We ended up having to overpay for a taxi since we had no other means of getting to the hotel. And the hotel did nothing to try and assuage the issue. If you'll notice, they are still offering this deal above on tripadvisor if you click on a link near the hotel info section-- but beware, you may not actually receive this service and will be out over $100 on airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: NLB20
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of the reviews, I thought the food was really pretty good (and I am a picky eater) - at least compared to some of the AI resorts I have stayed in. The water isn't beautiful right on the resort, but the beach is kept very clean. Not really anything they can do about the water now that the resort is built on it can they? The showers are strange in that there is only half a door so the floor gets completely flooded, but we just put our beach towels down. I have stayed at H10 Ocean Coral & Turquesa in Puerto Morales (about 15 minutes closer to Cancun) 4 times and while it is much larger resort, I think I liked it slighlty better, but it depends on what you are looking for. Ocean Maya is adults only. Ocean Coral & Turquesa is not. Spa is fabulous at both resorts and I have found the staff to be very pleasant (especially the restaurant wait staff and the Privelege Beach section waiter/waitress who are generally fabulous). My only real complaint is that I can't seem to get the room I reserve. I always go with a friend and ask for double beds but regardless of my early request on the reservation, I always get the king sized bed then they have to change my room and it is never ready and/or as nice a room or has the ocean view as I was guaranteed when I purchased the H10 "Vacation" club (i.e. floating week timeshare). It's not a huge issue, but it is frustrating and I often spend at least the first night of my vacation feeling a bit "taken" in having paid for something I am not receiving. I am not one to complain or want to move once I am unpacked, so I generally just pout and deal with it. All that to say, if you have a special request, you may want to call the resort direct the day before arriving and see if you can get that request taken care of - I think I may try that my next time around. All in all, I enjoy the H10 resorts. I have had always had very good experiences (except for the room / bed issue) and will continue to return.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lioncub31
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by our "personal concierge" upon checking in only to find that his sole goal was to sell us a timeshare. We hadn't even seen our room yet and he wanted to take us to another resort, promising a "very special gift". The "gift" was $100 towards the spa IF we were willing to spend an hour and a half listening to their presentation. Not a great first impression. Our room was fanastic. Spacious, clean, just what we wanted. They run out of beach towels every day by ten a.m. so get to the pool early. The pool was amazing. Relaxing with a swim-up bar. However, for beer drinkers BEWARE... the only beer they offer is Corona. As for liquor, you could get a recognizable brand ONLY if you upgrade ($50 per couple per day!) The beach was fine for what we wanted (beach chair, not too crowded) but only had a small area accessible to the water. Here is the big complaint... the food. It is AWFUL! I am not a picky eater and I love international quisine, but this food was terrible. By the second day it was fruit and bread for breakfast; fruit, bread and french fries for lunch; and dessert for dinner. The Japanese restaurant served the best food, but our Tempanyaki cook kept dropping the utensils on the floor then just picking them up and continuing to cook! Stick to chicken if you go and do NOT order any seafood. Both times we tried it tasted spoiled. Overall, I enjoyed the five days we had there, but would only consider returning if I wanted to use the vacation as a diet plan...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Exceeded all Expectations!! xoxo”
Reviews.Author: missy649
Reviews.Content: Wow! Wow! Wow! My new husband and I experienced all of the wonders the Ocean Maya had to offer for seven days on our honeymoon in June 2011. I have never experienced such a fun yet relaxing and luxurious atmosphere while on vacation. The service at the Ocean Maya was top notch. From the e-mail communication prior to arrival, to the smiling faces that greeted us on arrival with champagne, to the upbeat awesome entertainment staff (Amy's great!),to the bartenders and waitresses, and even the friendly groundskeepers. We felt as if everyone was there solely to make our trip unforgettable. One night we ordered room service because we were enjoying our gorgeous ocean view room too much, and they arrived right away with pizza! yum! Our mini fridge was always stocked with pop, water, and cervezas. :) The ocean view room was very "worth it".. we woke up each morning and opened the curtains to a view overlooking the swim up bar, beach, and ocean. We loved being next to the swim up bar because we could enjoy the music all day, too. The beach was beautiful and well-maintained. We woke up early one morning and snagged first row. There were always activities and night time shows going on if we were interested. I won a surf contest in the pool one day. Ha! The food was nothing like I heard about most all-inclusive resorts. We loved the variety, and the Japanese steak house was our favorite for dinner. We were also given a private table next to the pool with a bottle of champagne and five course feast one night to celebrate our new life together! Make sure to let them know if you'd like a romantic dinner by the pool, too. I'm not sure if you must tell them your are on your honeymoon or if the dinner is for all lovebirds. I recommend visiting the Mayan Ruins and beach at Tulum and/or Xel Ha if you've never been. The water at Tulum was unreal(wear your swimsuits)! Also we loved Coco Bongo (so much we stayed till 5AM!) which is an awesome night club that Ocean Maya provided transportation and information about. My favorite parts of the Ocean Maya were the friendliness of the staff, beautiful beach and landscaping, the Japanese and Mexican restaurants, coconut ice cream, updated rooms, and the two pools! I liked least that I didn't see many people tip for all the hard work that was going on, but the servers/bartenders were great and it didn't affect their attitudes. To each their own I guess! The memories we created at this resort will be treasured always! I would definitely recommend the Ocean Maya at Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: kentuckygus
Reviews.Content: Accommodations, food and staff exceeded my expectations. They were very attentive. Many good food choices, and very clean. We'll be going back in November. Highly recommended if you're looking for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation that was too short!”
Reviews.Author: Robynn_89
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all the staff at the Ocean Maya for an amazing vacation that felt way too short! Everyone was friendly and provided good service. The rooms were clean and comfortable, while the food was enjoyable. The Japanese restaurant was really nice with good food and a nice cooking show. Also, they were accommodating to a friend we had that was vegetarian.The grounds were beautiful and it was really cool to see animals around. The pools were nice and this was great because we spent a lot of time in them during hot days! I would especially like to thank the entertainment staff. They were simply AWESOME! They made sure to get everyone involved in daily activities and never ceased to entertain us. The nightly shows were really fun and entertaining and we loved the Grease show. Thanks to Omar for always being so fun and getting us involved in activities like water polo and water aerobics and always having a smile on his face! Thanks to Amy for also being really nice and so outgoing. Next, thanks to Nellie for being so friendly and taking us to coco bongo! It was one of the best nights out ever! Words can't even express how much fun we had. With that, thanks to Ricardo for constantly bugging us to go to coco bongo. I know I would've regretted not going. And, thanks goes to Polo for giving us Canada day "fireworks"! We'll never forget them lol. Lastly, thanks goes out to Jes for being so nice and entertaining us. Thanks again guys for making our vacation so enjoyable! The beach wasn't too great for swimming but the pools made up for it and the sand was nice. Overall, we had a great time at the Ocean Maya and would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation for the price!”
Reviews.Author: KLaCourse
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at this resort and was very impressed! Everyone at the resort was very friendly and helpful. The pools were beautiful and very relaxing. The grounds were beautiful, immaculate and very well tended to. The buffet had alot to offer and I never had anything I didn't like. We ate at all three restaurants and thought the food was very good! We met wonderful people and had an excellent time despite the two days of a tropical storm. For the price that we paid we thought that we got a fantastic deal. Jairo and Javier at the pool bar were awesome, Claudia helped us with our spanish at breakfast and the spa was very accomodating when I had to reschedule my massage a couple of times due to a painful sunburn. All in all a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star?? Not even close....”
Reviews.Author: Malambo1
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this resort but if you are opting for a nice Caribbean experience with clear pristine beaches – this is not the place to be. The beach consists of a very small strip with sticky grounds, rocks and seaweeds. Disappointing. Truly not what it presents in the website. However, the resort itself is nicely kept with good accommodators, pools and beautiful grounds. The staff was amazing, especially the hostess Ingrid, Silvia, wait staff Claudia, Felix, Benjamin, Chef Jesus in the Japanese restaurant and the guys at the pool bar. Food, not really what we expected but what other writers already stated – you get what you pay for. Looks like the hotel got a nice paint job and some accent pieces in the lobby and rooms but I would only rate this resort with 3 stars. Maybe a good place for economy tour groups. We left this hotel after 4 nights and went to Playa del Carmen….

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere. Great Location. Mediocre Staff”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatison
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful vacation with my girlfriend at the Ocean Maya. Overall I would rate my resort experience a C. It is very average, but for the price it is a good value. Don't expect the staff to bend over backwards like other resorts in the Riviera Maya. Some of the staff will do everything they can to help, but these staff members are quickly overshadowed by the next staff member who will be a total jerk to you. I'm very easy to get along with and please, but some staff members just don't want to be there. The event staff is amazing though. They are all very energetic and willing to make your experience memorable. I highly recommend attending the shows at night, and also being involved in the activities around the pool. Amy Jean Vera, Polo, and Jess were all awesome people. The resort is beautiful and the food is overall pretty good. Make sure you go to the hibachi grill at least once. The Mexican restaurant is the best by far. Especially the taco's. Don't buy the black wrist band, total waste of money. - Mr. Ocean Maya 2011

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: LilLorriLee
Reviews.Content: There was a mix up in our reservations but we enjoyed our stay anyway. I had reserved (I thought) an ocean view room but when we got there they didn't have one available. So, we had a nice garden room (my 1st garden room ever). This resort is amazingly clean and beautiful. You never even see a flower laying on the ground - they are always discreetly cleaning. Our refrigerator was restocked daily w/ water, sodas, beer & liquor (for free). The pools were sparkling clean always, but note that the pool and pool bar close VERY early. All food and drinks are at the front of the resort after 8pm. This is a resort that is beautiful but spread out so be prepared to do alot of walking. The gym is awesome and the spa massages are to die for. The staff at the entire resort (bag carrier, maid service, front desk, bartendars and spa personel) are amazing. We had a GREAT and AMAZING time!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation overall!”
Reviews.Author: katieofthompson
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before I took my trip and realize a lot of people just like to complain. Overall this resort was great. Beautiful landscaping, friendly people, and beautiful pools. The upkeep on this place was great! If you want a beautiful beach/ocean this is not the place for you though. The water was always very dirty with no fault of the resort. They tried to keep it as clean as possible. The pools were always very clean and never had a problem getting a chair on the beach or by the pool. The buffets were decent, breakfast was best. Would recommend La Hacienda for lunch not El Churro. Tried the Japanese and Italian a la carte resteraunts and both were great! Japanese was our favorite, went twice in the four nights we were there. The rooms were extremely spacious and well done. The bed wasn't the best, but we had no trouble sleeping after our relaxing days by the beach! Loved having our own balcony and the well stocked mini bar. The staff was great and extremely helpful. Gave us a free romantic dinner since it was our honeymoon which was scrumptious! Everyone you passed had a smile and a hello. The spa was amazing. Got a couples massage which was seriously the best massage I have had in my life. Highly recommend it! Overall a great vacation, can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with a not so great beach”
Reviews.Author: quirk6
Reviews.Content: Let me just say right off the bat that if you're coming for the beach, it's best to avoid this place and the places nearby. If a nice beach at your resort is secondary, then there's a lot to recommend about this place. It's beautiful and it's friendly. The grounds are gorgeous and well-landscaped. There are flowers and lovely swaying palms everywhere. The rooms are nice large, nicely decorated and had the best bed I've experienced in Mexico. The showers take a while to warm up most of the time, but they get there. The staff was wonderful as well. They great you at your shuttle with smiles and glasses of champagne. We were shown to our room, but we ran into a somewhat lost couple that obviously wasn't. I don't know why the difference. But everyone you see along the way offers you a smile and an "hola". They were all kind and attentive. There are two pools--a deeper one with a shallow ledge around the side, and another with a swim up bar. There are plenty of places to eat. Yookoso, the asian restaurant; Dolce Vida, the Italian restaurant now located at the back of La Hacienda since it burned down; Charro, snack bar during the day and a la carte Mexican at night; and La Hacienda, the buffet restaurant. The food was good, though not great, and had a nice rotating selection. There are also several bars and a coffee shop. Our best meal was at Dolce Vida, but we had most of our meals at La Hacienda. There's nightly entertainment, which we saw some of and was fun. They have a place to book tours right in the lobby, which we used for two tours. There are shpps and free wifi in the lobby as well. The place feels a bit isolated. It's not, really. They're shoulder to shoulder with other resorts in both directions. But it is far, far back from the road. They offer a daily shuttle to Playa del Carmen (12-5 daily booked in advance). There are also taxi cabs. It's different from when we were in Cancun, though, and could simply go outside and catch a bus any time we wanted. They offer pretty much everything you need right on the resort. I really wanted to go into Playa to do some shopping, but our chance was ruined by lousy weather. The bad part is the beach. Most of the beach front has been replaced by a wall/boardwalk. There's beach on either side, but the water was never as clear as what we had in Cancun. Plus, the entire time we were there the red flags were out. Maybe we just had bad luck. We took a walk up the beach and found that most resorts had sandbagged their beach fronts and were little better. Speaking of walking up the beach, head left and walk to where there's a fresh water stream flowing into the ocean, it's really nice. You'll be crossing across other resorts beaches, but don't worry, all beaches are federal property in Mexico. In all, I would definitely recommend it. However, if you're really after the beach I'd look elsewhere. We had a much nicer beach with much nicer water last year at Casa Maya in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “we were thinking of returning before we left”
Reviews.Author: 187069Alan
Reviews.Content: perfect holiday,perfect place,perfect staff,and for the money perfect hotel. We did not pay for any extras other than the basic cost of our holiday and found it to be very good,the staff were good,the pools were warm and the beach was nice most of the time,sometimes sea weed would wash up but was soon shifted by the staff its a shame it is now a couples only resort as we would have loved to take our grandchildren next year they would have loved it,but we will be back as a couple in the future,if you read any bad reviews about this resort then maybe they are just hard to please folk that i would not want to be at the same resort with,if you want a five star resort for three star prices this is it you wont come close anywhere else and the staff made our holiday,the food was perfect and everyone went out of there way to make your holiday cant wait to return......alan and chris uk

Reviews.Title: “Holiday full of great memories”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Gaynor
Reviews.Content: From the first moment you pull up to the hotel you can't help but be impressed with the look of the place. We were greeted with champagne by genuinely friendly and happy well dressed staff while we went through the reception process. The staff in reception were swift and professional and very informative and helpful all the way through our stay. The grounds are amazing and extremely well kept and designed in such a way that the local wildlife move freely around, the wildlife you see is fantastic. The rooms are large and expectionally clean and very comfortable. There are four resteraunts within the complex: La Hacienda which caters a la carte for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is a wide and varied selection of food all of which is delicious (even if you don't know what it is...you've got try it) Yookoso is the Japanese resteraunt, you can have an intimate dinner for two, or sit with others as you watch the chef perform his magic as he prepres your food in front of you. La Dolce Vita is the Italian, the food here was fantastic. I can't say more than that. El Charro is the Mexican resteraunt poolside. During the day it provides a full and varied a la carte menu throughout the afternoon, again the food is beautiful. Then in the evening it is transformed into a traditional mexican menu, again fantastic. There are two pools next to each other, one has the swim up bar ( for those in the party spirit) or if you are there for a more relaxing time there is the larger second pool. That's the decor and the facilities covered. Now what made this holiday just that little bit more special was the staff. All the staff are on the go all day every day working as hard as they can to make sure the place looks fantastic and you, as the customer, are happy. from the groundstaff, cleaners, maintenance guys and supervisors moving about the place each has a smile on their face and are always approachable if you have a query or request. If they can't help then within minutes you will have someone with you who can. They deserve a lot of praise for the work they do. The bar staff and waiting on staff also deserve praise alone. The service is amazing whether you are seated having a meal or lazing poolside, they are constantly on the go to ensure you have a drink and are comfortable.Then you have the entertainment staff....they are enthusiastic, young and work hard during the day to get as many people involved in events as they can then in the evening they put on themed evenings in the theatre. Superb. We have just come back from spending 11 days here and loved every second. On an individual note Maria Lopez (sub director) is fantastic, approachable and welcoming. Overall this is the best holiday both myself and my nearest and dearest and has had and the staff have alot to do with it. We would recommend this holiday for any couple who are looking for a holiday in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: Likestotravel27
Reviews.Content: We were greeted upon arrival with a glass of champagne and an easy check in. This place is beautiful. The staff is very eager to serve you and try to meet your every need. There are beautiful flowers everywhere and the wildlife is plentiful and fun to watch. The room was an easy place to cool off since the AC worked amazingly! These rooms have been refurbished recently and they are wonderful! As far as the beach it's good and you never feel overcrowded. I would suggest they get better lounge chairs. After you've sat in one for a while it sinks very much to the ground and gets uncomfortable. There is a beach buffet that is right by the pool and the food was very good as well as all the other restaurants. I was impressed by the food quality(and everything else) considering it was an all inclusive. And what makes this place nice is the all adults feature. It provides the resort with a real laid back feeling. It never gets loud and crazy which makes it much easier to relax. I really can't say enough about this resort. It was definately worth the trip. You should go.

Reviews.Title: “Not on your life”
Reviews.Author: dbatlanta
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Grand Maya Ocean Resort from June 5 - 9, 2011 to celebrate my birthday. This was my fourth visit to Riviera Maya and I like to try a different resort each time. This was definitely my least favorite one. Upon arrival, we approached the main check-in desk but were diverted to the Privilege check-in desk instead. I did not purchase the Privilege option, but after some back-and-forth with the desk clerk, was informed that we would receive the privilege perks, but not a privilege room, since they were all king rooms and we wanted a double room. DO NOT spend extra money for the "privilege" services. Unless you drink like a fish and need premium liquor, it's not worth it. The privilege section of the beach is behind a glass wall and is the furthest away from the pools and beach areas. On the one day that we did park ourselves at the privilege section of the beach (only because there were no umbrellas available at the pool), an attendant brought us two bottles of water in an ice bucket, but they were warm and the bucket contained no ice. No one ever returned to take drink or food orders. The two pools are absolutely beautiful, but each morning, staff cleaned the pools (with bleach!) while guests were lounging and swimming in them. Yuck! At a high-end resort, guests don't want to see ongoing maintenance, let alone be exposed to noxious chemicals. These things should be done after hours once guests have departed. Ok, now the food. Yuck, yucker, and yuckiest. I know that many all-inclusives don't splurge on food, but the buffets were full of strange and unrecognizable dishes, very few fresh vegetables, and questionable, gelatinous mystery desserts. All-in-all, a disaster. I will definitely NOT be back.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't stack up to other resorts in the area, Food and Beach disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Rob23
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Mayan Riviera 4 times now, and I'd probably rate this hotel fourth of four. There were some good things - the rooms were very modern, clean and spacious. The grounds were nice and the pools were nice too. There was also free wifi in the lobby. My stay was probably less enjoyable than it could have been due to a head cold I had / the fact that my ears wouldn't equalize the entire time I was there - in no way the resort's fault! :) The hotel is more in the Cancun Riviera area than the Mayan Riviera area and the beach is really sub par. The food at the buffet was lacking in variety and wasn't the greatest. The disco was tiny and empty. We went into Playa del Carmen for most dinners - the one a la carte dinner I had at the resort wasn't bad. On the day of check out, I left my room with suitcase in tote to head to the front desk to check out. They couldn't check me out without the lock and key for the room safe (a bit of a hassle - the room safe should be combination locked / not with a key) so I returned to the room. The room door was open and a hose had been run from the bathroom out to where some men were working. The key and lock to the safe were gone. The tip I left for the maid was gone and no one seemed to know what had happened to either. When I went back to the front desk to explain that hotel staff had been in my room they delayed me for a while to investigate - I was getting pretty upset as the 4 of us were leaving for the airport. I guess things like this probably don't happen very often, but it was EXTREMELY frustrating at the time - I felt like I was being shaken down for the key deposit (which they ended up relenting on). I'm not one to be overly negative about resorts - I've stayed at three others in the Mayan Riviera area and would rate them all well. In my not so humble opinion, there are lots of resort options that are superior to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLin
Reviews.Content: 5th visit to Mexico, and the first hotel that we would not return to. The rooms were lovely, as were the grounds, but the food was very dissapointing and the sea should be avoided. I can understand many people saying that is was great, but we know that there are many hotels on the Riviera Maya that have higher overall standards .Probably depends on what you want out of a holiday. Happy to answer any questions

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ruri51
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived to the hotel, we met Ana from Reception. She was very nice and helpful and we went to our room very happy. We liked the beach with the Charo Restaurant next to the pools. Nature is wonderful and very well cared for, all is tidy and beautiful. We fed the birds and one old iguana! We love the falls and how is made. Simply, we enjoyed our short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: RomiB1
Reviews.Content: I literally just returned from Ocean Maya. My boyfriend and I had a great time. The resort is very clean and the staff is extremely nice and helpful. The worst part of the resort was definitely the food, but it was not soooo terrible. I have definitely had worse. The mexican restaurant was the best I thought, the chicken tacos I had there were by far the best thing I ate all week. The sushi was not the best, and the italian was sub par. You learn what to order, and what to avoid. There is the "smell" that other people mention, but it is by far no reason to not come to this resort. There is a lotttt to do in the area, and I would definitely return here if I decided to come back to Mexico. I highly suggest going to Coba on the tour through the Traffic Tours they have on sight. It was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad. Overall was good”
Reviews.Author: ambersdevi
Reviews.Content: honest review of OUR opinions on OUR stay. husband and i stayed 5 days. Location-20-30min away from cancun airport (depending on how many other stops you have while in trasport) Grounds-very well kept. birds, trees, iguanas, lizards, rodants are great. Rooms-kept clean and redone. beds were super hard. we asked for mattress pad and was told they didn't have any (talking to another couple later they told us that they received a pad after they asked for one). so we ended up taking the mattress out of the hidaway bed from th couch in our room, ordered 6 more pillows to put on top of that and then piled some more blankets on that. it worked ok. we are used to soft beds. The maids must have missed our room one day for cleaning, not a big deal to us. Pool-well kept, clean, good temp, not very crowded. Beach-always seemed to be enough chairs. looked nicer and larger then other resorts nearby. water was VERY murky compared to the beach water in the town of playa del carmen playa del carmen-10-20min cab ride (around $15-$20) will get you to 5th avenue...the touristy strip/street with all the shops and stands to buy things at. neat little street. a block or two down is the beach. we were adventurous and took the Collectivo (public transport) into town for 15-20pesos (roughly $1.50-$2). you have to walk the 10-20min down the resort road to get to the main highway, cross that road and wait at the 'bus stop'.get off on the last stop, walk down a few blocks and it puts you at 5th ave. not hard and people are helpful. cozumel-ferry is $13 one way and is right off the beach by 5th ave in playa del carmen.about a 25min ferry ride. very pretty. food-we are foodies and the food here is pretty much just hotel food. they try, but we were always wishing for something a bit more mature for the pallet. it is edible and for most would be satisfing. entertainment-we did not attend any entertainment but everynight there was something. karaoke, DJ, sax player, fiesta ect... drinks-pretty good. mojitos were yummy! and it was easy to find a bar to get a drink. wifi-in the lobby only wishes-more variety of eating, better food selection, prettier water in the beach, softer beds. overall this is a good place to stay. every place has its negatives but nothing at this hotel would lead me to tell people not to stay there. it is what you make it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MelandJudy
Reviews.Content: Food was fantastic and there was a selection of meat and fish that was cooked in front of you every evening together with a Chef's speciality. A choice of 4 restaurants ensured you could have waiter service if you wanted and the Italian was very romantic with a beach side setting. The drinks and cocktails were all made with Branded spirits and champagne was available all day and flowed freely!!. Pools were excellent and so was the swim up bar where everyone could meet up. Having no children was an added bonus for us. Gardens and wildlife were amazing. Rooms were spacious and would highly recommend this. If there was one thing that could be improved...provide more shade as there were not enough umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: johnwalmsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ocean maya end of May till 13th June. Weather was great,loads of sun, bit to hot when the wind dropped on our second week and only a day of rain in two weeks. The rooms are massive with the best air con ever,cleaned every day and mini bar restocked every day. The hotel location is perfect surrounded by jungle,right on the beach,about 15min taxi to Playa Del Carmon centre.The cleanliness of the hotel is the best I've seen. Food plenty to chose from with 4 restaurants and all very very nice with good service. only dislike was the 30 Spanish students,who took over the swim up bar and the pool and were noisy.I think the contract is coming to an end with the groups soon so don't be put off.

Reviews.Title: “Adults only Hotel, Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Gasman1961_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 weeks from 20th May to 3rd June 2011. The Hotel may not be a top notch 5* but I doubt you would find anywhere else better value for your money. The food, drink and service were excellent. The staff could not do enough for you and nothing was a problem. We were there when the Italian restaurant burnt down, so that only left us with 3 to choose from. But within a few days they partitioned the main restaurant and reopened the Italian, best food all holiday. The Adults only was great, no screaming Kids running round all day, you could relax by the quiet pool, or get involved with the organised events in the large pool. Night time was a little quiet, some of the professional shows were good and the in house shows are on a par with other Hotels in the region. The younger ones ventured out to Coco Bongo after 10:30pm, returning worse for wear around 6.00am. Just in time to lay your towel out at the pool side. Loved all the creatures running around the grounds (no not the Yanks) but the little fury things, raccoons, lemur’s, deer, bats. Iguanas and beautiful song birds. If I had one complaint about the Hotel it would be mosquitoes, make sure to take room repellents and the strongest repellent cream you can buy. Might just be me but I got bit every day. The Bed was a little on the firm to hard side but the Tequila helps. I did my PADI Open Water diving certificate with the Hotel dive school. A little bit on the expensive side at $400, but it was only 20M walk from our room and the tutor was excellent, I felt very relaxed 50 ft under water looking up a wall of coral and fish. Why I waited till my 50th Year to try diving I don't know. But I wish I had started years ago. I can't wait to see the Whale Sharks in Jan 2012. As a Brit we are not used to tipping, and small nominations of pesos are hard to come by, so my advice is to take dollar bills and spread liberally. It gets everyone smiling. Hope you enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Would be Excellent, apart from Students!”
Reviews.Author: CY39
Reviews.Content: It was our Honeymoon and the hotel and staff were excellent, however this holiday was sold to us as a couples resort and that it was quieter than Cancun, but towards the end of our honeymoon 30 Spanish Students turned up (some didn't look even 18) and took over the hotel with no respect for others. Complaints were made but the hotel needs to establish want kind of clients they are after, they can't have both my opinion it doesn't work! Would go to this area again but not sure about the hotel, this did put us off.

Reviews.Title: “100% awsome !”
Reviews.Author: paulndoris
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I went to Ocean Maya/Mexico on our honeymoon recently. I had looked through many comments on t/a regarding the hotel and the majority were positive. We got to the reception after only about a 40 minute transfer and were greeted with a cold champagne cocktail while waiting to check in. Check in was great and we were advised to speak to guest relations regarding our stay before we went to our room. To our amazement they had tried to upgrade us to a honeymoon suite but had no availability. The kind lady at the desk then offered us a free romantic meal on the beach with our own waiter etc. We kindly accepted and booked for the sunday evening. The room was fantastic, the service we got from every staff member was out of this world, nothing(and i mean nothing) was too much trouble including delivering items to our room. The beach and pools were great and was looked after by a host of super friendly staff who would supply any drinks etc you needed. Food was out of this world, the buffet was fantastic and the a la carte was astounding, a big thank you to jesus from yookosa japanese restaraunt for such and awsome evening. If you get chance try to book his tepenyaki table!! Big Big thanks to Vicente and alfredo from the buffet area, you guys were there every day with big smiles and a chat, you made us feel so welcome everyday. Alfredo at the front door was awsome too, anything you need you let me knkw he would always say. The animation crew were brilliant, every day, a chat advice, a spanish lesson!! fantastic shows and super friendly. Overall the best we could want for our honeymoon and more, so good we only left site once in 14 days. We will be looking at returning with the rest of our families in 2012 so will hope to see you all then. In a nut shell this hotel was 100% in every way for us. Thank you all so much, Paul and Nicola

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great time !!!”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker64
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before booking this trip and decided the good reviews definitely outweighed the bad so... I booked it. I must admit (being the scpetic that I am) that I was thoroughly pleased with this resort. Many people have given long disertations and to both the good and the bad, but I think your attitude going in goes a long way in how your trip will be. Also, the manner in which you approach people goes a long way in how they will treat you. The staff from the get go was great and every smile given, was returned. Some people have commented that upgrading to the "Privilege" program was not necessary and I would COMPLETELY disagree... it was worth every penny. The beach beds alone were worth the cost. I would agree that the food was not the best (coming from San Francisco and great restaraunts) but it was edible and plenitiful. If you could not find something to make your belly full, you are to damn picky !! I would not for one moment hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great people, great holiday”
Reviews.Author: westrose1
Reviews.Content: having read lots of negative comments on here we were slightly apprehensive on what we would find.Check in was done in minutes with no issues,rooms are EXACTLY as shown on the web site big,clean and airy grounds are amazing we found all staff very freindly but slightly under staffed at times. We did find it a bit of a pain when going out as it is a good 45mins to get into Playa del Carmen but buses were on time every time we needed one food was plentiful, hot and a wide choice Mexica.Italian and Japanese restaurants were really nice and had no problem getting a table.Dont bother with the up grade even though its only just over a pound a day all you are getting is a different bed on the beach and top shelf drinks the biggest problem we had was the hotel had booked in a party of about 30 young girls who were very noisy and took over the bar each evening we did have a problem with our air con ( me fiddling) and it was sorted within 30 mins We have stayed in better etc etc etc but if in Mexico again would stay in the hotel no problem

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a get away!!”
Reviews.Author: Udochi
Reviews.Content: Well my friends and I stay the first week in June (June 3-7). Taxi arrived at resort and we were greated with champange. Check-in was painless, then we were escorted to our rooms. Nice and clean. beds were a little hard but we managed. Hotel faciities were lovely. Our villa was close to the pool/beach but far from everything else. Its an all-inclusive resort with about 2-3 different places to eat for breakfast/lunch but with a few more options for dinner. Food was good with plenty variety. Lovely staff. I have to mention the few staff members that really went the extra mile for us: Javier, who greeted us on arrival. Very sweet and funny. Amy Jean and Nallely who were apart of the entertainment staff, introduced us to a game of "spoons" which we played with other guests. We had soo much fun. Marianna and Azucenna who were apart of the food services were sooo pleasant and helpful. One negative were the many couples we saw. Almost the entire resort was full of couples which made it hard for us to really mingle with the other guests. Except for Becky and Jim who were the sweetest, most welcoming, and cutest couple there!!. So if you're single..this isnt the place for you. Another negative were the spa prices...they were equal to the prices in Beverly Hills. So we opted for a cheaper place in Playa del Carmen!! Overall I liked the place but I would only return when I married..lol.

Reviews.Title: “Excelled our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dennis-Eastwood
Reviews.Content: Anybody who can find something to complain about this hotel must have got it confused with somewhere else. The rooms are large and well decorated and kept spotlessly clean. The beds are huge the matresses are firm but not uncomfortable, and there is a free mini bar that is re stocked every day. I think all rooms have a balcony, we were told we had a pool view but we had a massive palm tree outside which did not worry us as it gave us a bit more privacy. The gardens were spectacular and well maintained there was not a leaf or a blade of grass out of place, in fact there was not so much as a cigarette end to be found anywhere in the grounds. There was plenty of wildlife to watch as well. The staff from the litter pickers right up to management were friendly with a ready smile and greeting as soon as they met you nothing was too much trouble and they all worked exceptionall hard to make our holiday special. The pool area was plenty big enough with ample sun beds and the beach was only a few yards further, there was no need to get up at the crack of dawn to reserve a bed there was always plenty, though shade around the pool was at a premium. The beach was soft white sand and the sea was as warm as bath water. There were 2 days when the sea weed got quite bad but the staff were quick to clear it and it did not stop us swimming in the sea. The Italian restaurant burnt down while we were there but this did not reflect on the efficiency of the service in the other restaurants, We never had to wait for a table and the waiters were really attentive our plates were cleared as soon as we put our knives and forks down and our drinks replenished as soon as the glass was getting low. The food though not cordon blue was excellent well cooked and presented and plenty of variety. My only critism of the entire fortnight was that they cremated the bacon, other than that the food could not be faulted. A word of warning beware of some of the sauces if you dont like hot spicey food I was caught out a couple of times so if I wasnt sure I would sample before loading my plate. The entertainment was varied and the animation team worked hard without being too intrusive, I have to mention the little waitresses in the bar who worked tirelessly racing about with trays laden with various bright cokoured cocktails they did not stop all night yet still had time for a beaming smile and goodnight at the end of a busy shift and the men behind the bar were unbelievable mixing dozens of cocktails all at once, another word of warning they are over generous with their measures of alcohol so allthough the cocktails taste lovely they do come with quite a kick. I think I have covered everything all I can say is you really do have to experience this hotel. Thanks to everybody for making this holiday great

Reviews.Title: “Looking to book this again for August this year”
Reviews.Author: Harry77x
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. yes we have stayed in better but we have also stayed in much worse. Good variety of food in buffet really lovely plenty of choice and changed regulary so always fresh. There was always nice salads, fruit, ham, cheese, taco's, chips, rice then a variety of other things that changed daily. Yeah you can get bored but use your imagination you can made toasties at breakfast and sandwiches etc with food availlable. Theres hot sauces etc that can spice up some of the bland food. Also enjoyed the a la carte it was nice for a change. Staff were really nice we did tip and perhaps that made a difference but we always had a drink in front of us and it was refilled before we had time to ask. Imelda was particulary attentive. You had to be up early if you wanted a parasol and a bed at the pool as they were both scarce but there was always beds on the beach but it was a bit hot for us. We put towels out at 6.30 and sometimes struggled to get a parasol. We walked along the beach every day there is some lovely views the beach is quite nice and yeah the seaweed was bad and some parts of the sea were really dirty but thats just nature if we wanted a swim we used the pool. You get beach towels and we changed them daily no charge but its probably an idea to take your own as we did find some people tried to use our beds. The main thing we loved was that it was adult only hotel, if only the flight was the same!! There was a fire when we stayed and we were evacuated out of our room at 3.00am to 7.00am. The hotel staff were amazing and kept us up to date and were really helpful and attentive. But Thomson rep didn't do a thing I half expected him to come and see us the next day to make sure we were OK but we heard nothing really disappointed. We paid for a sea view room and if you squinted out the window and I stood on my tiptoes you could see a small bit of beach so dont waste money for this it was handy to be near the pool though but not for the amount of money paid to upgrade think i would take my chance next time. Great choice of drinks included without upgrading to privelage. There was smirnoff, absolut, havana rum, bacardi corona on tap and a whole lst of others and it was typical spanish measures. Also great choice of cocktails. All in all we had a fantastic time and would book to go back, really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* & Definitely will not be going back!”
Reviews.Author: BenH0
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the H10 Ocean Maya from 20/05/2011 for 11 nights, I come home from this holiday feeling more stressed than when I had left, we went to the hotel thinking it was a 5* hotel but I believe it is far from this, on the 2nd day of our stay our apartment toilet flooded the bathroom and took several calls to reception for them to fix it, this again happened 3 more times over our stay, it seemed as though the staff bodged the job each time, we had a problem with our television so we were without any TV for 3 nights, again after 3 calls to reception and asking the Thomson Rep to get it fixed we ended up flagging down a maintenance man who had to reprogram our cable box, The sea has to be the worst in the Caribbean region I have ever seen during the whole 11 nights I didn’t see 1 person in the sea it was filthy (not like the pictures in the brochure). If you wish to have a sun lounger by the pool make sure you get up at 5.30 am to lay your towels before everyone else does! During our stay there was a huge fire 50 yards from our apartment whereby the Italian restaurant burnt down we woke up choking on smoke and without any fire alarms and electricity I felt this was a disgrace, we were told to wait in the lobby and too go back to our rooms 5 hours later (9am) our clothes were left smelling of smoke for the rest of our stay, to top our holiday off we had money stolen from the safe on the last night, this was our money we had to pay for departure tax (700 pesos each) so as we had budgeted throughout the holiday we had to withdraw money and it ended up costing us a lot extra due to currency exchange rates, commission and service charges, we spent the last day following this up with an investigation which we are still waiting to hear from the customer service team at the H10 ocean Maya, We returned back to the UK in need of another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Even for a budget hotel, it was lacking”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: We headed to the Ocean Maya for 4 nights as a quick getaway before an adventure packed trip to Europe. We knew going in that we were staying at a "budget hotel" (this place is 3 stars at BEST), and we had previously stayed at their sister hotel, the Ocean Coral and Turquesa, about 20 minutes north. We paid about the same as the Ocean Coral so we expected it to be similar. It was not. We've been to the Cancun/Playa area about 8 times and we know what to expect. I felt even with the low price we paid, we should have gotten better. PROS: - Rooms were nicely decorated and spacious. - Pool was nice and refreshing. - A la carte restaurants were better than the buffet and atmosphere was nice. - Grounds were immaculate. - Front desk staff was nicer than most I've experienced. CONS: - Upon checking in and them knowing it was the start of our honeymoon, they put us in a room with 2 double beds. Really??? lol. They changed it after we asked, but come on!! A little customer service please! - There should have been about 100 more pool loungers. I've never been to a resort with so few. - Food at the buffet was DISGUSTING. And it was just okay at the other restaurants. - Beds were hard as a rock. Worse than your average Mexico hotel. - Drinks were AWFUL. I stopped drinking alcohol it was so bad. Bartenders were RUDE. Heard many other people comment on the same thing while we were there. - Service was terrible. It took my husband 25 minutes at one point to get us two drinks. NO, I'm not exaggerating. I thought he got lost, but when I went to find him, he was sitting on a stool at the bar being ignored. - Coffee shop opens at 4pm?!? What??? - Swim up bar smallest I've ever seen. - Beach/ocean water gross (But I knew that going in, so I don't count this against them). - "Towel game" worst than any other resort I have EVER stayed at. EVER. You absolutely have to have a towel on a pool lounger before 6:15am or you won't get one. I understand the resort can't control people but they should remove towels if the chairs stay unattended for more than an hour. Also, adding a lot more chairs (because there is room) would help. Overall, we knew we weren't getting luxury, but it was worse than we expected. Sister hotel in Puerto Morelos is MUCH, MUCH better! And I'm not one of those people who is never happy.....I've reviewed a lot of hotels, etc on tripadvisor and this is one of the lowest I've ever given. Thankfully when we left Ocean Maya we had a great two weeks somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “WE loved the resort and the people!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikki49_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the resort for 2 weeks. The staff were wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and went above and beyond to meet our needs. We loved Claudia, one of the servers at La Hacienda restarant. We loved Antonio, the server in the Italian restarant. The resort was just the right size for us. It was small enough to remain personal. The staff remembered us when we went to dinner or were at the pool bar or sitting in the lounge area in the evening. Wonderful. I recommended it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyBravoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I headed down for our second trip to Riviera Maya to stay at Ocean Maya Royale. It was a good trip for us to get away from kids and relax. The resort, however, was not as great as we were hoping. Was it good? Yes. Certainly not a 5 star. More like a 3.5 star resort. Staff: The staff, for the most part, was incredible. Claudia in the main dining room was incredible, as were Javier and Eber at the pool bar. The front desk staff were decent, but we had to argue with them on several occasions to make things right. Room: Our first room was hot. The A/C was not working well. I complained 7 times before I insisted that they move us. I requested that they give us privilege bands, which they ultimately did. The bands were good, but ultimately not worth the hassel of moving rooms. USA Transfers: GREAT. We stopped for some food on the way down. I unintentionally overpaid the driver, and he came back in to give me back the money. He was incredibly honest, and not many people would have done that. Great for USA Transfers. Other guests: It baffled me how rude some of the guests were to the bartenders and waitstaff, like they were entitled to things. It was plain rude. If you treat the staff with respect, I assure you, they will take great care of you. Food: The food was not great, and got old by the end of the trip. We are not picky people and found food we liked, but a few more days would have been difficult. The Japanese place (at the hibachi) was great. Jesus was excellent. Utlimately, you get what you pay for. Next time, we will pass on the all-inclusive, and if we head back down to Playa Del Carmen area again, we will spend more money for a better place. But, it was a good vacation, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Best sister trip”
Reviews.Author: Colette29
Reviews.Content: Vacationed with my sister at the Ocean Maya from May 11 through May 18th, 2011. Had a wonderful time & felt totally safe. The staff were wonderful & accommodating. Met by Herere who couldn’t do enough for us from beginning to end. A slight issue at check in as our room was not oceanfront as paid for. Returned to front desk and spoke with Eduardo and was quickly corrected & all our luggage moved by Herere. Rm 3601 is ground floor & right near the pool, beach, and the Italian & Mexican Restaurants. People did rise early to claim their lounge chairs but there was always enough to go around. It appears our beach was much nicer then our neighboring hotels but those that snorkel complained it was cloudy. Wait staff incredible, especially Claudia in dining room, Karina & Azetera (white flower) on the beach and Perla at customer service. Some complained about the food selections but my sister and I were happy with our choices. Liked the Italian restaurant the best, Japanese was ok for the experience, food OK. Didn’t try the Mexican as we had enough exposure during our stay. Entertainment staff were great and really tried to involve you during the day, loved Amy Jean. Only suggestion would be to get a large printout of the ongoing activities during your stay. Perla did give us this on request. Would be good to be given upon check in just to know what is going on. Also, would suggest a schedule of the daily dinner buffet as these are themed and would be good to know ahead of time before scheduling specialty restaurants. We missed a fab seafood night as we had already made reservations at the Italian. They provide free shuttle to Playa del Carmen each day @ 12:00 to return @ 4:45. Need to book @ 8:00 am the morning of with the tour guy in the lobby. Books up fast, we got the last 2 seats @ 8:30. Senior Frog had a party on the beach one day and provided transportation that night, leaving @ 9PM to return @ 2 AM. Hotel also offered a night out – not sure were. Average age between 25-55. Not a loud, partying place – but that was what we liked about it. Peaceful & restful. We did not upgrade to the black band and had just a good of time. We did get an orange bracelet as we booked with Bookit.com. People who booked with Apple also got the orange bands (just a heads up-people who booked with Apple were not happy as their guide did not meet with them after arrival to arrange their return shuttle trip) You can dress fancy or comfy. They tend to dress up for the specialty restaurants. Don’t forget suntan lotion (if your fair bring spf 30+), aloe, liquid caladryl (for itching), immodium, cover up & a hat. Great vacation and hope to return again !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!!!! Awesome Staff!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigstu80fpg
Reviews.Content: This was a brilliant hotel, first impressions last as they say and when the coach arrived at the hotel the view of the lobby was breathtaking, checking in was 1st class very efficient, checked in and in our room within 5mins, bellboys and porters very well dressed and eager to help, the pool area and pools were very clean although you had to be up early to get decent sunbeds and umbrellas, entertaiment staff were great fun and got people to participate in games, but I think they need more games maybe try some shooting and archery, waiters and waitresses in the resteraunts were great and a special mention goes to Claudia who was the most pleasant of them all, in the bar a special mention goes to Imelda and Shadadey those girls worked soooooo hard and always had a smile for you,overall great holiday and would return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: rainbow050
Reviews.Content: The room was clean all the time... The food was great and the people that work the pool place to eat went out of his way to make me a fish plate. The guides were helpful and told us if we never sailed before to take lessons or he said I'll take you for 10.00 dollars each so we picked the guide to take us... The lessons are 30.00 dollars. We didn't have time to take lessons since it was our last day. The pool water was nice and warm. The entertainment was awesome. The night time place to eat was breath taking... Right by the ocean breeze... the place had sheets up connected to bamboo, candle light, and ocean breeze and ocean sounds... loved it. It was extra if you wanted lobster though! What was great was they had vendors on their property selling beautiful stuff... I bought a wrap around dress for after swimming. Everything worked in our room! For a 3 in a half star place it was great... We will go back... Our stay was April of 2010... Right after spring break and it was not crowded and not crowded at the places you scuba dive, swimming with the dolphins ect...

Reviews.Title: “Love Everything but one thing...”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer7325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed at the Maya Royale for our honeymoon. We loved the food and restaurants and the all-inclusiveness of the resort. We only left the campus once! The only we didn't like were the beds-- they were as hard as a rock. Everything was beautiful and the staff was courteous. There were beautiful glass showers and modern decor. I just wish I could have woken up without a sore back though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation (but you get what you pay for)”
Reviews.Author: sims117
Reviews.Content: Service - wonderful. The bartenders, waitresses, bell boy, concierge, etc. were all lovely. They were very attentive and helpful. Spa - fabulous! The massages were great and the body scrubs are worth the money. The woman that works at the front of the spa was very helpful and friendly. Helped us select services that were a great deal and each time we came back she remembered us. Food - was ok. The italian place burned down so we rotated between the buffet (C+), mexican (B+), and japanese (B-) restaurants. The waiters were, most of the time, great but the food just wasn't all that original or well prepared (especially the meat). I did enjoy the large array of options at the buffet but I can imagine that if staying there for more than 6 or 7 days, it would probably get exceptionally old. Lots of good fresh fruit and salad, but you can only eat that for so many days! Love the mimosa and bloody mary bar at breakfast. Grounds - VERY well kept and beautiful. It was very clean and the pool area was gorgeous. Pool/beach - difficult to get a chair but once you do, you're set. The water is the perfect temperature, the whole area is clean and well taken care of. The swim up bar is very convenient. Room - was great, all except the bed. The A/C was refreshing, the bathroom was nice, and it was very spacious overall. The bed was VERY hard and I woke up with a neck ache most mornings. It was frustrating to pay for a massage and then wake up the next morning with crinks in your neck b/c of the bed. This is of course a personal preference so if you like very firm mattresses - you'll love it. If you don't, beware. Cost - great! We got a GREAT deal at only around $140 a night for two people. Overall, it was a good vacation. We had a nice time, especially for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Filled Vacation - Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: amandaroy
Reviews.Content: We were a couple and two friends in our early 20’s. When we arrived at the resort we were checked in very quickly and taken to our room. We were told one of our tv’s was being fixed but everything was ready when we got there. The rooms are beautiful and look exactly how they do in the pictures. There was a slight sewage smell the first couple days but it cleared up and we didn’t complain about it as we were in the room very little and you couldn’t smell it outside the bathroom. I also read other reviewers who said closing the toilet lid eliminated the smell. The food was changed daily and the a la carte restaurants were very good although we didn’t eat at the Mexican we heard it was delicious. The Italian was very good but the Japanese was our favourite! The service at the pool and lobby bar was a little slow but the bartenders work very hard considering there are only a few of them. We found sitting at the tables by the snack bar to be fun and had received great service there. The entertainment staff very extremely friendly and made our stay memorable and fun. Amy Jean and Polo! went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They worked long hours and always had a smile on their faces. They played with us in the pool, danced with us at night, and helped translate (as there were many students from Spain although I’m pretty sure it was their spring break). Also, the shows they put on were really cool! Transportation to the city cost about 20 dollars American one way but going downtown is worth it. If you book with the hotel, depending on the bar it will cost anywhere between 40-70 dollars and they generally provide transportation and all you can drink service. Going by yourself is also fun and the town seems very safe. There was a wall on part of the beach and the first part beside the wall was a little seaweedy, but if you walked down a little the water was clear, beautiful, and refreshing. We could always find chairs and an umbrella or palm tree to relax under by the pool. Overall we had a wonderful time! There was a lot of young people travelling from Spain and by the end we had made friends with many of them, along with the staff. We would definitely return and recommend the Ocean Maya Royale to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Humpos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from the 12th to the 19th of may. I can honestly say that I have never been any were better than this. First of all the staff are very friendly and polite and cannot do enough for the guests, the rooms are very modern spacious and kept immaculate by staff. The food is great something for all tastes my favourite was the Japaneese. The pool area is great but think it lacks background music a little more. How ever the entertainment staff are great at getting you envolved. The beach is cleaned every day (if you take a walk to the left of the hotel down the coast you will appreciate how clean it's kept compared to other hotels). The wild life Is a site to see we Fed a racoon whom we named horhay by hand which I will never forget. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone and love to return again

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, peaceful place.”
Reviews.Author: Julezz
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a very nice resort. It was laid back and a perfect place to just hang out by the pool or the beach. It wasn't huge and everyone was friendly. Landscaping was beautiful and very well kept. Lots of iguanas and a few of the "raccoons" who would actually come and take treats if you offered them. Resort was small enough that you could walk everywhere comfortably - no need for a shuttle. Pools were great - one without the pool bar was shallow at one end and had ledges that were perfect for laying in the water to read a book, or sitting to talk and have a drink. The other pool had a bar, and a section that had built-in lounges with jacuzzi. We asked for a room close to pools and we got one, but it had no view, being behind the pool-side restaurant, but it was okay. Rooms are not large. We had two double beds, sheets were kind of scratchy, but everything was very clean. There was a desk with 3 drawers and fridge. One chair ; closet had shelves for storage and a safe. No mirror in the room except bathroom, which made it hard when both of us were trying to get ready. Bathrooms were very nice - loved the floors and the big shower and vessel sink. We ate at the Hacienda buffet usually, and they kept our drinks filled, and quickly took away empty plates. I always found plenty to eat, but by the last day, was a little bored - not too much variety, day to day, but I I thought everything was good. Tons of fresh fruit, of course. There was always a variety of meats, beef, pork, chicken, pastas, salads, breads. I thought it was kind of odd that there wasn't a lot of authentic Mexican food. One night, they served Mexican outside, and had great tacos, but not a lot of other dishes that I would've expected. The second night we were there, the Italian restaurant burned to the ground - a little scary for us to watch (it's VERY hard to get fire-fighting equipment through resort so practically impossible to put out.) There was also a Japanese restaurant; we went there one night, but that night, they were serving Italian (since no Italian restaurant!) it was elegant and food was good - not great, but good. I think that overall, the resort's food was kind of bland. I didn't really encounter anything that was really tasty, or a surprise. But again, I always found something to eat, so not really a complaint. There was a coffee cafe where we went for some good frappes, etc., but it was near the lobby and restaurant, a long way to walk from room and it was closed most of the time. I think one of my biggest complaints is that I would've really liked to have coffee on my balcony in the morning. They had the one-cup coffee makers in the room, but coffee was terrible, and usually didn't include creamer. There was a smaller restaurant right by the pool that served lunches, if they would've served coffee in the morning, it would've been perfect. it was just very inconvenient to have to get dressed up in the morning to walk up to restaurant for coffee, and if you asked for it "to go", they would give you a styrofoam cup with no lid. It WAS nice, however, that they kept the room fridges stocked with Coke, water, Sprite, orange, beer, etc. My other complaint is that it was VERY difficult to get a chair by the pool. I got up and went to pool at 6 a.m. the second morning, and found almost every chair was already draped with a towel or book; apparently, people claimed them before going to bed, or got up really early. They did this at both pools and on the small beach. There were not enough chairs or umbrellas to accommodate, and this was the off-season, so not sure what they do when hotel is busy! I had a sunburn and even with sunblock, I couldn't take the sun without umbrella all day, so I found myself getting up WAY early and joining the "chair stealer" crowd! I think they could alleviate this by just putting out more chairs and umbrellas. There was a set-up at the pool to paint pottery, but the boy who ran it did not speak any English, and I never once saw anyone do that. The entertainment staff came around and asked people to play volleyball or aerobics, but they were nice if you said no. It was usually pretty easy to get drinks at pool - they had someone who came around. However, drinks at the pool will NOT get you drunk - very, very little alcohol in ANYthing that I ordered. In fact, there was not a single thing that I drank anywhere at the resort that had more than a hint of alcohol. But I didn't really mind, or I'd have gone to bar and asked for more. Oh - one strange thing - - they do not give you straws! The only place at resort that you could get a straw was at the bar in lobby. We would got there and get a drink after breakfast, just so we could have a straw the rest of the day at pool. Seemed very odd to me. We went into Playa del Carment to shop a few times - it's a quick taxi from resort - 7 or 8 miles? Anyway, it's $20 each way, although we usually got our return trip a few dollars cheaper. We didn't go on any excursions this trip, although I've done Xel-ha and Tulum before and I recommend doing those. Resort has vendors come in and set up about every other night to sell souveniers, jewelry, art, etc., but much, much better deals could be done in town. This was a very nice resort, and unbeatable for the price. Great place to lie around, soak up the sun, and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, shame about the food.”
Reviews.Author: Braveheart57
