Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Ocean Royale yesterday and although we did enjoy our holiday, you paid your money so you may as well make the best of it,but it just wasn't great. Here is our opinion on the holiday. Sun Loungers:- to get a lounger with a parasol you need to get up a 6am, YES 6 IN THE MORNING. On our first morning we wakened up at 5.45 and went out on the balcony to have a look at the view and I was shocked to see the towels round the pool. This went on every single day of our holiday despite us complaining to the rep. To get a lounger with some kind of shade you need to be up and 6am every day. Its just ridiculous. Same in the evening, after dinner, trying to get a table on the terace is a joke Nothing to do with space, there simply is not enough tables and chairs for the amount of guests. Restuarants:- The buffet restuarant, the food was nearly always cold, meat undercooked and very repetitive. Mexican, not to bad but not great. Itaian, this was really nice but unfortunately it burned down whilst we were there (nothing to do with me, I wasn't cooking:) Japanese, this was lovely apart from the chef reminding us to tip him before we left. How could we forget, he said it about 3 times. Rooms:- the room was nice, we upgraded to a sea view and it was lovely. The only downside was it wasn't cleaned until late afternoon. One night the maid turned up a 6.30 to clean the room. and on 4 occasions we had to phone for clean towels. Priviledge Section, not worth the money. $20 per person per day and for your money you get branded drinks, you MAY get shown into the priviledge section of the dining room and you can go to the priviledge section of the beach which have the ballanese beds. Beach:- the beach is not very nice. There is a small bit at the hotel that is ok but it doesn't compare to the beach at Cancun. Pools:- the pool bar is at the "quiet" pool so it was NOT QUIET. The other pool has the pool games i.e volley ball etc. Staff:- the staff were fantastic, sooo hard working and nothing is to much trouble for them. I can't speak highly enough of them. The hotel needs to address these issues and if it does things will certainly improve.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip - loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: rockies2011
Reviews.Content: My husband & I met our English friends at the resort and stayed for 10 great days. The hotel was everything we hoped for - room, staff, gardens, beach, food & drink. We've been to many resorts in Mexico & the Caribbean, and this was right up there with the best!! Loved the fact that the resort was adults-only. We requested a table with Claudia every day in the main dining room - such a sweet girl - gave us the best service, and tried her best to teach us Spanish - not an easy task - what a treat! We loved the Japanese restaurant, and were thrilled each time Ingrid was able to get us a seating - she's a great example of excellent customer service. The bartenders in the main bar, as well as the waitresses, were also fantastic. This was a great vacation - would definitely recommend to our friends, and hope to be back in the near future. Our thanks to all for a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Rach8361
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at ocean Maya and have nothing but excellent reviews...... First of all a massive thankyou to the animation team for all your hard work and especially to polo who made our holiday!! We miss you already!! These guys work hard from morning to night trying to entertain everyone even when no one wants to join in they keep trying. The shows they perform are a must see cheesy lol but fun :) Now for everything else.....the rooms were comfortable, clean and well maintained. Cleaned daily and restocked. ......there is a good selection of food to choose from unfortunately the Italian burnt down whilst we were there but we managed to eat there before and was fantastic. Special thanks to ingrid for her always smiling face every morning and evening. Overall the ocean Maya is a fantastic resort, beautiful grounds and very friendly staff and we are already looking to come back asap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service - we would definitely recommend to friends and family”
Reviews.Author: KKSSouthyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have just returned from 10 nights at the Ocean Maya Royale and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Accommodation and service We did have a few problems with our room but we reported this to the reception staff and they offered us another room which was much better. We had a problem with the TV in our second room but this was dealt with promptly by maintenance. We feel that the staff were very accomodating and welcoming. The staff always greeted you with a smile and a polite hello and they could not do enough for you. Food The food was excellent, always plenty of choice and the food was of a very good standard. We would recommend that you dine in the mexican restaurant and ask Jorge for a special mayan coffee - it is out of this world! We were very sorry to see that Dolce Vita Restaurant (Italian) destroyed by fire during our stay and we hope that the hotel will be able to reconstruct the Dolce Vita very soon. We were delighted to hear that whilst the Italian restaurant had been destroyed the staff from this restaurant had been kept on and the hotel were continuing to offer its Italian menu in an alternative location within the hotel as soon as the day after. Well done!! Excursions offered by Thomson We went on quite a few excursions with Thomson and some of the excursions left us a little disappointed as we felt that not all excursions were good value for money. We did give feedback to our Thomson rep in the hope that Thomson will provide more comprehensive information about their excursions before offering these to future holidaymakers. We did the Chichen Itza full day tour by bus and this was a very long day but worth every penny. We did the Captain Hook night excursion and this was very cheesy but very entertaining and good value for money. Great for kids and big kids!! Try to get a seat on the deck rather than up at the top as you will get a better view of the show and get more involved. We did the Sian Kaan jungle tour (full day - a very long day!) It was advertised as a 1 and a 1/2 hour transfer and that breakfast would be included. You should be warned that you do have a 1 and a 1/2 hour transfer from the hotel but this is to the truck that you spend a further 2 and a 1/2 hours (at least) transferring to Sian Kaan. Breakfast is not provided until you reach Sian Kaan so you don't get anything to eat until 11 to 11.30am and this is a small pancake with a bit of cheese on top. The trip was a good experience however the transfer to and from the hotel to Sian Kaan was like an endurance test. We both had very sore backs and one of the people on our tour got his eye cut open and his glasses broken by a palm branch that hit him whilst travelling on the truck through the jungle terrain. Overall the trip was not worth the money that we paid for it and not what we had expected. The Playa Bar crawl and Coco Bongos trip began as a fantastic night out until we reached Coco Bongos. Coco Bongos was so packed with people that we could not see the show from where the Thomson reps had reserved. When we tried to move to see the show we were told to return to our places, we tried to stand on benches to see (as advised by Thomson reps) and we were told off by the bar staff. The drinks in Coco Bongos were supposed to be all inclusive but and when we were offered shots by the girls in Coco Bongos (advertised as free) we were then charged. We mentioned this to the Thomson reps but they didn't seem interested. We got a taxi back to the hotel 30 minutes into arriving at Coco Bongos. Quality and Value for Money The Hotel was fantastic and we would defnitely recommend to family and friends, we have not stayed at a Sandals resort but we have heard a lot of people say that this Hotel is just as good. Our ratings:- Hotal Service - 5 star Rooms- 4 1/2 star Food - 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Mlgman
Reviews.Content: Grounds r very nice but that's as good as it gets the ocean looks like jersey food is average and everything opens late shortage of beach chairs service is horrible and they cancel everything oh yeah italian restaurant burnt down while we where there so they r down to 2 restaurants good luck

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cjrauscher
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at ocean maya and enjoyed every minute of our stay. This was our first trip and we feel we made the right decision for the price that we paid. Hotel- The hotel was beautiful, comparable to some 5 star resorts in terms of beauty. While checking in you will see a nice grand lobby with marble floors a giant bar and plenty of couch loungers with open doors out the the courtyard that had the Asian restaurant and buffett on both sides. The courtyard is where the evening entertainment happens and is a nice place just to sit and have a drink. Restaurants- There are 3 different selections, Mexican, Asain, and Itailan. We loved the mexican as we can eat Mex food everyday. Not the best I have eaten but definitely edible and comparable to other AI. Make sure you ask for the Mayan coffee. It is a great show. We ate at the Mex on our anniversary night and I had emailed the resort ahead of time for a reservation and they where super helping. My wife had been looking for cheesecake all trip and on our anniversary night they gave us a small cheese cake with Happy anniversary. It was a very nice gesture. The asian was very good as well, you can smell the garlic they load up on the food while cooking at the Hibatchi. Jesus put up a great show. We did not get to try out the Italian due to a fire that burnt it down the morning we where going to eat there. The buffet during dinner was my least favorite dinner, it was asian night and I could not find anything I liked and I am no picky eater. I am hoping that it was just due to they where overwhelmed due to the fire. Because breakfast and lunch at the buffet was great. I feel like i am turned into a ninja turtle from all the guacamole that i ate. I really would return here for the price we paid. The staff is so nice and hard working and the grounds are so pretty to just walk around and enjoy your company. Shout out to my guy ricardo for his hard work that he does everyday and also every-other staff member that made our trip wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: appleye69
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great and wait staff was very friendly. Bartenders Eber and Javier were great. Pool staff member Amee was a blast. We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: longsands
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from this wonderful and relaxing holiday and I feel compelled to share our experiences. Almost everything about this hotel is spot-on with a few VERY minor complaints. I shall start with some of the many positives: Check-in is professional and quick and performed by genuinley happy and cheerful staff with a good command of English. The Bell-Boy who showed us to our room, although having limited English stayed with us until he was happy that we were conversant with the operaration of the facilities in the room. The rooms are of a higher standard than is usual in All Inclusives, at least the ones we have stayed in. This is due to the resort having recently undergone a refurbishment following the transition to "Adults Only". The grounds are simply stunning. The team of gardeners work constantly to maintain the obvious high standard. The staff in general are the most pleasant bunch you could meet, and special mention must go to to Lobby bar waitresses, the impecable Imelda and Shaday (AKA Smiler). The nick-name says it all. She beams throughout her shift and lights up the place. When we arrived there were three speciality restaurants, Japanese, Mexican and Italian. Unfortunately during our stay the Italian restaurant burnt to the ground during the night. Thankfully no-one was hurt but there was some inconvenience caused to those whose rooms were close to the restaurant. The food throughout the resort was of a good standard and even the pickiest of eaters should find something to please them. Now for the minor gripes: The beach isn't the best. There are two beaches separated by a boardwalk which has a plexi-glass screen that acts as a windbreak. Both sections of beach have a problem with seaweed coming ashore in large amounts. The beach attendants work continously to clear the seaweed, but it is a never-ending task especially when the sea is anything other than flat calm. The water is murky and the sea floor feels slimy to walk on. There is no wildlife to see so snorkling is a bit of a waste of time. There are never enough beds with shade, and even the ones with shade are snapped up before 7am. When you go down to the beach or pool in the morning, every bed has towels draped over them.... and there is not one person in sight. They have all been "Reserved" by inconsiderate people who often don't show up until late morning. This simply is not fair but is a re-occuring theme at this type of hotel, and the management seem reluctant to address the problem. As stated earlier, these are fairly insignificant issues when taken in context with the rest of the experience at this hotel. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time and Amazing Animation Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bkhavoc37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this resort through cheapcarribean.com and mainly choose it due to its affordable price. We stayed at the resort from 5/20/2011-5/24/2011 to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. Our time here was wonderful and everyone we dealt with at the resort was extremely helpful and friendly. All of the activities throughout the day are run by the Animations staff, who were all amazing. Ricardo was wonderful and constantly made sure if someone wanted to play water volleyball, beach volleyball, water polo, or any other activity that he would organize a game. The food was also wonderful with Hibachi being our favorite and the chef Jesus making it the best it could be. We would definitely vacation here again and we recommend it to anyone looking to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the OC & T instead!!”
Reviews.Author: invst164
Reviews.Content: We went to the sister H10 hotel to the Ocean Maya last year, the Ocean Coral & Turquesa, and it was much better than what we experienced at the OM this year. First **BEWARE** If you are one of the lucky few who get the "VIP Concierge" at check in, say NO THANK YOU and ask to be taken to your room. Unless you want to waste a day of your precious vacation for a "gift", run away. We sat down w/ the VIP Concierge but didn't go for the presentation - we did see a bunch of people being ushered around, though. Didn't look like fun. I don't know what people are talking about but the food was terrible. Okay if you want sodium on a stick I guess. The Japanese place was better than the others with the Italian place coming in second, if it hadn't burnt down while we were there. There aren't enough chairs or umbrellas at the pools. The staff was fantastic - all were more than nice and accommodating (except when you try to get into a restaurant when it's supposed to open - then they ask you to leave and open 30 minutes later). The coffee shop, Mike's, was AMAZING but they don't open until 4pm???? So only look forward to getting a cup of mud with milk until the afternoon. Because I am able to compare our experience last year to this one - go to the Ocean Coral - more & better food choices, more pools, more & better beach area, bigger lobby w/ more places to sit and relax in and out. One last thing, don't leave anything on the floor or any food in your room - little tiny ants or something get in your bags and swarm on a dirty plate or glass. Put all that outside your door and keep everything up. We had an okay time but were hungry and bored most of the time we were there and longed to be back at the OC & T instead.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hot5060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Ocean Maya from the 14th - 24th May, we met our friends from the USA in the reception and our holiday began. Check in was quick, friendly and informative, we did change our room as we like to be on the 2nd floor, but this has no reflection on our first room. Rooms are cleaned every day with excellent maid services. Restaurants: you will never go hungry in this hotel - with a choice of four restaurants, we used the buffet restaurant and the Japanese mainly. At the buffet restaurant we enjoyed our morning spanish lessons from claudia, who works so hard at making everyones stay enjoyable, she is an assett to the hotel. At the Japanese restaurant we meet Ingrid, she is an absolute star, we required a table for six at very short notice and Ingrid did her best to make this happen, All the staff are very friendly and work very hard to make your holiday unforgetable. We will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best All Inclusive Experience...Ever!!! Lotta Bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: biznjill
Reviews.Content: I will describe our H10 Ocean Maya resort experience below, after first reviewing others who played a part in our vacation. This was the first time in many years that my wife and I have been with all three of my adult daughters for a vacation. We have been to many All-Inclusive resorts in Punta Cana, Cancun and a non-inclusive in Aruba. We were looking for this vacation to be the best ever... and it was, thanks to: * Bookit.com- Outstanding, helpful, organized service. I would recommend Bookit to all and we will now choose Bookit as our #1 source for travel. Chris, our travel advisor, went above and beyond to find us the best value for our party of seven. Travel with ease describes it best. Vouchers for resort, transfers and links for airfare were straight forward and very user friendly. Thanks Chris and kudos to Bookit! * Best Day Travel- our travel representative for Bookit at the Ocean Maya. Augusto was courteous and very helpful, especially during the one and only hitch in our stay (see below). Best Day also handled our transfers also and we were promptly met by BD rep at airport and promptly taken to the resort. Return trip transfer was also right on time. * Delta- great flight experience, flew from Lexington, Ky through ATL to Cancun. However, baggage was beat up badly- torn, mashed, dented and zipper broken during handling. :-( to TSA for Baggage being ransacked during inspection at customs and not returned to proper packing order. :-) to TSA for helpful, easy, non groping customs and security. Now to the H10 Ocean Maya: What a pleasant surprise! Some other reviewers ( like the Vanderbilts and Rockefellers) expect Caviar and Lobster for every meal at $20 per night. We have very realistic expectations and the H10-OM met and exceeded them all! Hotel staff and resort grounds- Front desk and concierge service was so courteous and eager to serve. In particular, Luis @ guest services was the best we have seen and deserves a raise in salary(LOL!). Management was everywhere to be seen throughout the resort. Grounds were gorgeous and the pools (especially the quiet pool) were perfect temp and clean as could be. Rooms were immaculately and well stocked daily. My wife and I were in room 1406- first floor, right off the walkway and perfectly located in the center between pool/beach and lobby/buffet/shows. The desk staff accomodated my request for a central room due to my COPD and they granted my request with pleasure and went out of there way to keep looking until they found what they thought would best suit our needs. Food- Fantastic @ breakfast- Gerardo (Johnny Depp) made us eggs cooked to order and omelettes that were perfect. Much to choose from. our server,Vincente, is to be commended- what a sweet polite man! and he has such nice hair! Lunch at Charro, near the pool was great with slections such as pizza, great burgers, salads, meats, fish, vegan selections and a wonderful staff. Dinner at the buffet was as expected- not the best gourmet cusine, but always had plenty to choose from. Mexican theme night was awesome though! Street tacos, etc.- felt like we were actually experiencing Cinco de Mayo @ the resort. The reservation restaurants- all three were awesome! Japanese tepanyaki/hibachi (Jesus is a Ninja!- very entertaining) was as good as back home. we ate there twice. Italian was fantastic and surprisingly authentic. Perfectly seasoned and well presented. It was the pleasing shocker of our food experience at H10-OC. Wish we could have gone there again! The Mexican made us miserable...with delight !!! So much food ! We needed pillows for a siesta after eating there. We ate there 3 times. Reservations were easy and got the times we wanted all but once, but still got us close to our requested time. We give these restaurants 6 stars! The Food manager, chefs and staff deserve all the praise in the world for their menus and service. The best food at any AI resort we have ever had... bar none! Food so nice, I'll say it twice! The best AI food at any AI resort! At any price! Mikes coffee shop was also great! Hot and frozen coffee drinks of all kinds in a relaxed atmosphere! Bars- Noe @ Charro is El Hombre! Miami Vice, Banana Mama, Mojito, tequila shots, Corona beer highly recommended! Did not miss upcale booze at all. Lobby bar was busy at night after the shows, but service was still good. Swim up bar was okay... a little loud for our taste, but not unruly and service was fine. Shows and Entertainment- We normally go to the AI shows expecting shows so bad that they are great comedic entertainment. Not at H10-OM. "Grease" show was cheesy in a good way and was very entertaining. The Mexican show and Mayan shows were the highlight. The "Circus" show was also good. "at the Movies" was performed by the animation staff and was funny and entertaining. The H10-OM choreographer has put together some very entertain shows and the animation staff is hard working, eager to please, engaging and most of all- not in your face, dragging you to participate. Special kudos to our new friend Polo. He made our stay at the H10-OM unforgettable, with such personal attention and wonderful conversations with all the family. We miss him already and hope he is there when we return. Amy Jean was always cheerful, though experiencing a difficult family illness. Our prayers are with you. H10-OM should take great pride in the animation staff! There was a special Barbeque Beach Blast one afternoon at the beach with great food (including Payaya! -yum yum). The band from Cuba was awesome! There had a 70s 80s pop rock band another night that was also very good. Every night after the shows, there would be a DJ playing in a disco area just off the showroom. Not a real discoteque, but we made it a party anyway. There were a number of shops also, but take plenty of sunscreen... it is expensive there! The outdoor Karaoke Night was an all out funfest for our family and all that participated. Now to the only negative part of our stay. USE THE SAFES! We used safes always EXCEPT one night. After pooling and drinking until 5 pm, we went to our room for a nap until 7 pm and then waking, showering and going to dinner reserved for 8 pm. The rooms have a card slot on the interior side from the door for inserting the room key and turning on all the lights and outlets in the room. The AC stays on w/o the card. Every time the card is taken out, the alarm clock blinks 12:00 and needs rest. So, on this particular day I decided to use my cell phone for my alarm. The alarm went off at 7 and I hit the snooze and after one more alarm, I shut it off. My wife wakes me, telling me it is 10 minutes util 8. I jump from bed into the shower, shave, dry my hair, dress and went out the door in a mad rush... leaving my smartphone on the nightstand. Upon our return at 10:30 pm, the phone was gone! We immediately reported the missing phone to the front desk. Nelson, the night security supervisor was swiftly at our door and did a computerized check on our electronic door lock to see who had entered the room during that time period. He stated that we would get the report the next day. We discovered that the rear patio door had been tampered with. Nelson dusted the door for fingerprints and told us to not touch the patio door area and to not let any of the staff use that door. The next day, the Security Manager, Delphin, met with us to brief us on the investigation. Luis at guest services let me use the hotel computer to suspend my phone service and also called my cell provider, so that I could report the theft and make sure that my service was cancelled. Delphin is a very thorough investigator and told us that he intervied all employees who had been in the room during our stay. He said that he could confirm that the phone had been seen on the nightstand by the cleaning staff that night. It was his though that someone other than the cleaning staff probably entered through the patio door while we were gone and exited the same way, so that they would not be detected by the electronic lock on the front door. WE feel bad for our loss and also feel bad for the resort management, as they have only had 2 thefts reported since January 2011. USE THE SAFE! H10-OM management offered us upgrades or anything they could do to try to compensate us for our loss. It is a terrible thing for the actions of one bad apple to reflect badly on the reputation of the whole resort. We will be getting a report from H10-OM on the results of their investigation. Delphin and the security staff are impressively courteous and professional and showed genuine concern for our misfortune. Thank you Delphin, Nelson and Luis for your consirable assistance and concern. This is a professionally run resort with high standards for it's employees and high regard for it's guests. I will say it one more time- USE THE SAFE AT ALL TIMES! However, I know that safe or no safe, guests should feel that their belongings are safe and secure. We are disappointed that this happened to us, but Maria and all the management staff are disappointed also and have assured us that they do not take this lightly and will always work toward perfecting the security of the resort. So, in the end, even our misfortune has a positive reflection on the H10 Ocean Maya resort, in our opinion. Final result of this review: The best All Inclusive resort, management, staff, food, drinks, pool, bars, shows of ANY resort we have been to, AT ANY PRICE! This is the best bang for your buck you could ever get for a Mayan Riviera vacation. Thanks to Maria (Miss Tripadvisor 2011) and all at Ocean Maya for a wonderful vacation for my family. p.s.- the "all adult" as of May 2011 was a great move. Just keep the spring breakers away (there were none during our stay) and you will have great success in the future. SEE YOU AGAIN NEXT YEAR FOR SURE! With love and respect, The Kentucky Fried Tourists

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: nuttynhut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there May 8th-13th 2011, and we definitely would not come back. positive things: room is really nice, spacious, good room service negative things: restaurants are not open 24/7. Most of the time, if you want to eat around dinner time, if you dont join their Premium Package that they offer, you'll have to wait in line for your turn to eat. Premium Package is $20/day/person. Even if the restaurants are not full, they'll make you wait so they could reserve seats for people who do have Premium. Restaurants are not open on time as scheduled, and if you just even step inside, you'll be asked to leave. They always open 20-30mins late. Those of you who plan on doing excursions in the morning, you wont get to eat anything since only one buffet restaurant would be open, and it's always open late. There are a bunch of iguanas around the resort, their big and nasty looking. if you plan on taking pictures around the resort, look out for them. Sometimes even when you're sitting in a restaurant eating, those iguanas would crawl in and no one would chase them out because they dont mind having iguanas crawling under their tables, i guess. Also, around night time, if you're eating out on a deck, look out for racoons. They're big and they're everywhere. They'll bite you if you try to chase them away.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - quiet and relaxing with really hard working staff”
Reviews.Author: borisbrain
Reviews.Content: My GF and I have just returned from a week at the Ocean Maya. This was a really great hotel on the beach, not too big, with roomy accommodation set in beautiful gardens, and with an abundance of great food and drink. I've never come across a harder working hotel where everybody goes out of their way to say hello or help out. The lobby is large and welcoming, with shops, a bar and a coffee shop. This leads out to a nice courtyard with a rectangular ornamental pool with fountains to relax around. Here you'll find the the main buffet, the Japanese restaurant, the theatre and outdoor evening entertainment. There's also markets on two or three evenings a week. From the courtyard you then head past a beautiful rock garden with waterfall down through the grounds to the rooms. All of the rooms are spacious and modern. There are 37 villas set throughout the grounds, most with 8 rooms (4 up, 4 down). Our room had a king size bed, a terrace, free safe, closet with iron and board, sofa, armchair, desk, table, a coffee maker, free minibar and a flat screen telly. The bathroom was also modern, with the shower and toilet separate from the basin area, where you'll find a hairdryer and shower/shampoo/moisturiser potions. The only thing missing was the promised bathrobe and slippers. The maid service was efficient, although we didn't get any towel artwork - not that we were bothered. The villas are separated by the most immaculate grounds, which the staff work tirelessly to maintain. Some of the flora are labelled, as you might find in a botanical garden, with some iguanas and other wildlife occasionally flitting through. All paths lead to the seafront area where there are two pools, one with a swim-up bar and both with sunbathing ledges built into the pool - perfect for sunbathing and staying cool at the same time. There were plenty of sun loungers around the pool and beach. It's true that it's sometimes a little difficult to find a spot, but we always found somewhere. The hammocks were pretty good fun too. Staff weave throughout the pool and beach areas to bring you drinks. There's also low-key animation from friendly staff who then double-up as performers in the theatre later. You can also get a sea-front massage by the pool, though it's not cheap. There's not a huge amount of beach since part of it has been turned into a boardwalk - though this is quite picturesque in itself. The sea was warm, although quite choppy so not good for extended bouts of swimming or snorkelling, but fine for paddling or wading. Some reviewers have commented on the water - this is down to fine particles of seaweed, not dirt. At one end of the beach by a tide break and the boardwalk these particles can be so fine that the water sometimes appears almost black. This depends on the weather conditions out at sea and is not the hotel's fault. And everyday there are staff on the beach with the thankless job of raking up sea weed. It's really not as bad as some people have made out, and only limited to one small section of the beach. Food was great. The main buffet had an incredible selection, with a grill station for cooking beef, pork, chicken or fish to order, along with an impressive selection of pre-prepared dishes. There was also a pasta station and omelette station, and an extensive collection of desserts. The house red wine was pretty good also. In addition to the buffet there were three a-la carte restaurants - Japanese (by the courtyard), Mexican (by the pool) and Italian (by the beach). The best thing about these was that they were walk-in restaurants which didn't require pre-booking. The food at each was stunning. Tips: Try the Mayan coffee at the Mexican restaurant, prepared with flaming brandy. This, like everything else you'll find, is all inclusive. Also, try the coffee shop in the lobby. Ask for a selection of appetizers at the Japanese and Mexican restaurants. Visit Playa Del Carmen, Tulum or Chichen Itza. If you're a scuba diver, don't bother with the hotel dive centre, it costs a fortune -$125 for a 2-tank dive. I ended up choosing DiveMike in Playa del Carmen - a great outfit who only charged $55, and will also pick you up. Try the cenotes - cavern dives, or the wreck of the Mama Vina.

Reviews.Title: “A different perspective and review. . . .”
Reviews.Author: meegle76
Reviews.Content: Hi all, I'm going to take a bit of a risk here, but I think it's an honest assessment (albeit a subjective one). I'm going to start off by saying I AM an American and these are topics of conversation that are not broached in public. I rarely write these reviews, but felt that it was worth the time. I read a lot of reviews before deciding on this resort, when the reality is, I believe that all resorts will be about the same. The bigger issue is this: IT IS MEXICO. What you have, for the most part (not ALL, but MOST) is gobs of Americans looking to be served in a way fit for a king. .. but true to the American way, they want to do it for $72 a night. Think about what Mexico is derived of. . .this is a very, very poor country (well hidden as you drive to one straight road that leads you to resort after resort which are hidden near the gulf off of the main strip). The people serving you are wonderful and hard-working and most likely, if they are older, are trying to support their families off of their wages. Because of this (and in other tourist hot spots) of course the resorts will maximize their abilities to sell, sell, sell. My point is this: if you are a mullet-wearing, sun burning, chain-smoking, obese American who spends his or her day drunk and is looking for his/her vacation of a lifetime: you've found it! If you're 18 years old or a college student and want to have a vacation in a drunken haze with your friends, do it! This is for YOU! Who cares what the rooms or the grounds are like? You won't be in your room. Non-stop drinking and food-that's all you need and you've got it! If you are a couple who is looking for a getaway, for a comfortable bed and a haven to get away for a few days-spend the extra grand to go to Fiji, Hawaii, Belize or Sweden. These are places that do NOT need tourism to survive. Mexico is not one of these places. It simply DOES NOT matter what resort you go to. Even if you upgrade as we did in this resort (Privileged) this does not mean there is an increase in quality. The fact is that yes, the resorts are as pictured. But DO NOT EXPECT more than the destination can offer you.

Reviews.Title: “Service Staff,Food and Hotel AWESOME !!! The Mgmt. needs help!!”
Reviews.Author: Pepelpew
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 8 days and it was just a pictured. I read the reviews and did a lot of research before booking as I ALWAYS do. So when Our bed was so hard my Husband had to sleep on the couch I asked for a pad . It was thin but we gave it a try . The next day we were going on an all day excursion and I went to the front desk and requested "a PAD' for the bed and told them we would be out until 7pm so they had plenty of time to do it. he wrote my name on a list with other people requesting the same . No PAD when when we came back 12 hours later exhausted ,so I called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager , I was told he was out to lunch so I asked please have him call when he returns . He must still be eating because he never called. Finally someone came to my room and put blankets over the mattress and it helped a little .I booked this place and one of my things is I like room service in the morning to have fresh hot coffee and sit on the Patio enjoying nature while my Hubby sleeps in .It states there is room service .. Yeah only from11 am -11 pm as i was told by the front desk when i wanted coffee in the morning i was told only the Privelege get morning room service , I know i have a coffee maker in the room and a fridge but the fridge wouldn't keep the milk cold enough and i am on vacation. I was told i could upgrade to privelege for $20.00 each ($40.00) extra per day .No I don't think so .I have stayed at Secrets, LeBlanc and a few others and never was treated like i was looked down on for not being "Priveleged"So Mgmt needs to step up . I kept getting sales pitches and was offered $50.00 then $100.00 then $200.00 to go to a 90 min sales pitch , How many times do i need to say NOT INTERESTED!!! So besides that I must say the rest of the staff , food , grounds and tours were Excellent . This place has so much potential if Mgmt . could get it's act together . I'm sure they will do the I'm sorry post as they did to others but come on!!! Too little to late !!!! I stayed at Catalonia Royal Tulum last year and thets where I will go again It ran circles around this place .I feel sorry for the ones that do a good job , Like i said food was the best ever and i got great drinks with almost any liquor I wanted.. I tipped the hard working staff . But Mgmt. always made us feel UNWELCOME !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in the Riveria Maya”
Reviews.Author: bordia
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th trip to the Riviera Maya, and our best trip so far. As everyone says, the grounds are absolutely gorgeous. My husband and I love the concept of the villas which consist of 8 guest rooms (4 up and 4 down.) The rooms were very quiet. We never once heard our neighbors. The rooms are exactly as shown on their website. The walk-in shower is awesome. At every resort in Mexico that we have stayed at (22 in all) the beds have been firm. This seems to be the Mexican way, which is just fine with us as we prefer firm mattresses. Don't understand how anyone can give a negative review on the food. It was the best ever at any Mexican resort. At the La Hacienda Buffet your can find whatever you want for breakfast. For lunch and dinner there was a very good selection of meat and fish (pick whichever for them to grill for you) or choose from the big selection of other hot dishes, and don't forget the yummy ice cream for dessert. Yookoso, the Japanese, excellent show and good food. El Dolce Vita, the Italian, we did not eat here, but other guests raved about it. El Charro is the snack bar during the day (hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza, and an assortment of hot dishes) and the Mexican restaurant for dinner. Wonderful food and service, thanks to Jorge and Manuel. How about those Banana Margueritas! Some people on Trip Advisor cmplained about weak drinks. Why wouldn't they just ask for more liquor in their drink? Just ask Ignacio at the Lobby Bar and David at the Pool Bar. If they don't know your preferences, just let them know. This should be no grounds for complaint. On another issue, we did notice a slight septice smell on one of the walkways, however, it lasted for about 3 steps. Definitely not a big deal. On our last day, Omar and Ricardo from the Entertainment Staff joined us for lunch. They truly love their jobs, and it definitely shows. Although, we were not Priviledge, we could not have been treated any better. Thanks again to the very gracious Maria Lopez, who had a big hand in making this such a great vacation. She made us feel very special. s

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ed_2busy
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place the hotel food/staff/accomodation/ grounds were excellent. I must congratulate the owners for applying such high standards and attention to detail. We had a small upset at the start of our holiday from a large group of Spanish graduates however the hotel and thomsons dealt with it very well and the remainder of our holiday was truly R & R. The hotel offers many things not listed in the brochure, towels for the beach or pool ,iron plus board in the room,free safe to name but a few but all of which add value and give you more space for clothes . They also offer Privilage guest status at a cost of course which opens up a new set of benefits to enhance your holiday but these are limited and are only available on check in. The finest asset of the whole hotel is the staff they were superb, so friendly and willing to help with any request . I would recommend anyone to treat themselves to a stay here well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: vacationmaven_88
Reviews.Content: I was tempted to change my reservation after I saw all the negative reviews on here. THANK GOODNESS I DID NOT! This place was awesome! It was SUCH a good resort, especially for the price. The food was delicious, especially at El Charro. The beach was beautiful, the swim up bar was fun, there were two pools to swim in. All of the employees were so friendly and helpful! It was such a relaxing vacation, and we met A LOT of fun people too! There was always something to do, whether it was tequila volleyball, live bands, swimming, or just laying out. Definitely not a "party, party" atmosphere, but still fun! I would definitely go back. This was one of the best vacations I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantantic Time in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: CurleySuz
Reviews.Content: My wife and 5 other relatives spent 9 days at Ocean Maya and had a terrific vacation. Maria at the hotel was very helpful it resolving a reservation issue before we even arrived. Having stayed at another resort last year, every hotel has its positive points. For Ocean Maya those very positive items include the hotel layout with a number of separate buildings, the well manicured grounds, the friendly & responsive staff, (waiters Felix and Alberto were great, as was the chef Jesus at the Japanese restaurant), the breakfast buffet, the room decor, the two pools, as well as an overall safe & fun environment. Some items that were fine but not overly impressive included the Italian restaurant (at least not the night we ate there -- our group liked, in order the Japanese by far, the Mexican, the general Buffet, and then the Italian), the shower door does leak (although it does help when exiting, to draw the glass door towards you), the hard bed, the room safe is not large enough to fit a laptop (but there were no problems with room security), the immediate beach is not the best for swimming (it got better after a 15 minute walk to the right), the nightly entertainment was somewhat haphazard and not quite up to par with larger hotels (but that is not why we chose the hotel in the first place). Because our group went on excursions 4 different days (Tulum, Xplor, Xel-Ha, and Chichen-Itza), there was a little more expense in taking 7 of us into Playa Del Carmen, which takes about 15 minutes. Most of the taxis ,hold only 3 to 4 people, although we got to know Jorge (a hotel cab driver) who had a small van that held 7. We tried a number of different modes of transportation. We used the colectivo (about $35 pesos a person to Playa) which means you walk the 15 minutes or so out from the hotel to the street, and the same when you return. This works better with a smaller number of people as it may take a few attempts to find a van with enough room. We also negotiated a rate with Jorge to take us all to Xel-Ha (we couldn't believe he waited for us from 9:30 until 5:15 to exit the park). We have also taken the ADO bus before, which are nicer than U.S. buses. And one day we even took the hotel, free shuttle to Playa - it leaves at noon, returns at 5 pm and requires that you sign up for it on the day prior. If you want to allocate some of your money for other things other than a hotel, such as shopping , excursions, and getting to know Mexico, yet still have a quality hotel that does not feel like a budget resort then you will be pleased with the Ocean Maya - we were. Travel Tips: 1) Make sure you take an insulated thermos or bottle - it can be convenient for beach drinks but it can be a life saver at Chechin-Itza if you fill it with ice before leaving the hotel. 2) Get a H10 membership and it is possible to receive 10% off your bill 3) Take some good water shoes - a must for Xplor and other beach activities 4) The all inclusive tickets for Xel-Ha, Xcaret, Xplor or even Chichen-Itza, include lunch and the food is good ! 5) You may want to take a laminated copy of your passport while traveling locally and leave the original one in your hotel room safe. 6) Take a number of $1 bills with you for tipping the maids, waiters, servers and for shopping when they may not have change for larger bills. 7) You can get a discount buying park tickets online to Xel-Ha, Xcaret, Xplor and even a larger discount when you purchase tickets to more than one park. 8) Check out Xplor, it is awesome! Arrive at the park when it opens, do the zip lines before it gets crowded and be sure to see the incredible sights in the caves when taking the the river swim -- it is unbelievable !.

Reviews.Title: “I have to say it”
Reviews.Author: PRBubba
Reviews.Content: The last night of our stay at this hotel, we had something stolen from our room. We had an early departure and did not notice until that morning. With no time to be sure and report the loss, we left with the hopes that the hotel would respond. I contacted them, gave all the details I could possibly give, and they refuse to do anything for me. I cannot make an insurance claim because I they will not help. I loved this hotel until the end but I guess they don't care. And I can only assume someone knew we were checking out early. So I am going to tell everyone I can about the events of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastico”
Reviews.Author: iainsmith
Reviews.Content: just back and very unhappy to leave such an amazing place and what really made it was the local mexican staff the friendliest people you could meet ie all the entertainment staff especially daniella,fernanda and amy also other names to look out for ingrid, estella,imelda,alberto,alfredo to name but a few. The therapists,bar staff,pool and grounds staff were equally as friendly and accomodating. grounds were beautiful, rooms were spotless, good choice of food, cant fault a thing

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: krasotka_2007
Reviews.Content: A lot of good things have been said about this hotel and the only one I can add is.........DONT' BELIEVE THOSE PEOPLE WHO LEFT NEGATIVE REVIEWS . Those people are, probably, not happy with their life in general, not just with the hotel. It is a great resort, we didn't want to come back. Don't hesitate, go for it !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facility, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Calla0945
Reviews.Content: My friend & I went to the Ocean Maya for a relaxing girls stay. The Ocean Maya was very well maintained and the grounds were just beautiful. We had wanted to upgrade to a better room but were told nothing was available. Our room was OK, we did not have hot water for the first couple of days and had to have the TV looked at the first day, but that was fixed right away. Sewer smell was abundant throughout the villa's . We did get the upgrade to "privileged" for an extra 20.00 per day, and really would not do that again unless you really like an upgrade in drinks. The bright spot was our morning waiter, Alberto Mesero, who was so attentive and always a smile on his face. Our last day there, he had the sax player come in and saranade us with a song and a glass of champagne! Also, Katarina the waitress at the pool was also very nice . We had a relaxing time by the pool and made lots of new friends, but would not stay at this one again....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, value for money”
Reviews.Author: HannahBredon
Reviews.Content: After getting a really good deal and then reading mixed reviews, I honestly wasn't expecting too much from this resort, However I couldn't have been more surprised, the grounds were immaculate with lots of interesting wildlife, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the food was of very good quality with a lot to choose from and the guest rooms were large clean and comfortable. The beach was lovely although the sea was nicer in other areas, we travelled to Tulum where the sea was a gorgeous shade of turquoise. As others have mentioned we did have some issues with a large group of rowdy Spanish teenagers waking us up and monopolising the pool and bars but they did leave during our stay and I do not feel that it would be fair to judge this beautiful well maintained resort on its occupants. I had a fantastic time just wish we had booked for another week, I also definitely recommend a trip to coco bongo! :)

Reviews.Title: “WOW, A-Mazing!!”
Reviews.Author: mileskaye
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place to stay. The staff were really helful and always willing to do everything for you. There is lot's of entertainment and the staff are always looking to get people up to take part. The food was really nice and lot's of it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, the place is fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “just the facts”
Reviews.Author: smjsmj
Reviews.Content: Reviews for this resort seem to be really bad or really good. I will try to provide facts both good and bad. Check In I had e mailed ahead advising of our arrival time and requestiong a king bed on the second floor. I never received a response. We arrived at about noon. We carried our bags about 2 steps into the loby where someone took our bags and directed us to the check in desk. There were no cool towels nor drinks offered. We completed out paperwork, got our red braclets and were told to come back at 3pm. We had lunch and walked around and stoped back by the front desk at 2:40 to see if our room might be ready. It was not. We came back at 3pm and found lots of people needing to check in. There were not enough desk clerks not bellmen. It was 45 min before we arrived at our room. Facilities The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The rooms are clean and well designed. The linens are not very good quality. The cooling system works great. Beach The sand is fine white clean sand. The ocean water is not what you expect in the Carribean. It is more like the Atlantic Ocean. Chairs were always hard to find and many were broken. Food The food is not excellent but very plentiful. There was always some fresh fruit and good fish. I did notice that cheaper food is used. For example if you order beef filet you get beef with no bone not fillet migon and lamb is a lamb steak not lamb chops. Service Service was very hit or miss. We always had an excellent waiter at the buffet. We tipped and he ask that we always reguest his section which we did. If we wanted a drink at the pool or beach we got it ourselves. There were not many beach waiters. The bartenders work hard but are not wervice oriented. One day they ran out of plastic cups and told the guest to go to the other bar and get a glass. None of the staff seems able to honor any special reguest. Everyone does work hard but hard work does not always mean good service. Now for my personal openion. We paid a low price so we expected very little. We had a good time and would go back but only if the price was low. There were a few groups of young students from Spain. They were a bit loud at times.

Reviews.Title: “Better than rated”
Reviews.Author: molly9567
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ocean Maya Royale and it was simply great. The resort is just beautiful, clean and well maintained everywhere. The staff friendly and could not be more helpful, you ask and if they can it is done. Beds were firm but no problem sleeping. Drinks were well made and ever flowing. Can not say enough about staff from early in morning to late at night they just keep going. Polo, Amy, and Omar really give it the 110% all day long. Waiters like Alberto make all meals so pleasant and bartenders like David make the whole week just a week to truly remember. So don't believe some of the negative articles I've read, some people just like to find something wrong with everything.

Reviews.Title: “A place worth visiting... AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: ISORRO
Reviews.Content: Introduction: Every moment was an experience... Upon arrival we we're taking by surprised by the bellman asking what we wanted as our welcome drink cocktail. Something that hasn't occurred to us in other resorts, what an excellent treatment. "Thanks to all the amazing Staff at the Ocean Maya" Javier (Bellman): Excellent services and communicator Ignacio (Lobby Bartender - Day Shift) Excellent MOJITOS - What a Superstar Guy! Claudia (Guest Service) Courteous and well informed. Our Cleaning Lady (Villa 10) Sorry we forgot her name our sincere apologies BUT She was amazing on top of everything! Jesus Arsona (Sushi Chef of Yookoso) Very attentive to all guest at the habachi table, excellent communicator, and the cuisine was I have no words for it! 5 Stars! And best of all Maria L. Thank you for your amazing Hospitality and taking your time & effort in accommodating us. Above & Beyond our expectations. Reviews: Ok, let's be frank here! It became an ONLY ADULT Hotel on May 1st we got there May 4th. We wanted to relax and we did. Yes, Ocean Maya was bombarded with Spaniard (young adults); they were rude, disrespectful to STAFF & Guests.... but we CANNOT disqualified OVERALL the PROS of this hotel because of this minor mis-hap on these young rudely kids. Ocean Maya is a huge facility and we found tranquility even on this turmoil moment. Remember folks, experience enables you to recognize a mistake. We came with a Mission to Mexico (Relax & Enjoy Mexico) Restaurant (Food Overall): All eateries had a special and distinctive quality! -Mike's Coffee Shop: Excellent Lattes if you are a Coffee Lover like myself. They have a variety of teas (Hot & Cold) and Mini-sandwiches and pastries. (Location near the Lobby Bar) -La Hacienda-Buffet: What can I say, Gourmet FOOD all the way (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner)! Very Fresh, High Quality - Grade A. We read so many comments on trip advisor and we were wondering if we were on the same HOTEL. This was nothing but Fabulous food people! And Lots of it. Oh before I forget they make some awesome gourmet dark & white chocolate with fresh fruit fillings! Try their desserts too Yummy! (Location exiting the Lobby) -El Charro: How people been saying for a while....OMG. Authentic Mexican Cuisine! What more can you ask! Excellent Tacos, Seafood, Plantano Tequila. (Location Near the 2nd Pool) -La Dolce Vita: The food was good. Our favorite dishes was the Spinach Parmigiano Soup and the Linguini with Alfredo sauce with a touch of ham and mushroom. Also the Ravioli was fantastic. Beverages (Bars) Lobby Bar - I think this was our hang out spot, very beautiful bar, Drink were superb to be frank NOT water down. Maybe it was our luck! All other bars were just okay. Each bar has a hidden gem you just have to try them all and discover which one is your favorite. Rooms: The rooms were very modern, spacious, eccentric, beautiful, and best of all comfortable. We had a BIG KING size Bed, flat screen tv, balcony, Sofa bed, love chair, two night stand, beautiful bathroom oh and the FLOORS are amazing. Our Villa was #10 it's only a few steps away from the beach and pool! Activities: They have many activities on the Hotel Premises, to be frank we never ever got bored! Everything was well organized. Saxophone melodies, Karaoke, the night shows were very entertainment and funny, We were there for 5 de Mayo- they went all out in celebrating this day, the food and shows were amazing with the mariachis and locals vendors, Also they have Theme night for a disco, Music was up to date from Spanish to English, pool tables, many fantastic activities trust us you will never get bored here. Oh yes the hotel has a couple of shops. Did I mention Ocean Maya provides Free Shuttle Bus to 5th Avenue (Playa del Carmen) Oh yes! Definitely a plus. Cleanliness - One word - SUPERB! This hotels is very well kept! Property (Pool & Beach) -Pool on the Right has the Swim up BAR and 4 massage chairs and a jacuzzi. Very spacious pool. This is were all the activities occurs. -Pool on the Left - RELAXING mode pool so nice to just chill for the day! This was our favorite. -Oh the Beach: What can I say we asked about what happened to the beach, we were told that they got hit by hurricane and it take time for the beach to clean itself. We can't stop Mother Nature and we can't control the currents. But folks listen sometime is beautiful sometime it was gloomy. But other than that we did enjoyed our stay. - Hammocks: Oh boy we spent almost 50% of time here before sunset! It was Glorious! Now they have 10 hammocks overall (so pick and choice you color preference)... we got the party starting! To Finalize the review: Overall- If you are looking for Rest & Relaxation with a touch of luxury. You should stay at the Ocean Maya you wont regret it. It definitely compete with other upscale resorts at the Riviera Maya and this one is a keeper on our list ! Thanks for reading our sincere review, ISO & RRO

Reviews.Title: “Resort is great! Dishonest advertising about "No Springbreakers" not!”
Reviews.Author: donjulioforpresident
Reviews.Content: Everything stated regarding the beautiful grounds is absolutely true! The place is kept immaculate, by far the most impressive resort we could see walking 30+ minutes in both directions on the beach. The staff is just as everyone states, they were wonderfull, and did everything in their power to make us comfortable. Unfortunately they couldn't kick the couple hundred very young (supposed to be) adults out of the resort! The hotel advertises "No Spring Breakers", they can call it whatever they want, this was a bunch of children there to party it up just as you would see in Cancun in March (big reason we avoid Cancun). Very disrespectful to other guests, & the staff at OMR. A couple evenings hoping to have a few quiet drinks at the nice lobby bar (we read was very quiet after 9:00 PM) we found kids 8 deep at the bar, if you could get a drink they were carrying on so loud you couldn't have a conversation. That's when we figured out- leave the resort, & find what we wanted in PdC. We enjoyed the restraurants as far as AI goes. The rooms were fine, the beds were ok. The beach area was great regardless of what other reviewers have said, much cleaner than others in the area (other places seem to have a seaweed problem). Got a good spa package deal for my wife on her b-day, she said it was wonderful. And we met some great people that were adults! You may have seen an earlier review stating they could not get an English speaking channel on their TV, I've never stayed anywhere in MX where this was the case (10+ visits), & I didn't believe it. Well believe it! I really didn't care until the evening of 5/1 (I was on vacation who needs TV). However this just happened to be when the biggest news since 9/11 was announced. As an American who was very interested in hearing about the news of bin ladens death I was very dissappointed when I could not find an English speaking news channel. We called the front desk, they sent someone who said "sorry". As a home owner, with some passion for technology (TV's/ surround sound, etc.) I decided to take matters into my own hands, this is when I found the cable box was not even connected to the TV, they had ran a cable from the cable box out to the cable box in, no TV connection. Sort of a good disquise, however it was obvious whoever made the connection knew there was no use of the cable box whatsoever. I did make the correct connections, only to get a message something like "you are unauthorized to use this cable box". Fortunately our friends we traveled with did have a functioning cable box in their room, & we were able to watch some of the news we so wanted to see. All in all; the resort is beautiful, the staff is incredible, & we had a great time in spite of the kids, & we loved PdC. Not sure if I would go back, as I don't know if I can trust the owners, don't believe everything advertised! Next time we may look to get in/ closer to PdC.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming :)”
Reviews.Author: barbiejz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here March 18-25 2011. This resort is very clean, the rooms and grounds are beautiful and the staff is very nice and welcoming. Javier was always very helpful to us. Every morning at the breakfast buffet, Ingrid would greet us with a warm Hello, what a very sweet girl and Alfredo always gave us great service. The food, oh the food!! Amazing!! The a la carte restaurants were great, the Mexican is a must go! Jorge made us feel very welcome there. I look forward to returning again :) The beach was not the greatest with lots of seaweed and silt, but that's nature and you can't control that...but the pools worked just as well to cool us down. The only thing missing is a disco to go dancing in....and some softer pillows would be nice too :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort......had a realxing time. Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.”
Reviews.Author: Hockeymom1972
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Ocean Maya. We had a fabulous time. The staff are very friendly as mentioned by other reviewers and and the grounds are lush and beautiful. A real tropical feel. I find it amusing reading the negative reviews concerning the beach or the lack there of. I swam every day in the ocean. The water is warm and the bottom is soft and sandy. There is nothing "DIRTY" about this beach. It's nature, not a pool people! In fact, people from the neighboring hotel were coming to swim at our beach because it was nice and clean, not full of sludge like I observed on my walks. With regard to its size, how much beach does one need to have a dip? With regard to the negative reviews about the food, if you can't find something decent to eat then you're the kind of person who is just plain angry in life. If you want your food cooked a certain way, all you have to do is ask and they will. The staff is very accommodating. My only negative review is that the large amount of students from Spain were very disrespectful to the staff and the rest of the guests. They came back to the hotel from nearby nightclubs in the early am chanting loudly with absolutely no concern to the rest of the sleeping guests. They became an annoyance to the staff and the other guests. All in all, we had a very relaxing vacation and I will recommend this hotel to my friends traveling without kids.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT IS BEAUTIFUL - SPAIN YOUNG KIDS SHOULD BE BANNED”
Reviews.Author: sunfunapril11
Reviews.Content: the resort was beautiful. enjoyed everything until they allowed several groups of young highschool groups i believe to take over the resort. they were rude and disrespectful to guests and also to staff. drinks were order and left half drank and dumped in the pool they were diving off of the swimup bar. staff tried to contain them but there was not much they could do. in my opinion they should have been warned and then kicked out.THE BROCHURE SAYS NO SPRING BREAKERS ??? IF THAT IS TRUE WHY WERE THEY ALLOWED TO TAKE OVER??? THEY WOULD GATHER ON THE THE POOL STEPS NOT ALLOWING ANYONE IN OR OUT OF THE POOL. BOOKED AN OCEAN VIEW ROOM AND DIDN'T GET WHAT WE PAID FOR. IF THIS WAS TO BE ADULTS ONLY AS OF MAY 1ST THEY NEED TO ADHERE TO THEIR POLICY AND NOT LET LARGE GROUPS OF IDIOTT DISRESPECTFUL KIDS FROM SPAIN ALLOWED TO TAKE OVER. They left a terrible impression of how kids are taught to behave, they should all be ashamed of themselfs.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff, grounds and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sportyster
Reviews.Content: As I read some of these negative reviews I wonder which Ocean Maya Royale I stayed at, my experience is so completely different that I feel I had to have stayed at a different resort. Cleanliness and quality of staff are most important to me anywhere I stay and the previous reviews of the staff here helped me choose this Ocean Maya and I was not once disappointed. Upon arrival we were greeted with very friendly staff, check in was prompt and within a short time, we were whisked off to our room with a welcome drink in hand. The grounds were amazing and well kept, the pictures do not do this resort justice. The villas are so well kept and brightly painted. We booked an ocean view room and I contacted the hotel prior to our arrival to request a room with the best ocean view possible, Ocean Maya accommodated our request and we were not disappointed, the view from our 2nd floor room was incredible. The bed was firm but not uncomfortable and I slept wonderfully every night. My husband, who has back troubles, loved it. On the walk to the lobby area, there is a spot where you can smell sewer but it lasts for all of a few seconds, certainly nothing that affects the entire resort nor is it so bad that it could ruin an evening walk. We upgraded to the privilege service, we really didn't need it to make reservations for any of the restaurants as there was always room for us when we went to eat. Since neither my husband or I drink much, the top shelf liquor was not applicable. We never had trouble finding chairs under a palapa or on one of the Bali beds in the privilege section of the beach and what made the upgrade completely worth it for us was Azucena, the attendant in the beach area. She always had a smile, helped with with our Spanish and provided to us anything that we could want. Books and magazines on hand, cloths that were soaked in anise and water to refresh ourselves with, lemonade, cold water and ice buckets to sit beside our chairs. We enjoyed her company and conversation every day we spent at the beach. The staff at this hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful, there was always a smile and a “Hola” or “buenos dias”. We were always asked how our days were and many of the staff remembered our names which is outstanding considering the amount of visitors to this resort through out the year. Staff was always doing something from cleaning, to gardening, picking up garbage. These people work incredibly hard and are all very gracious. Our room was cleaned perfectly each day, the mini fridge was always stocked. The entertainment staff around the pool and beach area were great at trying to include guests in various activities and we had some really great water polo and volleyball games. Anywhere in this area, the people appreciate when visitors make an effort to learn some of their language and we had some great lessons with our broken Spanish from almost everyone we encountered and always with good humor. For the most part the food was good but not outstanding by any means but we always found something to eat and never went hungry. There is enough variety that even the fussiest of people (my husband) was able to find something. The food could be served at hotter temperatures nothing so drastic as to ruin the vacation for us. We were always happy to see Alberto's smiling at breakfast in the buffet dining room in the mornings and we really enjoyed the music from the saxophone player. We appreciated the smaller more intimate size of this resort and loved the villas instead of a huge resort. I can go on and on about what made Ocean Maya a great place to stay for us and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone that isn't expecting 10 star Trump luxury. If people are going to sweat the small stuff and allow minor issues to "ruin" a vacation for them then it doesn't matter where they stay, they'll find something to complain about. .

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever - Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Johnny123Halifax
Reviews.Content: Hi there, first of all, don't listen to the negative reviews. I always said I would never go back to the same resort twice, but I will go back to this one for sure. The Ocean Maya was amazing. We stayed from 14-21 April 2011, and had a great time. Lets break it down: Resort and staff - It is the most gorgeous breath taking place you will see. There is so much wildlife and lush tropical trees everywhere. It's so nice. We walked around the entire time going..."paradise". Everything is well maintain and clean. The staff were extremely friendly, and made you feel very welcome. Food and drink - The food was very good. We loved it. The Japanese was great and all the buffets were awesome. They even had a beach lunch which was so nice....live band and all. I couldn't have asked for better food. The drinks were very good, and strong. They made every kind of martini you can ask for. I recommend the chocolate martini....so good. Beach - Many people in the reviews complained about the beach. Sure it's not the nicest beach I have seen in my travels, but it was great. The water was warm and it was very gorgeous. Lots of areas to swim, and nice boardwalk. You can walk in the white sand for hours if you want. I had no complaints at all. They also had catamarans (no cost), jet skiing, para sailing, kayaks, windsurfing, all on site. It was great. If your young and like to party, this may not the place for you. Having said that, the resort organizes bar hopping trips many of the nights. You pay 30 bucks, and the staff will take you and a bus load of people out on the town in Playa Del carmen (big city only 15 minutes away). They will bring a bartender and will look after you big time. The bus leaves at 1030 pm and doesn't return until 4am. I think they also have a 9pm, which gets back at 2am. Pretty need if your young and want to party. For us we wanted a smaller place. If you are looking for a extremely romantic gorgeous location, the ocean Maya is the place to be. To be honest, I am online now seeing if I could go back to the Ocean Maya in the next few weeks. We got back just last week. That's how much I liked it there, and I am one of the those people who needs everything perfect and spends countless hours looking for various resorts. I recommend going to Playa Del Carmen. Such a nice place to visit and it's close. I would go in mid afternoon and staff until after dark. That way you get the day and evening, which had a different feel in the city big time. 19 bucks one way. Not to bad. The shuttle only hold 20 people and space is limited. This resort is also central to all the attractions. I recommend Tulum and Rio Secreto. They take you under ground in caves that are a million years old. You have to wear a wet suit, life vest and a helmet with a light on it. It will blow your mind. It's like your on a different planet. No joke. Best attraction we did for sure, but there are so many good ones. Well I have wrote a novel. Bottom line, it's a perfect place and our second trip to the H10 line. They have exceeded our expectations big time. Have a fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JDHalifax
Reviews.Content: Am here right now at this resort. It is fantastic. Will post a more detailed review on my return home. For those that give negative you are too picky and should stay home!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute nightmare from start to finish - Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: erofman
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that this will be a review of our experience with the H10/Ocean Hotels organization as well as our stay at the Ocean Maya & Ocean Turquesa. We booked our rooms about 2.5 months in advance for 3 nights at the Ocean Turquesa. Upon check-in, we were pulled to the side by one of the staff at the front desk. She told us (quietly and away from other guests) that the hotel has been overbooked due to a wedding. She was offering to transfer us to the Ocean Maya and upgrade us to the privileged service package along with a complimentary breakfast in bed. My wife and I were skeptical and asked what would happen if we did not want to go to the Maya. We were told that they were not certain when (or even if) a room would open up. The front desk told us that the Maya was the same class of hotel, just smaller and adults only. After some back and forth, we reluctantly accepted their offer and had to sign a paper stating that we accepted the change. This should have been our first warning sign of what was to come. We arrived at the Maya to find that this was not the same class of hotel as the Maya. There was no valet parking and the bellboys were non-existent (I thought I’d have to take my own bag until he finally showed up). The facilities were much older. The chairs and lounges in the common areas were stained and in general, the wear and tear on the property was very noticeable. The walk to our room (bungalow style) from the lobby seemed endless and was the last thing that we needed after getting the run-around all day. When we finally got there, we saw that some of the floor tiles were cracked, the toiletries were not restocked, the service book was missing (which took them 24 hours to bring), the safe was broken and the minibar that supposedly came with the privileged service was empty. We tried to call to get the necessities and realized that the phone did not work as well. After the long walk back to the lobby, we found out that “privileged service” and “privileged rooms” are apparently two different things, something that the lady at the Turquesa failed to mention. After some arguing, we were offered a privileged room. When we inspected it, it was really no different from a standard room, just slightly bigger. In addition, this particular room had an infestation of ants that managed to bite my wife twice before we got out of there. After seeing all this, we just decided to cut our losses and stay at the room we were originally assigned. All the while, we were in contact with our travel agent to see if there was anything they could do to get us back to the Turquesa or get a refund for something that we clearly did not pay for. Other than racking up considerable roaming charges in calls, this proved to be fruitless. When we spoke with the managers at both the Maya and the Turquesa, they said there was nothing they could do and repeatedly said that we signed the paper that confirmed the transfer as if it were some sort of legal defense. After these headaches, we saw that this was an unwinnable battle so we decided to try and make the best of it. Unfortunately, the Ocean Maya did not want to comply. The food at the restaurants ranged from slightly below average to downright awful. When we went to the buffet, we found mussels shells in our pasta which indicates that either all their food is cooked together or the buffet itself is unsanitary. As far as the beach, there is none. The hotel is apparently on the shoreline of some rough waters, so all there is are lounges next to the where a beach would have been and an unsightly boardwalk that takes away any water view you could have while laying down. The “privileged” areas are anything but – they are simply roped off from the rest of the lounges. There is no waiter service or any other benefits in the area, so honestly, what’s the point? On top of all this, we were promised a complimentary room service breakfast on our last day. We called the day before as per their guidelines to place our order for 10:00 am the next day. However, when they had not shown up by 10:20, I called again. They said they were sending someone right away. My wife and I ordered scrambled eggs/ omelet, home fries, bacon, fruit, and tea. We received two orders of hard boiled eggs, bacon that looked like it had been scraped off a dirt road, hash browns, no fruit, and coffee. They obviously did not have our order and scrambled (unlike our eggs) to get whatever they could to us. I found this very unprofessional and not worthy of any hotel, let alone one of that supposed quality. Upon checkout, my bill had some phantom charges on it that I had to ask to clear up. We could not wait to leave and cannot see ourselves ever returning to an H10/Ocean property. We were lied to and deceived on multiple occasions and when we complained, the staff just shook their heads as if this was business as usual. In short, this was an awful experience that ruined what should have been a relaxing weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dockratt
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday. Hotel is in a long way from the main highway. It is very clean and most of the staff are friendly. The first night there are light started flashing in the room. Lobby desk was notified and someone was going to respond to the problem. Day two the power stayed off for minutes at a time, day three NO ELECTRIC AND NO REPAIR MADE. We asked for a room change and were told there were none available. We were going to leave because of the electric problem when a repair was finally made. Food is tasteless and was cold in the Buffett and restaurants. Most items were either over or under cooked. Mixed drinks were very weak. What you read on the bottles and beer taps is not what your getting. Pool swim up bar closed early and other locations were under staffed and closed for employee work breaks. Beach area was covered with sea weed and is small. Activities (Jet Ski, sail boat rentals and trips) are Very Expensive. Went to rent a jet ski, there were no staff available to put it in the water for us. The pools are nice but were crowded with 17 to 19 year old High School kids Drunk out of their minds. Transportation to town very expensive. Round trip by Taxi is over $40. USD. You can take a bus but it's a Mile or more walk to get to it . If you need the internet good luck. It only works some times and to use theirs is $15. USD per hour. This H10 Hotel is a Minus 10.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Frediec1988
Reviews.Content: Ok, so where do I beging. I went on vacation with my beautiful girlfriend, were both in our early 20's. The Vacation started off horrible. Flights were delayed we got to the hotel around 9pm, and we find out that they gave away our room (FML) after about an hour later we finished arguing with them, and they decided to give us the Honeymoon Suite instead of the Master Suite, which was totally fine by us. FOOD - A+ Lets me just give you some background info. We're Jews from NY and We went during passover vacation, now if you dont know what passover has to do with food, your not allowed to eat anything that has yeast in it (bread,pasta,rice,cake. etc). So you can take it from us that even though we were limited on out options everything was still AMAZINGLY delicious. Rooms - A The room were very modern, and very cozy. The bed was very big and comfortable, this was probably one of the first vacations we had that we didn't complain about one of us hogging the bed (I'm pretty sure it was a California King). The bathroom was great, Standup shower, closed toilet area. The TV always had something on ( it was cable from florida) and if there was nothing on TV, they had an on demand movie channel (10 bucks) which had great movies on it. BUT the best thing about this room was the outdoor jacuzzi, almost all of our night ended off in there with a bottle of comp champaign. The only complaint that I have about the room(and pretty much the whole vacay) was that if you left the toilet seat open, you can smell the sewage.
