Beach/Pool Area- A The only reason im giving an A and not an A+ , is because you couldn't swim in the ocean, either because it was too windy or just plain murky. But the pool was amazing, and the beach area was even better. They have entertainment there, and fun activities such as horseshoe,pool volleyball, ping pong, etc. I know that you aren't only going to be reading my review, but please take what i will tell you next to heart. GET THE PRIVILEGE SERVICES, you will not regret living like royalty for an extra whatever a day. The privilege services was the reason why our vacation was as great as it was. From the private area on the beach, the top shelve liquor, private air conditioned area in the restaurants, first selection to specialty restaurants, all the way to room service for anything on the menu (or even off of it). If your already paying for a vacation, dont get cheap now, trust me its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, friendly staff, great spot to vacation.”
Reviews.Author: d0g0nwheels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ocean Maya and had a great time. The room we had was more than we could have expected. Very clean, spacious and the a/c worked quickly so we never had a problem cooling down after a hot day. I've never stayed at and all-inclusive before so i can't compare. Food was good. Not exactly fine-dining but we thought the buffet was your best bet every day. Definitely something for everyone. The tempanyaki grill at the japanese was also excellent and the pool side mexican place had a good burgers and snacks for lunch. The staff is excellent and friendly. I cannot believe how hard they all work. The beach isn't that bad. You can go in the water, or you can just walk next door and there is a larger area for swimming, no big deal. And regarding this so-called sewer smell: it is the same smell that you smell as soon you exit the plan in Cancun. It didn't bother me one bit, i just chalked it up to being in a very humid, hot, tropical area of the world. One downside was the lack of beer choice. I will never drink corona again!! You can leave the resort and cross the highway to the OXXO gas station and get your own beer though.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be home”
Reviews.Author: Sourcake
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, this resort was super clean and the bar staff and housekeeping staff were very friendly. The pool was nice and clean too. Food was average. Room was clean and the bathrooms were nice. Being a small resort, you don't have to walk miles from one side to the other. I enjoyed the iguanas and friendly wildlife on our walks.....however the septic stench that seemed to be place smack dab in the middle on the way to the lobby made the stroll less pleasurable. They overbooked the hotel so they offered us 2 nights at the Ocean Coral and Turquesa which was a nice change of scenery but our room was terrible! The bathroom had no door and not even a stall for the shower. The floor flooded continuously and all our belongings were damp by morning. The room reeked of mold and when we complained, they said there were no other rooms to move us to as they were completely booked also. When we returned to Ocean Maya we told them about this and they offered nothing. Infact, we had to wait from 10am to 3pm for a room to even become available. Meanwhile, our bags are locked up in a room. 2 of the 3 in our group were ill this day and just wanted to be in our room with a bathroom. One thing I noticed is there were never any apologies. It just is. I also want to caution everyone about their internet terminals in the lobby. You can feed it money or swipe your credit card, but it only works for a few minutes and then cuts you off. You cannot get your money back and when you complain, they tell you that the terminals do not belong to them, "they are concessions".....this is after we were told to come back on 3 different occasions and someone would try to fix it. The beach at Ocean Coral was amazing which made the 2 nights much more enjoyable, since there is absolutely no beach at Ocean Maya. Oh, and you get the same service without the privilege bracelet. We got the bracelet for a day......total waste of money. I've had less disappointment at 3 star resorts.

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: egilerman
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I hit a bump when we arrived to Ocean Maya Royale after an excruciating day of traveling thanks to American Airlines. All we wanted to do was go into our suite and just go to bed, however, upon checking in we were informed the room we had ordered (Romance Suite) was unavailable because they had to upgrade someone else that morning. After arguing for about fifteen minutes, I had a manager finally agree to get us a room that was similar to the Romance Suite and we got the Honeymoon Suite. The room was amazing! Big, clean, had somewhat of a sewer smell but if you shut the toilet seat it isn't so bad. The hot tub was an added perk too! Downside was television had mostly Spanish channels, would have enjoyed more English-language channels. Bed was so big my boyfriend and I could roll around and still not touch each other! Privilege - whoever says don't get it is lying to you. It was such a relaxing experience to have a cabana everyday, waiter service, air-conditioned breakfast area and reservations to every restaurant without having to wake up early! Entertainment - we only caught the last night's entertainment. They took movie trailers and then did skits about it - it was great! Additionally, on Easter they did a Trivia game at the pool and dressed up as the Easter Bunny and his helpers. They filled egg shells with glitter and baby powder and the grand prize was a bottle of champagne (which I won!) Food - it was Passover most of the time my boyfriend and I were there so we were unable to eat anything with yeast, wheat or corn, yet we still had an abundance of food to eat! The food was AMAZING. From Hibachi to Italian to the buffet - we never went hungry! Service - Great!!! We love Alberto from the buffet and Antonio from Dolce Vita! We will definitely be going back to an H10 and will be back at this hotel soon as well!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Ocean Maya Royale”
Reviews.Author: Cuba1987
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a relaxing week at Ocean Maya Royale. We have stayed several times at their sister resort the Ocean Coral & Turquesa, so thought this would be a safe bet. We had an excellent time and would return. It is not as large as OCT, and the beach is tiny in comparison as well, but the grounds are amazing, the staff excellent, and the buildings/rooms very comfortable and quiet. I think, however that they order their beds from the same place (both very firm!) Ocean Maya is a fairly quiet resort and even with the addition of 3 or 4 bus loads of Spanish and Portuguese teens while we were there, it remained fairly low key. I hadn't expected all these students, but in the end they were no problem. The two pools are side by side near the ocean, and we enjoyed swimming in them from time to time. They would benefit from adding more chairs around the pools. I have never seen chairs so sparsely set out around a pool. There were plenty of chairs on the beach. We paid the extra $20pp/day for the privilege service which turned out to be an excellent investment. It gave us access to the privilege area at the beach which includes 7 canopy loungers and many regular lounge chairs with extra padding. There was always space available no matter what time of day. And as a previous review stated, Azucena, the area attendant was excellent. Food in the 3 a la cartes was very good, and as there is no dress code for the restaurants, very comfortable. It's nice to be able to dress up for dinner, but I don't want to do it every day. If you like a quiet, pleasant, relaxing, peaceful holiday, I would recommend the Ocean Maya Royale. PS. We were there the week prior to it becoming an Adults Only resort, so there were still children around, and by the time this review is posted some things will have changed.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Amazing66
Reviews.Content: Ocean Maya staff is the best, they went out of the way many times to make our trip the most comfortable. Food was great and we loved the pool and beach being so close. We will be returning to the Ocean Maya again. Needs a few more beach huts.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have asked for more - this resort was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: PegLeg-and-SherBear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the H10 Ocean Maya Royale last week. We booked it based on reviews we had read and the fact that the price was certainly right. We could not have picked a better resort at which to spend a very relaxing and lazy week. Our check-in was seamless. I really appreciated how the bell staff didn’t fight with us to carry our bags when we opted to take them ourselves. The grounds of this hotel are phenomenal. So well kept; we saw people working on them all day every day, pruning, clipping, washing. Everyone there is quick with a “Hola” or “Buenos Dias” as you walk past. Our room was great as well. My wife told our travel agent that we’d like a garden view. That short of shocked me as we were headed to the ocean but the view we got was great. We were on the second floor of a villa type unit looking right into the canopy of a small jungle that separated us from the next villa. We were in building 25 which is a quick jaunt to the lobby and about a 5 minute stroll to the pools and beach. This gives a great opportunity to see the natural wildlife, lemurs, iguanas, birds, a cat, some other cool lizard that fans its neck and runs away on its hind legs, countless birds and geckos. Seeing the native wildlife is one of the great things about traveling. The critters we saw either ignored us or ran away. Some reviews have said the beds were hard. I'd call them firm and say that we had no trouble sleeping at all. The food was very good. There are three a la carte restaurants and the buffet. We were able to eat all our evening meals at the a la cartes and preferred the show at the Japanese, the venue at the Italian and the food at the Mexican. You will read other people’s complaints about the food at the Japanese and Italian restaurants but think for a minute about what kind of burrito you would get in Tokio or Milan. They do a very good job with the food here, the baking is exquisite. We ate all kinds of buns and pastries that were very tasty. One of my biggest missions of the day was exploring the buffet to see what I could get them to put in my made to order omelets – so good. Sadly my wife only tried her first one on our last day. Prior to that she’d been enjoying the fresh fruit, yogurt and granola for breakfast. The pool and beach are great. There are two pools, one with a swim up bar and one without and three beach areas. There is a beach area to the North from which you can see a pier and watch the volleyball court. In the middle there is a raised boardwalk area (some reviewers have called it a wall, but it’s a board walk) that has a railing with Plexiglas inserts to block the wind so people who choose this section of the beach are protected. Then to the South there is a third beach area from which you can swim or take out a catamaran or jet ski. The para-sailing also leaves from near here. You won’t find any better service anywhere than that which you receive from Azucena at the beach. She was working the boardwalk section when we were there. She is the ‘white flower’ that her name means. Every time she sees you she says hi and remembers your drink orders perfectly even if you, like me, switch from time to time. A couple of times the resort set up a little souvenir market in the main square. This was very nice as the vendors here understand their privilege of being on the resort and don’t harass you or make you feel compelled to buy anything. There is also a souvenir vendor every day beside the one pool. My five pieces of advice are: 1: go to the dollar store and get yourself a soap dish. The bathrooms are beautiful but the sink space is modern and sparse so a soap dish will keep you from messing up the counter. 2: while our room did have an input for our iPod to the alarm clock it was a mono clock so if you are big into your music bring your own speakers. If you are not then it doesn’t matter one bit. 3: change your money to pesos before you go down. If you are going from Canada and there’s a Travellex in the airport they will buy back any unused pesos when you get back at no charge. Mexico is trying very hard to encourage the use of the Peso so some places won’t take dollars. 4: eat at a Tapanyaki table in the Japanese restaurant early in your stay. The show is great and you’ll get a chance to sit with some other visitors and make some good friends 5: always keep your camera with you ‘cause you never know when one of the friends you met at the Tapanyaki table will all of a sudden take off because she’s finally seen her first lemur and wants to get a closer look.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, very very quiet”
Reviews.Author: gonetosnorkle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this holiday, there is really nothing to do at this hotel. Only the lobby bar is open at night-snooze fest. The beds are like sleeping on a box spring. Paid for the Priviledge upgrade-big mistake..there are no reservations needed at the restaurants unless you upgrade and they don't tell you where to get the reservations anyway. The bar is suppose to be premium with the upgrade which I figured would be great but the only thing premium is the actual liquor, no beer or wine upgrade, hard to drink draft beer for a week and the Vodka I like they kept running out of it everyday anyway so...also there was no room upgrade and was told they had no sea view rooms anyway (there was certainly sea view rooms) So basically I paid 300.00 dollars for a couple of drinks of premium vodka (lucky me) if the barstaff would even get around to serving you. They basically ignored you if you were not a young good looking girl or a guy.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing and enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsmom22
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on our first day (a Saturday) and our rooms weren't going to be ready until 3pm. That was fine, we planned ahead and changed into our swimsuits, headed to the buffet for a late breakfast, toured the grounds, and lounged by the pool until our room was ready. At 3pm our room was ready, one of the kindest bellman (I regret not getting his name, as he helped us a few times getting taxis and information) helped us to our room and showed us where everything was. We enjoyed the food in all three of the restaurants and the buffet, for those that complained I honestly believe they are the type of people that are never happy. Get over yourselves! Perhaps your attitudes may have created a snowball effect and that was why you had an unenjoyable stay, because ours was fantastic. The Japanese restaurant was definitely our favorite. The Hostess Estela at the buffet and Mexican restaurant/snack hut was always cheerful and helped me with my Spanish lessons :) That girl put in some crazy long hours but never complained, always had a huge smile and recognized us each time! We booked a couple of excursions for the Monday, and then booked a couple's massage at the spa to recoup on the Tues morning! WOW! I really tried to get Luis to come back to Canada with me, but couldn't convince him! The prices are incredibly good, as a person who works in the spa/beauty industry here, we got amazing deals! The grounds are gorgeous! Immaculately kept, with people working tirelessly everyday! We found our 'happy' spot for the days we stayed put at the edge of the one pools, where it meets the beach. Karina, one of the servers from the pool bar fast became my new best friend! Always a great smile, super quick and fun to joke around with! She is amazing. The beach is fine, it's the ocean, sometimes you are going to get some seaweed. If you want to hang out at a nicer beach then head into Playa Del Carmen, bring your suit and hang out there. The bartenders at the lobby bar are a fun, great, mischievous bunch! ;) Always having fun with us and made some pretty powerful and yummy drinks!!! The coffee lounge fast became my favorite place after dinner for the yummiest lattes! The entertainment staff were adorable. They put on some cute shows in the evening and tried their best to get people involved. Once we discovered the beach volleyball on the Thursday we were happy! Overall, it was a fantastic vacation! It's what you make it in the end. Every staff member from maintenance to front desk were quick to offer up a hello (Ola) or assistance of any kind. We would definitely go back without hesitation! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for a better vacation”
Reviews.Author: laurendoeshair
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ocean Maya for a week with two of my friends. I couldnt have asked for a better vacation spot!! The staff is extremely friendly and will remember you all week. They will do anything for you. The grounds are beautiful, and small enough to walk around in the Mexico heat without getting tired. There are a lot of dining options, although the buffet had the same breakfast/lunch/dinner all week. As a vegetarian, I pretty much ate rice and potatoes and bread all week. The italian restaurant, Dolce Vita, was my favorite. Down by the pool all day is extremely fun. The entertainment staff is there for hours in the morning and afternoon, getting you involved in volleyball, dance lessons, games, and water aerobics. I even did yoga one morning. It was very fun. They also provide entertainment in the theater at night, The pools were very nice. One more lively with swim-up bar and jetted area, and one with volleyball nets, a deep-end, and the entertainment staff. The beach was a few steps away, with both a boardwalk along the wall of the ocean, and a beach front to swim/lay out. There is also a pier to walk out on and beach volleyball nets. I got a massage on the beach, which was very relaxing with the sound of the waves around me. The rooms were great, Every room is a villa and in walking distance to everything. It seemed to me like you couldn't get a bad view, although it seems like villas 1-10 were the best area to stay-- close to pool, restaurants, and beaches. (I stayed in 7) At night, the one bar open at the lobby is pretty busy... and there are shows everynight. They even put on plays, and had karaoke. After 11pm, there is not really anything else to do... either go to bed, or go down to Playa del Carmen. If relaxing is your thing, there is a nice hammock area to lounge in and get some shade. That helped me when I had a major sunburn! I will definitley be staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya more than I could have expected.”
Reviews.Author: stac0426
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ocean Maya in April with 5 family members and it was more than I could have expected. I was a little leary by some of the reviews, but I think those people should have paid the extra money for a 5 star resort. Ocean had everything I could have wanted and more. The first day we were there I met Daniela from the entertainment staff. What a wonderful young lady. Every day the entertainment staff made sure they found us to try to get us involved. It didn't matter if it was for water polo, volleyball, beer drinking contest, water aerobics or Mr Ocean contest. They were the best!! I think if we wouldn't have met Daniela and gotten involved we wouldn't have had as much fun. It was great doing things with the ET staff during the day and then watching their shows at night. They did a great job on the shows and wish I could have seen more. I miss Daniela and have been trying to find her on Facebook, but there are hundreds of Daniela's with the same last name. We promised to stay in touch and now I can't. If anyone can help me I would greatly appreciate it. The restaurants are awesome. I wish we would have gone to them more. We ate at each one only once and I would have loved to try other dishes. I am a very picky eater, but had no trouble finding food I liked no matter where we ate. Check out the free water activities. We waited too long into our trip and didn't get to enjoy them as much as we would have liked to. Don't be afraid to ask questions and check things out right away when you get there because your vacation will be over before you know it. I also need to say that we stayed at Ocean with about 300 springbreakers. I would never ever choose to stay anywhere with 300 young people again, but the staff at Ocean did a good job of trying to cater to their other visitors also. I feel Ocean did the best job they could to make the best of a bad situation with all of these young people. Thanks Ocean Maya for a great vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: gj4041
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us in our group and we had a wonderful time at Ocean Maya Royale. The food was good and we loved the Japanese Restaurant. It was our first time at a Japanese Restaurant. So much fun and very good food. The entertainment staff were always so nice and inviting. They tried to get you involved but didn't push if you weren't up to it. Daniela was our favorite. We fell in love with her from day 1. The bartenders were great and we had a good time with them. Our favorites were Noe, Javier, and Eber. They really took care of us. We booked our trip through Travelocity and Olympus tours was our tour guide. Antonio from Olympus was awesome. He helped us book some amazingtours. We were just very happy with everything. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: gourmetsue
Reviews.Content: We traveled here with a our friends (all mid 30's) with hopes of a relaxing trip. We got just that. Having never been to Mexico, or any resort for that matter we did a lot of research and landed on Ocean Maya. We were incredibly pleased with the resort, the staff and our holiday in general and are already planning our next trip back. We had the privilege romance suite and our friends an ocean maya deluxe room. Both were spotless and very well appointed. The shower water pressure in our room (207) was a bit laughable, but it was the larger building. Seems our friends in a villa didn't have issue at all. Staff are excellent. They are welcoming, kind and went out of their way to help us whenever we asked. Jorge, Jose, Jesus and Manuel at El Charro were amazing! We loved having dinner there, not only because of the amazing food, but because of these guys. The grounds were immaculately kept. We had the pleasure of seeing iguanas all the time and the coatis made the experience more authentic. We even had a gecko or two in our room. The pools are nice, the temperature was perfect for us and we joined in a gave of water polo too. They were rarely over crowded and we never felt like it was too noisy or too many kids. We swam in the ocean, but it wasn't the best experience. As three of us were stung by small jelly fish. That can happen anywhere though. If you do plan to go into the water, I suggest wearing aqua shoes as there are some twigs and squishy spots. It's not a place to go just for the beach experience alone. The Spa was wonderful and I highly recommend Luis for a massage. I wish I hadn't waited until the last day to get it done. Overall we wouldn't hesitate to recommend Ocean Maya.

Reviews.Title: “HORRENDOUS EXPERIENCE...DO NOT BOTHER!”
Reviews.Author: Virgormt
Reviews.Content: I'll Start off by saying that the place is really beautiful and there is potential to offer whatever one is looking for in a vacation. That is, of course, if you are expecting to swim in the ocean...which is murky and cut off from swimming by several plastic panels which give you very little access to the beach. We arrived at night and our room had an awful smell, sort of a mix of must plus backed up sewer-like odor. We were told that if they could not fix the problem that night, we could bring our luggage back the NEXT DAYand they would change rooms for us. Yes, they said the NEXT DAY..Lucky for us, after I made a fuss they gave us another room the same night. The staff in general at best ranged from neutral to unattentive to blatantly indifferent, bordering on rude. They obviously have absolutely NO training in how to make visitors feel welcome. The front desk did NOTHING to explain anything to us...We did not even know that there was a SPA until a few days later, never mind where the SPA was. When we asked what activities there were , we were told " Look on the board near the pool" or near the theatre..what theatre? I never saw a board near the pool...... We had no idea what there was to do (since our tours did not work out)...DESPITE the fact that we asked!!....Need I say more about how useless GUEST SERVICES was? .As for the food, I dont even know what to say...most of the time it was cold and if you didnt get to the buffets very early, you got whatever was left as they did not appear to re-fill anything. The quality of the food was ridiculous...it was terrible....The desserts were the worst I'd EVER HAD ANYWHERE! Oh and then there were the raccoons and chullos running around all over the place...really would have been nice if someone would have warned you so you were not scared to death when they ran out in front of you at night....ALL IN ALL it was just not a very nice or memorable experience , in fact it was pretty awful. I would never, ever go back to this resort nor would i ever recommend it to anyone. Ive never written on Trip Advisor before , Im not just writing to complain but Im seriously trying to prevent someone from wasting their hard earned money. Im also hoping that someone important from OCEAN MAYA reads this and sincerely tries to do something about how they treat their visitors who work hard for their money and expect to go on vacation and enjoy themselves and be treated well. It does not feel very good to feel unwelcomed in another country. There was one Mexican gentlemen and I do wish I had gotten his name, b/c he was the only person who went out of his way and tried to make us feel welcome. For him we were very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, pool is amazig”
Reviews.Author: StormB
Reviews.Content: Nice sized room, great food selection at a variety of a la cart and buffer options - all inclusive. Regularly stocked mini bars, and a variety of activities and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler2015
Reviews.Content: We chose Ocean Maya because of good pricing combined with decent reviews. Having stayed at the Excellence Riviera and having a wonderful experience a year ago, we were willing to accept a lower level of service and fewer dining options as the price was very competitive. We were pleasantly surprised. The good: Staff was generally top notch Facilities, grounds and pool were beautiful and clean No wait at restaurants even though resort was full Dinner menus and presentations were nice quality Look at another resort if you want: Large, sandy beach and crystal clear water for swimming No competition for beach chairs Gourmet dining High quality entertainment Overall, we were pleased with our stay and would rate the Ocean Maya as a good value. We love the all-inclusive concept and would consider returning. It all comes down to a balance for quality and price. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Just as immaculate as the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Child
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to rest and we certianly did. We didn't find our King bed uncomfrtable at all. Slept like babies. They weren't "heavenly" but they were cozy enough. We upgraded to Privilege bands and it was worth every penny of the extr a$280 USD for the week. We never rushed for a beach chair, never worried about reservations at restaurants and (almost) never got our own drinks at the bar. We wanted to be extremely lazy and we were! We have 2 small kids who didn't join us (thus we rested) and the place is becoming Adults Only come May 1, 2011. That was part of its allure for us as we didn't want to worry about ours or other people's kids and we didn't. I wouldn't advise it for kids as the programming is geared to adults. Another alluring feature was the size - small, intimate, extremely freindly staff. We weren't giong for a Spring Break crowd and this was no the place for it - no disco, no real nightlife. We were asleep early anyway as we're not real booze-hounds and my husband won't dance. Don't get me worng - there was entertainment - some great that wrapped up by 10:30 pm so like I said, no late nights for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull place to stay!!! We will be going back”
Reviews.Author: Meech09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ocean maya for the 1st part of our honey moon , and we had a great time! We had a really nice room, very modern, jaccuzzi on the patio, bathrobes and flipflops, the whole 9 yards , we were very impressed! The food was amazing, no complaints at all there , the beach was really nice but a little windy, the red flags were up for the 5 days we stayed there.. Twice we walked about a 15 MIN up the beach to a natural cenote! its sooo cool,, fresh water gets pushed out in the ocean at this spot so its kind of like a small river coming through the sand thats crystal clear, and about 9 feet deep, so u can swim in it, and try swimming against it! sooo neat.. The locations perfect , $10.00 cab to 5th ave. we went to blue parrott down town for the 15th time, cant get enough of that night club!.. the grounds are very well kept, and theres no elevators! thats a major bonus cuz who wants to take elevators in a highrise, when you have a spot with tonnes of 3 story high villas! was perfect! The only complaint was its not 24 HR, so we came back from the bars at about 3 AM, and not a sole was around, everything was all closed up.. we tipytoed back to the room, and a security guard even escorted us worrying we would wake someone up I guess LOL But Honestly, this place is very great, friendly staff, great vibes here!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing week!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: geomm74
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.... I'll start with the negative.... NONE!!! Now for the positive. My girlfriend and I arrived to be met with cold drinks while we checked in. Since we checked in at 10am they put away our bags and pointed us in the direction of the pool. At the pool we met the two barkeeps. David and Aber (sp). They worked their butts off to keep the drinks full and both were very polite young men. After leaving the pool we checked into a beautiful, modern, clean room. During our stay we were welcomed one night to a yummy tray of deserts and on another night we found a bottle of red wine and strawberrys. As for the food.... We can't say enough about the Japanese restaurant. We ate there 3 times. Once we enjoyed hibachi and the other times had the most professional and nice waiter one could ask for. Thank you Hector! Now for the grounds. Clean, clean, clean and very beautiful!!! These men and women work around the clock to keep this place spotless! Even the lobby bar bathroom was spotless. The entertainment was also tons of fun! From the entertainment crew that got us in the pool to play volleyball to the crew that put on the night show. Thank you for a fun time full of great memories. If you want a smaller resort where you are not a number but a person, you need to stay at the Ocean maya. Every employee greeted us with a warm smile and a sincere hola as we crossed paths. The level of hospitality was amazing. We will return to Mexico next year for vacation. And we can't imagine staying anywhere else. Thank you staff at the Ocean maya royale. You are all amazing people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Really Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: AngelaW43501
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Ocean Maya Royale a few weeks ago. We stayed in one of the honeymoon suites and it was fabulous. We had no complaints about the room except for the bed was a bit uncomfortable. I've never really been to a hotel where the bed wasn't though, so it's not really a complaint. The resort was so beautiful. We never got sick of it! Palm trees everywhere, awesome landscaping, just gorgeous. The staff was excellent everywhere in the buffet areas and at the bars. We had privilege wristbands so we got all of the top shelf liquors and drinks so that was definitely a plus. I'm a beer girl and pretty much all they had was Corona Extra on tap except for at the Japanese restaurant they had a light beer. Not sure if it was Modelo or just Corona light but that was my favorite. I would have preferred a light beer everywhere we went, but hey, it was what they had, it was good and I drank all sorts of other drinks as well. The Japanese restaurant was delicious, Mexican was good, and the Italian restaurant was delicious but for some reason that one was very slow at bringing out our food. It may have just been our waiter at the time or time of night or something, but it took forever. Good food there though as well. If you go to this resort, it is definitely worth it to upgrade to a privilege room if possible, because you are entitled to free room service and you get to sit in a special area even in the buffets, where a waiter gets your drinks and anything you would like to order from the menu. It is great. If you don't have a privilege room, you can upgrade to a privilege wristband for $20 more a day. I definitely think it's worth it! The buffet food was decent, better than some other places I have been to. But the food at the El Charro(Snack area) for lunch wasn't the greatest. I preferred breakfast and lunch in La Hacienda much better. The only complaint I have from our experience is the smell of sewage outside in one or two areas of the resort. It was kind of gross but there are ways to bypass so you don't have to smell it. Besides a few flaws, I thought it was a beautiful resort and no place is perfect. We had an awesome time and it is a great place to just relax and enjoy the beautiful weather, which was perfect by the way. The ocean was a hop, skip, and a jump away from our resort too so it wasn't a long walk at all to the beautiful beach and ocean. Not much night life at all, but always something going on in the theatre whether it be karaoke or a mini play or mariachi band. The music would usually stop before midnight though, so after that we would just drink near the lobby and talk with new people until 2 when the bar closed. Then we would go back to our room and drink, go to bed, or use the hot tub on our patio. The vendors came and sold stuff a couple nights a week which is nice too. You can barter with them just like you would in town. They never came into the resort during the day though and cannot bug you on the beach which was really nice. All in all, it was a really good vacation and we had an awesome time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SheepyVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Ocean Maya in March 2011, and had the most wonderful time. The staff were friendly, the a la cartes were very good, and we didn't have a limit to how many times we could eat at any of them. Its true about reserving pool loungers very early in the morning, and both pools were fantastic. The beach was OK, we aren't beach lovers but the staff did work hard at keeping it clean. In fact, the whole resort was immaculate. They work very hard at doing so. This isn't a party resort, though the staff did try hard at entertaining the younger crowd by taking them out on the town, and ensuring they made it back to their hotel safe and sound (this was impressive, as the staff was back to work 1st thing in the morning). I would definately go back to Ocean Maya in a heart beat. Its was truely an amazing vacation, and a trip to be remembered.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johana-g
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, we all had a great time we all wish we were still there, if you a a beach person this isnt the place for you. The water was rough and dirty, but the pool was great... Food is great the mexican restaurant is to die for so its a MUST try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitly go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Wally47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Ocean Maya. We travelled with our two sons who are 19 and 20. We had a fabulous time. The weather was awesome. Food, drinks,grounds, rooms all beautiful. We have no complaints at all. I have been to a number of different resorts but both my husband and myself feel we will return again for sure. The entertainment staff were amazing. So much fun around the pool everyday. We especially loved Lorena Epinoza. She was the most friendly young lady and made our stay so memorable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel but there's much better out there for same price or cheaper. Say no to time share you've been warned.”
Reviews.Author: someguyfromindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are pretty and every one says hello. Night entertainment is the worst we've seen and we've stayed a many other resorts. The resort is quiet and doesn't have many activities which if you all you need is food, pool, and a room you won't be disappointed. If you don't mind paying a taxi 40 usd round trip to go to Playa de Carmen that's your best bet for a good time. Or hike 15 min to the main street and catch the bus which is way cheaper, but it is a public bus be aware. The food is tolerable, the rooms are nice but be sure to shake the ants out of your clothes before you come home as they are in the drawers. The sewer smell didn't bother me that much. Beach is horrible the sand smells and I about cut my foot on a piece of jagged concrete someone dumped in there. SAY NO TO TIMESHARE!!! They will consume your whole day trying to sell this to you. They will tell you anything to get you to buy when you say no they try to make you feel stupid for not buying and keep throwing offers at you. This a real put off.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best staff! Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Super8_Cambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ocean Maya Royale for a reunion with a bunch friends and had a wonderful time. I was amazed by the kind of service we were provided with the entire week. The food was good and the drinks even better. The pool is huge with a swim up bar and there is always some fun activity going on. I recommend this resort to all different types of travelers. Tip the staff well they deserve it, well done!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya - amazing”
Reviews.Author: Amallett
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at this resort. Everything was above our expectations. The resort was beautiful and being constantly cleaned. The food at the Italian restauarant was spectacularly good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, funfilled week”
Reviews.Author: Bev31
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of 6 ladies, an annual trip we now do yearly. From the time that we landed to take off again, I can't say anything negative about the hotel or their staff. When we began to look, we looked through the reviews, some were good, some not so good, very pleased with our choice. There is more than enough food for whatever type of eaters are out there, there is definatly something for everyone. the la cartes, we eat at them all, no line ups, however when we were leaving the resturantes, there were a line up waiting to get in. Mexican was the best for me, get the tequila drink, the waiter does an amazing job on his show. The nightly shows are typical, I enjoyed Grease and the Earth Day show. The entertainment crew do their best to get everyone involved with activitites, some prizes are awarded fro winners, lots of fun watching. Hands off to Jess, Richardo, Lorenza, and Omar, jobs well done! The pools are refreshing, not too cold as we read in other reviews, there is staff that walk around catering to your needs. The ocean area is small, however very clean, others around are not attended to as well! We went on a walking tour to be shown a little hidden heaven a little ways up the coast, very beautiful view with fish. Take some bread with you, you can feed the fish, they will come up to you, swim with the fish as well. We had no issues with getting s ride into Plays Del Carmen with the free shuttle ride, we even got the same day trip available. We took a taxi back for a cost of $15.00 usd funds. The flea market is a place that you can really dicker in price, they start off at a price (way to high) lots of room the get a good price. I paid @ 25% of their asking price. I found that everyone was freindly wherever we went, never felt out of place. The sax player was a nice surprise, he was there nightly, however did mix it up with other playing with him. The staff is happy throughout the hotel, the grounds keepers, the grounds are beautiful A special thanks to Javier for ensuring that we were having a good time, he checked with us daily, got us our drinks when we first arrived, took our bags and stowed them away until our rooms were ready,

Reviews.Title: “10”
Reviews.Author: CEichbauer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this H10 resort with extended family including 3 kids and had a wonderful time. Can't say enough about the terrific staff here...Maria, thank you for organizing all the great birthday extras for my husband (face in the cake, decorating the rooms, tequila, etc.) Ingrid and all the other restaurant staff, including Antonio, Thilo and others at the bars, thank you for making us feel welcome. These people go over board in terms of cleanliness... even male waiters with short hair have to wear hairnets (not really necessary... the chefs/ cooks sure, or if you have really long hair). Great juices, great fresh fruit, nice atmosphere - Would love to return with the whole family, if you do decide not to make it an all adult resort. Muchas gracias!

Reviews.Title: “A week of Paradise was too short!!”
Reviews.Author: EastC0ast01
Reviews.Content: Me and my new fience just had the most amazing stay at this resort, we never wanted to leave!! I even found a ring there and asked her to marry me ( she said yes!!) Right from the minute you get there you are greeted by the amazing staff. Simon and Catherine our Noli Tours reps were fantastic and helped us through our whole trip making sure we had plenty of fun things to do. I absolutely recommend taking a munute to pick their brain especially if you have never been to mexico before, they were awesome and very helpful. HUGE shout out to Susannah, Richardo, Maria, and the rest of the animations staff for really making our stay here memorable !! They were non stop everyday keeping the fun going, they took us to CoCo Bongo and put in a spot for our engagement!! This crew is one of a kind, because of them and the rest of the staff including Antonio from the main bar and Juan from the Hacienda we have decided to come back this time next year to have our wedding on the beach with the rest of the family. As much as i would love to keep this resort a secret it wouldnt be right. You should plan your next trip here you will not regret it consider this one a hidden gem. Keep in mind it is a smaller resort and not a party spot but there is plenty of fun to be had on and off the resort. And thank you again H10 well be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience and Best Staff Around”
Reviews.Author: Brandi26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there for our honeymoon and had a great time. I have been to the other H10 resort in Cancun, (which was great) as well as 8 other all-inclusive throughout the Caribbean, and I will say that this resort would be in my top three. This is a great resort if you are looking to relax because it is smaller and more intimate , if you want more activities and livelier night life at a resort, I would recommend the Ocean Turquesa H10. The rooms are very clean, the atmosphere is more laid back and quiet and the cabanas on the beach are amazing! I would recommend upgrading to the Privilege package because you get access to premium liquor , VIP seating for all of your meals as well as the cabanas on the beach (which you need to get up before 7am to get one)! There were a few drawback thou, the beds were uncomfortable and the food at the buffet is ok. This price point of resort doesn't include much seafood at all, but the staff is very friendly and accommodating. One tip I will give, do NOT go to Senior Frogs!! The entertainment staff will take you to different "hot spots" (Coco Bongo is fun) but do not pay money to go to Senior Frogs. The bar was totally dead, the service was horrible and the place was an absolute hole in the wall.....please don't waste your money there! Overall thou, it was a great resort and I would recommend it to anyone. My husband and I wanted to thank Alberto, our waiter, Eber, at the bar, and mostly Azucena, who brought as drinks all day at the cabana, for their wonderful service! Thank you and we hope to visit you all soon!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: prims25
Reviews.Content: Had never been to Mexico, my wife had, so I didn't know what to expect. Every resort had it's good and bad reviews on tripadvisor so was a bit nervous. Well any worries I had were gone when I walked into the lobby at Ocean Maya. Soooo clean, every staff member we saw were so friendly, greeting us with a "hola!!" everywhere we went. We upgraded to a oceanview suite all I can say is "wow" we could watch the sun rise every morning over the ocean. The rooms were clean and spacious. Not alot of privacy in the bathroom as the glass door separating the toilet/shower area from the mirror/sink is a visual barrier only. The grounds were well kept and clean. The beach was small, but not the resort's fault as alot of it was spept away in hurricanes, and the mexican gov't hasnt helped restore that area. The staff was awesome everyone so pleasant and kind. The food was very good our favorite was the italian a la carte, although all 4 including the buffet were excellent. Every night there was entertainment at the lobby, the entertainment staff do a wonderful job at Ocean Maya, will even arrange to take you to Coco Bongo or Senor Frogs in Playa Del Carmen - ensure safe return afterwards as well. If you go to Ocean Maya i reccommend getting the "privelege" bracelet it was $20 USD per person per night, but with it we received premium liquor, our own section at the beach (with bar service- her name was Azucena, the nicest sweetest person in Mexico she was so nice) and we could reserve dinner at the a la cartes (italian, mexican, and japanese). The reservation thing isn't a big deal if you are willing to wait. When I read reviews, I thought "what a waste of money" but I'm glad we did it. What a trip. Would go back in a heartbeat. If you are freaked out by iguanas, geckos, the odd raccoon, the odd food you don't like, then i'm not sure where you're going to vacation in Mexico. If you like beautiful weather, turquoise blue water, a wonderful, clean, fun resort with super staff then I would recommend Ocean Maya.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: bergdale13
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitate to book this trip based on some reviews, but I found a killer deal online so I couldn't pass it up. I feel our experience definitely exceeded out expectations. While this was a very clean, well kept resort with a great staff and decent food, I don't know if it was so special that I would go back, but if you could find a good deal I would definitely recommend. Rooms: It looks like they really put some work into their rooms. Everything seems to be refurbished and we have a nice flat screen tv with a lot of American channels. All the rooms are in a bungalow that has 8 rooms each and every room looked like it had a terrace. Food: We didn't go to any of the al a carte restaurants, but the morning and evening buffet was well stocked and very good. They had fresh salads, a pasta bar, I feel that anyone can find something that they will like. There wasn't a poolside snack bar that you could just quick grab and go, but rather more of a sit down buffet style restaurant located by the pool. It had nachos, burgers, salads, pizza, and fries among other things. Beach: The beach is the biggest downfall of this resort. I don't know if the wind was just really strong when we were there, but you can't swim it was way too choppy! Also, they do not have much of a beach, but rather a large wall to break the strong surf. On either side of the wall there is beach as far as you can see in both directions however, and the resort does have a few chairs on either side of the wall. I never felt that we had to get up super early to get a chair, if you weren't picky we always found something. Bracelets/ Privilege: I don't know why this resort has a "Privilege Club." It's a nice resort, but defiantly not "fancy" enough to warrant a "privilege" section. It seems the only thing that the Privilege section got was a roped off section in front of a wall and Top Shelf booze instead of bar pours. Neither one of these services warrant and extra $100 night to me. We had a green "regular" bracelet and i feel we got just as good as service as anyone else. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “The worst part is returning home......”
Reviews.Author: ckelly163
Reviews.Content: I just returned from paradise this week. I have abosolutely no complaints about this resort. The grounds are immaculate not a thing out of place. The weather was perfect the same everyday 28 deg. sun and 25 km winds. The buffett was good some this different everyday so you dont get bored of the food.a La carte's were great the best was the japan , the mexican second and the worst was the italian but still ok. Rooms were great fully reno compleated and very clean. Everyone were very nice and friendly and I would go back in a heartbeat. YOU SHOULD NOT BE DISAPPOINTED WITH THE RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful! Beyond Expections!”
Reviews.Author: DLPK
Reviews.Content: What an amazing resort! My husband and I who travel about 3 times per year, always at 4-5 star hotels/resorts were extremely pleased with Ocean Maya from the moment we arrived at the front desk. The staff was very friendly and we even had a glass of punch handed to us as we stood checking in. Nice beginning to our vacation! The grounds of the hotel are stunning. The bright, vibrant colours of the gardens that surround each and every villa were beautiful! The food was good, the service very good in all the restaurants. Very friendly staff - especially Manuel at the buffet! The pool(s) were very nice, the beach better than many in the area. And I cannot say enough about the Entertainment staff - they were incredible, as were their nightly shows! The hotel coffee shop was so good - making us Vanilla cappucinos each evening after dinner! They even had special "themed" evening throughout the week - "Martini Night", "Chocolate Fountain Night", and "Romantic Night" to name a few. Incredible ideas! I don't know how anyone can say a bad word about this resort - obviously the few that do, have nothing better to do or feel they deserve something more special. This is definitely a 5* resort. The one thing we loved most about the resort, was that it was small. It was not one of those gigantic mega-resorts, where you need to take a trolly to get accross to the other side. From the front lobby to the furthest point in the resort, you could walk within 10 minutes!! The pathways, surrounded by the lush gardens were beautiful for walking around, even in the evening as they were lit up all around! If you have any doubts about booking here, don't. You will be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: troutThunderBay
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly ,beautiful relaxing resort ! The beach was so so better than some resorts to the north not as good as those to the south ! The rooms we had were as shown on the net .The food was good nothing to complain about and the ala carte restaurants service was good except one time in the Italian ! We really enjoyed the jazz artist on many occasions . If want want to have a great time at a slower pace this is the place ,if your looking to rock on all night this is not the resort for you!! There was lots to drink and a good number of people who showed the results ! Champaign and bloody Marys at breakfast, chocolate fountain on Wednesdays and martinies ! What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “I Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravl15
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my vacation in the Mayan Riviera and I am still dreaming about it. I would have to say that this is one of my favourite all inclusive resorts that I've stayed at thus far. The whole experience was flawless. First of all, I have to say right from the start i was greeted with a delicious "welcome drink" which was nice for our grand arrival. This was just the beginning... Hotel-The room was absolutely stunning. It felt like I was staying in a "boutique style" hotel. It had the vessel sink in the bathroom with the glass shower. Since the hotel was renovated in August 2010, it is obviously relatively new. For those who are into winding down in the evening with some television, they do have satellite and you are able to find some English speaking channels like CNN, American Network, etc. I also loved the fact that is hotel is divided up into Villas. You don't have the congestion of people waiting at the elevators and its more private where you are staying. I really felt like I was staying in a private place. The grounds were also very well maintained and well looked after. When you first arrive in the lobby you will see that this not your ordinary hotel, its a modern, but cozy hotel that makes you feel quite comfortable. Food- I have to say that I am a very picky eater and I tend to suffer with stomach issues quite often, but my experience at the Ocean Maya was fantastic! I always felt great and the selection was pretty good as well. My favourite was the mexican restaurant. The portions were big and I couldn't even finish my desert. The Japanese was also good because we had the chef cook right in front of us. Very fun! We never tried the Italian, but we heard that people went back for seconds or thirds because they enjoyed it so much! The Buffet was always fully stacked and I must say, the mexicans are really into their fruits and vegetables. Delicious! Coffee House- I have to say that the coffee at this resort was out of this world. The flavour was amazing. At breakfast time, I was always sure to ask for a second cup, although i was already full. Their breakfast is "american style" . I.e- hot cakes, pancakes, french toast, scambled eggs, omelettes, toast, muffins, croissants, etc. You will not go hungry. Service- The service was terrific! They really do go out of their way to make you happy and satisfied. They also have a sense of humour, which i admire. I see that many reviews were positive, but I also see that some people were complaining about the silliest things. I must say, do not hesitate for one moment to stay at this place. You will love it! Those people who are complaining about this hotel are obviously the type who complain about everything and anything. They will always find something to complain about no matter where they stay, even its the four seasons! Don't hesitate and book this hotel today! Beach- The beach wasn't the greatest, it was rather small, but the pools are beautiful and I didn't mind having servers come and ask me what drink I'd like next! I didn't even have to get up off of my lounger, unless i wanted to cool down in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort!”
Reviews.Author: TrippyGirl2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a wonderful holiday at the Ocean Maya resort. From the moment we arrived after our flight we felt pampered...we were given a drink of refreshing fruit punch as we were waiting to check in and made use of the courtesy room to change into our summer clothes while we waited for our room to be ready (we arrived at 12:30 pm and rooms are ready around 3pm) A shower was available but we didn't make use of that. The next day we attended the one hour orientation session offered by Christine from Nolitours. Her presentation was excellent and answered all our questions. It is clear that she loves Mexico and her enthusiasm was infectious! We went on 3 excursions (snorkelling at Puerto Morelos, the Coba Myan Encounter and the Xplor theme park. ) All were excellent with wonderful guides. The gardens at Ocean Maya are beautiful, the rooms spacious and very clean and the staff very friendly and accomodating. Each and every staff member we passed when walking around the resort greeted us warmly and with a beautiful smile. We enjoyed all the restaurants especially the buffet which is available every night. There was lots of variety (fresh fish was amazing) and the service was friendly and efficient. We also enjoyed our dinners at the a la carte restaurants. The shows offered in the evening were very entertaining and fun. The traditional Mexican dancers were truly outstanding with a wonderful live band and amazing and colorful traditional dresses. This resort is a very relaxing spot with beautiful palm trees as well as hammocks and chairs to lounge on. We were pleased with the spa services (massages and a manicure) and enjoyed the live saxaphone music on several evenings. Although I was travelling without my husband I felt very comfortable sitting in the lobby enjoying a drink and a good book. The clientelle seemed to be mostly young and middle aged adults with a few teenagers and a few young families. As we were looking for peace and quiet this was the perfect get away. I would not hesitate to recommend Ocean Maya for anyone who wants a relaxing week of peace and quiet in a gorgeous setting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Resort with Beautiful Grounds.”
Reviews.Author: trakar39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya along with 2 other couples from March 5 - 12th. We thought the grounds were so lush and green and kept immaculate. All of us decided to stay "Privilige" and for the most part enjoyed these services. The internet wi-fi worked for about 10 minutes on one day in our room, so that was disappointing. The rooms were very nice and quite modern. The bed was great! We had a balcony facing the garden and it was quiet and beautiful. We tried to use the breakfast in bed (as part of our Privilige package) but after 80 minutes we called and they said it would still be another half hour. The food was ok at this resort. I found the buffet had lots of options from meats, salads, fruit, fish etc, typical buffet. My husband and I did not like the Japanese Restaurant at all. We are not big on Asian food, however this was horrible. Our friends decided to give it another go and went another night and said it was better. The mexican restaurant again was ok, nothing special. We did however really enjoy the Italian restaurant, grilled lobster, soups, breads were very tasty. Entertainment was very good, they worked hard and put on a great show every evening. We enjoyed the luxury beds in the Privilege area on the beach, kept very clean with complimentary ice buckets, towells, sunscreen, champagne and books. We think that they should keep the Tiki Bar opened later at night, this is a good way to meet people instead of the set up the have now where everybody sits at their own tables. Reading other reviews I am not sure why someone said they only could pay with American Express, not true, I carried and paid with pesos, visa, canadian and US anywhere and everywhere. I had read before going that the mosquitos were quite bad. I never saw them as they must be very tiny, but I sure did feel them. I am glad I brought spray and rubbed it on my feet and ankles everynight. The beach area is not very good, but the pools are great. Overall I enjoyed this resort and would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: PMbennett
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home this morning from a wonderful, relaxing vacation at the Ocean Maya. The staff is awesome..... Juan and Manuel in the restaurant are "the best" and Eber and David at the pool bar are two of a kind. We would be hard pressed to find any faults with this resort. The grounds are beautiful, the food is great. The rooms are immaculate ! We would definitely recommend the Ocean Maya to anyone and we will be BACK !!

Reviews.Title: “The 3 Rs: Rest, Relaxation and REVEN”
Reviews.Author: dizzylily
Reviews.Content: If you want to escape and enjoy some Coco Locos or other tropical delights on a palm-tree lined beach this is the place! The staff here are amazing, very warm and hospitable as are the rest of the hotel guests. They have multiple restaurants on the property so that you don't get tired of eating the same type of cuisine each night. They even have an entertainment staff whose wit and friendliness is unmatched by any hotel I've visited in the area. They produce nightly shows and parodies as well as organize trips into downtown Playa to experience the nightlife. The spa is also worth a trip, if you have some time on your hands or would like to get out of the sun for a few hours. It is run incredibly well and I got one of the best massages I've had in a long time! No lie! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “good 3 stars, but not more = worth max 100$ per room per night AI”
Reviews.Author: Puteshestvennik15
Reviews.Content: We wanted to escape from a rainy city and spend a week on the beach. Ocean Maya had a nice offer and we decided to try. We arrived very late at night, the guy at the reception gave us a room and Privileged bracelets. Our first room was a total disappointment - it was very humid, musty, my passport became wet in the safe! So we asked to change the room right after the first night - but we moved to a different room only after the third (and only after a certain fight). The second room was on the second floor of the villa and was much better. Apparently later we have found out that EVERYBODY who got the room on the first floor was asking to move up, coz it's just impossible to stay in such a musty and humid place, sleep there, rest - terrible! Second disappointment was food. First day we went to the Japanese restaurant - bad bad bad, waste of time. Sushi and rolls are incredibly bad! I know it was Mexican resort, but i also don't live in Japan! Mexican restaurant was very average too, we hoped that at least the local cuisine will be good - but no, it was a buffet behind the scenes, and the waiters were simply bringing you food from the already prepared food! The only pleasant surprise was the Italian restaurant. But as we were not the only ones who realized it - the line to get a table was usually up to 30 min. Buffet lunch - not impressive, even though the variety was big, the quality was poor. Definitely not the 5 star hotel level. But to be fair - the BBQ on the beach was very good and tasty! Our third disappointment was personnel. They are all smiling to you and being nice - until you ask them to help you! The girl at the Privilage desk - rude and unprofessional. The Italian guy at the reception - Fabio - incredibly rude and mean. No complaints about the waiters in Italian restaurant, who even spoke Italian! One more thing that was just outrageous - internet. When we arrived - the wifi in the lobby was working. In 2 days it went down. Every day they were promising to have it fixed the next day, it lasted for 4 days, wasn't fixed and they always had an excuse WHY they can't have it fixed so far. Really? that's the 5 stars? I would say that the rating of the hotel was confusing. When you go to the 5 star hotel you expect the level of service. If you adjust it to the real level of 3 stars for this place - it's fine. Just don't pay for a 5 stars when you get 3!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Niminy457
Reviews.Content: I thought I would read the recent reviews and if I agreed with them would not write my own. I agree with most of what has been said by previous reviewers.I agree that this is a lovely resort. It looks just like is is presented on their web site. The staff is so hard-working and very attentive. They always greeted us when we walked past. Our waiter at the Spanish restaurant sang "Happy Birthday" when we told him it was m bday. I'm writing this review to set the record straight regarding comments by two other reviewers. One person said there is no beach. That is absolutely incorrect. The beach is long, wide and has soft white sand. I'm attaching photos. Another person said the food has no flavour. I completely disagree with that as well. We were very pleased with the huge variety and preparation of the food at the buffet and restaurants. I was particularly impressed with the vegetables.There was a huge variety of vegetables, well-prepared. I believe that if you can cook veggies for hundreds of people and serve them in interesting ways without the veggies turning to mush, you know what you're doing in the kitchen. We really enjoyed the guacamole, ice cream and yogourt as well. This is a quiet resort, exactly what we were looking for. If you want to party, or have lots of options for your kids, there are doubtless better choices out there. I would feel very comfortable recommending this resort to my friends and family and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: mojo_rocks40
Reviews.Content: Wonderful relaxing vacation, staff was very helpful, rooms clean, food was enjoyable, grounds are very well manicured, iguanas add a wonderful touch! pool was just right, not too hot, not too cold. While we were away the other couple we were travelling with celebrated a wdding anniversary and we had dinner on the beach, it was terrific the staff was very attentive, even the hotel services rep came to the beach that evening to make sure everything was perfect, you dont get service like that in Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Put my faith back in Mexico resorts!”
Reviews.Author: DirtydealinVegas
Reviews.Content: Last year we went to Palladium in Puerta Vallarta. It was a disgusting stay and no service to speak of. My main memory was sewer smell 24hrs a day. I could go on and on but will spare you :-). This hotel is clean, beautiful and amazing staff. We would observe them working and interacting with people. The Mexican people are truly happy and love to make your trip memorable. Our room was large and cleaned daily/bar restocked. There was never a problem getting bottled water to go for day trips or in the room. It is very romantic for couples and I guess that is why it is changing in May to adult only. My friend and I still had a great time interacting with other tourists and the wonderful recreation staff (Laurena.....always in our hearts with her beautiful spirit). Our day trips were all great and would do more of them next time. Loved Xa ha park! Our negative experience was the Party Hoppers for 85 dollars plus 5 dollars tip. The first two places were ok. We did have VIP seating and service. The final place Coco Bongo was awful. We couldn’t see anything from where we were. There was a lot of smoke (not cigarette) every fifteen minutes or so sent out into the crowd. If you have asthma take your puffers. The music was great and if we could of viewed the show it would of been better. I would suggest not going on a Fri or Sat for maybe less crowded. It was not possible to move on the second floor and leaving via the only exit was a nightmare. It is difficult to find your way out if you don’t know this place. I hope there is never a need for emergency evacuation there. The show is worth seeing so go early not 11 pm at night and if possible during the week. Other people from the group left and went to another bar next door because it was too crowded. You do get a ride there and back to your hotel in the package. The next day we mentioned it Nolitours reps Catherine and all she said was did you tell the Party Hopper escort? We did speak to our server several times. The VIP area was already full before we arrived and it would have been better to stay on the main floor. From the main floor you can look up and view the show. My next visit I will not use Nolitours or Air Transit (no issues with the airline at all). We met some wonderful people and have great new memories. We bartered and met a lot of the local people on our shopping trips. Make sure to go to Playa del Carmen 5th avenue to shop. There is so much to see there we went twice. The staff, other visitors and beautiful grounds made it a wonderful vacation. I heard about the Privilage option on our last day. If you want 5 star then I would recommend upgrading. No regrets for picking this hotel and if I go without children next time I will definitely stay again. I know there were other very happy Canadians leaving a piece of their hearts there too. If you have any questions feel free to send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “More Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: nanWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place. Spent 2 weeks there. The friendliest staff you could imagine! Everyone from service personnel, bartenders, to entertainment staff were wonderful! We were treated so well. The rooms were beautiful, just like the pictures show, the grounds breathtaking, the food fabulous( we ate way too much), they held a barbeque on the beach twice while we were there, with white chair covers, tables the whole 9 yards, just unbelievable the work they went to. The most hard working people. We certainly enjoyed every minute of our stay. There was nothing to complain about. Would definetly recommend this resort to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “So-so resort — boors ruin the place”
Reviews.Author: dumbfromrum
Reviews.Content: We had planned this getaway for a number of years and were so looking forward to some rest and relaxation in the sun. However, shortly after our arrival we came to find a radio station promotion tour had booked a large chunk of rooms in this resort and proceeded to take over the place. They were loud and boorish — especially the radio hosts, totally obnoxious and crass — and their guests didn't behave much better. The resort itself was nothing out of the ordinary and the rooms, food and bars were definitely sub-three star. For our money, we'll look elsewhere and check to see if there's any touring clown troupes staying at our resort next time we head south.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: DerekCana
Reviews.Content: First of all I will say that I read a lot of the reviews before I went and now after I got back home and the people complaining are nitpicking and at the least unreasonable. My girlfriend and I stayed here and had the best time ever, we are both 22 and have no complaints. I will break things down: Grounds, building, location and cleanliness: The resort is beautiful and well maintained. Immaculate! there is someone constantly grooming and fixing the slightest details. The rooms are very nice and very clean. From the lobby to the beach it is at most a 2-3 minute walk, which is nothing when compared to other resorts. All the buildings are located on the way towards the beach. At one point a long the path there is a slight smell of sewer,if you may, but unless you stop and sit there to smell it you cant notice it anywhere. It really is such a small detail that you hardly notice. The location is good. not too far from Playa, the city. you can cab for $14 or take the bus ( not scary and actually nice) for 20 pesos, we did both. FOOD: The food was far better than I expected. The main buffet had so much to choose from. and had cooks there at every meal ( what they cooked depended on the meal) to cook fresh meats, pastas, omelets, and burgers. The service is exceptional and everyone is more than happy to help you enjoy your meal. There was also live saxophone at some meals. There is a juice bar at breakfast a long with bottles of alcohol at breakfast for you to use to your liking. I will say, however, you are ridiculous if you are expecting lobster and top cuisine like here in Canada or USA. We didn't get sick from the food either. There is food available pretty much 24/7. At the cafe you can order food after 11 until 6 I believe. we ordered a pizza at 430 am and had it delivered to our room. :) A la Carte: Japanese... it was very good actually, amazing service and if you sit at the grill there is a really nice show that they put on while they cook. Mexican... very good as well, a lot to select from on the menu and we both enjoyed our meals. the service again is remarkable. BAR: ***** We brought " 1.5 Liter bubba kegs********** BRING A LARGE TRAVEL MUG OR SOMETHING LARGE TO TRANSPORT YOUR DRINK IN. !!! It was kinda crazy the amount alcohol they poured into one of these things. I questioned if it was even drinkable. But though the drinks had a lot of booze in them they tasted really good. They enjoyed pouring these large crazy drinks. There was not much for lineups. Sometimes a waitress would just serve you on the beach or in the lobby unexpectedly which was nice, or you could go to the bar and you get prompt service. Hardly had to wait for a drink at all. There was no problem getting hammered, really I can assure you that if you drink, you're going to get drunk. A hangover is more a reality you have to face than something you have to strive for. Entertainment: We absolutely loved the entertainment staff. We didn't get a chance to really meet or party with the guys, but the girls were amazing and always up for dancing and having a great time. Susana and Loraina (both) made our trip something we will never forget. They are really a lot of fun. Loraina (I hope I am spelling it right) took us to Coco Bongo. it was 45 usd and included open bar, admission, and transportation. She went with us and partied with us. She made she we had great service from the server, made sure we had a good table and made sure to keep our drink coming. She willingly drank with us and made us feel like VIP. It is a MUST DO we stayed until 3:30AM and even then she asked if we wanted to stay or go. There are sports and games put on by the entertainment staff all day, and at night (9:30) there is a nightly show. From local dance, singing, bands, to theater musicals. Afterwards there is music and dancing for the willing. The entertainment staff, usually Susana and the Lorainas would be there trying to get people to dance. We danced all night with them and pulled onlookers in to dance. It was a BLAST. It is what you make it. BEACH/POOL I looked at pictures and read reviews and I was worried, but the beach was good. There is a wall to protect the beach from storms/erosion. There is a section of beach beside a pool that isn't in front of the wall. The water is nice and blue/green. I had no problems swimming in it and enjoying the ocean. We usually got up at 7:30 -8 AM and went and threw a towel on a chair. We still found chairs after 9AM on a couple of mornings. I look at it as you are on vacation so why would you want to sleep in. Get up, grab a chair on the beautiful beach and sleep there. Its better than your dark room. I certainly wouldn't pay money to sleep in all day. The pools are nice and cool. really cool you down on a hot hot day. Clean as well. STAFF: Everyone is so friendly and make a point of saying hello as you pass by. Always smiling, always eager to serve, help, and do whatever they can to make you enjoy your stay. THANK YOU ALL! Everyone was AMAZING Key points: BRING A LARGE DRINK CONTAINER makes the trip that much better. Get up at 730-8:30 AM to reserve your chair/ ENJOY the beach participate and talk to the entertainment staff. They are genuine and a lot of fun. Go to the night shows. They are put on for you to enjoy If you are afraid to dance just participate in the dance lessons, or simply ask the entertainment staff to teach you. It's fun, easy and they enjoy your interest. Go to COCO BONGO with the staff. You will never forget your experience I promise! Go to Playa... in the after noon. its cooler temperature wise. Theres a bit of night life and the shops are easier to barter with. We truly enjoyed our stay and I will honestly return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ondina30
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel! I went with my boyfriend and was a great trip. The staff are super attentive and the infrastructure is the best! Great Japanese restaurant! The Italian is not so good. Do the privilege! One type of upgrade that provides privileges as international beverages, restaurant bookings and room upgrades. We had trouble with the shower was weak. Only! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya Royale from Feb. 26 until March 12, 2011 This is not a 5 star resort as we are used too. It has no beach but the pools are excellent, very clean. We stayed in the privilidge section and did not get all our extras. I will say that the resort is very clean and the staff are wonderful. The beds are great and rooms very clean. To purchase in the store they will only take American Express credit cards or cash and one store only takes pescos. The food is good but limited selection in the buffet. Red wine is better than white and the coffee is not too strong. All the staff speak very good english. The entertainment is varied and good and lots of activities all day. A lack of beach chairs at the pools and if you want one you have to get there at 6am with your towels. The prividge beach area has beds and lots of upgraged beach chairs. I would not go there again as I perfer 5 star quality

Reviews.Title: “Hard to leave, easy to come back”
Reviews.Author: ellemac007
Reviews.Content: Ocean Maya Review My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ocean Maya this past week (Friday - Friday) and it was WONDERFUL! Bear with me - this is a long review, but I’m sure it will help! Last year, my boyfriend and I stayed at the sister H-10 hotel in Puerto Morelos (Ocean Coral y Turquesa) - and we didn’t write about it in Trip Advisor, but we should have! I am in love with H-10 Resorts! We arrived before check in - Dulce at the front desk had a smile and information for us. She took our luggage, gave us the all inclusive bracelets, the towel cards, the lock for the safe and essentially said “Have at it”. Thankfully, we had packed a ‘beach bag’ for my carry on, so we were able to enjoy the resort the full 3 hours before we had a room. We immediately made friends with Ignacio - the bartender in the lobby during the ‘mornings’. He was always smiling while multi-tasking … especially taking care of very thirsty Americans! His attention to detail was impeccable - but to be honest, everyone who worked there had great attention to detail. For something sweet - try the Pink Lemonade. If you like spicy - try the “Ojo Rojo”. :-) Jose in the coffee shop is an incredible person! Funny and full of life. Always smiling while making our espressos or cafe con leche’s. We first met him after hitting the gym - and I tried to get my boyfriend to NOT hit the sweets fridge, but that didn’t happen and Jose was laughing at our antics and he immediately became our friend! The next day he remembered our names and he makes my special cafe con leche with a smiley face. :-) He is just wonderful! A gem! The gym is … OK.
