It has circuit training and free weights and some cardio (elliptical, treadmill, bike). My only complaint is that one treadmill was not working, while the other one most definitely needs a tune up. But, who am I kidding - who goes on vacation and works out!?! If you do - sorry for offending you. I went to work out while the sun was setting - it was a beautiful view - all the birds flying, treetops as far as I could see, just gorgeous. The breakfast at “La Hacienda” is phenomenal. Whatever you want - they have. Omlettes made to order? Done. Yogurt with granola? Si. Fresh fruit? Claro que si! Toast and jam? Si! Cottage cheese and veggies? Yep! Bloody Mary’s or Mamosas? Indeed! Chilequiles? Oh my goodness, yes! Fresh slices of cheeses and meats? Ding, Ding, Ding! My man Jose would bring our 2 waters and make our coffee without even asking by the third or fourth day! I cannot say enough, the service is impeccable! Susana is the chef, you might not notice her because she is always busy cooking or serving, but when you do, her smile lights up the room! She is so friendly and so helpful, especially with my broken Spanish! I didn’t do any of the spa treatments because I am not a ‘spa’ person, but it looked amazing in there! Our day consisted of: Sunrise around 6a, walking the beach until 7a, breakfast, nap, beach or excursion. When walking the beach - go left from our resort - like you are headed towards the Italian Restaurant. It might be 20 - 25 minutes to get there, but there is an amazing fresh water river to check out. TRUST ME! At night, we were mostly spent from the day. I understand when writers would say that this resort is not a party resort - if that is what you are looking for, you should check into something that is actually in the city of Playa del Carmen - or in the Hotel Zone in Cancun. At night in the lobby they would have live jazz. It was nice. Oh - also, in the lobby they have free WI-FI! How great is that!!! Also, what I really liked - On Thursdays, they have a ‘Beach Party’ where they have a BBQ, live music, dancing and do a presentation of all the head honchos of the hotel. It was really nice to see them and meet them. It really makes you feel like you mean something to them. I have to say, every time I saw a worker, they were always doing something : cleaning, sweeping, painting, wiping, fixing ... but they always said 'Hola' - I loved that! Walking through the grounds was like a mini-botanical garden. In closing, I understand that you can’t please them all - reading the previous posts when I was searching for hotels for my spring break; I was really hesitant when I booked Ocean Maya. I guess I am writing this to make sure that no one feels the hesitation that I felt when I booked my room, but I am so glad we went! It was a perfect break from the long winters of Chicago. Some side notes from our trip: We took taxi’s into Playa - depending on the taxi - he would charge us between $14 - 17 USD. Just ask before getting in, so you aren’t surprised. It averaged about $15 USD. Avenida Quinta is a huge tourist destination. Be prepared for businesses having workers sitting outside the doors saying - “Almost Free”. I do have to say - it is IDEAL people watching! Grab a beer at one of the many outdoor bars, chill and people watch. We booked through ‘Funjet’ and we took an AeroMexico direct flight from Chicago. I have to say, the flight attendants were great, but the seats were AWFUL! Take a couple of Advil’s before the flight; your back and legs will thank you later!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!! .. Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dani2727
Reviews.Content: Me, My boyfriend & 3 of our friends Stayed at the Ocean Maya.. and all of us Absolutely Loved it & had an AMAZING time! *Food--GREAT! The Japanese A la Cart was our Favorite.. They have Restaurant seating & you can also Request to sit around the Grill.. Both totally different experiences! With the Grill they make Stirfry in front of you with Entertainment During the cooking Process... Throwing Brocoli into our mouths.. Lighting Big Fires on the Grill.. TONES of fun! * Rooms --were Nice! BarFridge Restocked Everyday. There was 3 girls staying in our Room & only one Mirror.. Which made for Great difficult when it came time to get dolled up!! So my Recommendation for the Hotel would be to have more than One Mirror in Each Room! Otherwise Wonderful Rooms *Staff-- INCREDIBLE! Super friendly, accomodating & FUN! They encourage participatin in beach Games & Let you know about the fun happenings @ night (Senior frogs, cocobongo's, ect) If you do choose to go to one of the Resort trips to a Bar.. you get a great price which encludes a ride there, back & unlimited drinks there ANDThe staff come with you to ensure you have fun and get treated well!! Ricardo& Lorena Will always have a Place in our Hearts! Along with Omar and Gisella...<3 *Drinks-- The bartenders are veryy friendly as well! Yummy Drinks Before going on our trip I had read threw Hundreds of comments about the hotel to get an idea of what to be careful of and what to be sure we took part in..And really the only complaint I read was that the Hotel does NOT have a nightlife... and I can now say That I Very Much Agree! We are a Young Group 22-26 and of corse Wanting to partake in Some Latenight Mexico Fun.. However @ 2am they stop serving alcohol and by 2:45am they are politely trying to get you to go back to your Villas.. no beach bar.. no beach parties.. nadda! The party is moreso during the day at this resort. To Ensure we had Fun nights while we were there we went into playadel Carmen a couple nights to Cocobongos & Senior Frogs.. & We made sure to make friends with Other Partiers @ our Resort so by the End We had a Fun Crew that Would Stay up @ Night! Over all We had a Magnificent Time. I would Definitely Recommend this hotel to others and I would Definitely go there again! LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people to deal with”
Reviews.Author: ngg165
Reviews.Content: From day 1, we had a great holiday with nothing but fun and good times. Very few kids, so quite quiet. Beach isn't great, and water too dirty and rocky to wade/swim in. Lots of palapas, and great white sand. Short cab ride into Play Del Carmen. All staff no matter what their jobs went out of the way to make you feel comfortable. Only minor drawback we found was the buffet restaurant food was usually only warm at best.

Reviews.Title: “It Was a Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: NikkiG80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here from 2/23/11-2/28/11 and had a great time. We actually upgraded from another hotel, so I was glad we had such a positive experience. The staff was extremely friendly, greeted us with drinks, etc. However, like other reviews, the drinks were weak!! My boyfriend enjoyed the Mojitos though :-) Javier, the bellboy was really helpful and just a great, friendly guy. Lorena, who is part of the entertainment staff was also great. One night, we paid $45 each (USD) and she took us to Coco Bongo from 9p-2a. Transportation & drinks were included and we had a fabulous time! Our room was very nice. We were located right by the beach, pool and pool bar, which is a few minute walk from the lobby. Our shower did leak each time we took a shower, but it wasn't worth changing rooms over. The TV was nice and had English channels (someone on here said all channels were in Spanish--not the case). Food: the food was alright. We had Italian the 1st night (I enjoyed the seafood risotto and my boyfriend had a steak dish which he really liked). The Japanese was good too. That was the only place we went to twice. The Mexican restaurant was ok, but I felt sick the entire next day, so I'm not sure if that had anything to do with it. The buffet for breakfast & lunch was fine, but did get a little boring after the first few days. All in all though, for the cost and knowing it's an all-inclusive (where food is not always expected to be top-notch), the food met our expectations. We only did one excursion which we booked through the hotel (Rudy was his name). We paid $70 each (USD) to go ziplining, ATVing and to see (a.k.a jump from a 30 ft. cliff into) 2 cenotes, which are these gorgeous natural sink holes that are actually all over this part of Mexico. Google the word "cenote" and you'll see what I mean! Some tips/words of wisdom: -Do not rent a car. This was a big no-no!! We booked a car b/c it appeared to be just as expensive as paying someone to take us to and from the airport/hotel. When we picked the car up, we had to pay an extra $315 (USD) for insurance!! -If you want a beach chair, wake up early and put a towel/magazine on it. Beach chairs are hard to come by -This hotel is not actually in Playa del Carmen, it's about a 15 minute drive away -The beach area of the hotel is not so pretty, however, if you walk about 10 minutes down the beach, past a few other resorts, you will get to "tres rios." You have to see it to believe it. There are these 3 small fresh water rivers that lead out to the ocean. Totally gorgeous and totally worth the walk!! We went there every day to relax, swim and wnjoy ourselves! -Great shopping on 5th Avenue in Playa. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. I already miss Javier!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: WIldDragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya from Feb 26th to March 5th, 2011. This is out third time to the Riviera Maya and were not dissaponted by any means. Resort grounds were emaculate, room was super clean, food was great. If people complain about the food then they are way more fussy than myself (and I am VERY fussy). Loved the fact that you don't have to reserve for the à la cartes. This was the first time we were able to get into a Japanese Restraraunt at any resort and it was an awesome experience!! The chef made it even more enjoyable with his great personality. It was a smaller resort with bungalowstyle complexes with 8 rooms in each, which I liked. Didn't seem like you were staying in a hotel. And everything was in reasonable walking distance. All of the staff were excellent, especially Egnacio at the Lobby Bar, super friendly and always remembered us with a smile. The entertainment staff have a long and busy day but they still manage to put on great shows, they always have a smile and they take the time to stop and chat with you. One issue I had, and not a big one is the pillows, they are very firm. Could have mentioned it to the front desk, but didn't bother. Also would have been nice to have a screen on the patio doors to let the evening breeze blow through, however again didn't mention it as it wasn't that big of a deal. Overall enjoyed the stay, met some really great people, guests and employees included and would definately return to this resort. Thank you for your hospitality. We will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Super Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: scraggles09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya for 1 week and absolutely loved it. It was newly renovated, very clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was very comfortable. We loved the layout of the resort because it wasn't too big, but still had a wide variety of things to keep us busy; including a small area about 15 min walk down the beach where you could snorkel. The pool was clean and right beside the ocean, the beach was beautiful (although the waves were a bit rocky so we didn't get to swim much in the ocean). The food was really good, we especially loved the Mexican a la carte, which you didn’t need reservations for and could eat at as many times as you wish. The nightly entertainment was great, they switched it up every night. The resort was only about 15 min drive from Playa and about 1.5 hours from Tulum & Xel Ha. The only complaint we had was that there were never enough beach chairs on the sand or beside the pool so you had to wake up before 8am to go save two or else be out of luck. We will definitely go back to any H10 resort, especially the Ocean Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Youandme13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the beautiful Ocean Maya on Sat. March 5/2011. It surpassed my expectations for a resort for the money we paid. The grounds and surroundings are immaculate. The service we received was excellent. Our room was big, clean, and just a short walk to the pools. Yes sometimes you could smell sewer or something, but not all the time and it really wasn't that bad. We received excellent housekeeping services. ( Villa 27 ) Lots of fresh towels, always a full mini bar with lots of water, and fresh coffee every morning to be made. Beds were firm, but that's what we like, and we had no trouble with the water pressure or air conditioning. The 3 a la carte restaurants , Mexican, Italian and Japenese, were excellent. We ate at these 4 times during our stay, and never needed a reservation. Sometimes you may have to wait 10 minutes, but the view is breathtaking and the wait was always worth it. There was an incredible variety of food at the buffett as well and lots of it. From the Mamosa's to the pastries. We did all our tours in the mornings, back to the resort by noon, and from there went and lied on the beach loungers. If you wanted a lounger by the pool, you did need to go early to get one for the day, but for us, we didn't find it an inconvience. As for the drinks, we always asked for doubles, and had no problem enjoying our beverages. I will say, our only complaint, was the wine. It was horrible. You could buy other ones, but the available wines, both red & wine , were not enjoyable for us. So we just drank something else! We didn't party all night, but if you wanted to there was always something going on, from CoCo Bongo's in Playa , shows in the theatre, the disco after 10:30 or visiting with people you meet. Mike's Cafe was became a hang out. Great Latte. One of the best parts of the stay was meeting Giselle from the entertainment group. Her energy was mesmorizing and her smile infectious. Miguel, Omar, Susanna, Roberto, and the rest of them are amazing when it came to entertaining the guests, from Aquasize classes ( thanks Omar) to the fashion shows, to "Grease" to the Oscar night. Fantastic.......We also enjoyed the sax player. He was amazing.....Thank you so much for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “"FANTASTIC"”
Reviews.Author: LiLiAylmer
Reviews.Content: I swear all the staff at the Ocean Maya is happy to be there. They are an incredible bunch of people. From the groundskeepers (beautiful tropical gardens), to the animation crew (excellent outdoor evening show with the Oscar's on a giant screen), to the restaurant and bar staff (no reservations needed for the a la carte restaurants, champagne on ice all the time), etc. They are all there to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. If you need anything, just ask and you will receive. We had a couple of special requests before we arrived and a simple email took care of them (thank you Maria!). Management is not hiding behind closed doors at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 5 STAR, BUT NOT BAD”
Reviews.Author: westnatl
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we left. yes it does smell like sewer when you walk to the beach area. the grounds , cleaning and housekeeping staff was wonderful, very well groomed and rooms where very nice. You do have to be up at sunrise to put towels on your chair or you wont get one. Dont even think you can get the free scuttle to town. It is always full. They should either get another or larger bus. taxi ride one way to town is $14.00 us. This is not the place for children or teenagers, we are in our early 50s and were bored at night, (old folks home) after 9. You can hang in the lobby and wait in line for a very weak drink. dont plain on drinking to much. Some of the food was very good if it was just brought out. Im not a fancy eater and when we first arrived , i went to the beach bar and got a hot dog and fries. both were very cold. Again , this is not a 5 star, maybe a 3star.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Could Ask For-minus BEACH CHAIRS!”
Reviews.Author: rejecca7
Reviews.Content: Loved the people, the service, the food and soo many other things about this hotel!!! BUT, they must get more chairs for pool and beach to make this the ideal travel destination! The a la carts were soo yummy! Japenese, Italian and Mexican were great! Ask for a Mayan Coffee at the Mexican-you won't be dissapointed. The Japanese has two cook tables. We didn't have a chance to enjoy this-but the food we recieved was awesome. The Italian was fun and again, very yummy. The Buffet has soo many choices, and most of everything we had was very tasty. The evening entertainment was fun. But, if you are looking for a party at the resort after 10:00-you will be leaving and going to towns near by or hotel hopping. We didn't care. After the drinks, pools and great weather, we found bed early and enjoyed the sunrise in the mornings off of our balcony. The rooms are beautiful. Modern and clean. Everything is very clean at this resort. Ask for a pool view and watch the people run to reserve one or two of the too few chairs around the poola and beach area. We would get up at 5:30 to make sure we had a spot by 9:00am. This is anoying. Causes a lot if irritation for the majority of guests and is soo fixable it makes one wonder why it hasn't been rectified!!!! You can up-grade at booking and on site to PRIVILEDGE and never be with out a chair on the beach with personal wait staff, but you will be missing out on all of the activities around the pool. The Entertainment Staff is friendly, fun and work hard to make sure there is always a variety of things to do. There is a daily free shuttle into Playa that you can sign up for the day before. It leaves from the hotel at noon and picks you up in Playa at 5:00....This is a great way to see the town and get in some shopping....Lots of deals to be had if you like to barter!!! Overall, I will go back to Mexico again. I loved this resort for so many reasons....They just NEED MORE CHAIRS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip was very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: cbenson31
Reviews.Content: Room: We had one of the newly renovated rooms and it was fantastic! Beds are firm but we actually didn't find that we had a bad sleep at all. Private patio was a huge plus and we used it all the time! We didn't find any mosquitoes on the resort at all....I always get eaten alive at home but I never had one bite during my entire vacation. The location of most rooms from what we could tell, are close to everything because they kind of clump them in the middle of the resort so you're never walking very far to get anywhere. And yes, tip room service and ask for things if they were not left. (we didn't get facecloths after the 2nd day, but no biggie, I just used one end of the hand towel as the cloth and the other end as the towel. Food: No complaints. There are so many choices you have to be a real picky eater to complain about the food here. We never heard of anyone getting sick or anything either. The only problem is that there really is NOT 24 hour food available unless you ask someone. We were in town until after 11pm one night and kept being told that snacks would be set up "any minute" in the coffee shop, which never happened. The bartender asked us what we wanted and had someone make cheeseburgers and fries for the 2 of us. This was very nice, but if we hadn't asked, we would've gone to bed hungry! Drinks: No problem with drinks at all! Try them all! LOL Entertainment: The mexican dancers and music at 9:30 was great! The other shows are ok, but we're not that into them anyway. We just sat in the courtyard and heard most of them going on in the theater. They did have an Oscar night while we were there, with champagne, strobe lights, Oscars and the whole works. They really do try to make it entertaining so no real complaints.....except....there is no music down at the pool bar from when daily activities end (usually about 3pm) until the bar closes there at 6pm. It would be nice to have a little background Mexican music for atmosphere....this was a big negative! Also the fact that the pool bar closes at 6pm is a real bummer! It's still sunny out! You have to go up to the lobby bar for drinks after 6. Excursions: We found them WELL worth the money! Horseback ridind and snorkelling was about 130US each and another day we did ziplining, repelling and snorkelling in a cenote for 86 US each. Great value and well worth it! Beach: I'm completely honest here and am NOT one of those "hard to please" people....sandy part was gorgeous but there was a red flag up and you could not swim in the water AT ALL! Garbage and weeds were at least 4 feet from the water's edge. They had one little pool boy out there ALL day long with a pitchfork and wheelbarrow. People were just shocked at the state of it and would take pics like we did and shake their heads in digust as they walked along the beach. One woman dropped her camera in the water off the boardwalk and everyone was surprised that she actually ventured in to get it! She came out looking like the loch ness monster! It's too bad because this beach may be prone to getting things wash up due to currents, etc...I don;t really know. But we were just surpised that they really did nothing to clean it up the entire time we were there. The landscaping and rooms are sooooo clean, they're immaculate! You will not find so much as a cig butt on the ground! We just wish you could swim there! Walk down the beach 10 or 20 min or go into Playa del Carmen. The beach there is UNREAL!!!! It's definately a must-see! Service: There were NO problems with the service. They are so nice and friendly, but be prepared with lots of tips money! Overall: The beach is very important to us so we would not return to this resort. They have their priorities off on this point and could easily have a crew of workers to work daily at the water. The one guy who had this monstrous job worked tirelessly all day and you wouldn't even know it by looking at the water. On the other hand, if you don't mind travelling to swim at a beach and want a great relaxing vacation, this is the place. (The pools were not cold, by the way!)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: booking123
Reviews.Content: We are a retired couple who have been to Mexico five times. Ocean Maya has to be one of the best hotels due to food, service and entertainment. Check-in: Fast and efficient but not before 3pm can you check in as the rooms aren’t ready. Rooms: We were in building room 902 bldg 9 with an ocean view. They are total of 36 villas with 8 units in each 4 on the bottom floor and 4 on top with 20 steps to the top level. The room was spacious l-shaped with a king size bed,desk, plasma t.v.,mini frig, couch and chair. The bathroom has only one sink with large walk in marble shower. The door to the toilet is only frosted glass. Privilege Building is located near the main lobby and consists of 3 floors with an elevator. These rooms are larger and more spacious than the villas. Food: Main buffet good variety with various themes in the evening such as Italian night, Mexican night, Caribbean night. Be sure to get there at 6:30pm as the main meat dish is gone later. Nights we were there they had prime rib roast, pork loin roast and whole mini chickens another night and there isn’t any long line-ups as buffet is fast and quick. Lunch is in the Mexican restaurant with good variety, fish, steak or hamburger with lots of salads and fresh fruit and ice cream. On Thursday they have a beach party/BBQ from 12:30 to 3pm. Mike’s Coffee: 4 to 11pm specialty coffees, tea, hot choc, and also baguettes and pastries Restaurants: Yookobo is a Japanese Restaurant with two tepanyaki tables running at a time (8 people at each). The menu has three sections appetizers, soups, main entrée and dessert. Be sure to try the delicious fried banana and ice cream for dessert. There aren’t any reservations you just show up at 6:30pm or later but the earlier you are you get right in and served faster. Charro is the Mexican Restaurant service is slow due to large number of tables there. Food is good with steak, meat platters, and quesadilla. The lime pie is a disappointment. LaDolce Vita is the Italian Restaurant down on the water. It has a marguerite bar in the middle and tables on either side. Our group enjoyed this one the most. I had grouper with brandy sauce on a bed of spinach. The pastas dishes were not good but the lasagna was great and so was the minestrone soup. Be sure to have the Italian coffee cake for dessert as it is delicious. Only place in hotel grounds where the mosquitoes are bad as restaurant is more open. Some restaurants are closed certain nights so be sure to check your calendar to see which are open. Dress code isn’t very strict as long as it isn’t wet. Entertainment: The entertainment is excellent with professional Mexican dancers Thursday night, Sat. is Mayan dancers, Sunday was Oscar night with the red carpet to walk down and you got your picture taken with an Oscar, Monday night was Movie night lip singing and dancing, Tuesday was great Grease show, Wed. was Ocean night with Karaoke (audience participation) not too good. Internet: Free WiFi in the main lobby only if you bring your own laptop. Internet cost to use their computers is $12 U.S an hour which can be divided into three units. There are also other internet machines for $10 an half hour. Beach: On the left side is a long walk out pier and the beach water is full of seaweed and not very clean. In front of the pool is a wooden walkway with plax a glass fence and on the right side is a very nice beach. There is always a shortage of pool/beach chairs which the staff knows about but do nothing about the situation. Free shuttle to Playa Del Carmen every day pickup at hotel is 12n and comes home at 5pm. Plan to book the shuttle a day ahead to get on. The bus holds 24 people. The taxi fare is 14 dollars from Playa del Carmen if you don’t want to stay that long or 15 pesos with the Collectivo which stops outside hotel on highway and then a 15 minute walk to the hotel lobby. Tours are offered by your travel agent but also a guy walks along the beach and his tours are half price. We went to Coba for $60 which was all day with Coba, Cenote swimming, and Mayan Village tour in air conditioned van which holds 9 people and only stops twice for more people. Great service called Pleasant Tours [---] phone. They offer ten different tours just ask for a better price and he will lower the price he gives you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and also go back again. In May it is to become an adult only hotel but there weren’t many kids there now. There are 50% Canadian with the rest Mexican or United States citizens. Be sure to bring $50 U.S. dollars for tipping as you can’t get any while there. There is an ATM machine in the hotel lobby. The U.S. dollar isn’t accepted as freely as before and they prefer pesos. I have a map of the hotel layout if you want a copy.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wondeful”
Reviews.Author: travelwhisperer53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wondeful stay at the Ocean Maya . I would take any negative review and read it knowing some people are very hard to please. or their expectations are so high they can never be met. We enjoyed every minute of our stay . When i read a negative reveiw i wonder if the people were staying at the same resort . The staff are great and i did not encounter one person who was rude, The food is plentiful and there is always something for everyone at any one of the restaurents My favourite was the Mexican . The hotel is beautiful and you can be involved in the activities the hotel has to offer or not ,it really is up to you . The one thing is you need to stake out a lounge chair early at the beach but i did not find that a problem . There is a free shuttle to town and there is many activities and trips to book in the area . I would go back in a heart beat The rooms were lovely and clean and we were ver y comfortable during our stay. Remember you are in another country and maybe not everything is like your accustomed to but i would say this hotel is trying to make your stay a memorable one

Reviews.Title: “A very uncomfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: exousiavampira
Reviews.Content: We arrived and they put us in a building close to the lobby. If you get placed close to the lobby you can hear them playing the same disco music every night until 2am. Our room smelled like raw sewage and we had to eventually move to another room which took great effort to have the staff realize we were not enjoying our stay. When we arrived the lock on the balcony door was broken off and we couldn't lock the door. This was rectified quickly - the staff gave us a wood stick to lock the window. There are no screens on the windows - tons of mosquitos. The showers leak badly onto the floors and had to mop it up with towels. Had to ask 5 times over the course of 3 days to get face cloths in our room. Our refridgerator never worked at all. The cable they subscribe to is all in Spanish. The beds are hard as a rock. Ask for a blanket if you need one! They're nice and soft. After we switched to the new hotel room things went more smoothly. The rooms are very gorgeous and newly updated and do look nice and the majority of the staff is friendly and helpful. If you leave tips for the cleaning staff they treat you like royalty. They even make towel art to leave on the beds each day. If you have a problem with anything talk to the Nolitours people. They were most excellent and were able to resolve issues quickly. Or you can talk to guest services. I unfortunately had the pleasure of having to meet the resort doctor because I was stung by a sea urchin in Xel-Ha snorkelling park. He was very professional and knowledgeable and is looking out for the guests best interests. He saved me from having to go to the hospital in Playa. The beaches are really nice and the bar staff are great! The drinks are very weak (alcohol wise) but if you ask for doubles they're more than happy to oblige. It was really nice that they had a little drink special each day. It was a great way to try new and novel drink ideas that I would never have thought of ordering. We had an awful experience with the Italian a la carte restaurant. The food was so bad it was inedible and we ended up having to leave hungry. Instead of having 5 course meals at the a la cartes I would love to see this hotel focus on QUALITY over quantity. Some of the staff in the Mexican restaurant were very rude to us due to a misunderstanding on their part. One meal was ordered and another delivered and they refused to fix it and actually argued with us about it. The head chef that evening was very rude about the situation and dinner was spoiled - and on Valentines day too. The entertainment staff are genious when it comes to the traditional and mayan dancing. Be sure not to miss that! Skip the other shows - grease etc. Really hokey and not worth the time. I really didn't like it too much when the entertainment staff kept nagging us to join in their couples games and volleyball and disco dancing. Some people just don't want to participate and you shouldn't harass them about it. It was nice that you could book a sailboard for free! There were never enough beach chairs for all of the guests. Unless you get there at 7am and put all your stuff on chairs to reserve them there is no way you will get a lounger. I really appreciated the hammock area! That was very nice. Another suggestion that I have is to get more variety of music for the pool area. They played the same cd and the same few dance music songs the entire week. Beware of keeping your patio and windows open at night. Not only will the mosquitos get you but there are other animals such as raccoons that we witnessed the staff feeding. Because they're so used to getting hand outs as soon as they see you they run to you for food. Make sure you go for a long walk on the beach. If you head passed some other hotels there is a little stream/grotto which is PERFECT for snorkelling. The best a la carte restaurant was most definitely the Japanese restaurant. It was the most popular and you may have to wait a while to get in but it was definitely worth it! None of the other restaurants or the buffet ever had a wait to be seated. The gardens are immaculately kept! So beautiful with all the flowers and plants. The gardening staff do a wonderful job! Another thing that I appreciate was all the little extra things to do at the resort. They had a fellow daily who was doing henna tattoos. There were spa ladies who were willing to put corn rows into the young guests hair. Also there were some vendors along the pool with pretty Mexican souvenirs. A booth even with Mexican ceramics that they would let you paint for 10-25.00 usd depending on how elaborate the ceramic piece was. I don't think we'd bother staying at this resort again. There are just too many others out there that make the extra effort to ensure their guests are comfortable. And honestly the food which is a large part of the appeal of this resort was rather awful. Next time I will seriously consider staying right in Playa del Carmen in a hotel and eat along 5th avenue instead of in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Resort with beautiful grounds, but problems with mosquitos.”
Reviews.Author: whiteshell12
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb 13-20. Weather was awesome 27-29 C everyday. Check in was quick and efficient with a welcoming drink. Rooms were clean and updated. Showers take a long time to get hot water and the shower door leaks out onto the floor. Beds are a little too firm. Do not take a room in first 2 or 3 buildings close to disco bar in court yard because disco music can go on late. Had to ask for soap & coffee packs for room after 4 days (even when we tipped room cleaner everyday). Linens on bed are scratchy. No shortage of good pillows. No screens on sliding door to patio/garden area. Several mosquitos were coming in from the sheltered alcove area from the main door into the room whenever you entered or exited the room. Received numerous mosquito bites even after swatting them in room every evening. Very small mosquitos, but leave big welts. Buffet was good and always found the selection of fruits, pastrys and chicken appealing. Highly recommend Japanese a la carte. Go early and put your name on the list as there are "no reservations". Did not like Italian a la carte. Asparagus had a charred flavour and the beef was very salty (over tenderized?). Not nearly enough lounge chairs on beach. Reservation needed for loungers (put a towel or book or hat to reserve before 8:00 am) or you will not get a lounger when you want one. Many loungers were booked all day with little occupancy. Not nice. Pools are cold and not used too much. Beaches are kept very clean with lovely white sand. Grounds are kept immaculant with hard working grounds keepers. Staff are very friendly, helpful and polite. Tips are appreciated but not always expected. Plenty of weak mixed drink, lots of cervasa (beer), house white and red wines are not very appealing. Highly recommend the Spanish dancers and the Mayan show in the theater in the evening at 9:30 pm. Very nice shuttle service to Playa del Carmen. Pick up is 11:00 am and returns at 5:00 pm. Only holds 20-24 people (approx). You need to book the day before @ 8:00 am or take a taxi for around 15.00 US. Evening time in Playa del Carmen is amazing. Liked the size of the resort and not needing a shuttle to get around. Would not stay here again because I am still scratching mosquito bites and not enough lounge chairs for guests. The food selections were okay for 1 week only. Would probably try a different resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week - would recommed without hesitation!”
Reviews.Author: divajen
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from a few months back I was a bit nervous but having just returned (Feb 18) from an amazing week at Ocean Maya I can honestly say we'd go back in a heartbeat and wholeheartedly recommend it! My husband and I upgraded to the privilege package and were very happy we did so. Gave us the ability to make reservations at the a la carte restaurants (all three were fantastic), access to the roped off section of the beach with the Balinese beach beds, top shelf alcohol, a separate dining space in the buffet, etc. For the first two reasons alone it was worth the money (cost us $20 per person per day for our stay). The a la cartes don't accept reservations unless you have the privilege bracelet so go early and put your name on the list, especially when the resort is full. And if you want to reserve a lounge chair at the beach or pool you pretty much have to be down there with a towel before 8 am or else you won't get one for the entire day. The resort really could use more chairs. Since we were in the upgraded section we never had to worry about reserving a place as, during our stay, there was always room in the roped off area. And we never had to go down to reserve one of the eight beds - we were quite fortunate that anytime we wanted a bed one was available. The beach is small, yes, but the sand is beautiful and you can swim on either side of the boardwalk. The two pools are cold, so be prepared! We didn't swim as much as we usually would as a result, but they sure were refreshing! One thing I loved was that you could see the ocean from the pools - beautiful! The grounds were beautifully manicured and you could tell much attention was paid to keeping them this way. The staff were fantastic - you couldn't walk past a single person without them saying Hola with a big smile. We loved Alberto, a waiter we came across day after day who always greeted us warmly and remembered exactly what we liked. And the wonderful waitress from the privilege beach section - I only wish I could remember her name! - was wonderful. So sweet, always smiling and happy to help, and great for a quick Spanish lesson. Rooms were nicely done, recently upgraded. Shower space is delightfully big enough for two and the towels are nice and plush. Beds are a bit hard as people have mentioned but we slept like babies so we really can't complain. Great closets help you to unpack and store everything easily and we loved the various lighting options - I could read in bed while my husband slept. Mini bar fridge was always stocked with four different kinds of pop and bottled water and there was a coffee maker in the room too which was nice. It even offered a variety of plug shapes at different places in the room to allow for many international plugs to work just fine. One thing - this is not a party resort. It's small and intimate - max 700 guests I believe - and that was exactly what we were looking for. It allowed you to see your fellow guests repeatedly which meant we got to meet a whole bunch of fantastic people and really enjoy their company. If you want a nice, laid back holiday that still has great shows and a mini disco after, then this is the place for you. Traditionally by the end of a week long trip I'm ready to go home but this time - this time I could have stayed longer, that's for sure. I was very sad to go! We'll definitely consider returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Melarossa74
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often, been everywhere from thailand to australia, caribbean, states you name it... i always visit a place once and move on to the next destination. this is the first time i'm sayin:" i will definitely go back to this resort ". Everything was fantastic... Staff is super friendly ,especially the entertainment .. Jes, Omar, Ricardo and all the girls are unbelievable.. They are very attentive and try to involve you in lots of activities but also respect you if you just want to relax and read your book! I enjoyed the food..u have 4 choices of restaurants ( Buffet with lots of variety, Italian, Mexican and Japanese ) and u don't need a reservation in any of them.. i'd recommend trying all of them.. Rooms are nice,modern and very clean.. Only problem there isn't a proper door in the bathroom, so not much privacy there!! Not impressed with the beach very much... i've seen much better ( SARDINIA just to name one). The sand is soft and white but the water is not that clear.. You have 2 gorgeous big pools though and in one of them there are 4 jacuzzi beds.. amazing! You can book your tours or even rent a car there and explore this beautiful city on your own. Town is only 15 minutes away by car and you don't want to miss the night life there, trust me! If you want to go clubbing take the advise from the entertainment staff... they will go with you, make a reservation in the best spots and offer you, for 60 dollars, a table and an open bar.. definitely worth it if you planning to have even just more than 2 drinks! there's so much to say... in one word this is a TOP resort in every possible way.

Reviews.Title: “By far... My favorite resort!”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Girl11
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever taken the time to right a review, I read them but never write them. But I believe this resort deserves the credit of a great review. I have been to Mayan Riviera 3 times, stayed at two other 5 star resorts and neither resort came close to being as enjoyable. First the food, being a buffet as usual you're prepared for average food. However, the buffet was fantastic! A lot of variety and each dish had great flavor to it! Oh the pastries, my favorite! The Japanese a la carte was delicious! Ask for the chop chop table if you want to sit around the chef making the dishes. Thanks Cesar for getting us a table so quickly! The rooms are all decorated very modern and the huge glass showers are great! Just a couple of things to advise you of, the beds are quite firm, it took awhile to get used to. And the bathroom has a glass door that does not reach the ground or floor, separating the toilet and bedroom, privacy is minimal. The spa offered a nice package that included a facial, spa pedicure, and massage for only $180usd. The nice thing was that you could spread out your treatments throughout your entire stay. So one day you can have the facial then next day the massage and so on. I recommend Jorge if you choose a massage... He's got magic hands! And finally the staff. All the staff were great at doing their job, especially the entertainment staff. Thanks to Jes and Omar for making water aerobics fun... Especially the massages after! Susanna for playing cards on a rainy day... And let's not forget the dance lessons that had me feeling like a pro after. And thanks to Ricardo for keeping us smiling and laughing, and being a good reason why Ocean Maya is the best resort and my favorite trip ever! I'm missing Ocean Maya so much and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Averybrooks
Reviews.Content: Other than seeming short staffed the odd time, it was really great. Didn't like the no reservations for the ala carte's but the great people working there made up for it. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: pasmith44
Reviews.Content: After reading many mixed reviews about this hotel I was worried, however it was an overall nice place. This is a quiet relaxing hotel not a party hotel, the free shuttle to the town was very nice (you must put you name on the list to go there as it has limited seating) if you wanted to leave town early you could get a taxi back for relatively cheap. The people who ran the shuttle were very nice, all the staff was friendly and helpful. The most helpful was the man at the desk to book trips Angle. Tipping the staff helps with the service even just a dollar; the food was just average buffet food. The Italian restaurant on the beach was nice and had fairly good food. We did the massage at the spa inside it was very nice worth the money. The grounds were nice as well as the pools, and the beach. I would say give it a try it was a nice place if you are looking for relaxing and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wayneandgrace
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at five other hotels in the Mayan Riviera all rated 4 to 4 1/2 and this hotel is one of the best so far. Beautifully manicured grounds, the rooms are very nice. The hotel is not too big so it is not crowded. Before we went we looked at the reviews to get an idea of this resort. Take most of the negative reviews with a grain of salt. This place is fabulous. The little glitches are nothing that any hotel would not have. And they were nothing that would deter from a great stay. If your only concern is a beach and nothing else, this is not the place for you. There is a cement wall at the water line 2/3 of the way in front of the resort and they have built up the sand level with the wall with a nice boardwalk. This makes for a nice level beach, but you don't have a big area to swim in front. Saying that my wife loves her beach and waves and we just went up the beach either way to swim. This did not deter her from having a great time. The food here is awesome. There is something for everyone. From the person who loves fast food to the health nut. They have a juice bar at the beach restaurant that makes fruit and vegetable smoothies. My wife eats healthy so she liked that. For someone to complain about the variety of food and the flavour, they must eat caviar for breakfast!! Drinks were very good. Don't see how anyone can say they were watered down. They had Captian Morgan and Whisky just like at home and they were generous with it. Bottom line, beautiful resort and you will not be disappointed. Thanks for a wonderful stay Maria. The romantic lobster dinner on the beach was fantastic!!!! Wayne Robertson. Mission B.C. Jan 28/ Feb 4 2011

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation for your buck”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMarc27
Reviews.Content: Catered to extremely well. Great staff! Best I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya – Best Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rena63
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one-week vacation at Ocean Maya Royale, Playa del Carmen (from Jan 29 to Feb 5), and I was very impressed! I’ve vacationed many times in Mexico, Cuba, Dominican Republic and this hotel is the best place I’ve ever stayed. Friendliest staff, most talented Entertainment Team, very clean and well-maintained resort, great food, and a gorgeous beach! What more can you ask for! The smaller buildings are more esthetically pleasing than a multi-floor large hotel. I stayed in a Deluxe room, number 2402 – large suite-like room, king-size bed, newly renovated – wonderful! The buffet, La Hacienda, was terrific, especially it’s little extras, like champagne and orange juice at breakfast each morning and little chocolate treats each night at dinner. I loved all three of the a la carte restaurants. The tiramisu dessert at La Dolce Vita is absolutely fantastic, and don’t miss the Mexican coffee after dessert at El Charro – Jorge is a true artist! Muchas gracias, Jorge! And last but certainly not least, the most talented Entertainment staff ever assembled –Animation Team Ocean Maya – well-trained and led by Miguel, Sports & Entertainment Manager! This team is fun, friendly, genuine, and from all over the world. Omar, Jes and Ricardo are pros with sports and the other pool activities. The shows are the best you will see at any all-inclusive resort, especially the fantastic dancing, the circus-act Hoops and the Silks starring Jorge and Jes, the Hollywood Show starring Oliver from Paris, France (unbelievable!), and the very powerful and wonderfully artistic Mayan Show – all demonstrating the strength, artistry and talent of these individuals. And don’t miss the trip to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen with the Animation Staff – they are at your service and they really take care of you. Thanks to Omar for bringing me my drinks, and thanks again to Jes and Miguel (DJ) for taking me back to the hotel. And a special thanks to Omar for eating lunch with me, giving me Spanish lessons (no te miento), and dancing with me (te extranare – I will miss you). “Ice creaM!” Muchas gracias, Omar!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Sun, Food & Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: TimKo1
Reviews.Content: Way better than expected. 12 of us traveled down Jan 28th until Feb 4th from Vancouver ,BC area.Can't understand why some people posted negative??Food was great, lots and lots of choices for alcohol even with a white band.Little waits at the bars. Had no problem getting into the restaurants. Japanese one was good and so was the Mexican.The entertainment staff were amazing. Laurena was amazing, treating us like family. Ricardo was hillareous.Even got to meet some of the management (Maria Lopez)She made herself quite available and made sure everything was going good.Felt like we meant something. We tried one of the mega resorts a few years back( Grand Palladium) did not get that personal feeling /attention that we felt at the Ocean Maya. Was our stay totally perfect? I can live with a super firm mattress no big deal. We plan to come back again if they can still handle a dozen crazy Canadians .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely relaxing. Just what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: tlmeyer
Reviews.Content: We were here from 1/21 - 1/28. Friday to Friday is the way to go. When you get back you have the weekend to get settled back in. My wife & I traveled here with another couple. We all wanted a relaxing, no thinking vacation right on the beach. We wanted good food, good drinks and good service. We got all 3. I would be remiss if I do not mention the hard working, polite & fun people working here that made our stay pleasurable. We spent most of our time at the poolside bar with David & Edwin. These guys work hard and still smile and have fun. They put in long days. In the lobby bar was Iggy or as we called him, Dr. Nacho with the medicine. He was always in good spirits as well. The restaurants were managed well by Ulysses. Alberto and Kenny are an excellent waiters. Wonderful people, all of them. Here's the specifics. Food - There is 4 restaurants. We ate at all of them. None of us ever had Japanese so we tried it. Not for us. We heard lots of good things about it but it just isn't for us. It's probably the smallest restaurant. The other 3 restaurants were very good, especially the Italian restaurant, wow! That was quite a surprise. Top notch food & presentation. The only improvement they can do here is move the restaurant up to the main complex away from the beach area where there is a man made bern of sorts to protect the shore. For some reason it creates a foul smell and we would catch it ever so often. This resort is going to go adults only this spring and that building would be a perfect place to transform into a band / dance place. The breakfast buffet had a large variety eveyday and was excellent. The buffet that was open all day for munching also had a fair amount of variety and very good. Room Service - We called room service one night. We couldn't locate a menu in our room so we just asked what was available. The person didn't tell us much that was available so we just asked about certain things we were hungry for that we thought made sense that they would have, burger, fries, hot dog... Yes! we have those. It took 45 minutes but that was ok. It was good when it got there. Entertainment - I think they have shows every night but we only made it to 2 of them. Both of them were very good. Beach - Earlier reviews weren't high on the beach, but we found it very nice and worked well for us. They built a boardwalk on most of their beach. I suspect it's to protect their beach from storms. They had a small beach area next to that, that we went to everyday. Our routine was get up early, go claim our 4 chairs & go for a nice long walk on the beach. We'd come back, go for breakfast & head out to our palapa and chairs for the day. We'd read and relax. Around noonish it was cocktail time. We would continue relaxing, reading, drinking and people watching. We maight go for a nap or another walk & then grab an afternoon snack. Later we would shower up & go get supper & maybe a show. Do it all over again the next day. Rooms - We had a 2nd level room and our friends had a ground floor room in the next building over. We couldn't get in the same building but that was ok. We both had "Ocean View" rooms. Technically we could see the ocean but it's not what some people might think as "ocean side". But that was ok with us. The rooms are large enuf and very nice. We had a king bed. We've been to many different places in Mexico and know to expect the beds to be hard. Nice flat screen. Very small frig. They would stock it daily with only 2 beers until I found the guy stocking and asked him to put as many as he could in there each day & then he did 4. I had read in earlier info on the resort that they stocked a bottle of tequilla in the rooms but they must've changed that cuz that wasn't the case, but no biggy. Our door lock stopped working so we had to get maintenance down to replace it. They came pronto and repaired it. We got room service each day. They don't do the folded towel animals here but we didn't mind. They don't always replenish everything so we would ask for things if needed and they kindly obliged. Trip to PDC - One day we took a taxi rde into PDC & spent the day there. That was nice but it was good to return to the resort and relax again. Grounds - The whole resort is well maintained and beautiful. They are constantly work ing on it. We admired the grounds wherever we went. Pools - Unfortunately the weather was unseasonably cold, cloudy & breezy when we were there. The pool isn't heated. I got in it once just to say we got in it. I sat in one of the 4 built in lounge chairs with jets in them. They would be nice on a hot day. The pools were very clean. Massage - We originally wanted to get an hour massage but we found the price higher than back home so we passed. Bracelet - There were 3 different bracelets, white, green and a black/yellow. The black/yellow was the 'privaleged' level that allowed you access to queen size lounge beds with canopies and waitresses. I think it also got you right in to the restaurants with no waiting but not positive. We had green bracelets which I'm told is above white. I asked someone what the green got us over the white and they just said special treatment. We could never tell a difference from white ot green. The only restaurant issue was when we tried to go to the Japanese place, there was a line & I dunno if we could've got right in or not cuz we decided to go the next night instead. Drinks - I don't drink beer so I had many different types of drinks that were all very good, some better than others & some we made up. David & Edwin were pretty creative. That was fun. Beer at most all-inclusives is usually keg beer and in plastic glasses. My wife and other couple were ok with it but would prefer much colder beer in cans. No complaints tho. They seem to go down just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Armenian4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Ocean Maya. Was so nervous after reading some reviews. The only complaint we have is that we cannot return because we travel with children. Adults only hotel starting in March. Everyone of the staff was excellent. Food was fine, plenty to choose from but have to agree the Japanese Restaurant was the best. We never had difficulties getting into any of the Restaurants. The grounds and surroundings are perfect. Cannot say enough great things. Nothing was a dissapointment....wish we could return!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya - great value”
Reviews.Author: oshawaa
Reviews.Content: Just home from a very nice trip to the Ocean Maya Resort. I was traveling with a friend and on the whole the trip was well worth repeating. I would go again, and I would recommend the resort to guests that enjoy the day but are not looking for a lot of nite life or individual attention. Every place has its good points and its bad. Checking in was a disaster, but after that things were relatively smooth. Ended up with a very nice room/ bathroom - absolutely no complaints. Pool bar service was extremely slow........The hotel could really help themselves out, by having extra staff there. It seemed to be a main complaint by most of the guests we met. Comparing the service to other resorts, it did not as well. .It wasnt the fun spot that other resorts have....On the other hand, it was not noisy - just very relaxing...... The animation/show staff were wonderful. Their shows were the best I have seen when compared to other resorts. The dancers, the Hoops and the Silks ,,,,,,WOW,,,,beyond amazing. .....Total 10 there....The Mayan show - very powerful.. - another 10.. I missed Grease, but heard it was really good and really fun. The animation staff were a super big plus for the resort.......They work so hard and it shows. Day time, nite time, meal time - great involvement. Lots to do, lots to see, and lots of fun to participate in. The food - well it could be better.....There was adequent amounts, but nothing that you could say was delicious except for the breads and the chocolate. I would not recommend the resort for its food, but it was pretty typical of 3/12 to 4 star... You wont go hungry. The Italian was the best of the 3 al la carts...........the spinach soup was really nice and the chicken dish and the beef dish were really good. Have to admit though.....seeing racoons coming into the dining area.......was just a big big NO...Screening needs to be placed so the little critters stay away....Some people however thought it was really neat, and were taking lots of pictures....The Mexican restaurant has fabulous "special Mexican coffee". It is a show in itself to see if prepared and then it is a real treat. The grounds at the Ocean Maya are really beautiful. Everything is so perfectly manicured, so pretty, so relaxing. One of the prettiest resorts I have ever been in. It felt very tropical - more then a 10 plus rating there. The rooms are nice - recently undergone renovations, so they are bright and nice. I liked the smaller buildings way better then a large hotel type resort....It was always a beautiful walk to get back to you room no matter where you stayed. The pools are really big and really nice. - from the pools you see the beach - not something you get to see very often - really wonderful views.......not enough cots, but if you get there real early in the morning (before breakfast) you can put your towel on a cot to safe them. The beach area is really nice, beautiful white soft sand. You can walk for miles to the right......and to the left you can walk about 10 minutes to the lagoon areas for a nice swim.....nice to see.... The resort is about 20 minutes to Playa del Carmen....a 14 dollar taxi ride (US),,,You can ask at the front desk for a taxi to be called. Max 4 to a taxi. Go in the evening - its real pretty and lots of places to have a good meal. Very touristy......busy, but really interesting to walk around..... I dont know how long 5th Ave is, but it must be a few miles of shops. Again, back to the 9:30 nitely shows.....The only nite, we really didnt like was the so called romance nite.............old cheesy music, focasing in on couples..........not a lot of involvement by the guests. The staff worked really hard to make the evening enjoyable, but it just didnt cut the cake......... Too many slow songs and couple type music. One nite there was a really fun dance hour or two - much more fun and laughter, and I am sure that most guests would prefer that over the romance nite. Fun nites are what is remembered..... If you are looking for a clean, well kept pretty resort, with pools right on the beach, decent nite shows - this is the place to be. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Geoge60763
Reviews.Content: We booked a Continental Airlines Vacation package at Ocean Maya, with travel to and from NYC and 5 nights, only $1750. Great price. The resort is very nice. It's not the hippest resort perhaps, but it is very beautiful, pristine in terms of the grounds and cleanliness of all buildings. Friendliest service I have ever experienced, both poolside, boat house, and throughout the restaurants. Food is good. Offers quality choices, lots of choices, especially at the Hacienda restaurant, the main building which has the large buffet room. Lots of healthy choices, fresh fruit, vegetables, and endless unhealthy as well. Very much a tourist spot, half Americans and Canadians, another half a mix of Europeans and Mexicans. All very happy and friendly as well. What's not to like, everyone has a drink in their hands! The two large pools are beautiful and the best thing about the resort is the beach. There are lots of umbrellas and chairs, get out there early to stake your ground, but offers more than most resorts in terms of beach area and sunning spots! We took a Hobie Cat sail boat out most days, no charge. I would suggest you spend a little extra for a "ocean view" room. We really liked this! Nice resort, ten minute taxi ride to Playa del Carmen, great staff, excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: guitarman1811
Reviews.Content: Everything was quite good. The food was average, not great but we've all had worse. My biggest gripe was the lack of availability of coffee. Between 6-7 AM there were a few carafes available for the guests. When the carafes were emptied, you had to wait until the dining room opened. During lunch hours, there was no coffee in the dining room and you had to walk to the lobby to get coffee. Has anyone heard of coffee urns? If you're a coffee drinker like me, either make sure the coffee maker in the room is working or invest in a supply of Starbucks VIA.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and OK location”
Reviews.Author: Darcy1029
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Mexico on Jan. 29. Had a great time. The staff were very friendly and food was plentiful and good. NO COMPLAINTS. Entertaintment was poor. The first day we arrived we had NO airconditioning so we couldn't sleep, so we closed down the bar, went to the front desk the next morning and they were going to move us to another resort, but we didn't want to change so they did give us another room and thank god this one had air. One complaint was there is not enough lounge chairs around the pool area, if you weren't down there by 6:45am to reserve chairs you didn't get one so I caught on to that pretty quick. Over all the resort was very well kept and staff was very friendly, I would recommend this resort to anyone, but if you plan on doing tours I would recommend staying on the other side of Playa as the tours are a distance away from the Ocean Maya Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip So Far”
Reviews.Author: dwiniarz
Reviews.Content: All I got to say it was one of the best trips I have taken, been to cuba and acapulco mexico and this place definetly the best so far. My Girlfriend has also been to dominican and she agrees with me. Very clean and well taken care of. Very Modern. Only complaint is not much night life and the beach chairs were hard to come by but we managed to get them every day. Food was awsome. My girlfriend is really bad with some food places even in Canada but had no issue at all here, we went to all the restaurnts and the buffet's and there were no issues, she ate everything. Room service was also great orderd at 2am in the morning and it was fresh and hot. Staff is so friendley and they dont bag for tips, they are always walking around and asking if you want a drink and letting you know what is going on durring the day, Pool arobics, poker, yoga etc... I would recommend this resort to everyone that is visiting Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* resort”
Reviews.Author: scoutpro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of January and found this hotel very beautiful!. The rooms are quite modern and very roomy. The food was good but, the la-carte's are impossible to get in to unless you were wiling to wait untill 8 or 9:00 to eat. This hotel advertises that you do not need to make a resevation but, what that really means is that you can't make a reservation and even if you line up an hour before the restaraunt opens you still probably wont get in. It was disapointing to get all dressed up for dinner and then have to eat at the buffet. The staff were great and the resort itself was very nice, but i probably will not return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best trip that we had !”
Reviews.Author: tsarappa
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed a great relaxing week, Maria and her staff insured that our stay was most pleasent.The Sarappa family was treatad with the prestige service. All the resturants and buffet had more than we expected and the food well,excellant. A supper clean resort,friendly and very helpful. For the beach I would rate ; 7 on 10 but very enjoyable, we were able to take very long walks on the beach with no problem what so ever. This would surely be one resort that we recommend highly,and surely to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 5 star resort, but if you get a good price and just want to enjoy the weather it is fine”
Reviews.Author: Saltydogcafe
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from week 2 weeks in Mexico. First week was at Hacienda Tres Rios-very nice resort. Second week was at Ocean Maya. It is located about 5 miles north of Playa del Carmen. It is tiered resort-that is there seem to be several levels of services offered to guests depending on what you pay. We bought this on auction for $40 per night so we got the basics. We had friends who had booked in several days earlier who warned us not to accept the main building as the air conditioning does not work. Of course they tried to put us ther but my wife was quick to say no. We got a very nice king room-it had been refurbished and had all conveniences including flat screen tv. It had a garden view, but that was fine as this resort only has a handful of oceanfront units. Food was fine. Not what you would expect based on the fact resort calls itself 5 star, but I cannot say I had an unpleasant meal. There was no lobster or fine quisine one would expect for this rating. We were advised the resort was 100% full, but they did not have sufficient staff at times to handle. On one occasion there was only one bartender handling both the pool bar and swim up bar. As well as basic guests we did not get premium liquor and were not allowed to make reservations at the restaurants. I will say the Japanese restaurant was excellent-tepanyaki table was great fun and our chef was very entertaining. I would also say food portions were larger than most Mexican resorts we have stayed at and I felt guilty that we could never eat all that was provided. They did a great job getting people involved in activities and the evening entertainment was pretty good. One nice thing was the Mikes coffee shop which did premium coffees and sandwichs. Beach is not the best, as it got hammered by the last hurricane and never came back to what it once was. They had hobie cats, windsurfers and kayaks all free of charge. One complaint that I heard from a lot of people, was that there were not nearly enough lounge chairs. You had to get up and place a towel before 7am to reserve one. My wife and I are early risers so not a problem for us but we also sat in the chairs shortly afterwards. It was disappointing to see so many people reserve chairs and then go back to bed and not show up until noon. I suggested to several guest to go ahead take reserved chairs as I had been there several hours and never saw anyone in them. I recommended the resort restrict the reserving of chairs for an unreasonable length of time. Many other resorts forbid this-if you ain't sitting in it, it's fair game. Had ok time but with so many other resorts in the area, I would not hurry back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYChristine1
Reviews.Content: I wish my own staff was as high-performing and motivated as everyone we met at Ocean Maya...and great eye candy, too! (JES - YUM!) I have never been to an all-inclusive and had no expectations going into it, and I did enjoy my time there. 5 days was enough, though...a bit overloaded with middle American mediocrity (smokers, drinkers, tanners - hello, skin cancer?) ...but if you feeling like doing your own thing, you'll be just fine. Buffet food was plentiful and good, but lukewarm...and restaurants were fun and yummy. Just go. Bring lots of ones to tip the hard working staff. A buck or two goes a long way. It's not necessary, but appreciated, so why not?

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: janno11
Reviews.Content: We read many of the reviews here before booking our holiday at the Ocean Maya. The hotel was not a disappointment in any regard. The gardens really are beautiful, well maintained....I enjoyed the lay out of the grounds, meandering pathways (never crowded) to the lobby and beach. The buffet offered so many different choices that I can't imagine anyone not finding something to suit their tastes.....you can choose the 'americanized' choices or feast on grilled fish (prawns/whitefish) steak to order. Good selection for fruits, vegetables, salad....cheeses, smoked salmon, proscuitto.....keep in mind, that there are those guests who only want to eat hamburgers and those that insist that their food be 'drizzled' artfully with exotic garnishes......you truly can have both. Reservations are not required for the 3 al a carte restaurants....you just need to plan on not being seated straight away at peak times. El Charro (beachfront) is open during the day for snacks and quick lunches....I would recommend the stroll up to the buffet for a more varied selection. Dolce Vita (Italian al a carte) is nice but don't go there hungry. El Charro is open evenings with a more traditional Mexican menu. Pay attention to the handout they give you when you check in.....it describes the evening dining options. Mexican night at the buffet (El Charro is not open)....Italian night at the buffet (Dolce Vita is not open)....same for Japanese. I love to swim and the ocean was lovely....the beach is small but you can walk for miles south and enjoy long stretches if you want. Evening strolls on the boardwalk and beach were absolutely gorgeous (full moon).....mostly deserted....Pools were clean and overlook the ocean, aquafit at noon is fun and lots of people join in. My ONLY complaint is that there is an early morning rush to 'reserve' beach loungers.....if you want a lounger, you must get down to the beach EARLY to mark your spot......Prime spots are GONE by 7am.....I am serious!! This is contrary to what I think guests should have to do.....the hotel simply needs to buy MORE beach chairs. Every guest should have the opportunity to relax comfortably. Our room was exactly as shown in the photos. Hot water at all times...attentive housekeeping (please show respect by leaving a gratuity) for the maid. In fact, the staff were all very deserving of a small token on a daily basis....yet, we seldom saw anyone tip the staff. We saw older couples, young families, gorgeous young men and women....a bit of variety. The entertainment staff was fun but if you like to party and have lots of nightlife, this might not be your first choice. For those who are knocking this hotel.....I just ask them to remember what they paid....it might have been a tip off. The Ocean Maya provides excellent value for the money....beyond what we had prepared ourselves for. We had a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Entertianment Staff Made the Difference”
Reviews.Author: Pinkydawn
Reviews.Content: There was more staff that made our trip enjoyable then there was bad. Having worked in the hospitality and a major hotel chain there was a few cases where I felt the staff could have been more enpowered to ensure our comfort. There was not enough chairs on the beach and yet the "Privelege chairs sat empty, use them. A la Carte resturant not able to eat at empty chop table until after 8, when the "Privelege" where done, but was also unable to let us put our names down so we can return at 8 for a dinner & a show. I also came down with Montazuma, from on property, and had been out of sorts last day and all night before we left, as we left at 7pm that night I asked for a late check no charge and was denied, unable to enjoy last 2 days of 7, and was in room, I was very upset. Very uncomfortable. Only one in group that was sick. All Entertainment staff, and Alberto,Gilberto,Ebner,Johny where GREAT!! Lots of laughs!! Mexican resturant also great service and great staff. All food was ok to good, not great. But we still ate lots.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: DblDs
Reviews.Content: We all thought resort grounds & architecture was very beautiful. Just finishing up a $10 million upgrade? Where? I didn't notice anything "new" except some of the buildings had a new paint job. Or was the $$ for rebuilding the beach? hugh hugh hugh sandbags were used to build up and protect what is there for beach area - kinda weird to be walking in the water (out about 10-12' to feel the crevis of a sand bag - weird - We are not the "hard to please" type of vacationers, however cold buffet food every day was disapointing (sp?) Breakfast eggs cold maybe luke warm, sausage cold - fresh pasteries & desserts - wow I didn't know there were 1000 ways to make jello. plus most of the cake type deserts tasted the same - which was bland. What I thought was flan, tasted like the everything else. Lunch / dinner not any better - we waited in line 1 1/2 hrs to get into the Japanese place - (5 of us total) they have 4 tables that hold 8 people for the "cook show" however only 1 table of 8 is allowed for the white wrist band persons, the time we were in the restaurant, I don't think all of the tables were filled up at any one time - just a shame to advertise something or wait for something only to be disapointed (again) Oh, and everything I tasted was cold, no kidding, and this was food we ordered off the 'menu' . Of course the weather didn't help lift our spirits as it was rainy, windy and chilly - better food and drinks probably would have eleivated some of the weather disappointment - but that didn't happen. I even brought booze from home and was going to the bar just for coke, and poured in my own --which I would have brought more of my own. There was an incedent one nite - (not going into details) and we asked for a different room - the following day (10 am) - so, @ 3 pm we got to move to the new room - and it was horrible, really - the musty smell was the worse, the patio had a little ant festival going on - so we couldn't keep the door open and air out the room, and to top it off one bed had wet linens through to the matteress under the 'top sheet'! how disturbing....... They had all day to find us a room - and this is what was given to us - we asked for housekeeping to come to the room, but after 1-2 hrs no one never came - so, we went to the lobby looking for someone in charge - so then again, later that evening - we were moved to a different room, and go figure - it was a room right up the stairs from where we had been to begin with -- omg -- hauling your luggage midway into a vacation - not enjoyable but to move from one villa to the next AND then back again! OMG. I do want to mention that they did 'comp' us each a 30 min. message, thanks to our tour guy who "speaking in spanish to the supervisor on duty" got us the massage, and it was nice (my 1st one ever),Though without him, a crappy bottle of champagne was suppose to aide in our grief, frustration, anxiety etc. I am only stating what we experienced -- and this is getting quite lenghty, but we were not the only ones who shared our experiences, as we got chummy with other vacationers who felt the same way about the food, bars and the resort grounds (which are beautiful) --The bars are understaffed - especially the pool bar - the 2 days it was nice enough to get into the pool there was 1 guy, yep 1 guy handling the pool bar part and the regular bar, plus making the drinks for the 2 waitresses they had getting drinks around the rest of the pool area and beach - yeap 1 guy - unbelievable (sp?) I can honestly say the only nite of 7 that i felt a little tipsy was our first nite - and the few beers we had on the bus before we were dropped off.. helped. we did like the Coffee Shop - that nite. On our last nite (Monday) I had 4, 'suprise me' drinks - told the bartender to make what ever he wanted these were in the blender, I can say they had fruity flavor, but no effect of alcohol - the drinks even started to separate before I could drink them that's pretty sad. I think this is my 1st vacation in over 10 years of travel to 3 different parts of Mexico, 2 different islands, and a cruise, that I never had a hangover at least one day -- rain or shine - I mean isn't that the reason you go all inclusive, eat drink be merry anytime you want? So, hope this is helpful to those who read reports - before they book their vacations. Be prepared for 2nd rate service if you're not wearing the black bands. I could go on - but I think I made my point. Not sure where the next vacation will be - as everywhere is becoming so developed - tourestie - such a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: nsold2003
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the Ocean Maya Royale Resort this January 2011 was for us like a family visit. The resort is managed by a talented team of Manager Giovanni Gil and his Assistant Manager beautiful Miss Maria Lopez. Miss Maria knows several languages and guest see her all over the resort: at the reception desk overlooking the registration of new arrivals, at the restaurant checking work performance and quality of food, she walks among people, talking to them, asking if there is anything they want improved or if there is any assistance the hotel can provide. You can see her in the coffee shop, the bar or at the swimming pools. Her smile and friendliness to guests and workers makes every one’s day better in addition to the almost daily Mexican sunny weather. But it is hard work to keep guests happy. Take into consideration all buildings, gardens with coconut and other trees, flowers and bushes, daily performances at theater, music, and repairs. The rooms at the resort are clean and well lighted. There are in-room safes, refrigerators that are daily stocked with beer and other drinks, TV and nice balconies. The food at restaurants is great and plentiful. At the main restaurant there is a great Chef, inventive with her surprises. You never know what she will offer in addition to the great food selection, what sweets or drinks… This lady chef is miracle maker and guests look forward for her next creation! In comparison with many other places where we have been before, we give to Ocean Maya an A++ grade and a recommendation to go there where not only management but all resort employees all the time greet people with smiles and best wishes and experience for themselves the happy time. Great job by Gil and Maria keeping everyone happy! Minneapolis MN, Jan.2011-20 George and Nancy Soldatow

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely atmosphere, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: organizer42
