Reviews.Content: Stayed January 9-16, 2010. Definitely a 4.5 star resort. Great food, awesome service, friendly staff, one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. I mean, who gets a flat screen tv in Mexico? We also got great beverage service by the pool, and on the beach. Not only that, they pour heavy at this resort, which was fun! Entertainment was top-notch. Outdoor patio was beautiful at night, lots of floating lights in the infinity pool. Lots of fun pool activities too. Only a 15 minute bus ride from Playa del Carmen. Bar service was supposed to be 24/7 but we tried twice to get drinks quite late at night (once was at 3:30 am when we returned from CocoBongo) but the bar was closed (probably a good thing). The reviews indicate couples and singles like this hotel. Even though we travelled single, and met several single groups at this hotel, in my opinion it is more of a couples resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food, Rooms, Facility and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ally2011
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was modern and clean, nice flat screen TV. It was only about 7KM from Playa del Carmen where there was lots of good shopping on 5th avenue. Veronica's on 5th Avenue is a great place for a relaxing massage, good prices too, only $60 for a one hour massage couples massage (less than half price back home!). Great food at the Japanese Restaurant, we ate there 3 nights in a row! Even though we didn't have the black bracelets, we still got into the restaurant without reservations. Someone on here complained about the 'sewer' smell. I noticed it once buy only very briefly, it wasn't bad enough to complain. The beach was okay, a little bit of seaweed but the staff work hard to rake it up. Some important advice, if you are going on any tours, I recommend booking them through the hotel travel guides or top, reputable tour companies. Don't book through any of the booths on 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen. They may be cheaper than what the people at the hotel offer but you get what you pay for. You may or may not get the tour you want and they will lie to you about everything, they can't be trusted. We got scammed and learned our lesson. Overall the Ocean Maya was a great hotel, I don't know why some people write bad reviews. I think some people just like to complain.

Reviews.Title: “SEWER”
Reviews.Author: alison154954
Reviews.Content: The stench of sewer was very bad. We had to change rooms becauseof the odor.The H10 Hotel line must of cut the staff as the service was slow and almost non existant at some times of the day. The black & orange banded people got top priority while the white bands came in third place. We paid good money for the trip and expected more. Oh, the ocean stunk of sewer also. We do not recommend this resort and it certainly has the wrong star rating.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: chungo12
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 1.30 am. there was 6 of us traveling together, and about 12 people checking in at the same time. check in was fairly quick. They managed to get us 3 rooms together in the same villa and also upgraded us to ocean view. This was great because it was a very short walk to the pool, the ocean and the bar. The room was great, I found the bed comfortable although the pillows were a little to high. There was a great walk in shower and always had hot water. There is no tub if you prefer it to a shower. The food was good, always a good variety at the buffets, however not always hot. The chicken was always tasty however it was cooked. The staff always very friendly and out going, especially my 2 favorite bartenders Gilberto who is so funny and also speaks italian, and Igi who works in the lobby bar and makes the best cappuccino w/ baileys. We had white bands so we could not make reservations for dinner and had to wait to get in so we did eat pretty late those nights, but we did manage to try all 3 restaurants. We took a taxi van to Playa del Carmen which was great we paid 300 peso's for the 6 of us and we had no trouble finding one to go back with. we had 1 rainy day and they had umbrella's in our closet to walk around with which was nice. All in all this place was a nice place to stay, you have to remember you are in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya - Had a great relaxing time!”
Reviews.Author: GinGer123_11
Reviews.Content: We checked into our hotel on New Year's Eve just in time for grilled lobster and turkey dinner. What more could you ask for? The Hacienda (buffet) always had a good variety of food and staff were personable and accomodating. The three a la carte restaurants were excellent and it's nice not to make dinner reservations. The Japanese restaurant was fun, as we got to sit around the grill with other guest. The Mexican restaurant was equally delicious. The Italian restaurant, located on the beach, had the most amazing ambience and the food was wonderful, too. Most days we headed to the beach mid to late morning and always found a lounge chair and a palapas to sit under. My husband had his afternoon siesta in the nearby hammocks! The coffee bar was awesome, nothing like a great latte and a shot of baileys to end the perfect sunny day. We also enjoyed the courtyard and lobby area each evening sipping cocktails and chatting with other guests. We did a tour to Tulum and Xel Ha, which was lots of fun. We also took advantage of the free daily shuttle into Playa, the driver, Pepe, and the guide, Giovanni, were fantastic and knowledgeable. We enjoyed an afternoon at the spa, don't forget to ask for a 2 for 1 massage coupon. Playa had much cheaper massages. Our only complaint ... the beds were too hard and the pillows were the size of small children, truly! We'd certainly recommend this hotel to friends and would, at our first opportunity, head back to this area.

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort that made you feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: sunnyshilo
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter down for a break during the Christmas holiday. It was her first vacation package South and she was extremely amazed at what we got, especially considering the steal we bought the week for. The van ride from the airport was typical, and late at night. It had the traditional multi stops at other hotels along the way. Check in was fast, and while there was a problem with our first room (only one bed) they quickly remedied it with another room almost at the ocean. We booked with Nolitours, and it turned out we got the black wristbands as part of our package...that was a nice surprise. The biggest advantage that we could see from it was that we were able to book our a-la-cartes where I believe the white bands had to go on standby, and ended up with the 9pm dinner bookings. The room was nicely laid out, the fridge was filled daily with water, beer etc, and the one night we called for snacks to be brought to the room, they were very good, and included another good selection of drinks. The beds were a little on the hard side, and the A/C was a bit temperamental at first, until we figured out that it must have frozen up from continual use. We left it off for an hour, and it worked great for the rest of the week. One of the things I was most pleased about was that they did not charge for the safe lock. Seems like most hotels nickle and dime you for something like that. I went to the front lobby with cash on hand, and the fellow just gave me one. He didn't even ask for my room number. I am picky on food, and was very pleased with everything that was presented. I put on 5 pounds over the week. The Christmas dinner they put on was quite nice, and the night before they had local children in to sing carols and gave us champagne in the main lobby. The Japanese restaurant was the highlight of the dining there. I would not hesitate to pay for the same thing here. There were a family of racoons which would show up on the grounds each night. They were very entertaining and would eat out of your hand. My daughter went for a one hour spa treatment and loved it. She has had some of these back in Canada, and felt this was just about the best one she has had, and well worth the money. A few negatives that I can give, and I feel guilty for doing so because overall we loved the Ocean Maya: 1- Although the beach was great, once you went into the water, not so much. There were a lot of accumulations of debris and silt under the water. I guess we wandered into one of them and I got stung a couple of times on the legs by something. 2- The shuttle bus to town was kind of a token thing only. It was too hard to get onto, with only room for 10 couples a day. It would be a big improvement to have this running for most of the day, rather than just once. Otherwise, it would run you about $14 each way to go to town and back by taxi 3- The entertainment often consisted of Karaoke. Unfortunately, they only had the very large screen on the stage, and only one microphone. As a result, the person performing would have to turn their backs to the audience, and if there were more than one person trying to sing the song, you would only hear the one. A smaller screen set up between the person singing and the audience, along with multiple mikes, would go a long way to making this better. Half the fun of Karaoke is seeing the earnest faces on some of the lessor singers. I would not hesitate to go back to Ocean Maya, and would say that it was one of the best trips South that I have been on yet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Cherrypits
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort Dec 17,10 to Dec 24,10. Overall I would say it was a great hotel for what we paid ...$890 pp. from Toronto. We knew booking this resort that the ocean area wasn't the best but we were pleasantly surprised when we found the lagoon (10 minute walk away) and the distant we could walk the beach going the other way. The food was fine...no sickness and we alway found something to eat that was enjoyable...my girls are pretty picky eaters. The japanese a la carte was our favorite...the appetizers were delicious and the deep fried ice cream was good...although the main dishes were made with tons of soya sauce..very salty, so next visit we all made sure to order plain rice with our meal. We never were able to get reservations even though we had black bracelets but never had a problem walking up and being seated within a few minutes. We had one of the best rooms on the resort...closest to the ocean and woke up every morning to a beautiful sunrise. Rooms were always clean and mini bar stocked. The pool was very cold and never went in it much until the end of the week. It is not heated so it never gets warm enough with the cool nights. Only went to one night of entertainment. It was Grease night. It was basically lound music with the entertainment group dancing and mouthing the words, although the girls in the group didn't know all the words in the songs so they were totally off.....All the employees were very friendly and could never walk by one wtihout a Hola... I would recommend this resort as long as you get it for a good price and aren't looking for a 5 star resort. Edventure tours: We booked this tour group before our trip. Had a great time. Highly recomment this company for snorkeling and touring Coba.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: SamSpice
Reviews.Content: What I loved most about this hotel was its size: not too big and not too small, the villa style of the room units gave you intimacy yet connection to the larger picture. All the staff were wonderful as well. The biggest downsize was the beach, or lack there of. Although this didn't matter to us per se, if you wanted to swim in the Caribbean sea everyday without leaving your hotel, this isn;t necessarily the place for you. With that being said, I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip; Very Different from anywhere we've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Sandles18
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ocean Maya on December 29th 2010 at around 12 in the afternoon. There were a lot of people however the line moved quickly. We had payed for the Deluxe package and assumed that it included the Black Bracelets that allowed access to international alcohol, along with other special treatments. We were wrong. It was an additional 210 US per person in order to receive something we were told by the travel agency that we had paid for. We ended up having to pay for it and once it was all sorted out we had to wait another 2 hours for our room to be ready. Rooms: We have a family of 5 and we always take 2 rooms and so we were given the top and bottom floor of one of the Villas. We were located very far away from the lobby in Villa 35 but very close to the pool. We were lucky as there were no bad odours around the building as we heard some other people had many problems with their rooms smelling. The maids did an amazing job keeping the rooms spotless and we never had any issues with anything taken or "misplaced", the fridge was always kept in stock and we always had fresh towels. Pool and Beach: The beach was totally not what we expected, most of it is shielded off by a glass wall but a lot of seaweed in areas where you could go swimming due to the massive amounts of wind everyday. The sand however was incredible and were the two pools. Only problem was that beach chairs were hard to find both by the pools and on the beach if you came a little later, little later being 11:30. Another thing was the sports were not that organized as at many other resorts. My two older daughters and husband are sports fanatics and were disappointed when they almost had to organize water polo or volleyball. Except on one or two days when the staff really seemed to get into it. **** There is an absolutely BEAUTIFUL lagoon 10min walk on the beach to the left (if standing on the beach looking to the ocean) with blue-green, crystal clear warm water, one of our girls found it and I recommend walking to it! Food: The food was good for Mexico, we were there on New Years and there was lobster and a large assortment of Seafood that wasn't that bad, as for the other nights you had to arrive early the main buffet opens at 6:30 so 7:30 would already be pushing it as food got scarce. One of the days we had gone to town and arrived 30min before the snack bar was closing for lunch and at that time already there was nothing to eat. The Japanese Restaurant was good, and we did not have a chance to eat at the Italian, but the buffet always had something different which was good as I can't stand when the food is repetitive. Bar: The bar tenders were all very friendly, but it seemed like the hotel is short on them. The bar by the pool was always packed and generally one bartender had to manage. Without the black bracelets you can only be served National Alcohol and even with the black bracelets my husband was told on one of the nights that they had run out of gin and it was only around 11pm. I was however impressed with the fact that the bartenders did not treat my children different just because my 8 year old wouldn't tip. Wonderful service in regards to that. Overall Service: Every single person that worked at the hotel would say Hola whenever you passed and were very friendly but not creepy to the point where my oldest daughter didn't feel safe. The waiters seemed a little short staffed but always worked very hard. The front desk was also very helpful in regards to tennis and the pool tables. Evenings&Entertainment: The nightly shows weren't the greatest but they were entertaining. 3 of the nights they had dancers that weren't from the hotel come and preform and they were very good. One of the best parts of the evening would have to be the Sax player who plays in the lobby and does as incredible job. We stayed a week and it must have been 2 or 3 times that the hotel allowed very expensive vendors to set up, once was nice then the next time was pushing it a little. Overall we really enjoyed our stay mainly because of all the people that we met, it was a very calm and quiet resort and it never felt like there was a lot of people except when trying to find chairs but a fantastic stay even though we had some problems here and there! Definitely recommend it, if you're not looking for a busy and crowed vacation.

Reviews.Title: “HELD HOSTAGE, BUT !”
Reviews.Author: zg2011
Reviews.Content: We were sent here against our wishes because of Oean Coral overbooking practices. Having to deal with Guest Services staff, Luis, Claudia and Raymundo was a pleasure, they were very professional and deserve to be commended for their hard work. That said, H10 Hotel rates this hotel a 4*, they refurbished the hotel, the bathroom set up is not child friendly and found it inpractical at times. I enjoyed the layout of the property. More attention needs to be focused on the quality of service , especially when you pay for a privledged package. The one night entertainment( Mexican) I choose to watch was enjoyable. The food selection was good at the buffet, but at times hot food trays were only luke warm, if that! The free shuttle was nice for an outing but it was'nt the destination we had planned to see during our vacation, thanks to the lack of consideration of Ocean Coral. For those who chose this hotel I hope your expectations were meet 100% .

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation !!!”
Reviews.Author: pyperpennie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Ocean Maya this past March/10 for one week. At that time we felt it was good value for the money spent and were made aware at that time that there were some renovations in progress. We had the "white" wrist bands at that time. We decided to return Dec 17th through the 31st and were VERY pleaseantly surprised by the changes made to this resort over the past 8 mths. This time around we had the "black" wrist bands, we requested an ocean front room, with balcony and king bed and received all. We had an issue with a clogged sink, made a call and it was corrected within an hour, never had any issues with lack of hot water, noise, lack of selection at the buffet or staff. My understanding is that this resort has upgraded to a 5 star since last March and is in the process of going adult only and diamond star in May/11. Now for the things I believe need to change...... The hotel management knows when guests are arriving and they need more staff at the front desk to recieve them....it sends a poor first impression..... Not sure if it"s because I'm old school but I ABSOLUTLY disagree that I should be waiting in line at the buffet behind staff ( staff are allowed to eat at the lunch/dinner buffets) Entertainment...there were some cute shows back in March but nothing this go around...when I asked one of the sports and entertanment staff why, they advised that the Ocean Maya closed down for 6 weeks earlier this year for room revovations and the entertainment staff were not given new contracts so they went elsewhere..... Reservations for the "al a carte" are a farce !!!! dont even bother...just go to the resteraunt and you`ll have no issues..... All in all we had a great timeand would go back again....I`ve read many of the reviews posted here and the only advise I can give is you can`t pay for a 4 star and expect 5 star service.....this resort gives you exactly what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Have all the right stuff but......................”
Reviews.Author: debbiemCorona_ca
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel and grounds wonderful.. Check in: If you spoke spanish you were in light flin....Upon checking in we were interuped several times with spanishing speaking people just butting in and asking questions. Hotel people responded to them first. They do not provide a bell man to take you bags to the room. They send you off with a map on your way. 1st red flag. Our room was not acceptable and discussed it with them that same night. WAs told that night that the next day we would have to pay up grade and get our room at 2 pm. Room was not ready and stayed outside waiting for it. FYI mattress like sleeping on coils waiting for the top matteress to come.. Humor that is the way it is ... .2nd red flag Also ,at check in we were given black writst bands for vip service which included domestic and intl drinks and to be able to have reservations at the 3 resturants. Mind you in the 6 days we were there 2 of the resturants were not open. There were many rules staying at the hotel. No phone in reservations for dinner they started taking them in the lobby at 7 am...............Needless to say that did not work for us. 3rd red flag Resturants= understaffed in the resturant by the pool (mexican) 2 waiters for 35 tables. 1 angry bartender (of many) Grilled food there was 8-10 people waiting. Lack of prepared food. Small pizzas (2) was told more to come in acouple of minutes. 20 minutes later finally came. People actually served themselves their own wine and left unserved....Main lobby resturant the Hacienda- watch out for the hostess.....if not there don't seat yourself- again lack of food and omelet line 8 deep. Lunch had the same problems but location bigger and you had better luck. (a good walk from the pool) anther red flag.. Bar at the pool- If you sported any manners you were cut infront of and ignored for glasses and clean up work. But if you spoke spanish you were greeted and served.My boyfriend is Black and I would not send him up because it would take so long for a drink. I however am white with some spanish managed to get drinks. As being a mixed couple and being a white female and we both have manners were were Discrimitated..... We noticed alot of Europen clients ( very , very rude every man for themselves) ( even with the cancelations in New York) at the resturants and the bars by the pool and check in.........Personally, the staff is over worked never had eye contact just served. I did challange a woman who did cut in on me and the asst for the bar tender did stand up and said I was next to be served. Black wrist bands. The privilege to make dinner reservations providing it was at 7 am and that the resturant was not closed (japanese closed 2 days) domestic drinks and intl drinks. Like their wine and their local liquor. No champaine or wine at the pool nor gin or local liquor to Ca) Chardonay local to ca 45 dollars per bottle. This hotel has great bones. The rooms are decorated nice (won't sleep well) the grounds a well manacured. Resturants have promis but................The employees are over worked and do not have enough staff....The main ingredent lacking...........YOU NEED TO MAKE YOUR CUSTOMERS FEEL IMPORTANT............. One final note : New YEars Eve party was great only...........There was a table next us with One older daughter with her child, grandmother and friend at the Hacienda resturant. A muckie muck (only came on this day and did not interface with the hotel guests) asked them to leave their table because they needed that table to serve other guests. Mind you there about 75 tables in this resturant. ill equiped to handle their hotel guest... There were 2 gentelmen who were fantastic. The bartender and the capacuino maker in the hotel lobby. YOu could order coffee etc but..... after 8 am and you could not take to to the pool or your room....And the gentleman at the front desk who gave us our wake up call al 4 am and arranged a taxi for us. He even had a gentleman serve us coffee...That is the way to be treated. They were tipped even though this is an an all inclusive hotel. OUr recommendatio is to stay at Dreams this hotel is a wanta be.......... PS. My friend works for the airlines. Best Day transportation-----not your best day.. book with another transportation co. Handed us off to another co. upon arrival with an unmarked van and a person driving not in their uniform.....Could not pick us up to take to the airport because not profitable (too far out) taxi charged less.............Best Day gives you a phamplet upon greeting and states they will meet you at your location at a designated time. He never showed up ( giveing him a 2 hour lead way then calling him he does come) and then could not follow through with the transportation to the airport. Maybe we should click our red heals and support our own hotel in our own country. At least we know we can have Starbucks coffee for under five dollars. NOt at the airport in Playa del Carmen mexico...................good luck we work hard for our money and desirve to be pampered.................

Reviews.Title: “Food makes you sick and no hot water”
Reviews.Author: zimdip
Reviews.Content: It started with a call two days before we were leaving for our trip from the Ocean Coral & Turquesa (sister property), telling us that our reservation was cancelled. We were never really given an explanation but were told we would be moved to Ocean Maya Royale with complimentary upgrades that included lots of bells and whistles. We did a little research and discovered that the Ocean Maya was clearly a downgrade from 4 star to 3 star and was a much smaller resort. At this point we had no choice but to go. The grounds of the property were beautiful. Very nicely landscaped and maintained, nice looking pool but that's about the end of the plusses. The beach is one tiny section, the rest of the "beach" is a boardwalk with a glass barrier. The beautiful pool was never used because they don't heat the pool or the hot tub. It was FREEZING! The food was terrible! I was sick for three days. The buffet was like a cafeteria. Trays of food set out that were barely warm. No attempt to display in an appetizing manner. By the end of the trip, the only thing I could eat was toast. The ala carte restaurants weren't much better. The Italian restaurant was gross. The mexican was disappointing. The Japanese steakhouse was the best of the bunch and was actually OK. I'm not a huge drinker, but I felt like there was absolutely no alcohol in the drinks and the all the brands were off brands. My upgrade was supposed to include upgraded alcohol, but that never happned. By the way, they also promised a lobster dinner as part of the upgrade that no one on the resort knew anything about and never happened. I never got a hot shower. We called every day to have it fixed and they came out and ran the hot water on the sink. That was the extent of the fixing. Let me repeat, for thousands of dollars I NEVER GOT A HOT SHOWER!!! When we were bumped from the original property, we were told we would be given vouchers for free nights on a future trip. We went to the front desk the first day we arrived to claim the vouchers and were given a runaround. We then visited every day for the rest of the trip and every time there was a story about why the vouchers weren't ready. "It's Sunday", "it's a holiday", "the manager is not here", "the manager is at lunch", "your travel agent will give them to you", "the reservation desk is closed", etc. etc. etc. The exchange ended five days later after pounding fists on the counter and saying I wouldn't leave until they gave me the vouchers. The vouchers magically appeared. Not sure I'll use the free vouchers because it was such a poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great time to relax, enjoy and be catered to”
Reviews.Author: Graham036
Reviews.Content: We got back to Canada on Dec 22 after spending a couple of weeks at Ocean Maya. We had a really great time. While there we had a few days when we needed a sweater on at night but overall the weather was great; especially when we checked back to see what it was like in Canada. So a few things to know and to watch for: - If you do not have travel arrangements from Cancun Airport get set up with Trafic Tours through the resort. Their cost is $18 per person return. It is about 45 to 50 minutes from the airport to the resort. - Although there are four restaurants they are not open all of the time. Know when they are open and make reservations for the a la carte. You don’t have to but it does save a wait. - If you want to go to Playa Del Carmen by the free shuttle then book your spot early. To do this, get to the lobby around 7:00 am and wait at the Trafic Tours table. If you want to go by taxi then it will cost you $14. - Know the extras that are at the resort. There are non-motorized and motorized water sports. Not all resorts have access to these. - We only had only had one day to take my daughter and grand-daughter on an outing so tried to do the “Swim With the Dolphins” and Xcaret. A big mistake on our part. Do “Swim With the Dolphins” one day and Xcaret another. If you have one day then be prepared not to be able to do everything at Xcaret. - Tennis. There is no place to sign up. If you are a fair player or just want to hit a ball around then take a racquet to breakfast. People will soon ask you if you want to play. If you know how to hit a ball well but have no one to play with then ask for Miguel at the sports desk at the pool. He used to play college tennis. He is in management but seems to find the time to still hit a ball around. - Beach – There are a couple of small beaches at each end of the property. These are separated by a built up boardwalk that has a glass partition on the ocean side. The whole area behind the beaches and boardwalk is made up of chaise lounges and thatched roof cabanas. Great for tanning or getting the fresh air in the shade. - Entertainment – During the day, there is always something happening around the pool area. In the evening there are shows. These are really well done considering the size of the resort. If you are looking at something along a Vegas/Broadway type show then you are at the wrong place. Karaoke is the usual hit and miss…some people are great while others could have helped everyone by staying at the bar. - The saxophonist plays at breakfast and other meals plus in the lobby during the evening. A really nice touch. - The grounds are mature and well kept. Not being used to the tropics, we all were really taken with variety of plants and loved the palms. - Wild life ….. sort of. At night you could see some raccoons and peccaries wandering around. On the path that runs along the south of the property there is a relative large population of coati. They seem to like fruit and are relatively tame. I wouldn’t trust them though to eat out of your hand. - We liked the idea of the small buildings amongst the gardens. Each had 4 suites up and 4 down. This is opposed to some resorts that have 5 story buildings with who knows how many suites. Each to his own. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed out stay and would certainly go back. We tipped but at the end of our stay but found the staff very helpful and certainly would go out of their way to assist. The food was great and in the a la carte restaurants, well presented. I have posted a number of photos to give you a clearer picture as to what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Home”
Reviews.Author: greekalicious
Reviews.Content: If your planning to get away for a week, away from the cold and stressful work place, This is where you want to be!!! I was very pleased with the service the moment i stepped into giligens island..haha..The people who greet you will remind you of this!! Buffet Food was ExCellent lot's to choose from!! The bar tenders right down to the house keepers were always very friendly and considerate! The entertainment staff always had activities that were fun and could win you some nice prizes, by the end of my trip i felt like i was leaving my family behind!! Thank-you Gama, George, Toto, Jes, Omar and many more For all the wonderful memories!! See you next year Amigos

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Rmvw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ocean Maya Nov 28 - Dec 5. It was a wonderful trip. I was a little concerned with some of the mixed reviews, but we did not experience any issues. I can be very hard to please and found the service to be very attentive. We travelled with our two boys aged 4&2 and still had a relaxing time! The kids club was fantastic and my eldest was excited to go. They had great activities for the kids including a pajama party/movie night, piñata, and arts and crafts. Daniela at the kids club really made the experience great for us. She was so great with the kids and my son still talks about her! Service at the restaurants was great too, especially Alberto! Dinner time with two young children can be challenging. He remembered our names and what the kids liked to drink and had it all ready for us when we came in! The resort is beautiful and everything was SO clean. I swear they must have cleaned the bathrooms by the pool every hour! We always had plenty of towels in our room, and the cleaning staff would always leave a towel animal on the bed- a big hit! It was so nice to not have to walk forever to get places on the resort. Whenever we came in contact with staff we were always acknowledged with a hola! The food was good with plenty variety. There were a few nights the buffet was not opened which definately would have made it easier with the kids, but we were able to experience the other restaurants which we wouldn't have gone to otherwise. We made sure on those nights to eat right when the restaurants opened so that it allowed other guests have a nice quiet dinner. All restaurants were very good. If you are looking to party all the time, this is not the resort for you. It's great for couples and families. The beds are hard as detailed in other reviews, but not unbearable. We loved the Ocean Maya and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. We would definately go back and/ or stay at another H10 resort in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: Rick0630
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I got in Monday night December 6 from a very nice 10 night stay at Ocean Maya. We arrived around 1 pm and check in was fast and easy. Our room wasn’t ready but they gave us our bands and off to lunch we went. After lunch we walked around the property a bit then went back to the front desk and got our room. They put us ½ way back in the complex and claimed it was an ocean view room. The only view we had was that of a palm tree. No worries as we don’t spend that much time in our room anyway. After a couple hours and a little further thought we decided to go down and ask for an upgrade as I don’t work all year to look at a palm tree. Be careful as they tried to upgrade us to the black band at $25 a night per person and leave us in the same room. But for $30 a night per person we got a beautiful ocean front room and it was worth it for me as I like getting up early for the pre sunrise and sunrise show. The black band thing isn’t really all that. They say premium booze but all you really have to do is ask. It gives you beds on the beach but we never used them and they say no reservations needed at the restaurants which was nice. We just got the upgrade for the ocean front thing as we like listening to the ocean in the morning and evening. From the time we arrived till the time we left we felt like family. Always a hello and how are you from all the staff including the pool guys and gardeners. That’s why I like a smaller hotel they always know you by name. Food was pretty darn good at the restaurants. The Oriental was the best then Mexican then Italian. I didn’t care much for the Italian but my girlfriend liked it. To each his own. The breakfast buffet was very good as with all the AI’s I have stayed at with plenty to choose from. My only complaint was the afternoon lunch buffet. It got a little old after a few days as they served up the same thing every day but still plenty to choose from. We had a great time with the entertainment staff. Always something going on if you wanted to get involved. If not they would leave you alone and not be pushy about it. Drinks are flowing freely around the pool and on the beach with Edgar always there to serve you. As others have said this is not a real party Hotel but still lots of fun and a great place to relax and unwind. One of my favorite things to do was sit in the social area by the lobby at night with the warm breeze blowing, having a few drinks and listening to the sax player. He was good very good and so relaxing. OK I’m rambling on. Would I go back? Would I send a friend? Yes and yes! If the price was right. We got one heck of a deal and I really wouldn’t pay more than I did for the place and only if I was guaranteed the room I had or the one next door. The only deal breaker would be as others have said is the ocean. It’s not that crystal clear blue water you would expect in Cancun or the Playa area. Any questions feel free to shoot me an email at r976tuna@aol.com and I will be happy to answer. Hint – If you are going to do a day trip try to line it up on the days the dinner buffet is open. Get a schedule when you check in. We made the mistake of doing our day trip when only the restaurants were open and by the time we got back they were ready to close. It would have been nice to hop in the buffet and grab something after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Great smaller resort makes ya feel right at Home.”
Reviews.Author: BigDivet
Reviews.Content: : ) Just got back from a wonderful trip to Ocean Maya Dec./2010 From reception to checkout the service was top self. Starting with a welcome cocktail ! Then we find out that we get a upgrade to the VIP black braclet low season bonus ! Then its off to the room very clean with every thing ya need to enjoy your holiday king size bed desk sitting table hide a bed 32" LCD TV /Closet with plenty of hangers and your iron and sewing needs! The bath is fully stocked soap / sampoo condioner ,shaver,tooth bushes and lots of towels ! Mini Bar only had water when we arrvived but as soon a i asked front desk they where on the phone and in no time it was stocked with pop/ beer and extra botteled water. The resort is spead out on beautifully landscaped grounds surrounding the villas with well lit pathways with signs directing you to the beach,reception villas ect. With lush flowers and the odd Iguana ,racoon are a family white nosed coati,s to great you along the way ! The two pools are steps away from the ocean one with a swim up bar for the adults and one for the water polo and kids there are plenty of planed activities to particaipate in ! The Beach was very nice! Yes there is a long board walk with a glass wall protecting you from the waves and reducing beach eroision but the whole time i was there we saw workers working hard removing rubble twigs ect to provide a nice clean beach area that i found no better are worse for as far as the my eye could see, And we hade the only pier dock to walkout on the ocean in the area. I would recommend a beach walk there is a inlet south of the resort with a nice bridge and several tropicial fish crabs and sea life to be observed ! Restaurants & Dinning ! Breakfast : Buffet standard omleate station and the regular sausage/bacon eggs ect fruits/ cheese/ pasteries breads yourgut cereals ect. Lunch was buffet or A La carta At the italian resterante (Dolce vita ) Buffet : lots to choose from always could get fresh grilled fish beef pork are burgers,pizza soups and salads ,fruitstrays and parteries. Lunch A la carta Was A nice change from the buffet with two are three chioces for sarter,s Entre and deserts we tried to sample them all and found them all very good . Dinner :Buffet Seemed to be theme oriented Mayan Spanish Mexican and featured several different dishes as well as roasted chichen pork and fish soups pastas salads ect. A La Carta at there Mexican/ Italian/ Japenese We tried all the restaurants and enjoyed the them all equally The Mexican was fresh salsa guacamole and the flavers of Mexico the Italian was of course Pasta several ways with lamb and beef steaks and the Japenese is a a entertaining show as well as a wonderful meal with a show are A la Carta. Snacks where always available 24/7 at the looby bar are Mikes Coffee bar ! Hotel has Wifi internet cafe, car rental Taxi/ excursions services Spa and Gym services . Service in general has been very kind fast and courteous remember to tip it well go a long way ! These people go out ther way to make your stay enjoyable !

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it: Great food, wonderful resort, beach ok”
Reviews.Author: gazpacho99
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a very relaxed week at Ocean Maya. We were pleasantly surprised of the excellent food quality, the nice personal and the lovely spaces and modern rooms. The garden between the houses is beautiful and full of iguanas and exotic plants. We especially like the Italian food restaurant at the beach which is almost empty for lunch and crowded for dinner. It was a bit of a pain to get a place at the "Tepanyaki" in the Japanese restaurant, but if you get there at 6:30pm they write you on a list and you will get a table at 8:00pm. The pools were nice and clean, the cocktails all included. Corona beer ok, mexican wine drinkable but not especially good, excellent italian coffee in the afternoon at the coffee house. The "a la carte" speciality restaurants (mexican, italian, japanese) are only open for dinner 4 times per week, the other days dinner is served as buffet in the main Hacienda restaurant (still delicious and big choice). The ground of the ressort is huge and you have to walk a bit to get from one end to the other. If it rains you are more likely to get wet during your walks to the main building (although they provide free umbrellas). The shuttle to Playa de Carmen is a fraud: Only 10 seats per day and you need to be at the desk at 8am to book for the next day at noon. Still it is highly recommended to go to Playa de Carmen as the beach there is much nicer (clean, emerald water, no stones) than the hotel beach. Still the hotel beach is nice and ok, rather walk to the right side and go into the water at the neighbouring "Secrets Capri Suites". The sand is white and fine, just the water is not as esmerald as in Cancun or Playa de Carmen. Still the waves are not too high (not as in Cancun) so you can have a relaxed swim. Tipp: If you are in Playa de Carmen book your tour to Chichen Itza there - you pay only 45$ (if you negotiate a little) per person and not for 99$ in the hotel. Also car rental at the hotel is much more expensive than elsewhere. Tipp: A trip with the "Colectivo" taxis to Cancun City (not really worth it) costs 30 mexican pesos, a ride to Playa de Carmen 15 pesos. Be prepared that you have to walk 15min from the hotel to the main street to catch a taxi. - Wi-Fi is only in the lobby, no signal in the rooms. - Printing out (tickets) costs $2 per page. - Dinner only until 22pm - Only 1 sort of beer We can only recommend this ressort because of it's high standard, nice amenities, great food, friendly people. If you want to have nightlife, better go to Cancun or Playa de Carmen, there is nice evening entertainment and dancing in the hotel. The beach to the right of the hotel (just a few meters of walk) is ok, but the reviews are true that say that the hotel itself doesn't have a nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Couples, great for family”
Reviews.Author: Bubblescope
Reviews.Content: The fact that we were picked up from the airport was great. But after dinner we got a little bored and wished we were a little closer to Playa Del Carmen. The food in the the Mexican restaurant by the pool was great. The rooms were clean and spacious although there was a bad smell coming from the bathroom drains, I overheard another family complain. There is lots of great evening entertainment but I think I would have liked to be closer to the town. Also if you go into the town there are cheaper deals in terms of tour operators who also come to pick you up from your hotel. We found our tour that we booked through the tour operator to be at least $50 cheaper in town. Also i would rent a car in town too. The tour operator said the roads are dangerous but it was totally easy we drove to Coba ourselves and to Tulum. 2 days before we were about to leave we got an upgrade to a great hotel called Grand Maya which actually made our trip. So over all good value. It's nice but I have a feeling there are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had an Awesome time at the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: TMPaquette
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fabulous week at the Ocean Maya Resort, Playa del Carmen. We had a wonderful stay. We arrived in the late afternoon and were welcomed by very friendly staff. We were brought glasses of punch to enjoy while we waited to be checked in. The lobby was so beautiful and clean. It opened onto a patio with a lovely pond and fountains. We were escorted to our room, and the person who helped us with our bags took us through and showed us where everything was, and how it worked. We tried to learn a few words and phrases to help us communicate with all the employees,and they all took the time to help explain what we wanted to say in Mexican. I don't know if my husband frustrated them, but you would never have known. They would smile, laugh and then tell him how to say what ever it was he was wanting to learn. Where ever you went at the resort, you were always greeted with a smile and a Hola, You were never walked passed with out being acknowledged. Quite a nice change from everyday life. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, and so clean. There was a fridge stocked with water, sodas and local beer. The whole resort was clean. You always saw someone cleaning something throughout the day. The food was amazing. You had a buffet every morning for breakfast. There were so many choices, there was no way you could get bored with the food. They would fry you eggs any way you wanted, or choose you toppings, and they'll make you an omelet. Almost anything you could want was available. Lunch was either a la carte, or a buffet to choose from. They would even do cheese burgers and hotdogs for you at the buffet. Dinner alternated between a la carte one night and then a buffet the next. There were 3 restaurants to choose from. There was Italian, Mexican and Japanese. You can make reservation ahead of time if there is a certain time you wanted to eat, or they would fit you in when they could if you showed up that day. We were able to book a seat in the Japanese restaurant around the grill, where they cook your meal in front of you. This was a great show, and delicious food. You needed the reservations for this meal, but not just to eat in the Japanese restaurant. The entertainment staff always had something to keep you busy. They organized pool volleyball and beach volleyball, water polo, poker at the pool deck, kids programs and so many other things during the day. Every evening they had a different event. They even did a version of Grease. It was great. They came around throughout the day and let you know what was planned for each evening. Plenty of lounge chairs on the beach and around the pool. Hammocks and beds on the beach were also available. You could even pay and have a massage on the beach through the spa. The beach was nice, but not spectacular. The hurricanes have washed away a lot of the sand, but the pool was right next to the beach, so you could swim in the pool, and look at the ocean at the same time. We did swim it the ocean, and it was nice, but it is just a 200 peso taxi ride to Playa del Carmen, where the beach is really clear. We could not find anything worth complaining about, and will definitely be returning to this resort on our next trip. Hola a todos y Gracias a mis amigos

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: JMKRY
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome smaller hotel. Our family of 7 - 2 adults, 5 children ages 22 to 11, had a wonderful vacation here. The resort is small enough we could always find each other at meals and beach spot or pool area. Was very worried after reading past reviews. -but none of them sounded like they were our family dynamic going in so we decided to give it a shot. The entertainment staff were amazing getting all the kids involved in something. They know you by name and sit with you for meals to get to know the family. They are great at accommodating everyone. Our 11 year old felt like a celebrity because he was even included in the adult games in a way. If after a week and there are tears at goodbye- they have done a great job. The other behind the scenes staff are also very attentive and always had a "hola" when they see you. Edgar on the beach was the best- keeping all the drinks straight and often. I would suggest VIP for the use of the cabanas and premium drinks. Coffee bar had amazing lattes and cappacinos. Japanese restaurant was great both in seating area and cooking in front of you area. The chefs were funny - it was a show. It was slow season so the buffet was every second night and a la carte every other. That was ok with us. They are renovating but we didn't hear a thing. The grounds are very clean and someone is always sweeping or picking up leaves. The beach isn't large but you can swim in ocean. This time of year the water is not the greatest because of weather. The rooms were clean. We like the villa style hotel rooms.The beds are hard and take getting used to.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway, not the place you want to go to party”
Reviews.Author: talltraveler32
Reviews.Content: Great place for a romantic getaway or family vacation. It would be a very boring vacation for someone single or ready to party. No night life on the property and Playa Carmen isn't as close as they make it sound 15 min. taxi ride (or so). Beautiful hotel and modern rooms! Food was ok, very little seafood :( We got a great deal so it was worth the price for me.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: AustinLueck
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent resort to get some rest and relaxation. Check in was super easy and we scored an ocean front room about 15 ft from the sand. The staff was very friendly, and everything was close so you didn't have to walk a mile. There was plenty of wildlife and scenery to look at everyday. The food was average, just about the same as every other resort that we have been to in the past. Keep in mind that you will not go hungry, the staff would make you anything you wanted to eat or drink. Overall I really enjoyed my time here and would go back to an H10 resort again.

Reviews.Title: “No beach, food is ok, resort is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Racoon1232
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful. Very modern and spread out, very romantic. There is no night life at the resort but you can take a cab to playa del Carmen. The pools are nice but expect kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Excellent Service Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: jenai23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from October 17th 2010 to October 21st 2010. We traveled with myself, husband, 1 year old and nanny in one room. When arriving our rooms were not ready but they locked up our luggage and we ate, explored and swam. When our rooms were ready we were pleasantly surprised. We requested first floor and next to our friends who were with us. We had building 9 right on the beach facing the ocean. We also had adjoining rooms with the other couple which worked out great because we were sharing a nanny. The room was completely renovated to a modern flair. It was small but a ton of storage. We had 3 adults and a 1 year old in it and had plenty of room. We had 1 king size bed, 1 couch, 1 chair a desk, table, 2 night stands, a fantastic closet. We had inside a full size jogging stroller and a pack and play. We requested a crib and all they have is pack and plays but who cares I did not have to haul it. It was clean and safe. The only thing that was difficult was the marble tiled showers with a 1 year old. Bring either a blow up tub or a non slip mat. The beds are hard but we did not go on vacation to sleep all day. The room was clean and we had really no issues. The first 12 hours we were there the manager called to see if we needed anything. If we did we just called and we got it. The safe is fine it has a key lock and we had no issues. In fact the only thing we had in it was money and our passports. My credit cards were out in the room all week in my purse and no one bothered them. I felt very safe. The staff is amazing and friendly. The food was great. A good selection. If you could not find something you liked I'm not sure you would like anything anywhere. I had no problem feeding our 1 year old daughter. We went to all the specialty restaurants and they were good. If you did not like it order something else. The drink staff was always great. No problems ever waiting. Shaday up front in the lobby was always on top of it. The resort was really empty. We barely ever saw a hundred people. It was quiet and peaceful. The pools and ground were very clean and beautiful. Mosquitoes are in an abundance so bring bug spray. It is Mexico. I though the nightly entertainment was not as great as other resorts but it was still good. Maybe will be better as they get busier. The resort was great for a 1 year old. Plenty of space for her to run around. The staff loved interacting with her. The beach does have a glass wall but you can walk to the other sides of it if you do not want an obstructed view. It was a bonus for us because it kept our daughter away from the water. We swam in the ocean it was warm and clean. My only complaint was our Apple Vacations rep sucked. He was only on the resort for 5 minutes of our 5 day stay. This resort was completely renovated and they are still working on some of it. For the value you could not ask for anything more. We payed about $700pp including airfare from Chicago. I would definitely recommend this place for the value and an enjoyable time. It is only a 20 minute cab ride to downtown Playa Del Carmen. Took a 1 year old and it was very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasBahamamama
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant to go here as I couldn't find many "current" reviews about this resort and I had gotten a very cheap deal. But I was very pleased with the overall experience. The resort was very nice and clean. The pools were clean. We took our 7 year old grandaughter and she WANTED to go to the Kid's Club everyday. That gave us a little time to ourselves to relax on the beach without worrying about her. There was a "beach boy" on the beach that made sure our drinks were full. We took the shuttle (actually a very large nice bus) into town to shop and had no problem get a reservation for the shuttle. We ate at all the specialty restaurants and enjoyed the Japanese the most. One night we ordered off the menu and one night we sat at the Hibachi grill and enjoyed the show. I have been to many resorts but the nightly entertainment was lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Mexican atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Zmijas
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I ever been. Beautiful place with great facilities and very nice rooms. I had large lizard on my backyard. :) Very good food and service. Easy to get to Playa del Carmen's downtown and Cancun. Staff very friendly and helpful. Easy to rent a car and visit ancient mayan saint places like Chichen Itza.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - only complaint was the food”
Reviews.Author: luv2ski84
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews about the Ocean Maya before we left (I went with 5 other girlfriends) and I have to say most of them were spot on. We were pleasently surprised with how nice and updated our room was - the bathroom was also very nice. And we loved that each room was sort of in a bungalow of 4. The first night we were there we ate at the Italian restaurant and it was delicious. I cannot say the same for the rest of the food during our stay. There were very few choices and none of them were all that good. We tried to load up at breakfast because lets face it - its next to impossible to mess up breakfast food. The pools were both nice and we enjoyed the swim up bar. One tip I would give folks traveling to this resort - bring a tall plastic cup! All six girls had a different color cup and we took them to the bar each afternoon and they filled them up - much better then the tiny cups the bar has! And the drinks were good - not too weak and for the most part not too strong. Overall - it was a great, inexpensive vacation. Oh- and we did the catamaran tour that a guy at the pool reccommended and had a BLAST - best $70 spent the whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A NIGHTMARE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JupiterDonna
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to highest level & got nothing!No ameneties, no stocked fridge, no iron,no robe & slippers,no alarm clock and only a sheet on the bed!Had to plead for ocean view that I paid for which turned out to be about a mile from the lobby!No room service, concierge never there.NO BEACH-there's a wall in front of beach chairs. No service at pool or beach. Pool was dirty. Was ignored at the filthy pool bar because they cater to the locals! Italian restaurant charged money for half the menu at an all inclusive! Did not feel safe, in fact, the room safe was not electronic as promised and very flimsy! Only one shuttle into town. Buffet looked like left overs! Staff was rude and not accommodating. We left in 24 hours which was 23 hrs. & 59 minutes too long. Thank God we hooked up with the only other americans who were leaving also! The pictures of this hotel are deceiving and so is Continental Travel Package. They lied about this Ocean Maya & that is fraud. Stay far away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your Money is Better Spent Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: PDC_Lovers
Reviews.Content: We go to PDC every year and wanted to try a new resort (we stayed at Viva Maya in 09). We stayed at Ocean Maya from July 31 through August 10. The grounds of Ocean Maya are very nice. However, the rooms need serious updating and cleaning. We were initially housed in the "B" building. This area is horrible. It's basically a hotel and is FAR away from the pool and "beach". After we complained that our AC wasn't working and the room smelled of sewage, we were moved to Building 19. The room was the same and was a little closer. The room we were in was small and was a surprise to us, as it was different than what was advertised when we booked the vacation. The showers are very slippery and the toilets were constantly overflowing. When we complained of this they informed us that they were having problems with plumbing. The pool area is nice, but the pool side bar was NEVER open and we were told it was because of no available staffing. The beach area of this resport is non-existent as it has been replaced with a deck and seating. You actually have to walk a bit to get to a stretch of beach. When you get there you will find that the stretch of beach is not what the Riviera Maya is known for. The food is ok. Selection is not to great and the family and I were sick most of the time we were there. Also, the times the restaurants are open is very restrictive. There are several hours where this is no food available. They will direct you to the coffee shop where you can get sweet bread or small sandwiches. It may be that we were used to having food available 24/7...but this place really restricts you. The drinks were ok as well. I drank mostly beer, but unless you are constantly tipping the bartenders, don't expect to get fast service (wait time for dinks can be as long as 15 minutes). I love going to PDC, but I would not recommend this place at all. Try staying somewhere in Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mudstrap
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went at the Ocean Maya because we found a good deal on the net: 755CAN$ / person for 7 days for Montreal. First, when we arrived, the check-in was really fast (5 min). If you want access to the safe, it costs 140 pesos. Then we went at the room in the Unit 13. The room was very nice. Very powerful air conditioning, very clean place, comfortable king bed. We didn’t upgraded the room for 30US$/day/person. Our room was really fine. The negative points for the room are that the TV didn’t work for the whole trip and there is no iron and iron table for your clothes. We ate at the Italian Restaurant 3 times for diner and that was the best restaurant. The Japanese Restaurant with the ‘’Cooking show’’ was fine. The Mexican was ok but really hot inside. In general, the buffet was good: not a lot of choice but everything taste good. So they invest more in quality than in quantity. In the morning you can do your own Mimosa (orange juice with champagne) at the buffet. Don’t forget to try the Café bar in the lobby where you can drink any kind of real good espresso coffee. The service at this hotel was really good, particularly in the à la carte restaurants. I was really surprised that the service was as good in the buffet as in the à la carte restaurant. At no time we complained for the service. At the bar, the best service is at the lobby. They know how to make real good drinks. You can drink glass of champagne as you wish! Bar at the pool was ‘’ok’’ because the drinks were so so with almost no alcohol. The beach is probably the worst negative point for this hotel. I kept my sandals to go in the sea because you walk on rocks and algae underwater. The water is always full of sand in suspension so you can’t go in the front of the hotel for scuba. There is nothing to see underwater. Activities/shows at night are more for children than for adults. Only on Wednesday there was a small party at the swimming pool with a music band, but that’s it. If you want to do the fiesta every night, I don’t recommend this hotel. I recommend trying some outdoor activities. We did the Coba temple visit and the visit of a real Maya family (in there house) (110US$/person). We went at the X-Caret zoo/park for 130US$/person (there is a show at 8pm in the park and it was amazing). Before entering the park, be cautious: they try to take your Sun-cream because they say there are poisonous substances for the environment in it and then they try to sell you their own ‘’organic cream’’. I brought 2 cream packs and gave only one at the entry and kept the other one in my bag. They give it back to you when you exit the park. Finally, we swam with the whale-sharks (fish are 8 to 15 meters long!) in the ocean for 200US$/person. These fish are so big! And there are in this region only for 1 month before they continue there way so we decided to go even if it is expensive. This hotel is more for family and couples. No negative event happened to us at the hotel. Overall, it is a nice place but I wouldn’t pay more than what we paid for this place. For best price, buy your alcohol at the Cancun airport. For good Tequila, you can taste it before you buy in the store. I paid 37US$ for a good one but you can buy cheaper for 15US$ 40oz.

Reviews.Title: “spend your hard earn money on another resort”
Reviews.Author: familyof11
Reviews.Content: can you say "public pool" yes that what it felt like. found out that the hotel allows day passes to family and friends of the staff. After 9am breakfast was picked over, lunch was packed from the day passes. They would bring in children that could not swim and then they would over power the bars. Our room was nice but unsafe, the shower leaked and was very easy to slip, asking for extra towels to accomindate the overflow was like pulling teeth. stay away, this place has given us a bad mexico experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: travel12326
Reviews.Content: My vacation was awhile ago, but I have been meaning to write a review since I returned to the US. First off, the group I traveled with (my boyfriend and some friends) were expecting very little from this place. Between the (mostly) harsh reviews and the very low rate we got we were practically expecting holes in the walls. I am happy to report we were very pleasantly surprised! From the moment we walked into the hotel we were greeted with drinks and welcomed. The only problem was that our room was not yet ready and we were forced to walk around and wait for it to be ready. We had to put our luggage in a storage closet and we wanted to change out of our flight clothes, but it seemed like more trouble than it was worth to dig out shorts/a swimsuit to change in the public lobby bathroom. Things may have started poorly, but after an hour or so our rooms were ready and we entered our rooms. The villas were very cute and gave the hotel a home-y feel. Our room had just one king size bed, and though the mattress was very hard, like some reviews say, it did not bother us in the slightest. After all, we weren't there to sleep! Granted, we are young and without any back problems, but that was our take on the mattress situation. The room was immaculate aside from a few ants right near the window but it was not close to the bed at all so this was not too bothersome. It should be known that I can be quite picky about cleanliness, and this room lived entirely up to my standards. The beach and pool area were great. We had black VIP bracelets so we were allowed in the nice roped-off section, which I must say was incredible. It did seem like there were pool games with a microphone going on all day which was a little annoying when walking by that area, but nothing not tolerable and I am sure fun for those participating. Food was overall very good. Fresh fruit, omelettes every morning...overall good variety. Fresh mojitos just waiting out one night! We tried all of the restaurants. Japanese and Italian were great, Mexican was not so great. Sometimes we were stuck with a late reservation but we had a party of 10 so that is to be expected. There was a great open air restaurant by the pool/beach, great for grabbing lunch without having to walk far. As far as drinks go, they were made fairly weak but if you slipped the bartender a dollar or two they seemed to throw a little extra alcohol in. On that note, don't bother converting money. US dollars were perfectly acceptable and even encouraged. It sometimes seemed like you were being hounded for tips, but these people are just trying to make a living and it did not take away from the quality of my vacation at all. One thing I had a problem with though was that I developed an ear infection about 4 days into the vacation and the doctor only came by on certain days. I needed some antibiotics, which I did not realize were over the counter in Mexico. But I made an appointment and when I arrived was told it would cost $150. This seemed ridiculous and I stuck it out until I got home. Despite a few small problems there was nothing I could think to change about the Ocean Maya. I was very impressed with the rooms, the beach, the food, the drinks, the grounds (people constantly landscaping). I would tell anyone to give this place a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Not all true!”
Reviews.Author: eastwood50
Reviews.Content: My family and extended family arrived on Saturday,07/24 for a seven night stay. From the beginning things were not right. We booked three rooms with the V.I.P. status and did not receive the bath robes or slippers in each room or the correct size beds. The beds only have sheets and no blankets which once requested from the front desk took 15 hours to deliver. The shower leaks onto the floor which will take about three towels a day to clean up with a family of four. However, room service will only deliver two clean towels a day so you are starting in the negative from the start. The refrigerator does not get very cold so the free beer, water, and sodas doesn't help. In the beach V.I.P. section there is not any waiter or waitress service as promised and any of the guest are allowed to use any of this area regardless of their status.This area is not managed for it's intended use. If you want decent bar service use the bar at the front near reception. The bar next to the pool takes way too long and if you are not Spanish the wait is longer. You may want to know that this resort allows locals to utilize the resort which includes the bars, buffets and pools on all seven days of the week from 09:00 to 18:00 for a price of $42.00 a day. The majority of the people there during the day is local folk which is not a big deal but they do receive better service being locals and you will be looked over unless you stand your ground. Here are some positive attributes regarding the resort: Resort is very clean. Food is decent for the price but gets old quick due to limited choices daily. Spa is awesome and recommended. Most of the staff is friendly and helpful. My family or extended family will probably never set foot on this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great first vacation”
Reviews.Author: D_from_Mtl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, really loved our first trip to Mexico and Ocean Maya ... The resort is very clean, people are friendly and hard workers!! The italian resto and japaneese are very nice, the mexican is so so. The buffet was Ok also. I didn't like much the drinks. We paid 1 650 $ for two, great value, great resort but don't pay more :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with only a few hickups”
Reviews.Author: KJM604
Reviews.Content: Room was great, somehow we got upgraded to a villa with a great ocean view, so first off we were happy! The bed like everyone else's comment was uncomfortable, but I can look past that. The food was ok, and the Japanese restaurant was fantastic! They wouldn't let us take food back to our room, we didn't like that as some nights we were hungry and needed downtime before heading out. Fridge didn't work, so when we called twice and finally got it stocked, it wasn't cold so useless. Staff was good, normal I guess, only 1 bartender at pool bar after 8pm, tough to get a drink all day, and watered down. Would recommend, but would rate as a 3 1/2 star, and $1000 canadian is all you should pay to fully get your money's worth..we paid $1057 from Calgary taxes in.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: vazsalgado
Reviews.Content: For the price, which is not cheap, the service is poor, very few people for too many clients. Food in the buffet has reduced options, nothing healthy for kids. The people in charge couldn´t help you or they just tell you to write your complaints down instead of trying to help. The Resort is beautiful, rooms are great except for some structural problems as water floods in the bathroom, but... I really needed a good rest, it didn´t happen. Be careful with the front door guy, he makes the taxis chrage the double fee for him to take half of it. Sorry, I don´t like being negative.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place and great service but be vigilant with management issues!”
Reviews.Author: Spurginj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Ocean Maya, and for the most part it was good. The room was very modern and spacious, the AC was very nice and cold, and the bathroom was pleasant. The beds, however, were very uncomfortable, but due to the high level of activity during the day and free booze, that issue worked itself out. The restaurants had great service but food quality was below average-slightly above average, definitely not excellent at all. The best we had was the Japanese grill portion of the Oriental restaurant (so named). It was plentiful and delicious, but took some time. Second-best was the Italian restaurant, Dolce Vita, but mainly for service and atmosphere (beachside with cool wind blowing at night). The food quality was average. The buffet had a wide array of choices but all the food was below average-average at best. The bars/cafes were great for service and beverages, but you'll be disappointed if you're a beer drinker like I am because all they have is Corona. I eventually switched to rum and cokes. The poolside bar is convenient but can get dirty, particularly the swim-up part. The coffeehouse was very nice and clean, with free baked goods. The front lobby had many sitting areas and was quite breathtaking aesthetically. The beach was nice to look at, and they had some sitting areas which were awesome. It was very nice at sunset. Also the iguanas were charming throughout the property. OK, for the negative parts - the most negative issues we had was dealing with management. We requested a king bed because it was our first wedding anniversary, but we received two narrow doubles. I went back to the front desk and even tipped the attendant a $20, which she took, but all she offered was to move the doubles together, which never happened. I never pressed the issue and we just took it as a loss, mainly because the AC worked so well. The first night, all the lights in our room went out about 7:00 pm. I suspected it was a blown fuse so I alerted the front desk people face to face about it at that time. They said they'd take care of it, but we returned at 10:30 pm and it still hadn't been corrected. I reminded them gain and they said they'd already fixed it. I told them to come back. I went back to the room on their direction to meet the worker and he never showed up, so I called and they didn't seem to have a clue what I was talking about. Annoyed, I told them we'd need another room if they weren't going to fix the problem. Well, the guy finally showed up and the problem was indeed A BLOWN FUSE! Which was fixed in 5 mins. The other negative is the amount of guests that smoked. I'd say at least 75% of the adults were smokers. To deal with this I think the management needs to sector off some designated smoking areas. Smoke too often wafted about the poolside and lobby. Some people even were smoking in the pool! I jested that they would probably even smoke underwater if they could. If you're a nonsmoker you may find this place a bit acrid at time. Overall though, I liked the room, spa, and overall place. 3/5 for me.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, you can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: firenicz
Reviews.Content: The room was wonderful, always cold. Food good with variety in all restaurants. Service was very friendly and helpful. We always had what we needed. It is a beautiful property. There is little beach and the water was not as blue and clear as most places. The massage for 50 bucks was amazing. The pool area was great. The staff was very , very good.

Reviews.Title: “Well...it's kinda thumbs up, thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: keddiej
Reviews.Content: I can recommend : the restaurants, the staff who are extremely helpful and cheerful, the cabanas by the beach (so comfy), the grounds were lovely, the spa- I had a very nice $50 facial that lasted over an hour. I cannot recommend: the rooms because the beds are pretty uncomfortable and our air conditioner conked out one night and the fridge was not too cold, the pool area, internet computer which charged me $1000 (see brother in law's review) for 30 minutes, and the availability of the concierge (nice lady but never there) If you go and want a great side trip- use edventures tours (see #4 I think on the Things to Do list.) It really was the best part of our trip. All in all, I had a good vacation with family. I will try another resort next time. If you get a good deal, go to the Ocean Maya. By the way, we're still working on the overcharge to our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Request a Villa”
Reviews.Author: BUEN_2
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday night, and the lobby looks amazing, at this point we are very excited to see the rest of the resort and our room. We ended up getting a room in the older "hotel style" part of the resort, it was on the ground floor right on the corner, facing the rear of the building that the buffet is in. It was a very loud busy area, and the sewage smell that alot of people are talking about on here was very strong near and inside our room. Needless to say I went to the front desk and requested to move rooms, I was told that the hotel was full for the weekend, but I could move sunday afternoon. So my advice is to request a villa during the check in process, they are much nicer, cleaner, and quieter. We ended up moving Sunday afternoon and the last 5 nights of our stay was really good. Our maid left a swan made of towels on our bed which I thought was a nice touch. Drinks were good, I would agree that the bars were understaffed, but when we made a trip to the bar we usually loaded up with 2 drinks each,so no real problem there. There was a waitress on the beach who would bring us a drink everytime she made her rounds which was great. The Italian, and Japaneese restaurants were very good, the service at both was great! The mexican restaurant was okay, the food was better than the service. Buffet was also okay, nothing special, but we always found something to eat. The snackbar by the pool didnt really have very much selection, but again we didnt really have a problem. The cheese burgers and fries were good, chips and salsa, and cheesey nachos were readily available to snack on while drinking on the beach. The beach was pretty good, the water was pretty cloudy for the first few days, but cleared out after a thunderstorm, and was beautiful and blue for the end of our trip. Some seaweed did wash up on the beach but they did a pretty good job cleaning it up. My ratings above would have been higher, if we didnt have to spend the first couple nights in our original room. If you do go to the Ocean Maya request a villa and I think you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “i believe we have uncovered a fraud”
Reviews.Author: sennedenne
Reviews.Content: The hotel and all it's amenities were ok. You can check my ratings to see how I felt about certain things. Here' the problem. They have an internet kiosk for a $10.00 charge on a credit card. I used it twice, on July 13 and July 15, and my sister-in-law sed it on July 13. I used a credit card once and a bank card once. On my second use, I checked my credit card and bank records to make sure nothing weird was happening. To my outrage and disbelief, my Credit card and bankcard were charged $1000.00 per internet kiosk use! I called my bank and my credit card company and both said I couldn't do anything until the pending charges posted, thinking they would come off and the correct charge would show. Both charges have now posted, and I'm furious. My siter-in-law also was charged $1000.00! The company is internet kiosk serv. in SanDiego, doubt that is their real name. I did complain to the hotel but was told I needed to fill out paperwork, and they would submit it to the company. What a joke. I've contacted my institutions and they are handling it for me, but I'm also contacting a lawer and he will by contacting the internet company, and the hotel, both who will be dealing with a lawsuit. Has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: “Really great”
Reviews.Author: enoeno
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading some of other reviews and all I can say is that I think the people who complained must have stayed at a different resort. The food was great, the staff were fun (I walked by other resorts and it looked like the guests were zombies they were so bored), a nice mix of guests. The room was great. We were warned about on-going construction and really....there were the quietest workmen I've ever come across in my life (no music or yelling or power tools). I'm not sure about this upgrade for better drinks, I didn't ask about it. But, I got Bacardi every time I ordered a drink and I saw bar tenders cracking open fresh bottles that they would go through very quickly...so watering down was not possible (even if they wanted to do this, they wouldn't have the time).
