I tipped moderately and got great service....when I forgot to tip or ran out of dollars, I still got great service. The entertainment staff were cute, they did silly but fun shows. The sax player in the resturaunt was excellent. Sometimes the pool music can be a bit much. The Italian restauraunt was amazing (perhaps because the managing director of the resort is Italian). I never got bored with and of the selections at any of the locations. The people who make comments about too many locals are just rude. Like what....you're not allowed to vacation in your own country? I think it's a plus that people from Mexico want to vacation at the resort...it shows that it is a good place. And what would we say if someone dropped a comment that Disney Land was nice....but had too many Americans. Sounds kinda silly, doesn't it?. The people who ran the internet cafe were not good. They were never there when they said they would and didn't care if you got the service you paid for. You can pick up free WIFI in the lobby if you really need to send that one e-mail to your boss saying that you quit and are never coming home. Go to the resort, be happy, you'll have fun, no need to worry.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KristinaZ4833
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from a 5 day trip with my sister and had a fantastic time! Here are some specific reviews: Transportation - We booked a shuttle transfer from the airport to the hotel through Best Day Travel. Roundtrip was around $40 a person. Note: They don't give you the return ticket at the airport so you have to wait around in the lobby the following day at 3pm for the Best Day rep. However we found out the Best Day rep is in the lobby every day from 2pm-5pm so you can work this around your sightseeing schedule. The front desk will not hold the packet for you. Room: We didn't upgrade rooms(black wrist bands?) so the one we got was a normal queen size bed. The bed was a little uncomfortable but that's the only complaint I had. We got a room right by the beach so it was an easy walk whenever we wanted to go lay out. Bathrooms were nice. Drinks: I read through other reviews before we started our trip and agree with everyone else that the drinks are weak. However, we soon discovered that Corona and wine are on tap so we just had that the whole trip. Food: There are 3 restaurants and a Buffet. There is a schedule that you get when you check in on which 3 are open for dinner. All were great but it was strange to be eating Italian and Japanese when you're in Mexico. We preferred the Mexican restaurant and went twice cause it was so good! The staff is also extremely friendly! Activities: I recommend talking to Angel at the activity desk! My sister and I wanted to go snorkeling with sea turtles and he set us up on the BEST adventure for around $80 a person. We booked with Your Underwater World and were picked up by our guide Vincenzo. Make sure you ask for him cause he was so much fun! We went snorkeling with the sea turtles and then went snorkeling in a hidden cenote. The group was small with only 10 people so it was easy to talk and get to know one another.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation,but wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: kgelarden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in early June. The weather was perfect, albiet very hot and humid. We upgraded to to the VIP black wristband, which I def. recommend if you like to get your drink on. Premium liquor makes ALL the difference, that alone was worth the extra $. The VIP beach area with the Bali Beds was very nice, however we were only able to utilize them early in the morning- the glass partitions they have instead of railings block the breeze coming off the ocean, and by 10 or 11 it was simply too hot to stay there. They also advertised "beach service" for the VIP area, which was untrue;yet the other beach area where anybody can go sometimes had a waitress or bartender come by and bring you a drink. Odd, but hey, whatever. Oceanview was nice, we stayed in #1206 which was perfect-close to pool bar and steps from the ocean. Room was very nice and modern,however (as others have mentioned) the bed was so hard it actually hurt to lay on it. I did mention it to the front desk and they had the maid put 2 extra blankets under the sheet which helped alot. Our major complaints regarding this resort seemed to revolve around food- when we booked our trip they claimed to have room service (which is a must have as far as what resort we choose) and low and behold, when we asked for it we were told they discontinued it 30 days earlier. To make matters even worse, they WILL NOT ALLOW YOU TO TAKE ANY FOOD FROM A BUFFET OR RESTAURANT BACK TO YOUR ROOM. This is ridiculous! When you are on your VACATION, there may be times where you dont feel like getting dressed for dinner- I paid good money to stay there, tipped well and often, and I should be able to eat where I'd like without worrying about the food Nazi's.We were VERY unhappy about this. We absolutely LOVED the Italian restaurant, both the food and the ambiance was out this world the 2 nights we ate there. The Japanese was above average also. Didn't try the Mexican, and honestly, if we could have we would have eaten @ the Italian restaurant every night! Only having lunch available at one place got real old, real fast- so basically we would try to wait as late in the afternoon as possible to eat, so we would be tipsy enough not to care. The service @ the pool bar was wonderful!!! We would tip $5 in the morning, and then another buck or 2 every few hours, and were treated like old friends. Fernando (aka Mario Lopez) was the highlight of my trip ; ) We didn't go on any excursions, allthough we made some friends who went on the all day, all-inclusive Isle Mujueres trip and they had a ball. We did enjoy a 50 min couples massage on the beach for $95, which was def. worth it. All in all, we had a nice trip, but next time we will try either the Blue Bay or the Ocean Coral.Feel free to contact me with any questions, I know how stressfull picking a resort can be!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Globetrter
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Ocean Maya (formerly an H10), during low season this place is great. 3 friends went, had a fabulous time, full of fun, relaxation and excellent service. Room: We were upgraded to Ocean view, a new room, comfortable enough for us, clean and no complaints. No musty smell at all!! Food: I had recently stayed at the Princess (just down the beach) so really nothing can compare to the food there. I believe because we went in low season, the selection was average, nothing spectacular. Service: From the excellent front desk staff, to the bartenders, to the entertainment staff to the housekeeping staff.... Canada could take some lessons from this group. Beach: VIP section - WAY BETTER than Princess's VIP section ... however because of the pier and the boardwalk, the beach/water front can be choppy and not as clean as if you were to walk the 15 feet and enter the water from the Secret's resort (the neighbour's). The water is clear blue, white sand, CLEAN!! And you can walk and look at all the neighbouring resorts. Value for money: on par with everyone else, however if you are looking for somewhere quiet(er) in low season this may work for you. After staying at the Princess in December, this was a welcome change. If you are going in high season, I can see this resort becoming very crowded quickly. The Canadians seem to like it here!!

Reviews.Title: “good holiday, will go back”
Reviews.Author: briwill
Reviews.Content: gardens on site are immaculate and colourful, beach not great, but adequate,norberta beach waitress always coming around with drinks,beach service good.food not so good,bland,limited selection,while we were there la hacienda [ buffet restaurant] open for breakfast every morning,but only open for evening meal four times in the two weeks we were there,one of those nights was a mexican night with japanese and italian food,alright if you like that kind of food.waiter service was hit or miss,if you cannot speak spanish you are mainly ignored.bar service is excellent and friendly bar staff.entertainment team are very hard workiing and do best for evening showscould be a bit more professional.lobby bar could do with a livener, like more music although some evenings juan played his saxaphone and is very good.we upgraded to a delux room which was really good and immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay first, then ugly, disgusting last. the hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: wanderer9917
Reviews.Content: No one cheered us when we checked in. We waited disappointedly for someone to bring us to our room. We were very hungry and went to the buffet first but the waiter told us they were closing. We understood they would close at 6:00pm and the time we wanted to eat was 5:40pm.But if we were not hungry we would not do that! or at least they should tell us where we could get something to eat. anyway, the food was ok, the beach ok, the location ok(but if you want to go to Tulum,Coba&Chichen Itza by yourself, you'd better choose the hotel near Tulum. Also the beach is much better there),service ok(we tipped everyday for room cleaning so we get towel animal/kid which was very nice; waiters were so so, they worked hard but they purposely chose who to serve and who to ignore,but we did give them tip after the dinners) we thought there were too many mosquitos around but later we found out it was not just mosquitos but also bed BUGs!Yes, BED BUGs! we got big red lump around our arms and legs which were not caused by mosquito biting. Later we checked the matress, black molds all over! there were a lot of red ants on the floor and bathroom sink.My god! but it was already the sixth day of our stay, what could we do except stay?! The shuttle bus sucks. We consulted the front desk about the shuttle bus and they told us to ask a big guy dealing with trip packages. He told us to book one day in advance. We asked if we could take the bus from Carmen without taking it from the hotel. He told us it was impossible because the bus was always full. We booked one day in advance and the big guy told us it was already full but we might come at noon to see if there were seats available. We came half a hour before noon and found there were epmty seats on the shuttle bus. Security told us someone already booked the bus for going back! We said one way no problem. But they said our name were not on the list so even one way was impossible. They said it was their policy and the bus drove away with at least two empty seats! We asked explanation from the hotel. The front desk assitant asked her supervisor and told us they could do nothing. We requested to see the general manager they said impossible and brought us a complaint form. If we wanted to complain the shuttle bus we need to fill the form in front of them and hand the form over immediately. It was really ridculous! For the shuttle bus we knew there was something wrong with the big guy dealing with packages. That guy really sucks! liar, and really not a good person. It seemed the bed bug following us back home. We use lots of medcine, disinfectant detergent to cure. Thanks the bed bug suvenir, ocean maya!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: AlexaWhynot
Reviews.Content: I read all kinds of trip advisor reviews prior to our trip and quite frankly, I got scared. We had a wonderful time!!! The rooms were fine, nothing fancy but who wants to pay all that money to go to paradise and stay in their room?? Everything was SUPER clean, people cleaning all the time. It wasn't overly busy as it was the end of April into the first of May so the staff were tripping over us trying to help. The drinks were by no means watered down, those who say they are must be alcoholics (there were a few so strong I couldn't finish them!). The food was great, I really miss the coconut ice cream. The Mexican a la carte was our least favourite but the Italian and Japanese were fantastic! The entertainment staff work their butts off from early morning until late at night, they were great. The beach does leave something to be desired (we're from Nova Scotia and have beautiful beaches here so we weren't disappointed but some may be as they beach wasn't as nice as we'd hoped). However, the pools were awesome. It's a nice, small resort with lots to do and see. We recommend Delphinus and Chichen Itza tours as they were both tons of fun and lots of memories. Overall, we had a great week. I can't say enough good things about Mexico and the resort itself, I would definately recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PuntaWunta
Reviews.Content: Studied the reviews before traveling to Ocean Maya, May 19-23--our group was 8 adults and 1 child (13 months). I wasn't nervous because I knew we would have fun no matter where we were going, plus we couldn't beat the price; the all-inclusive per person price was cheaper than a direct flight from O'Hare to Vegas during that same time period, so it was a no brainer. We all upgraded to the deluxe room (black wristband) directly with the travel agent ($15 per person, per day--cheaper than the other reviews that indicated it was $25-$30 additional when they upgraded at the hotel). In my opinion, the extra money was definitely worth it. Our room was recently renovated and we had an ocean view, mini-fridge was stocked with bottled water, beer and assorted sodas, room safe was free of charge; the liquor selection was much better (Grey Goose, Don Julio, Gran Marnier, Crown Royal, Baileys, etc.), otherwise it was the "house" alcohol. Hard to tell if we got preferred treatment or not.....however, the night we ate at the Japanese restaurant there were (3) full tables and only (1) chef; our table was first. Not sure if it was wristband related or not. Food was average; we ate at the Italian "restaurant" and the service was slow. Obviously we are on vacation and not in a rush, so it wasn't a huge problem. Be sure to order a number of appetizers/salads, even entrees--portions are on the smaller side. The breakfast buffet and lunch buffet by the pool was average also; appealed to the masses. Some tasty options, some not so tasty and bland. The coffee shop in the lobby was a nice treat; espresso and cappucinos were delicious. Staff was friendly and hardworking. We did not attend any of the shows although the staff approached us frequently to remind us. There were vendors set up in the courtyard nightly; not pushy at all. Last year we vacationed at the Dreams Resort, Punta Cana and the vendors were out of control pushy; we wanted to order room service just to avoid walking thru the courtyard. Pools were nice and refreshing; swim up bar could use some touching up, but the bartenders were accommodating. The free WiFi in the hotel lobby was very nice; the fitness center is small, but nice. The only excursion we took was a cab into the downtown area (5th Ave), Playa del Carmen. Very nice, but very commercialized. The street is blocked off and there are stores on both sides--Starbucks, Ben & Jerry's, etc. My family and I had a wonderful time and that's all that matters. If anyone wants further details or has any questions, please e-mail me and I'd be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING, we were robbed!”
Reviews.Author: 154976Beachbum
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked our vacation for this resort Ocean Maya thinking we were going to have a relaxing holiday in the sun. On the second night our room was BROKEN into. The person/people who entered our room did so with a key and stole 500 (American and Canadian dollars, from both our wallets inside our room. This situation was reported to security and hotel staff IMMEDIATELY. Both management and security did not help us in any way shape or form to investigate this situation. They completely acted as if we were lying, and making false acquisitions. The manager ESTER, was very rude and ignorant!!! Our safety and security of both (us and the people on the resort ) was at risk! This incident was reported to the police. Our trip adviser "Nolitour Vacations" and REP Justina, was also extremely unhelpful. We were left on our own, without money for the entire rest of our vacation. We felt an invasion of privacy, and it ruined our first and LAST trip to MEXICO. This theft was defiantly an inside job, and when we tried to have it investigated by resort security, it showed that the room was entered while we were not there. We even have witness to prove that we were eating supper at the buffet, and interacting with fellow worker/guests at this resort. Management showed no signs of remorse and did not even extend an apology. They didn't try to accommodate us in anyway! AWFUL Vacation, AWFUL Resort.. Don't let this happen to you! STAY CLEAR of Ocean Maya Resort H10 (Playa De Carmen ).

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: NDA62
Reviews.Content: Went there April 2010. Excellent resort. Very helpful and accomodating staff. Very clean resort. Not huge so easy to get around by foot. Had my parents with me and my mom finds it difficult to get around due to arthritis, but had no difficulty. Hotel under renovations so I can't wait to go back and see the updates. Food was great and lots of variety. Do have an upgraded band policy, which we didn't do, but feel you don't really need to for the cost. Would recommend it to any, close to lots of excursions if that is what you want to do and close to Playa del carmen if you want to shop. Looking forward to going back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, inconsistent service. Not a pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: jon1045
Reviews.Content: The facilities were nice, the check-in was pleasant, but that is where the good experience ended. The food was terrible, if we went to the grill or omlette station, the person working paid little or no attention to us. Everything seemed to be recycled from another meal, or it was extremely overcooked. For 5 days we lived off of cucumbers and cheese. We went to order drinks at the pool bar after we saw people with both black and white bracelets, who ordered in Spanish getting drinks out of larg plastic cups while we were served small Dixie cups. When we asked for the larger cups were were told "those are for a different type of customer" What does that mean? We came to the conclusion that since we were not speaking Spanish, we were treated VERY differently and were basically invisible to the staff. At one point, I stood at the counter for 10 minutes with no one else in front of me waiting to get a towel. The 2 staff behind the counter saw me, then turned their backs to finish having a conversation and hooking up a stereo. I eventually had to go around the counter myself. Every aspect of this trip was not good. The only friendly people there were the grounds crew. They were the only staff members that acted like they wanted us there. I have been to H10 resorts before and they were nothing like this, that is why I chose to go to another one. Now I am not sure we will ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Decieving!”
Reviews.Author: stellastravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were wary when we read the reviews but the price was too good to pass up. We are both pretty laid back and can make the best of any situation so we decided to book it, if it was terrible we would do the tours and use the resort to sleep. As we arrived and began the drive down the long drive I just knew this place was going to be a pleasant surprise. The grounds next to the drive were immaculate and very lush! As we pulled up we were greeted by the bellhop who took care of the bags and were given a strawberry daiquiri as we stepped out of our transfer (we did the private transfer with USA transfers, definitely recommend them!) We arrived at around 2:00 pm and had no trouble with check in ...very fast! We decided to do the VIP upgrade and it was well worth it. They upgrade your room and you have access to the VIP beach area that is roped off and also had beds. Vip also gets you premium alcohol versus bar rail and first choice on restaurant reservations. We never had trouble getting into the restaurant of our choice. The bellhop brought our bags to our room and with the VIP we were upgraded to a 2nd floor ocean front room. The view was AMAZING and that to us made the upgrade worth every penny. Nothing like sitting on your balcony and watching the sunrise with a cup of coffee! The maid service was also very good...we recieved a towel art most of the days we were there. I know others have said they do not do this here but maybe it is only the VIP rooms that they do this for. The restaurants were very good. Our first night we decided to try the Japenese and we did the teppanyaki show. This was very entertaining and the food was delicious! They do this fire show and at the end they let me up to the grill to try the flipping and fire for myself. We met another fabulous couple from Maine that we ended up spending time with throughout our stay. Watch out for the saki it is potent but the saki bombs are alot of fun! Our next night we tried the Italian, the atmosphere is beautiful. It is set right on the beach and the breeze from the ocean billows through and they have long white curtians that blow around. It is a very romantic enviroment, you feel like you should have a large bill when you leave. We never did get around to the Mexican restaurant but did do both the Italian and the Japanese again during our stay. The snack shop by the pool had great snack food and they are open until 4am! We would do this during the day while down at the pool. They also have a beer and wine bar here so if the swimup is packed this one is hidden away and never busy. The pools are very nice and clean. The swimup bar is a blast and the bartenders were alot of fun! We never had any trouble getting a chair unless you want one of the beds in the VIP area, then you need to get up before 5am to get one! Overall this was a fantastic trip! We are even considering coming back next year, the value is too good not too!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Ocean Maya from May 1st to May 10th”
Reviews.Author: mcmahon1
Reviews.Content: I was really concerned after reading the reviews regarding our stay at Ocean Maya, I didnt know what to expect because of the mixed reviews, but I have to say I was pleasantly suprised, I really dont know what people expect? I am very fussy regarding where I stay, eat, see, but I didnt have any complaints, aside from the wall in the black band area which did take away from watching the ocean, and the beach area did not have the beautiful blue water that is in the Cancun area, but it was still clean & warm, There was always plenty of beach & pool chairs, We were very happy with our stay. Alezandra & Lucy at the front desk were wonderful, Nora the server in the main bar area was also great. but everyone was kind and helpful. Dont worry about going there. Its beautiful, the food is very good especially the Salmon at the Itialian restaurant , the entertainment crew really tried to make everyone happy, the coffee at Mike's place was soooo good. We upgraded to a black band and we got a great room 1203 which faced the pool & beach. I'm not sure its neccessary to upgrade, they seem to treat everyone good regardless what color of band you are wearing. We meet a great couple Penny & Pete from Chicago and spent time with them. We would go back, it was a fun time. Dont worry about this resort, we have been to the Cancun area 13 times, and this is one of the best resorts we been too.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back...Maybe...”
Reviews.Author: DamienKage01
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Mexico and our second favorite resort ( Rui Lupita is #1 and Hotel Cozumel doesn't even deserve a rating! ) Our first room's air conditioning unit was broken and we had ants, so they moved us to another room,,,it was great and spacious and clean! The only downsides to it were we always had to remind the maids to leave clean faceclothes and the fridge was never filled with anything other than one bottle of water. ( and oh, the maids don't do the little towel creations...) As an added bonus, our room was on the ground level and a giant iguana lived under our step...we named him Arnold and we fed him granola bar every morning...( Room 2001 ) The grounds are very well kept and clean and the waterfall centerpiece is beautiful. The pools are clean and big. The pool bar needs some renovating. The restaurants are great....an italian, a japanese ( the best ), a mexican, and the buffet. Food was great. The staff....oh my.....the staff cater to the locals. The week we were there, on the weekend, the resort was opened up and what seemed like half of Mexico and their kids showed up. I would stand at the pool side bar and be passed by for everyone. Very frustrating. Plus, the drinks were watered down more than usual, so always ask for a double. The beach is OK. The outside bar and all the outside furniure is packed up by 8pm, which kinda sucked. There is only one shuttle a day taking people to Playa del Carmen, so you can either pay $15 for a cab or take a 10 minute walk out to the highway and hail a shuttle van for $2, and they pass by every 5 minutes. We did the latter. The night time life was very dull...the entertainment crew were OK, but their theatre is inside and it's like a giant oven...too hot to sit in and enjoy. The discotique, if you can call it that, was empty every night. You have to pay for a lock for the room safe...$2 a day. Do yourself a favor...book at a Rui resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort-Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nomowrk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ocean Maya early in the evening. Check-in was a breeze. No "special offer" deals, no "presentation" tomorrow at 8:00am, no "tour packages". What a relief from past check-in experiences. However, we were directed to a seating area for the "supervisor" to "tell us about the hotel". Oh boy, here we go again. But after a ten-minute wait my wife simply went to the desk and asked for the room key. Pleasantly, the desk clerk politely gave us the key with directions on how to get to the room. The very best buildings at Ocean Maya are numbers 9, 12, and 36. These all have first class views of the ocean and the property, with #12 being best of the best. Numbers 10 and 33 are also very good. There are many others around those numbers that are also good, but get a second level for those so you can look over the pool or other structures to view the ocean. We were lucky this time and got room 902 which faces the ocean on the ground floor. At the time of our visit, several "Internal" buildings (say those numbered in the 20's) were undergoing renovation, but we hardly ever heard construction noise. I suppose those immediately adjacent to construction could have had some noise, but the crews were very considerate of start-stop times. There was no internet connection in the rooms but free Wi-Fi was available in the lobby. Lots of places to plug in for power and lots of places to sit with your laptop. There were also two hotel computers you could use for a very pricey $10/30 minutes, so obviously your laptop/free Wi-Fi is the way to go. As others have mentioned, the grounds are very nicely maintained, so if you don't have a beach front building, at least you will likely have a nice garden view, not overwhelming, just right. Many flowers, beautiful shrubs, cleanly kept. There are small stands of "jungle areas" interspersed on the property. A nice resort, not glitzy, but a solid 4-star. Our room was very nicely appointed, clean, well-maintained, and pleasant. Lucia, the designated housekeeper, came in every day and staightened up the room, swept the floors, cleaned the bathrooms and showers, organized, etc. A full routine every day, no extra charge. As mentioned above, the room is right on the beach, ground level, a 50-foot walk to the beach chaises and palapas. It had a king bed with a very firm mattress, but not uncomfortable. A roll-away sofa was also provided and could have accommodated two more people but there was no separation for privacy. The room was equipped with a free use refrigerator and a $2/day small safe for personal valuables. Bottled water was provided--we drank a couple and were not charged for it. We went the European Plan (EP) route whereas almost everyone else was on the all-inclusive plan. Our identifiers were yellow wrist bands. The concierge told us we were one of only four couples on the EP. The people on the all-inclusive plan wore white wrist bands. About 30% of the people were on the "premier(?)" plan--black wrist bands" which, for a substantial fee, entitled them to privileges such as reserved areas on the beach, restaurant reservation priority, etc. That may or may not be worth it if you are all inclusive, but it is definitely NOT worth if if you are EP. Why pay for reservation priority if you don't plan on eating all your meals at the hotel anyway? Besides, we had NO trouble finding good chaise lounges with a palapa shade on the beach. There were even more spaces available around the pools. On the occasions we went to a hotel restaurant for a buffet, we were charged only half the time, even though we went out of your way to show the wait staff our yellow wrist bands. REALLY. But for the OTHER half the time, the meal on non-all-inclusive was very pricey. Flat rate buffet was 200 pesos ($17USD) for OK food or even a cheeesburger. So if you are on the EP, buy your snacks at the local Mega supermarket, eat most meals in town, and very few at the hotel. We were a little disappointed by the fact that there was no real "snack bar" for mid-day meals. Everything was buffet for daytime meals. The buffet had very good selections but we just wanted a plate of nachos or something simple. There were three restaurants from which you could order from a menu for evening meals. We made the gigantic mistake of getting free tickets to Xcaret, and other trinkets, by "just attending" a 90 minute "presentation" at the Grand Mayan/Mayan Palace. When will we learn? The 90 minutes turned into 4.5 hours with FIVE different representatives hammering us with all the benefits for ownership at the Grand Mayan. An intrusive, high-pressure, disgusting pitch. Contrast that with Ocean Maya. No pressure whatsoever. When we spoke to the concierge the second day, he noted we had not met the supervisor. Then he said, he could set up a special presentation for us, but "THERE IS NO OBLIGATION WHATSOEVER!!" We said , "No" and he said, because we were on the EP he would be happy to make recommendations for restaurants, or provide other assistance. What a contrast, and thank you Ocean Maya and concierge Jaime. The weather throughout the week was very good. There were some short afternoon showers, one downpour, but everything cleared up soon enough and out came the sun. As always, it is very humid but this is on the Caribbean after all. The beach itself was a 7-8 on a ten scale. Not as wide or glistening as Cancun or Playa del Carment directly, but still pretty nice. Clean and well maintained every day. Lots of chaise lounges, palapas, nice poolside amenities. Like most places, service was a little slow on the beach (I think the black wrist strap folks get something here) so better order two at a time. Sometimes the staff just came out with a whole tray full of drinks and just handed them out to whomever, EP or not!! Drinks were weak as usual unless you ordered a double. We paid for drinks about 1/2 of the time even on the EP and even though we specifically showed our yellow bands. The ocean swimming area is in front of a boardwalk that has a plexiglass wall. In this area was sand on the ocean bottom for about the first fifty feet into the water and then it got pretty clay-ey on the bottom. No big deal but a surprise to us for the Caribbean. Oddly, the adjacent area, which was reserved for the jet-skis, para-sailers, etc. had a much better, sandier bottom for a much longer distance. As a result, most people swam in the area where the jet skis were and few swam in the other area. When the deep sea fishing boats came in, however, people were scooted away. All in all a good-enough swim beach, poor snorkeling, and a nice sunning beach. But if you didn't like the beach, there was always the pools, which were nice. Take your pick. Staff was exceedingly helpful. We didn't meet a single staff member that even showed they were having a bad day. Everyone greeted us cordially, and were truly helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BosHappy_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I decided to comment on things that are important to me so don’t judge me for these trivial details. Hopefully this review helps next travelers if they are just like me . We got an unreal package deal on Travelocity. 2 adults, 2 children (8 and 13) room total about $2000 including flight(connect via Philly). Having booked this, my expectations were very very low so I was surprised beyond my expectations having to learn that not only this is a great place, we also got deluxe rooms and black bracelets as room description on my Travelocity stated (deluxe). Black bracelets may not mean much in terms of restaurant reservation, separate beach area and nicer rooms but they mean a hell of a lot when it comes to drinks. You can not even compare national drinks and premium drink and especially how they make you feel the next day. This one big reason I would suggest people get black bracelets. Their premium brands are nice stuff not some cheap crap, however they do make you sign some form every time you order premium drink which was kind of annoying. Premium drinks they have are Don Julio tequila, Grey Goose vodka, Bombay Sapphire gin, Bacardi rum, Courvoisier v.s.o.p. cognac, Johnny Walker black, baileys etc.. all the good stuff. Anyway, some tips: Snorkeling from resort: $35/per adult, $20 per child under 12, - not a bad deal, do it, only 2 minutes from shore. Scuba=$105 includes lesson, $75 for certified divers, also 2 minutes from shore. JetSki $65 for 30minutes. Food: I have learned that 5star, 4 start 2 start, 3 start resorts on All inclusive are absolutely the same. All are eatable but plain and can not be called great. Good at best. However, breakfasts are great if you are looking to pig out(what else to do :-), omelets, eggs, waffles, beacon, hash browns, mimosas, the best. I would eat breakfast all day. Italian restaurant is OK(not fish soup) everything else good, Japanese was good at the tables not the hibachi bar. While entertaining to watch, hibachi food was uneatable. Do not go to Mexican restaurant, absolutely horrendous. Stick to buffet or Italian or Japanese. Pool beach bar had basics, burgers, hot dogs, sometimes tacos and on the pool deck barbecue, ribs chicken, good stuff. Night shows, so so, entertaining but we have seen much better in other resorts in the area(not too bad). Coffee bar in lobby was nice, good coffee. The beach is an issue if you like swimming in the ocean. Access to it is from the left or the right and the water is dirty and murky also the bottom is a bit slimy not nice sand so beach water is not great but pools are right behind and are great. If you walk about 1mile to the left of the resort, you will hit a river which goes to the ocean. It is full of fish and you can take bread from cafeteria and feed the fish while snorkeling, good visibility too. Bring highest sun screen you can get. Because the money we didn’t spend on the hotel we usually spend, we ended up doing many activities (scuba, snorkel, park(we want to EXPLORE), very cool. Zip lines, drop to water, cave river swim stalactites everywhere, etc…. It’s only 10-15 minutes away so dont let the taxi and private bus drivers tell you its 45 minutes and charge you that much($40 each way). Well, that’s it, nice and relaxing. We booked Brant’s entertainment plus for private van transport from airport $135 for 8 people, great service, great van, on time to and from, very professional. If you have large party get them, as other vans stop in all the hotels and cost you almost the same per person. All reviews I read are 100% true. The difference is whether negative items bother you or not. If you set right expectations, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Wristbands”
Reviews.Author: dogwriter
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya is a resort which has come up with a way to keep its regular visitors while adding an enticement to attract slightly bigger spenders. Traditionally, a moderate resort, they have re-done many rooms and added a "Maya Deluxe" designation which comes with a black wristband and several good to excellent perks. A three-star visitor can get a white wristband, a good beach, plenty to eat and drink in a physically beautiful resort, serviced by a friendly, hard working staff. The four star vacationer can get a black wristband, a gorgeous new room, premium drinks, priority service and a Balinese beach bed with a fantastic beach butler in a private section of the resort. Rather than lose one client in the search for new ones, Ocean Maya competes with itself for both levels of business. This may prove to be a clever business model that pays big rewards. At either price point, guests receive a wonderful, all-inclusive vacation for considerably less than other venues with similar services. The resort is comprised of two- floor Villas, each with eight rooms. This is not a resort for those with mobility issues as the meandering pathways wind through beautiful gardens and are quite spread out. The Maya Deluxe rooms have a minimalist-Zen feel, with smoked glass doors between vanity and bathroom and enormous tiled showers with plenty of hot water. There is a sitting area, a flat-screened television, stocked mini -fridge and very firm bed. Each room has sliders to a patio or terrace with tropical or aquatic views. Maid service is quite good. The biggest issue we had was forgotten coffee on one occasion. A safe is provided for Maya Deluxe and is $2.00 per day for others. There was a new iron and ironing board in the room along with plenty of good quality toiletries. We found the food in the Italian, Asian and Buffet restaurants to be very good. We went to La Dolce Vita twice and enjoyed the show cooking in the Asian restaurant. El Charro was good for lunch or a late night snack. Early risers could get coffee there without walking to the lobby. The buffet had good variety each day for each meal. This is important for an all-inclusive, because the buffet is the "fall-back" place when specialties don't appeal to all guests. The pools were large, clean and beautiful. The swim-up bar was always busy and the lobby bar was hopping at night. Mike's Coffee was great. Specialty coffees and fresh desserts were provided daily. This is located in a back corner of the lobby and was a great place to grab a cup or a frozen cafe chocolata. The beach has been an issue, but the real issue is the access to the ocean. The regular and "private" beach areas are nice. There are plenty of lounges, palapas and beach beds. Service is prompt. The left and right sides of the boardwalk and glass wall are the access areas to the water. We watched the water go from cloudy with seaweed to crystal clear in a few short hours. You are at the mercy of nature here, with sea and weather giving and taking away. The southern most entry area is usually the best bet. The entertainment team, like the rest of the staff, is hard-working and does everthing it can to keep people happy. Nightly shows are fun. Do not expect Vegas or Broadway. Ocean Maya is a good resort with tremendous value. You can go low-ball or mid-ball and get exactly what you paid for and sometimes, a little bit more. If you go with a good attitude and expectations, you will sometimes get much more than you paid for or what you expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Wisc0Girl
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 25 and stayed for ten days. When we arrived the staff was very friendly and helpful. We got served two different welcome drinks as we were in the lobby and both were delicious. The rooms were nice overall, although the beds were a little bit hard. We had beach/pool front rooms which was very convenient and I would defiantly recommend this. The grounds were beautiful! They were very well kept and there was a lot of variety. The resort is about 10 or 15 miles from Playa and a taxi costs about $14. I would defiantly recommend going to Fifth Avenue in Playa is you get the chance! The food was pretty good. The buffet had different food every night and the family favorite was the fresh pasta bar! The Italian and Japanese restaurants were really good! I would recommend going to the Japanese two nights, once or the grill and once for the sit down. The entertainment staff was awesome! They had activities going on during the day and then did the entertainment at night. The hotel also has a shuttle that goes to Coco Bongo certain nights of the week. If you have teens or young adults with you this is something I would highly recommend! All in all, we really enjoyed this resort and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: missbigfish
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we are a young fifty year old couple, traveling with no children. We arrived at 3:00 P.M. and had no problem at all checking in, it was quick and efficient. We asked for a second floor room with a king-size bed and that was not a problem at all, we were also greeted with a welcome drink, which after traveling all day was a nice treat. The bellboy helped us to our room and along the way pointed out were all the restaurants were located. Let me say YES there was a smell of sewer at this resort. The room we got was fine and perfect for us. We opted not to upgrade and get the black bracelets, and after speaking with a few people of the perks from this bracelet the only thing which would have been nice was to be able to make dinner reservations in the sit down restaurants....We did eat at the Italian, Mexican and Japanese restaurants and only had a slight wait at each of these restaurants. The Italian and Mexican were good, honestly, I was disappointed with the Japanese, but since we did not have the “black” bracelets we were not seated at the “Hibachi Table” were the chef cooks in front of you, we were seated in the main section and ordered off of the menu. The breakfast buffet was very good and had everything you could want for breakfast, including mimosas and bloodymarys. At lunch you had the option of eating at the buffet, which we only did one day and that was also good, or eating at the snack restaurant near the beach/pool, which in the evening is the Mexican restaurant. They offered snack type foods for example hamburgers, hot dogs, French fries, chips, salsa, salad, wings and enough things for us to nibble on for lunch. Drinks at this resort were fine, and we never had a problem being served. We were served by “Betty” on the beach and she did a great job delivering drinks to us all throughout the day. Entertainment at night was put on by the Activity Team and they did an OK job, on Monday night they have a “beach party” and that was actually very nice, so do try to attend that. Service here was wonderful, everyone was very nice and helpful....Remember a tip does go a long way, and honestly I witnessed alot of people who did not tip, which really was a shame, since everyone there always had a smile and were eager to get you anything you needed. As noted is previous reviews the grounds at this resort were absolutely beautiful and well maintained... The beach was also nice, but if you are looking for crystal clear water DO NOT choose this resort. Everyone spoke of a glass retaining wall and that was also fine and did not take away for the beach at all. Beach chairs were always available, but the resort did fill up on Friday to Sunday with local people on holiday. Pools were large and clean. Towels at the “towel hut” were always available. They only have one free shuttle to Playa del Carmen and it was 12:00 until 5:00, honestly, it is just too hot there during the day, so we opted to take a cab into town one night and the cost was $14.00 and about a 15 minute ride. Previous reviews said there AC did not work, ours was fine, except for one day it leaked very badly into our room, word of warning DO NOT place your suitcase under the wall mounted AC, if ours was there everything it is would have been wet. We told the front desk and someone promptly came to fix it. In closing you do get what you pay for, so if you are expecting a 5 star resort and want to be totally pampered with high-end things, do not book this resort. But if you get a good deal and just want to relax, this resort is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, good service----muy bien!”
Reviews.Author: SpringBreakGetAWay
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens; nice pools; great buffet; great Japanese and Mexican restaurants; cool wifi lobby and nice lobby bar. Lots of cool iguanas! Room size was very nice, bed was firm but comfortable and very quiet; AC in room worked beautifully! We're not picky drinkers and found the white bracelet drinks and service to be very adequate! Pool area could use a few more umbrellas and regular chairs. A few umbrellas would be nice as well as that caribbean sun can get pretty hot mid-day:)! We like to explore town and found the $28 round-trip taxi fee a bit high because we visited two times. If you like to hang out in town, find a resort closer---and there are many! The resort could use a few more teen-based activities--arcade, climbing wall, better organized pool activities, for example. The disco could have been fun had it been air conditioned! Way too hot for dancing. Also, the resort is very large and requires significant walking to restaurants, pool, and lobby. Be prepared! Overall we had a very nice vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Pookamunga
Reviews.Content: We had a great view of the ocean, but we couldn't swim in it. The bed was harder than a board but the room size was ample. The grounds were well kept, everything was well groomed. The hotel staff lacked in efficiency when it came to problems with our room i.e. leaky ceiling and broken remote for tv. It took 3 days to get our tv fixed. The food at the buffet lacked in seasoning and often seemed bland. Would have expected a bit more spice with the cuisine. The al a carte restaurants were better but the mexican restaurant also lacked the heat one would expect from mexican food. The sushi was excellent. Would have gone there more if we could. Didn't take in any of the entertainment as it seemed to be poorly organized. Dominican Republic entertainment was 10x the quality due to staff encouraging guests to join in and musical productions were professional entertainment companies. Will travel to Mexico again but will stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price, but probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: SBG125
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip at H10 Ocean Maya (all inclusive place) based on the price and the reviews were okay (some good, some not so good). We've learned to take reviews with a grain of salt. But after having been there, we now understand the bad and "so-so" reviews. Best Parts: Room: Nice and clean, no problems with bugs or sewer smell. Made service was good, especially when you give them a few dollars here and there. We had upgraded to the "Ocean View" rooms and were happy we did. Try to get an upstairs room if possible. Hotel Grounds: Beautiful. Everything was meticulously maintained (grass, plants, trees, water features, etc.). Staff: Very friendly, spoke enough english to not have any issues. (we try and speak spanish, which they appreciate). Wait staff at main buffet seem to be a little understaffed. We sometimes had to wait for drinks or coffee at the buffet, but it's easy enough to go and get your own and bring it back to your table. If you want to be waited on hand & foot (not us) this isn't the place for you. Entertainment staff were very friendly & enthusiastic, although the shows were a little too "cheesy" for us, but some people loved them. Specialty Restaurants: We really enjoyed the Japanese & Italian specialty restaurants. Mexican restaurant was a little disappointing. My husband had a chile relleno that was literally COLD. My daughter had chicken fajitas that were just "okay". I had enchiladas that were okay, but have had better here in Colorado. If you're going during a busy time, be sure to make your reservations in advance. (this is sort of a drawback). But...these specialty restaurants were much better than the buffet. More on that below. The Worst Parts: Main Buffet & Beach Bar / Grill: Food at both the main buffet and the beach restaurant (doubles as mexican place at night) was pretty mediocre. The buffet basically had the same thing every night with very slight variations. We realized pretty quickly we should try and take advantage of the other "specialty" restaurants instead. The beach grill was also pretty bad. No mexican food during the day whatsoever. Just hamburgers & hotdogs, chips, salsa, fries, salads. No fresh fish, (I love fish tacos). We ended up going to the main buffet for lunches (a little inconvenient if you're planning on staying at the beach/pool all day). At least at the buffet I could make my own fish or chicken tacos with freshly grilled items. We LOVE real, authentic mexican food and it was pretty hard to find here. Even the "Mexican Fiesta" night at the buffet was so-so. Overall, the pico de gallo and chips were pretty good, but guacamole was pretty bad. The Guac didn't taste fresh at all - it was like it came from one of those plastic pouches you find in the produce section when you can't find good ripe avocados. Very disappointing. Bars: Drinks are small and watered down. Seems typical of an all-inclusive place. Even when you ask for something straight up on the rocks (vodka, tequila, etc.) it is NOT the real thing. My daughter's "virgin" margaritas were better tasting than the real thing. That's sad! Beach: This was one of the most disappointing aspects. We are beach people, and like to be right at the beach, with easy access to the ocean. The photos don't show you the big "wall" directly in front of the main beach - probably put in place due to all the beach errosion from hurricanes recently. It's like a barricade of sand bags that runs parallel to the ocean, and they've built a boardwalk on top - so people walking down the beach can get across it, and they have plexiglass railings (so you can see the ocean). Behind "the wall" there's a ton of beach chairs, palapas, on a big sandy area for sunbathing, with easy access to pools. If you're more of a pool person, you'd probably be very happy with the setup. As you're facing the ocean, to the right of the "wall" there is a small beach area with chairs & palapas and easy access to ocean, which is were we spent most days. (Except...that's where they have the sailboats & wave runners going in & out). Fortunately, there wasn't a ton of boat activity, but might be annoying to some people. To the left of the wall is another small beach area, but just a little ways from that is the pier and a big jetty type thing and the water is a bit murky over there. Water / Ocean: Water in general was not really clear -- looked pretty from a distance, but if you want to snorkel, this isn't the place for you. If you went swimming in the ocean the bottom is only sandy for a little ways, then gets a little muddy / slimy. Location: You're still pretty far from Playa Del Carmen, so if you want to go into town, you have to make a reservation for the free shuttle service (leaves hotel at 12 and returns at 5). We couldn't get a reservation one day, so we hired a taxi and spend about $15 each way. For $800 USD per person (including air, 8 nights & all food / drinks) this was a great trip for me and my family. But...we won't be going back. I'd rather pay a little more and have better ocean/beach, food & drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: MeemahNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and it will not be our last. The hotel was lovely with beautiful grounds. I think it was an older hotel but everything was well groomed and maintained. The food was the best I have ever eaten on a resort. The Japanese restaurant was fabulous-we ate there twice. There was never a meal that there wasn't something good to eat and we are very fussy eaters. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Anyone who doesn;t like this resort should just stay home. The swimming pools were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weather”
Reviews.Author: krista&mark
Reviews.Content: Well where to start?? We got what we paid for! It was an overall good resort and if I were the type of person to stay att he same resort twice we would go back but we never stay at the same place twice! Check in/out was smooth and had no problems, had requested a room on the second floor and we got it. Food: was adequate but somewhat repeatitive at times. We only tried the Mexician a la carte and it was not great! Line ups were too long to bother to wait at the other 2 places so we mostly ate at the buffet. The snack bar was good(great wings)! We did not upgrade to the premium and felt we were not treated any different! got good service at the bar and restaurant. Beach:was good never had a problem getting a spot under a hut no matter what time we went down. Actually the premium although they had beds on the beach their beach selection was small compared to the rest and you would have had to get there early for those. Water wasw murkey but went in anyway and it was warm. Pools were clean and a bit cool but once you got in it was great! Room was spacious and clean and everything worked well except for the last nigh out air conditioned and light did not work we went to the front desk and it was fixed right away! The staff work hard and it shows! If you want to party a lot don't bother to stay here but if you want to relax this is the place for you! Overall a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Do you know what you are looking for, what makes you happy, and how much you want to spend for it?”
Reviews.Author: Vyletnici
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to thank all reviewers who are giving me great info input before I and my young family goes on vacation. This year we wanted to go back to Mexico, and of course, prices are even at the time of spring break still far the best comparing to other Caribbean countries. We chose this hotel because of the price w/combination of good reviews. And I am glad we did it. This hotel is smaller resort comparing to large XCaret Flamingo types. This worked out well, since the pools were less crowded and we did not have to fight for the spot on the beach or by the pool. Rooms are spacious and clean every day - even your sheets. Of course, you might experience some toilet problems, broken TV, no heat water - if you report it, a service team will try to take care of it immediately. However, if the problem is big, then you might end -up not having hot water for few days. On the other side, this can happen at Hilton's as well. Ask for another room and I am sure they would be happy to help you with this. Food: Great Mexican food, high standard of buffet style, great selection - all at La Hacienda . As somebody pointed out, dinning at other teo restaurant is for guests w/white bracelet a huge problem. By now I don't understand why this resort is not using booking system for all guests. Can you imaging waiting for the table 45 minutes w/half-sleeping child? We gave up. After all, we went to Mexico to try Mexican food, right? Black wristband: I am glad I did not buy it for extra charge of $35/person/day. Save your money, there is really nothing extra. Extra drinks? Well, we don't drink alcohol anyway. Because of special beach area? Do not be jealous, they had just extra 15x7 meters of beach area, which was framed by the glass fence. Many guests w/children stayed at the pool area w/us, anyway. Services: People working in this resort are very nice, helpful, and hardworking. But this is standard for Mexican vacation at least per our experience, which we are thankful for. But back to vacation at Ocean Maya by H10. Hotel seems to be more family, middle age & older couple oriented. They offer kids club and night entertainment for adults and kids ( if they are still awake at 8.00 pm). Overall, we liked our stay at the hotel. Low key, smaller resort w/beautiful landscaping, few iguanas and other people-adapted wild animals, beach was nice, pool as well. Food was great, clean room, everything was accessible. Please make decision based on what you are really looking for on your vacation. If it is peaceful area w/nice beach, not crowded, great food, smiley and helpful people (Jonathan, Zayda, Manuel, Captain Marco, Jorge - thank you for getting us chair when my child fell asleep, great gesture!, etc...) and the price is just fantastic. If you are young single person who wants to party, I guess go to some other resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Mexigood
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Ocean Maya and had a fabulous time. We did not do the upgrade to black brackets and still received good service, food, and drink. Although our beach section was small, there was no shortage of chairs. You can also walk the rest of the beach for miles checking out all the other resorts. The water is a little murky until you are out a ways. I think if you want better beach front you have to upgrade to a better hotel or go to a different country. Even at the higher end resorts, their beaches were not that great!! Our minor complaints were that they ran out of beach towels a couple times and the beds were pretty hard. The service staff was outstanding, but the resort was understaffed. Simple things like getting coffee in the morning could take a while. Overall for the money is was very good and would return. We did a Snorkel tour and scooter rental on Cuzumel that was $67 each and well worth the money. We booked at a tour agency right in the ferry terminal in Playa Del Carma. If you are adventurous you can take the local bus to playa for $1.50. The taxis is $14. I would recommend it as you get to see the local scene before you hit the tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Non smoker hell”
Reviews.Author: nonsmoker111
Reviews.Content: All rooms smell like an old pool hall and are all equipped with 3 ash trays even though they say it's non smoking and you can't go near the central lobby/courtyard/restaurant/nightclub without being in cigarette smoke. Everywhere you go smokers fill the air and even in your room the neighbors smoke comes into your room. Regular rooms are almost unbearable for non smokers so after smelling 4 rooms we upgraded to a deluxe room at an additional $60 per night. Restaurants are all open air so you get constant smoke while eating. If it was actually a non smoking hotel it would be an amazing place for families or romance but unless you want to second hand smoke all the time avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but do your homework!”
Reviews.Author: Newfie70
Reviews.Content: Wow..Where to begin..I read several reviews on trip advisor before making a final decision to book at the Ocean Maya. Last year we stayed at the Ocean Turquesa and knew not to believe the things that people knit pick about in their reviews. So here is the "Real Deal"..The grounds at the Ocean Maya are absolutely Beautiful, very well kept up and it shows. As you may or may not be aware, some of these resorts have been built on swamps so sometimes if it is really humid you will get an odour-but this is normal!! The architecture is very nice. Each villa contain 8 rooms and there are 35 villas on the resort. The first night we arrived we had previously requested an above ground room however none were available upon check in. So for the first night we stayed on the ground level. This particular room was not one of the recently upgraded but was still very nice. Just to make sure that you know exactly what you are getting when you book you should ask your travel agent or the hotel itself. We paid $897.00 pp + taxes for 7 days. All of your meals are included of course, most alcoholic drinks, and towels for the beach. This is for the people who booked and are issued the "White Bracelets". There is NO safe, NO mini bar, NO service on the beach, and NO international drinks. And forget about getting into the restaurants WITHOUT a reservation, if you want to get in reserve in advance. We upgraded on the 2nd day to the "Maya Deluxe" rooms which cost us about $25.00 extra pp per night. They are newly upgraded and have new fixtures and furniture and were above ground. Once we upgraded we had all of the extras that I listed above that we did not have before. However, at the Ocean Turquesa that we stayed at last year all of those "extras" came with a basic booking. And these are sister resorts! There is also a roped off private area at the beach that only people who upgrade with the maya deluxe "black bracelets" can get use of. They have beds with canopies there too..You know you will have to get up around 6am or so to put out your towels, sunscreen and maybe a book to let people know you have it reserved. OKAY the BEACH. Yes people there is a section of the beach that has a retaining wall to keep the beach from further eroding. It does NOT look horrible!! They have clear glass walls in that section so you still have full view of the ocean. The rest of the beach is beautiful, there is LOTS of beach that is NOT behind the retaining wall and lots of ocean to walk into and go for a swim...People on previous reviews made such a BIG DEAL about the small portion of the beach that has a retaining wall but "Boy are they picky"!! Now the Food- Okay, after staying at a much larger resort last year where the VARIETY of food was abundant, it was a little different for us this year. This is a much smaller resort so there is NOT as much variety however, the FOOD WAS STILL GOOD. My stomach can sometimes be delicate so if I didn't happen to like what was cooked for a certain meal, there was lots of fruits, breads, deli, cereals, etc.. for me to choose from. The SERVICE- If you upgrade and happen to get service at the private beach area, PLEASE ask for "Edgar". He was one of the highlights of our stay at this resort. He speaks very good english and has worked in the resort business for a while so feel free to ask him anything about the resort or surrounding areas. Somedays the service for refilling the mini bar ran very late so hope your not too thirsty..lol...The ENTERTAINMENT-you have to realize that this is a smaller resort. There is entertainment EVERY night and they can NEVER get enough people to participate so bring your energy and your dancing shoes because they try really hard! Each night is a different theme and they really try to bring the energy. Swimming pools are very nice and of course the swim up bar was awesome! Remember they are NOT outdoor heated pools so they do not allow swimming at night! But they are a great temperature to cool off during the day! It is NICE to go for a walk on the beach to look at other resorts, however if you are standing up looking out into the ocean-go for a walk on the beach to your right...If you turn left the beaches along the resorts on that side are not very nice at all..Actually some resorts have an embankment to go over before they can even gain access to the ocean. All in all it was a pretty good trip. Obviously some people are more picky than others. We are only going by what we experienced two years in a row visiting the mayan riviera. We would definatley return to the cancun-mayan riviera area but probably NOT at the same resort again...

Reviews.Title: “This place is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: timest
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya is very nice for the price. The service was pretty good. The front desk staff was just OK. The service at the pool bar was a little slow.. I would recommend bringing thermal cups to make fewer trips to the bar and to keep your drinks nice and cool. The restaurants were very good. I especially liked the grill section of the Japanese restaurant. However, the Italian place had the best food The room was very spacious and always cleaned. The bed was very firm, but not uncomfortable. I enjoyed early mornings on our private porch. The location of this resort is somewhere in the middle between Cancun and Playa. If you're looking for nightlife I'd stay somewhere closer to town to avoid taking a shuttle or taxi. The "shows" at Ocean Maya are not very good, but the entertainment staff does try. The amenities are very good. We didn't pay extra for the black band, but we're perfectly happy with our chairs on the beach and waiting for the second seating at dinner. All in all it was a great get-away.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel of NO”
Reviews.Author: playachic
Reviews.Content: This hotel had beautiful rooms, beautiful grounds, beautiful pool and beach....but as soon as you asked for something the answer was NO. The first night we arrived they ran out of tequila! How does that happen in Mexico at an all inclusive hotel? you were only offered the lowest of low well liquor...if you asked for something with higher quality they said no, extra 50 pesos.....now remember this is an all inclusive hotel!!!!!!!!!!! One night i asked for a glass of champagne, answer, No, we dont have any, meanwhile there were three bottle of champagne behind the bartender. The drinks were served in small dixie cups and there was not a lot of food options...same thing everyday at lunch. the service at the lobby bar was the best, all the other bars the bartenders kind of ignored you unless you had the black wrist band which was for VIP and deluxe members. over all service was horrible. if you stay here get the black wrist band bc that is evidently the only way you dont get ignored. The wait staff comes up to you on the beach if you are wearing black bands. One good thing is their Spa. They run specials every day...and ask for Zacky, hes the best there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: ontario2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocean Maya Resort March 20-27, 2010 and the resort was wonderfull. Location was perfect not too far from the airport and close to playa Del-Carmen. The beach was very nice with lots of room and no problem getting a spot to relax. Food was great we ate at all 3 restaraunts (no reservations required) and the main buffet and there was no problem with any of them. Please do not believe the bad reviews for this resort as you will not be dissapointed we have stayed at many resorts in our travels and this is one we would have no problem returning to. Yes the beds are very hard but if you go on your holiday to sleep then you should stay home. Lots of hot water everytime we showered. We did not upgrade to the ocean front rooms so I cannot comment on them as they were an additional 30.00 per person per nite and we felt that this was not worth it for us, yes you do get a black wrist band that gives you a special location on the beach and so called premium liquor but it is not necessary unless you cannot drink anything else. All the drinks were very good and the beer was nice and cold. All in all a very solid 4* for this resort. For further information or any questions contact me at sylandkim@sympatico.ca

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: gmtc03
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before I went, and that made me a little leery because it was my first time to Mexico and I wanted it to be an enjoyable stay. However, I had an amazing time and it seemed like everyone else there did too. It wasn't perfect, but overall I thought it was a great resort well worth visiting. Here goes... Bracelets: -The upgrade vs. non-upgrade -- we had the black bracelet which means the upgrade. As people have said on here, its 25 per person a night, and I think it was worth it but not necessary. It gives you access to premium drinks, dinner reservations, a remodeled room, access to a different canopy beds on the beach (which were great), and a stocked minibar. I didn't see one of the non-upgraded rooms so they may be fine; our rooms were great though. Rooms: they were gorgeous and modern, big shower, never had a problem with AC or hot water, balcony, mini fridge, flat screen tv...etc. Only complaint here were the beds, but like others have said, not that big of a deal - I slept fine for 5 nights. Again, not sure what the other rooms were like but ours was awesome. Grounds: beautiful! I also loved that there were little villas instead of just a big resort - very spacious and beautiful. Lobby was also amazing, we loved to hang out there before dinner playing cards, etc. Pools and beach were great too - yes there is a short wall but other than that there is clear access to the beach. Food: We never had a problem with the food. We were only there for 5 nights, and I suppose if we had stayed longer the buffet could have gotten repetitive but we ate at all the different restaurants and they were pretty good. Mexican one was alright - nothing special. If you do get the upgrade - piece of advice - when you get there make your reservations at whatever restaurants you want to try for the next few nights. That way you can pretty much choose your time. If you do it the day of sometimes you're stuck making them later (if thats what you want then no biggie, but we tended to want to eat earlier). If you don't have the upgrade, although other reviews said they only had to wait a few minutes, when we were there, we heard the host telling those w/o reservations it would be at least an hour and a half wait. I guess it just depends - but if thats a priority for you id definitely recommend the bracelet. Staff: amazing!!!! they are so friendly and go out of their way to help you out. The staff and the grounds were most impressing aspects of the resort. We saw the Grease show as well - they do try really hard, but this is not the place for great entertainment. They do announce "bar crawls "etc they have going on in either playa del carmen or cancun. We ended up just going by ourselves to playa one night and cancun another which was a good time. Also, if you know you want to go into Playa one day make your reservation early!! We tried to book on Tuesday morning for Weds. or Thurs. and they were already full. We ended up just taking a cab is only about 14 dollars to Playa and then you can come and go as you please. We didn't do any excursions through the resort so I'm not sure how those are - we were content just staying at the resort during the day. Overall, it was a great time and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a more relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: frieda
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 5 relaxing and entertaining nights at Ocean and had an excellent time! If you want to have wonderful and friendly service during the day and fun, often slapstick, shows at night this is the place to go. The grounds are gorgeous and the extra $5 to use the hot tub in the spa before dinner is worth it! Get the poblano pepper in the mexican restaurant and take Edgar up on delivering you the "perfect" drink. Nelly and Miguel will make you want to dance the night away and if you upgrade to a black bracelet you can take advantage of very comfy seating on the beach and a room with an ocean view. We were sad to leave but hope we can go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good times.”
Reviews.Author: carribeanlovah
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico. (Been to Cuba, D.R. and Jamaica) It is very different as a whole as compared to Caribbean countries. I enjoyed it immensely. The check in process was quite easy. Very beautiful lobby, sort of lukewarm reception. We were not told about the deposits required to use the safe nor were we given towel cards. Our rooms weren't ready upon arrival so we had to wait about 3 hours until we were able to get into our rooms. That was tough but we'd experienced that before at other resorts. The room was okay. The beds were extremely hard. The tile floors were in rough shape, looking dirty but they were just badly scratched. The walk-in tile shower was nice. Otherwise, nothing extraordinary. I dont spend much time in my room whilst at a resort, so it served its purpose. Regardless of the bad bed, I slept really well! The beach was nice. Not enough chairs by the pool though. I love, love, loved the bartenders at all the bars (Edgar, a "Trip Advisor" favorite, Fernando, Filiberto at the pool bar and the young cutie pies who worked the evenings at the lobby, forgot their names). They were all very nice and muy rapido considering how busy they were! Hard workers they are. The drinks were great! All the frozen blender drinks were fantastic. Try the "ACC" (Amaretto, Cherry and Coconut) or Miami Vice. My favourites. The food was great. Breakfast was great, fresh fruit, omelettes freshly made, etc. We ate at all three "specialty" restaurants. The Japanese was my favourite, the Italian was good, and I actually liked the Mexican restaurant (as opposed to many other reviewers). I found the buffet really good as well. Fresh fish, fresh fruit, many choices. The entertainment staff was great! I thought their shows were awesome. And a few of them are really easy on the eyes....(Victor and Jesse...hoLA!). I really loved Isabel (I think that's her name). She smiled all the time and seemed to really enjoy her job. Some of them looked a bit tired or annoyed with the tourists which for some reason made me feel bad or annoying. Their "Grease" show was so cute! Good job guys! The nightlife wasn't so great. It really died out as soon as the evening show was done. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone looking to party hard at the hotel only. Get there early or you wont have a chair! My only big complaint was the white bracelet/black bracelet. Being a lowly white bracelet bearer, I really felt lower class as compared to the black bracelets. I think this should be eliminated entirely. If some people wish to pay more for their room, that's fine - but I don't think we should be separated in classes for treatment : lower class (white bracelet) higher class (black bracelet) super higher class (timeshare holder). All in all - had a great time. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Was much better than expected from previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Debhw
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ocean Maya last week and had a great time! We booked a couple months early and went to this resort because it was the only one that could accomodate our particular travel dates. After booking it, we read the reviews and we were quite nervous about all the bad reviews. There were a few things I was unhappy about in comparison to other like-resorts we have traveled to before. Although I am giving you the negatives, they didn't affect us as far as having a good time. Many of the staff do not speak English so they were difficult to talk to. Also, about 10% of them just seemed rude while another 40% of them were just neutral - not rude but not as friendly as I have grown to expect from the other all-inclusives we have been to. 50% of them were friendly and helpful. Also, even though they have 3 restaurants and you don't have to make reservations (and cannot unless you upgrade), they don't make it easy to get into the restaurants. They all open at 6:30 - if you want to go, you need to be there by 6:00 at the latest (recommend 5:45) because they reserve many of the tables for those who upgraded and they reserve them for the entire evening. It's as if they really don't want you to go to the restaurants - and the service is slow - very slow. However, the Italian and the Japanese restaurants were excellent - Jorge, our waiter, in the Italian restaurant, was very friendly and was very kind to my daughter (21)who was practicing her Spanish with him. The Mexican restaurant was okay - I expected more from it since, after all, we were in Mexico. Another area of concern was how hard the beds were - yes they were the firmest mattresses I have ever experienced - however, don't know if there is something wrong with us or not, but we all found them really, really comfortable to sleep on - even our 21, 24 and 25 yr olds agreed. Next concern - the beach - there really is a sea wall - but it didn't affect the view of the ocean from the hotel or pool at all. If you wanted to be on the beach closer to the ocean, it was just steps away. We enjoyed having the pool area right next to the beach. The view from here was nice. We loved lounging around the pool and found the grounds to be beautiful. This is a smaller resort than we usually go to and we enjoyed the serenity of it. The layout of the rooms is very nice. The entertainment staff was just ok - they kept things going - sand volleyball, water polo, dance lessons, etc. The kids participated in many of the activities. The shows at night were really bad- they gave it their all but they just didn't measure up to what we've seen at other places. Sophie, the conceirge (spelling may be wrong!), gave us great info on places to go - however, she hadn't been outside the lobby in the resort so she couldn't give directions to any of the places within the resort which I found odd. We told her we were interested in zip lining and she recommended Xplore which was the most incredible place to go - 11 zip lines, rafting and swimming through caves, and a jeep tour plus lunch included. All of this for $129 per person including transportation from hotel! All in all, it was a fun time - would we go back to this particular resort? Maybe - we'd check around the area first to see what was available before deciding - Since there is no maybe as far as recommending, I would say yes only because I wouldn't not go if others were interested in this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort and Staff... So glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: iwillgothere
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to come back and write a great review after reading so many mixed reviews. I got my wish! To start with, I had booked this vacation in December then broke my foot in February and decided to keep the reservation. Check-in – We arrived around 9:30. When we got there we had requested a handicap room, but my agent forgot to cancel the prior request for an ocean view (2nd floor). They were going to switch it, but we thought we should try the room and see first. They had upgraded us as a thank-you for not cancelling the trip I guess so the room was great and we heard the ocean and unpacked immediately. Room – Our room was fabulous, great view and spacious. Villa 3707. The rooms with a sofa have pullout beds inside (some people didn’t know that). If you want to know the weather or time (hard to find clocks since the idea is that time doesn’t matter) checkout Channel 21. It had great tunes, mostly 80’s, that didn’t have repeats that we heard for about 3 days, but we only listened in the morning and just before dinner. Our room was very clean. This room was also close to 2 of the restaurants and the pool and beach. If you book early enough, definitely book a villa and not a room in the hotel.
