We didn’t spend a lot of time in our room, but we liked it when we were there. There are 2 things that weren’t perfect. One was the outside wall of the patio had some peeling paint, they are repainting and hadn’t made it to the last one yet. The beds were not great, not horrible, but def not like being at home. Beach - The beach was cleaner than I had pictured from the reviews, there is plenty of room and chairs to use. The upgrade got us a members only area which had a walkway, it was beautiful. Pool - There are 2 plus a kiddy pool. They were beautiful and never too packed since the beach was right there and people would use the day for daytrips a lot too. Entertainment- The shows were good and humorous too. This isn’t Vegas; these people perform different shows every night so I was impressed with the quality. The shows are mostly family friendly and a lot of times get the audience highly involved. The disco is what you make it, if you have a good crowd with you, it can be fun, otherwise I would recommend the nightlife in town. During the day there was always something going on by the pool for kids and/or adults. There is also a kids club from 9-5 so that parents can have some free time. Shuttle: There is a free shuttle into Playa from 12-5 every day, be sure to book the day before. Cleanliness – We found the rooms and the entire resort to be very clean, there was always someone cleaning and the bathrooms were great. The grounds also need to be mentioned, they were beautiful and immaculate. The pictures (which I had thought may have been adjusted for colour) do not do this resort justice. Staff- Amazing!!!! They were accommodating, friendly, funny and always ready to help. I wouldn’t use the swim-up bar, much quicker to get out of the pool and grab your drink then pop back in. The service is as fast as it can be, but remember that you are there to relax and the mood there is also relaxing. We never had a problem with waiting a few minutes, but we also brought oversized travel mugs. Restaurants- You can only make dinner reservations if you upgrade to the black bracelets, but even without reservations people were almost always seated immediately or within 15 minutes. The morning buffet was always good in our opinion, there was an omelette station which was great. I would recommend grabbing the soda glasses near the soda machines for your juice though. Behind the bar in the main lobby there is a coffee bar which had the yummiest hot chocolate and treats were also available. The lunch buffet was also great and mixed up food choices. The snack bar near the pool had typical stuff, it was okay. At night: The Italian had a romantic atmosphere (which was lost on us), but the food was amazing, a lot of choices for food here. Japanese: We ate at the grill where the food was cooked in front of you, twice! I would recommend that seating arrangements. Mexican: It was just okay, only ate there once. Buffet: Good again  Drinks: Very good and yummy, at all locations. Some people on here had complained that there wasn’t enough alcohol in the drinks, but as my friend pointed out, you shouldn’t taste the alcohol in a good drink. And we watched them pour, they are not weak! Money: We did not exchange for pesos, only used American. And $1 tip goes a long way in a country where minimum wage is $4 a day. Overall we loved this place. We were treated like royalty and respectfully, always had service with a smile. North Americans could take some customer service lessons from these staff members! A fabulous place for a great price. I think the fact that we were given the upgrade made our stay better, but hung out with people who didn’t upgrade and loved it still. I would recommend this to people in their 30’s and up, friends, couples and families. If you are looking to party it up, look elsewhere. I also think that if you are a timeshare member, this may not meet your expectations. I do not typically go to the same place twice, but I would consider this again if the price was right and would definitely look into their sister resorts. PS- We got pictures of all our favourite staff except Eber, a bartender in the main lobby, if anyone has one to share, please let me know!

Reviews.Title: “between average and good”
Reviews.Author: MojieLeshures
Reviews.Content: This review is a few years too late, but a review nonetheless. It was known as the H10 Hacienda at that time. Went as a group of 4 friends in our early 20s. The beach had very soft white sand - if you dove for the volleyball, it wouldn't scrap your knees at all. The food was good. I wouldn't say great but somewhere in between good and great. The Japanese a la cart was fairly iffy - I wouldn't recommend the trouble of making a reservation for that place. Service was good. At that time, they had a promotion with their sister hotel right on cancun strip. The ONLY CATCH was that we had to check out of H10 Hacidenda/Ocean Maya at 10 and take the free 1hr shuttle to Cancun only to wait around for a few hours before we could check in there. Then the same goes when we got back to Playa - and we got different rooms when we got back. We weren't bugged about the time shares, probably because we all looked freshly 18. We talked to some other Canadians (there seemed to be plenty of us!) who had families and what not, and they shared their stories of harassment. Service was good. Other than the "Do not disturb" signs they have barely stay on the door handles. Our first room didn't even have one so the first morning, we had EVERYONE knocking on the door. The maid a few times, even the electrical guys who ended up fixing the light bulb has we slept off a hangover. And even the cable guy! It seemed like their whole posse was out to get us out of bed! You could imagine, that was incredibly annoying. Next time I'm going somewhere, I think I may make my own do not disturb sign that I know will stay on to save me from the too-crazy-night-before 'headache' The disco was kinda cheesy as there would only be a few ppl down there. The nightly shows they put on weren't spectacular but it was entertainment. Personally, I wouldn't go back as I would want to check out other resorts. I didn't know about this site at the time, which I find a lot of great tips in the reviews. I would recommend it for a young family. It's very quiet (esp compared to Cancun). You know your children would be safe. The staff is great with all ages. For the spring breakers, I wouldn't recommend this place. For the relaxed couple who likes to party it up every blue moon, I think this is a great place. It's only a 10(?)min cab ride into Playa de Carmen. We asked the young hotel staff what is a good place to go dancing the night away in town and they recommended Bali, which we had a GREAT time! Especially the ladies because that particular night, ladies drank for free! :) All in all, I'd just say.... between average and good :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kcunio
Reviews.Content: Check In was a breeze. Our room (villa 25) was lovely. A light wentout in our room in the morning and was fixed by early evening- no problem. Service at all bars and restaurants was excellent- the staff are very friendly and eager to please. Drinks are wells but Corona is on tap and bartenders can make almost anything. The Japanese was fun and the food was decent food court at the mall Japanese. The Italian had the best atmosphere. Food and presentation were nice. . The Mexican was your average chain Mexican restaurant- decent. . The buffett was above average and there was plenty of variety to choose from. The entertainment staff put on a good show every night- they work very hard and do a nice job trying to make you laugh. This is not a party resort and the disco has no atmosphere so go downtown if you want to really party. The beach is beautiful and you can lay rightin front of the beach. The water was great and there were plenty of lounge chairs. We went for a relaxing sun holiday and that is exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “What a TRIP !!!”
Reviews.Author: capelite
Reviews.Content: This was my first time ever away on vaca i loved it the grounds were verry clean and beautiful the staff was great always there to serve you they work verry hard i loved gillberto that worked at the pool bar he is great he knew what i wanted as soon as he saw me there fast and funny too the rooms were great plenty of hot water to shower i felt my stuff was safe in room maids never touched your stuff and i loved VICTOR !! he is what every resort needs one of him all in all i would go bace in a heart beat nightly shows @9:30 pm i ate to buffet every night it was very good andthibg you wanted so all those ppl that beat this resort down is tottaly wrong i thought it was good SO all ppl that read this go there you will love it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: MaritimeExplorers
Reviews.Content: Check In- We arrived at the Ocean Maya and asked about a room upgrade, which we had read about from other peoples reviews. We upgraded for $35 a night to a honeymoon suite. Great King bed, access to a blocked off part of the beach (which had drink service), a bar fridge in our room (which had beer, soda, and water), and allowed us to make dinner reservations at the restaurants Room- Our room was fabulous, villa 12, second floor (I liked having a second floor room, as opposed to a ground level room) It had a great view of the pool and the ocean. Food- There are 4 restaurant choices for dinner Japanese- Tapanki (table side) was alot of fun, and the food was great Italian- The best food on the resort was definitely found here. Mexican- No, don't bother! No one we spoke with liked the food at the Mexican place, which seems strange being in Mexico and all. Buffett- Was a buffet, just like you would except, good but not great Service at all the restaurants was terrific! You can also eat at the restaurants as many times as you please, we did Japanese 3 times :) If you are a wine drinker, especially red wine, buy some and bring it with you. The wine is awful, and I'm not even a bit fussy. I can hardly tell the difference between $10-$100 wine, but this red wine, is thick, and served cold, and kind of fizzy? Very strange. Entertainment- This is not the resort for spring break partying (thank god!). There is a nightly show, and since it's a smaller resort most of them are put on by the very hard working entertainment staff. If you do want to go partying, each night the hotel offers a trip to a local bar, coco bongos, or bars in Cancun. Everyday by the pool the entertainment staff are rounding up people to play volleyball, do some yoga, play water polo, etc. My advice is GET INVOLVED! It was so much fun, and they work so hard to make up things to keep everyone happy. Look out for Victor (ladies you wont miss him), and Daniel. Activities - Outside of the resort we went parasailing, which was a great time. We also went to Xel-ha, which was a great day, snorkelling, walking, swimming, etc. We also went into Playa del Carmen for the day, shopping and sight seeing. Even when we weren't sitting in the roped off area on the beach our favorite server Aaron seemed to find us, and bring us drinks. Also free wi-fi in the lobby worked great, so bring your phones or laptops. The people were beyond friendly, so if you visit treat them well in return :)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful - just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: k2g_mich
Reviews.Content: We were not supposed to stay at this resort. We made our reservations at the Ocean Coral & Turquesa in Puerto Morales. Upon arriving at our resort, we were told it was overbooked and were being moved to the Ocean Maya. We tried not to be too critical of the Ocean Maya, but since it wasn't what we were expecting we couldn't really help ourselves. There were a lot of great things about this resort. The grounds were gorgeous and there was always people working on the upkeep of the grounds. The pools and beach were very nice. Laying at the pool you were looking out over the beach, which we both enjoyed. The staff was mostly friendly. The bartenders and lobby staff were all very friendly. Since we were bumped to this resort, we were upgraded to the black bracelet (aka "privileged club"). The black bracelet allowed us to make reservations at the ala carte restaurants. We were told the white bracelets couldn't make reservations, but could show up. We ate at the Italian and Japanese restaurants. We did not make reservations at the Italian and were seated right away. The food there was probably a 2 out of 5 - definitely nothing fancy. We made reservations at the Japanese and sat at the table where they cook in front of you. It was by far the best food at the resort and it was entertaining. Also, with the black bracelet we were able to lounge in the private section on the beach. The sunbeds were great, but were in high demand. You had to put your towels on them by about 6:30 am in order to get one. It was worth it though. Also in the private section we were served by Edgar, who was great! He brought drinks, snacks, and you could put in your dinner reservations through him. The upgrade was nice, but I don't think we would pay for it. Other good things about the resort: the coffee shop was nice, the Mexican restaurant has snacks during the day and it's great while lounging at the pool/beach (they have Styrofoam plates so you can take it out with you), Wi-Fi in the lobby was nice. Some of our complaints: the food, the entertainment, the promptness (or lack thereof) of the staff, no one could make change, availability of king size bed rooms. The food - other than the Japanese restaurant the food was not great. The breakfast buffet was the same almost every morning with not a lot of choices and the dinner buffet was less than enjoyable. I found myself most happy with the snack bar - hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza, french fries, nachos, etc. The entertainment - we don't usually partake in any of the "activities" that are offered and the crew seemed to always be trying to get people involved, so that seemed great. However, the night entertainment was late - 9:30ish at night. We found ourselves trying not to fall asleep in the lobby waiting for the show. The staff was not very quick with requests. Our toilet hardly flushed and plugged twice. Both times it took at least 5 hours to have someone come to fix it. Also, there were only one or two bartenders at the bars and the wait at the pool bar during the day was ridiculously long. We always like to tip the staff, but no one could make change for us! Make sure you take lots of small bills because even the lobby and stores wouldn't break big bills. We were put up in a room with two double beds which wasn't ideal for my husband and I. We requested a change, but weren't able to change until the next day and we decided not to bother because everything else about our room was fine. Not surprising, but so you're prepared the prices in the hotel store are outrageous. We wanted to carry-on our luggage so decided we would buy sunscreen at the resort. We knew it would be overpriced, so we can't really complain but it was around $23 USD for a bottle of sunscreen. Overall, we went on a vacation to relax in the sun and that's exactly what we did. We enjoyed the vacation and the resort. We probably would not go back to this resort, only because we like to try new resorts. I would recommend this resort for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: erin s
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Ocean Maya. The grounds are stunning and immaculate. The staff ..always a friendly smile and "hola!". The pools were large, very clean and beautiful. Our rooms were always clean, the showers hot and we slept very well. No, you do not sink in to the the beds but so what. There was plenty to eat and the food was nicely garnished and appealing. Fresh fruit and salads were always available. It was not gourmet or 5 star cuisine, but, being a dietitian, I was very happy with what was offered. We ate only at the buffet, but I heard very good things about the Japanese restaurant. Also, we are glad we did not pay extra for an upgrade as It was unnecessary. Some previous reviews gave us a few good tips. The second floor rooms with a balcony were much nicer. We were glad we brought insulated mugs for drinks and lots of one dollar bills for tips. We tipped because the service was good, not because we expected better. Don't let some of the reviews scare you away. This hotel was very nice. We will probably return next year.

Reviews.Title: “For the price you couldn't do any better”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation75
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at the Ocean Maya and let me say we had a blast! After reading some of the reviews before we left I was a little nervous... well maybe more than a little nevous I actually called Expedia and asked if it wer possible to change our hotel 3 days before we left! I'm very glad we didn't this place is great! Very laid back and relaxing. The staff is wonderful and work very to do everything they can for you so please tip them, I assure you if you do your stay will be that much more pleasant. Some of the rooms are outdated and I must admit if I did have to complain about anything it would be the beds, they are very hard, but I did't come to Mexico to lay in the room all day so it was fine! The food is pretty much the same as any all inclusive you go to, mostly good but by the end of your trip you start to get a little bored with it. I must say that the Mexican resturaunt was our favorite, the Tala fish and Chicken fajitas were very good. Most other reviews were correct about the grounds they are beautiful and very clean and very well maintained. The beach was wonderful as well,you may see some nasty pictures of dark water and sand bags but those are one the far north side of the beach by the pier so you don't even notice it. The swimming area is great and there are tons of fish right there. One morning on my walk I saw a sting ray right out in front of the wall. All in all for what we paid ($710pp with air for 9 nights) I really can't complain and I would return. Just remember your not the only one on vacation so if you want to snap your fingers and get instant sevice you should probably rent a private home with a butler!

Reviews.Title: “I need a vacation from this place....”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Vaca-07
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst place I have ever been to. Keep in mind that I have went on many vacations. (ex: Mazatlan, Ixtapa, Jamaica, Dominican Republic, Cancun, ect.) The rooms were very dirty. Many parts of the room had visible mold problems. The beds were comparable to sleeping on box springs. Shower knobs did not work on any setting other than cold. Found many corners of the room where there were, what looked like pubic hairs laying on the floor. The sent of stale beer and smoke filled the room. This place has the worst food I have ever seen. It is almost like they recycle their buffet style food throughout the different restaurants they have on this property. For example, on night they had "Mexican Night", they were serving tortillas with a slice of single sized cheese inside of it. That was it. That is not Mexican food. More like on food stamps and welfare food. The kind of crap you would eat at 2am when your drunk and their is no food in the fridge. Next comes the drinks. They do not serve any type of good liquor, unless you pay extra. The quality of the liquor they do serve is comparable to the very cheapest you could possibly find in a liquor store. I dare you to try to take a shot of this tequila. It tastes like burnt hair. It is almost as if they water the stuff down. To top it off the nightlife. Get ready to spend your entire trip in the hotel lobby. Because that is all there is to do. I spent my trip sitting on my computer in the lobby looking for other trips for next year. My advice: DO NOT WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS PLACE!!!!. I wish I could get a refund. I can not even think of one good thing about this place. I hope this review helps some of you. I am never one to even bother writing a review, but I was so compelled to do so. It was something I said when I was there. “I can’t wait to get home to write a review on this place."

Reviews.Title: “Excellant staff and beautiful grounds!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaKicksButt
Reviews.Content: The entertainment staff, Juan and Nelly, were amazing. Adriana at guest services was so helpful! Really nice resort. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful - and didn't laugh at my horrible Spanish! Showers were cold - even after we switched rooms - I don't think there was enough hot water for the resort. The second room we stayed in #1101 was a lot nicer than #301. If was more uptodate and had a nicer ambiance. We had a promotional offer to go to the Barcelo, which was a huge resort in comparison. The bed was more comfortable and the shower was hot - but other than that I would choose Ocean Maya. It was nice to have a smaller place, reservations for the al a cartes were not required, (although there may be waits depending on when you went) and the staff was a lot nicer and remembered you.

Reviews.Title: “Just 'ok'”
Reviews.Author: Orchidmandy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a fabolous review, and I am glad other guests had a great stay in the same month my friend and I stayed here in Feb 2010. We had just stayed at another resort for a week (Flamenco Occidental Xcaret) and had booked our last week at the Ocean Maya. Check in took quite awhile as there was only one girl working by herself and was also in training. We are exceptionally understanding people, yet we also have our limits of 'ok, enough is enough'. Our first room had a king bed, not adequate for my friend and I. We accepted our next room as it seemed ok. But wow... the mattresses at this resort compared to the Xcaret were not good lol.. If you just rolled over you could hear the springs popping and your bed would move as well. I went to use the phone and i noticed something moving.. i picked up the phone and there was ants literally everwhere. I moved the lamp and underneath it was like a nest. They were crawling everywhere, up and down the nightstand, the floor, it was gross. We had called twice and NO ONE came and did nothing over 2 days. The final night I was talking to my friend and she saw an aunt on my forehead then crawl into my hair. Well did I get any sleep? NO, i could feel it crawling around.... Not good lol. So the next day I had to get our airline charter representative to do something. They moved us but said we never called or complained before. Our next room was ok, same mattresses and only aunts in the bathroom. At this point we just cut our losses. The food though was excellent. The italian restaurant was by far the best food I've had a resort in awhile. The japanese restaurant had the guy cook and through his spatulas aroun which was fun: food reasonable. The grounds immaculate and beautiful. The spa very average. Hardly any nail colours to choose from and my girlfriend still had dirt under some of her nails after her manicure. However the facial was outstanding! The coffee shop is a nice change, the drinks were very good but the main bar shuts down at 11. They keep a small tiny bar open with only vodka, rum and something else available thats it. The shows and entertainment very entry level and some shows almost embarassing to sit and watch. Music stopping, actors forgeting the moves... just not good. The free wifi in the lobby is great, wish more resorts had this. Upgrade to the black bands if you can. Its nice to know what the resort is like, but unfortunately we won't be returning. Great deals can be found, and its certainly a great place for your first time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: BankerinND
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed at the Ocean Maya from Feb. 11-18 and we had a BLAST! The rooms were clean and the grounds were absolutely gorgeous! The staff worked really hard and were always friendly. We especially enjoyed Nora at the Lobby Bar and Viktor, one of the entertainers. The nightly shows were very good and the beach was out of this world. We would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Suprising Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Debbi B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya for 7 days. I was very skeptical after reading reviews of the resort prior to travel. I am pleased to report that we experienced none of the issues I had read about. Check in and check out were both quick and easy. It was my 50th birthday and we were upgraded to the black wristbands and stayed in a villa near the restaurant La Hacienda and enjoyed an ocean view. All of the staff members were friendly and were eager to assist. They work so hard that it makes you feel almost guilty to be having such a good time. This is my third trip to the Cancun area. Both of the previous trips we stayed at hotels that were ranked higher on Trip Advisor. This hotel had the best food and drinks- by far!!! Even without the upgrade to premium liquor, the drinks were awesome! If I had one complaint at all, it would be that bacon was served at breakfast only two times while we were there. With the upgrade, you can make reservations in the restaurants, enjoy the private beach area with the awesome Edgar waiting on you... Pina Colada's made with fresh pineapple were to die for and I don't even like Pina Coladas or pineapple!!! Our villa had been updated and even though we didn't have a remote for the TV, I didn't care because we didn't go there to watch TV anyway! The Japanese and Italian restaurants are very good. The buffet is also nice. They did a special buffet for Valentine's Day that was excellent! The resort is between Cancun and Playa. A free shuttle is offered that leaves at noon and returns at 6PM and you must book a day prior or take a taxi. The ocean surf is gentle here and the color is not as bright as in some places and somewhat cloudy at times. The beach is well groomed also. I would have been perfectly happy staying at the resort without leaving even though we did take a couple of day trips. If you want to party and go out clubbing, this is not the place for you! (The night shows here could use a little help). If you want a relaxing vacation with BEAUTIFUL grounds that are kept clean and well manicured, then this is a MUST!!! The bottom line is, if you want a 5 star resort, then pay for one and don't complain that this is not a five star resort....... but it's close! Nothing up thumbs up from us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaBill
Reviews.Content: We've been going to the Yucatan area for about the last 7 years and this has been our best resort stay yet.Rooms were clean, everything worked, friendly staff.Pools were clean and the beach kept beautiful.Would glady stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: JudiCorbin
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at the Ocean Maya with 6 family members. We upgraded for 25dollars/per person/per night and received upgraded rooms near the beach, premium liquior, and access to a special area on the beach with the cabana beds and a waiter named Edgar to serve us drinks. To me, this was wellworth the extra money as the initial cost was low to begin with. We had margartas made with "Don Julio" tequila I was initially worried regarding the beach and bad reviews of the resort. The landscaping throughout the resort is absolutely stunning. I loved the villas. The beach area was beautiful with the seawall to prevent beach erosion. There was plenty of access to the water which was for the most part, clear aqua blue. Walking up and down the beach in each direction was interesting. North of the resort was several rivers that met the sea. The food was the usual buffet style and was adequate. The specialty restrauants were ok with the exception of the mexican restraunt which was not good. I especially loved the coffee shop where I could get a latte after 9am in the morning. We went on a snorkelling exursion by Maya Adeventures with a guide named Nacho and had an especially excellent time. The service at the resort was adequate with some glitches but all in all I felt the employees were hardworking and pleasant. i did feel that the resort needed to hire more front desk people, waiters/waitresses for the buffet and the bars. We also used the free shuttle into Playa del Carmen for an afternoon of shopping. My husband and sisterinlaw used the dive shop for a two hour snorkel exursion that cost 35 dollars which he said was well worth the cost. The resort put on a special Valentine Day's dinner in the buffet area. In summary, we enjoyed the area, the resort and the weather and felt it was well worth what we paid. The 7 days flew by and before we knew it, it was time to go home to the snow and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: GeneralLea
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time. The Ocean Maya is a lovely, smaller resort just north of Playa del Carmen. The beach is very clean, and swimming friendly, with lots of room to walk. The staff is excellent. Very friendly and attentive. Two concierge in particular were very helpful - Luis and Oscar. Edgar, too was very good. Nora and Fernando were also excellent representatives of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and roomy. Showers great. We had a regular garden room which was very nice. For an additional $25US per person per night you could upgrade to the black wristband. That included an oceanview room, minibar, bath robes, slippers, coffee maker, private area on the beach, safety deposit box, premium drinks, and the ability to make reservations at the restaurants. Our friends opted for that although we didn't, yet still had an amazing time. Not a lot of night life at the hotel, but that wasn't what we were after. We went into Playa del Carmen at night a couple of times and had a great time. We took the Playa Express across the street from our hotel for 15 pesos each. The first time is a bit of an adventure, but after that it's all great. You can also take the Collectivo, but make sure you ask the price first. We used it to go to different beaches, and had no problems. As for excursions - XelHa was good value, and we went on a jungle/zipline/cenote tour that was very well done. If we have any advice at all, it would be to ask for a second floor room. I'm a light sleeper and the floors are tile. P.S. The landscaping and gardening at the Ocean Maya are absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “This place is worth going back to”
Reviews.Author: drowsy_parrot
Reviews.Content: I really think for the money you can not go wrong staying here. This is my 5th trip to this area in the last 6 years. I have stayed at different hotels each time. This has got to be one of the best yet. Even with the upgrade I did not have beer in my room fridge but I was only 50 paces from the pool bar! I would recommend that when you leave the airport have the shuttle driver stop at 7 Eleven and get a few 6 packs for your room. it is less than 5 dollars a six pack. Pay cash as I used my debit card and found out when I got home they charged me over $80.00 for 6 beers!!! The beach isn't the best you will see but they work every morning to keep it clean. the grounds are some of the best you will see with coconut trees everywhere. The pool is about an 8 out of 10 but is very clean and has a nice swim up bar. The only complaint I have is the food. The Japanese resturant is the best. I highly recomend watching your food being made, you have a choice of menu or watching, take watching. If you find something you like at the buffets, take extra to your room as it may not be there again. all in all this place is worth the money. You can make your stay even better by tipping!!! I took a roll of 100, 1 dollar bills. That was good for a 5 day stay. I met a couple that took a hundred 2 dollar bills. That seemed to work even better and you could tip less with the same results. DO NOT FORGET sun screen!! I am still hurting!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: gingeredmontonAB
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful, the food was good, the staff were very friendly and always accommodating. Theme nights, optional restaurants for you to choose from. I will agree with some of the other reviews about the beds being a bit hard, but overall our stay was great. We went swimming and snorkeling from the beach. The ocean was very clean and the beach was always keep clean. I would rate the hotel at 3.5 this is a smaller resort were the staff get to know you, the rooms were clean, the food is good. We don't spend a lot of time in our room, mostly for a few hours sleep. If you your expectation is for a 5 star hotel then you need to make a different choice.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for and loved it.”
Reviews.Author: DoWeDive
Reviews.Content: We've been all over the Carribean and this was one of the best values we've ever had. Last minute vacation. Paid $602.00 for RT air from Atlanta and 6 nights all inclusive. One problem with the a/c. Condensate line plugged and dripped into room. We called, they came and fixed. Staff was very nice to us. Of course we were very nice to them. Bed was better than some, worse than most but we didn't have a problem with it. Room was clean with a little mold in the outside corner of shower. For what we paid...big deal. Food was very good for buffet. This is an all icnlusive, they cook to try to -please everyone so keep that in mind. Didn't try any of the specialty restaurants. Who wants to wait when the buffet was very good. We really didn't think the other restaurants were going to be better than what we can get at home. If you want a great swimming beach don't go here, or anywhere to the north for two reaorts or south for 2 miles. I walked each way and this section just doesn't have great oceanfront. Most had been reclaimed from mangrove swamps. The pools were great though. Smelled sewage for a second or two 4-5 times. Big deal, the grounds were beautiful and I know some places use grey water for plants in dry climates. I sure wouldn't pay a lot of money to stay here but by reading trip advisor beforehand we knew there might be some problems. Fortunately there weren't, I mean stuff happens. We chose to stay here because it was the absolute cheapest and that's what we wanted. Do your homework before you travel ANYWHERE! We prefer traveling often and cheaply rather than seldom and lavishly. Just put in the time beforehand to know what you're getting into. Would we go back here? For $100.00 a day including air you betcha. For dinner ask to be in Jose Medinas section and order the Coffee Maya. Never set foot in the disco. If you want to party stay up in the hotel zone. Talking to repeat visitors they said that it was nowhere near as crowded as they've seen it so this may be why the staff was so attentive. Fewer guests around to try and see to. We're avid divers but having been in this area before passed on any dives. maybe we're jaded but there isn't anywhere near enough bang for the buck to dive locally. If you want to dive this area just go to Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: skeefe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently travelled to the Ocean Maya with our two boys aged 8 and 5.I have to say we absolutely loved it!We travelled last year to the Mayan Riviera and stayed at the Ocean Turquesa and although it was much newer,we liked Ocean Maya better. The size of this resort gives it a more intimate feel and we never waited very long for a drink or for food. When we arrived at the resort my husband talked to the front desk about upgrading to a Deluxe room with an Ocean view.They had one available in two days so we decided to stay in the garden view room for the first two nights and then move the the deluxe room for the rest of our trip.WOW was it worth it!The room was next to the pool overlooking the beach and the ocean.We could even see Cozumel and the cruise ships! Having the upgrade gave us other priviledges too such as reserving seats in the restaurants,which we tried all of them,and enjoying the beds on the beach with our own personnal waiter. My best advice for people travelling to any all inclusive resort is "TIP".These people work very hard in all areas of the resort and really appreciate the tips as they do not get paid alot,about $8 American a day.We tipped generously and were well rewarded with great service all the time My kids had a great time swimming in the two pools and in the ocean.This beach was very well kept compaired to the other resorts along this strip. We would definately go back to this resort and are thinking of returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Insulting”
Reviews.Author: Rysiesproudmom
Reviews.Content: Our room was recently renovated so it was clean; however, bed was very uncomfortable. Toilet next door overflowed and affected ours which also nearly overflowed. Air conditioning stopped working twice. Asked for extra blanket on first day and didn't get it (even after repeated calls) until fifth day! Five restaurants, but not all are open and available every night. Mediocre food, very disappointed. Was always told how friendly everyone is in Mexico, but the staff acted put upon and they were not at all gracious. We made appointment for massage but because of very bad sunburn on my back, we called and PROMPTLY canceled. With our ride waiting (and other people in van waiting to go to airport) we were first told we were incorrectly charged for a bikini wax that I had and owed $20. Management gave this task to the poor girl who did my wax-she was very embarrassed to have to ask us for more money. Being reasonable and nice people we readily gave her the $20, not wanting her of course to get into any trouble or have it taken out of her paycheck. Then, we were told the massages were still on our bill and they had no indication they were ever canceled! The girl who worked the desk when we canceled was not in, but they did not bother to call her to check this out. Apparently, we were supposed to get some kind of paper from her confirming that we canceled which we never got because we canceled on the phone! My husband, who is always so courteous to everyone, had finally had it with them. He told them he was only paying for the massages because he had to get to the airport and would dispute the charges with our credit card company. He let them know that we've stayed at three-star hotels that treated guests better than they did. I think they were recently bought by some company, but whoever is managing affairs there is woefully inadequate. We never saw anyone with any authority walking around and making sure things were running well. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. My sister stayed went with us and her blinds were stuck halfway up and after repeated calls, someone finally came (around 4th or 5th day) and fiddled with them. When she next went to raise them, the handle broke off in her hand. She gave up and just did all of her changing in the bathroom. This is the first time on Trip Advisor and I just want to make everyone aware of what they might encounter. Bear in mind, we are not the type of people who demand things left and right and we're pretty positive and flexible so this isn't nitpicking. Despite the sometimes apathetic service, we always tipped, even in the restaurants, because these people do work hard and I'm sure they encounter alot of guests who are jerks. I wish I had checked Trip Advisor before booking Ocean Maya.

Reviews.Title: “nice place...NOT”
Reviews.Author: karebear10
Reviews.Content: NOT A 4.5 STAR,....NOT EVEN A 3 STAR. If you have never been to Mexico before and never experienced a 4 or 5 star place or if you only paid 500 or 600 dollars then yeah you get what you pay for. Here is just some of our experience; We checked in at 10:00 pm on Jan 10 there was games going on in the lobby as it was cold ( i'm talkin 14c) out side and you could not hear the reception checking you in. We got to our room # 2007(very back of property not close to anything) only to find the most run down dirty stinky room. There was mold on and in everything including the bed sheets were covered in surface mold. After going back to lobby and waiting in line (which you do a lot of at this resort) and battling the "games nite" noise we were told that there was no more rooms available and they would send someone to change the sheets. Needless to say by midnite when they finally got to our room,...I was in tears. There was no blanket on the bed (which took another 45mins wait before we went to lobby to get it ourselves) no clock, no coffee maker, and the fridge did not work,...oh yeah no hot water either (even after running it for 10 min). The next morning when we took our pictures of the room down to our Noli rep (after waiting in line again) she took us over to the front reception (and waited in a line this time as there were several other people there with concerns as well) only to be told that the only way we could switch rooms was to pay the extra $700.00 and up grade to a black bracelet (which does not mean jack crap at this resort) which we did out of sheer panic at this point. Long story short,..after 2 more moves to 2 more rooms because of electrical and leeking problems (don't forget these are the "VIP" rooms) (to which they had no other rooms available last night) we finally got to a nicer room # 1202 and most everything worked for most of our stay except,...it was loaded with bugs. By the time we finally switched resorts Jan21 we were both covered in no less than 30 bites each. I came to find out that there were other people in the same quality of room (VIP) that we were in and that it was the first room they were given (no up grade no black bracelet no extra cost). Our total cost for our flight and hotel at Ocean Maya was $4372.00. for 2 weeks minus our last three days at Ocean Coral & Turquesa (which was much nicer) This is the most expensive resort we have ever stayed at by this time. The food became very boring and repeditive. The evening shows were very poor quality. The were under staffed in most areas. there is only two bars on the whole resort (one of which closes at 6;30 pm) and it is generally hard to get a drink (even with a black bracelet). I've been given three addresses and e-mail addresses and none of them are correct so forget about trying to write anyone with your concerns. If this is your first time going to Mexico or if you go for almost free then you can't expect much and that is exactly what you will receive. Over all,...you could not pay me to return to this resort. K & R Troy Courtenay, B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “An excellent resort featuring very good food and lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: HaydenGregory
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed 14 days at the Ocean Maya resort. All levels of service were great. The main restaurant and the three a la cartes provided a good variety of excellent meals. The bars looked after all of our needs with friendly service. Our room was clean and well kept. Ocean Maya is located only 15 minutes from Playa del Carmen which made it much easier for execursions and trips into the city for shopping or whatever. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this resort and would not hestitate to return in the future. If we had a complaint it would be a shortage of staff. The employees work very hard to meet the needs of the guests, but there never seemed to be enough staff so that they could interact more with the guests. Never saw or heard from anyone in management. Perhaps the staff should be given more positive feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun025
Reviews.Content: Service was poor. Arrived after 3:30 p.m. and room was not ready until 4:30, we were asked to go grab a bite to eat, only thing available was the beach front restaurant. No one was around, food was dried out,. When we went back to get our room it took another 40 minutes to get someone to take luggage to rooms. It started pouring shortly after arriving in our room, the ceiling was leaking and they tried to tell us it was the air conditioner condensation... Moved us to another room, upgraded us to a junior suite. This room smelled musty all the time. There is NO in room mini bar. There is a fridge but it's stocked with water only. The toilet had to be unplugged about every other day. Food was not bad but no variety, the same stuff pretty much every day. If there was something going on the buffet restaurant, the Japanese restaurant was closed. If the mexican restaurant was open, the Italian was closed and vice versa. You could not get any food after 10p.m. and the bars close at 2 a.m. WE did a walk around the property our first night, stopped at the beachfront restaurant for a drink and were told you can only get a drink if you're dining in the restaurant. The pool bar...well if you're not a man it takes forever to get service, they totally ignore the women. The entertainment was poor. The staff is overworked! I have to say our maid was wonderful, she took considerable time each day to clean and the property itself is beautiful and very clean. That's pretty much all the good about the resort. Would not recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Labwalker
Reviews.Content: O.K., I wasn't going to write a review until I read so many negative ones regarding Ocean Maya. Wow, some people must be walking around with dark clouds over there heads. Here's our experience. First, we booked thru Apple Vacations and got a terrific deal...as always. They do a great job meeting you at the airport, getting you on the bus, and meeting your every need at the resort. Upon arrival at Ocean Maya, which was about 6:00 in the evening, we walked up to the front desk and I mentioned that all I really want is a second floor room with an ocean view. No demanding! When we walked into room 3306 and saw the ocean view, which also overlooked the pool, we knew immediately we were at a nice resort. The room must have been recently remodeled as it was just beautiful. Now I'll admit, the food wasn't what you might get at other "more expensive" resorts, and the selection was limited, but hey, you get what you pay for. We ate a different meal every evening and truely enjoyed every bit of it. As for a smell anywhere, we never noticed a thing. The grounds were beautiful and the help just wonderful. Our only real complaint is that their entertainment was pretty poor. But you know what.....we went for the sand, sun, and water. And there was plenty of all three. So I guess the bottom line is, if you want more than what you got at Ocean Maya, sure you can get it.....and you'll pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - could have been better”
Reviews.Author: WIDaisy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay. Buildings are 2-story with 4 rooms on the first floor and 4 on the upper. We had a nice room right by the ocean on the 1st floor. Room was nicely renovated and modern looking. However, I would suggest to request a room on the 2nd floor. We had trouble with the sewer smell coming up the shower drain several nights. We put wet towels over the drain and aired out the room, which helped. Our phone "hummed" all the time, so we unplugged it. We plugged it back in for our wake up departure call, which we never received. Luckily, we set the cell phone alarm for a backup. Had trouble getting washcloths and shower mats left when they tidied the room. Our requests always got a "in 10 minutes", but never received any. The beach area was quite nice for taking long walks. Sure there is a fence (that you can see thru) in front of the property, but that was no big deal. There is a nice walkway by the fence that leads you back down to the beach. You can walk quite a distance in either direction along the ocean. Pool area was very nice and clean. The snack area by the pool could use some more help. The one guy working cleaning off tables and running to get drinks for people was working his butt off by himself. Note: People, help yourself to drinks! Also, this property was very poplular with French Canadians. Sorry, but many were rude. Watch out for that cutting in line at the bar or the omlette station!! The staff were very pleasant and polite. Overall, for the great price we got thru Apple Vacations, it was a good value for us and we had a nice time. If we did stay here again, we would definitely want a room on 2nd floor. Having stayed in this area of Mexico 4 times now, I am aware that there are sewer issues because of the geographic location. It is something to deal with, but nasty when it is in your own room!

Reviews.Title: “Don`t Go”
Reviews.Author: crazyinbrooks
Reviews.Content: Good thing we could leave the sort one in awhile because it got us away from the bad sevice and unhappy and overworked staff!Our roomed smelled like mold and we had a few things go missing.We liked the area as far as the grounds,but no swimming except the pools.We met a ton of unhappy people while we were there,most with the same complaints,NO SERVICE,NO COFFEE POT NO IRON NO FACE CLOTHS FOR 5 DAYS!!!!!!!!NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Kicked us out due to overbooking, with no apology”
Reviews.Author: bosminn
Reviews.Content: While our brief view of the hotel seemed appealing, we were shocked to show up and find out that they had overbooked and were kicking us out. This information was delivered to us in one frank sentence with no apology whatsoever. They had us pay them, then sent us next door with a "transfer letter." I felt like they thought that the fact that they paid for our cab there and gave us a bracelet to access their services was supposed to make up for it. The bonus was that we did get to stay at the Blue Bay next door and were able to eat & drink free at both locations. However, walking on the beach & up to the central resorts wasn't worth it, especially with inclement weather, so we didn't really get to experience the Ocean Maya. We liked the atmosphere there a lot better, as it seemed more sophisticated and intimate. However, we'll never really know, since we got booted the moment we arrived. The whole process took more than an hour, between showing up, them scurrying around doing some totally disorganized paperwork, and then having to wait in line at the other hotel. Considering that we booked directly through their website and had no communication whatsoever about the problem prior to our arrival, I am still puzzled as to how this could happen. I'm frankly quite disappointed, as we had picked this hotel specifically because we liked the look and feel of it. After this experience, I will probably never book with the H10 chains again. It really ruined our first day of what was only a 4-day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money. Service sucks, old rooms. repeat food..”
Reviews.Author: teresagr
Reviews.Content: OMG, don't know where to start.... We had a 4 day stay with girlfriends. To start with, checking in was SLOW, and even though we arrived early, I had to ask where to leave the luggage since the room was not ready, I had to ask where to change clothes, I had to ask everything.... then when we finally got our rooms, no bell staff to help. Then , the elevator was BROKEN! We were on the 3rd floor! I had to ask a nearby employee to help me by the stairs. The room was average, a bit outdated, and bathroom marble could use some updating, cracked, peeling.... one night, there was NO HOT WATER! Food? The buffet was very repetitive, dame fish prepared different way each night. No shrimp. Alcohol was well drinks = cheap. Entertainment? take a taxi to downtown Playa, the action at H10 Ocean Maya was lame. Bar service in the night was bad. Coffee and tea bar closed at 10pm! No hot water available for tea either. I asked them to microwave a cup of water and they would not. I didn't think that was appropriate. There are also only cold cuts of ham and cheese to munch on in the evening , and no room service. So if you hang out late, and get the munchies, you are out of luck. Can not order a pizza either, as that is not permitted on grounds. Overall, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: jstahl
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay- Food was mediocre at best, with limited choices.Well below our expectations. Room was very nice, until the A/c stopped working several times. No telephone service for two days, no on demand tv service at all although promised, and very slow to respond to complaints, I mean very slow- for A/C need three reminders. Staff is very nice, grounds are pretty, although anyone who says they are the nicest that they have stayed cannot have seen many resorts. Staffing at pool bar, poor. Finally, ready to leave- cannot leave because they made a mistake on billing a Massage that never occurred. Had to pay before they would let us leave- No I have to spend my time disputing charge with credit card company. I am not a very picky person believe me and the vacation was still nice- but the management and operation of this facility was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time for the price”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict2010
Reviews.Content: We came on our honeymoon and were treated fabulously! They bumped us up to VIP for our honeymoon, had cocktails waiting for us at check in, we got to use the VIP beach area, and stayed in a villa instead of the hotel! The service was fantastic, and all the staff very accomodating. The night staff at the front desk had some troubles understanding english, I had to call down twice to get a blanket but it wasn't a big deal. The buffet was average, it was what we paid for. However, the specialty restaurants were no extra cost and absolutely amazing!! I highly recommend the Japanese restaurant, at the Tepanyaki grill. Also, absolutely everything at the Italian restaurant was fabulous, and the setting was amazing with it right on the beach. You could hear the waves rolling in. The beach isnt fabulous, but if you go a few miles away to Playa del Carmen it turns into exactly what you see in pictures of Mexico. However, the grounds are amazing. They are well taken care of and the fountains are spectacular. If you are lucky you can catch an iguana sunning himself up there just about every day around breakfast/lunch time. Basically, this is a resort with fabulous service, pretty decent food, but you get what you pay for. This is not a five star resort, but its still a fabulous time if you come into it with your expectations not too high.

Reviews.Title: “Just had a great week and would do it again”
Reviews.Author: mountainchef
Reviews.Content: The value was amazing. All inclusive for me and my friends is a great deal because of our mass consumption of beverages. The drinks were good and the bartenders will make anything you want. If you want your drinks stronger....no problem, they will accomodate. The food was not bad nor was it great, but I didn't expect great for the price. We were always happy with the amount of selections and different themes they offered for dining. The food wasnt really authentic but it was good. Rooms were gorgeous and so close to the beach. The smaller buildings were nice because you didnt feel like you were in a big hotel. It had much more style and character. The grounds are beautiful as well. I recomend going into Playa to do some shopping because the prices are much lower for jewelry, liquer, and souvaniers

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place for a family holiday.”
Reviews.Author: mit_mitz
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at Ocean Maya, from Dec 13-Dec 28, 2009. And what a terrific family holiday we had. This was our first carribean family holiday and are very pleased that we chose the Ocean Maya. Even though we have a teenager and a 7 year old this resort accomadated us in every way possible. The resort is beautiful, the employees are very friendly and helpful, and the food is out of this world. Spending our son's B-Day and Christmas there was an amazing and unforgetable time for all of us. This resort went all out ensuring that we celabrated Christmas using both Mexican and Canadian traditions. Our meal of lobster, shrimp, crab, prime rib, ham, fillet mignot, turkey and all the fixings was a pleasant surprise and something we will talk about for a long time. The Entertainment team and the Kid's Club team did a wonderful job both during the day and night. I felt vey safe leaving my daughter in their "fun hands", allowing my husband and I to relax . Our son played the programmed sports each day . Our Noli Tours rep Isabella was always there when you needed her. All in all we feel everything about the Ocean Maya is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sushi03
Reviews.Content: Family of 9 traveled to Ocean Maya to spend New Years (1 week stay). We did get the upgrade for $50 per room - we all got building 12! Plus premium beverages. So the drinks were awesome. Absolutely the best views. My 4 year old son loved Kids Club (Arianna). The 16-17 year olds were a little bored as it was far to town. The 19 year old loved it. She did the Disco tours and became friends with the staff who went to the discos etc after hours - very safe way for your kids to go. Food was just okay. We have stayed at quite a few all inclusives-and have had better. The grounds are beautiful. If you plan on bringing your laptop-be prepared they only have free wi-fi in the lobby area. So if you are in Building 12 it is a little walk to the lobby. There is quite the sulfar smell when the landscape is being watered (very stinky). Pool is not heated to it is a little chilly in the pool. I will say I was quite surprised to hear more people speaking french than spanish.... however very nice and fun time had by all!!

Reviews.Title: “Good January Getaway”
Reviews.Author: slgs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week in January. Traveled with spouse and 2 college students. Booked the Maya Deluxe Garden view. If you do not book into this section, you can upgrade for $25 per person per day. We asked for an upgrade to an oceanview room in buildings 10-12 and was told all rooms were booked. We chose this hotel for the price they offered in January. The weather was cool and rainy for two days but that is out of our control. We did have 3 nice days. Nobody was in the pool except for a few hardy souls. Room - Nicely decorated but mattress seemed older and very hard. On arrival we had no phone, air conditioning worked off and on, no beer or pop in fridge and needed extra pillows. We did get everything we asked for by day 3 but we should of went straight to the customer relations desk instead of writing notes to maid, calling the front desk or reporting these problems to the Ocean vip desk which we found out were time share reps. Be aware if you are invited to the VIP breakfast to be shown the upgraded amenities as it is a time share sales pitch. Food - We ate at the buffet and the 3 specialty restaurants. Food was very good except for the Mexican rest. We enjoyed the Japanese and Italian rest and the food was excellent. We tipped at every meal and staff got to know us and waiting to take our drink order before we even sat down. With our upgrade we got premium liquor which we drank Gray Goose, Kahula, Crown Royal, Baileys and Don Julio tequila. Corona was on tap and always cold. Also with the upgrade you can make reservations at the specialty restaurants and without it is first come first serve. Beach - We loved the premium section and the bali beds, Edgar our waiter was wonderful and gave us great service. The upgrade was worth it just for this perk. You can walk the beach 20 minutes north and hit a logoon at Tres Rios. South we walked 45 minutes and could of walked farther if we didn't run out of gas. Small beach to the south and north of the sea wall. We stayed at the Catalonia Royal Tulum last year which has the best beach in the area except for Maroma Beach. So we knew ahead of time about the beach and sea wall. We were content as we did not swim in the ocean due to the weather. Overall our twenty year olds loved it as they partied till the wee hours as there were lots of people their age. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace at night listening to the live music. We did not see any shows. But the entertainment staff were very hard working and tried to get all guests involved in the activities during the day and night. In the past we have upgraded to the vip service at the bahia and princess chains and we feel the Ocean Maya still has a ways to go to compete with them for example no room service,separate vip lounge, free internet service, turn down service with fresh towels ect. Also this is the first hotel we have stayed at they we did not get a towel sculpture left on the bed. Also one day the top sheet was removed from our bed but replaced the next day. Also our safe lock kept getting stuck and there was no mp3 player, slippers or umbrella as described on the website. I would think a supervisor would spot check these rooms. Our sons room had no phone service the entire week which was inconvenient. We were told the hotel is in the process of upgrading their phone service and service is sporadic. I feel if these rooms were not ready they should not of booked guests into them. We did get a spa credit for our inconveniences. We took a cab into Playa Del Carmen to shop and eat at El Foggins which was very good and inexpensive, we had 4 beers and dinner, two had tacos and two had carne asada and our bill was $26.00 The staff at the Ocean Maya were friendly, hard working and grounds were clean and beautiful. Hopefully the management can correct the room problems. We are not fussy people and we could of asked again for a room change immediately but were to lazy to re pack hoping all problems could of been taken care of immediately but forgot we are in another country.

Reviews.Title: “Beds uncomfortable, noisy air conditioner and pesky pool bees! H10 Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: BMERMichigan
Reviews.Content: What we loved about the H10 is that the staff is very bilingual, helpful and entertaining. They pride their self on communicating and supply great nightly activities (more for adults). Be prepared to walk to your room the grounds are gorgeous and it is a spread out casita type hotel (you will lizards and flowers). Personally, our air conditioner was extremely loud and our mattress was not comfortable for a nice night of sleep. The bathroom we updated with a shower only while the towels were a bit scratchy. Overall we felt that is was a safe environment and would rate it an above average stay. The main dining room is more like a cafeteria with average/good food while you need to make reservations for the other all inclusive restaurants at night. During the day they have a great pool bar and water lounge area but we were swarmed by bees who love the sugar on the margarita glasses. We noticed a large beehive in the tree next to the pool bar, we hope it is gone (beware)! They also had on site snorkeling/activity service and a below to just average lunch pavilion with ala carte burgers, chicken nuggets and chips and salsa. Overall it was alright the beds could have been more comfortable and the bees could have been removed. It is not very luxurious when dining by day but at night it is nicer, plan on staying at the hotel there is nothing else around unless you travel about 25min-30min to downtown Playa de Carmen. In down town visit Oca Los Tacos for lunch, shopping and neat boutique bars and restaurants just south of Cancun. This hotel runs a shuttle to Playa de Carmen for a small price. Stay together down town, put your wallet in your front pocket and secure your backpack and purses don’t be to alarmed by policia with rifles on the streets in down town Playa de Carmen it is a quaint Mexican town with vendors and nice eateries. Enjoy =)!

Reviews.Title: “+Overall Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Bob&Vica
Reviews.Content: After buying an upgrade for 25$ each person per day we had no complainants about the room. It had been just renovated and had a nice ocean view as well as a view of the pool. The beach was not as good as the ones you will find in Cuba, but it was okay. Make sure that you take swimming shoes. The food was average but if you took your time and looked around they sometimes had some nice seafood. The omelettes are great, the eggs are very fresh and it is easy to tell. The staff were outstanding, the grounds are really nice, the rooms are kept very clean and the entertainment is not bad. I would recommend this hotel, but it is not a five star! Maybe it gets close if you buy an upgrade, we also thought that it was cheaper to purchase the upgrade after arrival, it was about 700$ from the travel agent, and we paid $300 there. Take a bunch of American one dollar bills for tips as well; the smallest Mexican bill is twenty Pesos so if you don’t want to tip 2 bucks every time take the American Bills. Also don’t forget insect repellent, some people react quite badly to mosquito bites. Have fun! Bob and Vica Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time but bleieve the reviews about the food at this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: DAZZLE500
Reviews.Content: We arrived on De. 20th 2009 . As always, avoided all the time share by walking rapidly and looking down, didnt have any problem with them. Check in was relatively quick at the resort. We were sold the trip under the impression that we would have an oceanview room with a bathtub and a minibar. For anyone that enjoys their baths it's important to know that this hotel either offers a tub or an oceanview, why you have to choose I don't know. Anyway, we of course gave up the bath tub and took the shower in order to have the oceanview room because our teenage daughter was with us on her first trip to Mexico and we wanted her to enjoy the view. I will just go ahead and get it out of the way--THE FOOD IS HORRIBLE AND UNACCEPTABLE, BELIEVE WHAT YOU HAVE READ ABOUT THIS!!! I am an easy person to please when it comes to meals! I suggest you frequent the kiosk by the pool and just have the hamburgers/snacks etc as your meals. The buffet is horrific!-- The grounds of this resort are the most beautiful I have seen so far, especially for those who enjoy taking photos. We really enjoyed the activities that went on at the pool. Always something going on-water aerobics, fashion show, dance lessons, spanish lessons , stretch on the beach, and for the record all of these activities are ran by cute young energetic men =) Housekeeping was spectacular!!! There is always a cute little critter made from the towels left on your bed each day and room is nice and tidy. They DO NOT leave water and drinks each day like most resorts do in your mini fridge. They show it as a mini bar in the sales ad, that is misleading in my opinion. I had read bad reviews on the beach, however, I found it to be beautiful and so did my family. We did the Captain Hook cruise again out of Cancun and it was awesome as always. You enjoy great entertainment on the ship as well as a steak and lobster dinner. You meet up with another ship and have a cute little pirate fight then head back. Really neat. Fun for all ages. Lasts about 2 1/2 hrs. Well worth the $. We went for a massage down by the ocean in Playa Del Carmen, 15.00 for 30 minutes I HIGHLY SUGGEST THIS!! You will need it especially if you stay at this resort because the beds are just as the reviews say HARD AS CEMENT!!! We asked for foam in advance before we left the states and we asked when we arrived, they told us they would bring it but never did. --- Shopping in Cancun is a must as well. Stop in at Senor Frogs, its a fun place to eat and socialize. We were told the Co Co Bongo was an awesome place to visit but we ran out of time. There are just so many different things to do. We have a 14 yr old daughter and she had the time of her life. Staff is kind, and helpful. Resort is clean, airconditioning was good, our stay was peaceful. Over all, we had a good time. If you are big on dining, I would not choose this resort. We have stayed at the other H10 Ocean Turquesa and their buffet was outstanding, so I was really confused by this. As always, we hated to leave. But it was nice to get home to a bath tub, soft bed and a GOOD meal.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Resort”
Reviews.Author: sydfill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Ocean Maya. Would definitely recommend it to all. If you like a 3-4* resort you'll be pleased. Nice selection of food and drinks. Gorgeous grounds. Some rooms are a little dated but everything is very clean. Staff always has a smile for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: SuperMarioMontreal
Reviews.Content: We only had one problem overthere and it was at the arrival since we where located in Building B witch is different from the other ones. it is a big building with maybe 50 rooms on 2 floors compared to all other small building which add 8 room per building son we got upgrade the next day in the premium service for extra 25$ USD per night per person but it was completly perfect. lots of services with the upgrade premium service at restaurant, international drinks, free in room safe, premium beach front matress chairs beds and especially room with beach front view. all the poeples we meet on standard srevices were also very pleased with everything at this resort. What you want to see is Tulum Ruins because of the history of this place and also the beauty of the beach overthere. we rented a car and traveled around the place witout maps or anything. Rooms at the resort were very nice and cosy. Peoples working on site were nice and polite and always ready to give the best they can with a small tip once and a while. Buffet food was repeatly but very good food and a la carte restaurants were very very good. The beach is ok but if you walk up north a little bit you see it getting better but i couldn't complain about it since i also enjoy the pool which are nice. Overall i would definitly go back to this hotel with my family.

Reviews.Title: “bing on the beach???”
Reviews.Author: runwaydundas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked in January 2009. Disappointment began on arrival. It was late, around 11:00 or so at night after a long day of flying. It was advertised that food was available at any time. What they failed to mention that the night snack counter offered a lovely selection of dry bread, processed cheese and ham... There was nobody available to take us to our room which proved to be a nightmare, as all resort is spread out with pathways going in many directions, and a distinct lack of signs to assist. ,Part 2: The beach. A large breakwall exists at the resort waterfront, flanked by a pier which was pictured in the brochure. The pier had yellow police style tape prohibiting persons from walking on it while it was being repaired. There were also large white sandbags seemingly to provide a breakwall. The bags were actually black from the water. We were told by our travel agent that the water was as blue as the turquoise ring I wore...It was impossible to see the turqoise because of all the black "slop" in the water and on the beach. Walking in the water required extreme care to avoid the many rocks that covered the sand. Part 3: Bingo on the beach. We found 2 lounge chairs on the beach not far from the pool to relax and read. Shortly thereafter, I heard "B 2." Then "O 52." A very loud voice was indeed calling out bingo numbers. I can go to any rundown downtown in North America to the local bingo hall if I want to. But I definitely did not want to do this on my vacation to Mexico. Following the bingo game, the loud, booming club music began. It was really getting hard to concentrate on my relaxation...We had to ask to have the volume turned down but it was still there. Part 4: The dining room. A large cafeteria style room closed in. I have been in many other places in the Carribean and Central America. One of the attractions is the open air restaurants--it is something we in Canada can only enjoy for a few short months. I look forward to sitting in outdoor style restaurants on a trip to a tropical country so this was a great disappointment. Part 5: The illness. We both became extremely ill on the second day in. We had avoided all water other than bottled water, leading us to believe it was the food or the water which was used in the food preparation, coffee/tea making process was contaminated or not properly treated. My partner was so ill we had to see a doctor for medication for the cramps which did not settle for one week and he did not feel well until the end of the second week. We actually left Ocean Maya on the second day when we were starting to feel ill and went to Tulum. There we stayed in a lovely Cabana which I would recommend to anyone. While I realize that illness we sufferd is a common problem to travellers, expecially in Mexico, it was really the last straw to a huge disappointment in the resort. Avoid staying at Ocean Maya!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: Sherrydawn
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i have just returned from our second vacation at the ocean maya. We spent a 2 week honeymoon there last year and we were very pleased over all. This year we enjoyed ourselves even more. The resort has made many positive changes. The staff were great, the best service we have ever had. The weather was the best high 80's, the water front has been renovated with a new walk way which is beautiful. Once again we would recommend this place to anyone,it is a hidden little gem. We have planned nexy year for Playa Del Carmen, but we will return to the ocean maya .Good Food, Good people, Great service, very clean, beautiful landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mexlover49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb./07 for 2 weeks. Service here was wonderful. Pools are fresh and clean. Pool activities were also very good. 2nd pool had a swim up bar and water jet chairs to lie in. They have great entertainment staff. Food was 4 stars. Rooms were very clean. Water fountain was breath taking. I would go back

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but no swimming in the ocean”
Reviews.Author: mcvyger
Reviews.Content: at the end of the beach it's like a concrete wall, impossible to swim in the ocean ! Restaurants are perfect, rooms too, a lot of activities (but maybe not enough for somebody as active as me). The disco are better outside.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget”
Reviews.Author: Dtrain1066
Reviews.Content: I booked this simply because of the price. $50 a night! (1) the rooms are very nice but the showers were built so that the water gets under the door and floods the bathroom. All rooms are the same. (2) the food is sub par to say the least. Most of the time the buffet food was cold...even if it was supposed to be hot! (3) when you go to the restaurant you expect the menu to be free if charge right? Nope, not the case at all. They gave their cheap staple menu items that are free ..ie pasta and tacos. But if you want steak or some other expensive item you pay. A steak was $30 ! (4) they have three actual restaurants by name. Funny thing is they are all the same restaurant. They just call it a different name in alternateing nights depending on the theme. Japanese, Italian and Mexican. (5) they lied to me upon arrival. The snack bar is supposed to be open all night. Warning.. If you go into town and think to yourself .. I think I'll save some money and wait till I get back to eat , eat in town cause the snack bar will be closed by 10 or 11 pm. That really got me mad. I was soo hungry one night in an all inclusive resort. That one really stuck with me. (6) be prepared to spend time making your own arrangements for transportation. The hotel provides absolutely no help in this dept. They will only call you a cab .. That's it. ! No vans or buses into town. 14 bucks each way in a dangerous cab driven by a local. (7) don't worry about the maintainance guy scraping paint off the building over the outdoor dining tables while your eating. They assured ne that thier workers were highly trained???

Reviews.Title: “A Low-Key Relaxing Resort (with some minor flaws)”
Reviews.Author: mrs_dj_sol
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in early October at the Ocean Maya in Playa del Carmen (low season) to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Our first impression was that the Lobby and grounds were very beautiful and clean. So far so good. Check-in was fairly quick - about 15 minutes. We were given a ground level room in building 18, located mid-way between the lobby and beach. The room was fairly large, with a king bed, sitting area, table and chairs and mini-fridge. Both the TV and AC worked well. The first problem we encountered was that the patio door simply would not lock. This required a trip back to the front Lobby to request a room change. The receptionist stated that "no rooms were available for that day please come back tomorrow" and that "we shouldn't worry about leaving the room unlocked as there are plenty of security" - simply unacceptable response! Would a wise person leave their belongings unattended in an unlocked room in a strange place? After about 45 minutes and some stern insisting on my end someone was finally sent to fix the door (My husband had already repaired the lock himself in the meantime). I still find it difficult to believe that an alternate room was unavailable when the resort was only at about 25% capacity. Also, of note, at no time did we see security other than in the front lobby and at the hotel's entrance. Finally, off to the beach... We were very pleased by both the pool and beach areas. There had been many reviews complaining about the state of the beach so this was initally a point of unnecessary concern. The retaining wall is simply a much nicer solution to the beach erosion problem than the adjacent properties unsightly sand- bag solution. To the left is an area of beach the we found to be quite with plently of chairs, umbrellas and hammocks to relax in. To the right, the water access was a bit nicer with ample chairs and water sports. We have traveled to several islands and this was some of the nicest white sand we have experienced. The water was clean, clear, warm and blue and we saw many little fish enjoying it along with us. The pools were large, uncrowded alternatives to the beach. While we were happy to have a large pool to ourselves, it was a bit disappointing that the spa loungers and whirlpool were not turned on. Sadly, the pool bar was also closed for remodeling. The hotel was also in the process of remodeling the ocean view rooms (which was previously undisclosed) so there was a bit of construction noise to contend with. We made the best of what was available and were able to relax and enjoy the open ammenities. A positive about being at the resort during the slow period was that reservations were not needed for meals. We never had to wait for food or drinks. The food and drinks were just fine with a nice variety of choices. House beer is Corona. Japanese resturant was our personal favorite, but the Mexican and Italian were also very nice. We highly recommend the Mayan coffee (think of it as very tasty dinner entertainment). A few negatives about staying at this resort were that there was construction, would be services/ammenities such as the coffee bar, whirlpool, pool bar and main attraction fountain/waterfall were all closed or turned off.
