The resturants were open on alternating schedual. This information was not disclosed prior to our arrival. A huge negative was that we, along with six others, were standed after our "free" trip into Playa del Carmen and the hotel made no attempt to rectify the oversight and reimburse us for the return cab fare when the driver failed to pick us up. A tip and a warning - A trip into Playa del Carmen is a must-do, but prepare to find your own way back! For the most part, the staff we encountered were fairly hard working and friendly. We believe in rewarding folks for a job well done and were happy to leave small tips for the waiters and cleaning staff. The entertainment staff was pleasant and not pushy. We did enjoy the show that we attended. We think that some of the reception staff might benefit from some customer service training. The Olympus Tours rep was MIA our whole trip. No tip for them! In summary, despite a few negatives, we did manage to have a good, relaxing vacation. There are some small issues that the resort needs to correct, but otherwise this is a solid 3-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme Pampering on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: InTheHeart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Maya for nine nights and not once did we lack for anything! The employees were attentive, courteous and went out of their way to make us feel special. Food was tasty, varied and served with flair and pride. The free shuttle into Playa Del Carmen made for a nice shopping break but for most days we swam in the pool, sailed on the catamarans, enjoyed the beautiful beaches and serenity. We did two tours -- one snorkeling on the reef which we highly recommend and one to the water preserve which was too overwhelming for just one day.

Reviews.Title: “We are very happy we went with this Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: VacationSoon
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I saw that there were many positive reviews on this resort. But still, there were some concerns. But we did it! The price was great and overall I had a feeling we would like it. And guess what? We LOVED IT! It is a hidden gem for sure! My advise to people - When you are looking through reviews, ignore reviews that are negative which include remarks like " boring", "bad drinks", "not enough choice of food", "bad service"...and so on. Those are people who are spoiled, in my opinion. If you are a person who can appriciate other people's efforts and you keep an open mind, you should not ever have a problem with these things, when at the resrot anyways. These people work so hard and for such little money!! But, in regards to the Ocean Maya hotel, the above were never an issue. Everything was GREAT! The food, the rooms, the pool, the service. Everybody is so friendly there. We loved the set up of the resort. It is beautiful with lots of plants and flowers. The beach is nice. However, the water was not very clear blue water that I like. But I'n not sure if it was because of the season or the location. We spent half the time in the ocean and half in the pool. The swim up bar is great. We also went to another resort in May 09 and that beach had clear water, but that resort was located closer to Playa down town then the Ocean Maya resort. Ok, back to Ocean Maya! Just try it, it's so worth it. But this resort is not for party people or crazy people. This is more for families and couples who want to relax and spend time together. However, there were planty of chances to sign up for Disco and other Party outings through the resort. They do have a disco on location, but it's far away from the villas so we were never bothered by that. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Minor flaws, major value!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi-Plaza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip thru Continental Vacations. It is a beautifully maintained resort. The staff is friendly and the service is impeccable. Food and drinks are first class--we were never disappointed with the quality of our meals. A cautionary note: Please take bug repellent! The mosquitoes were as enthusiastic about their meals as were we!! Also, please be aware that the restaurants are not well air conditioned, and you will be perspired by the time you finish your meal. Despite these minor inconveniences, Ocean Maya is a fantasic value in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cool bungalow rooms but I will never return to Ocean Maya.”
Reviews.Author: darren-richard
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the place was awesome, I loved the Bungalow style rooms but the longer I stayed there, the more I disliked it. The food was decent, the staff we're friendly. NO beach there in March, i guess it was wiped out from the hurricane. The place is clean but had a sewer smell in the rooms & specially downstairs in the disco & meeting room. There are 2 bars, i found I was always waiting on drinks, they needed more bartenders at the pool. The enterainment was ridiculous, Ricki was really annoying. 20 of us went there for a wedding and there we're some hidden charges after all said & done. The bride & groom had to pay 25 dollars a head for the food when we all ate the buffet. The best night I had there was at the Mexican a la carte, try the tequila poppers and tip well, they gave us a couple 40oz bottles of tequila poppers when we left. The after hours disco was a joke & same with the gym. If your a young group mid 20's - 30's wanting to party & have a good time, this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for a nice all inclusive, try somewhere else. It isn't posh at all.

Reviews.Title: “I will stick to cruises!”
Reviews.Author: rriggleman1
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive, and it will probably be our last. Pools were nice, but the spas didn't work. Jack hammers all day long. Entertainment was ridiculous. The specialty resturants were good, but only open every other night. Except for the Japanese resturant, none were air conditioned. Tried to sit outside to eat, and because they had the fountain turned off, it was a breeding place for mosquitos. Very uncomfortable. Electricity was off quite a bit, and of course the air conditioning. Nice coffee shop that was closed for the season. No one cared weather they helped you or not, unless you paid for it. Could not wait to get home!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but small annoyances...”
Reviews.Author: A-Canadian-eh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocean Maya for one week in august. To be honest, after we booked our trip, I read many reviews and actually tried to change hotels from the many negative reviews out there, but it was too late, so I was a bit nervous about staying there. Overall, the bad reviews are overly harsh and I think some people are just too hard to please. Come on! we got a week all inclusive for under $800 plus tax! This isn't a five star, and it isn't priced as one either. Although we enjoyed our stay, there were some very annoying problems that made the stay less than perfect. The check in was reasonable, requested ocean view room(s), ( we booked two rooms ) but many were being renovated, so no dice. We did get two main floor rooms beside each other that were very clean and roomy. THE PROBLEMS: 1) Tv broken in room first night - fixed fairly quickly - ok 2) Toilet plugged first night - fixed fairly quickly - ok 3) Three people staying in room, but room service left only two towels next day - no big deal, after mentioning it to the front desk, they left 3 every other morning - ok 4) Woke up to no electricity one morning! nothing... now I've read this happening in the reviews before arriving, so I wonder why it still happens?... - took a few hours to get it back on - not cool, but ok 5) Toilet plugged again ( by the way, without anything in it! ) - again, fixed fairly quickly - yeesh but ok **BIG problem** 6) We had an all inclusive tour booked to Isla Mujeres one day. We needed a cab out front waiting for us by no later than 8:00am, so at approx 7:00am I asked the front desk to call us a cab for the time requested, after waiting past 8:00am without a cab showing up, the front desk guy "forgot to call" oops... we didn't get a cab until approx 8:35am and was late for our tour ( missed it ) we got the tour for free, but missed it because of the late cab. The staff seemed to think because it was free, we didn't actually lose anything, except the fact that we paid for the cab to get to the location late, and the fact that we went the next day, but had to pay for everything ( we lost the all inclusive ) so we had to pay for the trip to the ferry, the cost of the ferry and food for the day... it cost us... we tried to get compensation from the hotel but without success.. - NOT GOOD! ** BIG problem!!** 7) Phone not working on one room. A guy came by and had to pull out the night table and pull out some wiring to fix. He made a few "test calls to his cell". Here is where it gets ugly... we made two short calls to a local number to a friend. We found out that they ( Ocean Maya ) had a charge to our room of $140 US dollars!!! for two local calls! I personally made two calls to Canada and they only charge a 10 peso connection fee, so my calls to Canada only cost 20 pesos total, but the local calls were $140 US!! that included the couple of short "test calls". We argued this charge and they eventually reduced it by 50% ( we mentioned the cab foul up ) 8) There was construction going on ( jackhammers, hammering etc ) on the ocean view rooms, so you heard work going on, but I do understand that it has to be done sometime and we were there at their lowest season, so it made sense that they did it this time of year, although, information about construction going on should be made available to the travel agents so customers can make a decision whether they want to stay there... 9) Out of the blue, the sound on our tv was gone ( tv in second room )... muted... picture only... because we didn't want a staff member to have to come to the room yet again, we just left it... after an hour or so, the volume suddenly came on by itself! funny thing, this made me thing that some of these issues were the result of sabotage! hmmm, could these things be happening so a guy has to come by, do a quick fix and get a tip? hmmm funny thought... 10) Because it was the "low season" they alternated between the buffet one night, then the a la carte restaurants. So reservations weren't necessary for the al la carte... problem is, at dinner time, everyone showed up at the same time at the a la carte restaurants! so on a few occasions, we had to wait for a table... It would have been easier to just have the buffet open as it is the largest room with the most tables that could accommodate everyone at the resort... About the resort: THE GROUNDS: In one word "beautiful". The grounds are meticulously kept and are lush with thick green grass, palm trees and plants/flowers. FOOD: The food was great! The buffet was very good ( don't know why so many people rate the food awful!? We ate at the buffet, it was very good! we ate at the Italian restaurant - very good! had the lasagna ( kind of small portion, but very good! ) ate at the Mexican- very good! again, served small portions, after eating the small portions, we asked the waiter to please get us something else to eat ( long days of activities makes for big appetites! ) The waiter was great, and brought us two huge plates filled with tortillas and all the fixins big enough for an army! that did the job! BARS: The drinks were watered down somewhat, but overall, good. BEACH: This is one area where we were a bit nervous after reading the negative reviews. It is true, there is a wall running approx 70% the width of the waterfront, but there are two areas to the left and right that you can get access to the water and they were very nice, so we were quite happy with the beach! that was one area where we were pleasantly surprised! POOLS: Two pools, both great! very clean and warm! In closing: It's really too bad that we had these issues to deal with, because the place is very nice, and this could have been a perfect trip! We loved the surroundings, the many lizards, Iguanas, crabs and wildlife around the resort. The more serious issues we had to deal with really should make us livid! but the place is sooo nice, its hard to dwell on it... The management has to get their act together as far as those annoying problems... I've read on many reviews the same exact issues, so you'd think they'd get it right! We still managed to enjoy our stay at Ocean Maya considering the problems encountered. Important to mention... DO NOT MAKE LOCAL CALLS from your room! IF you do, bring a briefcase full of cash! The help staff WORK THEIR BUTTS OFF! Many times we recognized the staff sweating like crazy, running around serving everyone with most of them smiling and being very polite, stopping to say "Hola" etc... bring some tip money, these guys work hard, and it doesn't hurt to tip for exceptional service when you get it... When out and about, be prepared to tip for just about everything! it seems that at every turn, someone is requesting a tip... I will say, most of the people we encountered, from tour guides, bus drivers, tour guide assistants etc, were very friendly, many with great sense of humor, funny, making everyone laugh, musicians on the ferries etc... I know these people work very hard and rely on tips to supplement their income, so I had no problem tipping. make sure to have a roll of 20, 30 and 50 peso bills for tips...I was pleased to encounter so many nice, friendly people on this trip! Viva Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this resort”
Reviews.Author: Coffeedrinker2806
Reviews.Content: We were looking so forward to this vacation. But what we got was the sound of jackhammers from morning till night. The service was bad to put it mildly.unless you payed for it. The food in the main restaurant was really bad. The only restaurant that had air was the japanese. The sewer smell was awful around the complex.One of the guest was beaten up, robbed and put in jail, we all had the feeling that someone had put something in his drink. They close the coffee shop the day after we got there never to open again, the disco was non-existent. In short what they said was included in the all-inclusive was not included. I'm not a hard person to please but this place is really horrible and the power goes off daily. As for entertainment it was a joke. My husband was eating spaghetti one night at the Italian restaurant and found a screw in his food. There are alot of other resorts to stay at choose one of those. Take it from someone who knows if the price is to good to be true it probably is. Then only good thing that did come from this vacation is we met some really wonderful friends

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: musicgeek
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Ocean Maya. I thought everything about the place was at the least pleasant. We arrived early and immediately got bracelets and started getting a "lay of the land." This was good because the resort is spread out and we got lost a few times at first. Our room was cold (maybe too cold at times) which is good in August. The food was fine all the way around. The Japanese and Mexican restaurants were fantastic. And the buffet was fine.....especially on the Mexican fiesta evening. The beach was clean and there were plenty of chairs and palapas available. The pools had plenty of chairs....not many palapas (bring sunscreen). There is a free shuttle to Playa del Carmen daily. Our driver failed to pick us up, but the hotel reimbersed us for the cab ride back. The activity staff is energetic and talented. There are things to do for people of all ages. I cannot think of a better place to go than the Ocean Maya. Having said that, I planning a trip for that area this spring and going to a new place. Got to keep exploring new places. Also, having read some of the reviews, I would suggest if food is an issue with an all inclusive stay, go to a European Plan hotel instead. You control all food decisions that way. My biggest problem at an all inclusive buffet is knowing when to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: stevez1955
Reviews.Content: I really don't like to complain,but the first thing is the language problem,room cleaning was done early when I complained. 1st night was done at 4:30pm,second night got back at 6:00pm and still wasn't done,no shower curtain,couldn't change TV from bed or turn it off. Power outages. bees at the service bar's,no air conditon when eating. Theses are little things but they add up,to may kids for older couples,not for people who have problems walking,long why to restaurant,so if you get a deal I would go but never I mean never pay full price for this place

Reviews.Title: “Great time for a great price”
Reviews.Author: DCRedSox
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to Ocean Maya, we were greeted by a bellhop as well as 2 representatives from the hotel who spoke great English. We were checked in in under 5 minutes, and went to the lobby bar where we were treated to delicious pina coladas by the bartender, who also spoke great English. FOOD: the main buffet is good, it's not great, but it's certainly not bad. There's an assortment of food for breakfast (eggs, fruit, pancakes, omlette bar, french toast etc with a mimosa and bloody mary self-serve bar) and for lunch (pasta, meats with sauces, salads, rice, beans etc) and dinner which was always themed (Mexican, Caribbean etc). The speciality restaurants are great, really fun and great food. We went to Japenese twice: for menu and for hibachi. We also tried Mexican twice, which was really fun, very entertaining. BARS: the lobby bar, which serves drinks with an immaculate presentation. the pool bar and swim-up bar, where you might have to wait a bit for a drink. BEACH: the beach is gorgeous. there are a few cabanas directly on the beach, and then a bunch more that are elevated from the beach and set-back from the pool, but still on sand with a great view of the beach. POOL: there are 2 pools, one with water sports going on in the morning/afternoon, and another with a swim-up bar, which is attached to the walk-up bar in between the 2 pools. ROOMS: king size bed, air conditioned and a patio with 2 chairs. really nice because they are villas, so you don't feel cramped being in a hotel. the guest services staff were incredibly helpful during our stay, let us use the internet to check in to our flight, let us use the phone to make local phone-calls etc. For the price that we paid, we were incredibly satisfied and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: muscledfuture
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I needed a quick and inexpensive getaway before I had to go back to work (educator)...found a deal on Orbitz that we just couoldn't pass up in spite of the poor reviews. We are really glad we did as we were pleasantly surprised. Many of the reviews tend to be disappointed about the beach or the fact that there are too Many locals (hello, you are in Mexico- and many people look for places the locals hang out to insure the most authentic experience)..Well the beach is not the quality that you will find in other areas of the Carribean or Mexico, but it is okay. The hotel has worked hard to preserve the beach area and the beachbed cabanas and sunning area are excelent. We never had trouble finding a shady place near the pool. beach access and bar. The views are spectacular. As to the locals, they are there- mainly on the weekend- fun to talk to and though they tend to party with each other, they welcome anyone who speaks to them and seem interested in making friends. They were not rude or obnoxious at least no more than the overly drunken American or European. Check in- Five star. Luis was smiling and prepared. Drink offered and room was ready in ten minutes as promised. Victor, the concierge, was helpful and social- smiling and checking on us twice during the week. He said ours was his favorite room and although that might be the standard line, our room might have been his favorite. He arranged a late reservation at the show cooking table on the day we arrived. Room- Four and a half star. The only thing keeping it from five was that the refrig did not keep things too cold and the tv didn't operate with the remote. The room was newly redone in Zen decor with a king bed, great three head shower, flat screen tv and suoer lighting effects. We were in room 1007 with a nice balcony and a superior view of the sea and pool- close to the bar and towel exchange with direct access. Towel art daily and a bottle of sparkiling wine plua a candy/gift basket in room when we arrived. Room was always serviced by noon. Grounds- Immaculate. Only a faint sewage smell in one spot on two days. Ozone smell during storm. Flowers, iguanas and people cleaning all day all over reort. Happy and friendly. Spa- had a pedicure- nice but not spectacular- a bit pricey. Pools- not overly crowded except near the bar on the weekend. Slightly refreshing, but it was HOT! Activities focused here. Not bad. Music was a bitr redundant though. Bars- Pool bar had weaker drinks. Lobby bar had great drinks and service. Premium brands no extra cost. Table service there too. Did not go to disco. Food- Buffett was adequate with a lot of options. Omelets, grilled fish and meat. Pasta good, bread good some days, tough others. Guacamole and salsas/ chips available all the time. Coffee/ drink service spotty here. No air conditioning. Italian- good service, fair food- many items surcharged. Dessert not impressive. Mexican- fari service, below average food. Buffet was better. No Mayan coffee. No AC. Japanese- Our favorite. Show cooking excellent. Food very good. Dessert not impressed, Mike's- good iced cappuchinas and mochas (get a shot of Kahula from the bartender at lobby bar next door to make good great. Animation- They work hard and are not bad. Not Broadway or Las Vegas, but not bad. Evening music and dancing in the square outside the lobby bar until 2 a.m. on a few nights. Parking is about a block which is pretty far in the heat. They have closer available but not sure hwo it is for- we weren't allowed to park there. Overall the value was tremendous. We would return if we found a great deal even though the pre visit communication took some doing to establish. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: sabshire1
Reviews.Content: This resort had way too many locals. No one spoke English. All restaurants close by 10:00. Pool closes at 8:00. Not intended for adult fun. Lots of young kids. Food was not good. Would never go back. Even the entertainment catered to the kids with Limbo and musical chairs. big disappointment.....

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go!!! Too Many Locals - Not Enjoyable At All”
Reviews.Author: Mel-Lar
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at this same resort . We loved our stay the first two times, but now we will never go back. The resort was closed for the months of May and June due to the swine flu and in order to make back their loss they have given all of their locals a promotional rate. Thus, the resort was packed with locals who were rude and behaved like animals. There was standing room only in the pools and plastic cups were floating everywhere in the pool. The buffets and eating areas were even worse. They would knock you down to get at the food and ate like it was their last meal. I must say, the staff is wonderful and worked very hard to try and keep up with the mess. The grounds are beautiful (when they were not littered with cups and plates) and they have improved their beach area greatly. However, there was nothing relaxing about this trip. I would definately suggest going elsewhere if you are looking to relax and enjoy a resort setting. This was more like a mob scene at a public pool.

Reviews.Title: “MIss it already!!!! want to go back”
Reviews.Author: dioluvsme
Reviews.Content: this resort is amazing, would def. tell my friends to go. everyone was so helpful and it was great to party with the same people we spent the entire day at the pool with. Not too far from Playa del Carmen which has amazing places to go eat and have drinks, as well as do a little shopping. the resort itself is beautiful and always clean. the workers are so nice, always saying hellp when you walk by. only bad thing is there isnt really much to do after 12 so we always went to whatever club there were going to. it was a good experience because you paid and they took care of the transportation to and from the club, you never had to make a line and you always had the best tables. and if you got too drunk they had sure you made it back to your room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally poorly run resort...definitely NOT worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: evilangel74
Reviews.Content: First, I will admit I made a poor decision. In an attempt to save money at the busy holiday season, I booked a 4-square apple deal with Apple Vacations. For a reduced rate, Apple picks the hotel; you are guaranteed a hotel with at least that rating. (However, it important to know that hotels are rated DIFFERENTLY by different travel providers). The H10 Ocean Maya was NOT what I would have expected of a 4 Apple hotel; more like a 3...tops. Upon arrival to the resort, my boyfriend and I were ignored at reception. The ladies behind the counter saw us (with our baggage) and proceeded to assist guests who had arrived after we had. Not a very good first impression. Further attempts for customer service were less that stellar as well. Management/customer service seemed more concerned with the promotion of one of their new resorst nearby; we seriously considered switching (no additional cost) but was concerned that that resort would be even more poorly run than this, as most new places work out the kinks. Additionally, we had to pay for a lock in order to utilize the safe that is in the room. I have a had time rationalizing this policy, as it is my opinion that I should not have to pay for a service to protect my belongings from their employees. I have stayed at hotels in which the lock is built into the safe itself or you use a card. As I 've stated, we stayed during Easter Break...along with 200 or so Spanish students on Spring Break. They were loud, rude and obnoxious. The waitstaff and cleaning staff were constantly cleaning up after them. I'm sure they received a reduced rate to draw in business. The waitstaff, cleaning staff and other service workers were EXCEPTIONAL. I felt very badly for them; I'm sure they do not get paid very well in comparison to their managements counterparts. They worked so hard and were always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back for SURE”
Reviews.Author: lisabisa7
Reviews.Content: ok ok i was so scared when i had read the reviews on here....but they are totally false. The grounds are STUNNING...just beautiful THe food was AMAZING..usually I cant eat when I go away on vacation..I am so picky, but honestly the food was delicious, every night the buffet had a different theme and I was never disappointed. The entertainment staff was incredible. They were so fun, everyday by the pool there was something funny to do or just watch..they didnt harass you to participate. The guys were hilarious and very nice. The pool is clean and huge, it was really an amazing time, those other reviews are nonsense. We really had an amazing time and I am so happy that we stayed at the Ocean Maya. Oh and the lobby is beautiful ...check in was fast.... I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCanadaLori
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Grand Mayan Palace Resorts. This year I traveled with a girlfriend and we wanted an all inclusive. I was really worried about this place becasue of the reviews. This resort was wonderful! Entertainment all day and evening long either you particapate or you don't ----fun had by all. Entertainmet for all age groups.The Activity Staff are wonderful talented people.( See all evening shows different every night )Resturants are exceptional, from the food to entertainment. Yes, you must book the resturants ahead of time, just book them right after check-in. hours 9am to 4pm. Lunch is served in the main dining room also by the pool BBQ. Rooms are older looking but have the old traditional feel to them. Very CLEAN!!! Grounds are beautiful!!!!! Pools very clean. Drinks are not served to you by the pool, you need to get your own at the bar, 10- 20 steps from my chair LOL The coach ride back and forth to hotel is only 45 mins. I will go back again and bring my husband and children!!!!!!!!! Had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya. Hola we loved it. Thank you for our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bluesapphire78
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review, but I feel compelled to in the face of the negative reviews I just saw! We loved our stay at the Ocean Maya. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I agree that you are in Mexico to relax and if you have to wait a little bit for a few things, what does it matter, because where do you have to be? The staff do seem to work long hours. Our waiters were amazing and the bartenders so nice. I absolutely loved the nighttime entertainment and dancing. We enjoyed the night we dined at the Italian restaurant and wished we'd made reservations at the Japanese as it looked amazing. The only thing we would critique would be the lack of people in the disco. People mentioned that there was a bit of a smell in the disco which almost was like a chemically carpet smell. This is the resort for you if you are looking to relax with a friend, your partner or kids. If you are looking for a fun night, it is best to take the shuttle to Playa Del Carmen and go to Coco Bongo's and Senor Frog's. We had such fun shopping in Playa Del Carmen and had the best drinks as well.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy829
Reviews.Content: This vacation was much needed and a very long time coming for my family, and it couldn't have been better! The staff at Ocean Maya were absolutely terrific! Friendly, accomodating, always smiling. The ground are incredibly beautiful! The check-in did take some time . . . but who cares! When in Mexico . . . you're on Mexican time! They tagged and stored our luggage and sent us off for a wonderful lunch. By the time we had had lunch and a stroll around the beautiful grounds, our room was ready. (Relax! You're on vacation!) Our daughter was injured just before our vacation so she spent the week on crutches. Our room was on the upper floor, but by the next morning they had arranged to move us to a ground floor room. We didn't think to make restaurant reservations the day we arrived so were only able to get reservations to the Mexican and the Japanese restaurants, but the Italian was completely booked. Have the coffee at the Mexican restaurant after dinner! That's a show in itself! The only thing I regret about the trip was not staying at the resort more! We immediately booked excursions to Koba, Xel-Ha, XCaret and Playa del Carmen, and while thoses were great, we all could have used more relaxation time at the resort. Bring a thermal travel mug ---- it'll keep the Miami Vices cold longer! There was always something fun and entertaining going on, both day and night (one day staff did a "Village-people" number, ending with a strip down to bathing suits to get folks into the pool for water aerobics! very fun!), and the days we spent at the resort were at least as good (or better) than our excursion days! Our 10 year old could have spent all day-every day at the pools, and the staff were so kind and encouraging, welcoming him into water games. He just beamed to be included and was thrilled when they'd stop at our table at dinner, calling him "Bud" and asking if he'd be playing the next day! So kind and friendly to all! (We did enjoyed our excursions off the resort, but getting there always took so long because the bus stops at half a dozen resorts to pick up people, so you end up spending a couple of hours/day on the bus.) Our last day there was our daughter's 15th birthday, and she and I went to the spa for messages! Ohhhhhhhh! Incredible! Our stay at Ocean Maya far exceeded our expectations! We would all definitely go back! And next time, we'll spend 6 out of 7 days at the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun at Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: debthedriver
Reviews.Content: two friends, my husband and I spend one week at Ocean Maya and LOved it! The hotel staff was very nice, the food was ok and the rooms room large and clean. The bar staff made many yummy drinks, that seemed to keep coming our way! I would go back to this resort in a heart beat. The beach was some what small, but so were all the other resort's beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, relaxing, great for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: sunbums67
Reviews.Content: I also was concerned with the negative reviews so here is my input short and to the point. We are big believers in a holiday is what you make it. We went down with our three children 14, 10 and 9. Alex and Adrienne in the kids club are amazing. The two youngest spent every day enjoying the program they provided. The kids club (show at 8:15) was alot of fun also. We attended three of the main shows and they were good. These workers work long hours so cut them alittle slack. You may have to wait a couple of minutes for a drink but your on vacation, relax and enjoy the warmth and scenery. The grounds are very well kept. We travel twice a year all over the Carribean and these grounds were one of the best. The beach was great. We swam right at the retaining wall area every day. Some of the pictures show the water coming right up to the wall. When we were there we could lift the rope, jump down the 2-3 feet and walk on the beach or straight into the ocean. Tips: 1. If you are travelling with over 4 people, book your dinners as soon as you get there the tables are alittle more difficult to get. 2. The dress code wasnt as fancy as some places we have been to so long pants and a nice top is common. 3. The ala cartes are a must #1 is Japanese (the show is great), #2 is Italian (the restaurant is right on the water, beautiful) #3 Mexican (the staff are amazing, the beef was great) 4. The beach alacarte has amazing hamburgers, the best we have had my whole family loved them. 5. The beach can get a bit windy in Mexico so watch your sunscreen. Our family doesnt typically burn but we do in Mexico. Overall, the whole family loved the hotel, staff, grounds, beach, food etc. There were people of all ages, cultures, languages. Many activities during the day if you want to participate but they do not pressure you at all. Go and have a great time. You won't regret it Hola

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: RBOV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned along with our best friends from a very relaxing stay at Ocean Maya. The staff couldn't have been any friendlier. The rooms were clean, as were the pools. I was nervous about the lack of beach area, but it's easy to access the water, and there is a great sand area to relax in with plenty of chairs. We really enjoyed our stay and have no complaints. When you're going on vacation, you should learn to RELAX, I can't believe all the negative comments! Also, we had read to skip the Mexican restaurant, I am so glad we didn't! It was the best! Carlos was our waiter, he was so great....very entertaining. The Japanese restaurant is also a don't miss!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I paid for....expectations surpassed!”
Reviews.Author: blueindy
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand it. How can people know about Trip Advisor, know they can come on here and complain, but they DON"T read the reviews first??? Honestly, I read all the reviews here and on Debs, I knew what I was paying for and I could not have been happier with Ocean Maya! It's a stunningly beautiful little resort, I haven't seen grounds that nice in all my Caribbean travels! And the staff, so happy and helpful! I needed my AC fixed and called the front desk, there was a man there within 5 minutes! He fixed it quickly...left...and then another maintenance man showed up! Excellent service! Yes the buffet is small but very diverse, lots of choices even for the picky. Maybe it was just a good week to travel, the resort wasn't full, but we had no problems getting a shuttle to town that same day, or any dinner reservations either. Our tour rep, Air Transat's Isabelle was there alot of the time to help out, some other resorts I've been to they were only there twice a week. I was truly amazed at how almost all staff spoke THREE lauguages so well! Spanish, French and English! Great for everyone! Our room was huge and clean. Actually, it was my building that had the worst of the sewer smell that everyone complains about on here and honestly it wasn't as awful as people make it out to be. Geez, there is up to 700 or more people using the restrooms and showers every day, ANY place with a septic system would smell after a while! Maybe they just need their tanks pumped out. I have a septic tank at my country home, it gets full, it smells, get over it. The wildlife is something else here, iguanas galore! Lots of great pics to be taken with them ( look for the little cactus garden behind the towel shack, we found it the last day and were amazed at all the 'big guys' sunning themselves there!) The entertainment crew were a great bunch. I've never did much with a crew before, leaning more towards sunning than activities. But these guys, they were so polite and fun, we did all kinds of things with them! Spanish lessons, hancraft jewelery making, etc.... And they took a 'no thanks not today' very well, didn't bother us again at all. Ana, Jamie, they were fabulous! I traveled with my 70 year old Mom and as two single women we always felt safe even though we had concerns about the travel advisory. This was my third time to Mexico and I did not see anything out of the ordinary from the last times. I actually had the impression that the news reporters had blown it all out of proportion and it was hurting this lovely little area of our world unneedlessly. This place is one of those hidden gems you read about on here. Yes, the beach has sadly been taken away by nature but the rest of the resort, the people, food, grounds, wildlife, rooms, service, all round happy nature of everyone...it makes up for a lack of hard brown sand people say they need. Park your lounge chair on the fluffy white sand and wade into the pool instead, you won't miss it at all!

Reviews.Title: “"No Ocean" Maya”
Reviews.Author: DougPeg
Reviews.Content: This resort has No usable beach. Service at the swim-up bar was lousy, even with tips. If you are on a beach chair on the sand that the ocean never touches, forget about service. Fetch your own drinks. Only beer at this resort is tap. Taps say Corona but the kegs said Modelo. Food was ordinary at best. Italian restaurant was awful. Expected/desired more Mexican Food options. The grounds were beautiful, but did not make up for everything else wrong with this resort. We also didn't get our ocean view rooms. Day 2 they moved us to a room with a stunning view of the grass roof of the Mexican restaurant. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: perpeptualtraveller
Reviews.Content: I normally do lot's of research on the hotels we stay at but we had no choice but to come to this hotel because of a wedding party. After seeing some of the reviews, I was quite concerned and with good reason - the bad reviews were all true. The rooms were atrocious, especially the bathrooms which had an permanent awful smell. There was a sewer smell in different spots throughout the resort and it was unbearable in the disco. The food was below average and the nightly entertainment was absolutely laughable. The "free" drink selection at the bars is minimal and you have to pay top dollar for all the displayed products. This hotel would be lucky to receive a three star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: duff44hockey
Reviews.Content: We were pleasently surprised to find our resort very good, compared to the many dismall reviews posted. Our checkin was prompt (actually early), room had a beautiful view of the pool and ocean and no sewer smell as described in other reviews. The food was great, a la carte's a nice change with excellent food and service (Japanese the best). The pools were clean and refreshing, not cold. Only negative is that the jets for the in-pool loungers were not working. The beach wasn't great but we were prepared for this. That's what a hurricane will do! We found beautiful beach stretch 5 minute walk toward Playa del Carmen. Not quite sure what other reviewers were expecting but the positives far out-weighed the negatives and we'd certainly recommend this resort to others. All in all, good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3 1/2 star but they try like it's a 5.”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedEastCoaster
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent resort in a very nice setting. The staff is what really makes this resort. From start to finish they go all out to please you. The food was no better or worse than any other all inclusive. It is a buffet after all. My only negative comment would be that the front desk at check in and out is a little slow. Just keep that in mind a lower your expectations and more importantly allow yourself a little extra time to check in and out. The entertainment staff are excellent. These folks have an amazing work ethic and are very genuine. They are the pulse of this resort even if their speedos are a little tight (holy banana hammock). Overall very highly recommended. An outstanding family resort with plenty of time for relaxation a good quality family time. I would not hesitate in very highly recommending this resort and we will return. Some tips: 1. Coffee is weak so stick to lattes. The bartender opens at 0900 and he makes a latte better than any starbucks. 2. Beds are hard so be prepared. Ask for extra pillows first thing. 3. In the Mexican restaurant order Mexican food, In the Italian restaurant order Italian food and you wont be disappointed. 4. Try the Mojitos they rock. 5. No need to bring towels they have lots. 6. Although there is no expectation to tip it would be a a good idea to bring along some US one dollar bills. Again these folks work hard and they deserve anything extra. 7. The kids club is excellent and the two staff that run it are perhaps the most engaged people at the resort. Alex and Adrianna are outstanding. 8. Lobby has free high speed so it is worth your while to take a laptop and or a skype phone.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a minute”
Reviews.Author: CanadianChica83
Reviews.Content: After looking a for a last minute deal for Riviera Mayan, I found two weeks at $1097 pp Canadian. It was worth every penny!!! The food was delicious! The staff was very friendly, the nightly entertainment was very professional. We spent most of our time laying around the pool because the beach was not all that great. But that wasnt a big deal for us becuase we travelled quite a bit to other beaches. The pools like many I have seen in Mexico were not heated. It was very refreshing after laying out. Being there for two weeks we got to know many of the staff which are very friendly, especially if you take part in activities around the pool. My fiance spent much time around the bar where he got to know the bartenders that were extremly fun, friendly and spoke very good english. I also recommend to sit around the bar if you are looking to meet people. The food was very good. Breakfast I always had an omeltte that was never dissapointing, and fresh fruit. Lunch was a very large variety of pastas, sandwiches, salads and many mexican dishes. If you were around the pool or sitting on the beach you had a choice of the pool bar that had hamburgers and hot dogs, or snacks of your choice. Dinner was always our favorite. Dont miss out on Japanese night where you have a choice of fresh made sushi that made my fiance wait around for a second helping. The a la carte restaurants were also very good. The Japanase restaurant was more than we expected, you have a choice of different dinners and I recommend the one where you sit around the grill. That was very exciting and delicious!!! The only negative thing I can think about off the top of my head is the rooms need to be updated. Especially with some new matresses. But this seems to be a regular complaint at many Mexican resorts. However they were pretty bad. I tossed and turned basically everynight and couldnt wait to get home to my bed where I felt like a princess. We made sure we came up to the lobby everynight for the entertainment which was different everynight. The shows were very professional and you can tell the entertainment staff works very hard to learn all the dances. The trip to Playa del Carmen was about 10-15 minutes. Make sure you book the shuttle a couple days in advance so you can get the times you want. Or if you prefer its a $14 US cab ride. Which also helped us a couple of times where other couples would be going the same time so we shared a cab. I cant really say too much more except that we had a really great experience at this resort. I felt very safe, to walk by myself. I wouldnt however be by myself at night. that goes for any resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had hoped for, won't be returning to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 99Rocha
Reviews.Content: We've recently just got back from vacationing at Ocean Maya (formerly H10 hotel) and we were quite disappointed. First, the check-in took a very long time (over an hour). We were travelling with teenagers and families so we wanted our rooms to be close by each other but that did not happen. Nothing special about the food, not a lot of varieties. Very disappointed with the fruits options, not a lot of tropical fruits at all. The specialty restaurants (they have 3), were not very good. Watch out for the Mexican restaurant. I would say though that the Japanese restaurant was excellent. Also regarding the 2 specialty restaurants (Mexican and Italian), if you want steak or lobster, be prepared to pay extra. Not all inclusive in the specialty restaurants. The beach was NON-EXISTENT!. They had a beach area where they have the huts and lounge chairs, but there is no swimming to the beach unless you want to jump off the dock (which we would not recommend). One thing I would give this resort is that their grounds are very well kept, beautiful flowers could be seen and the grass is very green. Very disappointed to have booked at this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirlBarrie
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort (we are not in any way connected to hotel)! We went with our 2 young children during March break & loved it. Alot of negative things we read in the reviews before we left I did not experience. I've been to Dominican & Jamaica staying at 5 stars so I think I had pretty high expectiations going in & was pleasantly surprised. THE GREAT: The service & entertainment staff were beyond anything I expected. My kids & our friends had a blast. There was always something for us to do on the resort with the kids (kids club, mini disco for kids, & dance shows at night. The pools were awesome: always chairs (not a big resort - good), shallow & deep, and clean. Next to the pools a beach, which the kids loved playing in the sand & there were always free chairs & huts. The beach did not extend to ocean - which we did not mind because our kids always want to swim in pools. There are resorts on either side less than 50 ft where you can enter water to swim if so desired. The food was very good for an all inclusive - I love food so I'm hard to please. There was always choice & fairly decent tasting. The Japenese all la carte was great. There was always coffees at the lobby bar - top notch really. Definetly the most beautiful reasort grounds wise I had ever been to. Great spa - it had alot of services & great staff. NOT SO GREAT Beds were hard & a bit small. Rooms were very basic & water had a funny smell at times. Overall the rooms although spotless would be the only low point of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, just awful”
Reviews.Author: GoGreen1128
Reviews.Content: Terrible beach (basically wasn't one) and food nasty; the beds are like sleeping on wood. We were told the resort was updated but we didn't see where! Don't waste your time here. If you're looking for beach vacation you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: ashesovercancun
Reviews.Content: The staff make this resort a great choice. The beach is the only drawback. We had an excellent stay for 5 nights. The food was better than we expected. There were many choices and always too mch to eat. The Japanese and Italian restaurants were great. Make your reservations for the whole week early. The bungalows are quiet and arranged nicely. The resort is well laid out and easy to move around. The pools were cold in the morning but warmed up later in the day. The mixed drinks are weak but plentiful, they have Corona on tap. The coffee shop adds a nice touch of class. The check in and out were simple, no problems the whole week. The activities staff was fun and energetic, you could be invoved in some sort of activity all day long if you wanted. Ride the free shuttle into Playa and see the real beach and shop the famous flea markets. The grounds were immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl319
Reviews.Content: First, I want to mention that this hotel is off the highway and NOT near downtown Playa Del Carmen. The hotel offers a free shuttle to downtown, but you have to sign up for it asap if you want to utilize it. Otherwise, a cab is about $14 USD each way (at least that is what I was told). So, if you want to be near downtown I would recommend staying at one of the hotels in the Playacar area. Depending on where you are, you can walk to downtown Playa Del Carmen or Plaza Playacar. I will start with the positives. The hotel grounds are very pretty and clean. The employees are very nice and work very hard to keep the hotel clean. The rooms were also pretty clean and the pool was nice. The food was also pretty good. I would definitely recommend eating at the Japanese and the Italian restaurants. The Mexican restaurant was not good, which is ironic. You have to make reservations for all of these and I would also do that asap. The buffet was good too. I personally, enjoyed the pasta station. As far as the negatives go, we had some issues with our room. We had to switch rooms because all we got was one King bed and I was with my dad so that wasn't going to work. So we had to go back to the front desk. Which meant, we had to pay two different bell boys a tip to move our luggage. Then our second room had some issues. The air conditioning did not work. After 2 calls and 2 visits from the repair man they fixed it. Our t.v. didn't work and the sliding glass doors didn't open. Then, we came back to the room one day and there was a repair man in the shower fixing something. I still don't know what that was about? We also had very noisy neighbors slamming and beating on their door at all hours, but that was just bad luck I guess. Also, if you are a beach/ocean lover as I am you will be disappointed. The beaches all over this area are severely eroded due to past hurricanes and this hotel is no exception. My dad and I like to walk the beach and its in pretty bad condition. This hotel doesn't really have a beach, but you can walk in either direction of the hotel for more beach. Although, one side is full of rocks and seaweed and the other side is full of just seaweed. Unfortunately, as hard as they work to keep it clean, its fighting an uphill battle. I have been to Mexico 10 times and specifically Playa Del Carmen 3 times. This was not a horrible experience by any means, but I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: GDGV
Reviews.Content: We have been to Mexico 10 times and usually prefer the Mayan Riviera for the clear ocean water and beautiful beaches. This resort has no usable frontal beach and on this trip the ocean in front was brown and filled with enormous quantities of dead seaweed, totally unusable for swimming or snorkeling. The beach on either side is fairly good for walking. For swimming, the pools on the property are great. The grounds and exterior appearance of the property is very good. What is not good is the rooms themselves, although some are better, or worse than others. These rooms should be checked out prior to acceptance as some have lots wrong with them. . . missing furnature, missing lamps, burned out light bulbs, very bad or good bathroom vanity lighting, etc. By far the most disgusting fault was the smell (sometimes overpowering) eminating from the shower and bathroom floor drains. This strong smell caused us to move three times. The shower floor tiles in one room were black and drain covers and shower frames were corroded. The rooms need renovation but the bathrooms need a total fix! The good part was the staff, shows, and the food.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to pay for a 4 star and stay at the 3 star resort, then this is it !!”
Reviews.Author: rick0222
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I read the reviews for this resort when we arrived at the Ocean Maya and were not happy and nothing better to do. As many have indicated, this there are plenty of bad food and service to be enjoyed here. Do you yourself a favour and skip this place unless you can't afford anything better than 3 stars. There are signs that this resort had better glory days but not anymore. This resort features the worst piece of beach on the entire stretch of the beach and unswimable. We had to go for a 10 minute walk each day to reach a swimable beach area. The pool bar was swamped with guests and only one poor bartender that was sweating it but could not keep up. I suspect they are trying to save on alcohol. After all there were 4 people entertaining about 12 people at the pool area, yet 1 bartender to serve 12 to 15 people lined up around the bar area waiting to get a drink. Also at the lobby bar's many drinks which are available at other 4 and 5 star resorts in Maya Reviera as inclusive, here you will be asked to pay extra. e.g. Baileys Irish Cream is a premium drink and will cost you. Want to have a steak at the Mexican restaurant ? They have it on the menu but only if you pay $25. Or perhaps you fancy a Mexican lobster tail ? No problem its only $42. Anyway I think you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: Swirls83
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an amazing trip to the Ocean Maya. We arrived on March 6th and left on March 13th. ...just a few tips, this is not by all means a 5 star resort it is more a 3.5-4 star so don't go expecting a 5 star resort. We were also a little skeptical before going here after reading the reviews, but you need to go there and make your own opinion. As our travel agent put it, most people only write reviews on here because they had a bad experience. Well we wanted to make it our mission to come on here and let you know how our trip was, because it was not bad and felt it was well worth the money. Airport: The airport was a little bit hectic, you get off the plane and go through customs and then you have all these people coming up to you and asking to take your bags, and time shares, just walk right by them to the person holding up the sign to your travel agency, and they will direct you to the bus. The bus ride was good, they offered us beer 2 for 6 bucks, and we got to see a couple other resorts on the way to ours. Check-In, we had a really good check in, about 20 people check in. When we arrived it was about 10:15pm, and the buffet closes at 10:30, the lady quickly gave us our bracelts and told us to go eat before it closed and that we could check in after. We chose not to eat as we just wanted to get to our room after a long day. We had a very fast checkin and a worker took our luggage and showed us to our room, which we wouldn't have found because it was dark and the places are not marked well. Rooms: the rooms are just that, the beds are hard, the room to me is just a place to sleep you dont spend much time in here anyways.. the shower and toilet were all in the same room. We had no remote controller so had to go down to the front desk and ask for one. It was advised to ask for one when checking in;which we did and she said it would be in our room. Well it wasn't but we were able to get one right away. The air did not need a controller. It is true one night we had a shower and it smelt like rotten eggs, but it goes away, there is a mini-fridge in the room that they put 4 water bottles in everyday. There is only 3 pillows on the bed, so you might want to bring your own or ask for more. There is a safe but we went and asked for a key and were told they didnt have anymore, she put me on a list but we never ended up going back from one. we kept our suitcases looked and nothing was stolen. it is $2/day for the safe key. Food: the buffet was just that, the food is ok but its a smaller buffet so there isn't a lot of choices. Breakfast is good, they fry the bacon everymorning in front of you and you can have eggs and omlettes and panckaes and french toast. a La cartes" We booked this the first thing in the morning we got there for all of them in order to get seats. We never got into the Italian we were told it was booked until the day after we left. The Mexican is ok, we did go twice but we got the same thing both times, the nachos and the fagitas...they were pretty good..ask for a mayan coffee and have your camera ready...the set the alcohol on fire and do a little show. the Japanese restaurant was amazing, we had both the menu and the one where they cook infront of you, the food on the menu is quite salty but it was good none the less. the snack bar by the pool is good food, i had a cheeseburger everyday, and my husband loved the jalapeno poppers...The mozerella sticks were to die for, always good eats for an afternoon snack! Drinks were good - we dranks lots of margaritas, chocolate monkeys and miami vice! shout out to jose at the pool bar, he makes the best drinks! the rainbow shots are also very good! The bar in the lobby is supposed to close at 11pm but they are usually there later than that, after this you have to get your drinks down in the disco. There is pop machines in the a la cartes and there is also distilled water machines for you to always get water. Beach - well there is sand but there is no beach, bit of a disappointment but we knew this before we went. The retaining wall is there, and there is a pier you can walk out on. We did do the snorkelling through the resort, it was 35 each for an hour of snorkelling and they take you out about 10 mins from the resort to a coral reef. that was well worth the money! Pools - were awesome, newer, the pool bar they didnt always come to you down there, it was faster to get out and get your drinks at the bar and then get back in the pool. Entertainment, was in my opinion amazing..we got to know the entertainment staff really well, which was good because we got more out of our money, you can say NO to them but its worth it to say yes, they have activities from 9am-11at night. from walking beach tours to water arobics to beach and pool volleyball, drinking games, darts, spanish lessons, bingo, etc, etc..the shows are out of this world....we were fortunate to get to see grease...this was by far the best show...yes they are lip syncing but they did a good job of portraying the story..after the shows they continue the entertainment just outside the theatre with live music and dancing, and then the party continues in the disco. Smell: YES there is a smell, there is one spot on the way to the pool that does smell like a sewage plant and there is a smell walking by the disco sometimes..and by far the worst is the disco...if you have a bad stomach i highly suggest you dont go there...we did go the one night, and its true if you drink a lot of breathe through your mouth its better..one morning i walked through there though and gagged...a little tidbit, we were with nolitours and they do your orientation down in the basement, so beware of the smell it is pretty bad.. as for the rest of our trip, we went to playa del carmen one day to do some shopping, and we went to the tulum ruins one morning, we found another couple and took a cab to the ruins, it was 100 roundtrip and he waited for us, tulum is gorgeous....all in all we had an amazing time, we met some great people, and the entertainment staff really made sure we had a great time..missing it already...say hi if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Good all inclusive for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BCBeachBum
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days @ the Ocean Maya and we were happy there. There were for sure some issues, but I think you have to expect that in Mexico. We tried to upgrade to VIP to get top floor room with ocean view, but after paying the 3000 pesos, found that the room was not top floor and no better than our original room. (both had slightly musty smell). VIP also was supposed to get you better drinks and the ability to book ala cartes in advance, but they did not have better drinks (only Corona, on tap) and everyone seemed to be able to book dinner reservations in advance. So save your Pesos!! True there was a spot on the main walkway that smelled bad, but no biggie. The hall to the disco also smelled bad. If you want to swim in the ocean from your beach you are out of luck here. Tried snorkeling from the neighboring beaches but this area was not so good for that. Go to Puerto Morelas and do it. We booked a tour through Nolitours at the hotel $69usd and had a blast, is a must do. Went to Coco Bongo in Playa with some of the entertainment crew and had a blast, VIP treatment there, with shuttle to and from the hotel ($60 usd, drinks included). Also did Xcarat tour through Nolitours, the best part was for sure the cenote snorkleling. Could take or leave the rest of it. The food was good, not a lot of variety, but sufficient .Had Cappuchinos delivered to our table every breakfast. We found if you are not rude to the staff and tip reasonably they went out of their way for you. Japanese resturant was the best, but avoid the sit down menu...all our dishes tasted the same due to high salt content. The one where the chef cooks in front of you is great. This is the smallest and least expensive all inclusive in the area, but from the beach the grounds look better here than the others. Our a/c remote was broken, replaced in 5 minutes, our tv was screwed up and fixed in 5 minutes and our toilet backed up and was fixed when we got back from the beach. Do not agree with other posters about creepy staff, they all, including the entertainment crew were great. In all, we would return, the price is good for what you get. If you want perfect, pampered perfection, go a 5 star. This is 3.5-4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night is all it took!!”
Reviews.Author: KellysTravels
Reviews.Content: We got moved down here due to overbooking issues at the Ocean Coral 20 minutes north of here. I loved ever aspect of the hotel, it was fantastic. The grounds were gorgeous, the rooms were comfortable, and the beach was fantastic. I would recommend a reservation at the Japanese resturaunt, the preperation, show and food far out shined their sister hotel. I liked the palm trees and huts on the beach, but this is definitely NOT a swimming beach with the retaining wall. The resort next door has a good one to use though. The beds are EXTREMELY uncomfortable. They are like sleeping on a board!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice gardens but no beach !”
Reviews.Author: freewillys
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice and clean. the pool is beautifull and located near the ocean. there is no beach there. Lot of entertainements, specialy for kid's. the service in the pool and the lobby area is verry poor. the food was good, limited choice. Good value but we will probably not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, everything else awful; Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: josie353
Reviews.Content: The old saying is true: you get what you pay for. If Ocean Maya was cheaper than other resorts, you will understand why it's cheaper once you're there, and you WILL regret going there. We stayed there 2/27/09 - 3/7/09. This is not a 4 or 5 star, I'd give it 3 stars. Similar to a Days Inn or Comfort Inn. The resort pictures on their website are old because the beach is nothing like they advertise. There's a terrible sewer odor around the grounds, in the basement level near disco and even while taking a shower. Some guests vomited in the hall to the disco because it was so bad. (and no it wasn't due to alcohol). Shower went scalding hot to ice cold. The toilet ran over on our bathroom floor and we had to beg to get towels and water daily. We asked to move but were told no unless we paid $100 more. If you tip you will get adequate service; if you don't tip then you're ignored. They never came to look at our toilet the entire 8 days we were there, so we were scared to flush! Unless you have money in your hand, the staff pretends they can't understand you. Don't let your kids walk around alone, as some staff members are creepy! Pools are good but entertainment staff consists of a guy yelling in a bullhorn to try to get you up and playing games. The hurricanes took the beach away, and the water in front of Ocean Maya is rocky and murky. We took the bus north to Cancun to visit our friends who were staying there, and the beach was perfect, and the water at those resorts is crystal clear and turquoise. I wish we stayed in Cancun but we were nervous having a 12 yr. boy and 14 yr. boy. Our travel agent warned us not to go to Cancun with teen boys but there is nothing to worry about, our friends loved their resort in Cancun. Our travel agent had sent people to Ocean Maya before, but certainly not this year. It looks old and not kept up. Our boys were bored to death at Ocean Maya. NOTHING for them to do. In Cancun there are plenty of things to do - bowling, mall, ice cream parlors, souvenoir shops, all within walking distance. Ocean Maya's buffet was bland and my boys complained about not liking anything they offered and they are not picky, they are teen boys for pete's sake! Don't waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good with few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: holidayer1234
Reviews.Content: Well, for the most part the resort was very good. The staff was very curtious, especially all the servers. The hotel room was ok, very clean which is good. The food was good, but i found it near imposible to get a cup of coffee in the morning, there was never any cups. The pool was very nice, lots of beach chairs and nice sand. I found the beach crew entertainers very anoying, they did not stop when you said no. The service of the waiters was outstanding, and thats what really stood out to me. One horrible experience was my girlfriend getting a massage. The massager pestered her all week giving her free trails (which was good at the time), but when we finally got her one things kinda changed. the massage was good, but when he was finishing up he streached her out by pulling back on her torso with one hand , and supporting himself by putting his other hand in her groin. (luckly she wore pants). if that wasent enough he finished that massage by saying "you are a very beutiful girl and asked for a hug" other than that the stay was not to bad.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: N0tHardt0Please
Reviews.Content: Arrived around midnight only 1 person on duty for a whole bus load of travellers. No help provided to find your room at the resort at that time. Many areas in and around the resort smelt like an open sewer. Down stairs in the disco the smell was terrible. Make sure all valuables are locked up. Left our I-pod out in our suitcase one day and the suitcase was ruffled through and the player stolen. Service very poor and many of the staff unfriendly. Many of the dinning tables were left dirty after people had finished eating for long time periods, not much variety in food. Much of the beach furniture is broken. What beach there is is rocky. Beach/pool entertainment people annoying. They walk around with a mega-phone and yell in your ear to try and get you to participate and if you ask them politely to go away, because you want to relax, they just get louder and harass you more. Bar service limited. Nightly entertainment OK. Overall experience was disappointing, glad to leave and would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya - Good times for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: tanlines4me
Reviews.Content: Ocean Maya is a smaller resort in a great location, situated in between Playa Del Carmen and Cancun. The have a great buffet, and the A LA Carte Mexican restaurant was a nice evening with fabulous service. What I loved the most about this resort is the staff, specifically the entertainers... Loved, Loved, Loved the activities... as the staff worked hard to involve all guests staying there. The nightly shows are great, with different themes every night. SO MUCH FUN... I would definitely stay in the OCEAN MAYA - H10, if I returned to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WpgTourist
Reviews.Content: Who we are: My girlfriend and I are in our late 20's when we took this trip. We stayed one week at the Ocean Maya Hotel. This is our first stay at an all inclusive resort and our first trip to Mexico. DAY 1: After a four hour flight from Winnipeg and two hours in the Cancun Airport, we finally were on our way to the hotel. The shuttle to the hotel was roomy and comfortable with drinks (you have to pay for) served to the guests. We arrived at ~8pm and were tired. It took some time to check in as there was only one attendant (at first for 15 minutes). Once we settled in we decided to get some food. We went to the Italian Restaurant to see if we could get in or make a reserevation later that night (you actually have to book the a la carte restaurants at a small desk in the main lobby). Surprisingly the Italian restaurant took us in and made us a great meal. Issues / Concerns from other Trip Advisor Reviews: There is no sewer / sewage smell in the main lobby, it is however present in the basement and some few areas around the hotel. None of our small personal items were stolen but we did use the safe for the important things. Our maid never stole from us and always kept the room clean. There was no bathtub in our room, instead there was a large shower. Fresh bottled water (1 per person) was brought to our room daily at no extra charge. There was also purified water in the ice and by the bar. The beds are stiff. My girlfriend and I prefer that type of bed though, so it wasn't an issue to us. FOOD / DRINKS: To clarify from other reviews and websites there are 4 restaurants at the Ocean Maya. One buffet restaurant (with different themes for dinner) and three a la carte restaurants (Japanese, Mexican and Italian). The buffet was ok, the food wasn't great but the food never ran out and there never was a shortage of any item. The Japanese restaurant wasn't great, everything on the traditional menu was very salty. The person booking us for the Japanese restaurant neglicted to tell us about the "show" and the sushi menus for the Japanese restaurant so we missed most of their menu. The Mexican and Italian restuarants both have great food and yes some of their items you do have to pay for (anywhere from $25-42 USD for Steaks / Seafood / Surf & Turf). The drinks were always great. The only complaint I have is that there was no variety. There was one type of Margarita, Daquiri, and etc. I was expecting maybe 2-3 different types of margarita and etc, but didn't find any. Also, they do make Ceasars but they are not on the menu. Some of their drinks like their food, you do have to pay for. After dinner drinks, brandies, scotch and etc you do have to pay for. Also, for all the dinners I had at the Ocean Maya, there never was a wine list. There only seemed to be the house wine, which seemed unlikely considering there is a large wine rack room with a large selection inside the buffet restaurant. ROOMS: The rooms were very comfortable and were perfect for our holiday. Almost all the rooms (with exception to the rooms in "Building B"). Were located in two storey "villas." There were approximately 7-8 rooms per villa which resulted in a very quiet stay. There are either patios or balconys with each villa room and we were fortunate enough to get a room with a balcony. The balconies all have small gardens so I recommend getting a balcony room. There was leak at the base of our toilet and the shower door didn't close all the way. We complained on the second day about the leaking toilet but it was never resolved. The televisions were small and ours had to be turned on manually. ENTERTAINMENT / SHOPPING: The nightly entertainment did vary from bingo, drinking contests, auctions with fun money, and etc. The night shows were basically dancers lip syncing to hit music and show tunes which I didn't find to be entertaining. There were about 4 shops there at the resort, one general store, a mexican souviner store, a photoshop / internet store (you can take photos with exotic animals and purchase photos here), and a silver store. On the map of the Ocean Maya a "shops" area is described in Building B. We only found more rooms when we went to Building B. By the way, if you can, bring your laptop! Otherwise there is no free internet or free computer at the hotel. You either have to pay $10 USD for a half hour of internet use at the hotel or $5 at the photoshop store for an hour of use. POOLS / BEACH: There is approximately 150 feet of beach where you can enter the water but the water is murky and looks uninviting. There are 3 pools I could see. One small kiddie pool, a large general activities pool and an "adult" pool with swim up bar. Kids were in the adult pool so they are kind of loose on the rules. There is only one spot in the general pool that is more than 5 feet deep, so going on a diving board or anything such as that is impossible at the Ocean Maya. There was also no jaccuzi area, just an area in the adult pool with jets. There were plenty of chairs, hammocks and beach ground available for the guests and were all well kept. STAFF: All staff members were very friendly, polite and accomodating. Most of them are multi-lingual, speaking Spanish French and English. INSECTS / ANIMALS: Iguanas were either sunning themselves or walking around during the daytime. Some small racoons were walking around at night (we saw them on the first day only). Small lizards also crawled near the exterior light fixtures at night. No mosquitos at this resort but fruit flies were around the buffet soda machines and I found one in one of my Margaritas. SHUTTLES / ACTIVITIES: Be sure to book your reservation for a shuttle to Playa Del Carmen or Cancun well in advance (Maybe on the first day). Otherwise you may have to wait a few days before you can get an early shuttle. Shuttles to Playa start at Noon and theres only one shuttle per day to Cancun. Some shuttles returning to Playa cost $3USD per person. There were also stations to buy or book a trip to the various site seeing tours or parks around Mexico. GENERAL REVIEW: We had a great time here, whether it was swimming at the pool or eating at the many restaurants. Some small issues didn't make the trip perfect but it was still very relaxing at the Ocean Maya. I'd recommend this trip to anyone attending - including young couples. I think if we were to return to the region, we'd try a new hotel but only for the sake of trying something new.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SLDCalgary
Reviews.Content: Nice clean facility offered good food, drinks and overall friendly service. Enjoyed the nightly entertainment and the daily activities by staff. Of the three "A la carte" restaurants we tried the Japanese and Italien. Weren't impressed by the Italien restaurant however we did enjoy the Japanese rest. Buffet breakfasts and dinners were all very good. No swimming at beach in front of hotel. Always windy with red flags up and water in this area is not as nice as other areas of the Mayan Riviera. Pools in complex were very nice and we didn't have problems finding chairs at any time of day. I would recommend this hotel to other travellers as we felt it was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: bynthere
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico and I wasn't really sure what to expect. I went with a group of 6 and we were all quite upset when we arrived at our hotel at 11pm thirsty and hungry and there was nothing at all to eat (we were told there would food available 24/7) and had to go down into the 'disco' to have a drink. Thank goodness everything got better the next day! Being a picky eater there wasn't much that interested me and the buffet but everyone else seemed to really enjoy it. The cooks are awesome, the waiters were very friendly and the theme nights at the buffet were something to look forward to. Be sure to book early if you want to eat at the restaurants, they were mostly booked when we got there and we booked right away. We were with Nolitours and had no problems with them, they were really helpful and we booked 2 excursions. We did the Sea Passions catamaran tour which included snorkelling and lunch on the Isla mujeres and we had an hour of free time on the island as well. We chose to rent scooters and go around the island, very fun...if your not the best driver though try the golf carts instead. Also did the Coba Mayan Adventure which was different than I had expected but worth it! As for the hotel rooms they were clean and ours was in good shape. Only problems would be that they didn't have any TV remotes left when we got there and no Air conditioner remotes, so we froze for the first few nights of our stay. Be sure to spend some time in the lobby later in the evening, the bartenders are super fun! The pool was nice, but ocean was quite murky not quite the clear blue we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: sunshine055
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I am writing this review based on the fact that this resort is rated a 4* and that we got an excellent price. Myself, my husband and our children, 13 & 11, stayed here from Feb. 9 - 16th. The week we were there the weather was absolutely perfect which always helps make our vacation great. We certainly did not go expecting what we have gotten from 5* resorts in the past and we were not at all disappointed. The grounds are beautiful, the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the food at the buffets and the a la cartes was really good, always something for everyone. Do be warned though that there is only water in the mini fridges in the room, I was sure that I read there was beer and pop. We bring our big insulated cups when we go away so we just had to take a quick walk to the bar to get a refill at night. We also bought a couple six packs of beer in Playa Del Carmen to keep in our fridge for after the bar was closed, not a big deal.
