The resort is a great size and it is very easy and quick to get around to everything. I will admit that the beach in front of the resort was a bit of a disappointment, but it did not keep our kids from playing around in the waves. The hurricane has eroded a lot of the beaches around there. You can walk a long way down the beach and play in the water along the way. If you are a real beach person, then I would suggest taking the free shuttle from the hotel to Playa Del Carmen and hanging out at the beach there, it is stunning. Playa itself was beautiful with tonnes of great shops (high and low end) and lots of really cute restaurants. So all in all it was a great bang for our buck and personally we had no complaints. We were happy to be on vacation and in the beautiful Mexican weather.

Reviews.Title: “Fun had by all....”
Reviews.Author: shondalynn
Reviews.Content: We were at Ocean May during the week of January 28-February 4, 2009(were from northern Minnesota)After reading some of the reviews on the resort we were a little skeptical of what to expect. Needless to say the bad reviews were blown way out of proportion. Yes the ocean does have a retaining wall so you cant walk directly into the ocean and this is the only real downfall we found to the resort but the resort itself makes up for this-and if you really want to go into the ocean just walk down the beach either way(to the right is the better way) and play in the water there.Our only other complaint about the resort was the bar tenders arent always the fastest so we brought bigger cups with covers to the beach/pool area and had a waitress bring drinks to us in the lobby bar-get two drinks at a time if you need.No big deal. The size of the resort is nice-you can get from the beach/pool area to your room in a few minutes and its on the way to the buffet/lobby bar area, which is only a few more minutes.The grounds are beatuiful,the rooms are a little dated but cute and everything worked and they were clean.The beach and pool area were very pretty and very clean and close to each other which was nice.The food at the buffet andthe evening ala carte restaraunts were good(the Japanese restaurant food was GREAT!! We did both the short table and show meal. I recommend going to the Japanese twice and skip the Mexican alacarte restaurant-food there was ok but nothing to brag about).We didnt get in to the Italian-it was full. Be sure to sign up for the alacarte restaraunts right away as they fill up fast.The activity leaders are a hoot(fun and friendly-especially the guys Rikki and Jaime)and there are plenty of things to participate in from 11 am until around 3,if your willing to try them-water volleyball, beach volleyball, dance lessons, water aerobics,stretching on the beach,contests by the pool, contests on the beach,ceremic painting, etc.Most of the evening shows were good and the dance party folloing is fun to participate in.After reading the reviews about the disco we almost didnt go check it out but decided to on our last night after the lobby bar closed-I wish we would have done it sooner. Yes there are a lot of steps down to it and it was a little musty (not sewer) smelling-could probably use a few dehumidifiers-but it is beautiful and the activity leaders make it a lot of fun which makes up for the musty smell and after a while yu dont even notice it. Overall we were very satisfied with the resort and would definately refer it to anyone.(Check out the pictures)The resort was beautiful, the price was great and the atmosphere was pleasent-what more could you ask for?!And remember-its Mexico- and your vacation is as little or as much fun as you make it!!Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jessica-louise
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself spent two awful weeks in this hotel. It was supposed to be rated 5* but I have stayed in better 2* resorts. Whilst the grounds and gardens were very nice, the room was shabby with door handles hanging off, rusty dirty shower cubicle etc etc. The food was typical of a canteen style standard, cold and uninteresting. Onsite restuarants were excuses for ala carte menus. I asked for a cup of coffee in one and was told they didn't have any! Would this happen in 5*. At breakfast we had to clear a table in order to eat and then found that we had to use a plastic spoon for our food and drink coffee from a paper cups. The hotel bar served drinks after 10.30pm in plastic cups and to top it all the bar closed at 11pm. The entertainment was dire, with bingo and beer drinking competitions not only round the pool but in the loung at night. Shows were mimed and costumes were poor to say the least. We were without water for 24 hours, in that heat with no flushing toilets or showers you can imagine what it was like. It's a good job we don't play tennis because the courts were unusable. Quite honestly, I would never go back to this hotel, we were delighted to get home. We could write a book about the problems we have experienced and we are currently taking our case to County Court. Has anyone else had similar experiences? Oh I nearly forgot, we were told that we had to pay $2000 for our accommadation even though we had already paid our tour operator and had the relevant receipts.

Reviews.Title: “Great first all inclusive family holiday”
Reviews.Author: gdkmartin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Cancun area. Everything worked exactly as our travel agent had planned out. The fights the transfers and the accomodations. We had read different reviews about this resort so weren't sure what to expect. We knew we would have to base our review on our own experiences. We arrived late on Feb 1. The hotel had our reservations already to go when we arrived. We had 2 rooms booked side by side. We have a 22 yr old son and 14 yr old daughter. So the girls took one room and the guys took the other. The first morning we met with our Transat respresentative in the lobby. She was very good about explaining everything about the resort and the side trips that were available. The first 2 days we just hung around the resort and pools to get use the place. A big thanks to the entertainment staff (Ricki, Jami, Jerry and Susanna for the dance lessons and Spanish lesson.) They worked very hard around the 2 pools and beach getting everyone involved in all of the activites and then performed everynight in the theatre and lobby. The weather was in the mid 70's, sunny in the morning and then partly cloudy in the afternoon. The wind blew everyday so did not go into the ocean as the waves were crashing in everyday. The rooms were cleaned everyday and fresh towels layed out. The food was good in the main buffet restaurant for breakfast and suppers. We tried the Mexican restaurant one night (which was ok) The Japanese restaurant was excellent. The show and the food. Pros about this resort: Clean rooms and lots of hot water Friendly staff in restaurants Good food and no problems with the water Great entertainment staff Smaller resort not too big to get around Beautiful grounds great sand Cons about this resort: Wierd smell downstairs by the disco No drinks in mini fridge only bottled water No direct access to the ocean because of the retaining wall. They need better lighting on walk ways at night and better numbers marking the different buildings We would give this resort an "A"

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: gonehunting666
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ocean Maya. I was a little concerned after reading some reviews. Well the check in went very smooth got a drink before looking for our room. Found our 2nd floor room with king size bed and with a small table and 2 chairs.Lots of room hudge shower with great pressure and hot water.The staff had animals or flowers in the room each day. The food was great at the buffet a good selection.The mexican and japanese was great the other was already booked up when we tried to go so unable to try it. Staff works very hard to do activities all day and shows at night. They made all types of drinks for us anytime we asked.The beach has a wall but the sand is great. You can just walk around wall to the ocean. Yes some smell in one spot on the path.No big deal have a couple drinks and you do not notice. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ColinkaraWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ocean Maya on Jan. 28/09 for one week. From Winnipeg, we paid $1000 per person taxes included. Prior to leaving, I read every review that was available of this place. I was quite worried given the negative reviews. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised, but the stay was not without a few problems (as I will mention throughout this review). Food: Very good. The buffet was smaller than we were used to, but there was always something to eat. The coconut ice cream (looks just like vanilla) was to die for! The Italian a-la-carte was fantastic! We got one reservation and then wanted to return. When we were told it was full, we went directly to the restaurant and "tipped" the host and were let in immediately. The food that was included (some you had to pay for) was plentiful and delicious. The Japanese restaurant was also very good. We didn't go to the Mexican restaurant, so no comment on that one. Cleanliness: Very clean. Some cigarette butts on the beach, but that was about it. The grounds are spectacular. I ended up tipping one of the grounds workers and he was very grateful given that they are not often tipped. Rooms: Beds are VERY hard. I had known this in advance, so I brought along a foam pad to leave there. This helped immensely. (Tip: put it in a new garbage bag and suck out all the air with a vaccum - then seal it with a twist tie. This saves a huge amount of space in your suitcase). I would not have been able to sleep without the foam pad. The bathroom is OK. The shower and toilet are separate from the sink area. We had some leaking issues from the shower into the sink area. Also, we had some sewer smell issues. It appears that this is mostly a problem just after you've used the water. Likely an issue with Mexican plumbing. We had a maintenance man to our room as the smell was very bad, but he said that he couldn't find anything wrong. So we just lived with it. No point in getting upset. We had a second floor room in one of the haciendas (there is a 3 story building as well with rooms, but try to avoid these as they are apparently quite old and may be a bit moldy). Take a second story room if possible as we had heard that the main floor rooms were very loud from those staying above. The balconeys are nice, but be careful with the railing....it was a bit loose in our room which was only an issue as we travelled with young children. Overall, the rooms were fine, but the lack of maintenance and some chipped tiles and uncomfortable beds hold this resort back from having a better star rating. I know that you don't spend much time in the room, but it does matter if you can't get a good night's rest. General maintenance: Overall OK. Just be careful. There are lots of steps that aren't clearly marked and one could trip and fall if not careful. Also be careful around the bathroom by the pool (next to the restaurant). The flagstones that they used are quite sharp and not even. It is easy to hurt yourself there. Again, just be careful and pay attention to where you are walking. Pools: There are 3 pools. One very small round kids pool, one large main pool and one larger pool where the bar is. Yes, they do use chlorine as I saw them throwing it in every day. Some of the tiles are coming loose, but it wasn't really an issue. The pools are unheated and are clean. Beach: The chairs and palapas are plentiful. The sand is nice and very white. The sea wall is only an issue if you want immediate access to the water. The water was clean if the wind was coming from the north, but was dirty and full of weeds if the wind was from the south. The beach in front of the dive center was not great at all. It was small and had lots of washed up glass pieces. But this isn't a problem if you watch where you are walking. Note that there are washrooms also in the dive center for guests. These washrooms are MUCH nicer than the ones beside the restaurant. If you want to go into the water, there is a nice beach at the resort just north of this one (the Blue Bay Grand Esmeralda). There is a section where it is mostly sand and the water is quite shallow, which works well if you have children with you. There was only one day that the staff were working on the pier that is being rebuilt, so this really wasn't an issue. The beach is quite first thing in the morning. At around 9 or 10 am, the staff starts the louder dance style music that sometimes gets annoying when you are looking for peace and quiet. The activities staff were very pleasant and not pushy. They accepted "no" for an answer. Guests: This resort was filled with 90% french people from Quebec. They tended to travel in larger groups and were quite loud and rude (both to other guests and to the staff). Staff told us that they are very demanding and often cause a "stink" if their needs are not met. We met many other guests from Canada who all had the same opinion. Enough said on this topic. Shuttle to Playa Del Carmen: Sign up at guest services. There are time slots that are free and time slots that cost $3 US per person. It is not clear why this is, but just be aware that this is the case. Check in: We were first off the bus and first to check in, so it wasn't a problem. It does take a few minutes. From there, we went directly to book our a-la-cartes at guest services and had not problems booking. A safe will cost you $2 US per day, but is worth it. All in all it was a great vacation. We were pleasantly surprised with the service and the layout of the resort itself. It was a real tropical experience. We would go back if we got a good deal, but otherwise, we may try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place If you only want to swim in a pool”
Reviews.Author: Little Bull
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ocean Maya Jan 18/09 - Jan 25/09 Everything was very clean, service was great,the grounds of the hotel were gorgeous and well maintained, food at the buffet was very good the odd time there was a few things that you might not eat. The Japanese and the Italian (Argentina) restaurent was delicious. Staff were very friendly and there english was much better than Dominican Republic. If your were going for the beach this is not the place to go. We were told the beach was beautiful it was beautiful about 3 1/2 years ago before the hurricane took most of the beach away. There is about a 4 foot cement retaining wall which would be understandable after you had a hurricane but it was rocky and about a 1/2 of foot deep of seaweed. The whole purpose of going to places is like that is to have a decent beach where you can swim. If you plan on going here I hope you only enjoy swimming in the pool. Other than that everything was extremely good. Beachlover Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for theft!”
Reviews.Author: SUNADDICTS
Reviews.Content: This is the first time to this resort for my husband and I. We have been to the Mayan Riviera several other times. The resort had beautiful grounds and the rooms were pretty much standard, but clean. Our shower fixture was held together with yellow tape which wasn't the most appealing but that would be our only complaint regarding the rooms. Warning though....never forget to lock your safe. Housekeeping leaves a note on your door and forbids access to your room. My husband and I were horrified to return to our room, tip taken, room not made up and over $400.00 missing! We immediately brought this to the attention of the management staff and Nolitours. A report was filed with the hotel but they did absolutely nothing about it. They insisted that we go into Playa Del Carmen to file a police report. They even went as far as to say that the housekeeper (male) was interogated, but later was told by head of security that it was a friend of his from the Police. This definitely put a damper on our vacation and needless to say we didn't trust any of the housekeeping from then on in. The staff was not very friendly with the exception of a waiter named Jose :-) Check in for us was very prompt as we were a very large group coming from Edmonton, so they had everything prepared. The stench that all other reviews mention is true. The basement smells like a sewage facility and if you ever want to take in the night club you will have to grin and bear the smell. As some put it, "if you drink enough alcohol, you forget about the smell". The food was really good in the buffet restaurant, which changed their theme daily. Both the Italian and Japanese a la cartes were fantastic. Great ambience. With the Italian though, you need to pay extra if you want anything fancy. Hmmmm, all inclusive?? All in all the resort was ok. Would we stay there again? No. Again be very careful with your valuables!!!

Reviews.Title: “get away”
Reviews.Author: generalAlberta
Reviews.Content: I went to the Ocean Maya with a friend for a week get away from it all. The Ocean Maya was a beautiful resort with gorgeous grounds that were well maintained and immaculate. The staff were friendly and helpful, very nice people. The food was plentiful and good. The beach and pool area were great. The rooms were okay, nothing fancy. The entertainment was a bit hokey, reminding me of a high school dance recital most evenings. We did have to share a room with one bed in it for three days as someone screwed up and we didn't get the right room. We did get a cot, but it sucked. It also screwed up a day's activities for us as we needed to accomodate the room change and we were not apologized to or compensated in any way for this hassle. If you are looking for a nice place to stay while you are out touring in the Mayan Riviera, then this resort is great. If you are looking for a place that will entertain you and keep you busy, then this resort falls short. It is pretty boring to just hang out at this resort during your stay, unless lying on the beach is all you wish to do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Injure yourself as you will be out of luck.”
Reviews.Author: beginnerRedDeer
Reviews.Content: I have been bugging my husband for years to travel south and we finally made the leap, I am very glad that the sun was plentiful and our daughter had a glorious time so that he is encouraged to go again. We arrived on Wednesday night after a long day of travelling. We decided to walk down to the pool area for a quick look. My husband decided to walk around the pool area, not paying close attention to his surroundings he wondered onto the deck of the swim up bar. He lost his footing and fell onto the cement about 5 feet down where the bartenders stand. There were no lights, or ropes that would prevent him from taking this journey. The "security" guard or otherwise known as the man who stands by the pool sauntered over after a bit and called the front desk we thought as he couldn't speak English. We waited approx 45 mins for anyone to come, and the medic who did come didn't speak English either. After rubbing some "ointment" and shaking his head you can imagine our confidence in the Mexican medical industry. They didn't offer to help us to his room, and the calls to the front desk for extra pillows; towels; ice; and a remote control took 4 trips and 4 hours to arrive. The staff would bring one thing at a time as my husband laid in agony. We didn't receive one call from the hotel at any later date to see if everything was o.k. We didn't get asked if our room was on the main level and if stairs would be a problem. The rooms were also not wheelchair accessible. We had to follow up with guest services for crutches, they didn't bother to tell us there was a wheelchair available. When we finally signed one out, it broke, and then they didn't have a replacement one. They said they hurried to fix one as we had plans to travel into town and needed the chair, that delayed our trip by 4 hours. We finally got the chair back and it broke again on our excursion. You know it is one thing having to push a spouse on his holiday in a wheelchair. It is another to push a broke wheelchair. We saw on the last day you could upgrade your room for a cost with mini bar, which would have at least been a nice option as he couldn't travel to the bar even if he wanted to. Overall it didn't result in the relaxing vacation we had desired, and my husband with a broken heel and torn ligaments could have had a better trip but amenities weren't offered to make his stay any more enjoyable. The resort itself was beautiful and well maintained. The food wasn't bad but not as accessible as we were advised and poorly labelled. The pool was great, and the entertainment staff were very enjoyable. Our daughter enjoyed the pool and the trips, and the staff on our excursions were tremendous and very accommadating based on my husband's limited mobility. I highly recommend the trip to the Island of Women by boat, our crew was amazing. Our room was clean but not extrodinary. My expectation of the hotel would be at the very least a follow up to see how my husband was feeling, and what steps they were taking to ensure no others fell. This 4 star rating should be lowered at least to a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed everything”
Reviews.Author: BelgiansNYC
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and my 2 year old son) went there in September. We enjoyed the quiet swimming pool, the beautiful rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beach is not adequate for snorkelling (brownish water) and the snorkeling trips they provide are quite expensive compared to what you can find in Playa. We enjoyed the diversty of the customers (mix of Europeans, North Americans and Mexicans). Some minus: the food can get boring for a long stay (we stayed nearly two weeks) and we tought there could have been more mexican food. Plenty of mosquitos was a major problem for me as I reacted twice with allergy (which was the first time). The kid club take the kids only from 3 years old. We had read reviews before choosing and knew what to expect. The price was however unbeatable and we had decided to go for something cheaper but to visit a lot, what we did . Definitely good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - a real good place for families”
Reviews.Author: muddypickle
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ocean Maya this January with 4 other young couples and found this hotel is great for families as not too much was going on for young couples. I have nothing negative to say about the Ocean Maya. Check in - A bit slow, but who cares, you're in Mexico Food - Not too bad, a weeks worth of it is enough but I enjoyed it. The Japanese restaurant was great. My husband and I also booked a candlelight dinner on the beach and the food was delicious Pools - Great, swim up bar is good too - though there are only 2 bartenders so it can be a bit slow. Beach - Not that great, most of it is walled but the water seemed warmer than the pool Rooms - Had no problems with our rooms, make sure you tip for cute towel creations Service - Great Grounds - Beautiful! Keep an eye out for blue crabs at the spot with the sewage smell (yeah it smells, but its not that bad) Entertainment - Not fantastic, but the shows are fun to watch and the staff are great dancers Day Trips - we went on the Sea Passions (awesome for younger people, catamaran takes you to Isla Mujeres - amazingly beautful!); Captain Hook (a fun night, good for kids and young couples); Tulum Extreme (a packed day, it was great if you like zip lines)

Reviews.Title: “Read This If You're Considering This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhhhhhhhhh222
Reviews.Content: OK, lets start with I never listen to these reviews because I feel only the real complainers and hard to please people are the only one's writing. I've been all over Cuba, Dominican, Mexico and Bahamas. I don't have high expectations when I go away, I expect decent food, clean rooms, nice beach. I don't expect to be pampered or have someone wait on me 24/7. I will not tell you to not go to this resort nor will I tell you to go. I will give you the pros and cons and you can decide if this place is for you. CONS- The resort pictures show a beautiful beachfront. NOT. The beachfront was wiped out a few years ago the resort had to put up a retaining wall to prevent this from happening again. Assuming the beachfront is 300 feet wide, approx. 250 feet is a retaining wall with no access to the water, there is an area of 50 feet where you can go into the water. The water is no postcard material, it's not blue, it's not green , it's not turquois, it's Grey. The resort has yet to update the website. The Resort advertises 24 hour bar. NOT. There was no alcohol available after 1 am. Same goes for the 24 hour food. Disco/Nightlife - NONE. The disco is in the basement which is difficult to find, When you do find it, you will be lucky if there are 8 people in it. No onsite scooter or car rental. PROS- The resort itself was Very nice and clean. The landscape was beautiful, the rooms were very clean, the actual beach/sand (not including the ocean) was very nice. The food was above average. We travelled with 13 people including 5 kids and NO ONE got sick, no one threw up or got the runs. Everybody always found something they liked for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I don't eat seafood but there was plenty of it and members of my party said it was all excellent. The ala carte restaurants were very good. My only complaint is the Italian restaurant could have used some decor. The pools are really nice, a little cold but it is January. Showers were good, never ran out of hot water and had good water pressure. Overall, our vacation was OK. We had a good time and no one got sick and that's most important. And for all the people complaining about the sewage smell, get over it, it's a very small area on the walkway for about 20 feet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.... Not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FutureMrsF10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ocean Maya around 10:30pm on Wednesday 1/7 after traveling since 6:30am. (we sat in the plane on the runway for almost 5 hours before we took off, missed our connecting flight, had to wait around in Dallas before we could catch the last flight to Mexico.) Needless to say we were starving the guy at the front desk said that the buffet was still open, so we were excited to get some food. The bellman that helped us to our room said that there was food available tll 2:30am. We came back to the lobby 1/2 hour later to eat and the buffet wasn't open there was a pan of some sort of cheese (looked like Feta, cold ham chunks, and cold peas. Apparently that was the buffet they were speaking of. My fault for not being specific. Our room was ok - the bed was hard as a rock, but clean. The sheets were like sandpaper probably 100 count sheets. We didn't have a remote for the TV or the air conditioner. Our tv wouldn't turn on, so we pulled it away from the wall to see if it was plugged in, it was, so we started to investigate. We found a cable box screwed into the UNDERSIDE of the desk in the room. So when we did finally get a remote control from the front desk we had to lay at the bottom of the bed and aim the remote under the desk. The bathroom was clean, but there were tiny little ant like bugs scurrying around the sink. The pool was good. The bar at the pool was SWARMING with bees. So if any is allergic make sure you come prepared. The drinks were weak and served in small plastic cups. I caught on the next day and we bought little plastic coozie bottles in Downtown Playa. The bartenders will fill it up for you so you don't have to go a million times and it keeps your frozen drinks frozen. I found that it worked well when we got up in the morning we went and put our towels down on our chairs and then went to have breakfast. Only one day did we have a problem finding any chairs. The beach was disappointing. There was a sea wall which kind of ruined the beach thing for me. If you walk down the beach there are some fabulous resorts and spas. It is a great walk. The food was okay. There were a lot of choices, but unfortunately we weren't quite sure of what everything was. It would be nice if everything had been labled. Maybe I would have tried more things. We were relaxing at the pool one day and the guy from the Dive It shop came up to us and told us about a Catamaran / snorkeling / swim with sharks / parasail / open bar / lunch trip for $79 usd. He said that it is Adults only - NO KIDS and we decided to go forth with it. Well, when we were boarding the shuttles we noticed children, so we asked the guy that told us no kids. He said oh there is a different boat that the families and children go on. Well it was a bold face lie, we had at least 10 kids on the boat. I didn't care that they were there, but we were told that they wouldn't be. Just incase that is important to someone else, I thought that I would let you know. Otherwise the trip was great the lunch was great. The currents were super strong, and don't sit in the very front of the catamaran you WILL get soaked!! 5th avenue in downtown Playa is worth the trip. If you take the shuttle from the hotel it is $3, we did that and then took a cab back to the hotel for $14. People will try to screw you. You don't need the jewlery but they NEED the money. Be willing to walk away. They will chase you out of the shop and give you a better price. Also whatch them when they are doing their calculations - they keep "forgetting" what the currency exchange rate is. Wear comfortable shoes... it is alot of walking on cobblestone streets. Overall we had a good trip. The grounds were georgous. You get what you pay for. If the beach is important to you.... this isn't the place for you. There is plenty of sand, but not easy water access. Tip your bartenders and you will get better service and stronger drinks. There wasn't on person at the front desk that had any clue what was going on. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Drinks in Dirty Glasses”
Reviews.Author: Dirtyglasses
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Maya was the worst so-called four-star resort that I've ever seen. To be charitable, it was a three-star hotel with two-star people running it. It seemed to depend on your gender, age and linguistic abilities as to how you were going to be treated. The first of two rooms had a sewer smell inside and out that would not go away. The TV was old (30 years?) and small. It became smaller in the second room, which had a partial view of the pool. The bathroom had no bath, the shower head looked like it could have been salvaged from a condemned building and brought back to work at Ocean Maya. The staff had a few good people and a lot of not so good people. One lady behind the check-in counter said there were, "...too many Canadians here." Although I'm Canadian and it didn't make me feel too good at the time, I actually agree with her. We didn't travel all the way to the Rivierra Maya to be surrounded by our neighbours. The idea of travelling is to meet people of other cultures than your own. If I want to feel at home, I'll stay there, thank you very much. The best of Ocean Maya was the pool area, which was close to the shoreline. The most horrific experience was on the last full day (January 12) I approached the lobby bar with US dollar in hand and requested two Coronas. We both watched as the bartender reached onto a tray of dirty glasses, removed two, rinsed them off under running water and then filled them with beer. I told him that we would not drink beer served in dirty glasses. At that point another bartender appraised the situation, with the first fellow telling him that he washed the glasses in soapy water. That did not happen. We moved to the far side of the lobby and were eventually served. We did not go up to the bar again. As for the food, it was average at best. The Nolitour people used fear mongering to get you to book tours only with them. Time to go home! The only people who should be recommended to Ocean Maya are people that you don't like. We'll never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Maya was no "Honeymoon"”
Reviews.Author: eflare
Reviews.Content: Do not go here if you are on your honeymoon because you won't get treated that way. We supposedly were put in an upgraded room, but were put in a room by the pool. The room was not nice, there were little bugs around the bathroom sink and mold around the shower. We were not treated nicely by the service staff at the front desk, the bars or the buffet. We had to call the front desk 3 different times to get extra blankets and towels the first night we were there. The "entertainment staff" was annoying, they bugged us every day at the pool to do something, we were there to relax not be bothered by these so called "entertainers". The only nice thing about this whole trip was the weather!

Reviews.Title: “Great entertainment team and bartenders, everything else is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: vertlook
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a Christmas week of 2008. We booked Ocean Front room with two queen beds via oceanmayaresort.com for family of four. We arrived ~8PM on Sunday after long and tiresome flight with connection and were told that there is no reservation under our name (I actually called day before to confirm our room and the reservation was there) so we can take a hike. Then we were offered a room with one queen bed. After an hour of begging and negotiation and HEAVY bribing turned out they do have a room for us. By the time we checked in all the restaurants were closed - and we did not properly eat since day before. We were traveling several families together and our friends were arriving 2 hours later, so to relive them from this pain we asked the clerk about their reservation and he showed us their room on a map and told use they are OK. Guess what - when they showed up the same show again - there is no room, take a junior room, etc. Bottom line: it is just an extortion, simple and plain. Now, the rooms are CHEAP. As I mentioned we were several families together, all the rooms the same: everything is falling apart, all the lamps are burned and do not work, TV does not work (not that we needed it, but anyways). On the positive side, we did not spend match time in our rooms anyway, the entertainment team is amazing, kids club alone made our vacation - our kid could not wait to go there so we could have time alone, all the games and activities. The night shows are very good too, the dance after is very entertaining. Bartenders are very friendly, they would remember your name and what you like and how you like it. Be advised that all the bars close at 11PM, no alcohol in a room minibar either. Beach and a pool area are very nice. The buffet was pretty good, plenty of seafood. The japanese restaurant is a joke - don't even bother, even buffet food is better. You get more authentic japanese food for 5$ from Safeway. All in all, it was a very overpriced but a good vacation. For the price you can find much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resortt!”
Reviews.Author: Naddy63
Reviews.Content: First of all, the entertainment team is awesome!! Julio, Ricky, Jerry, Yo-Yo, and Jammy are real cool guys. They took us out to the night clubs in Cancun and were very responsible! I am definately going there again. Everyone that works at the resort is very nice. Classy lobby and the rooms were nice also! Food is also pretty good! Make sure you make reservations at the Japanese restaurant and eat at the Hibachi. Thanks a lot guys.. Naddy

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ginaqt29
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel!!! This hotel was beyond horrible. When we arrived, our room was not even ready and we could not get one until 3 pm. When we got to our room, it was disgusting. Not only was it old and rusty, but it also smelled like a sewer and there was no bathtub in the bathroom. The staff were rude, the food was horrible, and their “all inclusive” liquor was more like “all inclusive”. I understand that you can’t get top shelf, but this hotel did not even serve normal, regular tequila or vodka. Not only did you have to pay for the alcohol, but in order to have a safe, it would could you $2 a day… I never heard of such a thing before… safes are supposed to be a commodity for those who are staying at the hotel. Also, there was no entertainment. The pool was small and filled with cold water. And not to mention that, but there is barely a beach at this hotel… all you’ll get are rocks and damp water. To make the long story short… we stayed at this hotel for only one day before getting out of there to go a much better resort. If you stay at this hotel for more than one day, you should just forget about having a fun and peaceful time. When you get back home, the only thing you’ll remember is the stinky sewer smell that proceeded all over the hotel. By far the worst hotel I have ever been to!!!

Reviews.Title: “don' stay here”
Reviews.Author: HandicappedTulsa
Reviews.Content: paid for an ocean view superior room, requested handicap accessible, got a standard room the first night and only after crawling up the steps did we get a superior room the next 3 nights (never an ocean view). When we complained, we got the typical Mexican run around (I don't speak English, I'll take care of it just come back at 3:00 --after they change shifts and don't know what you're talking about) The truth of the matter is they have no handicap accessible rooms--NOT ONE! when I requested a refund, they acted as if they couldn' t hear me.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t book with Nolitours!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lady31Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I was quite alarmed to read the reviews of this hotel prior to leaving....but all in all this place was good. Check in was no problem but we didn't get in until night time...where the bar staff promptly brought us (3 women) a drink before we could even put our bags down. The room was large and clean...some minor fix-ups to be done but nothing that would affect your comfort (loose drain fixture, etc.) We went to the morning info session with Nolitours to find out what kinds of tours were available....the tours sounded fabulous, HOWEVER, my sister booked a trip to the Mayan Ruins for the Friday before we left...and she got taken!!! She was told by the Nolitours representatives that she needed to be outside waiting for the bus by 7:25am...she was there by 7:15 or so with another couple from the resort. The bus never came to pick them up and when my sister and the couple went and inquired about it they was called liars and that they would not get their $125.00 American dollars each back...my sister was beside herself not only because she missed the one and only place in the world she was dying to visit but that she was lying about being there...the Nolitours representatives not only did not apoligize but were rude and very unaccomodating to her....DO NOT BOOK WITH NOLITOURS!!! Then on the day we were leaving, we came to learn (far too late) that our flight had been delayed 3.5 hours and that the Nolitours reps knew of this and pretty much pushed us into the bus to get us away....not liking that we had something to say to them previously about thier poor service and rude demeanor....unless you can speak french do not deal with these girls or their company...so we were left to wait in the airport for 6.5 hours....prior to flying out....ridiculous!!!!! Once again...DO NOT BOOK WITH NOLITOURS UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE HOSED AND THEN CALLED A LIAR!!!!! The staff are amazing and truly accomodating to whatever you wish...tipping of course will help the service as well. The food was good...lots to choose from the buffet and they keep it regularly stocked so you don't miss out on anything....we went to the Japense restaurant and Italian....both very good but i would recommend the Italian one....one word of advice....book these immediately upon your arrival if you can....we were told that both restaurants were fully booked except for the 8:00 and 9:00 meal times....well they lied too...both restaurants were empty when we got there...so don't listen when they say they are booked because they're not...unless you don't mind eating that late. The beach was fine...yes there is a breaker wall but the sand/beach part above it is beautiful, clean and white sand....i walked along the beach on both sides of the resort and all the other resorts beach fronts were inaccessable...huge logs, trees and rocks...yes there was only a small part to enter the ocean from our resort but i would much prefer that to no beach front at all...which was the case with the other resorts...which were 5 star resorts All in all we had a great time...i would recommend this resort for those who aren't too picky and are looking for a good value for their buck!

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: zefsuper911
Reviews.Content: First of all....I have to say that I'had read lot of so so comments about the Ocean Maya...I just want to clarify it....All those bad comments are coming from irrealistic expectations, i.e. hey...you're in Mexico, not in downtown Dallas....! We were there from Dec. 20 to Dec. 27 2008. We are a family of four....two daughters of 7 and 9. It was our second trip to Riviera Maya...Last year we were at Grand Coco Bay...that was a bit of lower quality face to Ocean Maya....Just a lower one. OK...let's start. The staff is wonderful, always ready to help and smilly. The buffet is very good, lot of variety, very clean place. The three restaurants a la carte are very good...We preferred the Japannese one. The support from Nolitour is OUTSTANDING. The pools are clean, huge and there's always a lot of chairs availlables (x-mas time). The kids club is fantastic, my two daughters have passed a lot of time there, a very well organised kids club with lot of activities. No mosquitos at all. The rooms are not new, but clean. The gardens are absolutly wonderful. The only bad commentary we have to point out is the beach, that is virtually non existent. We passed a very good time there, and I recommended it all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value @ Ocean Maya”
Reviews.Author: TexasDoug1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ocean Maya was better than expected based on some of the reviews. We stayed 7 nights and paid for an ocean view room, which we were told on arrival was not available. I insisted that I had paid for the upgrade, and they were able to get us a view room immediately. AIRPORT: Walk past all people with ties and kiosks at the airport! These guys are tricky and they are ALL time share sales. your arranged transfers will be outdoors. COST: Our stay cost us $1,150.00, or about $165.00 USD per day, booked through a travel agent (thanks Debby!) - a great value for all inclusive. My 11 yr old daughter stayed/ate free and loved the hotel. TIPPING: Keep in mind that most workers in the travel related industry in Mexico earn between $8 and $20 USD per day for a 10 to 14 hour shift. They appreciate your tips - we took along about $50.00 in $1 bills - it doesn't take much to really help these hard working and friendly employees, and you will see their gratitude in the service you receive. We gave our maid about $10.00 at the first of the week and received some extra attention in our stock of bottled water, cleaning, and towel "animals" which our daughter loved. GROUNDS: The landscaping and maintenance is beautiful. There is one area that does have a persistent sewer gas smell on the main walkway from the beach/pool area to the lobby, it is where the sewer treatment unit is, and you only experience it for a few seconds as you walk past - not a big deal to us. We had no mosquito problems on our trip. ROOMS: The rooms are "bungalow" style, with eight rooms per building. We enjoyed this because it seemed more intimate and more like we were staying in a house. Our room was clean and comfortable - all marble or natural stone floors, nice balcony with chairs, $2 per day safe fee (not large enough for a laptop), no bathtub but a nice large shower. FOOD: Book reservations for the week as soon as you arrive for the specialty restaurants. The Italian restaurant was booked for the week when we finally got around to making reservations on the third day. The Japanese restaurant is great - kind of like Benihana - try to reserve at the preparation tables. We ate there twice, and one of the two chefs is an amazing showman and lots of fun - the other was just a cook, but the food was great. Mexican restaurant was OK, but not much to choose from. The buffet (no reservation) was very good with a fairly diverse variety to choose from - fresh fruits & juices, vegetables, fish, chicken, beef, pork & deserts. Snack bar near the pool was pretty lame, but it was nice to have food and drink available near the beach. BAR: We aren't big drinkers, but the bartenders were attentive and friendly - my daughter drank countless "Congas" & non-alcoholic Pina Coladas. SERVICE: We found the service here excellent - friendly and helpful - the workers were much nicer and friendlier than most of the guests! Small, frequent, tips are much appreciated. BEACH: From what I understand this stretch of beach near Playa del Carmen is man made, so the water quality is always somewhat cloudy. Ocean Maya is adjacent to Blue Bay & Secrets resorts, so these other two also share the same beach, and I would not book any hotel in this immediate area if water quality is your biggest concern. In spite of the water quality, we found the beach area very nice, as most of our water activities were off premises. GIFT: You may get a letter in your room about a "surprice" - we didn't fall for it because we were warned that there might be a time share pitch somewhere. We had no sales pressure for any time share stuff at Ocean Maya. ENTERTAINMENT: The hotel puts on a nightly show - song and dance to prerecorded music. Enjoyable, family friendly routines. There are many activities throughout the day for all ages for those who want to spend their day around the hotel. ATTRACTIONS: We went to Xel-Ha park, an all inclusive park near Tulum - very calm water for snorkeling, we saw & swam with baracudas, tropical fish, stingrays, etc. We will probably spend 2 days there next time. Good food and great trails through the jungle, river float, etc. Don't do the swim with dolphins on a one day trip to Xel-Ha, you won't have time to enjoy the other cool parts of this park.. Instead, book it at Delphinus, located near Playa and the Ocean Maya. Book these trips through a travel agency in the hotel lobby for the best deals and inexpensive transfers. We used Lomas Travel - very helpful (thanks Anna & Joanna!). This was our first stay at the Mayan Riviera, and while my family liked this all inclusive hotel, we will probably stay further south near Tulum next time we travel there so we can be closer to Xel-ha park, Mayan ruins, and reportedly beautiful beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Jeckle and Hyde of a Resort”
Reviews.Author: VillageKitchen
Reviews.Content: OK here's the real deal. We stayed at the Ocean Maya from 12/5/08 thru 12/11/08. I booked this trip because we got an amazingly low price for this trip, by reading the reviews I knew that there could be some problems, but the pictures looked great. I will start out with the good; The resorts grounds are actually very beautiful and well kept. The pool and beach area are also very nice. Some people didn't like the sea wall thing but did not bother us at all. It was nice to take long walks on the beach. Plenty of beach chairs a palapas. The staff was fantastic!!! OLA MANUEL AND JUAN!!!! Two of the nicest and best bartenders around. Very personable and went out of their way to wait on you and fix you whatever you wanted. I would often have drinks waiting for us by the time I got up too the bar. Please be sure to tip, a little goes a long way. Met alot of very nice people from all around. Very few americans and I think half of Canada was there. Hey Rick and Linda!!! We had a ball!!! People were very friendly. We did not have any problems with our room, the only thing is that there are not any bath tubs in the rooms so that threw off my wife a little bit, but she adjusted. Our maid was great and would leave us towel animals which was nice. Be sure to leave a little something for them too. Now the bad: Yes check in took a while but we got in after half of Canada arrived so this was understandable. Our room was fine and clean, where others we talked too had the sewer gas smell, no hot water, or low pressure issues that other had. One of the biggest problems for this resort is the sewer smell. There is an area about halfway up the sidewalk to the lobby where there is a constant sewer smell. The smell along with a damp musty smell is also in the Disco. We tried to go but couldn't handle the smell. The food was average at best. Not too much to choose from off the buffet and not much variety at the snack bar. We survived our week but definately did not put on weight that week. Would be go back??? We would have to think long and hard on that one, would have to be a relly cheap deal to get us back. I would probably rate this resort a 3 out of 5 stars. We are pretty easy going laid back people but were a little disappointed. Overall we had a very good relaxing drank too much time. The resort does have some shortfalls but if you get lucky with the room and weather it is survivable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation with fantastic people”
Reviews.Author: Mayanholidaygirls
Reviews.Content: Wow, there sure are a lot of complaints about this hotel! Our experience was absolutely amazing. I'll comment a bit about the negative comments first... Yes, it takes a while to check in. But relax, grab yourself a drink or three and remember that first of all, you're in Mexico and secondly, you're on vacation so chill out! Bring a pair of shorts and a bathing suit in your carry on luggage so you can hang out by the pool until your room is ready. For people complaining of bed bugs; we also got a few red bumps on our legs and arms but assumed it was from the mosquitoes. They have more than normal this year as the weather hasn't been the best. The food was great. It's a small resort so unfortunately they can't cater to everyone's needs but overall we were happy with every meal. We didn't notice a smell in our room or in our bathroom. The shower was amazing and the room was a great size with a nice little balcony. Yes, the basement has a "smell" and the disco is either hot or cold... but if you bring some friends down there, the music is great and you can enjoy yourself pretty quickly. I think your vacation becomes what you make of it and if you remember that you're in a foreign country where things aren't always up to your home standards you can still have an amazing time. For the price, it was entirely worth it... and then some! Now for my thoughts; the Entertainment staff are amazing. A special mention to Jame, George, Alex and Jerry for making us feel extra welcome and special. They spend their entire day making sure that you are comfortable and entertained. And then they spend the evening helping out with the shows and taking groups to the clubs in Playa or Cancun at night. These guys are awesome and tons of fun to be around. The bartenders always have smiles on their faces and if you tip a little, you'll find that your drinks come much quicker and much more potent! The service in the restaurants was excellent; in the buffet the service at dinner was the best. At breakfast you may have to wait a bit for coffee but you can always get up and get it yourself. Overall we had an awesome vacation! It's a small enough resort that you get to know everyone really well and as long as you have a smile on your face, you'll meet a ton of great people!! I have been to the Mayan 5 times in the last 7 years and this was by far the greatest service that I've had. Aside from the cloudy weather it was a blast and the staff was what made the difference. I highly recommend it. Edmonton, AB.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money or stars”
Reviews.Author: wildcancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel, first of all is 4 star by Canadian standards and 5 star by the Mexican, however, I would give it just 3. The rooms are nice and clean but my bathroom in particular smelled like sewer. The smell was so disgusting that at times I woke up at night and wanted to barf. I couldn't enjoy my shower. Everytime I got out of the shower I felt like I took a dip in the sewer. The entertainment sucked, they had the same actors perform different scenes/plays, but nothing special. Not all the alcohol is available, you need to have a special bracelet to wear it to drink liquors like Hahlua, etc. Food is ok, but the variety is not that great. Do not under any circumstances waste your time and book the le-carte restaurants, they are so gross! Mexican and Italian were o.k., but Japanese was just terrible. They had food on the menu at the Japanese that had nothing to do with authentic Japanese food. My friends and I hung out at the resourt right next door - Blue Bay Esmeralda, and what a difference! I suggest you stay in Blue Bay Esmeralda (some people paid the same as we did for one week at Blue Bay) and enjoy all the delicious variety of food, entertainment and truly 5star service!

Reviews.Title: “I'm NOT A complainer, however....”
Reviews.Author: emmatrue
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here, and thought, well, those must be "complainers!". I really thought it would be okay! How bad could a 4.5 star be? Well, I have to say, we were disappointed and won't be back. Grounds were lovely, spa GORGEOUS (however, hottub not HOT 2/3 visits) lobby lovely! But, PROBLEMS. I'm sorry, water is necessary! there were several nights we COULDNT shower, no/ittle water pressure. There was a foul smell (sewage?) throught the resort, and esp. right in front of the BUFFET... nasty! stomach turning. Rooms? Unimpressed, beds very hard.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't suggest this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovetheCaribbean68
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week of vacation at the Ocean Maya on December 5th. The hotel is very small, but nicely landscaped and clean. This all-inclusive hotel does not come close to others as far as what they offered. Check in - This was horrible. We waited in a line for almost 1 hour to be told we were in the wrong line. They don't have anything marked as far as which line is which. I told them I've been waiting a hour to check in and that I'm not going to go to the back of one of the other lines, so they did hesitantly check us in. They told us the room would not be ready until 3:00 pm. When we came back at 3:00 pm, we had to wait another hour in line. We didn't get to our room until after 4:00 pm. Rooms - Large room with plenty of places to put your clothes. There is a mini refridgerator that they stock daily with water. They also had a safe in the room that you had to pay $2 a day for. All the other hotels I've stayed at would stock the fridge with soda, beer and water and the safe was include. They are cheap that way. The refridgerator only worked at night time when all the lights in the resort would come on. We called them each day to come and fix it, before we figured it out on our own. Nobody ever came to fix it either probably because they knew that it wouldn't come on until the lights did and they couldn't fix it anyway. I don't know if that is how all the rooms are or if it was just ours. Beach - There is no beach. There is a nice area in the sand where there are plenty of palapa's to sit under. We found one everyday with out a problem. There is a wall that is built to protect their property from hurricanes. This wall is about 6 feet tall and runs almost the whole length of the property. There is a small area on each side of the property which you can access the ocean. This is the first trip I have been on and did not go in the ocean. It literally looks like lake Michigan. It's a brown-black color with lots of muck washing in. We walked about 1/2 hour in each direction of the hotel and there was no turquoise water to be seen. We have stayed at hotels both North and South of this hotel and had beautiful blue green waters. For some reason, this big stretch of ocean in this area is brown. Be careful if you do venture into the ocean, we saw broken glass and metal bars "rebar" used to support concrete structures in the sand next to the wall. They are rebuilding their pier which was taken out by the last hurricane. All day long they were hammering on the pier and it was a horrible loud sound of metal hitting metal echoing off the resorts buildings. There was no way to relax or try to catch a nap with all the noise. They look like they are almost half done with it, but who knows how long it took them to rebuild what they have done. Food - Very limited selection to choose from. We did not eat at any of the specialty restaurants so I can't give you any feedback on them. The buffet selection was very small and limited compared to other places I've stayed. The snack bar by the pool had hamburgers, hot dogs, fries, nachos, salsa, salad fixings and two other warm dishes such as stew or chicken. It was mostly the same thing every day. The food was good for the most part, but tasted a little different because you're in Mexico. They also put out a small buffet next to the lobby bar at around 11:00 pm with bread, ham, pasta salad and mayo to make a sandwich before going back to your room. The food does get old after a week like everyone else had commented. Neither of us got sick. Bars - There are only 2 bars. The lobby bar and pool bar. Bring your own mug with you. The cups they provide are tiny. They need more bartenders. We had to wait forever to get a drink. The lobby bar is only open until 11:30 pm. There is a disco located under the buffet restaurant in the basement. Check it out, I bet you'll come right back upstairs. I smells horrible down there and is cold and musty. It smells like the toilets overflowed down there. All in all, it was a nice resort, but I would never return after being to 5 other resorts in the Riviera Maya that were way nicer. The price was reasonable to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you want "bed bugs" stay here”
Reviews.Author: MeloMississauga
Reviews.Content: This is going to be short...... Stayed at this hotel Nov 15-21. -bed bugs ( I came back with all kinds of bites on my legs that are still itchy....some puss coming out of them on the second day of my stay) - scary!!!! - only 1 person at reception at check in- by the way you can only check in at 3pm- dosn't help when you get there at 9:30am..... -no beach (concrete wall approx. 6 ft. high before you can get to the beach) -Pool "very cold" -had no water for 24 hrs. ( reception was not accomodating at all) -breakfast was last nights dinner, lunch was this morning breakfast, dinner was today's lunch!!!! -room smelled of urine ****just so you don't think that I am being a [-] I am not a picky person...and I know these places are different from what we are use to .....but this was really bad! The Secrets hotel next door looked really nice...... I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!! ********3 star at best*******

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: nixonandkos
Reviews.Content: WE LOVED THE OCEAN MAYA - The people who work on this resort work thier butts off and love doing it.. It was totally obvious that they all actually enjoyed thier jobs. Every single employee at the Ocean Maya went out of thier way to take care of us. Hector at the lobby bar was great - always happy to see us and went out of his way to ensure we were refreshed (thanks Hector). Nora, a waitress in the lobby bar is a total sweetheart and no matter how sick of us she may have gotten she always greeted us with a smile. Alex and the rest of the entertainment team were also great, I have no idea how he manages to remember everyones names... Miguel and Manuel at the pool bar were also great entertainers as well as bar tenders. If you go to MEXICO and want to find a great hotel at an affordable price, GO to the ocean Maya. For those people who complain for having to TIP... GET A GRIP!!! What is a few bux out of your pocket for someone who has done you a service. Im sure they get paid little and tips are greatly appreciated. If you don't tip, you still get great service but if you leave a small tip, you will get further on your vacation guarunteed. Not just at the ocean Maya but ANY vacation. We had such a great time and loved every minute we spent at this hotel!!! Such a great atmosphere. The hotel itself was very clean, as well were the grounds. The food was great and plentiful. There is something for everyone...

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Ocean Maya !!!”
Reviews.Author: crimsbabe
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of November at Ocean Maya and absolutely loved it. It was shoulder season so it wasn't too crowded. The room was spacious and clean, although there was a weird musty smell but apparently its common in the Mayan Riviera. We got used to it pretty quickly. We found that tipping the maid got us a mopped floor each day which took the musty smell down alot, and guaranteed fresh water bottles in the fridge. You have to actually hand the tip to the maid. The pool bar was great, Manuel is the best, he's so sweet and is totally open to helping you with your espanol. The lobby bar is nice too, but we spent most of our time outdoors. Drinks were weak but its cuz Mexican booze is less than 40%, so we would just tip the bartender when we arrived at the bar and tell him mucho fuete por favor todos !! Bad spanish but the drinks were nice and strong after that. The entertainment team was amazing, their energy and talent is out of this world. They encourage everyone to participate in games and dancing, but they let you off the hook if you don't want to. We met a bunch of great people and had a total blast one night at the disco. The DJ is great, he reads the vibe of the crowd and spins accordingly. The food was good overall and lots of variety so, no complaints there. One thing that sucked is that they say they have continental breakfast available before 7am, and the morning we had to be in the lobby for 7am pickup for a tour, there was only a couple bananas so we pretty much starved until the tour lunch. A couple pointers, cigarettes are 20 pesos at the bar but only 1 brand, and 30 pesos in the gift shop but more brands. Tipping is great but if you overtip you come off like a flashy tourist. 50 pesos after a night at the bar is more than enough. Its only $ 5 CDN but consider that a pack of smokes is 20 pesos which costs $ 10 in Canada. If you go into Playa del Carmen, watch out for the tour guide kiosks because they are actually time share vultures in disguise. They will rope you in. We were warned ahead and are pretty savvy folks but we wasted 45 minutes before escaping. Also, the hawkers totally put us off, so much that we didn't even buy anything. Best bet if you don't like the haggle hassle is to shop in the little "department stores" along 5th Ave, they let you browse and don't bug you.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean99Toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned home from our vacation here. My legs were covered in bites (bed bugs), the food was horrible and the drinks watered down. We were without water for over 24 hours, toilets wouldn't flush, no showers; and there was no compensation for our troubles. I was extremely disappointed and would never recommend anyone visiting this resort. There is no way this is a five star (three at best).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go Here! Just don't go here.”
Reviews.Author: nejbiii
Reviews.Content: If you like Butlins in the 1950's, then this is for you. OR On the Shuttle bus from Cancun Airport we dropped other holidaymakers off at other complexes and when we entered the drive to this complex there was murmurings from other passengers to the likes of, "I am glad we are not booked in here." We were shown into a dirty room. We were shown a programme of events that included the closure of three of the four retaurants on site during our stay. We had toi endure eating with dive bombing pidgeons in the snack bar. AND no rooms have coffee or tea making facilities and the tea bar was shut.. So, were checked out within two hours and went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Rondale3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to the Mayan and our stay at the Ocean Maya was excellent. This is a beautiful little resort with plenty of beach area, a 15 min cab ride from Playa and not a bad ride from the airport (buy a Corona or 3 it makes the time pass). Although it was busy it was not over crowed, we were always able to get a spot at the pool or under a cabana without waiting or having to save a spot. The food was excellent (our only complaint is there was no seafood and we didn't like the food in the Mexican restaurant). The room was a perfect size and as the villas are only two story’s it was very quiet for the most part. The bed was very comfy (however there is nothing but two bottles of water in the mini fridge). It was an older crowd (30's to 50's) with a spattering of kids who were very well taken care of (no buffoonery that we witnessed). The service and entertainment was also very good. As it is an older resort there are pros and cons - pro beautiful (pictures do not capture) landscaping. cons some out buildings are in disrepair (bathroom near the pool) but under repair (if that makes sense). We would recommend this resort. P.S. it was 31 every day 30 sunscreen did not cut it also bring bug spray for any day trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great people”
Reviews.Author: WJEV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean maya for a week and it was amazing. It was my girlfriend and I who travelled together but met up with 2 other great couples. We didn't know either couple before hand but when leaving it seemed as if we were friends for a long time. First of all the resort was very clean, well kept, and felt extremely safe. Lots of security and to get in there was gates with gaurds. Everyone spoke great english and was always smiling. We had great luck with the pool tender, Hector who was hillarious and Manuel, Gilberto and Maria I bleive were all top notch bartenders.. they were all great but these ones stuck out. One bartebder was even serving up a little flare. I found a lot of the travellers obnoxious and rude when it came to being served both drinks and food. Maybe I am too nice but many people would shove, push and give dirty looks to cut in front of lines, and then use the " I don't understand " line when confronted. It definately turned me off, not of the resort but of people. My one major complaint was the A la carte reservation system. It was impossible to make a reservation because you can oly book one day in advance, and many people didn't bother to show up to their reservations, but failed to cancel. We tried to get into the japenese three times but were told it was too full, while there was more than half the seats empty. we waited one morning for 35 minutes in line to get a reservation, but the line didnt move and we had a tour bus to catch, it should be more simple than it was. The maids did a great job, and witha few dollars tip here and there you get a lot more service, ie towels formed as swans, extra waters etc... Like I said the bartenders were great, and altough it says gratuities included, you have to remember these guys make $5 US per day, so if you tip, obviously your service will be better same goes for anywhere in the world, why would i bend over backwards for somebody for free if somebody beside them will give me $5... it is common sense, service industries bank on tips. the out door sports and activities team was great... we got in with them, so pretty much if we wanted to play a certain game or sport they were all for it. Also compared to other places i have been, these guys would take no for an answer and respect if you just wanted to relax, which is great. the buffet was plentiful, but like any buffet by day 7 it was getting to me. You always had great selection, with lots of beef chicken pork and nachos The burger bar was also good, but only a few things to choose from like hot dogs hamburgers, nachos fries a few salads and a bit of fruit, but it served its purpose. All in all it is a great resort with a ton to offer, probably the nicest beachfront along the strip it is on, and lots of places to sit, ther is a ton to do just 15 minutes from the resort too, playa del carmen was awsome, and had some great food and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the entertainers and bartenders”
Reviews.Author: barbie68indians
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Mexico, so I had no idea what to expect. I was overwhelmed with the beauty of the resort. It was perfectly groomed and maintained. After settling into our room, we visited the grounds. The pool bartenders were very pleasant, we especially loved Manuel. He treated us with such service we felt like royalty. He was definitely our favorite, but there were many others like Nora, Gilberto, that were very good at their jobs. The entertainment group was another story. They really go beyond their call of duty to provide all guests with excellent experiences. Our favorites were Andrei, Natasha, Alvano, and Sabrina. The Argentina guy was shy, but very cute and adorable. We looked forward to the evening entertainment every night. Our guide from Lomas Tours, Luis, was very helpful and friendly. He gave us excellent suggestions which made our trip extremely enjoyable. I would love to go back as soon as possible. I went with my girlfriend and friends but I would love to go back with my husband for a second honeymoon. Barbara from Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: onvacation
Reviews.Content: Went as a group of eight adults. Had emailed the resort prior to going to request rooms together and close to the ocean. Arrived to find ourselves together in block 33 (overlooking the ocean!) Check in of 20 people was completed within a half an hour, were met at the bus and taken to a conference room, where forms were completed and info given, very smooth and effecient process. Rooms very clean, only thing we missed was a coffee maker for early drinks on the balcony. Bartenders had no problems filling our mugs (yes including the 52 oz bubbas) premium alcohol wasn't included, but we were very satisfied with the variety and quality of drinks, found a new one 'dirty monkey'...delic! Visited the Japanese and Italian alacarte, both great meals, only needed to book one day prior to visiting. The free shuttle to Playa del Carmen was fantastic, could book from noon to 6 PM, we stayed later and had a taxi on the way back for $14.00 (dollars). Staff very friendly, day and night entertainment great, activities by the pool and beach in the day. The beach is long enough to walk for about 1 1/2 hrs walk, white sand. The retaining wall in front of the hotel provides a view out over the ocean, the water along the front isn't the clear crystal water, but it was very wavy when we were there. Safe costs $2.00 (dollars) per day. We didn't find a lot of deals on silver, the same price as here at home, vendors at the hotel had higher prices than Playa del Carmen. Staff at the reception desk spoke excellent English. Had a massage $30.00 for half hour, well worth it! Buffet had a lot of variety, the buffet rest was quite hot at times, as there are not any fans in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, despite the other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: jturros
Reviews.Content: As everyone knows, September is hurricane season in the Caribbean. We were originally booked to go to another resort. This was because we had been to the Rriveria Maya many times and wanted to try something different. When Hurricane Ike was approching , before the travel agent approched me, I decided to change my destination, using the hurricane clause built in to many tour operators packages. I choose the Ocean Maya, despite the reviews . This was a well run resort. I e mailed the resort a few days before leaving , giving them my room choice. They respected all my wishes. They even responded to my e mail, which is rare for these resorts. The pool was spectacular, the beach was beautiful. The ocean was a little murky due to construction down the beach and of course the turbulance caused by the hurricanes. The room was very comfortable and immaculate. The food was your usual fare for a all inclusive resort. Nothing to compain about. I managed to gain a little weight. The property was beautifully lanscaped and immaculate. All in all I had a great time. and would definately return. We were able to sail the Hobby's every day with no hassel from the sports team. The view from the ocean is magnificent. This is a lovely hotel and i would recommend it with out problem. Montreal, Joan

Reviews.Title: “Little bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: molly1945
Reviews.Content: My cousin Christine and I spent a glorious week at Ocean Maya. All of the staff were going overboard to offer us the best service. We met amazing people there and had a wonderful time. How talented were the entertainment crew. They work very hard as do the other staff. I will be returning as soon as possible. Tom and Tina, you were great to be with. Don and Sandra, awesome. Fond memories. I am working on a figure like Sabrina's. Wisconsin, we love you. Thanks for everything, the week in heaven did the trick... Cheers Maureen (mollimops@hotmail.com) Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Resort was good, but not first choice”
Reviews.Author: CatLady08
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out horrible. We got to the resort at around noon, and found out that our room wouldn't be available until 3:00pm. Finally, at 3:00 we were whisked off to our room. Room seemed okay, a little dated. There was no hot water and the bedspread was very dirty. We contacted the front desk and they stated that there wouldn't be hot water for about another day. I requested another room. Well, the supervisor finally assigned us another room; however, once we entered the room....the room hadn't been cleaned yet. The bed wasn't made and there was towels all over. It looked as if someone had just checked out. We took all of our luggage to the front and asked for another CLEAN room. They kept telling me that they didn't have any other clean rooms. Well, after about 30 minutes....they finally found a clean room. I don't think they wanted to give up this room because it was close to the beach. Well, finally by 8:00 pm we were in our CLEAN room. The food wasn't bad. The buffet definitely has a great variety. The specialty restaurants are good, but the portions are small. The homemade ice cream is yummy. The entertainment is good and the drinks are weak, but good. If you tip the bartenders, they tend to put a little more alcohol in your drinks. We tipped $5.00 for the week...and our drinks were wonderful. The staff are friendly and funny. They try very hard to make sure your happy. They will work with you to see that you are having fun. Be sure to bring SPF 50 suntan lotion, as you will need it with the Mexico sun....very hot! Playa Del Carman is very warm in the afternoon. Be sure to go in the evening. The resort does provide a frig with bottles of water in which they stock daily. Be sure to drink the bottled water. The beach was ok, but the water tends to be cloudy. The pools are plenty and wonderful and clean. We spent a lot of time in the pool area, which there are 2 big pools....plenty of room for everyone. Also, there are plenty beach chairs and pool chairs. If the price is right, we would go back to this resort again. However, this would not be my first choice. To shop in town, you must take a shuttle (if there is room); otherwise you need to pay for a taxi ($14 one way). Shuttles don't start until noon....and stop at 5:30 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mamacolorado
Reviews.Content: We Took our adult kids and grandson. We stayed for one week. I felt that the resort was very nice and clean. We did alot of fun things. such as snorkeling, wave runners. etc. The food was good and plenty ful! The employees are extra friendly and go out of their way to make you comfortable. Of course every place has its quirks. But I felt that we really didn't have many.!! All and all It was a WONDERFUL TIME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Birthday in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: suzielouwho
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews before going, we were a little worried about what to expect. After going through the time-share gauntlet at the airport (Just say no-thank you!), we found our ride to the hotel and made the trip with no problems. Arriving at our hotel, we had no problems checking in, possibly as we were the only guests checking in at that time... The girl at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.(ask for your safe lock up front if they forget, we always get one, it does not cost much). We arrived around 1pm I believe but our room was ready and were escourted right to our room. The room was very clean, up on the second floor with a nice view of the ocean, not a direct view but you could still see it! There were 4 bottles of water in the frig and they replaced what you used. There were places at the bars by the pool, by the pop machines and in the lobby to get fresh water whenever you needed it. If you want to refill you bottles there you can if you need more. The grounds and gardens are beautiful. The air conditioning and cable tv worked fine, we needed the air as it got quite hot and humid a few days while we were there. We never saw anything but a small mosquito in our room. We were entertained every morning walking to breakfast by a colony of blue crabs that were always out of their holes hanging out in a grove of bushs by our room. We did see a few iguana's, the one in my picture was hanging out by the waterfall up near the lobby. We saw a snake crossing the sidewalk one time up there also, a big black one but he didn't bother us. There was something in the garbage can one evening coming back, looked like a big fat cat or some type of racoon sized critter, made a mess but didn't bother us. There were a lot of mosquito's on a few of the evenings we were there, bring spray. There was always a chair in the shade on the beach, wish they had more shaded area's near the pool, it was just too hot to sit up there in the sun for very long. The beach was always clean and the entertainment crew worked from morning to night, giving you the choice to join games if you were interested and working hard at night to keep you involved and entertained. Alex and the others were always on the beach asking if you wanted to do yoga, play a game etc. , at the pool doing bingo or games, or dancing on the stage in one of their productions. We have been to many of these type of resorts and they all seem to follow some sort of "All Inclusive Resort Entertainment Guidebook" for the games and shows with a few variations so we knew what was coming most nights. They did a good job though and some were very talented. They did have good live music a few nights, I always like that. There were not many Americans there when we were there but the place was pretty empty overall.
