We had no problem getting a drink when we wanted one,(the lobby bar was the best), the food was good, lots of choices. They really tried to make your dinner special, doing special coffees, one night I had a flaming desert prepared in front of me, etc. A few things that could have been improved; - the only place that had airconditioning to eat was the Yokoso, the Japanese place. They could not keep the doors open on the dining area or they would have been polluted with mosqitoes. It would have been nice to have an air-conditioned place to sit and have a drink or eat besides your room. There was a breeze outside the lobby where they did some of the entertainment but you had the mosquitoes to deal with then some nights. The entertainment area where they did the shows was air conditioned anyway. -There were only choices each night of the buffet and one specialty restaurant that night. We were only there for 4 nights so no problem but if you liked something you had to wait for 3 or 4 nights to go again. Would have been nice to have some background music at the specialty restaurants also. Pork chops were tough but we have learned to stick to the chicken or fish most times and they never seem to do steaks and chops right at these type of places. -They did come on the beach to serve drinks one day while we were there but not every day. Not really a problem for us but they should be consistant if they offer something. -We had a problem with Best Day, the rep was never in the lobby to set up our time to leave and we spent to much time waiting around for him to show up. The lobby staff did help us by calling the company to set up our transportation but it was annoying to hear he was supposed to be there and never was. -Other than that, we lucked out with nice weather, a few showers was all, had no real problems and were able to relax and unwind. We did go to Playa Del Carmen one day for a few hours but it was so hot I wish we had stayed on the beach. Probably going in the evening would have been more fun, you just have to find your own transportation them. Our driver took us through some very poor areas on the way there, makes you appreciate what you have. We tipped some, a few dollars to the maid, the bellboy, etc. They did a wonderful job and we appreciated it. We tend to go somewhere different every trip so might not get back to this one but we enjoyed out time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacations”
Reviews.Author: sitmex
Reviews.Content: Our trip started on Sep 11 and we were received by an efficient and kind recepcionst, we had two rooms for 5 people, three adults and two children. for the next 5 days. The entertainment crew was fantastic, Mexicans, Argentinean and french. The rest of the staff, also international people was able to keep us happy all the time. The food was also great but repetitive, drinks as most all inclusive hotels are good enough to drink, if you want a Jack Daniels whiskey, for example, you would have to pay for it. ($ 3.5 US) In short, the hotel is a great experience. Bugs: Mosquitoes in Common areas: Rare Cockroach: only seen ONE in the gardens. status: squashed. Odors: Humidity in room Staus. Left door for half an hour open and gone. Wildlife: Great! several harmless Iguanas, small lizards, small blue crabs, a small pack of coati.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go!”
Reviews.Author: RohanaToronto
Reviews.Content: If you think: TIP, then this is the place to go. You will have to tip to have your room cleaned and your beddings changed. You will have to tip the bartender.You will have to tip the waiter,you will have to tip someone to have access to a cop. The driver left us at the airport departing with our expensive camera and passports and to my own dismay we couldn't find a policeman. After screaming outside for the police while the cab drivers were laughing at us - and we were told - you did not want our help we will not help you - we did not tip them to carry the staff out from the cab. And then you will have the ones who look for tips in a different manner - the entertaiment girls - Sabrina the dancer would ignore me totally and give all her attention to my husband, came after us all the time and he has been invited to join in all the time, with the eyes and the attitude of a different type of environment. We never had peace or quiet time, there were screamings all the time to join some activity "a la piscina" or we were followed everywhere we went. Not a vacation - a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: zaweeza
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at H10 Ocean Maya and I have to say I am disappointed. From the moment we walked in I had a bad feeling and boy was I right. We waited forever for our room and when we finally got in I was surprise to find the room had nothing about the hotel, activities, spa, etc. in the room. The room didn't even have a pen and paper. The first day we must of walked 10 times to the reception area with questions and finally asked if someone could give us a tour of the place. The answer of "No" was unexpected and shocking. The second day we finally was able to talk to someone at the conceirge desk. He informed us that due to work in the area the hotel would lose power between 10am to 4pm the next two days. He said we better book some excursion off-site because there would be any air conditioning in the rooms. WHAT? Good thing for us we had already book an excursion through our Apple rep for the next day. Here's the best part... did the power go out? No. Not once either day. We found out we were told that to get us to book excursions through the hotel. Nice... we were lied to. After that I have to admit, no matter what they hotel did or didn't do, I didn't care. I was happy the day we left and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable Destination”
Reviews.Author: CotswoldsKar
Reviews.Content: My family incorporating two 16 year olds and a 14 year old, in addition to my partner and myself have just returned from this hotel where we had booked two family rooms. We stayed for 10 days and whilst the hotel was adequate we were all ready to return home, which is unusual for us. I was disappointed with the amenities considering the star rating and the cost. Whilst it was clean and reasonably well decorated it was not particularly comfortable. For example the 3rd bed was a settee, not a bed settee simply a chair big enough to lie on (but not if you are particularly tall). My daughter 16, son 14 and I ended up sharing a bed (all be it large) for the duration. In addition although we told them a number of times the cleaning staff only ever brought enough towells and toiletries for two. Another issue for me involved the amount of mosquitos in the room when we arrived, it took us most of the week and a lot of money in plug in gadgets to get rid of them. The bathroom was again adequate but by no means comfortable, small, dark and just a shower. My partners room had problems with both the TV and the air conditioning neither of which were fixed satisfactorily. To be fair the food in the main hotel dinning room was very good indeed, plenty of variety, good quality and fresh. In addition the service was excellent. There are some speciality restaurants in the hotel also and I cannot recommend highly enough the Japenese one however the mediterean restaurant on the beach was very poor. The entertainment programme was very Butlin like, and whilst I dont wish to knock the good old British Butlin holiday, I did expect more. Most evenings we had to play cards and were in bed for 10, (you can imagine the 16 year olds were none to happy!). The entertainment teams put on dance shows or musicals where they mimed to the music but once you had seen one you had seen them all. In my opinion it could have been vastly improved even by opening the pool or a beach bar in the evening, then people could take advantage of the beautiful surroundings. One evening the had live music by a traditional Mexican group which was pleasant and provided a variation but that was just once throughout the 10 day stay. The day time activities were a little better and the beach offered windsurfing, scuba driving, Kayaks and jet ski which I thought was a reasonable selection which we took advantage of. In conclusion my advice would be to think carefully about this one, particularly if you have teenage children. Pleasant enough for a quiet relaxing break but wouldnt wish to return. Hope this is useful to fellow travellors. Happy holidays

Reviews.Title: “resort style”
Reviews.Author: hapeangoor
Reviews.Content: I've read the negative reviews and its good to know what you're getting yourself into. The truth: The beds are hard, the shower does smell a bit - I do think there's something wrong with plumbing. You only get one towel, there's a front desk problem, beach front is man made and the resort caters to Europeans more than Americans. Perspective: It's a third world country!!! get over yourself! It's a well run, clean resort that does cater to Europeans - especially French. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with the activities, and the staff. I would say the resort is a solid 3 star hote by American standards (minus the beds). I do see how the front desk can be a problem - they have no computers, so really they're operating the old style way - which is somewhat impossible considering its a 400 bed resort. Oh, and the free gift on your entry - is a ploy to sell you timeshare. Just be aware and don't waste your time. Otherwise, its a pleasant stay if you know what you're getting yourself into....

Reviews.Title: “Was Ok- Probably Would Only Go Back if it Was Free.”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasonvac
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends at the Ocean Maya the last week of August 2008. It was ok, but NOT the 5 star they claim it to be, so please please do not go expecting a 5 star. I read almost every review on here before we left, so I knew what to expect. The reviews said that place was pretty crappy- and it was for the most part- so there was no disappointment. Check In- Slow, inefficient and unfriendly. Just as expected. These people could give a crap less that you want to check in to your room. They actually gave one couple in our party a room that was already occupied and they walked in on another couple in the room. Talk about an unpleasant surprise! It sounds like that happens often though. Rooms- Comparable to a Sleep Inn or a 2- 2.5 star American motel. The beds are rock hard (to be expected) and they do only leave you one towel. TG I was alone. I'm not into sharing towels. The air worked fine and I didn't see any lizards, etc. There was one nasty looking spider I saw one evening, but it disappeared. Probably into my suitcase. Lol. Restaurants- Think free promotional buffet. Everything was fried. The specialty restaurants were so-so. Japanese- get a hibachi table! The food was ok. Mexican- they take food from the main buffet and bring it out to the mexican restaurant. Italian- Don't bother going to this one- Gross! The main buffet had breakfast in the morning which was.... ok I guess. They would put the same food out over and over and combine weird things like yesterday's hot dogs with scrambled eggs. You can ask for fried eggs or omlettes. This will probably be your best bet. Mexican Night- They had Mexican food at the buffet and vendors come in. The vendors are expensive. Playa del Carmen 5th Ave is cheaper. It also costs about $15 in cab fare to get there though, so do the math for what special things you are seeking out. There was a mariachi band with horns and guitars and singers, etc, Plus an old guy that sang "La Cucaracha" and dry humped his guitar. Kind of on the weird side. Beach- This was the best part of the resort, by far. There were plenty of chairs and palapas. Watch your towel though. One of the people in my group got their towel stolen and the security guard told him to essentially go and steal someone else's. The water was pretty and the breeze was nice. Yes, there is the broken down decrepid pier, but I tried not to look at it. There were a lot of really red people on the beach, so make sure to bring plenty of sunscreen! I went through 2 aerosol bottles in 5 days. In conclusion, this place was ok. I wouldn't PAY to go back there, but it wasn't terribly awful either. Just read the reviews and know what to expect and you won't risk being disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Consider the whole package vs. Price B 4 U Book!”
Reviews.Author: Texas2U
Reviews.Content: Factor it all in & consider what is important to you before you book. If you can accept a slightly above average room that may run parallel to a septic system with a t.v. remote which may not work & advertises unavailable movies or that there is no instructions operating the checked-out universal remote for the A/C or that hot water is not always available then this is your place. It's little things; for example there was just one towel issued per day per person- not that anyone is going to get hot water consistently or want to shower more than once a day. The floors are tiled which is great for maintenance, but there was no door mat to shake off the sand so.. - you guessed it, the floors stayed gritty all the time. How about only one very small trash can? Even cheap hotels furnish a trash can for the bath and another for the room? Stationery to write on wasn't to be found and if they had WI_FI for your laptop, well it wasn't advertised. Food...slightly above average. Selection was fair offering 3-4 meat selections and multiple sides and desserts. The beach was flawless/ well maintained as was the pool. My kids are grown but the pools had plenty of stuff going on for them in fact it almost dominated the pool during the cool morning hours so again it depends, if you have kids this is a plus to factor in and if not well...maybe not so much. You will be "offered" if not pushed a variety of tours to take at check in, but the good news is they accept "we will think about" and let you go easy enough. Your greeted with a non-alcoholic drink but they also offer you anything else you might want as well which is very nice gesture after the flight and drive there. Would I go back? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Well Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dubsi
Reviews.Content: Having been to Mexico in July 2007, staying at the wonderful Grand Bahia Principe near Tulum, we decided to return to mexico this year thinking that we were going to have to similar pleasurable experience lik we did last year. In the end though, this hotel was far from its 5 star rating, and we were left dissapointed with the resort. On arrival, we checked in only to find that the airport driver left one of the bags in the van. 5 minutes into the holiday, we were one bag short. Great start! After the mini debarcle, and numerous phone calls to chase the driver and to get our bags returned asap, we thought we were heading to our room to get a much needed nap. How wrong we were. After 11 hours in a chartered flight, the last thing we wanted is for one of the reps to give us the old smooth talking business to get us to visit their main resort further down in the riviera maya the following morning. With us having said we were not to go if this was another one of those time share vacation club things, he lied to us and said to us it wasn't when actually it was. So 30 mins into our holiday and it was off to a not very good start. And things wernt to get better. As we ordered a family twin room, we thought we would get the five star treatment that we experienced last year. Instead we were put into B building or what i like to call B-block, as it reminded me very much of prison quarters. My parents room stank of a nasty odour, the amount of ants crawling in the room was unacceptable. And having walked past the haciendas, and seeing families live there, why we got the short end of the starw, I do not know. Anyway a day later we moved to a beach front hacienda, which was much nicer and was what we expected from a good hotel. However a week later my parents had to change room again to the numerous glitches with the AC, with the service men coming at either 10pm or 8am to try and fix it, which was ridiculous. Enough about the rooms, lets go onto the food. The brochure indicated there was a steak house. Well we certainly couldn't find it nor could the rest of the guests. Instead we found a place which gave us food available at the snack bar, and was of undoubtedly poor quality. Hence half way through, we walked out and went straight to the buffet. Halfway through the first week we went to the japanese and that was a disaster. We decided to go for the a-la- carte menu and it turned out to be a disater for us and fellow diners. None of us recieved the soup on the menu we asked for and the main dishes took over an hour to arrive. This was certainly not 5 star treatment let alone 3 star. The snack bar was average/poor with the same old stuff being produced on mass. The buffet was not bad though. However after 2 weeks we got bored of it after having breakfast lunch and dinner there. The waiters however we grumpy and not freindly apart from Juan who was a real gentleman. The other waiters should take note. With me being 20 and my brother 18, we needed stuff to do and to keep us active and entertained. Being a keen gym go-er, the state of the gym was disguisting for a 5 star resort and the tennis courts had numerous pot-holes and bumps, and were certainly not fit for playing. However the entertainment team made the holiday really fun for us, and we got on so well with them that my brother was asked to do the shows. Special mentions for JP, Franco, Alvaro and Sabrina for making the stay much better. They did a sterling job and worked very very long hours to keep the activities going. Even though the same activities came every other day, me and my brother thoroughly enjoyed our time with them and they are great bunch of people and deserve a massive pat on the back. If families were to go with children our age, they did organise trips to cancun and playa del carmen at night which were extremely good and certainly produced a bundle of laughs. During the night mosquitoes are everywhere around the lobby area so be prepared to get bitten, but also be prepared to get very hot, as there was no Ac in the lobby, buffet restaurant nor the theatre. The swimming pools are nice and the beach got better as the stay progressed, so much so that by the end, the sea was the nice turquoise colour we came to expect, and numerous tropical fish were seen swimming round our feet clearly. All in all this resort was a far cry from what we experienced last year. Everything about it was not 5 star and compared to the grand bahia principe, this resort does not compare. However, with all that has been said, the entertainment team were amazing, and they made the trip worthwhile in one sense. However, the food, the majority of the waiting and reception staff and the facilities available were not what we expected and wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Beautiful, Food Bad, Service Nonexistent”
Reviews.Author: toadie1234
Reviews.Content: Let me first say the beach was beautiful, the pools were excellent, and the rooms were clean. We had a couple of problems with the room (lights out, fuse blown). We called the front desk and maintenance was sent over almost immediately. I am NOT a picky eater, but the food was a little better than cafeteria food. The "steak restaurant" had no steaks on the menu -- only submarine sandwiches and other fast food items. We left without ordering. The "buffet restaurant" had almost no service -- the waiters were few and not helpful if you did manage to get their attention. Also, it took us a long time to check in and we ended up taking our luggage to our room ourselves (after dark) because no one came to help us after we waited for a long time. Very frustrating since it's a large complex and we had to find our room by reading the map by lights on the path. We did have a great time in Mexico despite our disappointment with this hotel, although I wouldn't go back and don't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “just meh.”
Reviews.Author: ce7871
Reviews.Content: H10 Hacienda Maya, Ocean Maya, H10 Ocean Hacienda, Maya H10 of the Hacienda near the Ocean….this place needs to pick a name is stick with it. I didn’t hate my stay here; but at the same time I wasn’t in love with the place either. The name game made me a bit leery of it in the first place. When a place of business continuously changes its name, it puts me in mind of those infamous signs you see at restaurants, “under new management”. The place may have had great management before, and never had one incident of toenails in the gazpacho; but the sign makes you think the service was dubious at best; so poor H10 whatevertheheck was starting out on the wrong foot, toenails or not…first impressions, as they say. In any case, once we arrived at H10, we checked in rather quickly. There was no tour of the resort, which would have been nice. The resort itself is very well maintained. The H10 has a beautiful marble lobby, huge columns, lovely artwork…and aloof staff…not so good…it takes forever to get help with the simplest tasks. The grounds are fantastic and wonderfully kept up, looks great especially at night…as long as you don’t mind massive amounts of mosquitoes, you are gonna love it. It is really cool that the lizards and crabs are all about on the grounds. They are harmless and pretty neat to look at. The pool area is very nice, and the snack bar has pretty good food. The pool bar…hmm…the drinks are good, they are not watered down…and many times they comes with a surprise in the form of bee bits. Occasionally a bee would fall into the blender and viola…extra protein in your drink. The lobby bar is s-l-o-w, and it closes at midnight? Midnight? The food at the buffet is ‘meh’ at best. Other than swimming and drinking there is really nothing else to do. When we where there the disco was closed the entire time, there are no pool tables or anything. The rooms are really nice, very comfortable beds, good AC, nice furniture, big(ish) closet; the safe is extra, as usual. The shows are…resort shows, young attractive people dancing badly in skimpy costumes…it beats t.v. Now for the beach (queue ominous music) it is horrible, it sucks, really bad. The main reason I go to Mexico is the water, which is funny since everyone says, “Oh don’t drink the water” which is a total wives tale, you won’t get sick off the drinking water, it just tastes like cr@p. Anyway that lovely beach ocean water is brown and nasty, and disgusting, and their beach is super eroded. They need to sandbag further out so the beach rebuilds itself; but they can’t even rebuild the dock (from what I can tell it has been in disrepair for 2 years now.) The beach was so bad that I followed the advice of someone else on here and went walkabout northward, where I had heard there was a pristine stretch of beach (actually it is an Estuary, meaning a fresh water river meeting the sea) I was super stoked. After walking about 20 minutes I came upon a construction site and right past it, there was the Estuary. It was stunning. There where fish at least 3 feet long, big ones. Deep super cool, super clear water, it was great. So I went back and got everyone in my group and we went back up. Now mind you the walking was a bit rough. I did fall in quicksand (I am not kidding) up to my nether regions. We finally got to the Estuary and everyone freaked that it was sooooo awesome, well worth the walk. We started swimming and after about 15 minutes a guy from the construction site came by and started speaking to us in Spanish (imagine that, Spanish in Mexico of all places) well he spoke no English at all, and some have said I speak broken Spanish, other have said my Spanish is totaled. Anyway, I got that he didn’t want us there and that his boss wanted us to leave. Well I do know that in Mexico, you can’t own the beach area, nor the water, so I said ‘aqua es libre’ or water is free. And that I didn’t understand him. So we swam some more and then his non-English speaking boss came and said he wanted us to leave. And I said, ‘el agua está libre, usted no puede hacernos licencia’ only not that grammatically correct…I said again, ‘the water is free and you can’t make us leave.’ He replied, “sí pero los malos animales le hará muerto” or ‘yes, but the bad animals will make you dead.’ And then proceeded to take his hands and make teeth with his fingers and bit me on the leg with them…it was weird…like in a bad place weird. Anyway, I said ‘¿nombre los animales?’ Or name the animals? And he said, ‘cocodrilos’ and then pointed to those really long fish I had seen…that seemed to have some company among them…sort of crocodile-ish company, and then I noticed that up stream the river was sort of swampy. So I then said, “Hey everybody we gotta go, we gotta go right now!” And I got my dumb American butt out of there. The construction guys where really nice, they took us back to the resort and gave us a few cold ones for the trip… and to settle our nerves…nice guys…horrible English though. So the H10 whatever needs to clean up its beach, so people don’t get eaten LOL. All in all, H-10 has enough good to balance out the bad, which just sort of leaves you with, well, meh. Well this is where I get off; I hope you found this review helpful or at least entertaining! Oh and remember, el agua está libre, y no pueden hacer que usted va; ¡pero los malos animales pueden hacerle muerto!”

Reviews.Title: “A Sorry Excuse for a Beach Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Leo1318
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed all of one night at the Ocean Maya because of its appalling services. H10 falsely advertises this hotel as a 4-star facility, a rating which is completely and utterly misleading! At most, Ocean Maya should be considered 2-stars. Upon arrival, one is immediately struck by a lack of guests, a feeling which may be characterized as finding oneself in an abandoned hotel. And for good reason. First and foremost, there is no beach at this resort. I repeat, no beach. There is a concrete slab with some sand and beach chairs but no stretch of sand or ocean in which to swim in. If one is to travel hours by plane from America or even Europe for a beach experience then please do not bother. The water that is in fact visible is blocked off by sand bags and is filled with seaweed. In fact, it was quite humorous that we were given ocean view rooms because we could not actually see the ocean. With regards to the rooms – again, there is no way they should be considered 4-stars. We were not provided with enough towels for our guests, there was mold on the shower head, there was no shower mat in the bathroom and someone from our party slipped and fell. Moreover, the sheets were stained. We were a group of 11 people with 4 different rooms to make these observations from and all displayed the above characteristics. Yes, Ocean Maya claims to have recently renovated but to no avail. So having no beach to relax on, one is left to the pool area. However, the pool has no chlorine, which is absolutely unsanitary. If you value your health you would not swim in this pool. The dining experience was furthermore atrocious. The dining room smelled of sulfur to the point were one is left nauseous and with a loss of appetite. It follows that the quality of food was also very, very low. Our group was left hungry because we could not bring ourselves to eat this food. Refrigeration was minimal, leaving dairy products warm and unappetizing. For an all-inclusive, the choice of alcohol was also probably the cheapest one could have selected. The resort is after all in Mexico but they did not even have Jose Cuervo tequila. The tequila they offered was displayed in an unnamed plastic container. Needless to say, the staff was unhelpful and slow, adding to an overall horrible experience. Asking for water bottles was met every time with resistance because were provided with all of 4 water bottles per room per day. Basically, if you are going to pay for an all-inclusive beach experience then you should get what you paid for. False advertising is wrong and Ocean Maya deceives its customers who pay for a beach resort and quality service and receive non of the above. Please, please do not waste your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: ibakovic
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Mexico in Riviera Maya and stayed at a H10 hotel for the first time. My first impressions of the hotel were that it looked very clean and very nicely maintained. The hotel was renovated in 2006 and it does look new. The landscaping of the hotel was wonderful all around and the people at the hotel work very hard to keep the hotel clean and beautiful. As soon as we checked in, we were offered refreshing drinks which was nice because it was a really hot day. The hotel is made up of about 30 small buildings which are in between the large lobby building and the beach. Each building has eight rooms, four on each floor. The buildings look very nice and each room had either a balcony or a terrace if you were on the first floor. Beach was great. The sand is yellow and small compared to maybe Varadero or Dominican Republic so it sinks in a little more in certain places in the water. There are no rocks or sea weed, very pleasant to swim in. There is one gigantic rock in the water in the deeper area of the water where you can use it to jump off, very safe and fun. The entertainment team is one of the best I have ever seen from all the hotels that i have been to. They are very energetic, enthusiastic and outgoing. They organize games all day long and there are usually two or three activities that go on at once. They are easy to talk to and very nice. If you like music, it is playing all day by the pool and at the beach. Keeps it fun and entertaining. Never a boring day. The food was good, the main buffet has certain nights where they have a special night like Mexican Night which is great and Tex-Mex as well as Oriental. Lots of food to choose from and you can always find three or four good things to each. The grill is always on and the fish is really good. You have garlic mash potatoes, roasted potatoes, French fries, salads, soups (really good creme soups), deserts. A la carte restaurants were a little weird because you do not make reservations to go, first time in eight years that I experienced that. So instead of booking your dinner time you just go. Sometimes the bad thing is that you might have to wait for a bit if the restaurant is busy. Overall food was solid. The hotel staff is very nice, always say hi and smile. The guy that cleaned our room was very nice and always said a few words. Did a great job taking care of the room. Bartenders were nice, made great Congas (non-alcoholic drink) and Mojitos. Service was really good. Finally if you want to experience so excursions, bring lots of money. It costs a fair amount but it is worth it. Ruins in Tulum, Chichen Itza and so on. You can rent See-Doo's on the beach for about $50 US for 30 min, very fun and Parasailing for $ 55 US per person for about 15 min. This is a once in a lifetime thing if you have not done it before, well worth the money. There is a lot to do, just bring the money. If you want to party in Cancun, its about $ 65 US for transportation there to the club and back, you ticket into the club with open bar bracelet. Well worth it. You just need enough people that night to go in order to fill in the large van of about 8 or 10. Coco Bongo, Bulldogs, Daddy Rock, Daady O and so on. The entertainment team will fill you in, just ask.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: BlondieMB
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hacienda Maya was our first trip to Mexico, when we arrived we waited to check in, our room was not ready for a few hours. Throughout our stay the staff was great we enjoyed the food, the service and the entertainment. The staff was always friendly and the rooms and the restaurants were kept clean. Shopping in Playa del Carmen was a good time, lots to see.The biggest disapointment of the entire trip was the "tour" we paid for. Rudy sold us a tour that would allow us to go parasailing, snorkeling, swimming witha shark, sail over to Cozumel do some shopping and have dinner there. They told us right off the bat it was to windy to go snorkeling, so we sailed over to Cozumel on a small crowded boat. By the time we got there half the people were drunk, we ate and did a bit of shopping, we passed by the "shark" that one person "swam" with. (Not what we had in mind when they said shark). Then we sailed back much too slowly, as the "captain" pushed alcohol on people nobody said a word about parasailing. The next day we went to talk to Rudy about the "tour" and he didn't know what to do. We didn't want for this to ruin our trip so we tried to forget it. The rest of our stay was still very good we met lots of people and got to know some of the staff. Our flight home was delayed for twelve hour so we got bused to another resort, and it was a bigger fancier place but it didn't really feel like Mexico it felt more like a large city and more like a hotel setting with lots of noise traveling through the hallways. It was here that we realized how nice the setup was at our resort. The suits were not in one large building but rather 8 suites in each, noise was never a problem. I would definitly go back, we learned a lot from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: td1z
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee travelled to this hotel as a all-inclusive july 4-11 2008. We arrived at 11:30 and were promptly checked in to our king size room (building 8). The room was clean and the air already on. We went down to the pool bar to be promptly greeted by the bar tenders which were fantastic all week. Soon after the entertainment team made note that new guests had arrived and came over to say hello. They were all fantastic all week. Besides the sun, pool and beach we didn't much all week. We went jet skiing, on the catameran and played in numerous games and activities. We ended up leaving with 2 free bottles of tequila and a t-shirt. There was lots of excursions to go on however we had a hard time getting a hold of our travel rep when we wanted to book so we didnt end up going on any. The only downfall to our trip was we both got sick one due to the undercooked food. So please be aware and make sure you are watching what you eat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Country, Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: gibler9
Reviews.Content: After being to Cuba, the other side of Mexico, Dominican I would say I would definately come back to the Mayan. This resort was very clean. The staff were super nice, and helpful, especially the entertainment group. Bungaloo style rooms. 6 to a building, loved that. Not a big hotel type. The rooms were very big - had not problems there. However, met another couple that were moved 4 times for different reasons: air conditioning not working etc but we had not problems at all. Biggest complaint, the heat, not in Mexico but in the different restaurants and theatre.! Were they hold the shows at night is in a building way too hot needs air movement! They really need to rethink this, either build something outside or adjust where they are. There is also an incredible Japanese restaurant - attached to theatre - way to hot but food and service were incredible! Very Impressed and we would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: farmersfrommn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the H10 was March 25-April 1 2008. The property had just switched it's name to Ocean Maya by H10. My husband and I went to this resort with 4 other couples from our home area.This was our first trip to Mexico, but our friends had been to the Mayan Riviara in the past, so we based much of our expectations on reviews of this property. This resort exceeded our expectations in every way! Our check - in was easy and without mistakes. We found the room to be perfectly clean, maintained, and comfortable. The "haciendas", which house 8 rooms each were very nice,and ours was close to the beach and pool area. We found the walk to the main lobby through the beautiful grounds to be very enjoyable. The buffet for breakfast, particularily, was much nicer than we expected. We made dinner reservations for our group on the first day to each of the other restaurants and we enjoyed them all. Our favorite had to be the Japanese. The entertainment staff are remarkable, hard working and really go out of their way to show you a good time. ( we loved Ana from day one) The bartenders were fabulouse!! Applause to Gilberto and Jose, who learn right away what you drink, and prepare it anyway you wish, and always serve with a smile from sun-up to sun-down . We made friends with Rudy right away, and he helped arrange for us 2 excursions. He is extremely accomodatiing and helpful, as well as the rest of the activities staff. The beach has sustained some damage from the past hurricanes, but for the most part, very easy to walk down and swim in. you can take the watercraft right from the resort beachfront without any trouble. We never had any problems getting beach chairs for our whole group by 10:00 or 11:00 am, and there was always good snacks available all day at the pool area restaurant. We felt completely comfortable and relaxed at the H10. If you want to join in the activities you can, or just hang out on the beach or the pool. If you want a lively night-life, this is not really the resort for that. There were party buses which departed from the hotel lobbly late at night to go into Play del Carmen or Cancun for those who wanted to see the night life. You will LOVE this resort if you are looking for a clean, beautfully landscaped, relaxing medium-class resort. The food is plentiful and "normal", but not gourmet, and the beach is comfortable, but not too big. This is an extremely "cozy" resort..not too big, not too small! Certainly some of this resort's best assets are their staff. I would'nt hessitate to stay there again, it was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Experiences may vary, but we had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: stephaniescrib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H-10 Hacienda Maya week of April 19th. The hotel check in was fairly quick for us. I did hear some people complaining about the time it took to get their rooms or have them switched due to improper accomodations. We thought all was well until we reached our room only to find one king size bed. My 14 year old son would have no part of that, so we went back to the lobby. Here we go, I thought! In passing I noticed a rep from RCI at a table, and asked him to intervene for me. Since I booked with this company, I felt it was to our advantage to use his services. He explained the room wouldn't do for a family of four(duh)! We were immediately given a room with two double beds. I have to wonder though if we would have not have had more waiting time had he not spoken on our behalf. I don't get why hotels can't assign proper rooms from the get-go! It's not rocket-science, especially when you have computers. The grounds were emaculate, the rooms quite clean and the house-keeping was good. All the waiters and bar tenders were great, especially Jose, who had my order down after only a few trips to the bar! These people really deserve their tips! If you are afraid to speak up at the bar, you may have to wait a bit, though. There were always lots of places to sit around the pool and the beach area. I just read a previous review with regard to the iguanas being everywhere...hey, this is their home! They certainly didn't bother anyone, in fact I wish they would have come up to me, I tried to make contact...no such luck! Think how silly it would sound for a Mexican to complain about all the squirrels, raccoons etc! Food was ok for the most part...maybe a bit of a challenge if you are a picky eater(I brought two of them). The beach area wasn't as bad as I had read, the seaweedy stuff can be found in various areas in Playa and Cancun. I really think you get what you pay for here. Go with an open mind, and don't let the small stuff get to you...you will have a much better time!

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: kmanster
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed here. i got a very good deal on the hotel so for what i paid, i felt ok about the issues. i read the complaints on this forum before i went. it boils down to how much you expect. since the cost was the same as a flight and hotel , the food and booze was a through in. the food was not great and yes the retaurants were not open a lot but you will not go hungry.and the waiters were very nice and accomadating. get 5 &10 peso coins and drop them off after your means. i took the free shuttle into PDC many days and enjoyed good food and margaritias. The best margarita i ever had was at La Quinta Passion on 5th, a few blocks north of where the shuttle lets you off. Go there, say high to Sergio, the owner, put your feet up and enjoy. you will be so glad you did. i had kids with me and they loved the kids club, the pool and the ocean all right in the same spot. we also enjoyed taking a sail on the Cattamarran. michael, is one of the most genuine guys you meat, not looking for a handout but rather, just wants to talk and help you with a lessson (which costs 10 bucks) but well worth it if you dont know how to sail. if you are a peron who goes to these places and stays there all week then this woudl not be for you. if you like to go and visit the town then this is a great place and deal. Rental Car NOTE : i rented a car and was pulled over just outside the hotel and shaken down by the police for $25 "tip" . the cops are scum and if you rent be careful. carry only a small amount in your wallet so they can only take a small amount.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: whitneyw
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 2 weeks with another couple for our honeymoon sort of vacation. the hotel location was nice, but it was definatly not a top notch resort. my husband and i requested an ocean view room, and didnt get into an ocean view room until we personally found a couple that was leaving the next day and requested to have their room. we would have stayed in our original room except for the fact that every time we showered, the smell of sewage came up from the drains. the other couple we went with were NOT on their honeymoon, and they had special treatment the entire time we were there including extra water in their rooms, and towel sculptures. my husband and i got nothing, and more than once we had no water whatsoever left in our fridge. the couple we came with also had an ocean view room as soon as we got there, and we had to fight for one even though it was our honeymoon. the food was mediocre. not great. but we didnt get sick so thats always a bonus :P the japanese restarant is really good if you go sit at the tables with the grills, but the other restarants were not great. the buffet was pretty gross. as was the lunch buffet by the pool. DO NOT ORDER PIZZA TO YOUR ROOM!! we ordered a pizza to our room and after about 2 hours of waiting, it finally arrived. we tipped the guy a fairly large tip only to open the box and find out that the pizza had been dropped apparently on its side before arriving at our room. we called the front desk to ask for a new one, and they hung up on us and would not call us back. we also do not reccomend booking excursions through the guys that hang out around the pool. they are not part of the hotel excursion team, but the hotel obviously gets a cut of their sales as they are allowed to hang out at this resort and book trips. we booked an atv/snorkeling trip for the second to last day of our trip. we were supposed to meet in the lobby at 7am so we woke up early and got to the lobby by 7. a van pulled up and a mexican man got out and said "atv?" and we all said yes, he took our tickets and called his office to verify that we had paid, and we were on our way. after an hour of driving, the man pulled over and kicked us out of the van in the middle of no where. he said we were on the wrong trip and someone would "come get us" in 15 minutes. no one came. we cabbed back to the hotel and spend our last real day there fighting with the staff to get our money back. we wasted a whole day because the staff couldnt figure out what bus we were supposed to be on. the one thing i really really enjoyed about this hotel was one of the bartenders in the lobby bar. he was extremely personable and a very good bartender. the market that they have in the evenings i think it is every second day, was also fun. there is a guy named Gabriel that worked there that was really funny. overall, we liked the resort, but it had some major issues that it needed to work out. some of the staff is rude, and they need to figure out their excursions more. i would go back, as the hotel wasnt BAD, just not very organized, but i would not pay what i paid for it. we payed 2500 per person for 2 weeks, and it was definatly not worth that much. i would rather stay at the bahia principe which has nicer beaches and many more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel but horrible food and poor beach”
Reviews.Author: alexxxita
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated 4 stars where I bought the package. I can assure you that it’s no more than a 3*. The hotel looks like a 4* but the food is even more like a 2 stars. It was mostly greasy staled fast food. The station where you could have your pasta custom made was using old pans covered with a dirty black layered and you could find a black oil residue on your pasta and at the bottom of your plate as well, horrible. The cook did not seem to know what he was doing at all. The pasta tasted horrible. They were missing a lot of basic fruits and vegetables. They served staled nacho and fries. Fish that was soaked in oil. Very low quality food and preparation. No good healthy choice beside basic salad. The beach as some sort of cement wall that is separating the beach chair from the ocean and it’s kind of high and it destroys the landscape. But then the lobby looked great, the Spa in amazing, we all got great massages and spent time in an outdoor tub that ad an amazing view of the ocean. The gym was also up to date, modern and was sunny with nice windows. The rooms were very clean and had a good size TV, a phone, hairdryer, clock, etc. But for me food is very important. I don’t like to stay at a hotel where the food is not good so I would not go back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ldw1950
Reviews.Content: Dates of visit: March 25 - 29, 2008 My husband and I received a nice size travel voucher last year for our wedding and decided to use it for something neither one of us had done - go to Mexico in March to an all-inclusive resort. I read reviews on this website and found them to be quite helpful. The H10 is very pleasant, clean, beautiful and relaxing. It's true - not a 5-star resort, but darn close!! We're in our late 50's and though there were all ages at the H10, including children and young adults on spring break, we had no problems whatsoever. It's very international we found - as Americans we were in the minority. Even with that, there really was no problem with language. The buffet for all meals was plentiful - we were there 5 days and did not find it boring - lots of different food for whatever your tastes. One of the best things I read on this website was to bring a coffee pot if you want to have coffee while getting ready in the morning. There is no coffee pot in the room (maybe my ONLY complaint), and it's a bit of a walk to the main building. I brought my small coffee pot so no withdrawal for me! If you've not had your sandles or flip flops on since last September, you might want to get them out and break them (and your feet) in again. Luckily, I had band aids with me as I had the start of a few blisters! Some have said you'll have trouble making reservations for the "special" restaurants if you're not in the lobby signing up by 9:00 a.m. You are able to make reservations for future days. I would suggest you do this on your very first day there so you have a better chance of getting a reservation. We ate at the Japanese restaurant and it was quite tasty. I echo what others have said - just go, relax and have a good time - you make your own fun, get involved as much as you want, and visit in the area. We took the free shuttle into Playa del Carmen and did the "tourist walk" - bargained for a very nice silver necklace. Another website I found helpful for all things Mexico is mapchick.com. Great info on getting around. So, go and enjoy - beats April in the north!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love the H10!”
Reviews.Author: LUVMEXCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This February was the second time I had stayed at this resort. Last August I went with my husband and my three year old daughter. I loved the beauty of this place so much I booked a trip in Feb. for my birthday with one of my best friends. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful with tropical flowers, waterfalls, and fountains. The staff are excellent and make you feel truly welcome. Food at the buffets is plentiful but don't expect five star gourmet food, either. The regular buffet is just fine. We tried the Japanese restaurant on both trips but found it a little lacking. The pools are huge, uncrowded and CLEAN! The only thing a little dissapointing is the ocean water at the beach is murky and not as much fun as swimming in the ocean at Tulum or Cancun beaches. The resort is quiet which I love. All you could hear at night were the palm trees swaying in the breeze and the air conditioner. If you are looking for night life it's better to stay in Playa Del Carmen. This hotel is good for families and people who just want to relax. All of the sightseeing is very close by, also. Tulum, Xel-ha, and Xcaret are all highly recommended. I found the weather much more tolerable in February compred to August which is really hot. This hotel is a great deal for the money and I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: sylviogirard
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, we spend a week at this resort february 16 to 23th and we was a bit nervous with all the review we read,but i can tell you it was a very pleasant week,the staff or amazing,very clean room,veru nice pool ect,only the beach was ok no blue water,but ask for the resort its like a 5 *. anyone look to book on this resort don't worry you will be very suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: LMO-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in March at the Hacienda Maya. We had a nice reception with a drink upon arrrival and an easy check-in, although we did have to speak to time share person before being able to see our room. The place is a bit isolated, but you can catch the local bus on the main road across from the hotel or take a taxi into Playa. For families (we are a total of five), take a taxi to the attractions and pay the entrance fee yourself. We saved hundreds doing it this way. Find your own taxi driver because the hotel charges a lot more if they book a taxi cab for you. We met ours in Playa after taking the free shuttle there. We had a great time at the resort, but going to Coba and cenotes in the area were the best. Also there's a lagoon in Akumal, which has great snorkeling (lots of fish). The food at the buffet was good, the Mexican show the one night was excellent. The hammock area is perfect and there's always plenty of chairs for everyone on the beach and around the pool. Water from the tap in the hotel room is not safe, but free bottled water is supplied daily. It's the nicest place we've ever stayed in. It's not perfect, but great for the price. Entertainment team tries very hard to please. Get involved. You'll have more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: hbwilson
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time during our week. The weather got a little unsettled, but we won't blame the hotel for that. The proximity to Playa del Carmen is nice and the trip to Chichen Itza was spectacular. Food at the Hacienda had great variety - we especially loved their fish. We want to give special thanks to Monica, Tony and Marco for always being helpful and for their bright smiles.

Reviews.Title: “very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: cr2404
Reviews.Content: The 2 of us were at this loverly resort for the week of Feb 22. From our arrival through our departure we were very impressed with the staff more than anything. They always had a smile a Hola and it was obvious that they enjoyed their jobs very much. Now onto the specifics: food - always plentiful although repetative (you always get tired of a buffet after 2-3 days) drinks: always plentiful and served with a smile rooms - roomy and clean, except for the sheets were not changed once throughout our whole week (I know this because we had a small pink circle mark on one of the sheets and each day after the maid left, I checked our sheets and the pink mark was still there, she just swapped the top sheet with the bottom daily). No fancy decorations with the towles (friends we met there had something different each day). entertainment: mostly enjoyable tours: snorkling was great although our day out was rather windy, but fun just the same beach: not entirely what I expected. I had wanted to go snorkling each day, but had to walk away from our resort to find water nice enough shuttle and ala cart restaurants: this was a pain as each morning (early) we had to stand in line to book for the following evening and with the shuttle we had to wait constantly as the same guy who took the reservateions for the shuttle, also was booking tours and the lineups were long and tiresome. I did not enjoy wasting time each morning of my vacation standing in line to book a shuttle or restaurant. I stand in enough lines at home every day. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and we would definitely recommend this resort. We would not return again but would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: lilbobo
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how bad this place was. It was more the hotel staff than anything else. They run the place trying to trap you there so they can squeeze every dime out of you. Everywhere you look, overpriced tours, overpriced souvenirs, staff looking for a tip(or bribe). All the staff tells you, "Buy your tours at the hotel or you'll get ripped off, Change you money at the hotel or you'll get mugged, don't take the public buses or you'll get kidnapped". And then they supply those same services at overly inflated prices and with poorer quality customer service. The hotels tell you the locals will rip you off and the locals tell you the hotels are ripping you off. Who's right? The Mayan Riveria is almost completely reliant on tourism, any complaints from a tourist about the public transportation system or public safety system is taken VERY seriously. They want to maintain a good image as a tourist destination so the government goes to great lengths to ensure the tourists are safe and don't get mugged. They still have laws and if you get drunk and act like an ass, and run a car into a building you're going to get in trouble. But if you are smart and keep your wits about you you'll be fine. Besides trying to continually rip me off, the hotel had so few beach chairs, you had to get up at 6 AM to reserve one. I got food poisoning off one of the restaurants, the salon was a joke(they tried to shave me with a used disposable razor), the nightly entertainment was pathetic, the disco was almost always empty, and the "free" windsurfing/sailing lessons had so many rules that you had to bribe the staff if you wanted a lesson before your flight home. I tried every single day I was there to sign up for a free lesson and everyday they gave me an excuse why they had to cancel my lesson. I was polite and respectful to them every single day (except the last day) but I refused to bribe them. And all souvenirs are initially overpriced(even outside the hotel), you have to bargain to get a good price. The same stuff is available outside the hotel but the vendors are much more willing to bargain than the hotel staff. By the end of my trip I was ready to start taking swings at the staff. If you want to get pissed out of your tree and act like a total jerk, which most guests did, then I suggest you stay at the hotel. But if you want to experience the real mexico(at least as much as you can in the area), stay in a condo in playa. You'll have more fun, have way better food and spend a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: robertswife
Reviews.Content: We were there Feb. 20-27, 2008. We pretty much experienced what was noted in previous reviews. The property is emmaculate. The staff very hardworking. Contrary to other reviews, I found the nightly entertainment to be fun and very interactive. The pools were very clean and the music not too loud. The main pool has the music and poolside entertainment, if it bothered you, you could walk 20 feet and get into the bar pool where it was quieter with less kids. As for the beach, yes it was silty, but all you had to do is walk out 10 feet and it was clear. I didn't encounter a problem with seaweed or rocks. H10 does have a retaining wall on their beach, and if they didn't they wouldn't have a beach at all. The resorts on either side of us gave up alot of their green grounds and landscaping just to add to their beach, so I'm not complaining. We were in building 8 and did not have "the smell". I would say it is strongest around 3-5, I would avoid those if possible. Go past those buildings to the right you will see a large male iguana, and his harem of girls, he was a show all by himself. The food...well the coffee was great. The main dining room/buffet in my opinion was good as far as fruits, veggies, breads and soups. The meat on the other hand was lacking in variety and flavor. Please don't rib me either guys. I've stayed at other AI's in Mexico, Jamaica, and St.lucia, and the meat was by far the worst I have had. After the second day, I didn't eat the meat again. We ate at the Japanese rest. twice but couldn't get into the other two. You have to be in the lobby before 9:00a.m. to make the reservations for the next day, same with the shuttle. Lobby bar was fun if Nora was working. She won't say anything to you, but if you can get her to like you, she will be your friend for life. She was a hoot! She also gets upset if you don't use coasters, beware! Front desk staff speaks very little English, as you would expect so when we had any problems we spoke directly with Luis or Carolina direct, they are at the restaraunt reservations desk. They are awesome. Our room was nice. I don't understand why anyone says the rooms are outdated. I found them to be in line with any other Mexican AI. and we were not disappointed except the beds are hard, but that's me, I like my bed soft. Housekeeping did a great job and made sure we always had what we needed, extra pillows, water etc. Security...I had a lot of questions about that before going because I had to take my laptop. I left my laptop out the whole time, as well as my cell phone and had no problems at all. The only thing we locked up were the passports. We were never approached by outside vendors or others selling timeshares and the resort appeared to be pretty safe at night as well. If you are looking to party, this is not the place. This is a laid back, quiet, family resort. We spent most of our days in Playa trying different foods, bars and restaraunts. The shuttle will drop you in front of Aca Los Tacos, you must try their tacos, very good. Los Aluxes for drinks, and Fusion for a beach bar and grill.

Reviews.Title: “Needs customer service help”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSunlover2008
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at H10 The front desk staff needs a class on customer service. In fact all the front of house staff needs a class. I am writing a letter to the main office about how unprofessional they are. Pool food weather is great. Rooms need to be updated and water pressure in showers is horrible. They need to put coffee makers in the rooms so guests dont have to walk to dining room to get some early in the morning alot of times coffee was gone!!!!!!!!!! Beach was worst I had ever seen in Playadelcarmen. Would I go back????????? No way there are to many other hotels to pick ffrom.

Reviews.Title: “Was a pleaseant vacation and go with your own views once your there.”
Reviews.Author: kiki9215Calgary
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews just before we left we were quite nervous about the smells etc. We had no problem with smells in rooms. THere is one spot at the resort when you walk by you can smell the sewer and that is because there is a septic field underneath. I must agree with everyone that says the staff works there butts off. THe entertainment staff are awsome and the kids club even better. The head of the kids club (Nati) is a wonderful loving person and loves kids. Tears to our eyes when we said good bye to her. They work from morning to late night putting on evening shows. Resort was very clean and we got a upgraded room for our family at no extra cost. Food was average, no better or worse than any other resort we have stayed at. It is Mexico and food is always different. So, families go and have a wonderful time we did. One thing I did notice is that this resort does cater to the FRENCH in every aspect. English people came second.

Reviews.Title: “H-10 Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from H-10 Hacienda Maya on 2-19-08. We were there for two weeks. We are two couples that travel every year together and have been doing so for a few years. We've been to Costa Rica, Puerto Plata, Punta Cana, Mexico and a few cruises. We stayed at this resort back in 2004 when it was the El-Mandarin. I read every blog on this resort on this site before we left and I thoght that maybe it had changed dramatically since we were there in 2004. It had, it was better. I would recommend this resort to anyone of any age that wants to have a quiet, relaxing vacation. The staff at all areas work their tails off. I agree they are understaffed, but they work their butts off to make up for it. So you may have to get up and get your own drink or cup of coffee. Who cares, all your going to do is sit around and eat and drink all day anyway. The resort is even more beautiful than it was in 2004. We were initially given rooms up front by the main entrance when we arrived. We asked them if we could get a room with a view of the ocean and within a couple of days they moved both of us to an ocean view room. We had a smell in our room that was slightly unpleasant. We asked to have it looked at and by the next day they had taken care of the problem. The food was decent. After a couple of weeks it gets a little old, but there is enough variety that no one should ever go hungry. The water clarity in front of the resort and a couple to the north is a little dirty. I was told by some vacationers that it had to do with the sea grasses that grow in the area. Two resorts to the south and the water clears up and is that beautiful Caribbean green. The clarity of the water didnt stop anyone from swimming. We feed the Angel fish almost daily in front of the resort. The pools were both very nice, clean and quiet. Contrary to some blogs, the music was at a decent decibel and most of the music played was American even though we found that most of the Guest were Canadian. We had a great time and I would go back again next year and recommend this resort to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Peter_PT
Reviews.Content: I was for this resort in March of 2007 and liked. one is resort small but very family. The gardens very are well treated; the swimming pool is adjusted to resort; the food is good, but the restaurants close at 22h; the rooms are great however the wc smell very badly! it must be of the pipes. the safe box has to pay; the beach has white sand but the water is very dark. to find water truily blue turquoise is necessary to walk for the beach… you go to find a true paradise; the employees are very likeable, since check in, passing for the group of entertainment until the gardener. excursions not to lose: Chitzen itza, Tulum and xcaret. and clearly go to playa del carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know Why The Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hugescotch
Reviews.Content: After spending the week of February 9th to 16th at the H10 with a group of 9 people, I'm not sure why there are so many bad reviews. Granted it's not a 5* resort (4-4.5* is accurate) it's priced as a 3* providing very good value for money. Below are a list of comments from the week Positive - there was no sewage problem in any of our rooms - grounds are prestine - only a $14 cab ride from Playa del Carmen - buffet was better than expected - if you give a bartender a healthy tip $20 he tends to remember you for the rest of the week - Nolitours Rep Serge was fantastic Negative - pressure to buy a time share - not permitted to move tables in dining room so if you are a large group eating together is not easy - Argentinian restaurant is awful - not enough bar staff at times Overall I was worried about not having a good time when I read the reviews, but once there I realized that most of them were completely off-base. You also need to remember that it's a vacation in Mexico and not an all expense business trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “it's a good value, have perspective”
Reviews.Author: gerryfromwindsorONCA
Reviews.Content: People...please!....the water was choppy? boo hoo...come on, have some perspective! If you want crystal blue water, you'll have to go elsewhere. Almost everywhere, the tourist guide pictures give you crystal blue water. At the best of times, maybe. Lets get on to the hotel. The hotel was clean, the food was very good, the rooms were moderate but clean, the palapa area had plenty of room, and you can walk BEYOND the breakwall most days. The pool was clean and inviting. Never had to race down to get a lounger. The staff were friendly and hard working; probably understaffed, particularly in the dining room. I highly recommend you immediately book the a la carte (Japanese, Argentine, Mexican) restaurants to vary your dinner buffets. The buffet was good, staff helpful, but from time to time, yes, you'll have to wait, or go to the drink kiosk yourself. No big deal. I know I don't work as hard as the Mexican staff do, it wouldn't hurt to drop a couple of bucks or pesos on them. The evening entertainment was good enough, but don't go there for a broadway type experience. This is a smaller hotel and more suitable for older (40 plus) adults who want to veg; or young families have an area all to themselves. Is it 5 star? No. You might have some minor aggravations. But 4 star? Yes. The true test is: would I go back? Yes I would....

Reviews.Title: “ok, but only ok.”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Jan 30 to Feb 13. It is a nice hotel the staff are very helpful. The pool and beach are nice. The ocean was a huge dissapiontment, it was very murcky every day we were there, not too sure if this is a temporary or permanent thing. The food was good, but became very repetative after about 10 days. The food and service in the alacarte restaurants was a little dissapointing. Maybe this is a better place for a one week stay than two?

Reviews.Title: “not pleased with the beach”
Reviews.Author: dissapointed01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Jan 22/08 - Jan29/08. We were not happy with the beach at all. We booked this trip expecting beautiful blue water and beach. The attached pictures will show you what we had. If you are going to spend time on the beach this hotel is definately not for you. I do believe the hotel is understaffed. We had some waiting times at both the pool bar and the lobby bar when ordering drinks of any kind. The food was ok, but there too they were understaffed and there were waiting times for service. Our room was alright, but it is definately only a three star. The entertainment staff does a great job considering that they are also do the entertainment at the pool, and are the babysitters for the kids club. We are truely disappointed-- the brochures show a wonderful beach area with a beautiful lite dock area. Actually I would say that the brochures are false advertising. We would never go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit good, a little bit bad”
Reviews.Author: rhcp4lif1
Reviews.Content: First off the staff was awesome except for the front desk staff, had to fight with them a few times about things. If the beach is what you are looking for in this resort keep looking at other places, most of the beach here is taken up by a seawall which isnt mentioned in anything Ive read about this place. Secondly the water isnt very good, part of one accesible beach was completely black and choked with weeds of some sort, the water is. The bar and restaraunt staff were the most friendly and efficient Ive had in my 3 trips to Mexico. The grounds were immaculate and nicely kept, very pretty layout. The pools were awesome, not crowded at all. Food was not to bad, had better but have had worse. Within an hour of some beautiful excursions and it was easy arranging these with the tour staff, I would highly recommend Tulum and Xel-ha. So over all would I come back to this resort, maybe but not likely.

Reviews.Title: “it's gonna betwo years next year”
Reviews.Author: gooblywook
Reviews.Content: Just back from this resort ( second time there ) and although things have changed somewhat,i still had a great time there, My hat's off to Serge( tour sales guy and tour rep ) he was most helpfull to me at this resort. Although things have gone down hill somewhat since our trip there last year, it seems to be back on track and i think all in all will be greatly improved by this time next year. Apparently The H10 Group have opened a new resort just up the road and most of the staff from H10 Haciendia went to work there, so a new manager and new cooks and new cleaning staff were apparent with our visit there this year. for those of you who don't know 30+% of these resorts were purchased by AirTransit and they put aprox. 12k people through this resort per month. We bought a 4 cup coffee pot down there with us and gave it and all the coffee as well as the coffee whitner/sweetner to her when we left. we also took a Homer Simpson tee shirt down with us as well as toys and lots of $20.peso's ( paper money ). every day i took a couple of boiled eggs, hard cookies, bananas back to our room, and i'll be darned if i wasn't hungry enough to eat them so i left them on "the pillows ". needless to say we always had enough water for the coffee pot and our daily needs. The grounds were as usual spotless and neatley trimmed, the pool was crystal clear and warm. We did a few of tours while down there, and i would suggest the Snorkling Tour, my wife always had a hard time with this ( snorkling ) and she learned how to durning this tour. This reef is second in size only to The Great Barrier Reef and is (900+ miles long). The captain of the Catamaran we were on was a dancing fool lol man he was funny and danced durning the whole tour, His first mate gave everybody his full attention and helped my wife immensely with her snorkling, hauling her and myself around via the life preserver. We had a shore snack when the tour was over and as we sat for the next hour enjoying the sun and clear blue water, we could see the Catamaran, and the Captain still dancing on it as it was being readied for it's next excusion.oops i forgot to mention that thye set up the Spiniker Sail for a wild ride into the air ( as high as 70' ) where you had the option to "jump " if you wanted to, most of the guys did jump from about 20' or 30' and they all said it was a blast.Anyway enough of this for now. it is goung to go down to -31 degrees C this morning and guess where my head is at this writing..next year it's two weeks and i can hardly wait. Gooblywook

Reviews.Title: “Experienced good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Sandy032
Reviews.Content: Our group of six stayed here from the 23rd to the 30th of Jan 2008 and experienced some good and bad at this hotel. THE GOOD. 1. Mimi at the front desk was great in keeping our family in the same building. 2. The grounds were beautiful and kept immaculate at all times. 3. Lots of space at the beach. 4. The staff were exceptional in service and courteous at all times. 5. The weather was hot and wonderful every day. 6. Great fun had with family. 7. The Japanese and Mexican restaurant were pretty good when we went. THE BAD 1. Our building, the 900 block also suffered major sewer problems. Not odour but toilet back ups constant. Maintence when it arrived plunged the toilet and wiped up the mess with a towel. We requested from maintenance and the front desk for someone to come and wash the floors but no one arrived until the maid the next day. This problem continued our whole stay. 2. The rooms were old, with stained tiles, broken lamps, dirty shower door, mirrors and glasses. Air conditioners were loud are not working at all and one leaked on the floor the whole week. The rooms in this building would not rate a 2. 3. The buffet was presentable but I felt the food was recycled far too often. Dinner brussel sprouts back for breakfast? We always found something to eat but were careful in our choices. 4. The steaks at the Argentina restaurant were Flank steak and tough as nails.Service was great. 5. Front desk would not answer our calls and the phones were working as we had a wake call which worked. 6. The beginning of each show they used a smoke machine which made it impossible for anyone with asthma to sit in there so I missed all shows but other members of our group said they were fairly good. In the state the rooms are in I would not recommend this hotel to anyone but must compliment all the employees who made our holiday very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “You know it wasn't all that bad.....”
Reviews.Author: sirdons
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed there between the 23rd of Jan. to the 30th. Everyone has a different experince to write about, and you make the trip what it is. I had read some nasty reviews here on T/A and I thought to myself, what are we getting ourselves into, so with that said I went with the expectation of nothing. What I got in return was a fantastic time, in my opinion I will break down what I thought. Checking in we had no problems because it was well after 3 PM, it was like closer to 7 when we got in. Rooms, this was a big disappointment, I expected better, but there was nothing we could do about the smell of rot in the room. Funny story though, first night there we got to our room the door was open, so I tapped on it asking if there was anyone inside? There was no lights on, so we walked in and the patio door was open? So I went over and tried locking it with no success at all, so when the guy came to drop the suitcases off I asked him to lock the patio door, he did no problem, only thing was that for the rest of the week I could not get the patio door open again :( We were on the second floor room 211, maybe stay away from that one. It was spacious, but there was no clock radios to tell you the time, as for no coffee makers it was not a big deal to me, you just got your coffee at breakfast The pools were great but chilly The beach was awesome when the water wasnt silty, we only went swimming once, all the other days the water was brown from the churning waves. The big wall makes sense to me only to save the beach from ersosion. There was always lots of chairs and umbrellas to sit at. No shortage or pool activities going on The bar in the hotel was 100 times better then at the pool. In list of my favorite restaurants- The Argentina restuarant was really good- The Japanese was ok and the Mexican one, dont waste your time. The buffet was good but after a week was starting to get tried of the food, the lunch hut at the pool was pretty decent for a quick bite. At night there was always shows going on, and it was entertaining, and there is a disco between B buliding and the main lobby, did not make it there, couldn't stay awake long enough to attend The grounds were well maintained, everything was very green and lush. Met some great people that were staying at the resort, everyone was as friendly as hell, thats because we were all in paradise. We did some site seeing and the tour company that we used was probably the best part of the trip, they were called Magic Tours. Best trip we did was the ATV'ing in the jungle then off to the sonatis for swimming. So over all it was a great time had by us, and we would go back in a heatbeat! *S*

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Mexico”
Reviews.Author: ssmustard
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at the H10 Hacienda Maya. We had a great two week stay with a wonderfull ocean beach front, swimming pools and activities were great. The staff was terrific, so friendly, awesome service and most of all awesome food. Unfortunately the return factor on this resort is rated at a zero due to the overwhelming smell of sewage in the rooms. This odour was highly noticable on returning to our rooms every evening approaching our walk way to our unit. Everyone in unit 37 was majorly nauseated with this odour and it definately made you want to relieve yourself of the great dinner we had just experienced. Our air conditioner did not work with the remote control. They made a few attempts to fix it but we spent the whole 2 weeks climbing on a bench to operate it manually. Our saving grace from the heat and odour was that we had a patio door and a window that could open, so we were able to create a cross breeze. Unfortunately the patio door had no screen neither did the window.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It and Would Definitely Plan on Returning”
Reviews.Author: VancouverDeltagal
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the Mayan but not first time to a Mexican All Inclusive, so familiar with all–inclusive resorts. I would rate this resort a definite 4 ½ star – if not more. My husband and our 2 daughters, Rachel 19 and Leigh 13 went to the resort from jan 23 – 30th. I will break down my review into categories. RESORT: Grounds are absolutely beautiful at the Hacienda Maya – extremely clean and one of the nicest landscaped resorts I have been to. Beautiful!!! ROOMS: We had two rooms and no complaints for either room, air conditioners worked, tv worked, showers were great – always had hot water and plenty of pressure. Yes beds were hard but we like that. We had rooms 2203 & 2205. Maid service was excellent – although I would have liked to have more than just two towels, but we just went and got our own out of the maid’s closet so we had two extra. She always left plenty of water and nice fresh flowers. Left towels made into a Teddy bear with flowers on our girls beds!! It was very cute. I defintely would not want to stay in the hotel portion of the resort though, like the individual buildings best. Yes we did get a sewer smell everyday around 6:00 pm but not too too bad at all.
