RESTAURANTS: The restaurants themselves are so so – the Japanese is the best – the Mexican was also good but the Argentina restaurant – was not so impressed with. What was bad about the whole restaurant experience is every day you need to go and get in line for 9:00 am to book a spot for the next day which is a pain, because if you are not in the front of the line up – good luck getting a decent time. I think you should be able to go up and book all three restaurants for one night each and then you are done. BUFFET: For an all inclusive – very good – and I require a special low in fat diet and had zero problems finding something to eat. Lot’s of variety and truthfully we never really got sick of eating there. Loved the Quac & Salsa and chips at the beach restaurant, which also serves Hot Dogs and Hamburgers & Fries. STAFF: Front desk staff was very helpful – no problems – never had to wait very long at all, more than helpful, always had one that spoke english – no problems there. Yes if you arrive a bus tour you do have to wait in line – what do you expect when there are 30 people arriving at the same time; however, I think they should put on more staff for these times when everyone arrives. They give you a drink when you arrive and are standing in lineup. E NTERTAINMENT STAFF: EXCELLENT – especially Eloisa (she is a doll), Gabriel (the best), Angel and Leslie.Wished I would have gotten Eloisa & Gabriel’s email address to send some pics to them and thank them again.! Thank you so much for making our trip so much more enjoyable. These people work very very hard and always have a smile and their face – they definitely make the resort!! H10 should be very very lucky to have these wonderful young hardworking people and I hope they pay them well cause without them our experience would not have been what it was. Loved the Kayaks, Catamarans, scuba lessons in the pool, horseshoe games and Volleyball!!!! Great Great Great!!! They also played pretty good music around the pool – not just mexican music which was nice for a change. SHOWS: : Some are great, Grease – Michael Jackson, Mexican night are very good!!! – some are so so - all are entertaining. The only thing about this is after the shows they move out to the outdoor area outside the lobby bar for dancing and there are just not enough tables and chairs out there – so nowhere to sit, yet they have room for many many more tables and chairs. Just could not understand this – they are trying to get everyone out there to dance yet nowhere for people to sit. Also no one goes to the Night Club and not too sure why that is. Perhaps they should dosome entertaining down there –have Julio sing a song or two down there just to get the people in there, but again no where to sit in there and start off your evening. They could turn this into a great bar!!! Bars & Alcohol: Not so great – beer was always warm only cold on a few days – need to get ice. TAKE YOUR OWN GO CUP! They beer cups they use at the swim up bar are regular drink cups – so you are back there a ton – they need to use Beer Cups the larger ones. The lobby bar uses really really cheap alcohol and never enough of it. We however, bought our drinks using premium alcohol. This would be our only really complaint. BEACH: AWESOME!!! We spent every day at the beach rather than the pool. Just wish they would put umbrellas around the pool so if you wanted some shade you could get it and don’t understand why they don’t have the small white little tables around on the beach and the pool area, it would be so much nicer to be able to put your drinks on something rather than the sand. The beach was great – plenty of beach – don’t listen to those other reviews –the beach was great. Take a bun out and feed the fish!!! You won’t be disappointed. Yes there is one little area that is rocky but as soon as you get past that – and it is only about two feet wide – it is all nice and sandy. TOUR: Did the ATV Tour out of the resort $60.00 per person – Great and worth it for a half day tour!! OVERALL: Yes in the evenings certain areas of the resort did smell like sewer but it is Mexico and their sewer systems are not the best! Yes we heard of people who had plumbing problems in their room and took a really long time for maintenance to fix, but again – that is Mexico, could happen at any resort. Our experience was perfect – we had nothing go wrong. I will go back next year for certain and would recommend the resort to anyone. Met some great people there and miss being there!!! Loved It! Loved It!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Canadians”
Reviews.Author: ajreid
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor members give very honest and accurate reviews. I researched this hotel and others before going and everything was exactly as people described. Read a few of the reviews and pay attention to things that are most important to you. Don't get too hung up on overly critical reviews. I was looking for an inexpensive way to visit Chichen Itza and other locations that was clean and convenient to areas I wanted to visit. I prefer a smaller and quieter hotel. This hotel met and exceeded my expectations in most cases. We were there from Jan 15-22, 2008. Best features of this hotel are outstanding grounds (beautiful landscaping), nice rooms and patios in a low density design (I had none of the room problems some reviewers had), beautiful pools and an excellent beach sand area. I have mixed opinions on the food and entertainment. The buffet was not that appetizing but I always found something to eat (excellent breads). The Mexican Restaurant was also kind of bland but the service and location was nicer (you can skip this one and not miss anything). The Japanese Teppanyaki was outstanding and I would have liked to go again to try the regular menu which was different. There is also a sushi menu (I don't like sushi) and others said it was not very good. The Argentenian Restaurant is open and there is no extra charge. I did not have time to go but others told me it was quite good (barbeque steak & chicken). The entertainment crew work very hard and some of it was quite good; some of it did not appeal to me. They are dancers and their best efforts are shows that allow them to dance (such as Latin dancing). Some shows like Grease are lip synced and seem a little too amateur. The Mexican show was really well done and involved an outside group with beautiful costumes and very authentic dances and games. There were live bands most nights in the lobby ranging from Mariachi to Jazz. For the size of the hotel it is pretty hard to expect much more than this. I think the entertainment would appeal to families with small children who would be more easily impressed. One show on the Movies was perhaps not suitable for young children (some adult themes). The ocean was rough the week we were there and did not seem as nice as in Playa del Carmen (more turbulent). We stuck to the pools (very nice) and walking the beach until we were exhausted. You can walk as far as you want for exercise. The beach area in front of the hotel is quite extensive and stays clean because of a cement wall. There are lots of Palapas. The hotel is understaffed so I can imagine they get overwhelmed at times. I usually got my own coffee or drinks in the buffet area (not a big deal). I have never seen bartenders who work so hard (I am not a big drinker but I wish I had tipped these guys because they deserve it!). I was amazed at how well they kept up even when it was busier. The service was adequate for my needs. The property is kept very clean. I did tip the maid everyday ($2 US) I did the usual tours that are popular: Chichen Itza (worth the bus trip), Playa del Carmen - Fifth Avenue (tourist trap IMHO - too many sellers competing for your attention), Tulum (beautiful) and Xcaret (don't miss this - there is something for everyone but plan ahead what you will do - there isn't time for everything in one day - the night show alone is worth the admission - basic admission is all you need and taxi is only $25 each way with tip). There are some things I learned that were not mentioned in previous reviews: (1) extra water is available from the front desk - the maid will keep your supply up if she sees you are using more than the usual two bottles per day (2) at least 50% of the guests are Canadian - announcements are in Spanish, English & French - very few Americans (3) Two Nolitours reps are there about a half day everyday - they gave a very good welcome presentation (Serge) and they can help with any tours you need (I prebooked most of mine not knowing that they are well represented) (4) Taxi is only $15 each way with tip to Playa del Carmen and is more convenient than the shuttle (afternoons only) (5) I wasted time inside the airport because I did not listen to other reviewers who said go through the terminal and outside to find the tour company rep for your transfer - in Mexico they will say anything (including lie) to get your attention and try and sell you a tour or a timeshare presentation (6) have compassion for the hard working Mexicans who are just trying to make a living - be polite and tip where appropriate - we saw great poverty on the way to Chichen Itza (7) you don't really need pesos - US dollars will do (8) there is an ATM machine in the lobby (dispenses pesos) (8) be prepared for TD - despite being careful my wife was quite sick for about six hours one evening and I felt some discomfort - Imodium, Cipro and Pepto Bismol were used when needed to keep this from ruining our vacation (we suspect it might have been the Mexican Restaurant but we can't be sure) (9) be prepared in case of wet weather - we did have some rain most days but mostly it was a few minutes and did not interfer a great deal - a cloudy day at Xcaret was perfect for seeing the park in cooler weather - it is hot when the sun comes out! Bottom line, I had a great week and got excellent value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “More than i could've ever imagined”
Reviews.Author: Mexico4Ever
Reviews.Content: Wow, my whole family of 18 went on a trip all together to Mexico for the first time. And it sure was amazing. Most of my family had been to mexico already and if they would compare this trip to any other, this would definetly be the best. The food was better than any other hotel, the rooms were nice and the pool was awesome. Best thing of the trip? The Entertainment Staff!! Wow, big thanks to Gabriel, Angel, Sam, Christian, Roxy, Julio, Leslie and so many more. They made our trip more than we couldve ever imagined. We were always busy, but there was still time for relaxtion. The dinner shows were awesome. We never missed a single one.I cant imagine anyone saying anything bad about this hotel. If you are looking for one awesome stay, full of entertainment, H10 Hacienda Maya is the place for you! Thank-you for an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “first time out of canada”
Reviews.Author: harleyh14
Reviews.Content: I dont know how people could even give a bad review on this resort!! I had a great time there, i went with my whole family all-exlusive, we stayed for a week. At first i thought i wanted to go home by the end of the week but by then i just wanted to stay another week. The food was great i thought, and if you didnt want to eat at the buffet in the lobby then you could go down to the beach plus there was another resurant along the side of the lobby, i thought it was enough to choose from within a week. The beach was beutiful, and the water was great, my grandpa hates swimming and he stayed in the ocean for nearly an hour jumping waves with us. there was everything you needed right in the resort, a gift shop were you could buy smokes and anything else plus a place you could go on the internet and a lady would come out there every once in a while and make fresh cigars. The rooms were very cozy, and you would wake up early every day just because the sun would shine right into your room which isnt so bad since you wouldnt miss breakfast, it wasnt a far walk anywere i went, altho i did get confussed as to which trail i was sposed to fallow to the pool haha. and there was a theatre there so you could watch plays and listen to music and after whatever time there was a disco, its just like a dance for all the people staying there. i didnt see one person there that wasnt smiling. everyone was always happy and laughing and drinking and going to the beach. i had alot of stress on my mind when i was at home but while i was there none of them even mattered anymore it was a great first experience for me and am thinking of going there again someday i really enjoyed it and i consider saying that if you would want to go to mexico that would be the place to go, its only a half hour from cancun and like 5 min. from playa del carmon. i didnt even want to go do any activities becuz i was having such a good time at the resort. all in all it was a great trip and recomend this resort to anyone!! p.s i never really thought of mexico as a place i would like to go for a vacation but when i did im very glad that i took the chance because it changed my views.-moral of that, have an open mind and you will have a great time garentee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: canadiangal717
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews of H10 Hacienda Maya, I was having some second thoughts about my resort choice, but they couldn't have been more wrong. We stayed here from Jan 8-16, 2008. First of all people, this is a Mexico, if you are the type of person who wants everything to be like home, then stay there. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby is very clean, and nicely decorated. We had great service at the front desk, it took us about ten minutes to check in and there was a tray of drinks brought to us as soon as we arrived. We arrived around 1:30 and were expecting to wait till 3:00 to get into our room, but it was it was ready so we had no wait. The rooms are located in bungalow type buildings, with eight rooms in each. It's really nice having your own entrance, and there is no problem with noisy hallways. Our room was clean and we had no problem with bugs. The AC only had one fan setting, but you could adjust the temp, so we were comfortable. We never once saw our maid, but she did a wonderful job of keeping our room cleaned, and our fridge stocked with water ( we never had less than five bottle per day, for two people). The pool area was nice and clean, but the water was a bit cold for me. The entertainment by the pool can be a bit loud, but if you choose a chair on the beach you can barely hear it. Service at the pool bar was slow at times, but I never waited more than 5 minutes for a drink ( most times it was only a minute or two).The swim up bar was slower, but there aren't many people at it, so i can understand why the bartenders don't really look over there as often. The lobby bar is always busy, but the service is very good. The coffee in the resturants is awful, but the lobby bar makes a decent cappiucino. The only thing i didn't like about the lobby was the smoking, but i live where there is no smoking allowed in public places, so i wasn't used to it. The buffet resturant was good, there was a nice selection, and each night was a different theme so it didn't get boring. Breakfast was the best, there was an omelet station, where you could get whatever you want made for you, and someone making fresh french toast and pancakes all the time. The juice was excellent and they had very nice fresh pastries. The wait staff, do an excellent job of keeping the tables clear, but it was sometimes easier to just get our own drinks, or bring drinks from the Lobby bar. The Mexican resturant was okay. The service was excellent, and the Tortilla soup is very good. Main course was a little bland , but fine. The Chocolate mouse, was pretty awful, it was more like hard jello. Our first trip to the Japanese restraunt was great. We had the tepanyaki, with the chef at our table cooking for us. The food was amazing and the service was prompt. Our second trip was not so great. Our reservation was lost, so we had to talk to manager to get us a table. The restruant was full and there was only one waiter, who i think resented us for complaining to his manager. We waited 20 minutes to get a drink, then another 20 for our first course ( which is prepared sushi in a fridge 10 feet from our table). The sushi was fine, nothing special ( but it's not Japan so my expectations weren't very high anyway.) My main course was excellent ( breaded shrimp). After we finished our main course, we sat and waited for 20 minutes for our dessert ( which we ordered before we started eating ,but it never showed. I asked for another drink before the main course, which also never showed, even as the table of 11 beside us got there drinks and appetizers. We finally had enough and left without our dessert and without leaving a tip. The argetinian restruant opened halfway through our stay but we didn't eat there, although we heard that have excellent steaks and ribs. The beach was okay, the water is nice, and there are no rocks. We had fun, with the seadoos and parasailing gives you a great view of the area. All in all we had a great trip. Keep in mind that you are on vacation, don't be in a hurry to do anything, and relax. I would definitely return to this resort. The minor flaws are nothing compared to the great staff,and the beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the H110 Hacienda Maya”
Reviews.Author: PalmTreeLove
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had an absolutely fabulous time at the H10 Hacienda Maya! The rooms were simple and tastefully decorated, very clean, and ample storage space. One night the ac wasn't working but we placed a call to the front desk and someone came out within minutes to fix it. The grounds were beautifually landscaped and very well maintained. Everyday we'd take a look at the tiny blue crabs living in the mangroves -- very cool. The pool area was very nice and very clean. Lots of deck chairs available both by the pool and on the sand. The entertainment staff has a ton of energy and will keep you entertained (if you want to be), but if you just want to relax there is plenty of room for that too. Lots of beautiful sandy beach, but unfortunately the water was a little dark in spots from the hurricane damage. We ate at the Mexican restaurant on our second night there, which was good however not a lot of variety, but the waiter did a great little show when he made our coffee. The buffet was fabulous. We ate there the remainder of our 1wk stay. The service. What can I say but "wow!". The staff there are absolutely amazing. A previous review mentioned hardly anyone spoke English. I disagree. Almost all of the staff there spoke excellent english. The one's that weren't "fluent" made a strong effort, communication was never a problem. All of the staff were so extremely friendly and hospitable, I found it hard to say goodbye. The staff in the buffet area were very helpful if you were looking for something and very were quick to remove the plates from your table. The maid service was great, everyday we looked forward to coming back into our room to see what she did with our towels that day. One day it was a swan, the next day 2 kissing swans, sometimes it was hearts with flowers. Everyday a surprise! Guest services was great and the bar staff were exceptional. Everyone from the front desk to the maintence staff were very friendly. I cannot emphasize this enough. We enjoyed everything about our stay at the h10 Hacienda Maya but by far the friendly staff were our favorite aspect. We will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “definitley NOT a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: mariajene
Reviews.Content: Wejust returned from a 2 week stay at the h10 hacienda maya, and felt compelled to give a brief but truthful review. I will give a breif breakdown of different features of the resort and how I would rate them, and try to do so compared to many other resorts we have stayed at throughout the caribbean throughout the past several years. I know that as a general rule you cannot expect to rate a 5* hotel in the caribbean to a 5* in a major North American city. Lets start with the positive: Rooms - the rooms I would rate a 4 star. They were a good size, tastefully decorated. We had a small covered balcony which was nice to sit out on and read when we decided to stay in our room. Shower/bathroom was all marble and very nice. The A/C unit did not work initially and then afterwards we found to be only working on/off cycles - it would blow out cool air for a time and then seem to bring in warm air from the outside - this we mentioned to the front desk SEVERAL times and that was the best they could do - but more on the service later. It was also quite noisy as far as AC units go. Overall a very good rating without nit-picking. The beds/pillows are about as uncomfortable as almost any resort in the caribbean and so would say they are about par with almost all others. Cleanliness- This was the hotels most outstanding feature and I would say it deserves a 5 star rating in this catagory. The maid service in the rooms and around the entire property was VERY clean. Even the small things like cutlery at the restaurants were always very clean - not smudges and foodstuffs ever on any of the cutlery we ate with. Excellent rating and well deserved. Grounds and common areas - Another excellent rating I would say 4.5 stars. Landscaping and common areas all very clean and VERY nicely maintained. The only reason it didn't get a 5 star was the cushions in lobby area ususally had stains on them - but not a huge deal. Front desk staff - 2 star. Very few employees around the resort know any english at all. The front lobby staff are the best in their English, but their attitude toward guests and their apparant lack of diligence in looking after complaints/requests for getting service done i.e. fixing the AC unit for example, is one of the worst places I've dealt with. Any requests that we made were always done very tactfully, even after being ignored or no action was taken in a reasonable amount of time. Not even close to a 5 star hotel in this regard, I have stayed in 3 star resorts where the attitude and customer service of staff puts this one to shame. Food- I would rate this a 3.5 star, and thats only because the Japanese restaurant was excellent. Honestly we are not picky eaters, but serious I had already got tired of the food before the first week was over. Food was very repetative, and lacked any pinache. Pasta bar was good, usually the roast beef or turkey special nights were quite good, but really a lack of variety kills the buffet dining room. Let me tell you that it is a very informal buffet - the restaurants are severely understaffed, so you cannot blame the hard-working cooks and waiters, but sometimes you will not get coffee and drinks served to you unless you happen to flag down a waiter about halfway through your meal. You can get you own drinks and serve yourself which is good, except for coffee/tea which are only available through the waiters, and getting one to come to you is a job and a half in itself. So, if you dont mind a very informal/self-service type setting, you'll do fine unless you want coffee/tea as mentioned earlier. But, in my opinion that is definitely not the type of standard you expect for a resort claiming to be a 5 star . Restaurants - Mexican - was OK 3 star food a little bland. Japanese - 4.5 star, we ate at the table where they cook your meal before you. The little "show" by the chef and the food were excellent, tastiest meal by far, and the only thing that raised the overall rating of food to a 3,5 star. The beach restaurant is 3 star - good hamburgers, hotgogs and nachos, but thats about it. After a few days of that it becomes unappealing. Oh and good luck getting beer or alcoholic drinks here, again the underlying reason is understaffed - a coomon problem throughout the various areas of this resort. Beach and Pool - The pool area is lovely although there is little shade to be found anywhere around the pool area - you can only stay here if you love to be out in the direct sun. The pool is nice and big and those with little ones can enjoy the small wading pool they have for little children, Very clean pool area, but some times there are a alot of aciivites going on, and its hard to have a quiet wade in the pool with all the activites and young kids having fun in the pools. The beach area is fairly large and the sand is preserved due to the hotel building a large concrete breakwater at the edge of the ocean/ beach area. There are LOTS of palapas and chairs and we never had a problem getting one. Also very few vendors come around, you maybe see one/day so its very nice that way not to be constantly harrassed to buy something. If you like going into the ocean you will hate this hotel. The water is constantly very turbulent and murky - I personally dont like wading into water where I cant see where I'm stepping even in foot of water. This maybe due to the damaged caused to the offshore reef by Wilma a few years ago, but not a picturessque site. The beach/sand area I would say is a 3.5 and the ocean water are 1 star. If you like a beautiful oceanview and clear water - you WILL be truly dissappointed here. Bars - We are not heavy drinkers but the service especially at the pool area bar can be quite slow. This is in no way due to the bartenders - they work hard and fast but they are simply understaffed, and this is a common problem throughout the resort that needs to be addressed. Sometines there was ONE bartender at the pool bar and no less than 35 people waiting around to get drinks. I felt sorry for the poor guy, but its lots of little things like this that you would not experience in a REAL 5 star resort. Entertainment - The animation / entertainment team is hard working and very enthusiastic young people, but the shows are geared toward children, yes I mean children. For parents with young ones, the shows are great for them from about 9:15 PM to 9:45 PM. After this the only entertainment affered to adult resort guests is a trip into Cancun to a bar club. We do not really like the club scene - it may appeal to younger single people, but usually for middle-aged and married people its not the type of entertainment that appeals to this general group. So, other than a kiddie show or going into a bar/ club to drink and dance with singles, there is nothing to do here but go back to you room and watch tv or sit in the lobby and chat with others. Overall, we had a generally good relaxing time, but its been the first time that we had gone somewhere for 2 weeks and felt like coming home after the first week. The resort is definitly NOT a 5 star resort, not even a 4 star- overall its been one of those places that we would say that weren't glaringly terrible, but there were SEVERAL little things that we experienced and observed that took away our satisfaction while we stayed here. This was our first time to an H10 resort, and while I would not say I would NEVER go back to an H10 resort, I will say it will have to be a while before I would consider going and trying them again, and we both were excited about the prospect of coming home like we have never experienced before.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years!”
Reviews.Author: YVR_yvr
Reviews.Content: Have travelled to Mexico many times, as well as DR and stayed at many all inclusives, so have an idea of different resorts and levels of service. Stayed at H10 for 2 weeks for both Christmas and New Years and had a great time ... it is all about the attitude you leave home with. Remember you are going to a foreign country and everything will be different than what you are used to at home ... that is why we go travelling isn't it, we are looking for an adventure!? If you want everything to be like home, then stay at home! Activities staff, bar staff and restaurant staff all great and really work hard to take care of the guests. They worked very hard to make Christmas Eve and New Years Eve special. Rooms are okay, clean and comfortable ... not 5 star, but did not expect them to be. Could not understand why everyday the housekeeping person who took care of us only would ever leave three bath towels when she woud see four of us everyday going in and out of the room and we repeatedly asked for four towels. We also tipped handsomely in an attempt to remedy the towel problem, but still only 3 towels and no better service than without tipping ... so finally I gave up and went with the flow ... brought a clean towel back from the pool everyday to use in the bathroom. Grounds are beautiful with nicely manicured gardens. Occasional smell of sewage in certain areas when you are walking around. Take mosquito spray for night time ... we did get many mosquito bites Food - buffet is your best bet ... lots of variety ... not 5* cuisine, but some good dishes ... lots of fruit available and menu changes daily. Breakfast the best meal of the day. Order your lattes from the bar ... they are very good. Mexican restaurant was very slow and food not good at all ... this is Mexico! the food in the Mexican restaurant should be the best. Japanese retaurant okay ... nice atmostphere, but not the best food ... but then again you are in Mexico ... not Japan! They do try their best and the deserts in the Japanese restaurant were good. Snack bar by the pool (daytime) - okay and saved a trip back to the main buffet for lunch, but they could change the menu a bit from day to day. Always the same menu. Pools are great ... very clean. Beach is great ... not sure what people are complaining about ... soft, white sand. Our kids spent a lot of time in the water. People complain about seaweed and rocks ... no rocks to speak of. And for those who come from landlocked areas ... this is the ocean! There is supposed to be seaweed in the ocean. Red flag up for most of the 2nd week we were there due to high winds. Book the sailboat in the morning for later in the day. Entertainment ... is okay ... have seen better, but they do their best and seem to all have fun doing it. These kids work very hard 12+ hours every day, 7 days a week and earn very little, so give them a break. New Years Eve the hotel organized a huge party at the poolside and it was very well done. Lots of entertainment and a good time was had by all until the wee hours of the morning. The staff really made sure their guests had fun and were taken care of on New Year's Eve ... thank you! Went on many tours while there, the best was Tulum. and the catamaran snorkeling tour. There is a free shuttle to Playa Del Carmen ... but does not leave until the afternoon. They need to offer this service earlier in the day as well. Was surprised upon checking out that they wanted to charge me for 3 movies (at $17 US/movie) when we had in fact not watched any movies. Two fo the movies were supposed to have been viewed on December 23rd at the same time we were arriving to the hotel, so not sure how they figured we had watched a movie at that time ... after much discussion with me and then confering in Spanish behind the front desk they agreed to waive the fee ... good thing, because I was not going to pay it! Be careful when you check out that you are not charged for things you did not use/buy. Drinks are okay, but very little alcohol in those margaritas ... I should have been on the floor after 3 of them, but barely any effect ... I suggest ordering a shot of tequila on the side and mixing into your margarita. All in all a great holiday ... wish I was still there lying by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday A+ Hotel F”
Reviews.Author: gc1408
Reviews.Content: Went to H10 Hacienda Maya all inclusive resort from Dec 24 2007 to Jan 6 2008 as part of a group of 26 family and friends. Although we booked all the rooms months ago, for some reason our room was located some distance away from our relatives in another building. The staff were extremely uncooperative to even allow us to change rooms. This took us 4 days before we could change rooms. Although we had specified 2 twin beds when we had arranged the holiday, we were given a room with one king bed. I am traveling with my wife and my two boys so this was unacceptable. It took 2 days for them to them to fix this... their solution was to throw a mattress on the ground, which blocked whatever little room was left to walk around. The air conditioner was located near the roof of the suite with no manual controls. For the first four days the air was on full blast cold 24/7 because there was something wrong with the air conditioner and it could not turn off. The room was so cold, I ending up getting getting sick. The repair man came several times to fix the air conditioner but was not able to do so. His solution was to climb up a ladder and somehow manually turn off the air conditioner. Unfortunately, after turning off the air, the room was too hot and stuffy to sleep in it. We had to call him back to turn the air back on. I chose to suffer the cold although I was already sick. Luckily the air did work in the second room we were moved to... The first room also had terrible problems with the toilet plumbing. There was a constant sewage smell and sewage blockup. The repairman came and was unable to fix this. The sewage problem was mostly ok in the second suite. There was just some smell, but the toilet did work for the most part. The second room had its own set of problems. The air and toilet were ok. However, the suite crawled with spiders, geckos, centipides, ants and mosquitoes. We complained about the bugs for 4 days, finally, after my son was bitten by a spider, they decided to fix the problem, by putting a door seal on the bottom of the front door to the suite. We had been blocking the door daily with a towel, but the bugs must have gotten in after the maid came to clean the suite. After the door was sealed, we got rid of most of the bugs, except the mosquitoes. On both sides of the resort, there are swamps. It seemed strange to me, that they didn't fill these swamps in, since this was the obvious source of the mosquitoes... The food at the resort was mediocre. The buffet was the best place to eat. However, the chicken, and beef were chewy and largely unappetizing. The fish was generally good. The pasta was cooked with way too much oil. In the morning the omelettes were uniformly good. On the mexican night ( once a week ) there are good mexican stews. There are good desserts, fresh fruit and self serve beer and wine. The salsa, gaucomole and tortilla chips are excellent. At the mexican restaurant, the food there was poorly prepared and there was very limited selection. We went once, and that was enough for us. At the japanese restaurant, it was obvious the staff there had never seen or tasted real sushi, The stuff they made was mediocre to poor. However it is worth going because the cook provided a good show making the food. The argentine restaurant was destroyed in a hurricane, it was still unrepaired during the time we were at the resort. The evening entertainment was performed by the hotel staff and was generally uninteresting, however, do see the mexican show, they bring in entertainers from outside the resort. The activities on the beach included free sailing and kayaks. There is extra charge for para sailing and jet boats. There are scuba lessons available right at the resort. However, the diving conditions are mediocre at the resort, the best diving is at Cozumel. The beach has a marked area for swimming, here the sand has been groomed and it is not necessary to wear feet protection. The water grows gradually deep and there are no strong currents or waves. The reef is just about 500 yards offshore, this provides good protection for the swimming beach, and other water activities at the resort. Some of the female guests chose to go topless at this resort, and the staff didn't do anything about this. This didn't bother us, but you might consider this if you are uptight about this kind of thing. The resort does offer free shuttle to Playa del Carmen but the hours are limited and you must book your trips. Otherwise a cab to Playa is about 15 bucks including tip and takes about 15 minutes. Playa has a Walmart, mexican supermarkets, restaurants, and lots of interesting souvenir shopping. There are a couple of tour companies with desks right in the lobby, and there is a Budget car rental desk as well. One of the best features of the hotel, is the free wifi internet in the lobby, we used this extensively during our stay. There are no annoying logins or passwords necessary. However, the connection is capped so if the total number of users exceeds the limit, the exceeding user will get the "server not found" error. We went on several excursions during our stay. Tulum is the most scenic of the ruin sites and if you chose to go to only one ruin, this is the one to see. We combined this with x'hel ha, which is a mexican theme park, which has excellent snorkelling among other things. Chichen itza is worth seeing, but is about 3 1/2 hours away from Playa. I found Coba to be the most interesting of the ruin sites. Coba has the highest pyramid in mexico and you are allowed to climb up the pyramid. The site is located in largely undeveloped jungle and has an Indiana Jones kind of feel to the place. At Coba be sure to either rent the bikes or take the pedicab. The site is enormous. Coba is about 2 hours from Playa. There are swarms of mosquitoes, so be sure to load up the repellent! We took the fast ferry to Cozumel from Playa and hired a local cab driver to give us a 3 1/2 hour tour of the entire island for 80 bucks. A lot of the island is nature preserve, and it is absolutely stunning. We also saw the ruins at San Gervasio. The driver took us to see his neighborhood, and showed us his home, and even helped us do some shopping in his neighborhood store. One day we took the shopping tour to Cancun for 26 bucks a person. They took us to Mercado 28, a local shopping center in Cancun where the prices for souvenirs are about 1/2 what they are in Playa. The tour also included two other shopping centers, the beach at Cancun and a driving tour of the main hotels and points of interest. We also took the tour to isla de mujeres. This is a island about an hour from Cancun by catamaran. A bus takes you to Cancun, where you board a catamaran to the island. One of the stops includes the swim with the shark. There is a 5 foot shark in a pen where you are allowed to handle the creature. The shark's teeth has been removed. The next stop is snorkeling on the reef. After the reef, the catamaran docks and you have lunch at a buffet restaurant and a couple of hours for shopping or sight seeing on the island. On the way back the catamaran crew unfurls the spinnaker sail and the kids have spinnaker rides on the sail. The tour includes unlimited drinks, including a tequila shooter contest.

Reviews.Title: “H10 was paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jay-MB
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two kids, 14 and 10) just returned from two weeks at the H10 Hacienda Maya...and we loved it. The food, the pools, the room, the grounds -- everything was exceptional. The place was 80 per cent Canadians and we just had a blast with everyone. I can't figure out how anyone could give this gem of a resort a bad review. Must be some really high-maintenance people out there. We stayed here when it was the El Mandarin three years ago, and there have been so many upgrades. Downside was the beach and the water. The shore is really eroded, making for some really murky water. But it was still fun to splash around in the Caribbean Sea, and all you had to do was walk about a few hundred metres for a better beach. I must also mention the excellent sports and entertainment team at the H10. They really made our stay complete, with all the fun and games during the day and the nightly shows. Some terrific dancers in the group. A big thanks to Julio and his crew of Roxy, Elizabeth, Christian, Juan, Angel, Sam, Gabriel, Carlos, Dini and the rest of the staff. These are really wonderful people, and we owe them a huge thank you!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: RedDeerAlbertaBsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from jan 4 -11.This is my 16th trip to mexico and my first to the H10. The rooms were acceptable with good air conditioning, and the housekeeping staff did a good job keeping the rooms clean. the room we had only had a removable shower faucette that took 5 minutes to get hot water in the morning. The food was just average, and is the selection. The best meal as per most all inclusives was the breakfasts with the best omlettes. I would recomend people to eat at the buffet in the main building as the food at pool side was lacking taste and was not very warm. The japanese restaurant was really good, the sushi was excellant. I would recomend eating there. I would give the overall food area a 3 out of 5. The grounds at the resort were very clean. I would give this a 5. The variety of alcohol was excellant and plentiful, as I woke up the next morning several times feeling I had to much. The entertainment department was excellant!! Thanks Angel for a great job. If you get a chance to go to Coco Bongo this is a must. Angel took us and 9 others there and for $60.00 we got the VIP treatment. Close to the entertainment and right by the bar. The resort is close to PDC, it is a $10.00 to $14.00 cab ride. You mus visit 5th ave when you go.The resort is 3.5 to 4 out of 5. I would definately recomend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: NattheBrat1
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good time at the resort. Good proximity to Playa Del Carmen. Clean resort, friendly staff and large bed. However, it did have some minor issues, such as a hard bed and food selection wasn't always great. A good resort if you like a small resort, and family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qwerty12345678
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a long perod of time, as I was doing some consulting work for another hotel, that is opening soon, and the h10 is in the proximity. The food is horrible. The staff is incompetent The secruity staffi is incompetent and they treat one like a prisoner. The rooms are horrible. The fixtures are out-dated, if not broken, or missing parts. They serve Corona lite, which is--somehow--worse than Sol, and Sol is horrible as well. The pool would be nice, but is annoying because the activites department is always screaming into the microphone. The pool cafe, or whatever it is called, is disgusting, unless you like 4 hour-old chicken nuggets. Overall, yout get what you pay for. Stay at the Iberostar or Secrets.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a good deal”
Reviews.Author: MELISSA29
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, My husband and I and our two friends whom are also a couple stayed at the H10 Hacienda Maya from Nov 26 - Dec 03rd. Here is the rundown.... THE HOTEL (Grounds, Lobby, Interior Appearance) The overall appearance of the hotel is very classy. The lobby is large and was a great place to sit ; mainly at night time when there was a really nice breeze. It is open-air so no air conditioning but surprisingly this was not an issue. Everything was marble (pillars, floors) or at least looked like it was complemented with dark ratan, wicker and glass tables and lamps. On December 01st the staff worked very hard and efficiently to put up thier Christmas tree and other Christmas decor. The grounds were very well manicured and you would not be able to find a piece of garbage, food or anything. Lots of flowers, greenery etc. Just outside the main lobby towards the rooms was a huge fountain and a garden consisting of small waterfalls and ponds. At night they lit this up which madi it look like they were Mayan Caves with little head carving things in them. ROOMS The rooms were your typical average hotel rooms. Nothing fancy by any stretch, plain but clean. The bed was like any hotel bed; fairly firm but who cares...you don't spend much time in it anyhow! The bathroom was probably the nicest part of the room with marble tile throughout and a glass entry shower. Only problem with this was there was no bathtub which makes it difficult to shave your legs or maneuver around in there. There was a sewage smell that would sometimes come up from the drain in the bathroom but it lasted a few minutes and then went away. Nothing to complain about like some of these people giving reviews!! The maids were like Ninjas. They had such stealth and speed. The first morning they knocked at about 8 in the morning. We were sleeping and asked them to come back. We later would out the "do not disturb" sign when we went to bed and then when we woke up around 9-9:30am for breakfast we would turn the sign around for the room to be cleaned. After returning from breakfast they were in and out without a trace; aside from a clean room. No mini-bar here folks! We would get about 4 waters a day stocked in out fridge. My friend tried asking for Coke but the maid said they couldn't get that..oh well. BEACH Keep in mind when reading this that I am not really a beach person. I love the sound of the ocean and being able to see it when I am away but not much of a fan for laying on it or swimming in the ocean. Infact I only went twice in the ocean plus one more time when I went Sea-dooing. The ocean has random rocks and shells sticking up which i think is where i cut a huge slice out of my foot but neverthless no biggie. The ocean was rough for our stay there all yellow flag and one red flag which meant the waves were crashing which in turn grabbed the sand from the shore making the water look murky and brownish in colour. When I went sea-dooing in the middle of the ocean it was bluish green and tourquise throughout. The beach was small but lots of chairs available. Sand was nice, white and well maintained. POOL This was my favourite place to be at the resort. Whether it be lounging poolside or at the pool bar, this is where I spent y days. There were two pools: One with deeper waters and a volleyball net. They did activities infront of this pool with loud music. I did not go in this pool once. I meant to but never got around to it. The second pool is where the pool bar is as well as a sectioned off area which has jets which go on and off periodically as well as built in lounge chairs in the pool with the same type of jets. This was our favourite spot in the pool as we called it "the bubbles". The pool got a little chilly when the sun went out but as long as you either kept swimming of drank some more you would stay warm. SERVICE The service was mediocre at this hotel. I have been to Cuba, Dominican and another resort in Mexico where the serivce was better. You have to wait a while for drinks at the lobby bar and pool bar. When I say a while maybe 5 minutes at the most but really, what are you in a rush to do??? You''re on vacation people! The serivce that did irritate me was the front desk in the lobby. They seemed to pick the people that spoke the least amount of English to work this area. The thing that urked me though is that you would be standing there and they wouldn't even acknowledge that you were standing there for a while. One day I went up there to ask for a pen and waited about 7 minutes before someone spoke to me. This brings me to check-in. Unfortunately check in is at 3pm. Well we arrived to the hotel at 11:30am. This meant that we had to sit around and wait until our room was available for 3.5 hours. This wouldn't have been so bad if we had of known this before. that way we could have worn our bathing suit under our clothing or packed a proper change of clothes in our carry on. So be aware that no matter what they will not check you in until 3pm. ENTERTAINMENT I only seen one of the shows which was pretty chessy but that's how these shows are. Unfortuneatly the final act in one of the shows a female dancer fell and hurt her knee. She could not get up or move from where she fell. Now, instead of stopping the show and helping her they just went on with the show with this poor girl lying on the floor in paoin for almost 10 more minutes. I was very upset and wondered why the hotel staff were not helping her or acknowledging her injury. It turns out that they called an ambulance for her and she was back later that night with a knee brace and crutches and seemed fine. Just the way they handled it was very insensitive. There was a Disco in the basement of the hotel which was a very weird place to have it. There were no signs indicating that it even existed so hardly anyone ever went which was a shame because it had such potential. Good music, pool tables etc but not enough people there. Nevertheless we made a good time of it. FOOD First off I have to say that the Japanese was amazing. Very , very good! We went there twice to the teppanyaki where they cook it right in front of you as well as get some suishi. We ended booking this place twice during our stay. I highly reccomend this! The Mexicanos a la carte was pretty good but not spectacular. The buffet for dinner was your typical resort buffet, slightly more dissapointing though. We did the Mexicanos twice and the Japanese twice to avoid the buffet. We ate dinner in town one night at Playa del carmen at La Parilla(Mexican) which was very good. The breakfast wasmy favourite. Omlettes and egges made to order and pancakes, french toast etc. Only weird thing is there was no bacon???! There were rumours that if you got there first thing in th morning there was bacon but there was no way I was making the 7am breakfast. Overall we had a good time. Resort was nice, food okay, drinks VERY strong!! Our group knows how to drink and we had to tell them to put less liquor due to how strong they were making them. Blue Hawiian's were good as well as Miami Vices. My husband and I went sea-dooing on a red flag day. Probably not the best day to go but it was fun if you like feeling like you are going to fly off lol. When we went to Playa del Carmen we visited 5th avenue. It was nice and there were some nice things to buy but it was pretty touristy! Overall for what we paid ($1,450) all together for both it was worth it. More like a 3 or 3.5 star though. Would I go back? Only for less than what I paid If you want more info or have questions feel free to email me at melissagearing@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “for a first time trip it was Ok”
Reviews.Author: WendyladyToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Maya from Nov 26 to Dec 3 2007... we were VERY excited due to it being our first ever.... First off check in is not until 3 pm... even if you arrive at 11am like we did.... and even then we did not get into our room until 4:30pm.... we were told that "something" was wrong with our room... at 4:30 they decided to give us a room change..... The rooms are VERY clean... and the view was great... we were in room 2906 you could see both the pool and ocean from it.... and about a 1 min walk to both pools and snack bar.... and about a 5 min walk to the lobby.... The grounds are breath taking and very well kept.... The pools are very nice and we spent most of our time there.... however the ocean is just what everyone else here has said.... we did go in a coulple of times but it was so merky that you could not even see your hands in the water... it was like swiming in a salty lake.... The food was ok... the buffet was not good at all the first night... but it did get better as the week progressed.... breakfast was the best so I heard as I did not make it there to much but the people I travled with seemed to like it ... the mexican was good I would recommend the yellow pepper soup it was tasty.... the Japanese was by far the best..... make sure to book the tapanyaki... it was wonderful both to watch and eat.... The entertainment crew works very hard and seem to be great with the kids.... however the one thing that I found most troubling was the show that we went to... one of the girls really hurt herself during it..... and they show just continued while she layed at the front of the stage.... I found it VERY insensitive... she had to be taken by ambulance after the show.... We spent one evening at PDC... it was very nice but they shop keepers are pushy and things are the same price there that they are here.... that was a little dissapointing.... but this was our first trip.... we will know better next time.... the last thing was the drinks... wow!! lets just say that there is something to be said when you have to ask for LESS alcohol in your drinks... they do not skimp at all.... Also there is a disco it is in the basement... walk towards the spa and go dwonstairs... you can play pool and the DJ will play whatever you want.... Overall it was a good trip.... with a few glitches... but well worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofsunshine
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th trip to Mexico, my second to the Mayan Riviera. The rooms are great. They are aprox 33 8 room 2 storied bungalows spread around the property, 4 upstairs and 4 downstairs. We had a room with 2 3/4 beds, as always in Mexico they were hard, but we like that. The odd thing was that they weren't bolted down. My boys would wrestle (they each bought nacho whatever masks) and the bed was across the room. A large shower/toilet area with sink just outside but around the corner from the rest of the room. Large balcony with an eye level view of palm trees full of coconuts. A fridge but it only had 2 bottles of water each day. Our friends were downstairs in a room with a king bed and a couch that could double for a bed. The shower/toilet room was smaller and didn't have a window. They had a little lizard living under the deck outside of thier room. The food wasn't very good. Don't get me wrong we could always find something but it was lackluster and alot, really alot of things showed up day after day after day. The hamburgers in the snack bar were awful, even loaded up with oinions, guac and everthing else, so were the chicken nuggets. The kids were sure that they'd been there a week or so. The Mexican al carte was okay but everyone was sick the next day. My youngest was up puking in the morning. It passed, thankfully!! The japanesse was very good. Probably the best meal we had. They cook it in front of you and make a show of it. The veggies were perfect and even the beef tasted good. One thing I didn't really like was that the buffet was up near the lobby. I like to eat nearer to the pool and ocean, either indoors or outdoors. Mind you the walk wasn't very far at all and probably good for me. I've read other reviews and I'm guessing that my tastes are different than thiers, but everyone I was with agreed that the food was lacking. The pools are nice and there were plenty of seats around it. They boys played water polo and had a few other vacationers join in with them. I think it was play with them or get splashed, hit with the ball or move to another chair. The beach was nice to walk along. Of course the sand is like sugar. Again lots of chairs and shade, no towel games going on that we could see. They have a retaining wall, with the chairs and sand above it, below it some days there was a little strip of sand, others the water splashed against it. Blue Bay is on one side and the beach ends there. Secrets Capri is on the other side and then after that, there is a ton of construction till you get to the Fairmont. (We never heard any construction noise) The water however isn't very nice. It's not clear and blue like it is farther south, it was very choppy and a really nasty brown (like coffee) colour for the last 3 days we were there. Not very inviting to swim in. The guy where we got the kayaks from said the water has been like this since Willma and that this little bit of beach is the worst. Farther down the water and beach is nicer. Out in the kayaks we could see the reef and thought it would be nice to snorkel in but you'd have to be careful as it was a ways out from the beach. The bar at the pool is fun and it's so nice to sit there and meet people. Half of it is in the pool and the other side is a reg bar with stools. Most days it was hard to get a drink in the pool. The bartenders stayed on the other side and you had to call and get thier attention. One day only one bartender was working and he was going crazy! Oh, and no straws at the beach/pool bar. I guess they didn't want the garbage. We would grab some from the lobby bar and take them with our bubbas to the pool, it made it much easier to drink the blended drinks. The lobby bar was nice too. They used glass there and it was a nice change from the flimsy plastic cups, made me feel like a grownup! No top shelve liquor. They had it but you'd have to pay extra. One thing I wasn't prepared for was that you have to take a bus or collectivo into PDC and then another to any point south. It sounds like a small thing but what a pain it was! It added travel time and a little confusion to everything we wanted to do. We like to go on our own to Xel Ha, Akumal and other places that are south of PDC. It's alot cheaper than a tour (even in a cab) and you set your own hours. We could have taken a cab everytime but they'll only put 4 people into a cab & we were 5!?! How is it that you can fill up the bed of a pickup truck with as many people as you want but only are allowed 4 in a cab? One cabbie took us into PDC but we had to have 2 to bring us back, they have a check stop, no really, a check stop that all cabs stop at, but only going north. One cabbie told us that cops could pull them over and that the fine was $700 pesos. We did a catamaran boat tour to Isla Mujeres. It was fantastic! We booked with they guys who are around the pool. It was $69usd for adults and $45usd for kids. The kids are all over 12 but I argued that they wouldn't be drinking and so shouldn't have to pay adult prices, they gave us kid prices which was very nice. We also did a zip line/cenote swim/tulum tour which was just okay. It was $96usd per person and I don't really think we got a good deal for the $$$ spent. It was fun and the staf was great but there were only 3 zip lines, only pop and water at lunch and we were really rushed at Tulum. I read in another review that this resort was near shopping and I can only guess that they meant PDC? Which is a $14usd cab ride away. There are shuttles but they don't start till noon and the ones returning after 5 are $3usd per person. There were tables set up every other nite near the lobby with a variety of things for sale. You could barter but it was the same old, same old stuff that I've seen everytime I've been to Mexico. On a good note, no one approched us about time shares. So, all in all it was a very nice trip. Especially when it's -20 at home but I don't think I'd stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Xtina272
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 last March and loved it. The only thing was, we seemed to be the only couple in our age group. 25-30. The disco opened at 11pm and every night we were the only couple in there along with some of the staff. It was cool cuz they would play all the songs I requested. The shows were great and the staff was too. We took a day trip to Isla Mujeres, that was a blast. This was a very nice hotel w/ beautiful grounds, good drinks, good food (I liked the Japanese restaurant)

Reviews.Title: “Top Service Excellent Food and Value”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca2007HoustonTx
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great time, I met my boy friend from Toronto at the Hotel as I'm from Houston TX. we had one of the greatest romantic moments anyone could experience, he organized a Mariochi band that just happened to be visiting the hotel to sing in front of our room and proposed!!!! The staff was extremely cooperative and kind. The food was exceptional and sevice is fantastic. Negatives: Beware of Monica of guest services who will try and CON you into a Welcome breakfast, she is a slick sneaky lying person that will pretent to like you and be very charming but will try and hook you out of a dollar. She plays a little game where she tries to tell the man what to do to take control of the interview and suck you into a time share waste of time...This is right after her asking if you were solicited at the airport to make her pitch FREE OF TRICKERY. I told her not to speak to us again and filed a complaint. Some of the staff also like to have a little side line going where they try and invite you on their own time just to make a buck off of you.....I'm sending a few letters of complaint until I hear a response from someone in authority.....Other than that incident, we had a wonderful romantic time and accepted his proposal for marriage!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value Im on my second last day here and love it”
Reviews.Author: JasonTorontoOn_
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to any of the previous negative commets none of them are true I'm currently here and don't see any of the BS people have written I'm in the legal prof and I'm impartial. Please contact me for any infor...Excellent value for the money ..great hotel close to shopping. the best staff in the world ...featuring Mr. Francesco Jorje mgr. fabio guest services David in main dining area karla front desk oskar front desk manny in spa lobby bar nora and all of them are great...beach is ok..bring a bath matt floors are marble spa is excellent food great security excellent pool is great excellent kids program Best Deal in Mexico...excellent rooms very clean...very organized...they have Monica that will asign a "time share person" to speak with you try to avoid that waste of time...Don't come here looking for a 5 or 6 star hotel...again entertainment is great ...incredible value..I'll be back in March..08

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, management is lacking”
Reviews.Author: mexicobound1888
Reviews.Content: We just returned from H10 Hacienda Maya, our visit was a short family get away from Nov. 23-27. We had stayed at this property 2 years ago when it was El Mandarian, the property is in a good location and we decided to give the new management a try. We used Lomas for transporation and where very happy they where on time and we had very little wait before they took us to the resort. We did arrive about noon so we knew that we would not be able to get into our room, however we did not expect to stand in line for 2 hours before we even started the checkin procedure. There was only 6 people in line before us so this was rather frustrating. We did our check in finally and when we where done it was already 2:30, still they would not let us go to our room. We checked back in after lunch at 3:30 and our room was still not ready until by husband produced a $20.00 bill, then our room became available. We where given a room number and a map, where we quickly discovered that we were not in one of the villas they advertisted, we where in Building B (all these units are a three digit room number) building B is essential a Cheap Motel type building. We decided to make the best of it and check out the rooms, we where to have 1 room with 1 bed and 1 room with 2 beds, both rooms you guessed it had 1 bed. We went back to stand in line a the front desk to request the rooms we had reserved (we noticed several people in line doing the same thing) After being in line for another hour we where told to go to guest services, we stood in line there for 15 minutes or so and where told we are sorry we will try and fix it by tomorrow come back to the front desk at 1 pm tomorrow. We went on with the rest of our day and hung out at the beach which is very nice and decided to make the best of it. We headed back to our rooms to get ready for dinner, the boys (teenagers) where looking forward to the buffet and it had been a long day. We went back tried to turn on our TV (a small 13 inch ) and got nothing but static, we decided not a big deal the TV worked in the other room so we could catch the news and weather there. We headed to the buffet and when we walked outside there where no outside lights at all on this building which made the narrow staircase very dangerous. We went to guest services again and requested some lights it was handled immediatley. Things are looking up. We decided to have some before dinner drinks and they where awful, I tried the 4 or 5 drinks I normally will drink and none of them where good. We decided to stick with beer, it was Corona so we figured it was safe, the second day the beer was extremely stale and had a strange smell to it. We gave up on drinks and stuck with non alchol options, they where good. The buffet was very good, lots to choose from, the food was presented very well and was all at the correct temp. The second day we decided was a beach day, we had no problems at all securing chairs at 10:30 am and enjoyed the sun and water. The boys decided to try Parasailing and had a great time. We ate lunch at the snack bar, the food was not good at all, after that we started having stomach issues, took some pepto and things got better. We went to the front to try and get the right rooms, we arrived at 1:00 as we where told and a bus was arriving at the same time. Guest services did come over so we didn't have to spend several more hours in line and said sorry we can't change the rooms today either maybe tommorrow, check again tomorrow. We decided at this point we would live with what we had and enjoy our stay, which we did. Highlights of the trip, the water activites crew is great. The Japanese place is wonderful, although a little slow as far as getting drinks and there is not much of a chance of getting your coke refilled. The beach has beautiful white powdery sand and lots of chairs. Themanagement in the main dining room does a wonderful job. The downside, the front desk is extremely unorganized, not helpful whatsoever, and very unfriendly. The management is completley lacking and unaware of anything happening on their property and are unwilling to help fix any situation. They simple call the front desk the front desk says no and that is that. The resort was not at capacity so I'm not sure what the problem was. Their alacarte Mexican rest. has allot of work to do. It took 4 of us 2.5 hours to eat a four course meal. The food is already precooked and in steam tables with the exception of the meat for fajitas and so forth that is grilled right there. Our appetizer order was not correct but we gave them a try anyway and they where pretty good. The salads had watered down dressing and set under a heat lamp for 20 mintues before they where delievered. The main course, which everyone had ordered fajitas was not very good, no one ate even half. We did order dessert and 2 of the four items where correct, again it was just okay. Don't make the mistake of going to their welcome breakfast, it is a timeshare pitch and it is very hardsale. After 1.5 hours the sales ladie's manager came out and asked why we wouldn't buy, we told him we didn't feel the product was worth the money he them threw in "the bribes" which was free weeks at the resort, we said that we didn' really like the resort enough to want to come back, his exact words where "that is good, we really don't like repeat visitors because we have already pitched our product, we like to have new people come in" Then the hardsale started all over again, we got up and walked out. Those words he said fits the management and front desk attitude toward their guest, it all made since at that point.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: debdun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort when it was called the El Manderian.......that was three years ago.Pre hurrican Wilma.The only thig that has changed here is the beach.It now has a wall but it is very nice.We went with three other couples and we all had a problem with our rooms but nothing serious and it was fixed right away.The food was good and the service was good....all we can say is tip and you will get great service. We were a group so there is advantages to that when it comes to going on some tours you can get a private van and you also save money.We booked two tours Xhelha all inclusive and the Chitzanecha tour and we got a day shopping in Cancun they take you to three differnt places to shop and a tour of Cancun it was fun.So if you go as a group of eight or more its great.If you get Gregario as one of you drivers say hello from Deb,AL,Peter Audrey,Jack and Colleen,Delvin and Helen he was lots of fun, he remembers everyones name. All the extra resturaunts were good.The Japanese resturaunt were they cook on the grill is the better one.And the Mexican resturaunt by the pool was good also.Make sure you have the special coffee after dinner there it is worth watching as well a drinking. Just remember that you are in Mexico so slow down and relax you will have fun.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: jesssean
Reviews.Content: we just got back from mexico yesterday. we had a wonderful trip. we stayed at hacienda h10. the hotel was nice, it was medium sized, not huge. the a la carte japanese restaurant was fabulous, make sure you choose to have the chef cook infront of you, very fun. the beach was beautiful, not very busy when we went. infact we got the same 2 lounge chairs in the same area everyday. 2 complains, the bed was horrible and the noise from people closing their doors was pretty loud. other than that i felt very safe there, the staff were absolutely soooo friendly. the lounge area where the front desk is located was beautiful and huge. lots of room to just sit and people watch. be prepared to eat dinner at 7pm and on. no restaurants serve prior to this. there was a specialty coffee area, where you could have an espresso or capuccino as many times as you would like. i would have about 3 capuccinos everyday. the food was pretty good. the rooms were average, but clean. this hotel was good at leaving lots of shampoos/soaps/handcream/and liquid soap. no discos so not much fun for younger folk who want to party. at nights there would be markets set up so you can purchase mexican stuff, there was music, there was usually an animal or reptile you could take pics with ie, donkey, monkey, parrots, snake. there was a show usually at around 945 with performers either dancing or lip singing. not that great but a good way to waste time. remember to try the drink cabana (if you drink alcohol) and conga (non alcoholic version) very yummy. also lime margareta is good as well. pina colada not so good, i have had better. . i would go back to this hotel. make sure you do the "extreme shopping" tour. men it sounds blah, but was awesome. it was $38 us dollars but we got to see downtown cancun, which is stunning. if we had taken a cab it would have cost us double if not triple, and if we had taken a bus it would have taken us forever to get there. it stops at an outdoor flea market, where you can purchase mexican stuff, also goes to a nice outlet and a mall, you are taken to senor frogs for lunch (yoiu pay for this). the guide havier was so informative which made the tour even better. each stop is for about 1 hour. so you are not at the stores very long. i would highly recommend this inexpensive tour, other tours are about 90 dollars us and up. take good walking shoes if you plan on doing the sites. you will need them. make sure you visit playa del carmen 5th avenue it is an awesome tourist spot with lots of hotels, restaurants, shopping. very nice. we went to the walmart there which is about a 5 or 10 minute walk away from 5th avenue. that was an interesting experience. just to look around. it was very neat. we went to coba, it was great. besides looking at ruins, you got to walk thru the homes of 2 mayan villagers, it was very interesting to see how they live. if you do go make sure you take alot of your excess hotel shampoos and stuff for them. they love this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: alan49TX
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. The room was your basic room, but no problems. Ocean was amazing, pools were great, staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Entertainment Crew Go the Extra Mile!”
Reviews.Author: Jackpotjo
Reviews.Content: Visited the resort from Oct. 1st through the 6th - 2007. This was my second visit in two years. At that time it was called the El Mandrian I believe. The rooms were clean, the beds were actually comfortable and the air was cold - 2nd floor has best views. No bugs. The check-in was easy and everyone was extremely accommodating. If you needed something, housekeeping was there with it right away. We arrived on Monday and everything was pretty quite and not too many people, however by Thursday evening more people started to arrive. My only compliant was that the food was on the sub-standard side until later in the week and it started to get better. When I was there two years ago - the food was excellent the entire time. The kids that do the shows each night are really great entertainers and dancers. We had alot of fun with them. Took the free shuttle to Playa del Carmen to show my friend the shops and had lunch. On another day back to Playa to take the (30-40 minute) ferry to Cozumel - rented a car there and drove to the other side which is wild and beautiful and hotel-free. On the last day we rented a car at the hotel and drove to the ruins in Tulum. It's easy driving and take about 45-60 minutes...$2.00 to park your car and $2.00 for a round trip tractor shuttle to the ruins - $4.50 for entrance. Took my suit this time and went for a swim. I sincerely believe this is one of the most beautiful places on earth... This is cheaper than buying an excursion and you can come and go when you want. Also, the hotel had great cappuccinos - drank them non-stop! The pool is beautiful, and so is the beach and all in all I would say this hotel is a very nice and relaxing place to stay. Jo Ann McInerney - Jefferson City, Missouri

Reviews.Title: “all things considered a nice time”
Reviews.Author: callie924
Reviews.Content: we went to the hacienda maya during the off season, because of this the hotel was mostly empty. In some respects this was nice because we had the whole beach and pool to ourselves. on the other hand all the ala carte restaurants were closed because the hotel was empty, this left us with the buffet for every meal during the entire trip. while the food wasnt terrible, it did get redundant. the beach was ok it wasnt the nicest i have seen, i think the beaches in cancun are a bit nicer. the sand was really nice the water, because of a recent hurricane, was at times murkey and there was sea weed that washes up on shore. the pools were really nice and very very clean. there were built in lounges made of tile with spa jets in them to give a relaxing massage experience. the staff was really nice low key and friendly. the rooms were extremely clean and more than adequate. every night the staff of the hotel made efforts to provide entertainment again because the hotel was mostly empty it lacked some excitment. the grounds of the hotel were kept immaculate not a paper or cigarette butt to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bedo_14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 14 days, from July 20 to August 3. It was the best 2 weeks of our lives. Resort was VERY clean, you would see people cleaning throughout the whole day. The food was very good and we never ate the same thing twice during those 14 days (ice creams are to die for). I believe the resort had turned into a 5 Star resort when we got there. The resort itself is amazing with all the trees and plants, it was truly paradise. The people who reviewed that the beach was horrible should have walked along the coast, because we did and we concluded that we had the best beach on the coast, the other hotel's beaches were absolutely horrible especially the one next to the pier, poor people could not even swim, water was to their knees. The only thing with ours was that there were SOME rocks and it was not very clear, that is all. Service was AMAZING, 5 star service! One night at 2am our A/C broke down and we called front desk thinking that we would not get anyone to fix it until next morning. To our surprise after hanging up the phone with front desk, 2 minutes later the technician came. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The buffet had reasonable number of workers, every time you put a plate on the side when you finished someone would quickly come and take them away and ask you what else you would like to drink. Also every night there was a show in the theater followed by a band outside the lobby. Very good entertainment. During the day, activities were organized almost every hour. You can also feel safe since there is always security with the cleaning people so they could not steal anything, not that they would. Also you would find security at every corner which makes you feel very safe. All and all, we have been to other places in Cancun but would rate this resort as the best!

Reviews.Title: “Relax, you're on vacation”
Reviews.Author: HunnyM00n
Reviews.Content: That's the best advice we read, and that's exactly what we did! We stayed at this resort from the 14th of July to the 21st for our honeymoon. Honestly, if you like to be pampered and served, this isn't the place for you. This resort was perfect for us tho, because we love to make ourselves at home, and that's exactly what we did. This resort was paradise! The food was beautiful and perfect each and every day. We had absolutely no complaints about this resort. It was heaven on earth. Advice for people staying here would be to avoid the desks at the right back of the lobby, going outside through to the villas. This is where the time share people sit, and yes, they will hound you for your entire holiday if you don't go to their "complimentary breakfast", which will turn into a lenghthy spiel. Also, if you visit Playa Del Carmen and don't like to barter with shopkeepers, head to the very end of 5th street and go to the Mexican outlet. The prices are reasonable, and no haggling involved. If you love to snorkel, go visit Jorge in The Dive Shop right at the resort! For a small fee, they take you to a beautiful reef right close to the resort! It's awesome fun! All in all, our honeymoon was perfect, and still going strong, thanks to a wonderful beginning at this Resort!

Reviews.Title: “H10 Staff disappointing & upsetting”
Reviews.Author: smiley120
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the begining of July 2007. The service staff was horrible. Dinner tables were unavailable whenever we went to eat and we had to stand at tables waiting for them to be cleared or clearing them ourselves by stacking dishes onto other unclean tables. I had to call 2 times to get clean towels that took 3 hours to get. Our air conditioning broke down in our room and had to be fixed...took at least 2 hours for someone to take a look. Nothing but 2 bottles of water in the small fridge that didnt work properly and water bottles were not replaced daily. We were told by our concierge Monika that she wanted to book us a special VIP welcome breakfast so that the staff could go over the facilities with us and show us around and would tell us how we could come back again for a better price next time...yah right!!! The VIP breakfast was the same as our regular breakfast. In the same place with the same buffet but with a stranger that was trying to sell us a "MEMBERSHIP" to there establishment.
