It was $ 45,000.00 for a membership and we were sapposed to get points to use every yr. It sounded more like a time share! She didnt give us a tour but showed us a room that could be offered for use for members...then we were taken into a special room with tables and a bar and given a drink of our choice (with extra alcohol-extremely strong) and harassed until I told the lady that we were mislead about the meeting and I was not happy and wanted to leave. This whole ordeal lasted over 2 hours and in return were given a 25 minute massage. It was not worth it ! This ruined my mood and the way I felt about the hotel. It was deceiving and we were told only 1 hour of our time was needed it ended up being 2 hours and when the sales lady saw us in the hallways she gave us dirty looks. I let the conceirge Monika know that we were upset but I dont think it really made a difference. You don't expect the hotel to set you up for something like this when they warn you about people selling time shares. I dont think anyone should be harassed and set up like this by the hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to friends or family. Upset and disappointed, Vicky Sra

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: SandraGerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from June 30th to July th 2007 for our honeymoon, which we got a king size bed nicely arranged, fruits and a bottle of Spumante...and we both loved our vacation! Everyone was SO nice the place is beautifuly decorated with nice flowers everywhere. The food was very good also. The only thing is if you are going there cause you love the beach you will be disappointed. The beach is not very nice, the color is brownish and there are many rocks. If you walk along the beach for about 10 minutes you'll find nice water but still many rocks. If you want beautiful beaches that are secluded and you can swim in them, go to Cozumel. We rented a Jeep for the day and went around the whole island. And if you do go to Cozumel you have to go to the restaurant Carlo's & Charlies...you will LOVE it there..it's so fun!! But overall, we loved our trip, we had a blast and met a lot of nice people. It's very family oriented and not a 'party' place if that's what you looking for. It's perfect for families, friends and honeymooners :-)

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe & awful!!! I wouldn't go back if it was free!!!! It was absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: jspair
Reviews.Content: On my last night, I was in the lobby and witnessed an altercation between an American man and a local (who was a contractor for the H10). The local stabbed the US man in the side! Hotel security did not take the knife away from the worker nor did they call police or an ambulance. It wasn't until the next morning that they called an ambulance for the American and by that time, the H10 worker had already checked out. Another night I was leaving my room and I noticed there was no running water. When I arrived in the lobby, there was water leaking from the ceiling and light fixtures. This could have caused a major electrical fire and there did a poor job of roping off unsafe areas. Another night my electricity went off and when it went back on, the TV would not go back on. We had to have someone come fix that. There is a major language barrier and if you are not fluent in Spanish, no one tries to even understand what you are asking. They say that there are 4 restaurants but only the buffet is open daily and the others rotate days and reservations are required for all of them. Also, the Brazilian restaurant is not included and it is $30 US per person. Room Service is pizza only which is not inclusive and don’t even ask for something to drink because you cant get it. There is no ice available for your room either. There is barely any wait staff and they are in no hurry to assist you. They must not like to get tips because none of them went out of their way to even attempt to earn a tip. Then when I did tip them, they didn’t even say thank you! There are a lot of bugs that will wind up in your room if you don’t close the door right behind you. You will also see hundreds of lizards and blue crabs as your walking through the resort. Be careful, the little lizards will crawl right under the door. I lined a towel by the bottom of the door every night and slept with cotton in my ears. I have never camped in my life but I felt like I was camping while staying at this resort. Their so-called "Disco" is a closet in the basement. The one night I did attend for a short while, I was followed into the women’s bathroom by a local (a Mexican Elvis wanna-be, whom was also a contractor for the H10 and was with the other local who stabbed the American man). There is not much to do at this resort There was a kids pool and then a separate pool which had a swim up bar. I do not feel that children should be allowed in a pool where there is a bar with adults drinking and smoking. No one said anything to the people who had their children in this "ADULT" pool. The weekend seemed to get more crowded with locals and a massive amount of children. This must be a luxury vacation for them to get away from their normal conditions but it is definitely not for an American who has traveled to several parts of Mexico and had much better experiences! The rooms were just OK! The beds were like cardboard boxes. The liquor was just awful. They only offered domestic liquor and if you wanted domestic, there was an additional fee. Good thing I bought a bottle of Vodka in the airport on my way. That was the only thing I drank because everything they had to offer tasted like rubbing alcohol. Their tropical drinks were even awful. The only good thing I have to say about this hotel is about two of the activities directors. Nelson and Johan spoke very good English and were very friendly and outgoing. Spend a little more money and stay somewhere else. This trip was the biggest waste of my money! I would NEVER go back nor would I recommend it to anyone else. If you don’t expect much, like bad food & drinks, rude staff and no customer service than this is the place for you. I would rate this hotel a 1.5 star at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Surprizing AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: frank9999
Reviews.Content: Arrived back from the H10 3 weeks ago and let me say I was truly amazed and impressed with this resort. I read a lot of mixed reviews all over the internet regarding the H10 (you have to do your homework people) but for the price I thought it was worth a try. Well let me tell you... it was AWESOME. I'm an experienced traveller being down south to many different destinations many a time. I generally stay at 4 Star resorts as I have found spending the few extra dollars will help assure you will have a better stay. You do get what you pay for most times in life after all. Anyway this resort, although not perfect, did meet or exceed our expectations in every way. I was surprised at how well the holiday went. Too smooth almost. I've heard the horror stories about Mexico but definately not here! the Mayan is a beautiful region. The weather was sunny and 85 every day with a cool breeze blowing in off the Sea just enough to keep you from sweating. The food was well prepared with plenty variety. The beach was beautiful. Rocky in the water in front of the resort but if you go down the beach to just past the peir where they are building new resorts, you will find the perfect beach with no rocks in the water. It was like we had our own private beach. Very safe on the beach as people stroll by occationally as well as soldiers and security guards. Just enough to feel safe not threatened. The grounds are immaculate. 2 pools which are well kept. The a la cartes were good but not 5 star. The service was good and the workers friendly. It only about a half hour fronm the Cancun airport and a twenty minute shuttle ride to Playa Del Carmen which is a must see. Especially 5th Ave. The construction at the neighbouring resort was at a minimum and didn't distract us at all. The rooms were well kept. Very clean. The a/c worked great all week although I believe I found out why people were having problems. The remote MUST be set on 77 to control the a/c. Any other # and the remote doesn't do anything. I would go back in a heart beat or stay a second week no problem. All in all a fantastic time. You can e-mail me for more info. Till then, chill out and enjoy. You are on holidays...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful staff, good food”
Reviews.Author: COpirates
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a week at the H10 Hacienda Maya (June 12-19). This was our first visit to the Riviera Maya area. Some reviews on this site have been critical of this resort, so we were interested to see things for ourselves. We traveled with two kids, ages 6 and 10. Our overall experience was wonderful. All the staff were extremely professional, warm, and friendly. When we were checking in, the bartender of the lobby bar brought cold punch to all of us (a nice touch). The resort is beautiful and the pool area is great - two very nice pools. We visited during the off season, so the resort was only about 50 percent occupied. The weekends are more crowded with local folks who drive in from Merida and Cancun. But even at the busy times there were plenty of pool and beach chairs and it was relatively easy to get service from the bar or dine at the restaurant. At the advice of our tour guide (TNT tours - they work with BestDay in Mexico), we booked our Xel ha excursion on Saturday to avoid one of the crowded weekend days at the resort - this worked very well. We booked the combined Xel ha/Tulum trip, but the kids were having so much fun in Xel ha that we didn't get on the bus for the Tulum portion (the tour guide made it clear that this was an option - I think many folks do the same). We could have saved a few dollars by booking the Xel ha-only tour. We took the free resort shuttle to Playa several times to shop and visit the beach. This worked very well - the Magic Tours drivers and staff were very helpful and professional. All of our shuttle transport was very punctual - they only wait a few minutes, so don't be late for the stated pick up time or you will likely be left behind. We found the food to be very good at the resort - there are many choices at every meal including fresh fruits and vegetables. The desserts were very good. Our only culinary disappointment was with the El Charro Mexican restaurant - the food took a very long time to come and was not anything special. We really enjoyed sitting at the grill at the Japanese restaurant - the kids said many times that it was their favorite meal. We really enjoyed eating at the poolside buffet for breakfast and lunch - not as many choices as in the main lobby, but a very nice setting. The beach is not as nice as some - you should wear water shoes to avoid rocks and other stuff in the surf. The wind and tides were not favorable for swimming while we were there - the lifeguards said that there were jelly fish in the water, but we didn't actually see any. On one of the calm days we took a short snorkel trip with the Dive shop that was very good. The off-shore reef is great and we saw a lot of fish. The dive staff was great - especially with the kids. One thing that puzzled us at the resort was the morning wake-up visits from the cleaning staff. They would knock on the door between 8 and 8:30 and actually open the door if you didn't answer right away. Then they would just say "hola" and walk away. Not really sure what that was all about. I suggest that you bring a rubber door stop to stuff under the door to discourage the staff from coming in the room (the deadbolts don't slow them down a bit). I pushed my swim fin under the door. We never asked the front desk staff about this because it wasn't really a problem for us (we were always up and just about to head off anyway). Also - note that the beds are very firm - we almost wished we had brought a camping mattress or foam pad along. Also there are no extra pillows in the rooms. Our A/C was off for a little while one afternoon, but maintenance staff was working on it even before we reported it (some kind of power problem). We had a great (and reasonably priced) vacation and would definitely consider returning although we usually like to explore new places every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bigavsfan23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 day stay at the H10, from May 25-June 1. Overall, we had a great trip. This is our second time to this resort. We were there last year at the same time (we had a voucher for a free stay due to the construction last year). Much better stay this time, they have done a lot of improvements to the property. The rooms were clean and and the air conditioning worked great. The food was good, and the staff was friendly. We had no complaints at all. The dive shop was great. We went on four dives total, great coral reefs and a lot of fish to see. The staff was friendly and knew what they were doing. I am a new diver, and wanted to try a dive in Cozomel. They actually felt that I needed more experience. Good for them, they did not pressure me to take the more expensive trip. They were more interested in my safety than money. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A top tier all-inclusive at a great price”
Reviews.Author: dogg2gs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a Memorial Day romantic getaway to the H10 Hacienda Maya. Having taken several day trips to Tulum, Xel-Ha, and Delphinus that involved picking and dropping people at other hotels, I can honestly say the Hacienda Maya is one of the best, esp. given the price for the quality. I talked with several people staying at other hotels (including Secrets next door), and can see no advantage that these places have over the Hacienda Maya. However, you need to evaluate the pluses and minuses for yourself: + The Japanese restaurant really is that good. One section is Benihana-esque and the other is a sushi bar. Both are good, although we liked the sushi bar better. + The activities are great, especially if you are an active person. There are yoga classes on the beach, water polo, volleyball, dance lessons, tennis, free scuba lessons in the pool, kayaks and catamarans. The fitness center was ok, good weights, but the treadmills/ellipticals are mid-grade. As with most Cancun area resorts, the jacuzzi was not hot, just jets. Of those I talked to, no other resort seemed to have so many activities. + There are two nice sized pools, one with the great jet chairs and another more for kids and activities. The bar service at the pool is great during the week. Even on the busy weekend, we never had more than a few minute wait for a drink. Although not top shelf, there is a great selection from mojitos to daiquiris. + The staff is hard-working and respond quickly. Cleaning staff is constantly working. The front desk service was good, although sometimes you have to wait, esp. in the mornings and at dusk. + Fast and free wi-fi access (however only works in the lobby/bar area, not the rooms). Bring your laptop to avoid Internet fees. - The food at the buffet was just ok (I can see why others have written poorly of it), as it needs more flavor. It is something that may be a deal breaker for some. For the best food, eat early and stick to the food made on-the-spot, like the omelets, pastas and roasted chicken. - The restaurant reservation system is a little too bureaucratic, esp. in peak times (early evenings) when lines form. Be sure to make all your reservations on day one, as same day reservations are impossible to get. It would be more efficient if they could computerize the process. Also, even though reservations were required, one night at El Charro 10 people showed up at the same time and they did not have the staff to adequately wait on everyone right away. - On the weekend it gets significantly busier and seems to be a popular place for vacationing Mexicans. During the week, it seems to be mostly tourists from America and Europe, often a good mix of younger couples and older couples, with fewer families. I just think you should be warned to expect many more people on the weekend (great time for a day trip somewhere). - We had new water bottles in our room fridge each day. Although no alcohol, so if you want to drink in your room with a stocked minibar, this may not be the place for you. Overall, we had a great time. Reading other reviews, it appears the key is to pick your time to go. If you go at peak travel times, the service does slow. However, we never had a problem and would definitely recommend this as a top tier place that can save you money for some fun day trips.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: jen1110
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from 8 nights at the H-10, the week before leaving I almost changed our hotel to another one we were familiar with and should have done it. Now, we must tell you we have been to Mexico many times and are the kind of people who don't complain and get along just about anywhere, but this trip was by far the trip from %^^&. The resort should be rated a 2 1/2 star at best. Good; the resort grounds are well kept, the maids were great. Bad; The room we were assigned had a cracked sink when we arrived, but again not wanting to complain and thinking that it had been repaired from underneath we just let it go, on the second day we had been at the beach, came back in and put my swim suit in the sink, went in laid down, got up walked into the bathroom only to find my self promptly being flipped to the ground, anytime thoes floors are wet they are very slick, the sink had broken and all the water had drained on the floor and my feet were out from underneath me, I flipped around backwards reaching for the sink, hit my back and made a 4" gash on my rib cage bruising my ribs along with a broken blood vessel on the ankle a torn mussle and hit my head, thank god for my cosmetic case that was on the floor. Had it not been there I would have hit my head directly on the hard floor. We went to the front desk to complain, they gave us the utmost attention and said they had never had any complaints of the sink being broken, which we find hard to believe because it was old cracks and had been that way for awhile, the said that a doctor should see me, we went to eat as they called the doctor, but no doctor ever came, a beach paramedic, who was very nice and many hotel staff members, the paramedic said we should see the doctor, after going to our room to see just how bad the crack was and relaizing it had been that way for some time and they screwed up, they called the doctor and came to tell us we would have to pay the 80.00 usd to the doctor to have him look me over. OK, this was the last boiling point for my husband, the resorts mistake and they would not even pick up the cost. Long story short, we told them to heck with them I would see a doctor in the states if I felt I needed one when I got home. They did move us to the room above us, which was better but guess what the sink also had a smaller crack! The beds seriously are only a box spring, no mattress. Now we all know that the beds are usually hard in Mexico but sleeping on these beds is like sticking something hard into all parts of your body all night. The food; ok, it appeared to be nearly all left overs each night, very bad food. the only good was the special mexican food at the beach area on only certain nights. If you stuck with salads all the time you would be ok, except the fact that many nights they had all the salad dressings but no lettuce or greens. The beach, we had picked this hotel because of the reviews of the nice beach and we do understand they have been through a hurricane, just make sure you bring your water shoes, very rocky getting into the water and many days mostly dirty water. Be aware, the resort does not let you charge anything to your room, other than laundry, the shops want you to pay cash, some credit cards but it seemed like everytime we turned around they wanted cash for this and cash for that. Much of our cash went to the resort which was a bummer because you don't plan on that and it puts you short when out and about. the internet police watch you and tap you on the shoulder when your at 2 minutes left on you internet, $4.00 everytime you walk in there for 15 minutes and it better be CASHusd. I would never reccommend this resort, I heard many people complaining it wasn't just us. Beilieve me there was some bad experiences for other people, I understand I can not report on certain events at a resort, so I will not, lets just say, it wasn't good. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere. I spoke to many people from the Ibeostar resorts who had a great time and couldn't say enough about their trips. Apple vacations should remove this resort from there list or list it properly at a 2 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “A fun and exciting stay!”
Reviews.Author: abequest
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just arrived home from our 6 day stay at the H10 resort. I was really worried before leaving because we had read so many bad reviews but now I realize that people are just really picky and I had a great time! The hotel is situated on the beach and there are plenty of huts to sit under and relax. There are a lot of seats around the pool and fun music to listen to. The staff was always very polite and cheerful. The food in the japanese restaurant and mexican restaurant was wonderful! There is another specialty restaurant but you have to pay 30 USD to eat there per person and nobody we talked to had so we didn't think it was worth it. Instead we spent the 30 apiece to go snorkeling. There is a diving and snorkeling center on the beach that is run through the hotel and they take you for a 5 minute boat ride to a beautiful reef. I have never seen so many beautiful and colorful fish. I've been snorkeling several times and this was the most beautiful. The entertainment at the hotel is great. Every night they have a show and usually a contest so some audience members can win some prizes, we were some of them that won. The entertainment crew is busy all day providing activities for kids and adults around the pool and beach. There is a large list of things to do everyday if you are interested. We joined in water aerobics twice and it was really great. Dancing lessons were fun, too, and we had something to show our families when we got back. The whole grounds of the hotel is absolutely gorgeous. There are flowers everywhere. We took so many pictures. There were bugs and I got a few really itchy bites and so did a few other people we talked to but my boyfriend didn't have any. A little bug repellent would help that. Although I had a really really great time, there were some downers. The first one was that there are only two bars, the lobby bar and the pool bar. During the day there was always a really long line at the pool bar. An extra bar over there would have been really nice. Also, the buffet restaurant which is where we ate when not at the specialty restaurants was not so great. It offered the same things every day and I didn't like much of it. My boyfriend eats everything and he didn't care for much. Also, I felt that the advertisements for the hotel were misleading when they said snorkeling was included in the price. I have stayed at many other hotels and they all mean snorkeling where they take you on a boat to a reef but this hotel means they will give you a snorkel and mask so you can swim around the beach area. We had to pay 30 USD to go snorkeling on the reef. It was worth it but still we felt misled. Also, the sand in the water was a little rocky close to the shore but then got pretty mucky going farther into the water. I really think this is due to the hurricanes a few years ago breaking up all the ground. All in all, it was a wonderful stay and I'd encourage people to stay there. We had a really nice memorable trip! Don't listen to all of those other bad reviews! It was great!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MJLee
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time at the H10 hacienda. We stayed from May 11-19, 2007. I was a little worried before arriving at the resort because of the bad reviews I had read. But honestly, those reviews were not accurate. Our stay was wonderful. Flight: We flew with skyservice. Their food has gotten worse but no one flies for the food. The movies there and back were good (dreamgirls and music & lyrics). On time and smooth flight. Cancun airport: Baggage was quick. **Make sure to walk straight past the people in the airport who are offering different tour specials**. They will attract you by asking which tour agent you're with and asking if you're looking for the bus to the resort. Don't listen to them unless you want to buy a tour package (I suggest just to wait until you get to the hotel). The buses to the resort are outside of the airport. Reception: Very quick and efficient. check out is 12pm and check in is 3pm. Bottled water is available here not at the bar. Very nice lobby. Book for the la carte restaurants and shuttle to playa del carmen near the tour agents. Safe keys available for 2 dollars a night. Rooms: Wonderfully large. With king bed, fridge, couch, nice shower. Very good water pressure, always had hot water. Did experience some black outs. Some were on and off, once it was off for 5 hours. Bring bug spray just in case. I brought raid because another review said some rooms had mosqitoes. Our room did and we were thankful for the raid. Leave the maid 2 dollars a day or so instead of a large sum at the end of the week (different men and women clean the rooms each day). They don't provide face cloths so bring some. It rained really hard one night and the water came through the door so if it rains make sure to put a towel at the bottom of the door. Resort grounds: Great, always clean. Lots of iguanas and lizards and crabs. Well kept flowers and plants. Pools: Huge pools. The pool bar is usually abandoned by the bartender. Easier just to get out and get a drink at the other side of the bar. Beach: We got up early to reserve palapas (830am). During the weekend it gets really busy. You can walk forever on the beach, the said is so soft. The water is very calm with bigger waves in the afternoon. If you want, bring water shoes because there are a lot of small sharp rocks when entering the water. Lots of fish, you can feed them bananas or bread. Check out the dock as well, lots of fish at night. Nice fabric lounge chairs so your bottoms don't go numb. Food: great food, always something to eat. The buffets were excellent, great omelettes in the morning. EXCELLENT guacomole! The japanese restaurant was ok, very salty at times. If we go back I'd stick to the buffets. We didn't get to try the mexican restaurant because of the blackout. Corona on tap. Not many waiters so you can get your own beer, wine or pop which is fine. Coffee and espresso at the lobby bar. Try the sangria. Entertainment: ok. not a lot of people attend. the band that plays outside the lobby everyday is great. nice to sit and relax with a cup of coffee or a magarita. People come to sell different things on tuesday, thursdays and saturdays. Make sure to bargain. Excursions: we went on the coba trip. The best trip i've ever been on. We climbed the pyramid first, looks intimidating at first but its fine. They then take you to a cenote where you swim for half an hour in beautiful clear fresh water. Very refreshing. And the highlight of our trip was the mayan village where you meet a 95 year old mayan lady and learn about her lifestyle. Make sure to book with the tour agent that offers the shuttle to playa del carmen(sits at the desk next to the dinner reservation guy). They offer better prices then your travel agent & a GREAT tour guide. Also visit Playa del carmen. lots of shopping, great lobster restaurants and beautiful beach. The hotel offers a number of shuttle times for free. Other advice: the internet is very expensive at the resort (14$ US for one hour). Go to the city, its 10 pesos (1 US dollar for 30 min). Bring bug spray and large travel mugs. Bring a flashlight if you want (there may be a few blackouts). Overall we had a great time. We would definitely go back. We stayed at the Catalonia Yucatan our second week and we prefer the H10.

Reviews.Title: “When it seems too good to be true, it usually is!”
Reviews.Author: HolaCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Mayan Riviera and after researching hotels extensively we thought that for the price this deal was too good to be true. Unfortunately that turned out to be the case. I will list the good points first for those who want to be convinced that this is the place where they want to stay and then the bad. 1.The grounds and pools are beautiful. Well manicured, clean, lovely flowers, iguanas. The beach is also wide with lots of palapas. There was no reason to “reserve” your beach chair with towels etc. unless you were very picky about where you wanted to be. There is a small retaining wall about 18 inches high that separates the actual water from the area where the chairs are so that the seaweed that everyone talks about doesn’t get washed up into the sitting area. The beach heading south toward Playa goes on for miles if you like long walks on the beach. 2.The food. Even though there is only one restaurant the selection was very good. There are at least 16 stations with an assortment of food from hamburgers, salads, soups, meats, vegetables, pasta, to Mexican and American specialties every day. The pasta or dessert tables were incredible. The restaurant is open almost all day and late into the night. The Mexican restaurant, by the beach is also open for breakfast and lunch and by reservation at night but their selection is limited. We tried the Japanese restaurant twice, but actually preferred the Mexican which was much more intimate (although the way the shrimp was cooked was not for me, unless you enjoy raw bacon I would try something else) but the chicken was terrific. The waiters prepared a great Mayan Coffee and even performed a Mayan sacrifice which was hilarious. We found that the cooks at the Japanese tappan grill used too much oil in preparation of the vegetables but the meats were delicious. 3.The room itself was spacious (but more about that later) and Emilio did a great job of making our stay as comfortable as he could. Loved the flower and animal arrangements. 4.If you went to the desk right after breakfast you could book a free bus ride to Playa and back , for the same day or the next day. We took advantage of this many times. Visit Walmart or the Mexican version of Walmart for cheap tequila or vanilla. Pure vanilla extract in Walmart was 15 pesos for 500mls. If you are CANADIAN and taking a direct flight, you CAN carry liquids through security in your hand luggage. No thanks to the Nolitours reps, one who said that you could, the other said that you couldn’t. NOW THE BAD 1.The front desk staff will go out of their way to avoid helping you with your problems. Their solution to any problem is to tell you to come back later. When you do, you will once again wait another half hour for assistance, and have to explain the whole story again to someone else, who usually contradicts what you have been told by the first person you talked to. They have a little book that they write down complaints or promises made by other front end staff, so make sure that if you are promised something that they write it down. Remember the date when it was written down because you will most likely have to tell them to check the book when it comes to getting what you were promised. 2.We had a lot of trouble with our room and so did others in building 15. Almost enough trouble to ruin the vacation. First of all we requested and were promised a quiet room, which turned out to be facing the courtyard where the band played until 12pm (not always the best music either)The first night the air and power went out and stayed out until late the next afternoon. For two weeks there was a really bad sewage smell which they tried to mask by spraying large amounts of air freshener and pouring copious amounts of bleach down the drains. After complaining and being promised a new room and never delivering we finally just put wet towels over the drains which helped a lot. We had no hot water for showers until the last two days of a 14 day stay. On another night a security officer started drilling the safe next door at 11:30pm for a guest who had lost his safe key. After an hour of drilling and other residents screaming for him to shut up he was finally done. Oddly enough the guest wasn’t leaving the next day? So, because of the hassles we experienced, we did manage to convince the front desk to let us stay in our room until 7pm on our last day for free because Nolitours had rescheduled our flight twice and we were leaving 12 hours late. No apologies, no concessions from that company either.(first and last time )But… The front desk called us at least twice after the normal check out time to tell us that we had to get out or pay the ten dollars per hour. Luckily we knew the date that Mini had written approval for our request down in the little book at the desk. See? 3.The lounge had no ventilation (or air conditioning) and at night was blue with cigarette smoke. Not a place to be enjoyed if you happen to like fresher air. It is also the only place after 6:30 where you can order a drink and you have to pass through it to get to the dining hall. The toilets in the lounge washroom were often overflowing or plugged, or had no toilet paper and were not cleaned until the next morning. 4. We would have enjoyed sitting outside in the courtyard but for 300 plus guests they only have about 70 chairs and tables. So… if you don’t like cigarette smoke and don’t get lucky enough to nab a chair the only thing to do after dinner is go to your room and as other reviews have stated, drink water. 5.We will never use Nolitours again. The reps were no help at all. They were only available for about one hour per day and usually lined up with dissatisfied vacationers. During our two week stay, three different reps represented the company and not one would be briefed on what the others had promised. Our flight home was continuously rescheduled and the only way we knew that was to constantly check the board daily by the empty Nolitours desk .Noltiours made no provision for you to stay later in your room and you had to sit and wait in the lobby. We were lucky to only have to do so for three hours, but others had almost 12 hours to wait. Their information was often inaccurate or conflicting, as previously mentioned; after deferring our flight for 12 hours and being promised that that the duty free would be open we arrived at the airport to find everything on the main floor locked up and the one small duty free upstairs only open for 10 more minutes. Other stuff We took three trips through Magic Tours. The Chichen Itza tour was a bit of a disappointment other than the guide Sergio who was extremely interesting. Chichen itza is overrun by beggars and vendors selling souvenirs who follow and hound you constantly. (They do sell cheap though if souvenirs are what you are looking for) The lunch provided was disgusting, a buffet that looked like it had sat there for a long time.. We both got sick on the food, later that night although we chose carefully and ate sparingly. The cenote was interesting but so many people use it, it had a film of suntan lotion on top of the water, kind of gross. If you want to see ruins I enjoyed Tulum more. There are no vendors and just as many ruins placed over a smaller area. There is also a fabulous beach at the bottom of the cliff where you can go for a swim in the sea. The building shown on Chichen Itza brochures is the best and most impressive of all the ruins but you cannot climb it, you can only look and basically the only one that is complete. The period of time allotted on the tour was hardly enough time to see much. The shopping tour to Cancun was thrown in free if you bought 2 tours so we took that too. It is just as it says, a shopping tour, not a sight-seeing tour. They take you to three malls or you can elect to skip the last one and go to Senor Frogs for lunch.They do make a quick photo stop at a beach. Nothing you can’t see in Playa for a free bus ride, same stuff, same prices, same hassles. The ultimate best tour was the Sian Khan Biosphere. Totally amazing! We are two crotchety middle-agers who wouldn’t have even thought about it except for some advice from a couple even older than us. The tour takes you through the jungle to a small village called Punta Allen. Here, before you start your trip, a small sea-side restaurant serves salsa and sour cream on freshly made warm tortillas, with lemonade. You are then fitted with snorkelling gear. One word of advice, bring your own mouthpiece , shoes that can withstand water, a waterproof bag , and try to wear your swimsuit under your clothes. They claim that everything is sterilized properly but we saw a dog drinking out of the pail where they were supposedly cleaning the gear. You are taken out by boat to an area in the ocean which is surrounded by a coral reef, a natural water filter. The water is crystal clear and only about 4.5-5 feet deep. After a brief swim, you are taken to an area where you can observe huge sea turtles, and beautiful starfish. From there you continue to a mangrove, then to watch dolphins feeding and finally to the coral reef for a bit of snorkelling. I had never snorkelled before and managed fine. (I did take advantage of the hotels marina and practice with their gear for half an hour in the pool for free) When you are done you return to the restaurant for lunch which is either freshly caught barbequed fish, or paella. The fish looked good but we chose the paella, a mixture of saffron rice, fresh shrimp, and squid which was so soft and tender I thought that it was scallops. Umberto took us through the town, which is very small and gave us historical facts, which were interesting, or you could stay at the restaurant and drink beer. This will be our last trip to Mayan Riviera because the rapid growth has changed it from a quiet, leisurely place to one of massive hotel and condo chains all up the coast. The traffic has increased dramatically and if you are looking to get away from the hassles of traffic jams, and crowds this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel if”
Reviews.Author: sizzleCalagryCanada
Reviews.Content: just got back from h10 stayed there from may 5-12.We prehired a van to take us from the airport to hotel greatidea so you can get to hotel and make sure rooms are satisfactory.Arrived at 730am could not check in till 2pm that is ok though cause we packed suites and shorts in carry on.Upon checkin we were asked for a credit card for insidentals never have i experienced that at an all inclusive unless i make a long distance call.At H10 it is for anythig ,if you want to book tours or have diner at the argentinia resurant Al Carte it is 30.oo per person are you kiddig me.Anyways at checkin they tried to put us in bungalow 25 NOT it is farthest from the beach.Not that it is overly far but too far for me.Since i emailed reservations manager prior to going,a few minutes later karla gave us bng 12 room 1201 right next to pool and beach.Room was nice air conditioner worked really well mini fridge had its water no pop or beer like at other all inclusives we had a view of pool 20 feet away and the beach 10 feet away. MAID we tipped maid and room was spotless.One problem was hair dryer everytime u used it it blew a fuse no biggy they came right away and fixed it. FOOD: I travel alot for my job as an agent and the food is good but not alot of change no theme nights. STAFF:All helpfull but not enough of them to go around ROMANTIC DINNER:i booked a romantic dinner on the beach for me and my better half and had william as our waiter he is the best they have Service was great food was good we had lobster. BEACH:Yes there is a little sea grass that comes up but take a walk in either direction other hotels that are more monry have more,h10 rakes the beach every morning, the beach chairs are also up on another beach level, GROUNDS:they are beautifully kept All in all i would give this hotel a 3.5 star rateing not 5 i would only recommend it if it was a good price all in all great location to playa del carmen.People complain about the drive way up to the hotel yes it is up from the main road they all are at least H10s is paved with nice grounds unlike sandos which is dirt.My recommondation if you are looking for clean nice beach average food good location and get it for a good rate go to H10 if you want 5 star service go to bahia coba/akumal or the secrets capri next door to h10

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable week”
Reviews.Author: FRF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Hacienda Maya from April 23 until April 30 traveling with Funjet. This was trip 31 to Mexico or the Caribbean. It is a beautifully landscaped and very clean resort. We were assigned Building 34 but asked to be moved because it was so far away from everything and next to major construction (noise) going on at the resort next door. Building 25 was further from the beach but closer to the lobby and main dining room and somewhat quieter. The resort is spread out, but not a far walk to any area. The area on the left side, facing the beach is the construction side. Spent most time on the beach where the loungers were plentiful and well spaced. There is a break wall dividing the lounging area from the rest of the beach. The lower part of the beach is narrow and there was a problem with seaweed on most days. The pier with sandbags under it seems to trap the water and weeds when the wind is blowing. The staff are constantly raking and moving the stuff, but it piles up. On several days, few people went into the water because of the weeds. The beach is good for walking south. Lots of construction along the beach, but far enough back so that it is still a pleasant walk. The food was ok but the service in the main dining room was almost non existent. There are self-serve beverages so you can get water, wine, etc…when you give up on the waiters. They were not ignoring us, there just was not enough help. The Mexican restaurant was ok, not great, but the Mayan coffee is worth ordering after your meal. Check out the beach snack bar for breakfast (opens 0800) and lunch. The pools are nice and large, but there is no shade next to the pools. They need another bar for the beach/pool area and another rest room. The lobby bar was the bar open in the evening. Did not catch any shows but a combo provides music on the patio outside of the lobby at about 8 p.m. They need more chairs and tables in that area. The resort charges $3.00 for 5 minutes of internet service or $4.00 for 15 minutes. If you go to town the charge is $1.50 for a half hour. There was also a charge for the in room safe, $2.00 a day. We used the complimentary shuttle to go into Playa one day. Overall it is a nice resort for the price, but we agreed that we would not want to be there at peak season. It would be very crowded in the public areas. On Saturday there were many children (probably local families with day passes) and it was very busy in all areas. Any questions, contact vfranks@wowway.com

Reviews.Title: “Did Not like it at all. Stayed there 4/28/07 - 5/1/07”
Reviews.Author: Ewa13
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at the H10 Hacienda Maya again. I like staying at nice hotels and this one definitely wasn’t up to my standards. If you have low expectations you will like this hotel. If you are like me and like to be catered to, this place definitely is not for you. I would rate this hotel 1 star and although the price was pretty cheap, I think it was too much for this resort. Room: Our room 3102 had a serious mosquito problem. We finally received some bug spray that seemed to fix the problem. Other bugs even came out and croaked on the floor. Thank goodness for the bug spray. Still it was pretty nasty. The water in the shower stunk and tasted like salt water. Not that I was drinking it, but you could taste it when it hit your mouth. The room refrigerator had water in it only. I am used to other all-inclusive hotels that fill the refrigerator with water, beer, and soda. The air conditioning had a motion sensor. It only worked if you were in the room. The minute you left, the air stopped. Upon returning the room was hot. If you wanted an ocean view room, you had to pay $50 extra per night. Needless to say no ocean view for us. Service: What service? They had two people working the front desk, so when a huge crowd came in to check into the hotel, the line was huge and took forever. If you needed something you had to make sure to ask for it a few times before it actually got done. Calling the front desk was useless, because nobody ever answered the phone. Food: Great place for people who are on a diet. The buffets always had the same things in them. The buffet by the pool had hamburgers for lunch. The burgers tasted so gross. Not sure what kind of meat they were made out of. Eeew! The buffet in the main building had breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Same stuff every day and nasty. Thank goodness for the fruit and vegetables, which is basically the only thing I ate. There were two restaurants. One Mexican and one Japanese. Reservations were required for both…not sure why, because they were never full of guests. The restaurants were ok. Be careful where you sit in the Mexican restaurant, because there are lots of mosquitoes in it that will eat you up. The Japanese restaurant was pretty good. There is one more restaurant, but it is not included in the all-inclusive package so it costs $30 per person. Never went to that restaurant. The all-inclusive package includes cheap liquor. If you want premium it costs extra. The cheap liquor is nasty and obviously watered down, because it’s impossible to get a buzz. Other: The resort offers some kind of deal for locals, making weekends busy with local Mexican families. Saw some kids lick their fingers at the buffet, touch some food and put it back! Eeew! The resort had lots of Europeans there. Mostly French I think. Beaches were mostly topless. Didn’t mind that at all. The beach was nice, but staff did not deliver drinks to the beach or to guests at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Female_Traveller_37
Reviews.Content: Just returned April 21. We were a group of 3 woman. The resort was very clean. You could alway find the staff cleaning bathrooms, walkways, trimming landscaping etc. Nice clean beach. The food was also very good, everything that was meant to be hot was and everything meant to be cold also was. The Japanese a la carte was very entertaining and yummy. We heard that the Mexcian a la carte was not good so we didn't try it. We didn't bring our kids but I wouldn't hesitate. The kids club did seem like it might be dull compared to others I've heard about. One negative was, most times it was difficult to get service at the buffet for coffee and tea. Not because the staff was standing around - they were busy. But most meals we had to flag somebody down. Tipping didn't seem to help. Although mildly annoying we considered that a minor inconvienence as all else was great. Overall experience - excellent, relaxing, enjoyable week. Would recommend. Nolitours rep Simon was awesome! Very professional.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: coloradosunbum
Reviews.Content: this was our sixth year to the mexican riviera maya and this was by far the cheapest, and as good as any. We have stayed at high end resorts for three times what we spent at H10 and had the same problems with lights and water not working ( think it is just the erea) and the food at the buffet was the best we have ever had, along with the japanese resteraunt, It was awesome!!!! yes there is seaweed on the beach, "ITS THE SEA PEOPLE "!!!!!! Go to the pool if you cannot tolerate seaweed. You can walk for hours on the beach. we did waste a morning on a sales pitch to buy a vacation package. The staff will present it as a tour of the resort to show you what is available to you in your all inclusive. Dont waste your beach time if your not buying!!! We will definately visit a H10 resort in the future, had a great time!!!!!! Need to mention that the resort was very clean, they were always cleaning the bathrooms and floors of the pool side restaraunt and someone was always cleaning something. very impressive!!!! colo springs, colorado

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: weezy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 daughters just returned last night. I really want to tell people how nice the resort was because I was so fearful about going after reading some reviews that were written earlier in the year. We were very satisfied. I'll break it down: Food: Restaurants were good. Even the buffets where they made pasta to order for both lunch and dinner. Great selection of fresh fruit and salads. We found no problem making reservations for the ala carte restaurants (we have had problems before at 4.5 and 5 star resorts). We were not limited to the amount of reservations we could make based on the length of our stay. The Argentinian restaurant did cost extra. We got ours free for listening to 50 minutes of the "presentation" (more on that later). It was sad that they worked so hard putting on a show and staffing and there were only 4 others there besides the 8 of us who got ours comped. I think I would actually pass on it if I had to pay the $30/pp. Drinks: I loved the fact that Corona was the beer on tap. I was suprised to learn that if you wanted a Bacardi rum or Tangeray or other call brands that they charge extra for it and you could only get it at the lobby bar, not at the beach bar. They did make a good mojito. Word of advice: Bring your own insulated cup. They only use small 9 oz disposable cups which don't hold much. Spa: We stayed at the El Dorado Royal (5 star)2 years in a row and loved the spa. The spa here riveled it in all aspects. My husband and I were able to get couples massage in a great treatment room. We were given robes and plush towels to shower off before the massage if you wanted and after. We first booked massages when the were running a 20% off special. Then 2 days later it was 2 for 1 so we "had" to go for it again! They offered so many types of massages that it compared to a 5 star spa. Beach: Very nice in comparison to further down past Playa where it is very rocky and not able to walk the beach. We were able to take very long walks on the beach in the mornings which was great. Water was a little more murky than what I have experienced at the El Dorado a few years back. Still was able to see the gorgeous green water. Do yourself a favor and buy polarized sunglasses. Bring another pair along and you will never go back to not wearing polarized lenses. You see so much more differentiation of the water. The only excursion we left the resort for was to go horseback riding in Maroma beach. Otherwise the kids swam, played in the sand and painted pottery one day. We were all so exhausted after dinner we were in bed usually by 10:00 so didn't see much of the shows or disco. The bits of the shows we did see were loud and hot in the theater but the recreation staff does a great job. Word of advise: Don't fall for the "give us 50 minutes to listen to to our speil and we will give you incentives". We said we would give them 50 minutes and only 50 minutes in exchange for our dinners in the Argentinian restaurant. They guaranteed us that it wouldn't be more than 50 minutes. What a joke. We told them after 50 minutes that we were done and would like to receive what we were due. The time share guy , Jack, said no that we didn't fulfill our end. We did argue with him a bit and seen we were not going to get anywhere. He blamed the hotel staff for quoting 50 minutes but I don't buy that for a moment. We did complain to the hotel and they gave us the vouchers and said they were now going to tell people that it takes 2 hours. I hope they do in fact make the change. The other thing that was a bit problematic is that it is a family resort yet there was a LOT of topless gals. I know it is commonplace in Europe and I don't have a problem with it when we are at the all adult resorts but when our kids, (8 and 11 plus our friends had a 6/girl and 10 year old boy) are exposed it poses a problem. And it may not have been so bad had they only sunbathed topless on the beach versus the pool area as well but they would also go to the bar, the bathrooms and the ocean topless. Over all, I believe we would go back. Only the plethra of topless gals would discourage us. I believe the resort could change this by setting a specfic area aside for adults only.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely landscaping”
Reviews.Author: renia_22
Reviews.Content: H10 Hacienda Maya has a beautiful landscaping; the beach and the pool area are well maintained-clean. The food was just OK. After two days of the buffet restaurant we did not want to go back there again, the same thing every day, food very greasy, meat dry. The Japanese restaurant was pretty good but it was difficult to get an early reservation. The Mexican restaurant has the same menu everyday so after one visit you don't want to go back for the same food. The hotel should improve the food variety and quality. The bar by the pool area did not pour any alcohol to drinks during the day. The lobby bar was great and if you tip the bartenders enough they will give you the premium alcohol at no charge (at least they did that to us but we made sure they got good tips) The air conditioner in our room did not work. We have made several phone calls to the reception desk complaining about it but nothing was done until we saw a maintenance person walking by our room. We dragged him to our room and explained the whole air conditioning situation. After two very hot nights, they finally left a letter at our door step that they were unable to fix it and we needed to move. It was also difficult to take advantage of the free shuttle to the city. You need to go to the reservation desk early in the morning to book it for the following day. There was a separate desk to make restaurant reservations. It seemed like we were just going back and forth these two desks to make reservations-waste of time. The daily shows were good but nothing extra ordinary. Every night there was a live band playing just outside the lobby, which was very nice and relaxing. They changed this hotel to five stars but I don’t think that I would rate this as a 5-star hotel due to the food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: gasoholic
Reviews.Content: Just returned and felt like I should give my 2 cents. Airport: for sure Cancun airport is a jungle, many flights arive at the same time so people everywhere but just follow along, fill out your paperwork, get you luggage, and out the airport to sidewalk you go. Take a moment to look around relax then work out how to get to your resort, if transportation is not provided. We took the ADO bus. We were a family of 4 with 2 kids under 8 years old and had no problem. A man in an ADO shirt showed us to the bus sold us our tix for 8 us an adult and 4 us child. Taxi would be about 50 bucks, transfer vans about 60 bucks, 24 bucks we took the bus. It's an air cond brand new bus with TVs more comfortable than the plane. It runs ever hour on the 45. Hotel: Very clean, well manicured, beautifull. Reception was smooth, taking the bus we beat the lineups. The room was nice every thing worked fine had a balcony with a semi ocean view, the room did the job just fine. Pools were clear and great for the kids or adults. The drinks were great, bar was understaffed and tipping made no difference. So, I tipped the dudes cutting the grass or raking the seaweed instead, they need it more. The beach was clean with white sand. The ocean is not like in PDC or Cancun with the turquois water you may be expecting. It' s like a resort we stayed at in Porto Morelos, the water was just fine, shallow and kid friendly. The food was typical all you can eat food. They change it here and there, but really the same stuff most of the time. They'll make whatever you want, but I tend to be a little carefull when it comes to food. Because of this, myself or anyone in my family had didnt have any stomach problems. The restaurants were nice and we had nice family dinners. Talking to people there, not one person had any complaints about the place. Not everyone will be happy because they probably are never happy. I never stay at the same resort twice. If you have a bad time there, you would have a bad time anywhere. Before going to this resort, we were very worried what to expect. It met or exeeded any of our expectations. Not everything was perfect, but seldom are things in life. We had a wounderfull family trip and the hotel certainly does not deserve some of the negative reports I've read. Any questions about anything, feel free to ask, otherwise, I can't tell you everything about everything in a review like this.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioMac
Reviews.Content: Newmarket & Markham, Ontario - Feb.25/Mar.4/07 There were 4 of us and we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, as written previously the beach was the best at the H10. I wouldn't have wanted to have stayed at the Esmeralda as there was no beach. It is very windy on the Mayan so if you don't like it windy that could be a problem but we all agreed if it wasn't it would be really hot!!! . The food was good, the buffet is the same as most places you can usually find something to eat. The Japanese and the Mexican restaurants were very good. And we did the Argentinian show and dinner at $ 25. U.S each and it was I think a 6 or 7 course meal. I lost track and it was very good. We went to Playa del Carmen on the shuttle - had no trouble booking the day before we wanted to go and thoroughly enjoyed it - my sister in law and I took the ferry across to Cozumel for $ 20. each U.S. return which wasn't bad. I had been there previously a few years ago and it hadn't changed much. lots of shopping as in Playa del Carmen. We found the staff very accomodating - our a/c wasn't working very well the first night and we complained and it was fixed. The drinks were okay, you had to pay premium for Bacardi and Cdn. whiskey so that can be a problem for some. There are lots of day trips to the different ruins you could take - my sister/ brother in-law did the Tulum trip and thoroughly enjoyed it. All in all, the weather was great and the trip was relaxing and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful buildings, pool and beach; terrible food and understaffed”
Reviews.Author: Marga88ca
Reviews.Content: Starting with the good points…. This hotel is beautifully laid-out – it is in the style of villas, each 2 stories with 4 rooms per floor, so it seems like you are in a beach side town, with small pedestrian walkways connecting the 38 villas to the main building. The lobby area is beautiful to sit in, spacious and open. reat pools, and great beach. We walked along a few kilometres of the beach area, and this hotel definitely has the nicest beach area, as it’s in an alcove area and doesn’t get much debris washing up on the shore. The bad points…. I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels, motels, room rentals, etc, ranging from 1 to 5 stars in various countries, including many in Mexico; this was by far the worst food I’ve ever had anywhere, hands down. The cheapest ingredients are used, and then are not cooked well (indeed, often under-cooked, as several times I didn’t eat the chicken because it was still pink inside). We survived on eating fried eggs and toast every day for breakfast, as it was the only thing cooked fresh that had not been sitting out for 3 hours. For dinner, bread and butter mostly. They have 2 restaurants (a Mexican and a Japanese) in the resort; these are actually quite good. But they have very limited seating (generally you can only get a reservation at 8:30 or 9:30pm), and you are only allowed to eat there twice during your stay. They also have an Argentinean restaurant that others said was good (we didn’t try it), but it is US$30 per person to go (and doesn’t include drinks). The staff are all very friendly and trying to accommodate, but this is by far a very under-staffed hotel for its size. For example, there was only 1 person doing check-in and check-out, even though they were expecting a bus off 40 to arrive at the same time, so it took hours to get everyone checked in properly. The only area that is over-staffed is in the salespeople that nab you the moment you are trying to haul your luggage (by yourself, no bell boys) to your room – they are selling you timeshares (although they call it “Club Membership”), and are very persistent, following up with calls at 8am in the morning trying to get you out to their “free breakfast” salestalks. Also, the hotel next door is expanding, and was directly in front of our room (if you are looking towards the ocean, we were furthest to the left). They started digging with heavy machinery at 6:30am every morning. Even earplugs did not help much. On the plus side, it got us out of bed early to get good seats by the pool! However, as this area is swampland, the digging caused sewer-like odours to permeate the entire beach area (even going to the opposite side didn’t help much). All in all, I would not recommend this hotel for the price. For another $100-200 you can stay at a decent chain resort, that really is a 4 star (this was definitely not). Otherwise, go to a cheaper resort (eg. $300-400 less), as in the end it will be similar service. Alternatively, look at some of the resorts that offer the no-meals option, with kitchenette (there’s a Walmart in Playa del Carmen, you can rent a car or take a taxi and stock up on food, drinks, everything there for the week).

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great trip”
Reviews.Author: whg4
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a wonderful six days at the Hacienda Maya. We decided to stay there based on the reviews we read here on Tripadvisor so I only feel obligated to write one myself. We were looking for, above all else, an escape from the cold winter that we've been having. We wanted to plant ourselves on the beach; aside from that everything else was secondary. We didn't necessarily want to stay in an all inclusive resort, but we found that the price was great at the Hacienda Maya and we figured that we could enjoy the beach during the day and go into Playa at night. We were right. Despite the convenience of the resort we found ourselves leaving every day for one thing or another. (Day Spa, Shopping, Tulum, etc.) One thing I wish I knew earlier was that you had to make a reservation on the the shuttle to town. The list is short and fills up very quickly. Not all the shuttles are free, some are $3 USD per person. And the last shuttle is at 7 pm. Try to make reservations as early as you can as we didn't and ended up taking far too many taxis at a fixed cost of $12 USD each way. The property was well cared for and we appreciated the work that had put into the lush surroundings. Yes, there was a foul smell here and there but it wasn't nearly as bad as we expected, only when we were walking on certain paths, and not anything that you could notice in the room, the beach, or the pool, but good to know about in advance so we weren't taken aback. The rooms were good, no complaints. We stayed in building #7, which I would highly recommend as you're close enough to the beach without giving up privacy or being subjected to the noise from the pool entertainment. This wasn't a stroke of good luck. We asked at the front desk what rooms they had available and told them that we'd wait for a quiet one. Looking back, this was a good move on our part as we really liked the room and it only added to our enjoyment of the resort. They were kept clean and while it make not seem like a big deal, they always left the AC on when we came in. Nothing felt better after a long day in the sun! The beach itself was great. They kept it clean and there were plenty of chairs available. I went for a walk north and south of our beach and we really did have one of the best spots on the beach without question. Very clean and not the least bit rocky. The food was okay. We liked breakfast and lunch. They had an espresso machine which we appreciated. For dinner we tried to go into town as often as we could, but as I mentioned earlier taxis were $24 USD + tip R/T so we couldn't justify making that trip twice a day. We ate at the buffet for dinner once. I think it was an off-night but even then it was very disappointing. On Thursday night they had a special "Mexican" night at the buffet which looked a lot better. My recommendation for dinner would be to make reservations at the different specialty restaurants, avoid the buffet for dinner unless it's a special theme night and to temper your expectations. Or just take the shuttle into town and take a taxi back. There were some great restaurants in Playa we really enjoyed. All in all, I think that for what we wanted, an easy trip to the beach with a few chances to experience some great food (off property) we found exactly what we were looking for. Thanks to all the Tripadvisor reviewers that helped us plan a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GordonSMississauga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 weeks at the H10 and were quite satisfied with the experience. Renovations as described by others were still underway but did not cause much inconvenience. After all, maintenance must be done sometime! There were a few minor inconveniences which the hotel should address: A nearly permanent lake at the north end of the beach restaurant walkway where it joined the main path caused inconvenience. Apart from pumping it out from time to time, no effort seemed to be made to correct the drainage problem. The spa and exercise area was not open we were told when we registered. However, one rainy day we wandered upstairs (above the main reception hall via the staircase adjoining the buffet restaurant entrance ) and found that everything was indeed open and the people up there seemed to be bored while waiting for guests to come. No big surprise with the lack of communication - happens everywhere..... even in Canada and the States! Food was good and varied. The Japanese restaurant was very enjoyable. Don't miss it. Playa del Carmen is fun too. DO NOT MISS THE CAVE RESTAURANT on Juarez. Really unique. Little bit away from the main tourist area of 5th Avenue. 307 Alux (pronounced Ah-loosh) is a bar/restaurant/nightclub that is built inside of a Cenote (cave)

Reviews.Title: “Better than we ever expected”
Reviews.Author: rlph_law
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this resort. The first was a couple of years ago when it was the El Manderin. We like it then, we really liked it this time. The staff was extremely courteous and there when you needed them. The food was good, maybe could be a little better, but hey folks, this is a third world country. As far as the resort goes, I have no complaints, zero. It was an inexpensive trip through Apple Vacations and I enjoys every minute of it. A lot of people complain if things aren't just perfect, but at this report you can and should have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Grossly Under-rated in TA Reviews”
Reviews.Author: playaobsessed
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hacienda Maya and think the place is grossly under-rated in these reviews. The grounds are spectacular, the pool is lovely and empty, the beach is great, (superior to the two five-star resorts beside it) you can walk for miles on it, the staff bends over backwards to please you, the rooms are clean and spacious , the buffet had interesting, different offerings every night, (most of which were very good) the lobby is a knock-out, the live bands were decent, there was no problem getting a beach or pool lounger, and the Mojitos, unbeatable. If you had to look for something to gripe about, yes--they play a lot of loud music around the pool all day, which you can hear at the beach palapas. But isn't this the case with most AIs? Second (and this isn't the fault of the resort) the milieu among the other guests there is unfriendly. People were......cold. Perhaps this was just the mix when we were there, which was about 75% French Canadian, the rest English Canadian, Americans, and Europeans. Go figure. But overall--about as pleasant a place as one could imagine. Anyone who gives it a bad rap is a chronic malcontent.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jnthetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 Hacienda Maya January 28 until February 1, 2007 as part of a vacation package. H10 is a hotel chain out of Barcelona, Spain. Be prepared because most locals still know the hotel as the El Mandarin - indeed, many of our toiletry packets (shampoo, shower gel, etc.) still bore the old name. Overall, the grounds are beautiful--lush and well cared for, the buildings (rooms are in a series of 8-room buildings) are a tropical orange with lime, blue and pink accent walls. Although there was a spa and gym onsite, we did not use either. The two pools were well cared for and only heavily used during the pool games. Periodically, there was a strong whiff of sewage when out walking, but nothing persistent. Our room was nicely furnished - TV problems were prevalent (the signal would periodically cut out for no reason), and the water is horribly soft (thank goodness for unlimited supply of H10 bottled water). Lots of closet space, a large shower, and a large balcony were great! The beach was very well taken care of. We walked north as far as possible, and south for about 1 1/2 miles on the beach, and the H10's beach was cleaner and better cared for than all other resorts. The cabanas are nice and plentiful, as were the chairs. Drink service was spotty. There are motorized and non-motorized water sports on site, and parasailing seemed popular. Entertainment was a definite weak spot at the Resort. The nighttime gathering spot was the bar in the main lobby - the entire lobby became noticeably smoky and full of people in various states of inebriation. This resort seemed to cater to couples and groups of all ages, although some kids were there. We saw about 8 kids of varying ages (4-10) participating in kids activities each evening. The 9:45pm show was a music/dance show, most of the nights while there. Most high school productions were of better quality; my wife and I actually walked out of the first show - the costumes, dancing, and entertainment value were all lacking. There were three restaurants open while we were there - the main buffet was only OK in quality, although breakfast was better than the other meals. There was always plenty of room to get around the buffet and no wait for a table, and wait staff was typically attentive - although after-dinner coffee and tea sometimes were delayed. We ate at the reservation-only Japanese steakhouse one night - sushi and typical 'prepare-at-your-table' steak meal. It was the best dinner we had while there. The Mexican restaurant by the pools was also reservation-only; we didn't understand that so were not able to make it there. If their menu was of the same quality as their Guacamole, it would have been good. This restaurant serves hamburgers and hotdogs at lunch and was the best choice for that meal. We don't drink, so we cannot comment on the quality/quantity of alcohol. It seemed like everyone was happy enough in the bar and on the beach! Amenities in the hotel are still being added/refined. The gift shop was junky, but the 'general store' had all the basics. There is an Internet cafe, but only 3 PC's (one was broken the entire time we were there), and the cafe was only open for a few hours a day. We decided that 3 full days at the resort, with one on an all-day excursion to Chichen Itza (the highlight of our trip), was about right. Any longer, and we would have been too bored. If all you want to do is lay out on the beach and have basic food, the H10 is probably a good place for you. If you want a more luxurious resort experience, we would suggest looking elsewhere. When we go back to the Riviera Maya, we're going to look for the Cancun Hotel Zone - so we're closer to the action (and the airport - which is a 45 minute drive away).

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Rivera”
Reviews.Author: Geo.Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here week of Feb 5th to 12th, We fly last minute every spring and this is one of the best values ever. Completely refurnished in superb condition, excellent staff, very good food, the Mexican al a carte was a knock out.There is a show in the theatre just off the lobby every night. Great stuff especially the Mayan Revue and "The Blues Brother" .I would compare this to a 5 star anywhere. Two comments. 1. Watch out for the "super sensetive" weigh scales on departure. You must be below 20 kg (40 kg per couple) or get hit with $10.00 a kilo overcharge. 2. The "entertainment shack plays very loud latino music from 10.00 am to 4.00 pm. It blasts all over the pool and beach, no chance of a nap or to read a book.

Reviews.Title: “A good time was had by all!!”
Reviews.Author: BucknBay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in a group of 24 aged between 30 and 45 from Ontario, Canada that stayed at the Hacienda Maya from Jan.27-Feb.3. I can't think of any problems or complaints that any of this group had other than a few minor ones. We all had a great time and most of us were not ready to leave when we had to. I was reading the previous comment about having to tip the bartenders to get served, never did any of us feel that tipping was necessary to get a drink, the bartenders were always happy and smiling and I was amazed how they could keep track of when people came to the bar and they served them in the proper order, we tipped them because they did a great job! The tv problem was related to the sattelite feed coming from Cancun...not a resort problem. The rooms were always very clean, we found all the staff very friendly and helpful. The food was great..never tired of it, the buffet offered roast turkey,roast pork, beef etc pizza daily always something for everyone. We found the nightly resort entertainment shows much better than other resorts we have stayed at. You can tell they put a lot of work into the performances. As for the alcohol, I didnt drink much beer but when I did it was always nice and cold and the cocktails had enough alcohol to keep a smile on our faces! You can never keep everyone happy all of the time, just remember life's too short, you're on vacation, relax and enjoy it! All in all we all had a wonderful time...would I go back...yes ....in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Swork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club El Mandarin as it was then in June 2005 - it was great!! They couldn't do enough for you - I really wouldn't pay any attention to anyone who complains that they didn't remove the seaweed from the beach - please get a life!! If you're not going to get seaweed on the beach, where are you going to get it??!! - Honestly - I would pay attention to the good reviews and only worry about the ones with valid points!! Liked the rooms and the king size bed and the Air Conditioning was great - actually felt cold in the rooms. Weather in June was changeable, had a few days of torrential rain in our 14 day stay and the hurricanes in Cozumel happened a couple of days after we came home. I would recommend the fine dining restaurant - it says you need to make reservations but this wasn't the case when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: Imissthesun
Reviews.Content: 10 of us went to H10 the week of Jan. 28-Feb. 4th. The hotel is very beautiful and I thought clean. That was all I could say really kind about the place. To start we arrived at 10:30am and got stuck waiting till after 4pm for a room. Our room was nice if you didn't mind the T.V. working occasionally and forget asking to get it fixed. The Argentine resturant that was suppose to be open Nov. 06 was not open we kept hearing opening end of week - never happened. The free shuttle to Playa de Carmen that is advertised on the web site, was not available we were told hotel to full $3 per person to town. Also for people who were hoping to go and relax and have a few drinks get ready - draft beer only. 4 ounce cups of warm draft beer and the mixed drinks while they tasted good - had little to no alcohol in them. We ended up going and buying our own beer and alcohol which kind of defeats the all inclusive part. Also to get a drink with some of the bartenders required having a dollar bill in your hand. The tipping was absurd - who tips for a 4 ounce cup of draft beer. The hotel I feel deserves a 2 star rating at tops. Their food was just O.K. and the shows were basically the same thing everynight. I hate to disappoint anyone going but I wish I would of known more before we had booked - I would of picked a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: susiegee
Reviews.Content: I have never been to an all inclusive resort before and I read a couple of horror stories about this place but it was fantastic. The staff went out of their way for us. They wore name badges with various country flags on them as to which languages they spoke. Mostly Spanish (of course) English and French. I was only there for one week so I never tired of the food of which there was a huge selection. From Cancun to Playa del Carmen there are many beaches and a lot of them are too rocky or coral-y to swim in...not so at this resort....fantastic white sand with very few sharp bits. I noticed that some of the beaches closer to Playa del Carmen were disappearing so the chairs at those resorts were quite crammed together....we had lots of space at H10 as the beach is still good. It was quite windy in the week I went so for a couple of days the red flags were out and swimming was impossible. I guess this is typical for the Mexican Rivera. I didn't frequent either of the 2 pools because there was almost constant loud music during the day. I even had to plug my ears on the way to the pool bar. That would be the only real complaint I had. Once you were at the beach, though, you couldn't hear anything but the waves. The rooms were clean and the beds comfy. We didn't use the resorts' tour to visit Tulum. We went on our own by bus which we caught on the highway and it was easy and inexpensive. I would highly recommend this resort to everyone including families as there is plenty for adults and kids to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for AI”
Reviews.Author: Lawpurr
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this hotel...GO!.....this is a very nice resort, very well kept up, clean, easy to get to other places (Tulum, Cancun, Playa etc.)..ALL of the employees get an A+++.....they all work very hard, are always friendly ,smiling etc. Remeber this, the minimum daily wage in Mexico is only $5US dollars a day. Tips are not expected, but I'm usre it helps them meet their bills! Every employee deserves recognition here, from maids, tour directors, right down to the hard working gardeners!....who I might add, are knowledgeable at what they do.
