I cannot say enough good things about this resort. Secrets and Grand Gala Esmeralda are on either side. H10 has the better beach, very little rocks, seaweed etc. The water is a bit murky, but only Mother Nature controls that!. You can walk out to the highway, there is a bustop right across the street, Playa express runs every 10 minutes to Playa or Cancun. cost:13pesos. We took a taxi to Tulum, only becuz I wanted a really good window seat, you can't see out the bus windows that well. And it was a round trip fare, but we took a collectivo back into Playa for $2US. There is only bottled water in the fridge in the room. No coffee maker, but you don't really need it as this resort has an espresso bar in the buffet, and at the bar later in the day. They also set up a brandied coffee station in the lobby in the late afternoon. Very good.!! The Japanese restaurant is OK,but the food was kinda "mexicanized" if you are looking for authentic. The Mexican food is very good. Lots of food around all day, so no one could possibly go hungry here. The pastries and cakes etc are outstanding! The Nolitours reps, Marta is very friendly,smiling and willing to help. And she has only been on this site for a month!.And Isabelle is very nice and lives locally so is a wealth of info too. So go!....no worries here.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rocky10
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week of Jan 07 arriving New Years eve to a well organized dinner and party, something we were not expecting. It was a great start to the week. Our check-in went well and the room we got (Bldg 31) was very nice and clean located about 3/4 ways back in the complex but not at all a long distance from the rest of the facilities. In fact we liked this location as it was quiet in the later hours if the evening. the place is clearly not a 5* and misses the mark on 4* in some areas but all in all we enjoyed our vacation and had no "horror stories" as I read in some of the earlier reviews I read prior to our departure. (Having been to the place now I really don't understand some of the graphic reviews written on this place. I suppose some people have unreasonable expectations or are always complaining). The complaint of English not being spoken is absolute rubbish. I found the staff all extremely freindly and spoke English very well for English being their 2nd language. I spoke at length with many of the staff and enjoyed their view of Canadians, American and others. Language is absolutely not a problem. Some house keeping staf speak no English but a smile, gestures or a tip is understood in any language. We had all the bottled water we asked for. ROOMS - Very clean and modern, equal to other 5* that I have been in. As we we there at the busiest time of the year, there was a day there was no wash cloths available earlier in the day, this was corrected when we spoke to the front desk. One day returning from a day excursion we were face with the AC not working. Within 1/2 hr a fellow was there and had it reset and all was fine from there on. ENTERTAINMENT - Very very good, Better than the RIUs and Grand Bahia Principes that I have stayed at. they truly do a first class job on this part of the business. Can't say enough about the Entertainment and pool staff. FOOD - A la cartes were good with the Japanese standing out over the Mexican. The Main Buffet was average with the same dishes being served each lunch and dinner, I guess because I travel so much in my job I found it boring. (Their OJ and Ice cream are awsome, kids loved it). the small restaurant near the pool was an embarrasment as they were never open and rady to serve breafast at 8am nor were the chef available to make an omelet in the morning. as the morning went on they would not re-stock the fruit, or the breafast items such that if you went in their at about 10:30am it was picked over and not very appetizing. We often went to the main buffet for this reason but noted at about 11am the same thing was occurring there. This experience alone caused me to rate this place just below a 4*. We, along with several others form Ont had a day or so of Montezomas revenge, nothing that Imodium didn't clear up quickly. I always seem tohave a day of it when going south; you can guess until forever where you actually picked it up, everyone had a different theory. Two other families from Vancouver followed the same path as we did and had no incidents. Go figure. The small restaurant by the pool (Mexican at night) is basicall a snack bar (Hamburgers and Hot dogs) at luch and through the afternoon. Again it is "picked over by 2:30 - 3:00pm. You need to go to the main buffet. BEACH - the Beach was good and pools very good. I have seen other resorts clean the beach every day in fact the resort next door (Secrets) cleaned their beach every day and the difference was noticable. Getting beach towels is a problem, there doesn't seem to bee enough. When a delivery is made to the pool shack you got to be there or they are gone within 30min and it could be hrs before another small delivery is made. We spent the first day and a half trying to get our timing working with the deliveries. GENERAL - Good place for families although most of the vacationers we couples. I found the number of smokers was high, but coming from Vancouver that is not unusual. The smokers were predominantly from Quebec and the US, but smoking was contained to the loby and courtyard area with the eating areas being smoke free. There is no liquor in the rooms, not even beer! This was a dissapointment to me as it was advertised as having these amentities and I would much rather relax and read in my room in the eveniong enjoying a beverage rather than having to crowd around the main bar waiting for service. Their "domestic" booze is not great and they charge you up to 55 pesos for what they call premium liquor which in Canada is normal liqour (Barcardi's, CC etc). This is another reason I wouldn't rate it a 4*. The exercise room was barely OK. Missing was Mats, water and the floors were not cleaned the week we were there. Also there could have been one more set of equipment. We enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this place to others (with the cautions I mentioned above). Disregard the hooror stories related by others because they are exaggerations, however, make sure the price you pay is equal to a very good 3 1/2 star resort in the area.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuaneDonovan
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from the H10 - we had been to this property when it was the Club el Mandarin.......There are new owners to the hotel, and they are bringing the property up to their rating of a 5 star.............the grounds are beautiful and well kept.....they have added a lovely new pool, with swim up bar, and beds in the pool that have jacuzzi jets, plus a large jacuzzi...the food was very good - they do have two restaurants completed the Japanese (where service was very slow) and the Mexican (where service was very good)....the beds are very comfortable, and you can ask for xtra pillows, the bed linens were always clean and smelled very nice. From the front desk down to the maids and gardeners, the people are all very gracious. This property is like being in a private country club it is a very good buy for families, couples, singles... They do need to do a few things to meet the 5 star rating....they need to fill the mini bar with soda and beer, not just water.......they need to install reading lights in the rooms, as the lighting is very poor for reading at night.... They could also put some more money in the ammenities, as in soap, shampoo, bath get, etc.........as these were not of good quality......also a coffee maker in the room. The bathrooms are large have a very nice make up mirror, and blow dryer....... All in all I would give this property a very high rating and it is a bargain at the price.......

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KTB12
Reviews.Content: The El Mandarin now Hacienda Maya was really beautiful. The other reviews must be older as it has changed. The beach is beautiful and very well kept. The staff is very friendly and attentive they speak very good english. The rooms are really nice and very clean and I never had a problem with hot water. The food is very good as well. The entertainment staff does a good job and there's always something to do if you want. This resort is also in a very good location very close to Playa Del Carmen with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: chris61
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from El Mandarin last night and we had a great time, the reviews were inaccurate. This place is great the staff are friendly and helpful, they speak english and understand english very well. Our room was clean and we had the best housekeeping crew, we even had towel animals done daily which my seventeen year old thought was cute. We really didn't want to come home, if you go you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “thing must have changed”
Reviews.Author: blondejen
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this resort a few years ago, and found it to be much different from all of the more recent reviews.Our room was clean and spacious,there were no problems with the TV or AC,the staff spoke english quite well,and we enjoyed the resort very much.The food was fine as well and fantastic if you compare it to the food in Cuba.We have stayed in more elaborate resorts but still found the El Manadrin to be enjoyable.After reading these comments I am not sure about going there this year as we had planned for xmas. I am sorry to hear this about the resort. Jennifer Lennox,Abbotsford,BC,Canada

Reviews.Title: “!!!!!!under construction!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbmurphy192
Reviews.Content: This place has potential, but stay away for the next few months! I stayed there with a friend from Sept 24th thru the 29th. The Lobby bar was boarded up, there was scafolding throughout the lobby. JACK HAMMERING at the beach!!! I'm not kidding, there is nothing worst then trying to relax on a beautiful beach and hearing jack hammers behind you. Plus, they start working at 8am and don't stop until 8pm. We booked through AppleVacations and was not warned about this, so I'm trying to get the word out. Yes, the place is cheap in comparision to a Sandals, Iberostar, or Secrets (which is right next door) but it's not worth it. Almost everyone there was from Europe and spoke Spanish, so if you don't, be warn you will not be able to communicate with anyone there. I was going there only to relax and get away from life for a week. Well the activity planners are all over you to join all the various activities they have. So if you are looking to be active you won't run out of things to do, if not, you will have to shoe away the planners every ten minutes. Food wasn't that great either...

Reviews.Title: “Beach and ocean are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dansi
Reviews.Content: Here is from the Original "The Good ,the bad and the ugly." We stayed at the El mandarin (Mayan Riviera) from march 19-26-06. I begin with the ugly. We landed in the afternoon with Air Transat in Cancun,,No A.C.in the terminal,at first it looked OK. We were moved upstairs,then downstairs again.A-long line lineup followed,,by the time we reached our bus 2-hours had passed..Later we were told that 5 planes had landed in a short time ...Total chaos! Now the good..... Check in was a breeze. Large rooms, A.C.(whisper quiet). Grounds are beautifully manicured. In dining,we always found something to eat.There was only one ala carte. We stayed with the buffet. There is a free Shuttle to Playa Del Carmen. Beach and ocean are beautiful,but there is still some repairs going on from the last Hurricane. The bad... Some mornings,there was no water to take a shower.. the buffet was most of the time understaffed..coffee was served in a thermos bottles,on your table,twice we did not even get any coffee in the morning. We rated this place about 3-star. Herb & Viola

Reviews.Title: “Hotel hell 2 - Please don't go there”
Reviews.Author: ghitz9
Reviews.Content: Was there between Aug.20 to 27 - Pretty lame place. Firstly, I am not a first timer in Cancun/Playa and I know what a good resort should feel like. We are a couple in our late twenties and are not very picky and don't mind the "small" issues but as you will see this resort is not worth your precious vacation time. Folks, it's true what other reviewers were saying: THE GROUNDS SMELL LIKE RAW SEWAGE! as much as hate to say it but it's true, seems like they are having issues with the piping which will not be fixed. Also a huge dissapointment for us was the lack of AC in lobby/bar/restaurants, it's friggn hot everywhere except your room if the AC is working there. We don't mind the heat but sometimes it's nice to eat in a comfortable place. Trust me you will hate it there. NOTE: This hotel was owned by an Italian company and it was recently bought out by H10 which is a mexican hotel chain. Seems to me 65% of the people were from Mexico and it was hard to meet other english speaking people. STAFF: The front desk staff is awful, even if they speak a little English they don't try. If you have any requests (like missing air conditioner remote, shower drain clogged, you know "small" things) then you will get blank stares at the front desk. You have to raise your voice if you want anything fixed. Basically changing our room was out of the question for them. The rest of the staff in the kitchen, entertainment, and housekeeping are nice. ROOM: It's just ok, there is much mould accumulating around that does not get cleaned. The bed and the pillows are hard but that's the norm at 4 stars hotels in Mexico. One thing I noticed is that the bed is shorter than king beds here in CAN/USA, my feet were hanging over the edge and I'm only 5' 10" , with my head close to the headboard. The room smells mouldy unless the AC is on and it's not particulary special. BUILDINGS: This is not a high rise hotel it's made up of 2 story apartment like units. They are currently getting repainted and of course work starts at 7 AM and the ladders and the paint buckets banged the walls of our unit for 3 days straight. If you think you won't be bothered by this you will not escape the Lawnmowers and they will get you at least one day. Our unit was by the beach and there is a 5 min walk to lobby, or any restaurant (except the snack bar by the pool). The grounds are nice but there's a lot of walking around if you get a unit by the beach. FOOD/DRINKS: Folks no matter where you eat, sweat will drip down your face beacuse AC is non existent in any of the restaurants or the Lobby. They have 2 restaurants, buffet and Japanese (GRAND GALA next door has 1 buffet and 3 a la carte) and the Japanese is not good (it was empty most of the time) and the only one left is the Buffet which is OK. The breakfast is weak but the lunch and dinner is good. The snack bar by the pool is ok too. Drinks are watered down as usual. BEACH/POOL: For us this is why we go to Mexico. The beach is ok considering that all the beaches in the area are bad and we have checked them all out by walking them. The beach situation is sad I guess due to the recent hurricanes, it is not your typical clear and blue water and also no waves, but murky and full of seaweed. You will always have a palapa and a good chair to sit on and the sand is nice. They give you free canoe to go out on the water if you want. We actually spent a day in Cozumel's south side where there are waves and the beach is awesome (rent a scooter and ride down to the beaches before CocoNuts restaurant) you will not regret it, then when you come back to Mandarin's beach you won't want to go in. The new pool is nice, but then again what's considered a bad pool? Overall we hated this place, it's 2.5 stars at best, spend a little more and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Nestiny
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (ages 21) went to H10 El Mandarin from August 6-13. We were both very skeptical about this place because of all the negative reviews that we read. However, the resort exceeded our expectations. I can't understand how people can rate this resort so low and give negative reviews. They must be from another planet or the type of people that complain about everything. This is how it REALLY is: Our room: The room was very spacious and was kept clean every day. I would recommend renting out the safe, which is 2$ a day. Better to be safe than sorry. The bathroom sometimes smelt of sewage, which can be totally normal in any foreign country. All we did was put a few glasses of water down the floor drain. It worked out well. Sometimes we had to take cold showers. The reason, I believe, was because we took showers when everyone else was probably taking showers. Right before dinner after coming off of the beach. Other than those miniscule problems, the rooms were beautiful and private. The beach: Yes, as you have probably have read, the water is not as crystal clear as you will probably expect. But it is definately clean and swimmable. It's just algae...no big deal. And the guys out there work hard to clean it up everyday. If you are looking for a turquoise waters, then take a trip to Playa del Carmen, where there is public access to the beach. The water is breath-taking there. There are plenty of palapas and lounge chairs on the resort Most of them werent even used the entire day. The sand is white and powdery. And Nora brings you drinks all day long, which is nice because it gets very hot out there. The restaurants: I thought the food was good. I tried some things. Liked and disliked. It was buffet style with a lot to select from. If you can't find something in there that you like you must be crazy. I could not get enough of the guacomole. Absolutely delicious. The japanese restaurant was yummy and fun, but you must make reservations. And it gets very hot in there if you choose the Hibachi. The resort only has Corona as their beer. And whoever has said that the beer was watered down is just ridiculous. How can that be possible? If you feel that your mixed drinks are watered down, then just ask for more alcohol or get another drink. It;s all-inclusive, for God's sake. The bartenders are always happy to serve you. Staff: No complaints at all. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Excursions: We wanted to do a bunch of trips, but we ended up doing just one that included almost everything that we wanted to experience. I definately recommend the Coba excursion that AllTourNative offers. It was 112$ booked through the Apple Rep. It was worth way more than what we payed. This excursion is for people that are looking to do a lot of physical and challenging activities. They pick you up at 7 am and you come home around 6pm. You climb pyramids and see the Mayan ruins after bicycling through the trails, zip-line over the jungle and repel off the cliffs, eat in the Mayan village, kayak through a lagoon, hike through the jungle and swim in a cenote, which is an underground river. It was a very tiring day, but well-worth it. A definite must is taking a 7 minute drive to Play del Carmen. Its free by shuttle or the taxi is 12$. This eclectic town is filled with shops, restaurants, artists, music, everything. The beach is one block down, which I mentioned before. If we were to return to the Riviera Maya, we would stay at a small hotel in town instead of a resort. You can experience more of Mexico this way. We ate at The Blue Parrot. It does not serve Mexican food, but it was very tasty and had an awesome atmosphere. I liked this place a lot. The resort does not offer many things to do at night that includes drinking and going crazy. If you want that, I would suggest going iinto Playa. THere are bars everywhere. Or just go to Cancun. Overall, this resort is beautiful and colorful. You should not worry about the small things and just enjoy yourself. You're on vacation!!! Nothing is ever perfect, but this place was close to it. I would go back in a second (if I wanted to the resort-kinda. vacation). Bring a camera!!! Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “awful- the worst vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: klee82
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about this place and was expecting a resort that was not 100% but this place was terriable. We got there at 3pm which is when check in time is, i asked for two rooms- one with double beds and one with a king- she barely understood English so she just yesed me to death. Only one room was ready- when I asked her where it was she pointed- resorts are huge so pointed really did me no good what so ever. I asked a couple of the workers they had no idea what i was talking about so we were left to wonder around our selves to find it. Once we got to our room we got changed and went back to the front desk to obtain the key for our other room- honestly 15 minutes later- after she finally talked to me, she helped everyone else before me- everyone else that spoke spanish at least. She had no idea what i was talking about- it took about anohter half an hour to get keys and more water and a key for the safe. Once we got back to that room it also had double beds. We made it to the pool finally and found out that the walk was about ten minutes just to get to the beach/pool. We asked to be changed closer to the pool, they said that they would change us the next day but then never mentioned it again. The 2nd pool was open along with the swim up bar so that was nice. The ocean water was gross the first day but after that it seemed to clear up. The buffet area inside was so hot that it was almost unbearable- but the food was not so bad. There was no apple guy at the resort there was only one "travel person" to help us, so every morning we had to wait in line to be able to talk to him. WE tried to make reservations at the Japanese palce but they were booked. On the third day my boyfriend got a double ear infection from the water and had to go to the doctor- they charged him $80 just to talk to him and then another $100 for medication which didnt work at all. Our room was filled with tiny little bugs all over the bath room and about the fourth night I got attacked by some sort of bed bug. My legs and arms are stilled covered in honestly hunderds of bites. It was awful- my legs were all puffy and looked as though I had chicken pox or something. The TV never worked and the power went out. When we asked to be switched to a different room they said no and that there was nothing that they could do- NOTHING. We were not able to buy anything in the resort without peso's and everytime we tried to exchange money at the lobby they said to come back later or that they had run out and there was once again nothing that they could do. The main desk people only wanted to talk to you if you spoke spanish along with the entire staff. It was geared more towards people that spoke spanish then anything else. I have been to Mexcio before and never had this problem. I will never go back to this place nor do i advise anyone else to go there. They were doing construction every day in our "villa" starting very early in the morning and even casueing them to come into our room a couple of times a day.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: annoymous
Reviews.Content: First off , let me say that I am generally easy going and not hard to please, I realize that not all things are perfect and don't expect them to be. We arrived to a hot lobby and our room was not ready. We went to the dining room to eat and it was also hot. The room was hot and never really cooled down. The a/c broke twice, and took hours to get anyone to fix (breaker was thrown). Hardly any of the staff spoke or understood English. When you tried to speak Spanish they just shook thier heads. There was enough hot water for just one person to take a quick shower. The kid's club only spoke Spanish so the English speaking kids did not participate. The beach was full of some brown gunk and seaweed, and it smelled, and you could not even see the bottom in a foot of water. There was no paddle boats, or wind sails, the snorkleling equipment you could get if the dive shop they run on the premises was not on a dive and they ran tours all day and close at five so good luck. I finally got some and could not even see my hands in two feet of water. The food was not that good and the same stuff all week (Guacamole was fabulous though). The shows were ok but not great, there was very little audience particpation. The vendors on the patio were pushy to the point where I would avoid walking by them. There was no disco. I have been on all inclusive vacations before were the staff was friendly, knew you by name, and even if they did not speak really good English, if you tried to speak Spanish to them they would try to talk to you and have a coversation. They would include you and try to get everyone to participate. We do not get to go on vacations very often and when we do I expect to get what I pay for. I paid for a good time, beautiful beach, and friendly people, and I feel ripped off. As an English speaking person I guess I felt ignored and kind of left out, even though we would try to speak Spanish and particiapte. I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: 2ndgenirish
Reviews.Content: The water was green and filled with grass. The sand (if you could call it that), under your feet while in the ocean felt like muck. The pool was slippery and dangerous getting in and out. The lobby was so hot, not a fan in site, and was closed in on all but one side, not allowing any air to get in if it tried! The dining room was hot, the air not turned down enough. The food was OK but I have had much better at other resorts. The room was nice on first entering but the mosquitoes that came out from behind the shower curtain, and the closed closet door upon opening, and the patio door curtains when opening the door to place our washed bathing suits out to dry were vicious. I never had so many mosquito bites in my life. Finally, the desk clerk, who gave us a bill of twenty American dollars instead of the fourteen dollars due for the rental of a safe key. As my title states, "Won't Be Back".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Package”
Reviews.Author: tiffany0879
Reviews.Content: What an excellent experience. Everything from the poolside to the bar staff to the entertainment staff. The hotel has been through some renovations but at this point they are done. The second pool with the swim up bar and jet seats opened the second day we were there. The enterainment staff puts on great shows and keep you enterained during the day. I have never seen staff work so hard to keep you happy. The buffet dinners are beyond any buffet selection you can think of. Never disappointed by the food. Filtered water always available. The beach is raked everyday and the three a la carte restaurants are excellent, a grill, a japanese and a mexican. Beautiful service, constant enterainment and excellent service. I have no complaints. The renovations are done and I am really impressed with the improvements.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not so nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nadiakol
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews below from the travelers that were staying here th e same week i was. Not sure where they found a dirty beach. Yes there was some sea weed, due to the fact that the hotel next door( gala grand esmeralda)'s beach was dirty and full of seaweed ( their customers were coming over to mandarin to swim) - hence the bugs as well. The only problem we had is that the first night we were there, the glass shower door in one of the rooms broke and the glass was all over the floor. It took us a while to make the front desk undersand the seriousness of it and move the people to another room. Otherwise, the entertainment was better than we expected, i loved the live band that would play there every night before the show, the food was good and the mojitos were great. The beach was clean and not crowded, the rooms were nice and clean, and AC'd ( make sure the room has a remote control for the ac since the equipment is new). We showed up to the resort way before the check in time and they were ready to accomodate us. It is a relatively imexpensive hotel and for that price it is of a good value. Clean property, yes, they are having a construction going on - building of a new pool with looks cool. If this hotel changes its staff - esp the front desk service it would be great

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night trip. Mom, Dad, 10 yr and 5 yr old boys. I had also read several reviews and didn't know what to expect. Don't worry...we have been to Cancun 3 times. This was 1st time as a family and it was the BEST ever. There is only one pool (2nd is under construction) but it was a great pool (very large). It allowed us to interact with the same people everyday and was very easy to make friends. We never had to look for a lounger at the pool or the beach...they were always available. Rooms were very clean and they give you bottled water everyday (our room had a refrigerator also to keep it cold). The grounds were absolutely beautiful and VERY well kept. The bar/restaurant was great. The kids enjoyed the grilled cheeseburgers, fries and chicken nuggets. I LOVED the guacamole. (The best I ever ate). Others have complained the drinks were watered down... duh, ask for more rum/tequila. We had no issues with the drinks, they were to our liking and they also were very plentiful. However, they did not offer top shelf liquor for free. The Japanese restaurant is okay for the meal that is served in courses but I would recommend making reservations to have the chef prepare your meal on the hibachi grill. This was a good show for the kids and the food was GREAT. The buffet always had plenty of fresh food, a big variety and was good. No buffet is ever great. The activity staff was AWESOME. They were extremely friendly, knew us by name... I cannot say enough good things. They have more than enought stuff to keep you entertained. My 10 yr old got so attached to Larissa (kids club girl), he cried the night before we left and is still a little down. He has yet to remove his all inclusive bracelet. WARNING -- if you do not like construction, this is not the place for you. We did not mind as we were constantly at the pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: rhorbacker
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a package deal of 7 nights. We were a group of 6. We have been going to all-inclusive resorts for several years, all in the Cancun/Riveria Maya area. In comparison, the villas in this resort, made it much nicer than going up/down in an elevator in a large hotel. The food was above average in the buffet, and Mexican Restaurant. The Japanese restaurant was OK, but who really expects Japanese food in Mexico. All the food areas were plentiful and very clean. There were more beach chairs at this resort than most resorts. One of the bars was very conveniently located next to the pool. It is true what some people say about the drinks being watered down, however I like them like that. The friends I went with would sometimes order doubles/triples, and the bartender readily poured them. Sure, there was some construction going on, however, we knew about it ahead of time, and the employees really did a good job of keeping everything to a miniumum. Our room had a refrigerator, that was supplied with 2 bottles of bottled water everyday. The beds were definately above average for these type resorts. The air-conditioner in the room worked great. Most of the guests were about in the 30-50 year old range, which was great, no loud college kids. The pool was kept clean and was very large. My mother and her friend whom are 75/80 years old, had a little difficult time entering/exiting the pool. This resort had a barmaid that came around the beach with a platter of prepared drinks, this was certainly a nice touch. We would go back someday, however, I am guessing their prices will be higher after construction.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but....”
Reviews.Author: cszlaien
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to the Rivera Maya. We statyed here from June 17 - 25. I was a bit nervous before I left because of several of the negative reviews I read however I had already booked our tickets. The positives of the hotel are the rooms are very nice and spacious. The staff and service is good and always willing to help you with your needs. The entertainment was above average in my opinion. The last all inclusive had bad entertainment and it was outdoors, this at least had AC. The biggest con for me was the FOOD, it was horrible. I couldnt eat dinner in the buffet. All the meats were overdone and there was nothing appealing. There were only 2 restaurants open, the mexican by the pool and the japanese which is brand new. I am from NY and I know good japanese food and this wasnt it. The mexican was a better option for all dinners. For lunch I would opt for the snack bar, which has great guacamole. Breakfast was decent. If you are a food lover this is not the best place. There was significant construction by the pool and in the lobby which can be a bit distracting but it should be complete by August. The shuttles to playa del carmen were definitely good and you can get some shopping done and beach time in. The beach is clearer at playa del carmen but you get more privacy at the hotels beach. We went on 3 excursions. I would opt for not going snorkeling since there were barely any fish to see and always ask for a discount if you are booking 2 or more and remember to shop around the different tour companies. We booked through apple and there price was higher than the rest so we went for the cheapest even though they said other companies are not allowed to sell to apple tourists. If you are looking for cheaper tequila go to covi in playa del carmen, you will save some cash but remember only 3 bottles per person are allowed back (they didnt check me but better safe than sorry). Alot of cancun and mexico is still recovering from the hurricanes (wilma and rita) so it wont look as pretty as expected but all in all it was a good trip. I would say if you are a young couple as we were dont go in the summer because as we were leaving the families were coming and the resort is small. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful All - Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this all-inclusive resort from May 18th through the 21st. I had read about the construction, but being from a city where construction is 24/7 it really was not that bad. The construction is ongoing at the main pool, and most of the villas are quite a distance from that pool so we didn't hear that. They did have some minor construction within the villas, but it was not overwhelming. The grounds are gorgeous! They work very diligently to keep the landscape in top shape, and the hotel staff involved with customer service really put an effort into making our stay pleasant. The villas are spacious, clean, and pretty. I believe the colors of the resort from the paint to the landscape to the ocean make this place one of the prettiest places I've ever seen. It was also quite romantic because there were not an overwhelming number of people in one place at one time. All three restaurants were great - I suppose the only drawback was there was no where to get food late at night, so it's smart to stock up on to go food for the fridge during the day. The only food they had available was pizza for order and it was not that good. The drinks were average, (not watered down as I had read from other reviews); they pour them right in front of you. The nights were quiet and peaceful, so whether we decided to have a night on the town or relax - we had a good nights sleep. The only reason I rate it average is because of the construction - we'll be back when that's over!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were superior”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We brought 31 people down the week of Easter for our wedding. We had many concerns prior to going down due to the hurricane and reports of construction everywhere. We were pleasantly surprised that there was very little construction going on. Not once were we interrupted by trucks or work crews. The hotel rooms were modest. It was great to have a refrigerator in the room. The beach and activities were great. The concierge at the hotel was superior. She helped us arrange transportation at a good price for the wedding at Xcaret. Tables were set for a small reception when we returned. She went out of her way to make our wedding day exceptional. The food was very good. Every night there was a large assortment of fresh fish, beef, pork and chicken. Even the fussiest eaters in our group were happy. That says alot for the variety presented. I would definitely recommend this resort to people that want quaintness. You get to meet lots of peolpe at this resort. You are not treated like a room number.

Reviews.Title: “Think again before booking!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel1956
Reviews.Content: This is not a place where you'll later say that you had a fantastic vacation. It is OK, but lots of problems. First, security wasn't going to let us in at the front gate, even though we had the appropriate reservations. Then the desk clerk wasn't' going to let us check in. After some banter back and forth, the clerk "found" our reservation. Next, the card keys would not work... after 4 trips back to the lobby (which was a hike from the room) some tech guys came FINALLY arrived and fixed the problem. Later, the power would go out like 3 - 4 times. (Sort of hard to take a shower and shave in the dark!) The food was a bunch of slop. The main dining room was closed, so we had buffet upstairs where there is little ventilation or AC. All those cans of sterno to keep the food trays warm kept it way too warm to be comfortable and enjoy (ha) a meal. Some of the wait staff were rude and didn't' care to service the table. The beds were hard... sheets weren't changed regularly (We were there a week.) Had to beg to get a wash cloth. On and on. In short, the best thing I can advise is to look at other places on the Mayan Riviera. Apparently this has been taken over by a Spanish Hotel chain "H10" What H 10 means... I don't know. Maybe like a small step up from a Motel 6. Don't expect a lot from this place. I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 16 through the 23: It was a great stay. We went Easter weekend and they said they were fully booked, but the pool was never full, we Never had a problem finding a beach lounge, and the sand was racked each morning (so the beach always was clean). Rooms were clean. We had a problem with the shower and the TV and the maintenance people fixed them within 2 hours. Grounds were very clean and beautifully landscaped. Security was always present. There were 2 security guards in the beach area all day. They monitored whose was walking across the beach in front of the hotel. There was never anyone on the beach trying to sell anything. Food was good, (I think you would be hard pressed to find a “Great Buffet” at any resort). There were a lot of different things to pick from and there were enough different choices each night to make sure things did not get boring. The only construction going on is at the new pool area, and that area is surrounded by a 8 foot high fence so you can’t even see in. There is no damage/construction still going on that would be the result of the hurricane. They have 2 travel company reps that sit in the hotel lobby about 8 hrs a day. You can book all excursions through them. It is nice because you can see what they both have and then they will actually try to under bid each other (We went on a Mayan ruin trip and it started at $88 and we got him down to $65). I was disappointed that they closed the pool side bar after diner. It would have been nice to drink beachside at night. You will not be wowed by the drinks. There is a large selection of “tropical drinks”, but few were worth tasting a second time. They definitely do not over do it on the alcohol. They will be more then happy to give you additional shots, but by default you get the bare minimum. Another thing I did not like was that if you want to use the safe in the room you have to rent a lock for ($15 US). Trying to communicating with family back home was disappointing (not that this is the hotels fault, but something to be aware of). The Internet was down for 3 days, and to you a calling card they said you had to use one purchased from the hotel, and you could only use it from one of 2 lobby phone (which was loud and busy a majority of the time). Great trip…would definite give it a 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “The Must Miss Resort of the Mayan Riveria (El Mandarin)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one week vacation at this resort in Mexico. Both of us are easy to please and not inclined to complain about the little things, however... First of all the accomodations. Day one we were flooded out of our room with a quarter inch of water in the bathroom. After three trips to the front desk over a span of seven hours we finally got moved to another room. Which did not have a functional air conditioner for two nights. After which the room was adequate. Second the drinks. They were in plenty but of very poor quality. Everything was watered down and no matter whether you ordered, rum or vodka or gin or rye, it all tasted like tequila. Third the food. Current theme, bread and cheese with minimal meat, vegetables and fruit. One would think in Mexico that fruit and fish would have been plentiful and of good quality. Fourth the activities. Beware of the very unfriendly harbour staff. The use of aquatic equipment is highly restrictive and limited to thirty minutes a day per room. Fifth the day trip. Both of us have been to the Mayan Riveria before and have had great experiences with day trips. However, the one we chose this time with a company called Don Diego onboard a trimaran sailboat to Isla Mujares was of extremely poor quality for $70 USD and misrepresented as a small casual cruise at the time of booking. It was in fact a jam packed pre-school tour (hand holding all the way). Sixth and most importantly the beach. There was no reef and the water clarity was less than one meter. The beach was not soft and well tended, instead it was always full of seaweed and large pieces of coral. We spent most of our time on beaches in Playa del Carmen which were equally affected by the hurricane. Overall, this resort is by no means three star worthy and we would recommend spending your money elsewhere. In hindsight a much more enjoyable experience would have been to stay at a hotel in Cozumel and eat at the local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star at best - Full On Construction Site!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For anyone considering this hotel as a possibility - DON'T! Prior to our arrival we were assured that the hotel was fully operational and that construction was minimal. Upon arriving there was litterally a jack hammer ripping things up outside our room (even though we told them to put us as far away from the construction as possible construction is everywhere!) If you're still not deterred, make your way to the "beach" - 1/2 of what it supposedly once was due re-development and the hurricane. Murky water and people on top of each other. Not to mention that they are working on the septic system so it smells like S&*!! everytime the wind blows. As you're resting in a hammock, don't be surprised to hear the sweet sound of a busy buzz saw and the clang of a hammer. Stay clear of the bobcat that drives up and down the beach and make sure to watch out for the cement truck! (I felt sorry for the people getting married here - how grim!) When you've had enough and have finally decided that you can't stand it anymore go for a walk up & down the beach ... not pretty. Construction and filth as far as the eye can see. The grassy area by the pool was replaced by plywood to sheild the parked trucks and jack hammer. If you're looking to visit a full on smelly construction site this is the place for you. I don't know about you, but when I go on vacation, the last thing I want is to bring the sounds and smells of a busy city with me. I want to hear the crash of waves and want to be able to shut my eyes and relax without worrying that someone is going to trip over me on my 2 feet of designated real estate. Food: My dog eats better. The beef was cooked til it was black! Flies gallore. Drinks: Watered down. When we were unfortunate enough to check in we had to ask the maid or whoever she was 4 times to get off the phone so we could settle into our room. Even the shower was a disappointment - the water's not filtered so if you like salt, you'll be showering in it! Worse yet, although Air Transat finally moved us to a great resort it was a huge hassel. One employee promised we'd be moved the next day because in his opinion the place should not have been up and running in the state it was at but when we saw him the next day he told us he couldn' help us cuz it was his "day off". The other Air Transat employe hadn't ventured past the lobby and looked helpless when we complained. We wasted 2 days of our vacation trying to get ourselves out of this nightmare of a resort. Choice is yours. I'd spend the extra cash (which you will have to anyways if you're lucky enough to get moved) + spend a small fortune on cab fare to get out of this hell hole. Happy travels!!

Reviews.Title: “What to expect”
Reviews.Author: AmandaHalifax
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Club El Mandarin for our Honeymoon with another couple also on their honeymoon. We had a pretty good trip over all. There were some disappointments with this resort. At check in we were asked to sign a blank credit card slip with our information on it in case there were extra charges to our room. We declined and advised we will pay cash for any additional charges and this annoyed the gentlemen at the front desk and he threw the paper back at us. But we tried to keep an open mind. The rooms were great very clean and we got lots of bottled water. The cable was pretty fuzzy but we weren’t there to watch TV and when the TV broke they had it fixed in 5 minutes. The food was pretty good and there was lots of it but nothing was ever hot at the buffet and we were there as soon as it opened. The biggest disappointment was the construction. The Disco was closed for renovations. They were building a restaurant/kids club on the beach. At the other end of the beach where our room was they were drilling holes and by the end of the week had pile wood walls up everywhere and there went our view. The noise was not too bad but it was there. So for anyone planning on going in the near future beware of the construction. Overall it was what I would expect for a 4 star and from what I could tell there is a big difference between the 4 and 5 star resorts. The excursions were amazing we went to Coba and Emilio’s Snorkeling adventure. I would consider going back to this resort once all the reno’s are done.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to 4.5 star resorts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed from April 8-17 with 2 young children. This is the first time we went to a less then 4.5-5 star hotel. I could freely say - all that Club El Mandarin lacks is: staff fluent in English (that is OK with me- they are nice and doing the best), pool needs major re-modeling (but they are building another one next to it) and some minor touch-ups... THis is much smaller resort and we liked that you can walk back to the room in 1-2minutes or get to the lobby in less then 5 min. Rooms are as clean as in Iberostar Quatzal or Bahia Principle - where we stayed before. Grounds are also well maintainted. One thing to note is that they do not stress energy and environment savings as some other hotels in the area. There was even more lounges on the beach and around pool then there was in Bahia (which is a 5 star). I guess they are either reading the comments and working hard on being better place to stay. I am curious - if it is always windy on Mayan Riviera? Or is it only in April? Please share your weather experiences. We had 5-6 days of rough sea and so much wind that geting into water (ocean or pool) was quite challenge. And the water was cool. Fortuntely we had 3-4 days where we had less wind and could enjoy swimming very much. The smell some mentioned -is from algies. No smell in the room (we were in building 23 - next to that little 'jungle' where sometime we could smell 'something'...)

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility on a budget”
Reviews.Author: FCSteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club El Mandarin from April 10-14, 2006. It was much more than we expected. The beach was incredibly beautiful and was never crowded. There were ample lounges available at any hour. We were very impressed with the food. The snack bar by the pool had wonderful cheesburgers, cheese fries, and guacamole. There were no lines anywhere. The two ala carte restaurants did not require reservations. We ate at the gourmet restaurant twice and the Mexican restaurant once. The service was very good. Drinks were constantly offered. The buffet was also very nice. No lines and good food. People told us that the nightly shows were good, but we never made it to 9:45. We loved the rooms. They were very quiet, spacious, and clean. The water was hot and the pressure was good. Another plus was the fact that kayacks and catarmarans were available at no additional cost. The only down side that I could see was that there might not be enough for teenagers to do at night and it was a $12 cab ride into town. Since we were there with adults, we would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Silver Fpx
Reviews.Content: Exterior of buildings and grounds very presentable. Rooms are tired and require a facelift. Broken fixtures and screen door left in need of repair during stay of week. Staff friendly, meals were average. Need more beach huts. 4 star rating is too generous.

Reviews.Title: “Construction zone ahead!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Customer service was absolutely outstanding! 50% or 60% french canadian (the guests not staff) ... that was a suprise! The grounds were amazing, but keep in mind to maintain this beauty is alot of work. Starting around 8am the whipper snippers and lawn mowers are buzzing. The staff are beyond helpful and friendly. The club changed hands the second week my husband and I were there. The food was medocre the whole time with the exception of buns and pastries. The fact of no water in the rooms, power was intermitent, the disco was all torn up and inaccessable, those were just comlaints the real issue was the construction going on at both ends of the hotel, it goes on until 9 o'clock at night unless you throw yourself in front of the bobcat on the beach like I did! A couple getting married on this gorgeous property had a load of sand dumped not 10 feet away from where the preist was giving them them their vows on the beach! So if you don't mind being boxed in by the constuction while you are on the beach and don't mind being dumped on on your wedding day .... the grounds and the service are enough of an attraction. Also beware of surcharges at the bar on some liquors. The "free shuttle" you have to be there before they open, to book only 20 people.. this is for one of only 2 trips on the following day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place But....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was there for a week just got back majority of the staff are realy nice people, until a problem comes up. Management could be more attentive to problems as mine, I had my digital Camera stolen from my room valued at about $2000.00. No forced entry. Another indevidual I met had his Ipod stolen from his room as well. Management did not seem concerned not one tried to contact me about the incident. Food was ok I think a 4 star hotel like this has lots of room for improvement. Could also serve a better quality bar stock I drank alot and did not manage to get the buzz going. Over all the facility is nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Place ”
Reviews.Author: DanSer
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there from march 25th to 31st. It was my 5th time in Riviera Maya and her first. I usualy go to 4 1/2 stars so I did not expect to much. We both liked the place. We had and ocean view room (see photo). The hotel's beach is not very nice, the water is not clear and some odors make it not appealing. We took a walk every day and went swimming to a nicer place five minutes away(we did not mind). I suppose that the hurricane last fall was responsible for that. A month before, I stayed at the Barcelo and the water was very clear. If you want to sit under a palapa, you will have to get up before 6 a.m. to put your towels on the chairs. The swimming pool is not big compared to other hotels I stayed. They are in the process of constructing a new pool. We did noticed the sewer smell but fortunately it was not near our room. The restaurants were ok. The snack bar does not offer much choice so we went to the main restaurant even for lunch (had to get dressed). We tried the two "a la carte" restaurants (mexican and international) and it was average. There is a lack of ambiance there. The tables are much apart from each other and no music. They don't take reservation, you have to wait in line to get a table (first 50 peoples only). The buffet restaurant offers a good choice every day. Only once there was a theme for the buffet; it was a mexican night with the visit of mariachis. The animation was less than average; there was about six persons on the team. We didn't like the shows very much (very amateur) and the place was almost empty each night; people entered and got out after a few minutes. On the other hand there was live music outside, before and after the shows. We danced every night and it was the place to be at night. The phones started to work just shortly after we arrived. Internet is available for 14$ / hour. They also take pictures with iguana, parrots, monkey, etc. They charge 10 $/photo, but we met people that negociated it from 7 $ down to 4 $ ... Be prepared. The personnel is very friendly, especialy in the buffet restaurant. Try to learn a few word in spanish, it makes wonders. They appreciated tips but did not seem to expect it. The resort is not that big so people tends to talk to everyone. A lot of french-canadians like us were there. We made a lot of friends from Canada and the U.S. For the price that we paid, I consider that we had what we paid for. I would say it is more a 3 1/2 stars than a 4. P.S. : Construction didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place. Very well taken care of. They are always cleaning something or taking care of the gardens. We had a great time. The disco is closed for March and probably April too for renovation. There is a show nightly it's alright. The food was great for Mexico. Lots of variety. Try the upstairs restaurant very nice. (men wear slacks) Lots of activities on beach and pool area. Very friendly staff and great drinks. We probably had the room with the best view. We walked outside our room and had the ocean. With the beautiful view we had a few problems that went along with that. Our room had a horrible sewage smell. Cable went out. No telephone in room. A/C was O.K. never got real cold. We called maintenace several times to fix problems. They would take care of us by saying let me think abou this and I'll be back in 5 minutes. They never came back. We talked to the front desk and said we wanted another room and a gentleman at the front desk told us all the rooms were full. The vacant rooms were for the guests coming tomorrow and he couldn't upset them. We asked us WHAT ABOUT US? He couldn't give us an answer. Playa de Carmen was a nice town. Free shuttle at 12 and 1 for going there and Free shuttle at 4:30 and 5:30 for return. Lots of good bargains. Overall I think I would give them another chance to see if they could be better. I would love to see all the rennovations.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Fortune_Financial
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place - dormlike setting with each unit ours was unit 6 - have 8 separate rooms (250 sq ft)- food was typical buffet style - lots of repair work going on - quiet until the afternoon then the entertainment would play music that was NOT relaxing Definitely migrate into Playa del Carmen - cute town - had I known I would have stayed in the downtown area - very cute area - lots of inexpensive eateries we were fortunate that the hotel offered to move us to cancun for two/three nights - we gladly accepted

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great place for the $”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This would be a four star hotel if not for a few minor areas .... check in is at 3:00, not a minute before. If you pack a small bag, tho, w/suits, etc., you can leave your luggage in a locked room, change in the banos, and hit the beach. When checking out (noon), and your flight is later, you are allowed to keep your towels, wrist bands, etc. and put your luggage in the same room and keep on using the facilities, which is nice. Request a room in a villa near the walkways - the rooms on the perimeter are the rooms near the "creek" and have the sewer smell around them. The food is okay; the restaurant near the pool always has hamburgers for lunch along w/hot dogs, some chicken and the like. The breakfast buffet is great - why there are no spoons, tho, remains a mystery. Rooms are as pictured - spacious, sunny, big patio/balcony. No in-room coffee. Grounds are very nice - well maintained and very pretty. Pool and hot tub are quite nice. Beach is pretty nice, too. This resort is right next to a Secrets ... Secrets Capri, I think it is. Not alot around - the walk along the beach (after Secrets) is mostly empty w/a couple of new resorts going in. Not near the Playacar area - cabs into town are $12 but there is also a shuttle bus for a few bucks per person and, in fact, a couple of them (certain times only) are free. Overall, a very nice place. I was pleasantly surprised after having read some of the postings here.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at El MAndarin”
Reviews.Author: fishinmurph
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Don't stay in rooms 21-26, strong sewer smell. The place was nice, clean, friendly. Food was good. Can only eat and drink so much in 1 day. No phones or internet in rooms. Disco is closed for renovations. Chichen-Itza tour was great, Romando was an awesome tour guide.. Make friends with Baldaszar the bartender in the main lobby, ask him for strong drinks, he'll use the good rum if tipped well. Fishing trips cancelled due to 30mph sustained winds. Xcaret was a good tour as well. Don't pay more than 50% of quoted prices when shopping, this was told to us by tour guide. Nextel works, set up for international direct connect. Will probably return again.

Reviews.Title: “El Mandarin okay”
Reviews.Author: fox40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights at the Club El Mandarin (3/6/06 - 3/10/06). We love the Mayan Riviera and have been quite often, however we never stay at the same place twice. Club El Mandarin was okay - nothing spectacular but no real complaints either. I thought they were a little understaffed. Dining in the buffet, the servers only cleaned the tables. If you wanted anything at all, you had to get it yourself. The food was okay - but nothing outstanding. Even in the gourmet restaurant, it was just okay. It wasn't really gourmet. At night when we would sit in the lobby and have a few drinks and meet other guests, there was no bar staff walking around taking drink orders - we had to go to the bar and get our own. I also didn't understand why we had a mini fridge in the room, if it was only stocked with water. Other places provided sodas and even beer. I'm not complaining about the El Mandarin. We had a wonderful time, but these are little things that we missed. It's all in what you're looking for in a vacation and what you want to pay.

Reviews.Title: “10 day stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 10 days, 3/2 - 3/11. The resort itself was pretty well kept up and clean. The ground area was very beautiful, but the building air units were an ugly sight. We were with a group of 10 people. The others in my group all complained of bugs in their room, but I did not have that problem. I felt the staff worked hard and were very nice for the most part. I did however feel that they had a shortage of help. The buffet area needed more help cleaning as did the bar tenders. The pool area needs work on the cement. There was broken slabs everywhere and uneven payment which was hard to walk on and I saw quite alot of people falling, including myself. There were not enough chairs around the pool, but plenty in the sand on the beach. The food in the buffet was actually OK. There was always a variety and you could always find something to eat. The beach was very nice and big, it however was not that clear because of the hurriacanes. My groups biggest complaint was the fact that there was nothing to do at night. Once you ate dinner thay had a band playing, but it was the same thing every night. The shows started at 9:30 and were pretty lame and not worth watching. There was no towns nearby to walk to and visit. Of course if you like to drink all night you were all set. There was an awful sewage smell every day too which was sometimes bothersome. For the most part it was good, but we have decided we would not go back. It is hard to not have a good time in Mexico, but compared to other resorts you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin gave me the best week ever...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Club el Mandarin was awesome! We found fault with nothing. The food, rooms, beach, staff, drinks everything was great. Everyone there is so welcoming that it feels just like home! This resort is great for people of all age ranges. The Entertainment staff do an awesome job at keeping everyone entertained! The night shows were fun just keep in mind that they are put on by ametuers not broadway stars :) Go to the club el mandarin you will have an amazing time! In response to some complaints.... -there was NEVER a shortage of beach chairs -alcohol was not watered down -food was great -never smelt seuage -staff(bar, front desk, security etc) were all very nice and always smiled! -always had hot water and our room was always cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Manderin better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sueneal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at Manderin.Hotel was great overall.Coiuld use more staff in restaurant,as service very slow.Lots of new lounges on beach,which by the way was well groomed each day.Roberto & Rudy were great help with the tours (they work out of the towel shack).Cabs to Playa $12.each way,but you can usually share with other persons.Entertainment so-so.Shows start too late.Grounds were gorgeous,& well maintained.A little bit of repair work still going on from the hurricain,but nothing to worry about.Go with open mind and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “don't beleive the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: karen-7chicago
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week here with my boyfriend, and it was an incredible time. I've been to similar all inclusives in nuevo vallarta, and also stayed at the occidental grand xcaret last year around this time. this place is my favorite. It's not so huge and overbuilt, everyone seems to know you by the end of the week. The landscaping was incredible. The pool and beach were fine. There are a few rocks in the water, but nothing terrible. The food is just fine, there's plenty of variety. Everyone said there was a line for the a la carte, but we went at 8 every night and always got a table right away. People mentioned a shortage of chairs but they must have gotten more because we never were on the beach before noon and there were always plenty. The service was what made this place stand out. Everyone was so great and willing to help whenever you had a problem or suggestion. I loved all the restaurants -- only had breakfast and dinner -- we just drank our lunch! ;) If you're expecting the Four Seasons, I can see how then, and only then, you might be disappointed. If you want to enjoy an incredible beach, have a few tropical drinks, and relax in the sun for a week, you'll love this place. Go for it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Suekee40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Club El Mandarin Feb 3-17 - We had a great time. The staff was very friendly and accommodating - Requested a certain room - And received it - The food was great - Never got tired of it. The beach was powder! Loved the fact that we could walk for miles down the beach. The rooms were very clean and the maid service was excellent. Jose the bartender was our favorite. We didn't care at all that the phones weren't working - we were on vacation and didn't want to be bothered anyway! Met some wonderful people from Germany, US and Canada. We are definitely going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there on my honeymoon for 2 weeks..just got back and burning to write a review. Before we left we didn't find many reviews of this place and I rely on other people's opinion before I go somewhere. The first thing we encountered that bothered me was at the Cancun airport. When you're making your way to your bus, a number of very legitimate looking representatives approach you as if you are expected to go with them. They get behind their official looking posts and then bring out brochures of places to go and sites to see, all for a very reasonable rate.."better than any other deal around" they spew. Do not go with them..it's about time share condominiums; and while you may get something a little cheaper you will have to spend up to 4 hours sitting through one of their sales pitches. So the Club El Mandarin..we arrived at 11am and could not get our room until 3pm. Although this place is kept clean they just don't have enough people where they should. The buffet is crowded most of the time and the waiters are run off their feet clearing dishes mostly. The tables are usually dirty unless you get there right when they open. And the food is left out for almost 4 hours at a time..be careful to go early. I don't care how well they keep things hot..the pancakes were hardly warm so I'm guessing the meat can't be kept safely hot either..just logic to me. The a la cart upstairs has the exact same number of waiters for a quarter of the volume of people..hmmm? No reservations needed upstairs but they pretty well have 2 sittings (6:30 and 8)No shorts allowed aswell as no sandals for the guys. The Mexican a la cart down by the beach (opens at 7pm)serves terrible food. During the day that beach restaurant has fast food noon until around 5..not too bad tasting. I did have tummy troubles from day one but eased off near the end of our trip. Now here's the part that I cringe about..there are steps and stairs everywhere at this place. Everywhere! And in the 2 weeks we were there I witnessed 3 people fall badly (older and also younger people). I saw another man with a fresh gash on his leg too. I'm not normally a negative person but I have to be honest because that's what I appreciate about other reviews. The phones don't work in your room and the phones in the lobby to call out were out of order or you couldn't hear the person on the other end properly. The outings we went on through the representatives in the lobby were falsely advertised. We did go into Playa Del carmen with another couple in a taxi and that was great..watch out for vendors they always ask for twice what the item is worth..just walk away. And we rented a taxi and went to Xcaret which we LOVED!! It cost us less than the tour offered and we did what we wanted and came back when we had enough..no stupid wasted stops for shopping at ridiculously priced places. Tulum is beautiful too but we should have done that on our own too. The Transat flight was great and the Rep' Alex was very helpful. He warned us that 'there aren't any sharks in the water to worry about only the sharks walking the streets'. They don't have 5 kids to feed, they're doing very well apparently. And the bartender Jose, who I chatted with in the mornings while he made cappuccinos. He was the sweetest, friendliest guy in the world and he made our stay there pleasant..along with a few other fun guests. The recreation team can be annoying with their microphone anctics but I watched them interacting with the kids and they've 'got it'. The one show we stayed up for was very well done, they are quite talented musically. So that's it..oh and the coffee and tea machine by the bar is the hottest..the waiters typically serve luke warm coffee. Hope this was not too depressing for those of you going..we did have a wonderful time despite our surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kimdon
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 35 people stay the week of January 28 - February 4, 2006. Check-in was the best check-in every. We did it on the bus from the airport to the hotel. We arrived at 9:30am in the morning. Of course rooms were not ready but remember check in is not until 3:00pm. Everyone enjoyed the use of the hotel. Luggage was stored and check-in did start at 3:00pm and not before. Staff was friendly and helpful. The bar staff was AWESOME. Yes, they were busy and sometimes you had to wait. But your on vacation whats the hurry. Food was good. Mexican at the pool was VERY good. Never ate at the other alternative one but people in the group did and liked it. Buffet had a great mix of foods. Even my picky eater's could find somrthing. The ice cream is the BEST! The phone service was still not working. So walkie talkies are good to take. If you needed a wake up call. No problem they came to your room and knocked on the door. The showers were great and very HOT! Rooms very clean and no BUGS. TV had about 15 channels. The beach is wonderful. Yes, there is a shortage of chairs but we always managed. Playa Carmen is a excellant town to go to. This is the second group I had to the hotel in 10 months. I have had a total of 120 people and everyone would go back. Remember the staff works long days. If you want something try asking for it and you will receive it. Asking nicely does not hurt. This is not a 5 or 6 star it is a 4. The value is great and well worth it. I wil be returning with another group at the end of the year and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “First Time All- Inclusive...lets do it again.”
Reviews.Author: jrburns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El Mandarin last March prior to hurricanes...atmopshere at the resort was great with activities galour around the pool. Rooms were modest but comfortable, clean and maintained. We had a small problem with a shower faucet on arrival but maintenance crew had it repaired immediately. Food at buffet was standard a.i. faire...couldn't get a good steak unless you paid extra, in the dining restaurant the best word we found to describe the 'beef steak' they did offer was, "flubber"...the servers and staff were excellent! The small dive shop on the premises run by Vicente Fito was outstanding!! We used them for our certification and had him take us over to Cozumel for a day...excellent!! We're heading back this coming week and will be looking up Vicente for future dives. Overall, there's better things in the world to complain about...El Mandarin isn't one of them. Enjoy a modest accomodation with good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: Framate1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort with 2 of our friends from Jan.19th to Jan.26th. I found the resort itself ok. The staff was friendly and helpful . Adan was great in telling us about the excursions and which places to visit in town. The grounds were very beautiful and clean. The food was ok, I liked going to the a la carte restaurant, it was different from eating at the buffet all the time and seeing a lot of the same dishes. The nightly entertainment was great! The pool was very small and there wasn't a lot of room for chairs around the pool, had to sit at the beach all week (not that it's a bad thing). I thought that there should be more bartenders so that the line ups wouldn't be as long...you should consider bringing your own mug as the cups are very small. Our room was very clean. Had clean towels every day and hot water in the morning. The television did not work, there was no phone in the room and no alarm clock, oh well...we managed without! I think that what makes this resort a good place to go to is the animation guys & gals! They were lots of fun! Fran & Marc

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from Jan 21-28. As many others have, we had read many of the reviews and were a little weary but nonetheless kept an open mind. Some of the bad things were no telephones, no remote for the TV, every now and then encountered the "sewer smell" (only after it rained),bank machine sometimes worked sometimes didn't, also you did have to get up early to save a beach/pool chair. How badly did this affect our trip.... Nil. There are phones in the lobby which is just a short and beautiful walk away (the grounds are quite beautiful and well kept). We were not there to watch TV and spent so little time in our room to be bothered by this smell everyone writes about. As far as the bank machines, well that was inconvenient a couple times, but again not a big deal. As far as the chairs, we would take turns and one of us would quickly get up go down to the beach, put a towel on the chairs and then be back in bed, all in about 5 min, then it was right back to sleep. Some of the good things were definetely the people working there, clean rooms, good food and plenty of beautiful scenery. Everyone, starting from the front desk, to the room maids, to Baltazar the awesome bartender, to the fabulous entertainment and activities group, managed to make our stay a pleasant one. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. Loved it! Especially Cuco, Israel, Lupita, Eric, Manolo, Alex Madeline and everyone else (you know who you are)you guys are awesome. We want to thank them for making us have so much fun. Between the 3 restaurants, there are enough choices of food to not have the same food all the time. It was never cold and always quite tasty. There is enough of a variety to please everyone. The beach is quite beautiful, and although a little rocky here and there, some water shoes can fix that problem. Overall, our stay was a pleasant one. The little "quarks " we experienced did not affect our vacation. There is plenty to do, or nothing at all if you want to simply relax. Adios ! Mr. and Mrs. Mandarin Please feel free to e-mail any questions

Reviews.Title: “3 star??”
Reviews.Author: CathyNewmarket
Reviews.Content: I agree with visitor from Montreal. I was there Jan.7-14th. We had to change rooms due to the horrible sewer smell in the main hotel building. I was not amused at getting up every morning of my vacation just to grab a beach chair before they were gone. Food was ok, a lot of the same thing every day. Although the grounds were beautiful and staff helpful I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun901
Reviews.Content: I have been to Cancun six times. I love this area of Mexico. This hotel is ok. We stayed the week of Jan 21st for one week. The staff work hard, food is good, rooms are clean, pool and beach are ok. It's an ok hotel/resort. The hotel is in need of some work I believe due to it's age. It's a dated hotel. The interlocking around the pool is falling apart and uneven. You had to pay attention as you walked so that you wouldn't trip and fall. There were not enough chairs around the pool. Not enough tables and chairs around the out door bar or at the snack bar. Seceral of the pool tiles and hot tub tiles were missing. Water in hot tub is not hot. There is NO kids club. When I called to book my vacation I was advised it was available. It is NOT available. The building that housed the kids club was damaged by the hurricane and is under repair. The food was good. We actually liked the food. Rooms were clean no problems. Power sometimes went out but really was no problem. Phones in room didn't work, but we never needed the phones. Pillows were hard, but thats like most hotels. Sometimes the water was cold when having a shower but by the end of the trip water was always warm if not hot. All staff work very hard and deserve tips !!! Beach is ok. Wide beach area nice sand but, the water colour was very disappointing. It's not that nice brilliant blue nor can you see your feet in the ocean. When you go to Cancun you want nice clear water to play in. I asked a staff member why and was advised the hotel is located in a bay and the ocean water gets pushed into the bay and turns up the sand. They had a nightly band which was great ! People hung out in the lobby area and it was nice. Be prepared to do lots of walking from your room to the main eating and lobby area and than to the pool/beach area. If you are elderly it will be difficult. We had to drag our very heavy luggage from the main lobby area down a flight of stairs across the resort to our unit and than up two flights of stairs. The bus trip from the airport to our hotel took 2 hours. It might be a 45 minute drive but the tour company also had several other groups to drop off at other hotels. You may want to pay the extra and take a taxi. I would not return to this hotel for two reasons the ocean water is not clear and very sandy. You cannot see what is in the water. You step on several sharp rocks, there were crabs. Fine if there are crabs but if you could see where you are stepping you could avoid them. Secondly I wouldn't return because the place is showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club El Mandarin Jan. 14 to Jan. 21, and had a wonderful time. I think people that complain about this resort just don't want to have a good time. I had read reviews ahead of time as well and was wary about going, but decided to keep an open mind. I was pleasantly surprised with the staff, the hotel, the food, the grounds, the room and anything else that was involved. We went with a group of seven and we all had a wonderful time. We never encountered long lines at the buffet, a la carte restaurants or at the bars. We never went early to get a beach chair, and we found enough for all of us almost every day and we usually only got to the beach around noon.
