We only went to three entertainment shows in the evening and wish we would have gone to more, because we really enjoyed these. The animation team did a fantastic job with everything they did, but they were never too pushy. A special shout out to "Cuco" from the animation team. If you are going to Mexico to have fun and relax, you will love your stay. Remember you are on vacation, what does it matter if you have to wait a few minutes for food, drinks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Question/Canada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to the Yucatan Peninsula 4 times, we were very disapointed with this resort. I would class Club El Mandarin as a 3 star. Housekeeping---10-10 Food-----------7-10 Staff----------9-10 Alcohol--------4-10 Beach----------8-10 You want the good alcohol you pay. Menu is at the bar, ask for it. You can order pizza from your room, you pay and no phone lines. No phones, internet, smell of sewer in rooms, shortage of beach lounge chairs. I was bitten in the night on our last day there. Our plane landed in Canada and I was taken to the hospital. *spider bite* the little guy was hiding in our bed, maybe under the bed or in the headboard. I'm still on treatment and doing well. After speaking with different people and the resorts that they stayed at........a 5 star or better next time for us. Happy Traveling!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just returned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay at the Club El Mandarin. (Jan 7-21,2006). I had read previous reviews of this resort and talked to my travel agent as well. I had some reservations on this resort given the negative reviews but decided that I would go with an open mind and then decide. We have never travelled before so we had no real expectations- although I knew it was not a 5 star and so I was not expecting that. We arrived at 1;30 in the morning and had no problems with check in. We were in villa 3506 which was close to the pool/beach but a nice walk to the main building and such. Our room was nice-- we did find it had the sewer smell but we ended up putting in a couple of cups of water in the floor drain and it cleared up the problem. We never had any bugs and such. The Tv was a hit and miss thing but we did not come to watch TV. We talked to the front desk staff and they'd fix it right away. The room phones were not working but it wasn't a big deal to us. If you needed a wake up call the staff would come to your room at the arranged time to wake you up. It would have been nice to have a clock radio. Our villa was fairly quiet. They were doing construction on a new resort so at times you could hear the trucks and such but it really didn't bother us. The beach area was awesome, they were working on repairing the dock while we were there and it was near completion when we left. I never got bite but I did see some people with bites. You had to get up early to get a chair but I have had friends who have gone to other resorts and had to do the same thing. I don't know how resorts can improve on this other than assigning chairs when you arrive and you keep those chairs for the time you are there-- maybe they could have room numbers on the chairs. the resort definitely needs to invest in more lounge chairs. We didn't mind getting up a bit early to get the chairs. The pool area was nice-- nothing fancy. the pool bar did stay open after 6pm because they were using the snack area as the Mexican Al a Carte . We went twice to this al a carte and enjoyed it. during the time we stayed you did not need reservations. We had no problem getting in on the 2 occasions were went. We also went to the other al a carte twice-- the first time we did have a long wait but we weren;t in a hurray anyhow. It was nice to be served . My husband had the steak and it was a flank steak. I had pork tenderloins the first time and a chicken dish the 2nd time and they were both okay- nothing outstanding. You could order lobster but it was $33 US. the buffet was a buffet, there were some dishes that I didn't enjoy but how do you make 700 people happy-- you can't. I found enough on the buffet to eat but after 2 weeks you do get tired of seeing the same dishes. Yes sometimes the food was not piping hot and yes sometimes the buffet was busy but don't go right at 7pm or 12;30pm and you can generally find a table. The first week we were there it was busier than the 2nd week. I would suspect by the end of Jan into Feb it will be really busy. We never had any problems with the front desk staff. We also found that the grounds were well kepted and they were always cleaning and keeping things tidy. the lobby bar was nice but it got busy at 6pm so you had to wait a bit -but you are on vacation so does it matter. They maybe should have a few more bartenders at that time. The pool bar was busy at times as well but we'd watch for a lull in the line and then get our drinks-- it wasn't a big deal to us. nora was great and she would bring drinks down to the beach and pool area a couple of times a day. We took our own go cups because they do serve the drinks in plastic cups. The beer was draft - my husband would have preferred bottled beer. (we went into playa and picked up some beer for our rooms so it wasn't that big of a deal) I didn't find the drinks watered down as some people claim but the booze is not premium brand. The pool bar was open after 6pm so you could get a drink there and sit by the pool if you wanted. I found the nights a bit chilly and always wore a sweater or light jacket. I can't comment too much on the activities during the day because I didn't participate much. I did the stretching in the morning and I did the water aerobics. They had spanish lessions and dance lessons by the pool. You just had to listen. It would have been nice to have a posting of the activities and a scheduled time. The entertainment staff were very friendly and they mingled well which was nice. The nightly shows were okay-- we only attended 3 only because we were generally too tired to go-- they started at 9:45. We did go to the disco one night-- it started at 11;30-- a bit too late for me. It's geared more for the younger 20's crowd but we did enjoy it. We went into playa a couple of times-- we were always able to get the free shuttle but you do have to book-- I suspect in the next few weeks it will get harder to book only because the resort will be full. The cab is only $12 each way. We booked a tour to Xel Ha and enjoyed the day. We talked to a couple of people who rented a vehcile for a couple of days and did the tours on their own and it was definitely cheaper but you have to be a brave sole to drive!!!!! We also booked a snorkeling/catamaran day with Rudy from the beach- it left from cancun-- the trip ended up being cancelled because of the weather but we were able to get a refund from Rudy. But I am sure some tours you wouldn't get a refund. Additional trips are costly. I was a bit disappointed as to where the resort was-- there is only one other resort by it at this time-- Secrets Capri but they are building other resorts. apparently Club El Manadrin is under new ownership-- just recently so they are going thru a transition period. The new owners were on the resort while we were there so I am sure they are aware of the complaints/concerns. We did have some electrically issues during our stay but it could happen to any resort. We all have to remember this area was devasted by the hurricane and they are still working on rebuilding and it is a long process. We were able to keep our room until 3pm but this is hit and miss depending on how many people are checking in on that day. Check out is noon normally. We were grateful to be able to keep the room til then. We had no problems at check out time. I can't say if this resort meets the criteria for a 4 star rating because I have nothing to compare it to. I think a week here would have been suffient but it all depends on what you want to do. We might try another all inclusive but only for a week and then spend a week at a regular hotel or condo and enjoy restaurants. If anyone has any questions please fill free to email me at dgatin@sasktel.net

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star 3 at most”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there from jan 4 to the 11. The place was overbooked, the beach is not as bad as some say, just walk past the secret capris and it is fantastic. The food was not good, not tasty, not hot. Not enough bartenders, the drinks are like slush and they don''t pu alcool in... or not much. The a la carte upstairs is not good, the food tastes like if it was microwaved, the staff cleaning around is verry good, the shows at night are mediocre and my two daughters 10 and 12 never saw anyone frome the suppose kids club. If you go there i suggest playa del carmen for a day, and try Tulum and Xel Ha, fantastic with kids. From what i saw the best place to go on the riviera Maya seems to be Playacarr, thath's where we will go next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 'Great' Vacation we had planned!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a family group of 13 who had planned this vacation seven months ago. We were travelling with all age groups including my 80 year old mother. We had requested a terrace room for her as she has difficulty climbing stairs. When we arrived at about 1 a.m. the front desk had only 1 clerk to check in about 60-plus people. It was a madhouse! We had asked our travel agent to book rooms all close together. We soon found out that we were scattered everywhere and no attention was paid to our request for a "terrace" ground floor room for my mother. The clerk said to come back tomorrow and speak to his manager. We fixed this problem amongst ourselves as someone in our group gave up their ground floor room (they had requested a balcony) so that my mom could have the ground floor room. The next morning when we went to complain to the Manager. He argued with us that this should have been requested by our travel agent. He would not listen to us as we tried to tell him that our travel agent did indeed request the rooms. Next time I will bring a copy of the confirmation sheet that my agent usually sends us. Even the Transat Representative, Genevieve, who listened to our problem about the rooms did nothing in the end. She also tried to blame our travel agent by saying that she had no request for our elderly mother's request. We never heard from her again. We have never encountered this problem in our years of travelling. As in the other reviews, we confirm that the power went out almost every time we used the blow dryer, no telephones, no internet, no TV for some of the nights. The shingles were being replaced on our bungalow roof so we were awakened every morning at 7:00 a.m. by the tap tap tapping The beach chairs were gone at 7:30 a.m. We soon learned that one of our group had to go out and reserve some chairs for the day. All of these little hiccups didn't really bother our group as we understand that they had just gone through the hurricane and were trying hard to get the place back to normal. The grounds on this resort were immaculate. It looked like a beautifully manicured park. However, we thought that the food was great at the buffet! They do need more people to clean the tables and get coffee for the guests. The beach grill restaurant was good too. We ate at the International Restaurant and enjoyed the food also. The entertainment was great especially the band who played in the lobby area. The animation team shows were o.k. Despite all of the above, we had a good time! But I would not recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, still have problems due to hurricane”
Reviews.Author: joyce221
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Mandarin, overall not bad. There is still alot of hurricane damage at the hotel but the hotel is operating normally. The main beach is AWESOME with new palupa's and more sand than there was before. They have only one bar open at the beach, the other is still being rebuit. The telephones in the cabanas DO NOT WORK. There are not clock radios in the rooms either and no wake up service. The bar inside the hotel is the only one open after six PM. Food was excellent, good choices but could have been hotter. Front desk and reception was poor at best.Our kids are 13 and 16 and they recieve the same colored bands as adults. If you have booked more than one room, DO NOT EXPECT TO GET A ROOM IN THE SAME BUILDING. If you take money, US is best but the exchange rate is best in town. If you can get alot of Pesos, take them. If you have two way radios, take them.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters, aged 5 & 10 spent a very relaxing week at the Mandarin. The kids program was excellent - the activities ranged from painting ceramics by the pool to a mini disco in the evenings. The staff at the kids program were excellent - we had no worries with leaving our kids with them. We requested a room transfer - initially the hotel staff was reluctant but once we spoke to our Transat representative we were moved within two hours. The first room we had did have a faint sewage smell. The rooms were always very clean and the showers hot. The grounds were beautiful - very well kept. We did the Jeep tour of Cozumel - a bit pricey but alot of fun! Overall we had a very, very relaxing trip. We love the Mayan Riveria.

Reviews.Title: “Over Crowded Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I went to ElMandarin for a week early Jan 06 and came back pretty deceived... This is not a 4 stars but a good 3... We got there and had to wait until 5pm for our room to be available. TV wasnt functionning well, room was pretty ugly and dont even dare to take a bath in the nasty bath tub. Wall are thin so at night you can hear the music from the main resort, doors clapping or people talking outside the room. 3 days later the roof was leaking. Instead of moving us to another decent room, they decided to make us wait 3 hours in the lobby to see if they could take care of the leaking ceiling. After those 3 hours we got back in the room, floor was covered with water everywhere... They expected us to stay there for the rest of the vacation... I had to ask for a new room... Food is good but the buffet is crowded and noisy. Seems more like a cafeteria than a nice buffet place. Good thing Playa Del Carmen is not to far so we could go out there and have a nice quiet couple dinner. ElMandarin seems to really overbook their resort. I had to wake up around 6h30 am every morning to make sure we had 2 chairs available for both of us. At 7h30 no chairs left for the 300 other people. Dont lay in the sand or you'l get moskito bites all over. Water wasnt clear and the beach was full of rocks. Those were comments from most of the people we were there with... Every morning I had people taling about all the same problems we encountered... The beach chairs availability was the worst or them all... If u like overcrowded resorts, kids running and screaming around and so-so service, that place if for you! If you prefer a nice and quiet vacation with your lover with no stress or pressure then look somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Was leary but ultimately pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After many months of researching we booked this hotel,then voila the hurricane hit! We were very leary of what would await us as we have travelled in Mexico before(albeit the west coast) and do understand Mexican time.Our biggest concern is that we were travelling with a 13year old boy and did not want him to be bored.We were very lucky as in the 2 weeks we were there he met tons of buds and was pretty independent.He and his Dad went down having taken the schooling part of the diving requirements and just needed to do their open water dives.Huge kudos to Juanam and Claudia,they rock!The power in our room went out a number of times but was taken care of within minutes.Hotel staff and cleaning staff are outstanding.This is not a 5 star hotel but you know that when you book(i hate people that book at a 4 star and want 5 star treatment).Food was fine it is just me that gets sick of eating in the same place all the time.I would say the only complaint we had is that on X-mas eve dinner we sat under the air conditioning which they would not turn off so we ate and ran before we turned into popsicles!overall a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: 1habfan
Reviews.Content: Our family, 2 adults & 2 kids(12 & 14) stayed here for 2 weeks at the beginning of December. When we first arrived we were disappointed that the hotel was not fully operational. The restaurant next to the pool was without a roof and the ground was littered with logs & tools. However, it was fixed & up & running for the second week. The phones in the rooms dont work but how much do you need the phone anyway? The Guest Services was very good about letting you use their phone if required. We also found that unless we all showered before 7:30am, there was no hot water. We did mention it to the front desk twice and the next day it was hot, but after that it was always cold. We just lived with it, its so hot out anyway it was not a big deal. The night shows start at 9:45pm which we found to be quite late. Our 12yr old was kept pretty busy with the kids club & loved the young lady, Madeline that ran it, but our 14yr old was somewhat bored. He did get into some games of volleyball and soccer but overall there is not much for the teens. Our son cut his foot on some sharp tiles in the pool and we witnessed at least 3 other people who also got cut, one who needed stitches, so be careful. Wow, when I read back the review it doesnt sound very good but it was great! The maid did a fabulous job cleaning & we made sure to tip everyday rather than at the end of the week in case it was her day off. We felt much better about tipping at this resort. It was always appreciated but never expected. The staff were as friendly to our kids as they were to us. All the staff were great! We learned a lot more about the people on this trip compared to our past vacations. We dont ever go back to the same cities we've visited before but we would definately recommend this hotel. Most of the problems we encountered were due to hurricane Wilma and they are busy, busy, busy, getting it all fixed up. The only real complaints we have are with Transat Holidays but that is another story.

Reviews.Title: “great food, sensual atmosphere, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tequillasunriser
Reviews.Content: was at mandarin dec. 4 to 11. loved the staff, food, room, pool, nightly disco and theatre shows (very interactive). i was initially bummed out with the state of the shoreline. wilma has reduced the entire mayan riviera shoreline to washed-up coral debris which is painful to say the least in terms of walking on it to soak in the ocean...not the resorts fault; the ocean churns up and washes ashore new dead coral daily. but the mandarin resort itself made the holiday totally enjoyable and my best ever visit to mexico. i loved the daily catamarin sailing which is included. if you are an early riser the 5:30 am sunrise over the sea is nice. eliseo is a super food service director. teenagers will be in their glory here because of the nightlife and young entertainment staff. parents will love the place too. the moment you arrive at the cancun airport terminal avoid people who are not your official mexican holiday reps. they will be trying to sell you excursion trips and you may miss your transfer bus to your hotel as a result. wait till you get to your resort and meet your official rep there to discuss these options.

Reviews.Title: “El Mandarin, best hotel quality vs price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Mandarin from October 13 to October 20 with a friend. We had to leave a little earlier because of Wilma. I really enjoyed my stay there. Eveything was perfect. It was my 12th trip in the Carribbean and this is the hotel I enjoyed the most, even though it's not a luxury resort. The food was good, especially at the restaurant El Quetzal. I had dinner there 4 times because I didn't have to make reservations and since it was off season, there was always availability. I really appreciated that because I usually travel the first week of March when it is harder to get into the à la carte restaurants. The staff is really pleasant, the rooms are well kept, the beach is nice and there are lots of palappas. I also enjoyed the atmosphere at night with the band playing outside the lobby bar. The hotel boutiques were full of nice gifts to bring back, if you didn't have time to go shopping elsewhere. I really enjoyed my vacation at El Mandarin. I want to go back there in January with my husband. I hope that by that time they will have recovered from hurricane Wilma and will be able to receive tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in May for 5 days. I thought the place was great. The staff was always cheerful and answered any questions I had asked. The food was great both in the buffet and upstairs. When I decide to go to Mexico again, this resort is where I am going to stay for sure. Great price, great service, great food and great property.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: ottawagal
Reviews.Content: A good friend of mine and I stayed at the el Mandarin from October 13th-20th. We are two women in our early forties, who have both travelled a fair bit in the Caribbean.(I think this was my 11th all-inclusive trip). Although I have stayed at more glamorous resorts than the El Mandarin, I must say that I enjoyed it very much. Here is a bit of a breakdown of my observations: Beach: I am a beach lover, so a nice beach is important to me - and El Mandarin delivered. I am also very light skinned, and burn easily, so having shade is important. I think I counted approx. 30 palapas on the beach - more than adequate to cover the needs of clients travelling in the off-season. Food: This is always subject to great disagreement by travellers. I found the food good (not excellent, but good)with plenty of choice. The main buffet restaurant has theme nights every night, and we enjoyed this. As a previous reviewer noted, the buffet restaurant has exceptionally good ice cream (more like gelato actually). Coconut, chocolate and maple walnut were out of this world! Pool: The pool was certainly adequate to the needs of clients, but was not overly large or glamorous as you might find in newer resorts (i.e., like Iberostar Paraiso, where I stayed a few years ago- that is an amazing pool!). Evey second day I took part in the water aerobics classes, which were good fun, and it got me up off my beach chair. Room: Our room was very good - clean spacious and comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well as did the television. The room was cleaned well every day. No complaints here. The grounds/layout of the resort: This is something I especially liked. The resort, as others have noted, is extremely clean and the grounds well-maincured with beautiful flowers and shrubs. The lobby is spacious and has a fair of amount amount of seating (they could do with a few ceiling fans, though. The lobby bar is large and L -shaped and if you go to the end nearest the buffet you will find a coffee maker, as well as a self-serve selection of brandy, cognac, tequila, amaretto and xabentun (licorice - flavoured liqueur, which is excellent). I thought this was a wonderful touch. You could also get a great capuccino at the lobby bar. Due to the fact that is was the off-seadon, we never waited more than a minute or two for our drinks - bar staff was very pleasant at all times, and we tipped them occaisionally. The thing I enjoyed the most about the resort was the kind of open air terrace that they had just outside the lobby. You feel as though you are in an open air plaza, with tiled floors, and wrought iron tables and chairs. A fabulous Mexican band played there every evening, and many people got up to dance.Waiters also came out from the bar to take your drink orders. You can walk the length of the resort from reception desk to beach in about 6 minutes - which further added to the friendly casual atmosphere of the place. Staff and Service: We thought that the staff were very polite and friendly, and we never encountered a problem.The animation team in particular, really when out of their way to get you involved in activities, but did so in a friendly, not pushy manner. One day a member of the team came to our beach chairs to give us a spanish lesson - we really liked that. We also tried out the salsa and merengue lessons. The waitstaff, barstaff and others were equally pleasant - no problems there. As a general comment I would very much recommend this resort for its overall quality, comfort and casual but friendly atmosphere. I do think however, that due to its size, it might be too small to adequately accomodate a high-season crowd. I would also not stay there in the summer months due to the fact that the public areas would be too hot (no ceiling fans in the buffet and lobby as others have noted). As a final note, I wanted to mention that our tour company moved up our flight due to the impending arrival of hurricane Wilma. Our thoughts are with the guests and staff who may not have been able to leave. Whatever damage this beautiful area sustains, I know that it will recover quickly and be ready to welcome back visitors from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “i love it¡¡¡”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i love stayed on this hotel i think this is not a very elegant hotel but it's perfect for a few nigths. i hope come back some day...and i think i will. the staff was great with me and my family....and also the food was good, and the show every night...good. i sure recomend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Excellent relation price/quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed during 2 weeks in Club El Mandarin. We were 7 persons and 1 baby. Everything was OK for all of us. It was quiet but we did not get bored. I would recommend it for everybody : with or without children. Excellent animation, food OK, cocktail delicious, extra clean ...

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: kenfVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip down to the Cancun/Playa region and I have stayed at hotels ranging from 3 stars to the 5 star Royal Hideaway so I believe that I have a good background to properly judge the quality of this hotel. I must say that I was pleasently surpirsed by the Club El Manadarin. Based on the many critical reviews previously written, I wasn't expecting much. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were pretty standard but very well cleaned on a daily basis. The maids fully mopped the floors every day which was good for us as we had a 14 month old baby who liked to crawl around on the floor. Don't be discouraged by the negative reports on the food. The food was good and I don't know what they could of done more with the buffet (tones of selection). I noticed food inspectors regularly checking the temperature of the food and checking for it's freshness. I never got an upset stomach which was a first for me down in Mexico. The ice cream was absolutely amazing better than the gelato I have had in Italy. The food servers were pleasant and helpful too. The a la carte restaurant was ok but nothing to rave about as we mostly ate at the buffet restaurant. The beach is fabulous and even better if you walk for ten minutes to the south. Yes, there is some sea weed but who cares as it is a beach!!! On the negative side, there were tones on mosquitos and little black flies (obviously not a fault of the resort) and I got bitten to death. You must bring bug spray. Also, they are stingy on leaving bottled water in your room. Also, the plastic drink cups are small. The lobby and restaurants can get a little hot due to the lack of A/C. In conclusion, don't be discouraged by the previous negative reviews as I guess there are many people out there who need to complain. Make the most of your vacation and you will have a great time at the Club El Manadarin.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, WILL RETURN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one week. It was the best. The food was great. The service was amazing. I loved it so much. It's not a place for below the age of 25. It's a relaxing place. People still drank, but nobody was acting like two year olds. It's in the 25mins from cancun and 15mins from playa del camen. So we where close to the cities, but not too close for the wilder areas. We are looking forward to the next visit. Clean rooms, great food, shows where fine, pool clean, beach wonderful. You would be crazy not to give this place a try.hot tub small, but who wants a hot tub in that kind of heat!! go see the dolphins and go diving or snorkling, it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKING FORWARD TO A RETURN VISIT :)”
Reviews.Author: Chamomile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are looking foward to our third trip back to Mexico and our second trip back to Club El Mandarin. We took a chance last March and spent two weeks in the Dominican at a 5 star. The only differents was we had champagne at the 5 star. The food at Club El Mandarin was much, much better among other things. Looking so forward to Jan/2006 :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury resort but a good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: lquinnie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Club El Mandarin in April 2004. The grounds were immaculate and rooms very private with beautiful garden views. The staff was very courteous and accomodating. The breakfast buffet and meals at the restaurants were also very good. The snack bar by the beach was unimpressive, although they did have a constant supply of fresh chips and guacamole, which was excellent. Prior to our trip, I read through all of the posted reviews and I must say that a lot of the negative comments were unjustified. (Some travelers will always find something to complain about.) For example, many reviews mentioned a foul smell throughout the grounds. In reality, this smell was neither overwhelming nor offensive. In fact, had I not read about it, I would not have even noticed it, as it was a smell typical of a bay or beach. The one and only disappointment was the beach: a lot of debris on the shore and in the water, making it very murky and unsuitable for swimming or snorkeling. It was near impossible to find a beach or pool chair, let alone an empty hammock. There was also not much shade in the beach/pool areas, and when you have skin as fair as mine, this can definitely be a problem. Luckily, my boyfriend and I are not much for the beach scene and spent most of our days outside the resort. We loved the town of Playa del Carmen, which has a nice promenade with excellent restaurants and shops. The beach in Playa del Carmen was beautiful. You can catch the ferry to Cozumel right in town, which I highly recommend doing if you are interested in good snorkeling. Other day trips I recommend are Coba/Pac Chen and Tres Rios, an ecopark located within a few minutes' walk up the beach from Club El Mandarin. Overall, Club El Mandarin was an excellent value for the money, and it suited our purposes just fine. Again, not luxury, but if you are on a budget and looking for a reasonably nice place to stay and don't mind the condition of the beach, Club El Mandarin is a good choice. If I go again, I'd prefer to stay in town. However, if your main goal is to be pampered, lay on the beach, swim, and soak up the sun the entire time, this may not be the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “El Mandarin is average”
Reviews.Author: Csora2547
Reviews.Content: If you have never been to an all-inclusive in Mexico then this hotel would be OK. There are many that are better out there, but this one is OK, especially if price is a major consideration. The food is average but plentiful. The rooms are large and nicely furnished. If you had children with you the rooms would be good because of the size. The facilities are OK. The water at the beach was disappointing because it was not crystal blue like at other hotels we had stayed at in Playa del Carmen. What we found most disappointing were the people that worked there. The attitude of some of the employees needs improving. We found one young man at the front desk to be delightful and very helpful...we also found a young woman who seemed to find it a great deal of trouble to do much of anything there. The person in charge of setting up weddings at the hotel was a little scattered and not that helpful. The wedding coorinator that the hotel uses. Laura, was great and worked really hard to make sure everything turned out well for the wedding we had there. A word of caution!!! This is not a good place if you have older people in your party that have trouble with stairs. We had several older people that ended up staying in their room most of the time because they couldn't get around. We had to deliver their food etc. because the stairs to the dining room were too much. The hotel does not have a wheel chair on hand. I would not choose this hotel if I had older people in my party. Also, there are no fans in the main dining room or lobby so it gets really warm in these areas!

Reviews.Title: “Club el Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: schmoopy
Reviews.Content: No A/C on the first day. Hotel staff was only helpful when this wheel got very squeaky. Staff seemed to avoid assisting with hurricane questions. Main eating area was unbearably hot, and there seemed to be no rhyme or reason to when they would open windows or turn on the A/C. Ate at the nice restaurant upstairs and got sick... not our favorite experience on the Yucatan. Pretty awful, actually. We would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the club mandarin july 13th -15th (short due to hurricane emily). like other reviews we viewed some of the same problems from previous reviews. first day was the 13th and had no problems checking in and had a welcome drink (that was great) they explained and reviewed their hotel and what went on. we stored are luggage in a secured locked room and headed for the pool. are room was not going to be ready till 3pm. the pool was ok not spectactular by any means, warm but clean. the pool needed some attention such as new tiles around the pool and most of the underwater lights were just hanging into the pool. there is no swim up bar so you had to go to the pool bar and order drinks, they were good with no lines. the pool resturant was ok with hamburgers and hotdogs. the ocean was cloudy and smelled real bad like rotten eggs. some of the stone ledges that border the beach needed repairs. the beach and palpas were nice and water sports were nice. we rented a waverunner for $55.00 a half hour. many women were topless on the beach and made my kids wondering. our room was nice and clean. the view was a creek with thousands of blue crabs all over,but never bothered us much. we did notice a window screen in the tree behind us? the buffet was ok some food good ,some bad but overall fine. the water is purified and never got sick, nor my family also. they had shows that were ok and dont forget to bring long pants and closed toe shoes if you want to go to the restuarants. the grounds were ecceptionally clean. freddie the apple rept was great with tours and getting us out of there in time before hurricane emily hit (and it did) their procedure was if you stay, or were stuck during a hurricane you will be staying in the theatre with others without air and power.(so i decided to leave asap) the resort was nice but not a 6 star resort. we would of liked a better (well known ) resort better. won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off we came home sick sick sick! The food was not good and if you want US standards for food prep- look somewhere else. The buffet restaurant is so hot you literally sweat while you eat. And they can't keep cold food cold due to the heat- why they have no air or fans in there is beyond me. Ask many many questions when looking at tours, there's where we got sick! The golf cart trip through cancun was dangerous and a couple of people's broke down- they were left on the side of the road and told someone would be by for them! For lunch- which was marketed as a gourmet meal was hotdogs, slaw etc, None of the cold food was on ice! Getting back to El Mand- the entertainment was fair- we were asked to be a part of the 70's show- well we were the majority of the show as well as the other 8 or so people asked to help. Basically we danced on stage looking like fools while the cast changed clothes- the audience looked dumb-founded. While it's cool to get audience participation- being in the entire show, sweating our ya know what's off, when we are supposed to be on vacation enjoying being entertained- not cool! The rooms were nice- it rained our entire stay. Not hotels fault but... took 2 dats to get our TV working, 3 days to get an extra pillow, and never got the "free" water bottles each day. The staff was courteous... as long as you know Spanish- otherwise you are S^&% up a creek! Our flight home was not until 8pm so we went to pool and beach for the day- was told we could shower in lobby locker room. No towels available- had to ask 3 different people- one of which was a manager and he told me to ask someone else!!!! I will not be back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Was Expecting”
Reviews.Author: cjracing37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club El Mandar the week of July 4th. They advertised stocked refrigerator in room. This is not the case you get two bottles of water and if you want soda and more water you have to buy them. This defeats the purpose of all inclusive. Also advertised safe in room but forgot to mentioned you had to pay for it, two dollars a day a must well worth it to keep money and documents safe. Hotel had beautiful grounds except main lobby and buffet restaurant was not air conditioned which is not a problem is they would have had ceiling fansn. Very uncomfortable eating. Bugs - bring plenty of bug spray. Very disappointed with the pool - only one pool for alot of guests. They also cleaned the pool while people were swimming in it. This was really nasty has they were scrubbing off mold and mildew and big hunks of black mold and mildew were being pushed into the pool, not picked out with a net or put into the filter but pushed into the pool. This stuff was floating everywhere and kids were trying to swim. What a horrible mess. Also not enough staff, pool area had trash laying around, falling into the pool, I even found cigarette butts in it. Should warn you about the beach, BIG disappointment, I have been to Mexico several times and have never seen a thing like it. Seaweed everywhere. They worked hard on clenaing it up - which I could live with. No visibility this is an inlet so the beautiful water you are expecting to see you won't see here. I had to pay to go to another beach so my son could see what the water is supose to look like. It stunk like sewage, don't know what was in it and didn't want to find out. Wished someone would have given me a heads up. I definitely will not revisit this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Old Saying: "You get what you pay for!"”
Reviews.Author: beachbum01Texas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Mandarin from July 7th - 10th. We go to Mexico once or twice a year. To the point: Grounds: BEAUTIFUL! yes there was a sewage smell every once in a while but we beleive it was more or less stagnant water thus mosquitos/bugs. Mosquito/Bug probem: No more than the other places we have stayed at. Remember- you are OUTSIDE most of the time NOT inside so WHY would bugs be a shock? Bring bug spray for the evenings and you will be fine. Room: GREAT VIEW! We were blessed to be in building 12 RIGHT on the beach. Best room view we have ever had while in Mexico! Electricity went out and they had it back on within five minutes. A/C was great! Food: So So-- Nothing really outstanding although they did have some wonderful soup such as their Creamy Cucumber! The fine dining place took two plus hours to eat at. IT IS NOT WORTH THE TIME OR FOOD unless you want to eat some place cool. We had also planned on lobster or steak. They wanted $38 for lobster and $24 for steak. Other AI's we have styed at lowered the price by taking off what the original meal would have cost ($18 and $12 respectivally) We were surprised that the main buffet place was so hot! It had huge sliding doors which were never opened-- and nothing to help move air about. Other resorts we have stayed at that were not air conditioned had fans or were open for a breeze. Again not horrible-- but not exactly comfortable. We did notice that on the weekend it seemed as if they had turned on the air. Shows- The singers on the patio were very good-- the entertainment-- WELLLL...how bored are you? We went international night and one of the songs played a dancer came out dressed in leather /studded outfit with a collar being held by another dancer (masochist style). If I had been a parent with young children I would have been ticked. BELEIVE ME I AM NOT A PRUDE LIKE THIS SOUNDS! Drinks: Good strong drinks and plenty of water. But this is part of the "Get what you pay for"-- YOU have to BUY extra alchohol/soft drinks for the fridge in your room. Other AI's have your fridge stocked. All you get here is two bottles of water a day in the fridge. Again.. you get what you pay for! Service: EXCELLENT when someone was there to provide it! They seemed under staffed. It was also obvious that the resort tended to cater to European/South Americans. Actually NO problem except for the singers/performers/waiters tended to cater to them language wise. I know a small amount of Spanish and have not ever had this type of language barrier at other resorts. BOTTOM LINE-This was a nice quick vacation for us. Value was equal to our money spent with the exception of not having a stocked fridge. Beach area was beautiful and Hurricane Dennis missed us -- Great few days in Paradise at an average resort. As someone else said, "YOU MAKE YOUR VACATION-- NOT THE RESORT!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for R & R”
Reviews.Author: QOHweddings
Reviews.Content: First let me say we booked less than 30 days out and got a great deal.... so you really tend to be more impressed if you've paid less. Flight: Apple Vacations really disappointed us...we booked on line, got all of our documents and when we got to the airport they had oversold the flight (USAIR) and had no seat for us, with the next flight not leaving until the following morning. We were 4th and 5th on the wait list and due to some people missing check in got one seat...not sure how they came up with the second seat but we got on. Trip to Resort: No problems - other guests who had stayed there before got driver to stop for Corona on the way so we started the trip with beers! Resort is beautiful, great gardens, well kept, the check in was smooth and the people are very friendly, rooms were spacious and clean - few TV channels - but I can watch TV at home. AC and power went out for a few hours the first night but came back on by the time we were ready to crash...I think this is more a function of the outdated power grids in the region not the hotel. Food at the buffets was very good, plentiful...if you are there for a week and don't leave the resort you will get tired of it...they always offer rice, beans, pasta, tortillas - but they do a pretty good job of mixing it up. Listening to previous reviews I expected the Animation Team to be dragging people out of the pool, the music to be like lounging in a disco and the pool to have an oil slick.... NOT THE CASE - they were friendly but not pushy, the music was moderate and the pool was clean. Beach is beautiful, can literally see fish swimming at your feet, they will swarm around you if you feed them bread. People were cleaning up the seaweed all day.... hey it's a BEACH, get over it. Plenty to do, plenty of cocktails, friendly staff we'd definitely go back.... Our other recommendation is "FAT CAT" - this catamaran trip was great, snorkeling, sun, good food.... we booked through the travel agent in the lobby (we chose not to use Apple) Our other trip was the day trip to Chitzen Itza - great tour, booked again through the agent there - it's run by Cancun Lines - they were great and saw a lot before we got there too. We went for R & R, had time to rest and still had a great time

Reviews.Title: “So So ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here are the facts .. Raw sewage smell at certain part of the resort including the beach. Hold your nose as you walk from the pool to the lobby. Expect power outage and AC problems. We had no ac the first night and the whole facility lost power on June 30th for about 7 hours. The power did not come back on till 10PM. Main dining facility is hot, food is ?able, and often run out of glasses and ice. Service and wait staffs are limited so waiting for a drink at a table could take a while. Your best bet is to wait at the bar. The upstairs restaurant does have AC but the food is also ?able. Prepare to wait unless you come very early since there is no reservation. The rooms are clean but the one we had smelled like an ashtray. The night shows are pretty lame but the good part is that it's only about 30-40 minutes long.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful place I have ever seen, perfect for a romantic vacation. Not with boss like I went with. The people are very kind and will go out of their way to make you feel special. The food was wonderful, a little different than what we are used to over all, wonderful. The ocean front is just beautiful and so blue it is what a country girl dreams about. The rooms are really clean and spacious, we got lucky with an ocean front view, really the greatest. Maintenance was on top of things, we had a couple of problems and they were repaired immediately, we didnt have to wait like I have had to do at some hotels. I would love to go again with my boyfriend, I think it would be alot more fun and I know it would be alot more romantic. The beach at night is so beautiful that is really like a fairy tale come true. The greatest experince of my like was going to Club El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: romusik
Reviews.Content: Good: - Very nice and friendly people in main restaurant. - Beautiful landscape - Free activities: catamaran, wind surfing and ocean kayaking. Make reservation in advance for catamaran, wind surfing and you have to take free lesson before going for catamaran, wind surfing. - Volleyball court is right on the beach. - Mexican band at night in the main lobby - great music. - Good bar and service in the bar OK Beach – small, but clean. Entertainment – middle school level ( but fun), but once a week is really nice Mexican dancers. Bad Main Restaurant, where you will have all buffet-style meals, does not have AC. It’s still OK for breakfast, but for lunch and dinner is getting VERY hot in summer. One restaurant, which is open only for dinner has AC, but food is far from the best. We went once and did not want to come back. So if you cannot handle really hot temperature in the restaurant, do not go there in summer. Swimming pool is located right on the beach. From 10 to 6, there is very loud music (hard rock). So if you want to relax and listen to the ocean, this hotel is not for you. Before 10 and after 6, it’s very calm and peaceful. AC did not work in our room only last 2 days. They sent a technician to fix but he was not able to fix it. We called at least 10 times and ask front desk for another room for one night. They said they do not have any clean room and they cannot give us the dirty room. We insisted and they finally at 2 in the morning gave us a clean room. So if you have problem you have to strong out there :)

Reviews.Title: “Worst all inclusive I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned home last night from a 7 day stay at El-Mandarin. It was by far the worst place that I have ever stayed. There were a few bright spots, such as the lobby was very pretty, the entertainment staff were nice, and the grounds were well kept. - The rooms need to be renovated. We only had hot water 2 days when we were there. Our TV was broken for 4 days. There were bugs all over the rooms. We had no AC most of the time. We lost electricity 4 days that we there. The beds were like sleeping on rocks. - The restuarants and food were sub-par at best. For an all inclusive resort we could only get food until 10:00 pm. The service was absolutely terrible. We had to wait over an hour just for a cheesburger and fries. The buffet night was replusive. The food was cold and or tepid. I suggest eating an omlette in the AM. Besides that the room was absolutely stifling! There was no AC in the that room. - The beach was nice however make sure you bring bug spray. We were eaten alive by sand fleas and mosquitos. -The entertainment staff was nice but they really do not have many things for the kids to do. If I heard Tone-Loc one more time at the pool I thought I would drown myself or the DJ. Suggestions and or tips. -Bring bug spray -Bring snacks for your kids -Brings something to do for the kids like board games and toys. -Make sure that you have lots of $1.00's, everyone is looking for a hand out. -Taxis are very expensive. Shuttels only leave at noon and 2:00. -You can not use Credit cards or charge to your room at the gift shop. -Try the Rum Punch!, Very good. -Bargain with the street vendors at the hotel. They are very expenvie but will bargain. -Get up early and save beach chairs. -Room safe is $2:00 extra per day. Go to Xel-Ha and swim with the dolphins, it was by far the best part of our trip. If you have stayed at an upper scale all-inclusive like the Palace resorts or Beachs/Sandals you would be very, very disspointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation! Very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from 1 week vacation at the Club El Mandarin. We were very pleased with the resort. Our room was very clean and was located very close to both the pool and the beach. It was a 5 minute walk to the main lobby, but a very enjoyable walk since the grounds are just lovely! Don't be surprised if you see an iguana sunbathing along the way! They are shy, and will run off if you approach them. It was extremely hot and humid all week (high 80's - 90's) but our room AC was always working and there was almost always a balmy breeze on the beach. For those who complained about the drinks being "weak" or "watered down" -- we are not big drinkers, but we did not have that problem! However, we tipped $1 USD every time we ordered our drinks, and made sure that we had the tip in our hand in plain sight when we placed the order! Trust me, you will get good drinks! We found the food okay, but not exceptional! We ate most of our meals in the main dining room. We are not big meat eaters, so for us there was plenty at the salad bar and always fresh fruit! If you have a sweet tooth, there are always plenty of desserts to choose from! And always ice cream, which was very good... many flavor choices! Our only complaint with the dining room was that the sliding glass doors all along the terrace side (facing the turtle pond) were always kept shut. This didn't make sense to us, especially in the evening when there was a nice little breeze on the terrace. We felt that the staff went out of their way to take care of us! They are very hard working people, and very much appreciated our tips! All and all, we were very pleased with Club el Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation :)”
Reviews.Author: LakeSimcoeFan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I bought 7 days all inclusive in this hotel. Thanks to other reviews on this site, we chose El Mandarin and it turned out to be the best desicion. As we spoke to people on returning flight, many complained about dirty rooms, bad food and water, long waits, ignorant personnel, you name it. We on the other hand had a beautiful time! 1. People are friendly, entertainment team was funny and made everybody feel alive and free to do little crazy things. We had water aerobics, Spanish lessons, salsa, merengue, little contests. Live band. Silly-funny shows every night - my daughter liked them, I preferred tequilas. 2. Food was excellent and different, except breakfast that was the same every day except cookies and pastry. Wonderful cakes, I still feel my extra pounds LOL . Dinner menu was great, both mexican and international, fresh juices, PURIFIED water. Yes, despite all the warnings, we had no issues with water. Drinks were good too. 2 a-la-carte restourants, one of them I visited and loved their fish stuffed with seafood. 3. Playa del Carmen was close and once a day the transpotration both ways was free. A lot of silver and semi-precious stones, perls , opals, etc for a good price. 4. warning - internet and film for the camera are expensive. Bring your own film, and forget about WWW - it's good for your mental health :)))

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from El Mandarin 2 days ago, and were completely impressed by our experience there. There were 3 families, all with kids in our travel party. Our hotel selection was made, largely with the help of reviews on this site. Thanks to the large number of helpful accurate reviews (there are some surprising negatives, but even those (with coherent spelling at least) seem to have legitimate, albeit minor gripes). My wife and I are from Europe, but have lived in US for over 15 years. This was our 5th visit to Mayan Riviera, first time at this hotel. We would recommend El Mandarin, and will probably visit again some time. Entire staff was extremely friendly from front desk checkin, to water sport/scube centre (even Edgars gruff sidekick). Clientel was very cosmopolitan (German, British, French, Belgian, Canadian, even a few Americans). This was a good thing, especially for us expats, making it feel like we were back in European resort. Overall friendly bunch, some radical dress/swimwear choices (or lack thereof) Overall resort is extremely well maintained. Spacious open reception, Bungalows freshly painted, gardens spectacular and well kept. Internally rooms were very nice, but not perfect. Pool area is a little bit worn, but Palapa were being reworked, as was some poolside tile during our visit. Overall, there were slight signs of aging, but no areas of neglect. We were pleasantly surprised in this regard, having read some review comments. Food was good overall. A lot of variety in buffet, but similar every night. Mexican resaurant by pool was quiet, but still slow for dinner. Breakfast and lunches were fine. Our party could not get into a la carte restaurant because of long trouser/closed toed show dress code (our poor planning). Poolside lunches were tasty, albeit a little greasy looking. All 11 in our party got through 5 days of eating without tummy incidents, and kids in particular found something they could all enjoy. Drinks were as good, or better than any other Mayan resorts we have visited. Any beer you like as long as its Corona (not too bad), knockoff brand liqours that were fine. Activities were good and frequent. Watersports excellent (hobie cat use included was a nice touch). Poolside eurpop was a bit grating after a while. Staff were very eager to get crowd involvement in pingpong, basketball, soccer, dance lessons, etc. We had mixed attendance for the evening shows, which did seem very late (9.45pm seemed a lot later down there). Staff did put huge amount of effort (same crew doing early morning activities, who were performing in evening shows). There are a few negatives, but these were for the most part minor. We had AC drain clog in our room on 2nd day, and caused some minor flooding (2 beach towels was enough to absorb the drips from AC wall unit. Repair guy showed up quickly and fixed problem. This was not a big deal, but could have been disaster if we had anything sitting under AC unit (I moved my ipod just before water came in)... Beach was very nice, but waters a bit too rough for snorkeling (sand being kicked up). This was the ONLY item that left us longing for our prevous Cozumel resort. Probably single biggest concern was overall cooling of public areas in resort. Air conditioning seemed minimal in restaurant, and ineffectual in lobby (completely open air on two sides). Our family have a pretty high tolerance for heat (spending a lot of the time in our backyard in Austin, Texas), but would probably only consider this resort outside of midsummer heat. I would recommend El Mandarin. Its not perfect (I have not visited a resort in Americas/Europe/Asia that is). Our family got more than we expected for the price we paid. The kids would go back tomorrow, I will probably wait till Xmas...

Reviews.Title: “what a trip !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a Smooth trip we had. From start to Finish. It was GREAT ! Flight from Philly was good - which was a awesome start. LOL. Then the ride from the airport to the resort was a little SARDINE like thru Apple Vacations, but it wasn't a long ride @ all. Maybe 25-30 mins. Depending on how many stops the "bus" makes before your resort. I'd take a TAXI next time --- it may cost about $20.00 but worth it !!!! we were there EARLY so our room wasn't ready -- but that was ok. we headed to the Beach with our carry on and put away our other luggage in a safe place with the hotel. It was a cloudy day, so I didn't apply sunscreen - SILLY me, I got a little burned. NOTE TO ALL : you need lotion no matter what the sky looks like -- the sun there is STRONG !!!! i was told that and I didn't believe anyone .... LOL. About 4pm, we went to see if the room was ready - and it was. we were in 2608, 2nd floor cute 2 bed room near the pool and beach. The walk to the front lobby area was about 3-5 mins. but the walk to the pool was 30 seconds. the Grounds are BEAUTIFUL !!! they really take care of them. Lots of pretty flowers and well groomed bushes. It really is noticable how well they look !!!!!!!!! The bathroom didn't smell like Sewer water like others said it did -- we were nervous about that. It was a VERY cute and comfy room ALL AROUND !!! our first day there for breakfast, lunch and dinner - we ate @ the Mexcian PLace which is outside. Very Convienent to the POOL. Pool Bar there. NO SWIM-up BAR like one of the reviews said there was ! WEIRD !!!! it was ok though. it really was close enough. The food is AVERAGE. If you are expecting HOT and kick butt food --- you are in for a surprise. ITS AVERAGE !!!! not great, not awful. I am a picky eater, but was able to eat all 3 meals with a variety all week. The entertainment thru the daytime is GREAT and at nitetime is COOL, toooo. They want to keep you busy -- trust me. They are all soooo friendly and kind there. I was there 4 nites and 5 days with a girl friend. 2 single young girls there to RELAX and get tan = what we got !!! Minus the one and a half day of rain .... it was ok though, we SHOPPED !!!! If you want to PARTY -- there is not the place. You need to stay in Cancun !! and if you are looking for crystal clear water, there is not the place either .... its cloudy like colored water. Nice, but not as clear as i was expecting. there was ALOT of seaweed which was GROSS --- but they cleared it every AM !!!! what a job to have. LOL. OVERALL, I had a good vacation. I got what I wanted out of it !!!! I'd go back to Mexcio === but I'd stay in Playa Car, I am told that is beautiful. (p.s. topless is optional, so let the Ta Ta's hang loose. LOL) thanks for an awesome vacation, SANDY !!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Whole family loved Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Club El Mandarin and had a wonderful time. We snorkeled, sailed, swam, shopped, ate, drank, danced, exercised, went to shows, played volleyball and went on an ATV tour in a jungle. I don't know where the folks who gave the earlier bad reviews were or what they expected, but they weren't at the same place we were. We, too, have traveled a bit and were very pleased with everything, especially considering the price. It goes to show you how people's opinions differ. The staff, service, electricity, and grounds were all great. The rooms were really nice. Everyone there works hard to please you. Just say "Hola!" when you see them and "Gracias" when they take your plates or bring you food. The food and drink were good, not great. The "Animation" staff were the best! They work from 9AM til midnight with activities and programs. Do not miss the "Tribute to the Blues Brothers"! The only thing disagreeable was the ocean water, which was cloudy sometimes and had seaweed in it. The people who go there are from all over the US, Canada, S. America, Europe and Mexico, and are there to have a good time. There are couples, families and many unattached girls and women, but not as many men. We will go back again for another stay, and take another family with us to enjoy it. Cheers! PS Even though your all inclusive is supposed to pay for tips, a buck or two once in a while is a nice thing to do. It goes a long way in Mexico and the staff work very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back in this lifetime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on the resort before leaving on vacation and was frightened. However, the A/C worked, there was no sewage smell in our room, and the shower water was hot. If you have booked a stay with them already, you will survive. If you are debating on staying here - only do so if the price is very cheap (under a $1,000 total - I paid $807 which included taxes and airfare). The food - I ate in the main restaurant in the lobby area. The food was fine. I did eat quite a few french fries to fill me up though. Their meat selection was decent and the ice cream was good. The drinks - I'm over the party days, but drank a few mixed drinks - horrible. I didn't drink any beer, but it's probably the better option here. The mixed drinks tasted like kool-aid. The staff - The staff at the resort are not friendly. The entertainment staff pretty much walked around trying to look cool. They were really not friendly. The activities - lame. Kids would probably dig it though. The beach - There was seaweed, but it was cleaned up every morning. There were quite a few cigarette butts in the sand. The beach smelled like sewage really bad one day (I think it was because it rained the night before). Also, there were quite a few topless women on the beach. The room - the room was okay. There were ants hanging out in the sink area. They were tiny and only discovered the toothpaste on the last day. The tv worked, but the channels were few and far between. We didn't have towels one day, but otherwise the room was cleaned daily (the maid did a good job). I did the tour to Chitzen-Itza through the tour guy in the lobby. It was worth the money. If you do it though - keep in mind it takes 3 hours to get there and it is in a jungle (hot and humid with poisonous snakes and poisonous trees). The tour guide was really good. It costs $3 to take a van to and from Playa del Carmen ($3 each way per person). The taxi cost $10 and was definetly more fun than the van ride. 5th Ave in Playa has a lot of tourist shops. I thought the prices were insane (even at 50% off the marked price). I did pick up a few things at a store close to where the van drops you off. I've traveled a good bit, but this was my first all inclusive. Not the best experience, but I'll stay at one again sometime - just not at Club el Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz-Carlton, but certainly not Motel 6.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, my wife and I just got back from Club El Mandarin on June 1st. This was our second trip to Playa Del Carmen, we stayed at the Riu Palace in Playacar two years ago. Having the benefit of staying in a first class resort like the Riu Palace, I was better able to put Club El Mandarin in better perspective. Here's the bottom line folks, ya get what ya pay for! I liken the Riu Palace to the Ritz-Carlton and Club El Mandarin to a Holiday Inn. Club El Mandarin is affordable because it affords less of the finer things that people may want on their vacation. #1)Staff- Contrary to what people have said previously, the workers were not all "Great". The front desk workers seemed aloof when you asked them questions and were a tad disorganized. The grounds crew took several days to find a palm branch strewn across the walkway just outside of our room. The bartenders did a decent job but were prone to give preferential treatment to locals who spoke the language and "marble bag" wearing customers who were inclined to cut in front of you at the bar. #2)Food- The food at the beach restaurant was okay, they served the same breakfast daily (eggs, bacon, sausage etc.) and lunch (hamburgers, hot dogs, chips and salsa etc). We were there for 7 days so after about day three, I found my appetite was wavering a bit with the thought of having the same things again! The food in the Lobby restaurant was buffet style where they would have different themes nightly. I found just about everything they made was very bland and not very fun to look at. One positive was that the desserts were delicious and the ice cream was fantastic! Quetzal is the finer dining restaurant that is upstairs from the lobby. Though we only dined there twice, my wife and I found this to be the best place to eat. Surprisingly, they were never busy and we were immediately seated both times. The food was very good, the house wine was delicious and the service was great. For any future visitors to this resort, Quetzal is a must! #3) Amenities- First of all, I saw reviews in the past saying that you could request an "ocean view" room. Oh yeah, tou can request an "ocean view" room for an extra $30 a night! Personally I think if you pay for your package ahead of time, you should be entitled to an identical room regardless of location. Like I said earlier, this is like a Holiday Inn as far as resorts go. The room was nice, their was a king bed and a couch, there was a nice size closet and we had a very little patio area with bird poop all over it. The bathroom was okay, there was an occasional sewery smell in there and I still don't know how you use one of those bidets, kinda scares me. Pool, the pool wasn't bad. There are plenty of sun chairs around the pool and aside from some greasy film I saw a couple of times, it was nice. Let me make something very clear to people who find this essential, there is no swim up bar! I was a tad disappointed as I think this is a nice addition to a resort. Beach, the beach was adequate. The water is clear in spots but there is a fair amount of seaweed floating around and if you're afraid of fish like my wife, you'll not like being in the water as there are schools of fish that swim around you while you're out there. I must say the staff does do a great job raking the seaweed as it is quite a task. Also, for those who enjoy a beverage or two, there is not a bar right on the beach as you'll find at some resorts. Yes the pool bar is only about a minute away but when you're being lazy on your getaway, it's nice to walk 20 feet to the bar rather than throwing on your shoes and fighting through pool traffic. #4) Guests- Folks, as I said earlier, there are different class resorts and this one having reasonable prices has a more "mixed" crowd. It goes without saying that some people (most are wearing speedos) have never been taught that if someone is waiting at the bar or in line at the buffet you simply DO NOT step in front of them. I had bite my tongue numerous times as I patiently waited for a drink and some guy or girl would nonchalantly walk in front of me as if I wasn't there. Also, I may be crazy but it seemed like the majority of the guests smoked. I don't judge people on their vices but when they light up in the middle of breakfast, your vice is now mine! The lobby is a happening place in the evening, as my wife and I would go to and from dinner we would be inundated with smoke as most of the people in the lobby were lighting up. If you're looking for a relaxing time, enjoy your days during the week, because I'm not sure if the hotel slashes it's rates on the weekend or what but for Friday and Saturday there was a HUGE influx of new people who basically took over the pool and made for long lines at the bar and made it very difficult to find a table in the beach restaurant. To summarize (and you may be suprised by this next comment after reading my review), my wife and I had a GREAT time! We had adequate service, a decent beach to spent our days relaxing, sunning and reading. I would recommend this to other travelers with the words of caution that this is not a first class resort but a decent resort that is worth the money. Like I said "ya get what ya pay for".

Reviews.Title: “Electrical Failures All Week?”
Reviews.Author: askeddie
Reviews.Content: I was here during an Atlantis Exclusive weekend and give this resort a 3 out of 5. The resort is very well kept. It is fairly new and very nicely landscaped. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the service was better than normal. The resort is very relaxing and romantic. There is a beautiful beach and oversized pool. They have three restaurants but the food wasn't very good. They need variety. I got tired of getting fried flour tortillas every day. The drinks were not the best, they used some kind of watered down homemade mixture of lemonade for the Margaritas from Hell! Ask for a "Mamasita", a redish drink that tastes a little like a Pina Colada, only better! The staff was very friendly, often joining us during the evening parties. The only one thing I can say really troubled me was being without electricity and without A/C. I've done plenty of travel to Latin America and the Caribbean, so I've been a few times without electricity in several places, but at Club El Mandarin there was a power failure just about every night during my 8 day stay. On our third night, we realized that the hotel was shutting down the power. Maybe they could not handle being at maximum occupancy? Either case, we saw the maintenance crew going around and shutting down the power, but when we asked we were told that they were "resetting the breakers". We didn't buy this story! No A/C makes for a very very HOT SUMMER VACATION !!! Wear very light clothing and expect to be shirtless for a good portion of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of variety at Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyRDH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Club El Mandarin in the Playa Del Carmen area. There was a lot of variety in both the people who stayed there and the food we ate!! We stayed at Iberostar Tucan in 2/04 and spent twice as much. I can say that this place was just as good! There were a few things I noticed that Club El Mandarin didn't have but, overall, it was great! There are three restaurants there but we only ate in two of them. We were only there for five days so when we found something we liked, we stuck with it. The main dining hall where most folks eat breakfast is just fine. It could be a bit more open as it has sliding glass doors but they choose to keep the air conditioning on. The food there is great. Mostly buffet but in the A.M., there's a chef cooking omlets any way you like them. The cafe con leche is wonderful also!! The Restaurant El Mandarin by the pool is perfect buffet style for lunch and a full service restaurant for dinner. That is where we had dinner most nights because it's by the beach and has the ocean breezes!! They have an all inclusive menu or a purchase price menu to choose from if you eat dinner there. We never strayed from the all inclusive menu and were never dissatisfied. The people working at the resort are wonderful. Please feel free to tip them although your travel agent may say there is no need. They will remember you and if you're outgoing, they're bound to remember you by name! Drinks were not watered down that I could tell but if you tip them, I'm sure you'll get stronger ones!! Our room was wonderful. Our bed was firm, but not rock hard. We had a bidet in the bathroom and the shower was plenty big with lots of hot water! We had a T.V. (didn't watch it), a couch, coffee table and a huge closet with both shelves and drawers!! There was a coffee machine also but the cafe con leche in the dining room was better. Also, we used the safe in the room for $2 per day. No complaints here. It's still half the price of the Iberostar! We participated in activities on the beach like volleyball, soccer/football, aerobics classes and utilized the activity hut for the kayak and the windsurfing. The folks recruiting for the games and classes are so enthusiastic and are a blast to deal with. We went into town one time on the shuttle. It's $3 per person one way. We went late in the day and took a taxi home. Make sure you clarify with any cabbie as to the fee for you trip before you get in the cab. Is the fee he's quoting for one or two people? Is he clear as to where you wish to go? Playa is a neat town, lots to do but tons of merchants yelling to you to come look at their wares. You can haggle with them if you want to and get a better deal. There are merchants with silver and t-shirts, etc. who come to the resort two times per week if you don't want to go into town. The show we saw at the resort was cute. Lots of audience participation and silliness. We are not club type people so don't know how the night life compares to that of Playa in town. There is a ton to do at night in Playa Del Carmen though. The beaches are beautiful at the resort! I'm going to try to include some pictures although I've been having some trouble getting them onto the TripAdvisor site in the past. The smell everyone speaks of seems to be the seaweed that is dumped just off the property. We smelled it too but not in our room or anything. Just when the wind blew a certain way. When we investigated, it really seemed to be all the seaweed that was cleaned off the beach and dumped just off site. Not too offensive, just noticeable. There are visitors from all over coming to this area!! We met folks from Europe, Canada and the U.S. Quite a nice mix! Everyone was nice! Hope this helps you decide! Have a terrific trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful week in paradise on May 8th through the 15th. The grounds are beautiful as are the rooms and beach. Walked for an hour or more on the beach each morning. I guess it ends somewhere but we didn't find it. The staff is great. They will entertain you from 10am till after midnight. There are activities all day on the beach and around the pool. They have a very nice Gym. Not all the equipment that is in a big gym that you may go to at home but Plenty of equipment and free weights for almost any one. The food is very good and tasty but don't expect beef, though it is tasty, to be as tender as you might like. They have nice table wines that are free. They also have fine wines at additional cost but believe me they are vey low priced. This is our 5th time in the last few years to this resort and I guess that says how much we like it.

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest but decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our seventh trip to Mexico and our sixth all-inclusive vacation. This resort has solidified our decision to not bother going back to all-inclusives ever again as we find that we relax more when we just go to a little village and stay at a hotel and hang out with the locals. Nonetheless, I'll break it down for you: Bars: Lobby bar is great and the staff there are nice. Most nights they have a live band playing and they really get the place hopping. Saw lots of couples dancing to anything from disco to merengue. Very entertaining. Pool/beach bar is good, nice bartenders. Disco is the only place to get a drink after midnight but if you don't want to party in the disco it's ok because you can just go in to get your drinks and then take them back out to the lobby/courtyard area. Drinks were watered down but that's what you get for a 4 star property. Do order the mohitos from the lobby bar, they are awesome and refreshing on a hot muggy night. Restaurant: The Pool one is good. It starts out as breakfast in the morning (omellets, etc) then switches to lunch around noon (hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza, etc). At night it turns into an a la carte Mexican restaurant and it's quite good. It's totally open so you get a nice breeze at night which is great. The Lobby buffet restaurant has good selection (salad bars, pastas, meats, fish) It is open for breakfast as well but we never made it there (only until 10:00am). Only draw back to this restaurant is that it's bloody hot in there. They have these huge sliding glass doors but keep them shut for some reason which really should get addressed as this restaurant has the potential of being pretty decent as far as a buffet goes. Upstairs a la carte restaurant totally sucks. A buddy and I ordered the pork medallions with dijon mustard and they were totally overcooked and the dijon was regular mustard. My opinion is don't waste a night there. Pool: Nice and clean. Lots of stuff to do there with the entertainment staff if you're into that sort of thing. The bar and restaurant are handy to get to which is nice compared to some larger resorts. Beach: Gorgeous. Beatiful warm Carribean sea and white sandy beach. Lots of angel fish there. Grab a piece of melon or bread and they'll come to you. At one point we had about 50 of them swimming all around us looking for food. Very Cool!! Only drawback is that the beach doesn't go very far if you wanted to take a nice evening stroll down a long beach. Front Desk staff: Seem to be confused a lot of the time but they got us checked in after only a few minor screw ups. Rooms: Awful.....they need to renovate the rooms badly. After we finally got checked in we started to unpack and noticed a light bulb not installed in the bathroom. We called the front desk and they sent someone over to put one in there. He comes over right away, puts it in there and it works........great!! NOT!!!! After he leaves the thing turns off all on its own. So...we call the front desk again, well 20 minutes later...no maintenance guy. So, we call again and wait and wait and still noone shows up. A third call to the front desk explaining that we need to take showers finally brings someone around about 15 minutes after that.
