At this point my wife and I are paranoid so we start checking everything out and we found that the fridge wasn't cold and the bathroom sink pipes were leaking water everywhere. So we got all of that dealt with at the same time. Needless to say, this put a huge black mark on my view of this resort. In the end everything got fixed and we didn't let it ruin our vacation or anything like that. Overall, this resort is very typical of a 4 star property to which we have been to before. If you can afford to bump to a 4 and a half or 5 star resort, do it and don't bother staying here. If you are on a budget, then this property can be a good option. The lobby bar and courtyard/turtlepond areas are nice. The food is so-so, drinks are ok but the rooms suck. One thing I almost forgot, the bathrooms in the rooms have a sewer-like smell to 'em but it's not too bad. Also that same smell occurs at the beach but , as I said, it's not so bad that you'll feel sick or anything. It kind of just comes and goes. Hope this helps. If you have any questions just email us.

Reviews.Title: “A cruise ship on land...”
Reviews.Author: TravelJohnson
Reviews.Content: This resort goes to a great deal of effort to make you believe you are aboard a cruise ship, the only difference is you are land-locked. The highlight is the friendly staff, very friendly. The "animation" department (guest activities) is a collection of high energy, attractive, young people. The beach area has wonderful white powder sand; but the actual beach is very small. Bring lots of sunscreen, the sun can be intense. Things to watch out for? Do not expect to find gourmet cuisine. Though generous in quantity, the quality was lacking for my tastes. With the exception of a second floor dining room, everything was served buffet style. Lines could be long at times. The second floor dining room offers a more elegant approach to dining and you receive table service; however, the menu does not change, the wine list is very limited. Seating is limited, as are the hours and days of operation. For most people, all-inclusive can be a bargain if you are a big drinker. However, lines can be long at times. The plastic glasses for beer are tiny and there is no light beer available. The "house liquor" is bottom of the barrel; but, you can upgrade your beverage choices for an additional $100+ for the week. If you are on the basic all-inclusive program and want an Absolute martini before dinner, your only option is to purchase the beverage upgrade. If you want to use your in-room safe, then be prepared to pay $2 per day for this option. If you need to check your email, be prepared to pay high rates to use the computers within a small shop in the hotel. Expect to take twice the time to conduct email business, the computers are set up for the Spanish language and you will go nuts trying to conduct English using a Spanish language keyboard! Seems to me that it would make sense to have English language computers for guests to use. There is not a guest service directory in the rooms. As a result, you might become frustrated in trying to make calls are call to inquire about guest services available. Dialing "0" will get you nowhere. Fair warning, you cannot charge purchases from the various stores in the hotel or with the crafts people that set up and do business in the hotel. Nor do these merchants accept credit cards ... it is CASH ONLY. The nearest ATM is in Playa Del Carmen; several miles and a cab ride away. There is no ATM in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved el mandarin”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMommaYeah
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I too was nervous. Excellent place. My sister got married on the beach there and there were about 30 of us. Upon check in, very polite and got us to our rooms right away. We were in the pool within 30 minutes of check in. Facilities are incredible-clean, and always being groomed. Entertainment was fabulous and we had a great time. Would recommend this place to anyone. We traveled with our two children 5 & 7 and they are already asking when we could go back again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent family trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed from april 19th to the 26th, had a wonderful holiday, the breakfast and lunch were excellent but dinner wasnt so great, met lots of nice people and the hotel staff were very friendly. Beware to take cash if you want to do water sports or any beauty treatments. You cannot charge anything to your room. Our room was very large and perfect for a family of four, we never ran out of hot water and the air conditioner worked fine. Older resort needs some upgrades, the stones around the pool are uneven and you have to be careful with bare feet. Our children loved the angel fish in the ocean and the crabs, and turtles to look at. The gardens are beautiful. We also loved the band that played in the lobby and dancing lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Vive Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got back last week from an amazing 2 weeks in mexico at the Club El Mandarin. Everything from the travel advisor to our drive home was perfect, no problems at all....perfecto. Beautiful, clean, resort, happy, friendly, helpfull staff. The pool palapa is where it's at, for casual breakfast in your bikini to quiet drinks under the stars (lobby was very busy- still amazing service though). The food and presentation at the buffet beat the socks off any buffet we've ever seen (totally amazed). All the staff are so HARD working. We both have nothing to complain about, except....power kept going out in our room most every night. BIG DEAL. Can't wait to go back next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin from April 13th through the 19th. We had the time of our lives!! There were a few negatives about this resort but over all I would return. The first day we arrived the A/C did not work very well but we told the staff in the morning and they were quick to fix it and it was like an icebox every day forward. Apparently there are power issues down in Mexico; it was nothing the hotel could control. We were not affected personally but I did hear a few other guests complain about no power in the rooms and the hot water running out. One day the shower piece broke but was promptly fixed. We were in a room right next to the main building were the disco was, the first night it was annoying because the music was VERY loud, but every night after that we were so tired that it did not make a difference. There is a show every night, we only attended two, and there is the disco, which we also went two times. The staff was extremely nice and tried to keep things interesting. There was always something to do. Some people on the web site here have complained about the music by the pool, it did not bother me and half the time I was in my own world relaxing or playing a game that I couldn’t even tell you the name of one song that was played. I also saw somewhere that someone complained about seaweed, HELLO you are on a beach, besides the staff had it cleaned up immediately. The other guests where a total blast too, it didn’t matter if you understood each other or not, every one danced and played games together. I have to send a HUGE Hello to the CRAZIES GUYS FROM Rhode Island and to our new Friends from Alberta, JAIMIE AND CLINT…Si, Si, Si. Yes the drinks were very watered down, BUT I learned by another guest, just ask the bartender to make them strong and they are happy to oblige. The beach was ok, there are this angel fish very close to the beach line and they will swim all around and under you, that kind of grossed me out so I was good with just staying in the pool, not to many people did go into the ocean, the water was blue but a little cloudy, we were further south one day for a Dolphin Adventure and that beach was so clear, so the beaches further south are a bit better, but I prefer being closer to Cancun and the Airport. The food was ok, the buffet got a little boring our favorite night was Mexican night, the upstairs restaurant was stupid, it was way to much of a production, it took to long to sit you, and serve you. The Mexican restaurant was a bit of the same way but not as much and the food was great. There was plenty of chairs on the beach and you can always find a shady spot if you want on. The last night we were there the hotel staff put on a strip show for the ladies in the disco (it was kept pretty clean, I’d say PG 16), the men were mucho hot!! The rooms and the ground were spot less; I never smelled anything funny, no sewer smells or anything. This is one of the more economy resorts but over all we had a great time and I would go back. If you are looking for everything to be perfect then go to the more expensive hotels but if you are just looking to relax and are on a budget then I recommend Club Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Club El Mandarin- Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mandarin was ok, but needs to update. Older buildings. Lost power two nights we stayed there. Much emphasis on drinking and alcohol. Staff was wonderful- warm and welcoming. Spoke English well. Area beautiful. cabbies, shopkeepers & most locals speak English. Small ants in our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience: Stay here if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: katyfox
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Club El Mandarin and, although we enjoyed our holiday, we wouldn't go back to this hotel. Our experience was very mixed: some things were good, some things were not-so-good. Our summary is that if you get a package deal of a good price, then you will probably have a very nice time, but don't stay here looking for perfection. Some details: we loved the bar/lobby area, with its big wicker chairs and lots of plants; having cocktails by the turtle pool in the evening, among long colonades and palm trees. The front desk staff were extremely helpful at all times and responded with efficiency when we complained. Everything was very clean. Some of the theme nights in the main buffet were rather good, particularly the Mexican night. The grounds are beautiful, and the fact that it is surrounded by jungle is wonderful. The clientele was quite international, which we liked, and the small size of the resort made it easy to make friends. Things that we didn't like: there was a smell of drains in our room, and one night there was a flood in our block. We were surprised at how quickly it was dealt with, but nonetheless, it was irritating to be woken up at 4am with water slooshing under the door. There was intermittent power for a while, and although this seemed out of control of the hotel for the most part, there was a night when some rooms had power and ours didn't. Also we had insufficient hot water resulting in several cold showers, and after complaining on two occasions, we were moved to another room. The staff were very courteous about the complaints. The food was ok, but at times pretty average. The breakfast omlettes were very good, and the guacamole excellent! The fish at dinner was good too, but often many of the dishes looked rather tired. The a la carte restaurant was a bit hit and miss: my food was overcooked and uninspiring but my husband's was delicious. The entertainment staff were full of energy. The constant raucous music at the poolside was a bit irritating, and the evening entertainment was frankly bad (except for a traditional dance troop from Playa del Carmen), but other activities were fun. Top marks to Annie and the beach volleyball. If the food were improved, music played at the pool only occasionally, and some of the issues with rooms were ironed out, our experience would have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider using the teen rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Mandarin during the first week of April. Overall, we were very happy with the resort. We found the buffet offerings were great for our two picky eaters, with a nice variety of international dishes, fresh fruits, gourmet desserts and typically North American fast food. We only ate a la carte once; the food was wonderful but we weren't able to eat much of the entrees after the series of appetizers we were given. Buffets suit our consciences better. Our only concern, and we consider it major, is the sleeping arrangements we were given as a result of taking advantage of the resort's teen and kid discount rates. Usually, my son and husband share a bed when we are four in a room, and usually we are given two king or queen sized beds, but a double bed is barely big enough for my petite daughter and myself (I'm also on the tiny side). The two guys didn't have a hope of a good night's sleep. We find Transat Holidays partly to blame because they had assured us that we could request a roll away bed upon our arrival. The resort does not supply cots or roll aways. We ended up taking turns on a makeshift bed of extra pillows we got from the resort after three days of pleading. Otherwise, we highly recommend the El Mandarin. It was clean, convenient and breathtakingly gorgeous. All the facilities were in good working order. The staff and other patrons were great.

Reviews.Title: “club el mandarin okay”
Reviews.Author: karen g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the club el mandarin mar. 20-28,2005 and had a good time. Checking in not a problem, the front desk clerks were nice and accommodating. Requested late check out and received it for a small fee of $30. Guest services people were very helpful. Staff at hotel nice and helpful from lobby bar to restaurants, although very busy. The rooms were clean and large,air worked great, bottled water every day in mini fridge, grounds immaculate and great band in the evenings.Entertainment staff worked very hard day and evenings to keep guests happy. The food was not great I thought but my husband liked it as did other guests I talked to so it also can just be personal preference. The water was great. Some days there was seaweed but it is the caribbean and staff worked very quickly to clean it up. We found the beach wonderful for walking as well as just lying around. We didn't have any problem finding chairs. There were line ups for drinks at the pool bar and lobby bar occasionly but it was very quick to move along and we usually ened up chatting with someone in line. We met alot of Canadians, (Hi tom and barb from halifax) as well as americans there. Taxis to Playa Del Carmen was $10 either way. You can book the free shuttle but do have to book one day ahead or book the same day ,if space, for $3 a person All in all I think for the money we saved staying at this resort it was well worth it. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at this wonderful resort. We were two twenty year old girls looking for a relaxing time. At first glance, we weren't sure if we had made the right move or not, going to this resort. There are lots of families at this resort. When we realized this we were a little scared. But, if two young women can have a good time here, anyone can. On the second day we met the some of the animation team, and the good times started rolling! They are AWESOME!! Can't brag them up enough. Rolando and Erick (as somebody else mentioned, already) will do anything to get you laughing and having a good time. Our room was very roomy and always clean. The waiters at the buffet were always there to welcome you with a "Good morning, Senoritas". The food was no surprise.....you're in mexico, not north america. Thankfully, we had good ole faithful eggs. We found breakfast to be the best meal. We were also impressed with the mexican a la carte restaurant, the chicken fahitas are decent. One day trip that I would recommend to anybody is the Xel-ha/Tulum trip. It's one of the most expensive trips, but SO worth every cent. Xel-ha is beautifully breath-taking. One thing that surprised me, was that it's very windy at the beach. This is not a bad thing, though. It's a warm wind. One thing that I really liked was the fact that there was an internet shop. I emailed home once and for five minutes it cost me $2.50 American dollars. I can't say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Probably visit again, if going back to that area!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was wonderful. Weather was great and we did not have any problems at the resort. Check-in was a breeze, we got there at 11AM and of course as in any hotel in the United States we could not check in until 3 but they gave us a room to change into our swimwear and a place to put out luggage with security guard our wrist bands and towel cards and we were on our way! We were a little disappointed in the meals, breakfast was about the best but we didn't seem to stay away!!!! Drinks were awesome and yes there was a little wait some times but hey relax your on vacation! Suggest as others to bring some insulated mugs, they are happy to fill them. Our maid was the greatest....tipped her daily with cash or little gifts. She worked very hard, washed windows daily and scrubbed the floors, even on the patio. Grounds are beautiful and even bumped into a few iguana once in a while, especially early moring sunning themselves on the waterfall of the jacuzzi. Did have a rain storm one night and the next day we could not lay on the beach as the no-see-ums or gnats were horrible but we just moved up by the pool and didn't get bothered. All in all, great place.

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: TwoCouples
Reviews.Content: Four of us (adults) went here from Mar. 4-Mar19). We have stayed at many all inclusive 4 and 5 star hotels in the past, most of them much bigger. We were created from the start with a very rude man who was very unpleasant and no help at all. What turned out to be a common phrase "can't help you now, come back later" was used initially just to get 2 keys for the room and a key to the safe. These people at the desk are the only ones who ruin this hotel's reputation, in our opinion. We had booked 8 months in advance and hoped to get rooms side-by-side which we know is "not guaranteed" but we have never had a problem in the past. Not only did they refuse to help us out here, our friends were put in a ground floor suite (something they had refused over and over in the past, again with no problems anywhere else). Their room was flooded from a storm the previous day and basically, long story short, they had to wait 4 days to be moved and finally next to our room (which had other people moved in the same day we were). Basically, the front desk people are not even close to helping out their guests, it obviously too much trouble. A woman (in charge at the front desk) was especially rude and condescending to us all.....she apparently holds a rather high position. The food was boring and exactly the same every single day. The "one and only" other restaurant also had unbelievely slow service and just a rude servers and manager. The bar staff and cleaning staff were fabulous but we did have some long waits due to management not hiring enough people. One day our room did not even get cleaned and we had to hunt down clean towles. The bugs were terrible at the beach and everybody was itching constantly......it needed daily bug/spray maintenance which obviously management again thought was unnecessary. This hotel will decline rapidly in popularity if the management is not changed or retrained. Very unprofessional people in charge here. We have, in 30 years of travel, never written a negative respopnse to any hotel or resort.....this is the first time and the last time to this resort.....EVER! btw.......this resort should be rated at the most.....a 3 star.....when compared to all other 4 and 5 star resorts we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Average Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Mandarin March 17th to 24th with my husband, 10 year old and mother-in-law. I would give this resort an average rating for the following reasons: First -- The Good: the grounds are well-maintained, lush and beautiful; the rooms are clean and reasonably comfortable (although workmanship is beginning to show signs of aging); the pool is adjacent to the beach which is good if your group includes "beach" and "pool' people; the NO RESERVING CHAIRS FOR MORE THAN 30 MINUTES policy is great -- we didn't have any trouble finding chairs or patches of shade; staff responded quickly to issues with the room (air conditioner and tv remotes) and when we needed a doctor to take a look at our son's sunburn, they had a doctor to the resort in 1.5 hours; generally found the staff to be very friendly; the beach is fine -- there is some seaweed (not a lot) and while the water looks a bit cloudy, I think this is from the wave action on the sandy bottom; check in and out was relatively smooth, and transportation to airport was punctual; the trio that performs in the lobby between dinner and the show were very good. The Not So Good: you have to pay for the room safes and they didn't have any available for us when we first arrived, we had to wait for some people to check out; the food is average at best and pretty repetitive -- my son and I have some food allergies so expected some limitations in choice, but even at that we were often hard pressed to find something that appealed to us; the buffet restaurant is all self-serve (including drinks) -- wait staff are there only to set and clear tables, replenish food etc., not wait on guests; we were told that bottled water would be placed in our room fridge everyday, but this never happened unless we specifically asked the chambermaid to provide it; this is a matter of personal preference, but I did find the music and noise from the loudspeaker system at the pool a bit loud at times -- our room was not near the pool, but the noise was enough to interfere with an afternoon nap; evening entertainment starts fairly late (9:45 pm). Some other information that future guests might find helpful: the king-bed rooms have a day bed that we didn't know about in advance -- for families planning to share a room with children this may be more comfortable than a two double bed room; the trip to the airport takes longer than 45 minutes as we made a number of stops to pick up guests at other hotels, so make sure you use the facilities before-hand; similarly, on a half-day trip to Tulum, which is about an hour south of the resort, each one-way trip took closer to two hours because of all the pick-ups and drop-offs along the way (although this is not related to the resort itself). Having been to a 5 star in Cuba last spring, I wouldn't rate El Mandarin as a 4 star, by comparison. I'd put it closer to 3.5 stars. Overall, not a bad resort. There are a number of positives, but a few issues to be aware of before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Go prepared!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read all previous reviews prior to booking at the Mandarin, so was prepared not to have a 5 star resort but to have clean rooms, ,good food and great weather. I also figured that the people who had trivial complaints were just people who could not be satisfied. To those I apologize. I now understand that when you are constantly being annoyed by pesky problems they compound and truly changes your attitude. Basically our main complaints were: 1. Our initial room stank so bad of sewer that my daughter refused to go into the washroom. Yes I brought airfresheners, ,they couldn't touch the smell. The airconditioner leaked like a tap - and beeping noises from the utility room kept us up half the night. Maintenance came and fixed the airconditioner promptly but could do nothing with the smell and had no idea what the beeping noise was. We ask to move rooms and were told none were available but in a couple days they maybe something. We were led to believe that the only rooms available had either 2 double beds or one king bed. No so!!! After meeting with a couple from Ontario they informed us that they had a suite with soaker tub, huge bathroom, seperate bedroom with 2 double beds and living area with 2 daybeds. Needless to say we went to the front desk to ask to be moved - told to come back 3 different times and were treated very rudely. Finally were shown new rooms and opted for the kingbed and 2 daybed room. We were very happy!!(Some people were told they would have to pay for a room up grade - but no one we spoke to had to pay any extra charges) 2. This concern did not affect us directly but was very disturbing. Most of this hotel consists of levels. The main lobby is beautiful but to go from one area to the next there are step ups or step downs. The night show also has this. To get to the main level from the lobby is a series of stairs ( I did not see an ramp) We saw in our two weeks someone getting hurt almost daily by missing the single steps. 3. The pool area is beautiful but the cement around it is very uneven. Several people cut their feet and one fella broke his toe here. As for cleaning the pool - we did see a guy vaccum it and skim it in the morning but never anyone cleaning the grim around - you could see the mildew in some areas. 4. The line ups at the bar was a bit annoying when you consider that one bar with 2-3 servers who were usually busy washing the dishes or talking on the phone had to serve the entire hotel. Okay enough of the complaints - Here are some helpful tips that if you go to this hotel I think may help you. - bring insulated cups for you drinks - the ebigger the better to avoid line ups. - check out the prices of tours from each tour operator before you book. We found World tours in the main lobby to be great. -Do the Isla Mujares trip from World Tours - you won't be disappointed!! - If your a family of 4 like mine consider doing taxi rides instead of the shuttle. We also booked the Xcaret by only buying the entrance tickets through World tours and catching a cab for $18. each way and burgers for lunch. So would I recommend this hotel? Possibly to someone who hasn't been to an all inclusive or a 4 star or better. Never to an older couple! We did over all enjoy ourselves - got drunk, got tanned, and saw a lot. Met some great people and felt very relaxed. Ps Demand an upstairs unit to avoid noise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: nddray
Reviews.Content: We returned from Mandarin on March 19,2005. Please do not go by any of the negative reviews posted. We were quite nervous about this resort because of previous reviews. This place is awesome!!! The rooms are huge and very clean. The beach is beautiful with very little seaweed as it is cleaned every day. What can you expect this is the ocean!! We took our 2 teenage sons with us and they really enjoyed themselves. The entertainment was good in the evening. The food was a bit repetitive over the week but you have to remember they are serving soooo many people. It is not difficult to get the free shuttle to Playa. Yes the van only carries 12 people, we are a family of 4 and had no problem. As for the a'la carte restaurant, you can go as many times as you like, we walked right in. We booked our Xcaret tour through our rep approx $550 Cnd for 4 adults. Only complaint about the tour is, it should start as soon as the park opens (8:30am) not at noon. The exhibits close at 5pm. We missed out on alot of things because we ran out of time. The only changes we'd like to see made: There is no bank machine at the resort. The closest one is in Playa. The entertainment starts a bit late in the evening 9:45pm. After supper there really isn't much to do. The beach bar should stay open much later than 6:30pm. This was our 4th all-inclusive resort in Mexico and we will definately go back some day. Just remember when reading the reviews, there are alot of people out there who are very hard to please. We are quite fussy and we were very happy with the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from Club El Mandarin. This resort will be the highlight of your trip. We stayed in one of the bunglaws close the the beach. It was like having our own little house within seconds from the beach. The staff was fantastic and a lot of fun. The beach is so breathtaking. We went sailing the first day. The hotel has activities throughout the day ranging from Spanish lessons to water aerobics. If you want to just escape from everyday stress and enjoy natural surroundings, book your trip today. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place if you have any disabilities....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a note to maybe the older crowd or if you have any disabilities re walking....beware. This resort is not suitable for anyone who would have problems with steps or uneven surface walking. My sister and I just returned, she has rheumatoid arthritis and found the walking difficult for her as in the lobby part of the resort you will have many steps for the different levels. The accomodations are all on a lower level which means that each time you wanted to go to the buffet or restuarant you had to climb approx. 12 steps. Our accomodation was on the ground floor but the 2 steps which was the entry way to your room were higher then normal steps with out any railing to help you. We soon found out that it was better for her to use the patio entrance but that only worked if I was with her to go in the normal way and unlock the patio door. We did notice a few injured quests during our stay and knew of one lady who had broken her ankle and was trying to enjoy her vacation in a wheelchair. My sister did fall as we were walking up to the lobby for dinner on our last night, the Guest Service Rep did come and talk to us, suggested that she should put ice on her side where it was hurting and if we wanted the Dr. to be called she would. At my sister's request no Dr. was called, but after returning home the next day, xrays taken and she has 3 cracked ribs. I must comment on the grounds which were beautiful and the staff at the reception desks were very polite and most helpful. I was disappointed in the ocean water which was mukey so that you could not see what was brushing up around your legs (angel fish) which made me very uncomfortable, this of course has nothing to do with the resort but think someone might want to be aware that these angel fish like to be around your lega. I was very surprised as well to find out that the resort is only 5 years old and of the conditions of the rooms. My first thought was that we were in an older section of the resort and that was the reason of the conditon of the room but after talking to other visiters and finding out their accomodations were in the same we determined that it must have been the poor workmanship at the time of building. The outside of these villa's were all in good repairs. Would I go back to this resort, the answer to no. Hope these comments are useful as I know I was interested in reading the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Mexico for a weeks stary. The grounds are just beautiful, immaculate, well kept always trimming and cleaning. Rooms clean and well looked after. Beach is beautiful can walk for miles. Food is excellent , 2 a la carte restaurants, only went to one upstairs, no reservations needed which is great. Only complaint, pool closes at 6 along with the bar. Lobby bar only opend till midnight then you have to go to the disco which for us was 'loud'. Need more bartenders and servers in the buffet. Would recommend to 40 plus adults, not a party resort. very quiet. Not much to do after dinner. Good thing is your close to Playa del Carment. Great little town for shopping free shuttle to and from. Yes would recomment to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say....El Mandarin was one of the best vacations we have ever been on! We loved it! We were there for 2 weeks from Jan. 2 - Jan. 16/05. The food, beach, pool and best of all the staff there were pheonomenal! Erik and Rolando made our trip a memorable one. Annie was terrific with her water volleyball and waterpolo. The nightly shows were great and always so much fun! I even won the mexican lottery one night...anyone up for Tequila!!! We also met a great couple from Kelowna B.C...Hola to Heidi & Cory...they made our second week very enjoyable. The weather was fantastic and I got an amazing tan. My daughter was in love with Norma and Madeline from the Kidz Club. They were just fantastic with the children. My daughter was never ready to come with her us, it just goes to show you that the staff do make you feel like you are at home. My husband and I even took up spanish lessons with Erik and it was hilarious...I still have all my notes for my next trip! We had one waiter in the main restaurant, Jose who just couldn't go enough for us...he was always ready with drinks before we actually sat down to eat. This holiday is highly recommended and we would definately go back and as Erik would say "PERFECTO".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to El Mandarin in January 2005 - we are both 29. We went for 2 weeks and wished that we could have stayed longer. We arrived around dinner time and as we had our welcome drink we had a painless check in. We asked for a non smoking room with an ocean view and king size bed and we received everything that we asked for. Our luggage was delivered to our room with no problems. The grounds were amazing. They were always being looked after and kept up. The beach was great. After the storm of last September, the beach is now a wonderfully sandy area. Nothing wrong with the beach what so ever. There were always chairs to use but alot of times we stayed at the pool. The pool was on the cool side but it was great for those hot days! The ocean didn't even cool you off, so we really enjoyed the pool. The drinks were ok. We've definatly had better, I don't think you can expect more in that area at an all inclusive. I had an amazing massage at the massage palapa that was on the beach. It was a full body massage - so good!! I could barely stand up when they were done as it was so relaxing. The animation staff: We found the animation staff extremely friendly and fun. We got to know them right away and they definately made our trip! Eric and Rolando are always around if you need a dancing partner and WOW can they dance! Benjamin who is the manager of the animation staff is great. We often sat with him and talked, laughed, and joked. Eric's spanish lessons were a hoot! There are always activities and games going on around the pool. I am proud to say that my husband won the beer drinking constest. It was close though as Lupita who maybe weighs 85 pounds who is the staff coriographer for their shows almost beat him. Next time Lupita - Tomela Tomela! The music at the pool was great, never too loud as some of the reveiws have said. Our room was very clean. The maid did a wonderful job everyday leaving the bed made in a different way with fresh flowers laid on top. We had no problems with our personal belongings. I often left my jewellry in the room and there was never any issue. The food was amazing! Anyone who complains about this is crazy! We ate at the pool bar during the day and at the buffet every night. The buffet always had a variety of foods. They even had sushi a couple of nights which I thought was pretty good. Their pasta was so good! We loved the corona and wine on tap in the eating area. Thanks to Jose who always treated us well and kept our glasses full. A tip at the beginning of your stay goes a long way(with all of the waiters)! As some of the other reviews have mentioned - no there is no food after a certain time at night. We just took an extra few pieces of pizza from the buffet and put them in our fridge for later on. We found that by having a late dinner - we weren't too hungry after that anyways. The disco goes until 1:00. Its not too full in there but we went a couple of nights and it was fun. If you want the real "party" go into Playa Del Carmen. As for the bit of sewer smell around the resort that you get at times.....Don't forget that you are in Mexico!! The sewer systems are not like ours. The smell didn't bother me at all. Yes you may smell it once in a while but you forget about is so quickly because you are having such a good time. You are there to have fun and enjoy just being in Mexico and don't worry so much about the smell! Have a drink! You'll get over it quickly. We met alot of great people there from across Canada. Hello to Patty/Vince(Ontario), John/Brandy(Ottawa),John/Sarah(Ontario), and Phill/Diane(Saskatchewan) Thanks to everyone at El Mandarin for showing us such a good time! I was worried that we might be bored after a week as we didn't go with anyone else. As it turned out, we didn't need to be there with friends as we made so many there. A special thanks to Benjamin, Lupita, Annie, Daisy, Fred, Rolando, and Eric. (Perfecto) For those of you nervous from the bad reveiws - don't be! This hotel is great, the people are great and no matter where you go or stay - your vacation is what you make it! Have fun. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband & our kids (6 & 4) were there Feb. 2005. The hotel had beautiful grounds. The pool was excellent for our kids (1/2 of the pool was 1 - 4ft deep) it was VERY clean. There are quite a few turtles in a pond by the main hotel. That kept the kids interested......but that's it. We didn't like the food very much, the drinks are watered down. The rooms are ok. The main restaurant buffet style always had shortages in glasses, plates, bowls, juice, some dishes of food, dessert, tables would be full of dirty dishes. It was not pleasant. We did not get a chance to go upstairs to the international restaurant (that apparently was very good, so we heard from other guests) because men had to wear pants & our travel agent did not tell us that. Other guests apparently did not know either. The restaurant at the pool had not a bad lunch but dinner wasn't all that great. All the staff was pretty good. No problems there. I would go back to the Mayan but not to that resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin was lovely ...Complaints ???”
Reviews.Author: Moonstruk555
Reviews.Content: We just returned from El Mandarin after a lovely week starting Feb 15. I have read all the reviews as well, and yes it caused me a bit of anxiety having read the negative ones. I suppose its a matter of what you expect from a vacation. We found the hotel amazingly clean, inside the rooms and the main lobby of the hotel and the grounds were kept immaculately groomed. The staff friendly and very willing to help. Upon arrival at 2:30 in the afternoon we got checked in and were welcomed with drinks served directly at the main desk. We were told to leave our bags and they were taken to our room within 20 minutes. We were made aware that if we hurried we could still get food from the buffet before it closed to prepare for dinner. The hotel lobby is lovely and comfortable and I can't even imagine complaining of having to sit and have a drink there for even a few hours ( as stated in other reviews) as we often just sat with a drink there during the late afternoon before dinner. We only attended the buffet restaurant for all meals but one and the bar restaurant once for lunch. It was lovely that each night had a theme to the dinner that carried over into the nightly theatre show as well. We tried to go to the A la carte restaurant one night but it was full, and then decided that the buffet allowed us more options anyways. While on occassion the cutlery wasn't at the table, I would go and get cutlery and a server was usually there quickly to ensure we had everything else we needed and were very courteous and so polite. The staff at the main desk was polite and cheerful. We arrived and recieved two double beds in our room and then next day requested again a Kingsize bed, while they couldn't meet our request that day they kept record of it and did notify us on day 5 that there was a room available. At that point we chose to keep our room, as it was close to the main building. The pool was cool, and a pleasant relief to the hot sun. The staff kept the music playing and activities are always happening, never did the music become too much as I have read in other reviews. The bar did get busy on occassion but come on folks... your on vacation ?? where are you going in a hurry anyways??? Only one morning did we find it difficult to find a beach chair, we never went down and " reserved" one the whole time, we were willing to find a chair and move it to a pleasant spot... When we were ready to leave I called the main desk and our luggage was promptly picked up and taken up to the main desk. ... If vacation time is about kicking back and remembering what relaxing means, and not expecting to be waited on hand and foot, then I recommend the El Mandarin. The staff work so very hard to ensure your happiness, we tipped our cleaning lady and always had lots of water and a fresh flower on our bed. We had a truly lovely time that I doubt we will ever forget, it truly is part of paradise. Don't fret, go there and enjoy it, its gorgeous !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weather - Resort Average (Jan 20-30th)”
Reviews.Author: backus2006
Reviews.Content: The arrival to Cancun Airport was unbelievable. We arrived when four other planes arrived to go through customize and it took over 1 ½ hour for all of us to get through. We went with another couple to Club El Mandarin for a 10-night vacation. First of all I would like to tell you the weather was great. A little breezy at times but we couldn’t of had nicer weather. I think out of 11 days, two days were partly cloudy or cool. We arrived around 3:30 in the afternoon and our check-in went like clockwork. We wanted an oceanview room but there was none available and the waiting list was a mile long. So we ended up in a upper bungalow by the kids club and could see the ocean partially. The room was very big and simple. The problems we had with the rooms were the sewer smell from the bathroom, the sliding screen door never work, refrigerator was not working and two of our table lamps didn’t have switches. Can’t forget our electricity went out once and others did not have water a few times. But I would have to say our A/C work great. When your refrigerator works you can get bottled water at the lobby bar. But after 7 days they ran out of bottled water so you had to fill your own bottles with water from the coolers at the bar. The overall layout of the resort is nice. The pool was cold but very refreshing in the afternoon – no swim-up bar. The beach needs some improvement. Lots of broken shells and seaweed by the water. We have seen better beaches and we both enjoy walking 3 miles a day and this was like work trying to dodge crap by the oceanfront. Like other people said it is about a 1-hour walk to Playa Del Carmen. You have to get up at the crack of dawn to save sits by the pool. I think we saved lounge chairs earlier and earlier each day to make sure we got the chairs we wanted (6:30 in the morning). Most of the nightlife is up in the main building and the daytime activities are at the beach and pool area. If you lucky enough to get a oceanview room be ready to make a hike every night to the restaurants and disco because it is a nice walk back especially after a night of having fun. The problems we had with the restaurants and bars were that the pool bar closed at 6:30pm. It would of be nice to have this bar open longer because the breeze off the ocean and sound of the waves were very relaxing. After the pool bar closed we headed up to the lobby bar (only bar open) until that one closes at 11:00 pm (these bartenders need help in being friendly). Then you have to head into the disco where there is no air circulating, lights and get drinks until bar time. The resort would be better off if they would open the beach bar later in the night to get away from the lobby/disco area. One thing we almost forgot to mention is you have to pay for premium liquor and they have no bottled beer. There were many people upset at the extra cost. We did go into town and bought bottled beer for around $16 a case (XX). The food was OK for a all-inclusive. We didn’t have time to go to the sit-down restaurants but the buffets were find with us but very similar every night. Our other suggestion about the beach bar would to open the beach restaurants for late night snacks after the main restaurant closes. The main restaurant closes at 10:00 and there is no other place to get food. We came back from Playa Del Carmen one night around 1:30 in the morning and we were all hungry and thirsty and nothing was open. We did go into Play Del Carmen three times and took the ferry over to Cozumel. If you have ever been on a ferry before just shop in Playa Del Carmen and save your money to Cozumel. Both places have the same shops, bars and restaurants. The taxi ride is $10 each way for four people. We never took the shuttle from the resort because it is only free for a few hours a day. The staff works very hard. We had a few run-ins with the lobby and wait staff in the main restaurant but overall they treated us well. We would like to say thank-you to Annie from the activity staff and hope she is still wearing the cheesehead and say hi to Antonio and Nora at the beach bar they were great……. Overall rating of this resort is 5 out of 10. We all felt this resort was rated too high from the previous trips we have gone on in other parts of Mexico and the Caribbean. We got a great deal on this vacation so I guess you pay for what you get and this resort was not rated appropriately………. We would probably stay south of Playa Del Carmen next time. The beaches look so much better than ours. If you have any questions feel free to e-mail us at crawdad2004@charter.net.

Reviews.Title: “Best week of my life!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club El Mandarin in mid-October of last year. I must say I "totally" disagree with the reviewer from Burlington, Ontario. I arrived late on Sunday (due to flight delays from Chicago). I was given assistance with my luggage and they had even kept the dining room open later because they knew there would be guests arriving late from Chicago. I had originally requested a 2nd floor room, as I was traveling alone. There was none available when I arrived, but I was given one the next day. It is an excellent resort and the staff is outstanding. The nightly entertainment is great and the last night I was there, was Mexican night and they had a mariachi band playing in the dining room as I ate and later in the outside ampitheather, they had a dance troupe from Playa to put on a show. It was great. I will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “super staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 and all had a great time here. The staff was super friendly and rooms very clean. I would come back again in a minute. The upstairs resturant was not worth the wait as the food was not all that special. The other two provide enough variety for all types of taste. Remember to ask them to play bung darts which I introduced while I was ther it is a blast. Only problem is going to town either way is a cab fare of $3.00 one way and Cancun can be 1hr drive.

Reviews.Title: “Club El Mandarin, Not a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week stay at Club El Mandarin and were truly disappointed. We arrived just prior to noon and were told our rooms would be ready at 3:00 p.m. We were hungry and found the restaurants closed and would open at 1:00 p.m. so we just walked around or sat and waited. It was not a great welcome. Staff, although polite were not all that helpful. The floor in the main lobby is terraced and poorly marked so when a level changes it is easy to loose your footing and trip when you step down. This place is not recommended for anyone with ambulatory problems. We were given no assistance with our luggage when we checked in. We were told to take it to a storage area where it would be held until such time as our rooms were ready. We then returned for it and picked it up ourselves. There are a series of stairs one must descend to the pathways which lead to the various hotel room buildings. When we finally got our room keys, we had to drag our luggage down this stairway. Again, this place is almost impossible for anyone having difficulty walking, as these stairs must be traversed each time you go to eat, or do anything else concerning the main building. Room safes which go for $2.oo US per day were unavailable. We were told to check daily to see if any locks (for the room safes) become free. One would think they would have the same number of locks on hand as they have safes! The grounds were very well kept and the rooms, although dated were spotless and the queen size bed was comfortable. The buffet where breakfast, lunch and dinner is served was rather tiresome. Food, although adequate was very uninteresting. The restaurant "Quetzal" was supose to be 'a la carte' dining but the management couldn't decide from one day to the next how to handle the patrons. Reservations were not required but only the first 45 people in line were allowed at each sitting. (2 sittings per evening). That's rather silly when the facility could seat more and there were 320 rooms occupied at the resort. The food was good and the service excellent for the lucky few who managed to get in. We departed at 6:00 a.m. and had to drag our luggage up that long staircase ourselves. We were offered no assistance. The beautiful pathways leading throughout the grounds were not lit and we walked in the dark to the main building. The lobby was also unlit except for the check out counter. There was no snack or mini breakfast offered. We sat there in the dark waiting for our shuttle to Cancun. The Air Transat Rep also had a bit of an attitude. This was truly a disappointing stay and deffinitly not a 4 Star Resort. Save your money and go elsewere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I just came back on Feb. 5 with a group of 22 people from the El Mandarin. I read all the reviews and was a little nervous. So I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. I thought the food was very good for a buffet. The service in the dining room needed some improvement has at times it was hard to find a clean table. I didn't get to try the upstairs resturant because it was always full by the time I got there. The food at the grill by the pool was excellent, best cheeseburger I have has in a long time. The service at the main bar left something to be desired even after tipping many time over. The pool bar service was much better and Nora and Antonio really worked hard to wait on everyone quickly. People stated that the music at the pool was so loud that they could not hear the waves at the beach, I don't know what resort they were at but we never had that problem. The rooms were excellent and very large, we had building 36 room 3607 which was an oceanview and it was very nice with a very great view. Only problem no rollaways, we had 1 room that had 3 people and it only had double beds which are not very big when it is 3 young men sharing a room. The grounds were very well kept up and clean. Staff works very hard at keeping everything very clean. The ocean was not as clear as I would have liked until our last day so snorkeling was not an option. My kids had fun with the kayas and the catamarans. The beach was clean and I never saw the seaweed that people were talking about all I saw was the beach boy out there cleaning the beach several times a day. If you go DO NOT throw away the bottle from your water. They only give youu 1 bottle of water and you have to refill from the water jugs they have. Or you have to buy more. And as stated before bring a large thermal mug. If I had to stay at this resort again I would and so would any of the other 22 people in my group. Enjoy your stay and don't let negative reviews ruin your stay at the El Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and Happy”
Reviews.Author: Ivzmom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely week's stay at Mandarin. We had an excellent trip--very relaxing. I can echo many of the other comments on the board. I was pleaantly surprised in the resort. For a 4 Apple Rating from Apple Vacations, I wasn't sure what to expect, but I feel the Resort definitely stacks up to 5 Apple Ratings of places we've stayed at in Ixtapa. Each place is unique and wonderful in it's own way. What I really liked about El Mandarin was the beach, the food was good--the was fresh grilled fish was to die for. Elegant night (just the buffet theme - don't have to dress up) was the best night. Grilled Grouper I can't quit thinking about. Had beer, red and white wine on tap in buffet. I liked the red wine, although I'm not used to having it chilled, it was very good. I just let set at room temp for a while. Our room was one of the nicest we've had when staying in Mexico. We were in Building 6, Room 620 and it was very centrally located, which I liked. Tons of hot water and water pressure. As others indicate the grounds are truly beautiful and the place is spotless. I didn't see a mark on the wall. Constantly polishing the floors. They were painting buildings that I thought were already freshly painted. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful--especially Antonio and Nora at the pool bar. Didn't see a lot of tipping. We tipped room service and bartenders frequently. There are 4 shops on premise, as well as an internet store. In the beauty salon, I had a massage, which was great. $60 US for 1 Hour. Well worth it. Playa Del Carmen is definitely worth the trip for shopping and looking around. Very clean, as well. I would definitely go back or recommend Mandarin to anyone who asked. Very diverse group of guests--many Canadian, French, Italian, German, and Americans. People were pleasant but not overly friendly--I believe because most were traveling in groups, it wasn't as easy to meet other guests, which was okay, as we really didn't go out of our way on this trip. It is quiet hotel--mostly family and couple oriented. Definitely not one of the mega resorts. I think Mandarin has about 200 rooms--which is nice sized. It never felt crowded, although I believe the hotel was full. If want specific beach or pool loungers, you will need to do the towel run and reserve in am before going to breakfast. If I were single and wanting some excitement, this wouldn't be the place--but I'm past that point so everything suited my husband and I just fine. Tips: Do bring insulated cups. Hotel is very, very casual and laid back--don't need to overly dress. Only negatives I can think of: 1) No swimup bar, and 2) the pool water was so cold that not many people were ever in the pool. There is a smaller jetted pool, but I wouldn't say it is a "hot" tub, as the water is not heated in that pool either. Even so, I wouldn't hesitate to go back. In October we're going back to Playa Del Carmen, but trying the Rio Tequilla, so it will be fun to compare. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “COMING BACK AGAIN FOR SURE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married at Club El Mandarin on Jan.26 2005, and we couldn't have been happier. The grounds were impecable, and the staff simply goes above and beyond. Hardest working folks I've ever been around and soooo nice. The pool and entertainment staff are awesome and a special hello to Daisy. The beach was still way better than any in the U.S. The food was good and plenty, but somewhat redundant. The drinks were also plenty and potent, all you have to do is ask to KEEP POURING!! Try tequilla poppers even if you don't like Tequilla, and Miami Vice will get you right in a hurry. Take or buy a big insulated cup, best $7 we spent all week. WE ALSO STAYED AT THE MOON PALACE, AND GIVEN THE CHOICE TO GO BACK, WE WILL BE AT THE CLUB!!!!!!!!!!! JASON AND MICHELE FOREVER

Reviews.Title: “An overall good (but not spectacular), experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a large group of about 100 people to Club El Mandarin on January 22-29th, 2005. I would give this resort about a 3-3.5 stars. I'll start out with the positive things. First, the grounds and facilities are beautiful and kept very clean. Our rooms were the largest and nicest I've visited in the caribbean area, and always clean. The food was average, nothing spectacular. We mostly ate at the main buffet, and once at the outdoor Mexican restaurant, which was good. We didn't get a chance to eat at the upstairs restaurant, which was rated very good by our traveling partners. The main buffet had good food, but it seemed like it didn't vary enough from night to night. The resort was good at organizing tour buses to various attractions around the area. We took the shuttle into Playa del Carmen for shopping one day and into Cancun with a guide another day. We also took a guided tour to Chi Chen Itza, the mayan ruins. The trip was well worth the three hour drive and money. The beach was clean, and there was always enough room and chairs to layout. The water wasn't as clear as other places, but not disgusting. You can rent jet ski's and catamarans to cruise in the water with, which was fun. There were a couple of things I was disappointed about. First of all, the bars here closed at very weird and not convenient times. The pool bar closed around 6:30. We were usually still lounging around in our swimsuits by the pool at that time. Then, the main lobby bar closed at midnight, forcing you to go into the disco if you wanted to drink. The disco was really fun, but if you didn't want to drink around the loud music, there was no place to go. Also, there was not any where to get food after 10:00 in the evening. At other resorts, there has been some sort of quick food option late in the evening, here there was none. This was a good, quality place, but certainly not one of the best I've visited. The price was reasonable, so I guess you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives, few negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club el Mandarin from Jan 9 - 16 2005 with my 24 year old son. I found the staff to be exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Not once did I encounter an unpleasant situation with anybody from the bar staff, maintenance staff, frontdesk staff, shuttle staff, activities staff. I found our room much larger than most resorts I've been to and it was kept very clean. For some reason, they didn't like to stock my bathroom with facecloths. When I requested some, they were delivered immediately, but then the cleaning staff removed them the following day and didn't restock them. It wasn't a big deal to me so I didn't bother asking again and I was humored to see if I would get them. I enjoyed the varied food and thought it was well prepared and exceptionally presented. There was a lot of variety every night and in as much as I enjoyed it and wanted to try everything, after a week, I was tired of eating. The reviews I read about the pool were unfavourable because they claim the pool is too small. I found that even with the activities in the pool, most people didn't use it. even the kids didn't use it much. It felt colder than the ocean so most people chose to wade in the sea. The outdoor jacuzzi was a cold one, not a hot tub like us Canadians are used to. The shuttle to Playa del Carmen left on the hour for 6 hours and cost $3.00. The cab by comparison cost $10.00. The last shuttle was at 6:00 p.m. and I found that wasn't late enough. Fifth Avenue in Playa is a hot spot and there is shopping until midnight so I was always forced to cab home. I found that there was lots of space on the beach to lay around without feeling crowded. I read several reviews about the seaweed washing up on the beach and when I was there, we had 2 nights out of the 7 that some seaweed washed up. It happened during the night and it looked almost like 5 inch spruce needles. The clean up staff were out there at first light with their rakes and they cleaned up the beach immediately. At no time was the water unswimable because of the seaweed. I live on Vancouver Island and when we get seaweed it generally has a pungent odor and is ankle thick. The seaweed on this beach was nothing compared to what I'm used to. There was no smell to it or sand fleas. Out of curiousity, when I saw the seaweed, I walked the beach for several hours and every resort was faced with the same thing. This is the ocean here! There were no rocks on this beach as I found on others. I found the entertainment to start too late in the evenings. They had a live band that played on the outdoor deck for about 45 minutes until the show started, then they would resume after the show ended. People would dance outside anywhere they saw fit and also in the lobby. The indoor show started at 9:45 p.m. and I found some nights to be quite entertaining but overall not as good as I've seen in other resorts. I found this resort to not be too handicap friendly. There were a lot of stairs to manipulate and people in wheel chairs or with heart problems may not be able to deal with this. I tried the international restaurant and it was nice. I wasn't too keen on the quality of alcohol that was being served. I wouldn't not go there because of it because I could go buy a 26 of really good stuff and drink for the entire week on 15 dollars. The activities staff were young and spirited and worked hard to offer people various activities. Overall, my experience at the Mandarin was positive and based on the services I received, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “b-e-a-utiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i had the greatest time, i didn't want to leave. I got brown, swam in the ocean, tried tequila, and saw stuff that i wouldn't see in a million years. I would live there if i could. If you want to find a great hotel, then go to Club El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and fun”
Reviews.Author: checkitout_10
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Mexico, second time to playa del carmen. Preveously we had stayed at Barcelo. From the minute we arrived the staff were the friendliest we have encountered. Our room was awsome as nice as the picture in the brouchure. This is a bit smaller resort so the beach is busy but the pool isn't to bad cosidering it isn't that big. The pool is perfect if you have kids because it starts off shallow and gradually gets deeper. The food in the beach restaurant isn't that great but the main restaurant is awsome. The fresh breads and salads and lots of variety made the meals my favorite. I also liked having the bbq burgers by the pool. The guests of all ages got very involved in playing games and joining activites. The lady doing massages on the beach was so good people from secrets next door were coming to see her because she was better and cheaper then there lady. I think one week is perfect for this resort. You have to keep in mind the distance from the airport, this one is close. After a long flight and sometimes long wait at the cancun airport you don't want a long agonizing trip to your hotel. I would recommend this place to my friends because it is nice and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for-which isn't much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our 4 teenagers came back on Dec.25. We arrived at noon on the 18th.We were told to go to the beach until our rooms were ready.When they were,I called down to get our luggage-I was yelled at on the phone by the staff at the front desk.When our luggage did arrive 2 pieces were AWOL-when they were found,I had to lug them myself.Then I had to go back to the desk to get a safe key,cuz we were not told to get it when we checked in. The front desk staff was rude& insulting.I tried to explain to them that they represent the hotel-the first one's the guests see upon arrival. I said don't argue with the guests-even if they drive u crazy, you should do your best-grit your teeth and suck it up.With the exception of 1, they were all in our opinion & many others the poorest choice the management made. The restaraunt staff, maids, bar tenders & entertainment staff were all A1.There is no food available after 10pm,we couldn't get reservations at the Mexican restaraunt,and the Christmas dinner was poorly organized.We were told to be in the lobby at 8:30-we did not begin our meal unti 9:50.There was food set up in the lobby 1 nite,so I filled a plate of sandwiches-the front desk woman told me I already ate my supper,they were not for us-they were for a group arriving from Canada. I said I was from Canada-we didn't even get a welcome drink. she told me to put the food back!!!! I did.The rooms were clean,air conditioner always broke down.We booked this 2 days before we left-it was all that was available-now we know why.We definitely would not recommend this hotel unless you like being abused, and told you're not allowed to eat. My teens had fun as they went into Playa del Carmen 5 out of 7 nights.Aside from the disco there was nothing for adults to do at night.There was no swim up bar as advertised,and 1 not 2 discos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: United Fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Mandarin for 8 nights in December 2004. We had a great time and were sorry to leave the temperatures in the 20s for the snow of Canada! The food is very good... the buffet selection is varied every night. The bar staff are very knowledgable and the front desk are heplful. The grounds are worth the visit alone. They are like botanical gardens... full of flowers, palms and wildlife. We asked for top floor facing the ocean and that's what we got. It's also close to the pool area, so if you like peace and quiet during the day, choose a room closer to the main hotel. The pool area was quiet after 5:30 however and then the ocean view was worth waiting for. Downside: You need to be an early riser if you want to book the two a la carte restaurants... they were fully booked by early to mid morning every day. The same goes for the free shuttle bus... it only holds 13 passengers at a time and that is nowhere near enough capacity for a hotel of that size, so get up early to book the shuttle bus too. The trips to Chichen Itza etc are best made in Playa del Carmen rather than the hotel. The hotel trips take in a lot of tourist traps and most use the mini buses as transport rather than larger, more comfortable coaches used by larger tour companies. The hotel trips are over-priced too. Overall we had a fantastic time and would recommend El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At best this hotel is 3.0 to 3.5 stars. That doesn't make it bad by any stretch, just be aware that this is what you're getting for your money. The rooms were below average (but always kept clean) and the hotel, ground, etc are also very basic and average but nicely kept. There is only one small pool and the beach is nicely maintained but the ocean by the hotel has a seaweed problem, which is not the best for swimming and lacks the nice aquamarine color that the Caribbean is know for (I had to take my friend who had never been to this side of Mexico to another beach to show him what it should really look like). There are only three restaurants (two you need reservations at) and the food was fair. Staff were very nice and our air conditioning which quit our second day there was repaired in a few hours so they do respond to requests reasonably quick. If you're looking for a laid back vacation with the basic of amenities for a reasonable price then this hotel may be for you. If you want a greater variety of restaurants, better food, pools, and such then spend a few extra bucks and go for a 4.5 star or better.

Reviews.Title: “A solid vacation experience...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed at the Club El Mandarin for 2 nights and three days in late November, 2004. The grounds were very nice, the service very good (our cable TV wasn't working and they had it fixed within 30 minutes), and the food was a very wide variety and above average quality. The drinks were okay--a bit watered down. There was not much to do at the resort overall, but mosts people came to relax anyway. The rooms were large and clean. Great service - it poured the first night we got there and they gave us umbrellas and tried to sweep away the water from the walkways. Overall a good all-inclusive resort on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mln
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this resort on the 4th of December and had a great time. We read all of the negative reviews, but we disagree. The food was good and the service was wonderful. Our room was clean, the grounds were beautiful and our room safe was "safe". The entertainment was good...this resort is not a "party" resort....mostly families and couples. You definitely have to make reservations for the free shuttle to Playa and for the specialty restaurants. Also, if you want a lounge in the shade, your towels have to 'reserve' a space by 7 am. We would definitely go back.....

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday after spending a week at El Mandarin. The place is spotless. They're always cleaning everything inside and out. We were amazed! We were surprised at how good the food was. The only thing was we would have preferred waiter service to a buffet at dinner other than the one night we ate in the specialty restaurant upstairs. But the array of foods at all meals at the buffet was incredible. The beach and pool areas are great. Don't miss lying in the hammocks, it's very relaxing. I don't think this would be a good honeymoon place but it's great for bringing young children. The staff from the front desk to the maids are always smiling and friendly. I'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SaSa_go_LaLa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a great stay at Club El Mandarin. We were on our honeymoon and we have no complaints! The food was plentiful and was a wide variety as well. The a la carte restaurants were good too. We had a very relaxing time - there was plenty to do if you wanted but staff left you alone if you weren't interested. The hotel is a 15 drive to Playa del Carmen main street (they have a bus available for $3)....great place to shop as well as visit another beach if you are interested. No complaints on the staff or cleaness of the resort either. The room was a good size too. Smaller resort, which we enjoyed. One thing I'll mention is - there is little night life on the resort, but they offer bus trips to Cancun. So if you are looking for a party this is not likely a place for you. If you are looking for a place where you can have relaxation and privacy....you get it here.

Reviews.Title: “a real blast”
Reviews.Author: steve_fra_2004
Reviews.Content: Just got back from el mandarin in Oct and had a blast. The bad reviews I read had us worried ,but from the time we got there we where treated excellent from all the staff. The hotel was great, our room was next to the beach and the view was unbelievable, the room was clean and everything worked up to par. No bugs, food was nice and the beach was very clean with nice white sand. I've been to alot of places in the south and el mandarin was in the top half of all the resorts and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from spending a week at Club El Mandarin from 10/30-11/6. As most reviewers have stated, the grounds here are very very pretty and well kept. We found the employees very friendly and helpful with the exception of the front desk. Do not plan on getting your room requests met or being treated very well at this front desk. If you are arriving during the day over a weekend, you will find two people working the counter, and in our case, roughly 20 people ahead of you in line. I spoke with a gentleman from Boston on Sunday morning who had arrived Saturday night and said it was even worse. Not the end of the world, but plan on a rough check in more than likely. We had requested a king bed near the beach ahead of time, got two full sized beds about the middle of the complex instead and we were told to bad, can't help you. It does get better from there though. We found the beach relaxing, the ocean not as bad as what some reviewers have said, we were in it several times each day, and never saw a crab, roach, or anything else for that matter. The food was very good for the most part, drinks aren't to bad, just stick to straight booze or order your margs on the rocks and you'll be fine. Also, be sure to take your own insulated glass or mug. They're happy to make your drinks in them and will save you alot of trips to the bar. All in all, a nice relaxing vacation spot outside of check in. Not a five star over the top resort, but much less expensive and much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Vacation”
Reviews.Author: milkiest99
Reviews.Content: Like many other people who have written, we were worried about the negative reviews we'd read here. Our mantra, for the entire 5 days we spent at El Mandarin, was: "What are people thinking?" We loved it. The beach was clean, the water clear. The pool was great, the drinks bountiful and refreshing. Even the food is great if you stick with what's simple: make your own tacos with the tortillas, freshly grilled fish, grilled veggies, and delicious guacamole. Our kids--5 and 1--had the time of their lives. Plus, our room was lovely and huge. Fabulous staff, beautiful grounds. We did notice the swampy smell on some days--but believe me, we could live with it! A great deal, a really fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “A week at El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for seven days at the El Mandarin on the week of October 24th and both had mixed reactions. We concur that the property is well cared for and the rooms are clean however, the buffet food can become a bit redundant and the bar drinks lead something to be desired. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with four swimming pools and a swim-up bar, El Mandarin is not the place. If you are looking for value with a great location and a place to sporatically hang out at, El Manadarin is the place for you. In conclusion, this was a inexpensive vacation for us but I think that we would like to try another hotel on our next visit. Definitely a 3 star hotel not 4!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort for couples!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Club El Manderin is awesome. I was worried we'd get a party resort or a very quiet setting. I wanted an 'in between' atmosphere! We definitely got that! The staff were great and we had an awesome time being part of the nightly live shows!!! Great drinks and food and room cleaning staff! We're going again but taking our 3 teenage kids with us! They'll love it. So much to do!

Reviews.Title: “best 7 day vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers, I was apprehensive about our trip here from reading some of the horrible reviews. My husband and I stayed 7 days and nights(Sept 26th- Oct 3rd) for a late 25th wedding anniversary trip and had the time of our lives! The room was very clean and any problems we had (the tv wasn't programed right, needing fresh wash cloths) were dealt with right away. Yes the lobby and buffet rooms were not equipped with AC and were rather warm-but remember -you are in a tropical area surrounded by jungle- DUH!!! If I wanted cool weather I'd have stayed in Ohio! The beach area was spotless and while the water wasn't crystal clear it was clear enough to see fishes and small squids swimming nearby. We didn't go snorkeling or diving but from what I heard from everyone there who did just a short distance away there were crystal conditions to go to. Yes the pool area disc jockey got annoying in both Spanish and English but most of it was people having a great time. All the staff were the hardest working people I've ever seen and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. If you wanted a nightlife or something different than just staying at the hotel there were free shuttles 2 times daily to Playa del Carmen or any excursion you wanted could be set up in the lobby by a number of people. We took the Apple tour to Chichen Itza one day and one freeby to Playa del Carmen (too crowded and touristy, could have been back in the states if it wasn't for a few local restaurants and more Spanish than English spoken) and spent the rest of the time RELAXING and getting to know each other again,and soak up the sun and the ocean breezes. It did rain almost every night we were there, usually for a short burst and then over in 15-20 minutes. Not bad for the rainy season! Our last night we had a bad storm come through and knock out most of the electricity to the rooms. We had our wake up call at 5 am as we requested ( a knock on our door since the phones were down) and had a porter from the lobby come with a flashlight and help carry our bags to the lobby! How many American hotels would do that for you? The staff went out of their way to help us as my husband is handicapped and had difficulty climbing the steps to the lobby and other places. Other than the steps from the lobby to the rooms, and to turn down the volume from the pool loudspeakers we have almost no complaints about this wonderful piece of paradise! Excellent food, wonderful rooms, great staff- we'll defininately go back!!!! P. S. Oh and the people complaining about the crabs- if they bothered you that much why didn't you pick some up, throw em in a pot and cook them?? The ones we saw were plenty big to eat and usually tried their best to scurry away from people when they were approached. And-horror of horrors- we had a live gecko crawl into our room that we "adopted'" as our room pet while there. We figured it was his home long before we got there. Since he was only about 4 inches from head to tail I don't think we had much to worry about. I suppose those kind of people (" the crabs were all over the walkway") didn't take the chance to appreciate how lucky they were to be at a place that still has live crabs to walk around , or turtles in the pool outside the lobby or watch the bats fly in the lobby at night eating the insects that might bite you.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sun22
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending a very long week at El Mandarin and boy was I disappointed. I found that the bathroom in my room was discussing.
