The bathroom and the entire grounds smelt of rotten garbage. Oh and watch out for the wild crabs, very large roaches and grasshoppers on the compound. Going to diner was a wonder on how many crabs will we encounter in the dark. The food was good, the staff every friendly. The place had it's good points as well as bad. This is a place I would not recommend or return too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bwilliams
Reviews.Content: Very nice, well maintained grounds, good food, lots to do, but the beach was lacking. The beach was clean, brilliant white sand but the water was merky more like the Texas coast instead of the crystal clear waters of other resorts. Overall a wonderful experience. We took 2 children ages 9-12 and both really loved it. We would go again and would recommend it to others if snorkeling at the resort is not a big interest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Club El Mandarin for our destination as it looked very beautiful in the travel brochures. We were not disappointed. The grounds are amazing. We were there for our 25th wedding anniversary and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. The resort is close enough to travel inexpensively by taxi to Playa Del Carmen and Xcaret. After a few days of venturing off site we did not want to miss the any more time at the resort and spent the final three days at the beach. The staff were wonderful, the room was clean, the beach immaculate and food declicious.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went there for a mother and daughter vacation and we truly enjoyed our stay. I was dreading on going because of all the bad reviews I've read but once I got there, I was pleasantly surprised. We enjoyed everything! -- especially the Catamaran water sport!! I highly recommend this place and I must say, the staff there are phenomenal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of local days”
Reviews.Author: czgal
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, but important to post for future patrons. I stayed at the Mandarin in May 2004 with my family. This was my second time at an all-inclusine resort so I do have a valid comparison. Upon arrival, the lobby was packed with locals and the luggage guy told us it was the end of gay week and now they were promoting a special for locals over the weekend. It took us 3 hours before we were able to get into our rooms. Atleast we were able to get our swimming suits and store our luggage so the entire time was not a waste. The rooms were beautiful, spacious and clean. The same goes for the grounds of the resort. The ocean was dirty and the pool was packed full of local kids....everything was in Spanish. We felt as though we were in Mexico City and no one spoke English or even cared that we were there, it was tough getting drinks, towels etc. The worst complaint is the food at this "all-inclusive" resort. There was little variety and everyday the food was exactly the same. The staff was annoyed and very cold-perhaps because it was local week. They ran out of food on several occasions and were reluctant to replace it. I tried to get a fountain coke in the morning and they refused to turn on the machine! I am sure that the locals being there had a lot to do with the lack of service we received, but it did take a lot from our vacation. The dive shop was great-not too busy and I received a lot of personal attention from the divemasters and had a great time diving the Cenotes. My non-diving family left the resort very dissapointed. Next time I stay at an all-inclusive I will make sure to call ahead and ask about any "local specials." Apparently they do this to fill up the hotels. Don't make the same mistake we did!

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Earth---Club El Manderin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Club El Manderin, Mexico This was hell on earth. If I was offered a free trip to this place, I would run as fast as I could in the other direction. Dirty beach, that not a single person sat on or swam in. We arrived on a Saturday in July, and our air conditioner never worked until Wednesday. No night life at all. They had a disco, that never opened once while we were there. Horrible, discusting food that was recycled from day to day. Small dirty pool. If I could give this resort a "0", I would, and that would be to generous!!! Stear clear of this dirt hole!

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mandarin 3 nights last week and we were not pleased. The rooms were like an older Holiday Inn. Although the grounds were very pretty, the lobby had not AC which was not THAT bad but the dining room did not either. We sweat every day eating there. THe other 2 restaurants were booked the entire time we were there even though we tried to book at 8am. The so-called mini-bar? Two bottles of water inside. No bottled beer anywhere at the hotel. Even the bars gave you tiny Dixie sized cups of beer and NO premium liquor. We figured if we are paying for drinks included, the drinks should be desireable at least. Margaritas were awful too. The pictures on the wall were all lopsided and the shower did not drain. The worst was the salty water in the showers. You have to bathe in salty water! We asked for another room and none available. We even tried to change hotels with funjet and nothing was open. We had to get to the beach by 8am to get a beach chair. Forget it if you want to relax and listen to the waves...there is music cranked almost the whole time with the screaming DJ playing silly name that tune games with the hotel guests. The food was dealable but nothing special. No remote control for TV, had to pay for the safe lock (a daily fee). I would not suggest this place...keep on looking for another place. It is ranked low for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “A Week To Remember In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our week in paradise began on Monday, July 26, 2004. Unfortunately, our flight was significantly delayed. Upon our 10:00 p.m. arrival we learned that a number of guests who had been scheduled to depart earlier that day were delayed because of the same airline delays. This resulted in management telling us "there was no room in the Inn that night." We were taxied to a substandard property about 15 minutes south of the Mandarin. Upon our return the following morning, however, Mandarin management more than rectified our situation. We were given room 2907; a very spacious room with an incredible view of the beach and sea. Our houseman took care of us as if we were royalty. It is amazing what a few US dollars per day will do. Prior to our trip I had read several poor reviews. In particular the ones about how loud the pool area had been; about the poor air conditioning; poor attitude of the staff; about the less than stellar food offerings; about the "less than clear" water and the seaweed; the buffet restaurant was too warm, etc. Keep in mind these were reviews for stays that took place just a week or two before our trip. Frankly, I think those writers went to a different resort. Our air conditioner worked fine. If we had a problem, then we reported the problem, and management rectified it within hours. The buffet restaurant was very comfortable and the food offerings were tremendous. The bartenders at both bars work their tails off. Demetrio is a great bartender. The pool area was sometimes loud, but the noise was from people HAVING FUN! Sure, there was seaweed and the water was sometimes not very clear, but this was not one of the protected areas for snorkeling. The transportation to and from Playa Del Carmen was more than adequate. The Apple tours we took were to Chitzen Itza and the Golden Cruise. They were both excursions to remember. The bottom line is I would recommend this resort to you if you are looking to relax and have fun in paradise. We wanted to relax and have fun and that is exactly what Brava Club Mandarin provided.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went from our reception we went to the resort. We were so excited when we arrived to our room a housekeeper was coming out of it. I took one step in the room and slipped on a puddle of water on the floor. I smashed my face off the floor and broke my front tooth. Right away, we contact the front desk, to get a doctor because my root was exposed. First, they told me that I would have to pay for the doctor. I was furious, so they said they would see what they could do after an hour of arguing. Then I told them that I needed to see a dentist because I did not want to spend my honeymoon in so much pain. They again argued about that, that I would have to pay. So I decided to contact a lawyer in Canada to let them know of my situation. I actually had to threaten them that I would sue them and Air Transat vacations for all the unfair treatment I was recieving. I broke my tooth on their wet floor and they gave me nothing but trouble on my honeymoon. I don't know about you but we pay alot of money to stay at these resorts to have this much pain and suffering and to have to deal with that.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Mandarin from July 20th until the 24th 2004. We absolutely loved it. The grounds were so beautifully landscaped it was pure tropical delight and everything was so clean. We've stayed in 6 star resorts that don't compare to this one. The main buffet is the best. The food was outstanding such a wide variety of items to choose from. I was very impressed and could not believe some of the items that were available like fresh seafood salads, shrimp etc. Everyone was very helpful in making our stay an unforgettable trip. The rooms were a good size, they had a variety of things to do throughout the day and the entertainment was'nt bad either. Overall I would say that we had the perfect vacation we would definately like to come back but next time with the kids. It is a great family place. So if your looking for a nice relaxing vacation this is the place to be. After a few days here you'll need to work hard on the treadmill when you get back... Mimi & Anibal Rivera

Reviews.Title: “Not everyones cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoNikki
Reviews.Content: Now to put up the good and bad. Good-The room we were given 2003 was way from the beach, but the airconditioner worked awesome so we didn' ask to be moved(we are young) The resort itself is soooo clean and the worker work their butts off. The food was good always had a choice of mostly anything. The specialty restraunts I could take of leave, nothing special except getting wait on. The people we met Hi Sally and Adrian. Bad- the Beach, having traveled to Cancun Four times in the last two years, this beach sucked, the pool is to small for the size of the property. The Free shuttles, when we got to the resort they were all booked up for the first five days. So we ended up paying $10 per way to go to Playa to have a decent beach. Why pay all inclusive if you can't lay on a decent beach. Our Apple Rep that is in the resort. We asked to be moved up to Cancun, withthe understanding we would have to pay the difference. He told us there were NO room in cancun, so I went in the internet cafe, found some phone #s and called the propeties myself. Not only did everyone that I called have rooms, they had lots of them. I went back to the rep and told him this and his reply was that if we wantd to change it was up to us. Apple would in no way help at all, So here we are STUCK at this resort. Im telling you all there are a lot better places out there. We would never return to this resort. But we are on our way back to Cancun in Dec. with our kids. We stayed here July 20 to 27. Have fun peaple

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: veggielovr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous time at the El Mandarin. Our room was very spacious and we very much enjoyed having our own private deck. Lucky for us, we were an end unit and so we did not look out onto anyone else. The staff at the ElMandarin were what made our stay extra special. Everyone was very courteous and willing to help you however possible. We especially enjoyed the food, and although alot of the buffet was redundant, there was so much to choose from, you could satisfy any pallette. I especially enjoyed the desserts and the never-ending guacamole! The food was always available, and in the hours (only a couple during the course of the day), when the restaurants were all closed, there were drinks and appetizers, along with live music on the veranda, and in the main lobby. There was music on the beach starting at ten, when all the entertainment started for the day. Though some may find the music too much, we really enjoyed the fun and laidback atmosphere of the resort. There were activities and lessons going on all day, everyday. There is also a daycare for children (though we left ours at home). Although the beach has a seaweed problem, a short walk down the beach, it is very clear and lovely. For other daily activity, the hotel has an agreement with the Tres Rios park, just a short walk down the beach. $17 gets you a week-long pass. Tres Rio is a nature park where you can enjoy snorkeling, horseback riding, bike rides, kayaking, and a host of other activities. We also ventured out on a snorkeling trip from the hotel. The staff was very helpful, as it was our first-ever snorkel adventure. $25 for an hour may seem a bit steep, but an hour is pretty much all you need! Navigating the reef for an entire 60 mins is very tiring! (Esp. when you decide to forgo the life jackets!) All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay. We may even consider going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were some problems when we first got to the resort: They had given us a room where the a/c didn't work, no fans, the lights didn’t work; and the phones were not working, and the room smelled musty and moldy. I also tried to purchase an international phone card from one of the hotel stores – the clerk would not accept my payment and sent me to the check-in desk to get pesos. When I returned she had closed the store 15 minutes early. They resisted giving us another room at first, citing how they were fully booked, but after working with the a/c and finding out the hoses were busted and leaking water, they gave us a great room close to the courtyard. They also allowed us to use the phone in the hotel office, which reflected their desire to make our experience a good one. After that, everything went well for us, but each time I passed by the check-in desk, there were more people complaining about their a/c and phones. The International Restaurant requires long pants, so we were not able to eat there. The buffet restaurant was very warm inside, but the food was good. Drinks were good, and the bartenders were good. The staff was very courteous. The store clerks inside the hotel stores would not always accept our credit card even though they said they would and our credit card was good. We tried to make 3 different purchases, and 2 of those times they would not process our credit card. We think it either was due to them not knowing how to use the credit card machine or they just wanted US currency. The hotel charges 3% commission to cash in Travelers checks. As for activities, we chose to go out on an excursion for snorkeling to Paradise Reef Adventure because, even though it's a little more expensive than going snorkeling through the excursions from the hotel, it was worth it. We also went to Tulum - highly recommended and the beach at Tulum afterwards was great. We also went horseback riding, so our 3 day stay was full and those activities were excellent. I was disappointed with the resort's beach, but the hotel offers free kayaking, catamaran, and windsurfing. Overall, Club El Mandarin was OK, but at the prices we spent, we should not have had the problems that we did. This resort has good potential, and I recommend as a starting point, they examine each room before check-in to make sure everything works.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from El Mandarin last night. Stayed from 7/20 to 7/28. Good points: Beautiful grounds, immaculately clean. Staff is friendly, if you say "hello" first. Food is excellent, best is in the buffet (selection is amazing)...specialty restaurants are not quite as good. I have a 6 yr. old so the variety in the buffet is superb. Pool is great...water can be a bit warm in the afternoon, but it is superb. Lots of kids. Very few speak english (mostly spanish and italian), but kids find a way to play. Beautiful outdoor drink and hors d'ouvers set up around 6pm outside everynight for mingling with guests before dinner. Beautiful rooms, no bugs, very clean. Huge turtle fountain with at least 25 live turtles, the kids find them fascinating. Entertainment staff is wonderful, you can do as little or as much as you'd like. Improvements needed: Air conditioning.....worked the first night, went off the next afternoon, after 4 calls we were finally told that it could not be fixed. The manager told us that the hotel was 100% booked could not be moved...had to "sleep" in 87 degree room. We were moved first thing the next morning and everything was fine for the remainder of the stay. The ocean is "grassy". The sea is filled with what I can only describe as "loose lawn clippings". You can swim in it, but it is not visually appealing. However, the pool is great! Overall, I think the hotel does an excellent job in treating its guests well, and I would gladly go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a week's stay at this hotel. I thought that it was great. The entertainment staff there were very friendly and there was lots to do. Although there wasn't a bar inside the pool, that wasn't a big deal for me because the pool bar was so close. The bar staff was also friendly and quick. Despite some reviews I have read I didn't notice any stinting on the drinks/liquor. As far as the rooms were concerned, the first room they put us in was disappointing. However, after requesting a better room, we were given a great room with a King size bed and balcony overlooking the beach/pool area. I thought the food was very good. I had no complaints and there was certainly a lot of selection and plenty of it. The only thing that I would recommend is that you bring some bug spray as the bugs can get a little bit annoying at night (biting ankles etc.), At this time of year there were definitely kids. The pool was just the right size for me. Not a large deep end and the water pretty much only came up to my chest. All along the one end of the pool was a wading area - a great way to sit in the water and just relax, talk or read a book. There was also a separate hot tub area and it was nice as well. The pool water was very warm. So... if you are looking for an adult resort, this would not be the resort for you. But all in all I had a wonderful time and the staff were very helpful. I was looking for some R & R and that's definitely what I got. I would definitely recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hola, Just returned from our second trip to Club El Mandarina in the Mayan Riveria. We had a delightful time. As a road warrior, the resort provides me with just the right amount of activity and relaxation time. For those of you who want glitz, glamour and feeling like you are in the states this is not the place. About 80% of guests from Europe(Italy, Spain and Germany) and South American, Americans all very continental in their view of the world. The grounds of the resort are lush, well groomed and extremely clean. The rooms are large and gorgeous, sure like anywhere in the Carribean the water pressure was not terrific all the time. We stayed in the 2100 building and had a great view of the pool and sea. The housekeeping was excellent, we did not have wash cloths, asked the maid and then had wash cloths daily. We truly enjoyed the beach, many different areas to sit, not just one large beach. Was amazed that you could find a palapa any time of day. They are truly working hard to keep ahead of the seaweed and erosion, towards the end of our week the water was very clear. However one could swim or wade out to find clear water. Could also walk south beyond the Secrets resort and find clear water. FYI Secrets had the same seaweed concerns. The Activities and Entertainment staff were the best we have ever experience. All very friendly, interesting and engaged in creating a pleasant day for all guests. Cannot say enough about all of them. Some from Italy, Mexico, Canada, South America. The water aerobics class is a great deal of fun, however they make sure you do get a work out. Would also recommend the morning strech and beach walking tour. I read that someone was turned off by the music. Yes there was music on the beach, however is only loud at certain times(lunch, late afternoon). I actually enjoyed hearing Mexican music. We truly enjoyed the food. Very well done and a vast variety. However if you only enjoy American food, there is not much of a variety with the exception of hamburgers, hotdogs and french fries. Drinks were great and plentiful, be sure to bring an insulated cup for beach drinks(only use plastic cups). Beach bar closed at 6pm. However the bar in the lobby was open. Found it lovely to go to room around 6pm shower and then go to the lobby where they served very decorated native drinks, some with and some without alcohol, most evening had live music befor and after dinner. There are 2 gourmet resturants, reservations can be made at check in only 1 at each per stay, good nights to book are Saturday and Sunday evenings. Queztal is air conditioned, the Mexican is not. Also the main dining room does not have a strong ac system, if traveling in summer dress lightly. My husband found that regular golf shirts were too heavy, bring light weight shirts, I had no problem wearing sundresses, short skirts or shorts with sleeveless shirts. Men must wear trousers to Queztal, not the Mexican resturant. If going into town with 2 or more people, bus space limited on free shuttles (to at Noon and 1pm, from 4:30pm & 5:30pm), other times available but $3/person/way............taxi $10 each way. We took at taxi one day and like the freedom of when to go and come back. Town built up even more than a year ago, decrease in # of vendors to bargain with, enjoyed not having the hassle. Word of advise town is HOT HOT HOT, go later in afternoon. There are many tours from the hotel. This was our 6th time in Mexico and the beach and relaxing is what we were seeking. Would recommend going on the ISle of Muijeires tour, from hotel all day food, boating, snoerkling, sailing, tour of island and parasailing for $65/person. There is also a 1 hour snoerkling trip to a reef for $25/person which is extremely worth while and will see many fish and coral. As I said earlier, I am a road warrior and for vacation I need a place that is clean, pretty and where I can just hanging out in my bathing suit and sarong all day and not really think about anything except if I have sunblock on. Please let me know if you have any questions. We plan to return to Club El Mandarian!!!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I chose the Club d/t price. We bought the package on expedia w/airfare for $600 pp for 4 nights and 5 days in May. We read the reviews on the website and most of them were good, there were some negative comments. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful grounds, clean and well-appointed rooms. Check in was quick and ez and although it was only 1:30 in the afternoon we were shown right to our room with an ocean view. Trip advisor suggested we bring cups for the bar. We did both day and evening 20 oz cups. The bartenders filled them without question. In fact other guests looked like they wished they had thought to do the same. The pool was clean, but we needed floats--none provided. The sand and chairs at the beach perfect. The water, we were told, is mirky and gross d/t a storm and the destruction of a coral reef. That is not the fault of the hotel. Despite the condition of the ocean on site, our trip was delightful! The staff was polite, the shows were hokey (though some were better than others), the food in the Mexican restaurant was muy bueon. My only gripe was the buffet restaurant was unpleasantly hot. They need fans or at the very least open the sliding doors. The 3 piece band was great and very responsive to our suggestions. I recommend this place and we may go back again with a larger group to enjoy an affordable vacation so close to home. Excellente CLub El Mandarin. Muchas Gracias.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi All. Like most of you I did alot of reading on this website on the El Mandarin before we travelled and to be honest I started to dread what we'd find when we got there. Thankfully most of the bad comments are grossly exaggerated and as with anywhere the holiday is what you make it. We arrived on 4th June 04 and spent two weeks and what we considered to be a beautiful well maintained resort. Yes we had bad storms whilst there and experienced a lack of water and electricity, but in comparison to people in other hotels who were evacuated the El Mandarin coped really well. They always kept you informed and did their very best to keep moral high. We were lucky to get an umbrella from reception however I do accept that other guests weren't as fortunate. Food was good but very Americanised especially the breakfasts, staff everywhere were the friendliest I have ever met. The grounds, rooms and beach are always kept immaculate. No the sea isn't clear blue, but there is no problem in swimming there. They organise excellent trips from the hotel which tend to be cheaper than the same trips through your travel company. For those of you visiting Mexico for the first time, swimming with the dolphins is a must! While we were there a few people complained about stomach trouble, but I can honestly say that didn't effect either of us throughout our trip, I guess some people aren't happy unless they are complaining ! After reading so may concerning reviews about the hotel I really was worried when we left Gatwick but I can honestly say hand on heart it was one of the best holidays I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June19th to July 2nd, I`m glad I read all the reviews about the hotel before and we were aware of the problems corncerning the sea and the beach.In the scheme of things it wasnt as bad as it was made out. Parts of the beach made swimming in the sea accessible It was not too bad as we had pleasant calm weather for the two weeks.Mexico has a terrible habit of placing paper bands on your wrist for visits either to Talum,snorkling orother outsid activities.I did object to the hotel band and managed to hide it under my watch strap.It meant that in all our group photos they were visibile all the time.The food was well presented and the upstairs resturant is a must , found the wines a bit expensive.Would have thought that good Calaforian wine would have been lots cheaper than the others as its right on their own doorstep.A major problem was the heat in the main resturant,no moving air and the doors were shut i`m sure to stop people taking their meals outside.From a European view point lots of the meals are geared for American tastes,saying that there was plenty of salads and mouthwatering fruits.Cheeses very boring.As mentioned else where the beer is one step up from tepid weak watered down pale liquid,one good tip is to seek out the head barman tip him early on and hey presto instant service.We found the staff extremely helpful and always cheerful,they do work very hard for their meagre wages.Mind you some of their health and safety practises are non existance.Man blowing ant dust with machine not wearing a mask.Also with the room maids a few extra Pesco`s go a long way to make small request go smoother.The pool was a bit small but we coped and the pool bar was well placed as we were not always inclined to walk up to the main resturant every lunchtime.Rooms were spacious and we never had any problem either with the power or air-conditioning.The bathroom could do with having extracta fans fitted to take smell outside. Room to room cavities a bit thin as people up stairs having a arguement kept us enterained for some time. Lastly we could not fault the entertainment staff first class how they keep their cheerful demeanor up all all day every day is to their credit,from activities around the pool to evening shows they were a pleasure to know. I personally sailed every day,the catamaran good do with a new set of sails.the scuba instructer is a first classteacher ,We also hired a car which gave us the flexability to travel further and save on some of the paid tours.In all a nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “"A Wet Beginning"”
Reviews.Author: boston72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Club El Mandarin from June 12 - 19, 2004 to celebrate our one year Anniversary. When we arrived it was raining really bad, thinking it would stop we checked in and waited in the lobby for a while where it was very hot, no air conditioning. So we waited, and waited and waited but the rain just kept coming down, and there were no umbrellas available, being that our bungalow was a distance from the lobby. Finally we got our hand on a half assed umbrella and decided to go to our room. Well let me tell you all, by the time we found our room we got there soaked, due to all of the rain, all of the walkways were flooded. When we got to our room our luggages were outside waiting for us also drenched. The room was average, nothing to write home about. At 3a.m. we lost power and had no a/c, and to boot no water!! The water and electricity came back the next day, but we still didn't have any a/c for about three days. Finally we asked for a room change with a/c that worked and we got a great oceanfront room with finally a king size bed that we had requested from the start. The phone were out for about four days so we couldn't call home at all, and when they finally did come back we had to pay $1.50 just for the connection charge to use a prepaid calling card. The rest of the week the weather was beautiful, no problems. The animation staff are great, during the day by the pool and at night putting on shows, very friendly. The food is good, we alternated by going to the resturants and the buffet, make sure you make reservations a day before you want to go to one of the resturants. The beach as we had heard was murky, I had to see it for myself, but the beach in Playa del Carmen is beautiful, worth the trip. The grounds are very well kept and the wokers on the resort really do work hard. There are blue crabs all over the place, but the are harmless, and will run and hide when you get close to them. Alot of big bugs outside at night, we had some ants in our room sometimes, but what do you expect in the middle of a jungle! Tipping the housekeepers does help sometimes getting extra towels, especially when the towels were limited due to the storm flooding their laundry room. A dollar goes a long way, these people work nearly for nothing, we even felt sorry for them. There is a free shuttle to Playa del Carmen at 12 & 1p.m. but you need to make reservations the day before, it does fill up fast. If you want a good spot near the pool you need to get down there early in the morning and put your towels down. Drinks are ok, not the best, and they only had one type of beer, Corona. The main dining room where they have the buffet is very hot, they have no a/c there and none in the lobby and bathrooms either. All in all for the price we payed, we got our moneys worth, but I think next time we would upgrade. Maybe the Mayan Palace, check it out if you get a chance. We got a free breakfast and a free excursion to Xel-Ha and Tulum, just for going to check out the hotel in hopes that next time we would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Honeymooned here at El Mandarin from June 6 -June 10, 2004. THe Grounds are impecable, the Corona Beer is good, the Mixed drinks are tasty but takes a lot to get ya trashed (tip bartenders and wait staff and they will put a lil more kick in the drinks, or just ask for it) The beach is brown but if you walk(great walk) north, less then 10 minutes (.3 mile) is TRES RIOs and it is beautiful. They have a deal with guest of the mandarin pay $17 per person for unlimted use during your saty at the hotel. Tres rios has Horse riding $30.00 and snorkeling of Cenotes for a $5 mask rental fee (must do!!) Everything else canoes, kyak, bikes, chairs, palapas and beach (crystal clear) are included in the $17. Our room was great Ac was cold, every now and then you would see a bug( remember this is the 3rd world). The funky smell people complain about we noticed only once and lingered for a few seconds. Now as far as pool bars and what not who cares about that, the bar is right by the pool, get ya butt out of the water and get a drink. Recommendations go to the gift shop and buy a big beer stein. The Bar will be gladly to fill it up with your favorite concotion. We did this and it cut down on the trips to the Bar. lOBBY BAR HAS BOTTLED WATER pick up a couple before you go to bed. The animation/activity directors were great. BEst day tours for the Tulum was awesome. For the money very gooood deal. We paid 1200.00 for five days including air fair thru expedia. e-mail me for ?

Reviews.Title: “Great (for the price)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there with our 2 kids (ages 8 & 10) on June 2 thru June 8. They say "you get what you pay for", however, you definitely get more at Club El Mandarin. Is it a 5 star resort? No! Is it worth the price? Absolutely! The resort is beautiful! The beach is nice, but the water is nasty! I tried to go in one day and cut my foot on some coral I couldn't see because of the murkiness! I never went back! But we came to relax, and the kids loved the pool! We went to Xel-ha and enjoyed the snorkeling and swimming there. It is a must-do especially with the all-inclusive! The kids said "this is the most fun I ever had in my entire life" - even more than Disney World! You can travel for free to Play Del Carmen by shuttle at the resort which you must schedule ahead of time. We all enjoyed shopping there, and you can enjoy some beautiful beaches while there. The animation team there was okay at best. The children liked a couple of the shows, but a few were pretty stupid, and one had to do with pretending to kill your wife then yourself! Not what I want children seeing (or myself for that matter!) Also the shows don't start until 9:45 or 10:00 which is too late especially for kids. The kids club was practically non-existent and one child age 6 was left by herself by the pool by the staff with no parent or guardian! The buffet restaurant is way too hot and needs air conditioned! When they do open the sliding doors, you get attacked by mosquitos - buy repellant! The staff is very friendly and hard-working. The food is good and none of us got sick! The kids recommend the hamburgers at the snack shop/pool bar for lunch! Definitely scope out prices at the souvenir shop by the lobby counter before buying from the vendors by the turtle pond (which is cool) or in town! Best prices we found! And never pay the price the vendors in town quote you! They tried to get us to pay $45 for our daughter's hair braided and I got them down to $25! Just start to walk away and they usually bargain! Also do NOT listen to the people trying to get you to go to the Mayan Palace by offering you discounted prices at the local tourist attractions! They are found in town and at the airport when you arrive! Just keep walking! It is a gimmick! The rooms are nice - ask for a bungalow and possibly an ocean view! Best to call a week or few days before while confirming your reservation! There are definitely a drawbacks to this resort, but we had a wonderful time! Nothing that caused any regrets to our choice! We probably won't go back, but that is because we want to try new places and countries! So go, relax, and enjoy all the money you saved!

Reviews.Title: “Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from vacationing at CLUB EL MANDARIN. I wouldn't go back to this hotel. I don't understand why APPLE gave it a rating of 4 star. It is 3 star at best. Personally I would give it a 2 star. The beach was murky and seaweeds were all over the beach. We checked into the rooms. The rooms were okay. We had a balcony facing the pool. But the air conditioner didn't work. We called them as soon as we checked into our room. They came by pressed some buttons and said it'll be better if not they will fix tomorrow. Tomorrow came by the ac still did not work. They offered to change our rooms but it was further away from the pool. Since we were only there for 3 nights..and this was our last night. We said forget it. So we sweat through our whole vacation. The other problems was the lights in the room. When you use the hairdryer the lights in the bathroom starts to flicker and turn off. All the lightings in the room was screwy. Lights would turn on by itself or you can't turn it on. We thought the room was haunted! But if you play with the bulbs or the switch it's just loose wires. The toilet got clogged on the 2nd night and they never came to fix it. We ended up using the toilet next door in our friend's room. For a hotel that's somewhat new, the condition of the hotel looks old. There were cracks everywhere. It's true. They only have 1 pool for the whole hotel. So everyone congregates there and if you dont wake up at 7am to grab some chairs they're all gone. The other complaint I have is the food. They said all inclusive but you can't really eat 24 hours. No room service. And you have to eat at a set time. Breakfast is served at main dinning hall from 7am to 10am. If you miss it ..too bad. Then you will have to grab continental breakfast by the pool. Dinner is from 7pm to 9pm and you can't bring food out of the dining hall. So you're out of luck if you are hungry at midnight. As for the alchohol? What alcohol. Everything was watered down. Tough luck trying to get drunk. The only thing that I really like about the hotel are the staff. I really give it to them. Great job on the entertainment. We made the most out of the trip but doubt it I will ever come back. Spend the money and stay in the hotel strip in CANCUN. The beach is 100x better.

Reviews.Title: “great resort...bad location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, me and my wife arrived at Club el Mandarin in May 2004. First of all, the resort is absolutely exquisite, clean, beautiful grounds, I mean, really impressive. The staff was great and very helpful, and the food was very good. We though we were in paradise...until we went to the beach. Now I dont know why but the portion of the beach that belongs to this resort is very dirty and not even close to crystal clear like the rest of the beaches around playa del carmen. Oh and if youre planning on goin to Cancun or Playa de Carmen this resort is stuck right in the middle of them both so bring plenty money for the taxi's. Overall we had a nice time but it would have been good to know that we were not going to be close to anything because this resort is really secluded. Next time we will make sure we are either ACTUALLY ON Playa del Carmen or ACTUALLY IN Cancun where everything is happening. Would we stay at Club el Mandarin again? yeah, probably when we are about 55 or 60 years old. This resort is for the more mature crowd.

Reviews.Title: “It was a decent hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club El Mandarin from 05/29/04-06/02/04. Overall, we enjoyed our trip. But there were a few hiccups along the way. This is going to be a pretty long review since I'm going to try to comment on things that I think other potential visitors should be aware of before deciding where to stay: Let me just start with the fact that the sevice was very good. Everyone was very cordial and polite. We tipped particularly the maids and waiters whenever we thought appropriate, which was quite frequent. It's obvious that they work very hard. As most other reviews have commented on, the beach was more than lackluster. It was full of seaweed. I had been checking the weather starting the week before we left and did not see any evidence of rain or storms to account for the murkiness, which remained this way the entire trip. (FYI... the beaches in Playa de Carmen, just south of the El Mandarin Hotel, was absolutely beautiful.) So with a disappointing beach, guests are left with the swimming pool which is not very deep (good for little kids) and feels quite slimy. There is not swim-up-bar, but the bar is poolside. The animation team (at poolside, they're the ones in the red swimsuits) work extremely hard to keep guests entertained. At night, they put on shows which were good and entertaining. There are 2 tennis courts (located close to the entry of the premise) which were clean and playable (there were lights but we didn't play late enough to see if they worked). There is a small work out area in the corner of the lobby (close to the buffet dining hall); I actually didn't use the facility myself but looking from the door, the equipment looked adequate. The landscaping was very beautiful. The rooms are tiled and are large and spacious and most importantly- well air conditoned. Each room has an airconditioner which is remote controlled. We never had a problem with the AC. Each room has a small refrigerator (which is not cold at all, but enough to keep the contents cool). On arrival, there were only 2 bottles of water. So whenever we walked through the lobby, we would go to the bar and pick up extra bottles of water, which we tool on our excursions. There is a safety deposit box in each room. But guests need to pay $2.50 USD/day for a lock to that box. If you are traveling with a large family, you may want to verify beforehand that you are all staying close together. We had 4 different rooms- 2 rooms were in the same bungalo, 1 was in the bungalo next door, but the other couple had to stay way on the opposite end of the premise. Also, just be aware that check-in time is not until 3:00 PM. But during the interim, they have any area where you can change to go swimming or you can go eat until your room is ready. A problem that we all had was the running water. Often times we did not have hot water. They would try to fix it as quickly as possible but it beame a recurring problem. Furthermore, the 1st night that we were there, our tub was not draining well, but the maintence ppl came and fixed it relatively quickly. The tap water is salty but tolerable. We didn't do this- but future guests may want to use the bottled water to brush your teeth, etc. Be ready to endure the heat. One of my biggest complaint is that other areas of the hotel is not well air conditioned at all! There are no ceiling fans anywhere. The lobby area is an open area and is hot with some relief when there is a cool breeze. The buffet dining hall is HOT, HOT, HOT. Sometimes, they'll open the side doors to the outside, so try to sit next to these areas if these doors are open. Future visitors may want to bring one of those small portable fans. The food is safe to eat. The buffets themselves are plentiful and offer a wide variety with lots of fresh fruit. Breakfast starts at 7:00AM, lunch at 12:30PM, dinner at 7:00 PM. The breakfast buffet was great- the best of the buffets. The smoothies are very good. The lunch buffet was so-so. They have a very wide selection for dinner. There are 2 a la carte restaurants where guests can eat at, but reservations are required the day before (there is a desk in the lobby area where guests go to make reservations). The sevice at both places was very good. The Mexican restaurant (during the day, it's the poolside grill) was okay. The best dish is probably the speciality, the "El MAndarin.." (its shrimp stuffed in a plantain). The international/goumet restaurant (located in the upstairs lobby area) is better. Again the main entree was okay, but the desert that I had (chocolate cake and ice cream) was delicious. We rented 2 cars to go on our excursions. When fillin gas, there is gas station attendant who will fill up your gas tank. Remember to check and make sure that the pump has been zeroed before they start pumping the gas- unfortunately, we had this happen to us. We went to Xel Ha and Tulum on our excursions. The entry to price to Tulum was $4 USD/visitor. You could pay $30 USD for a tour guide. The ruins are roped off but it was still an amazing site. There are beautiful views of the shoreline and beach. Just be sure to be ready to endure the heat. Xel Ha is closeby to Tulum. People can swim with dolphins (it'll cost you >$100 USD to do this). We went snorkeling here, which was very fun. If you don't have your own gear, you can rent all the gear for $10 USD to use the whole day. However, one of my traveling companions, who had been here before, was very disappointed at the lack of corals and fish. For those who want to purchase souveniers, I would recommend checking out the souvenier shop (not the gift shop) in the lobby; it's open from 9:30AM to 10PM. The prices are set but reasonable. We had gone to the stands located just outside the hotel and other shopping areas in Cancun and realized that these outside vendors really try to rip you off. Would I go back? Only if the beach clears up and ceiling fans are installed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigred57
Reviews.Content: I really have to wonder what some of these people are expecting when they travel!! I'm glad I didn't get a chance to read these reviews before my husband and I vacationed at Club El Mandarin. My husband bought our tickets and gave mine to me for X-mas. (What a surprise) We left on Jan. 10, 2004 for one week. We had such a good time! We both came home talking about going back as soon as we can. There is still so much that we want to do there! We went to Playa De Carmen one afternoon to shop. Didn't have much time to see everything so want to go back there again. We went on 2 tours which took up 2 more days. We spent the rest of the time sitting by the pool and plain old relaxing, glad that we weren't back in cold Canada. How can this not be great? Our room was right beside the lobby, which we ended up thinking it couldn't be more conveniant. The time spent in the lobby (restaurant/bar) or reading a book out of the sun was right next door to our room. Our own washroom was handy. Why use the public one? The pool and the beach was only a five minute walk, and it was nice because the lawns, bushes, flowers were so beautifully maintained. The occasional smell that came from the swamp wasn't that bad!! The food was great. Such a big buffet. No problem finding something you liked and a lot of it. The only thing I didn't care for was the coffee. It seemed bitter, but the banana milkshakes made up for it! The house wine was good. The outside restaurant/bar was also nice. You could get out of the sun and have a hamburger, hotdog, fries, nachos, fish, etc. They had slushie drinks that were so good in the heat. The animation team were awesome to say the least. They were all friendly, and always so busy! They spent their day entertaining the guests, giving spanish lessons, dance lessons, playing water and beach volleyball with whatever guests were interested in that activity. Football soccer was also also played. I don't really know the rules to it, I didn't go watch it. There was water arobics every morning. This seemed to attract the older visitors. Then in the the evening the same people put on outstanding shows in the theatre. Considering they weren't professional actors I thought they were very entertaining. All in all, it was a very good holiday, and worth the dollars spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: sandstorm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at El Mandarin from 5/9-5/14/04. We booked a package online through Expedia. The cost of the hotel for two of us, excluding airfare, was $500. Not bad for an all-inclusive. I did a lot of research regarding this resort and like most I was excited, yet a little skeptical. Overall, it ended up being a decent vacation. DAY 1 - We arrived at El Mandarin on Sunday 5/14 at around 4PM. We were given a room in the efficiency building which I was not aware that they even had. Room was of a nice size and was clean. Air worked ok. One problem was that our bath tub did not drain very well which I cannot stand. Also, the resort was extremely crowded and therefore the efficiency building was very loud. We later learned that it was Mother's Day in Mexico on Monday so the resort was really crowded with families and tons of kids. After we settled in we went straight to the beach. I was dying to check out the water, one of the main things I was looking forward to. All the reviews I read said the water was murky, but I just couldn't believe it. After seeing the water for myself I was sadly disappointed. It was very murky and full of seaweed. It was windy while we were there, but I can assure you the wind had nothing to do with the color of the water. It is just the location of the hotel. After a while we went to get a couple drinks. It took forever. The bar at the pool was crowded and there was only one bar tender. They even ran out of beer later on in the afternoon. I couldn't believe it! Later on that evening we requested to switch rooms and to be moved to one of the bungalows. By the end of the first day I couldn't wait to get home and was quite disappointed. Day 2 - We woke up to find a room change notice under our door. I was glad because I thought we'd need to constantly ask them to move us. It rained for most part of the second day so we did not do much as far as sitting at the beach. All the families and little kids were checking out. From here on out the resort became nice and peaceful. We made reservations for the free shuttle into town for the following day. We moved into our new room around 4PM. New room was very nice. AC kept the room like an icebox. Shower worked good, and our bungalow was very close to the beach in building 9. DAY 3,4,5 - Vacation turned around from this point. We took the shuttle on the third day into town. It drops off right near 5th Avenue. We went straight to the beach which is like a 5 min walk from where the shuttle drops off. Now I was happy. The water was absolutely beautiful. It was the aqua blue water you picture in the Carribean. We took the shuttle into town 3 days in a row and sat on the beach there and played in the water. There are also a couple really neat bars we went to there. The one we like was El Pirata (the Pirate I believe). The thing that was cool was instead of bar stools there were swings at the bar that you could swing in while you drink. Was nice and relaxing. The Rooms - The room that we were in at El Mandarin after we moved was nice. Couch, fridge, great AC. Very clean. Make sure you request a room in the bungalow. The Beach - Like I said the water is very murky, even black at some points with all the dirt and seaweed. However, the sand itself is clean for the most part. There is a beach boy constantly raking the seawide that washes up on the shore. There are plenty of beach chairs and palapas. We never had a problem getting one. The dive shop is right there if you want to check out kayaks, catamarans, snorkel stuff, or rent jet skis. If all you want to do is sit at the beach and tan then the beach here will suit you just fine. The Food - Overall the food was very good. The buffet had a different theme everynight. Lots of variety. I really enjoyed the spicy Mexican salsa and all the guacamole. Lots of fresh seafood. Fresh omelettes filled with what you like for breakfast. There are two specialty restaurants which require reservations. They can only be made the day of. I prefered this because when we have been to other All-inclusives you could make reservation days in advance and they would always fill up. The specialty restaurants were good, nothing spectacular. There is the international restaurant, El Quetzal upstairs in the lobby. It was the restaurant where you needed to look nice, no shorts etc. The food was good for the most part. One night I had the fish in esparagus sauce which was really good. Another night I had the lamb chops which weren't that good. The other restaurant is El Mandarin Mexican restaurant which they have at the pool snack bar. I think I had the fried chicked tacos for the main course which werent that great. However, the appetizers the had set out were really great. Tostadas, tomales, etc. Between the 2 restaurants and the buffet the food was overall pretty good. The Bars - Lobby Bar and Beach Bar. Both were fine. I drank lots of Corona and Bananna Mamas. Didnt have to wait long at all (with the exception of that first day) The Pool - We didn't spend any time in the pool. The pool was kinda small, but big enough for the size of the resort. Don't think it was very deep. Maybe 4 ft at deepest. No swim up bar. Had activities like water polo and pool volleyball. Hotel Shuttle - This is what saved our vacation. We took the free shuttle to and from town 3 days in a row. It is about 15 min into town. Shuttle drops off right near 5th avenue. 5 min from awesome beach. You can only sign up one day prior. I believe Alex arrives at the desk around 8AM so sign up early. However, one day we even managed to sign up for the free shuttle a couple hours prior. The shuttle runs every hour starting at noon. Only the 12PM and 1PM shuttle leaving the hotel are free, otherwise its 3USD per person. Coming back the free shuttle is 430PM and 530PM Staff & Service - Overall the service was really great. Alex, the guy at the tours desk that does the shuttle reservations is very helpful. Remembered our name during our stay. The activities guys and gals were really cool. Always had something going on. They would talk to you and ask you to participate, but would never pressure you. Staff was very friendly. Bartenders were great. Very friendly and remembered your name and always made great drinks. Entertainment - At around 830PM there would be a live band on the patio area by the main lobby. They would play oldies and rock. A lot of the older crowd seemed to enjoy it. We did not see any of the other shows they did later at night. Grounds - The grounds of the resort were beautiful. They were very clean and very well maintained. Always someone doing gardening or making some sort of improvements. Overall, our stay at El Mandarin was a nice one. For the price it would be hard to find better quality, especially for an all-inclusive. If you find a good deal, I wouldn't pass it up!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Week in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My parnter and I just returned home from a week at the Club El Mandarin. We had a very relaxing week. First the lows - 1.) the beach wasn't that great, but props should be given to the staff for trying to maintain it by keeping it as clean as possible - must be an environmental issue?? 2.) too long of a distance from the main building to the pool; but that can't be helped now that the property is already built - hehe Lastly the highs - 1.) the Animation Staff was amazing - fun gals and guys that kept the guests going till the wee hours of the morning. Their hospitiality was 2nd to none. 2.) the resort grounds were beautiful - pretty flowers, budding trees, grass that was taken care of and green and plenty of neat local animal life. 3.) the pool - was awesome - big enough for all and we had a great time playing water volleyball. 4.) the all-inclusive way is the way to go - all the booze and food you could ever need or want for the week. 5.) take the tour to Tulum for the Mayan ruins and to Akumal for the snorkeling!! FUN!! Middle of the road - 1.) the staff was ok - not incredibly personable, but easy to work with non the less. 2.) the food was ok - buffet style does ware on you after a few days. Go into Playa and eat at La Parilla - a fantastic restaurant!!! 3.) the power went out maybe 10 times on Sat and Sun - very annoying but it stopped and as far as we could tell never went out again. We had no problems with our a/c - but it seemed to be a hit or miss thing. Some of our friends had issues, while we did not. 4.) the bugs - there are bugs in Mexico, but again it was hit or miss - some rooms had issues, while others did not. **Not sure we'll go back to this resort, it won't be next year at least! But, Playa is a fun town and there really is no need to go up to Cancun! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is just fine the water is murky but so what ,I was able to walk 4hrs towards playa without bumping into more than 10 people.The staff was very informative if you find someone that speaks english which they do.Definitaly not much night life but 10 bucks gets you to playa ,and everything you want is there!! As far as the entertainment all I could say is they try hard and those ladies can dance.WouldI go back?probably not,would I suggest it to someone else,absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: drtwnbysMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a week at the Club El Mandarin. We were part of an Atlantis Events week there. Overall we had a very good time. the grounds are well kept, and the food was good overall. I would say though that we wouldn't go back to this particular resort as there are so many others to choose from, that offer better accomodations, food, and beach. The beach itself was well kept and has a new pier you can walk out on. However, the water was the real downside. The water was full of seedweed all week and was a dirty brown color. No one went near it. As we walked down and up the beach we saw that other areas had water that was quite clear and clean. So it appears to be a localized problem at this resort. The rooms are somewhat plain, and we did have an ant probem in our room. We also had a problem with the a/c and the electricy the first couple of days. Drinks and food were plentiful and as I said earlier quite good. I would rate this resort as a 3.5 star resort, not a 4 or 5 star as I have seen mentioned in other commercial reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Manderin from. Apr. 18-25th. Ita was fantastic. The weather was perfect!! No rain!!! We ate everything--and drank the water!!! We never got sick. The food was outstanding, especially the gourmet restaurant (great service, romantic atmosphere etc.). The mexican restaurant was not great, but we had fun anyway. The hotel staff were polite and went out of their way to accomadate us. We didn't like where our room was and let them know before check-in and they changed it--no problem!! My partner developed swimmers ear and the doctor was there wihin an hour to treat him. He even delivered all the meds he needed! Outsanding! We did a few excursions and loved them all! First, Xel-Ha, undescribable! A real beautiful experience. Second, Breathtaking--Tellum Pay the $35 us for the guide -- we didn't and regretted it later when we heard what others experienced! Go shopping in Playa del Carmen--A blast. We met another couple from Quebec and did most of our trips with them. Great people-- that made the trip special. The beach was neat an tidy but we didn't do in the water because of the seaweed as a result of a storm. BEWARE of the offer to stay at another 5 star hotel in Cancun. It is to good to be true. DO not do it!! Stay at El Mandarin as we did!! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “don't use the international phone service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not to talk bad about this resort....We absolutely loved this place. Food was great...tons of choices. The grounds were impeccably kept and were beautiful. The staff were incredibly entertaining and really did an excellent job at keeping you busy with activities, if you so chose. I have no complaints other than the international phone service they use. I made a phone call home that lasted for less than a minute, because I was quoted a $4/minute charge. I got home to find a $40 charge on my credit card from MCIC... They don't tell you there are extra charges unless you have the intelligence to ask such questions...If you ask how much it costs, they give you the per minute rate. I'm furious and will take this up directly with the phone company...Not to bad mouth the resort....they're wonderful. Just do NOT use this phone service...bring a calling card. Or call from town to save you a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: jude
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple with an 11 year old child stayed at Club El Mandarin from March 10th to 24th. We were in a lovely room, no it wasn't ocean view, which so many people seem to demand, but it was a beautiful big room on ground level with a nice patio that I could sit on in the mornings and watch the hummingbirds in the garden. I have to say the food in this resort was GREAT and we were there 2 weeks, never got sick of it. The staff from the front desk, guest services, restaurant/bar staff, maids and animation team were the best! This hotel has 320 rooms and has a friendlier feel than other large resorts we have been to. They remember you! The only thing I would have changed was to stay 3 weeks instead of 2!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that this is the first all_inclusive resort my wife and I have stayed at. We are both in our early forties, so we left the kids at home with grandma and got away for 6 days and 5 nights at the Club El Mandarin, from April 22 - 27, 2004. We weren't looking for a 24/hour a day party, that's why we stayed outside Cancun. We wanted to rest and relax and do nothing. This was the perfect place for it! There were plenty of activities organized by the hard working staff, however, if you didn't want to do anything but eat, drink & people watch, that was fine too. The grounds are beautifully maintained and our room was very nice. The food was not gourmet, but for being mostly buffets, it was fresh and there was plenty of things to choose from at every meal. The drinks were good, make sure you find Antonio at the poolside bar, he makes the best Long Islands we've had anywhere. The only downside we encountered was that while the beach was very well maintained, there is nothing to break the surf, so the water is not very clear or usable. While we were there, the only people in the Sea were some brave souls who had rented Jet-Skis. But the pool is very large and that's were everyone hung out during the day. So, if you're looking for the Ritz and Mortons Steakhouse, then this isn't the place for you. However, for what we paid and what we got, we were more than happy and would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the El Mandarin. We were there from April 8-15th and it was incredible. The resort is immaculate, the staff were great, the food was super and overall we were truely impressed. We loved the beach and the pool and the animation staff were a blast. We had read the reviews here before and were a bit worried but now I'm trying to figure out if those nay-sayers stayed at the same place!! The water was a bit murky some mornings, but we had some pretty impressive night storms during our stay so I was not surprised. We never had any problems whatsoever and I would go back in a heartbeat. If you plan to take a tour try the Coba- Pac Chen tour through Alltournatives. It was worth every cent and our Guide was fantastic. We're planning our next trip to El Mandarin already!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you El Mandarin ....We will remember this for a lifetime!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank You to all who wrote poor reviews....We went expecting less and were pleasantly surprised to learn what so many others did, that the Elmandarin is wonderful and that where ever you go in life you will always find people who choose to see life from the negative side. We had an amazing week from airport pick up to our final day, our children ages 12 and 9, both said this place is better than T>V. and Video games....that says alot. I could go on for pages about the many positive things of the El Mandarin but I will sum up in this statement. " We are an average middle -class family that came to Mexico for a break from stress what we found instead was ' a little peace of heaven", the country and its people worked extremely hard, ( 10- 12 hour days , 6 days a week for only $10- 20 US dollars a day, keep that in mind when you critisize the service, plus a dollar tip goes along way),to make our vacation wonderful", My advice go to Mexico, take in the beauty of the country and its amazing people, relax smile and enjoy your life. We went for a get- away and discovered Heaven and more importantly we discoverd ourselves.....Thank tou to the Elmandarin and to all the people....One complaint....rude Europeans....".relax people your on a" Mexican Minute" relish it it may not come again

Reviews.Title: “*** Excellent resort - PLEASE READ ****”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First I have to say I booked this trip 8 months ago for my family & kids and another family and there kids. I have been reading reviews on the resort ever since we booked the trip and I will tell you I was worried! I read alot of bad thing and a few good things. We left March 27 thru April 3 and I just want to tell every one that we had a EXCELLENT TIME !!! The grounds were perfect / clean / well taken care of. I read reviews that the resort smelled. PLESAE dont belive this! both family never smell any bad oders! The staff was GREAT! Everyone was polite and said Hi. The pool staff was also very fun. The food in all 3 restarants were very good. I read in the reviews that some people had problems with there rooms. Our 2 rooms were clean / fresh smelling and the AC WORKED GREAT. Just an idea - get a extra key to put in the slot to keep the ac running. The beaches are keep clean every day. The water is not the clearest sometime but that is not the resort problem. This is mother natures problem and the resort has been building a breakwall and it seens to be working! We also used the dive shop at the resort to go snorkling and had a great time!!! For the money this resort is a 5 star resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow. My wife and I just got back from Playa del Carmen, we spent 1 week from March 27th, and we just loved it. This is going to be a long review, as I did lots of research for months before we choose El Mandarin, and feel its only fair to cover off EVERYTHING! The resort is beautiful. It is 10-15 minutes north of Playa del Carmen by shuttle or taxi. The shuttle runs from noon to 5:00pm, and then returns. It costs $3 USD, but, the noon & 1:00pm shuttles are free, and the 4:30pm & 5:30pm back to the resort. Otherwise, you have to pay. You also have to book your spots the day or days before. We had no problems, just go up to the travel agent desk in the lobby and sign up asap. Taxi's cost $105 pesos or $10 USD. They are great, direct, clean, safe and taxi's can be found anywhere. The resort itself is on the beach, and it is a few minutes just to drive to the lobby from the highway. Don't worry, all shuttles, buses and taxi drop off and pick up at the lobby. We never walked further then the lobby. The grounds are so well maintained and beautilful, it is amazing how many people they have working throughout. Everyone essentialy spoke English. We basically said Hola, Gracias, Que hora and Cuando Cuesta Esta (how much, you will say that alot). All the staff were exceptional, and made sure that if you had questions or concerns that they were addressed. They were always friendly, outgoing and extremely helpful, especially those at guest services. The animation team were great, incredible that they work from 9:30am till midnight, 6 days a week. They are on the beach in the morning, stretching, walks, beach & pool volleyball. They are very outgoing and friendly, speaking English, Spanish and French. It really reminded me of camp and they were camp counsellors. The reception is the only thing that was average. Although, I think it is because they have to listen to all of the complaints. We had none whatsoever, and I am a very, very picky individual who does not want to have any stress to deal with. You can exchange USD, Euros or Canadian dollars, but only at specific times. Also, whenever you pay for anyting in the hotel or town in USD, they will try to give you pesos, then when you ask for USD back, they seem not to speak English as well. This is everywhere though, not just at the hotel. The safe is $25 pesos a day, and recommended, as there is no where else to leave valuables. Make sure you got a proper phone card that will work in Mexico. We got one from home, but were unable to use it. The hotel had a payphone, but it was out of order? They charge you $7USD a minute to use the phone, so don't bother. You can use the internet room in the hotel for $3.50USD for 15 minutes. It is expensive, but cheaper then the phone. They have internet cafes in town that apparently were $1 for the sametime, but we used the hotel one for quick communication, and had no problems. Even if you arrive early, your room will not be ready. Everyday it seemed the people arrived early, but the rooms were not done until 3:00pm, which, is the actual check-in time anyways. They put you bags in a room with a security guard, then you can change to goto the beach or normally it is lunch time, you can eat. Not an inconvenience, so, don't worry about it. The rooms, well, we were in 3606, and we think that this was the best room at the resort. We asked for a king bed, balcony room with a view, and that is exactly what we got. It was beautiful. The room is the very last complex north of the resort on the beach, and it was just great. The room itself was large, clean and we never had any problems with insects, geckos or anything. They were cleaned everyday and we tipped a dollar everyother day for the maid services, and things went well. There is a mini fridge, 2 waters when you arrived, nothing else. I thought this might have been a problems, but it was not. Drinks were at the bar in the lobby and the bar at the pool. Make sure you ask everytime you go by the lobby bar for bottled water and take it to your room. We didn't know this the first night, spend lots of money for bottled water at the store in the lobby. We just kept stocking up on the bottled water, take water with you everywhere you go, especially if you are going on an excurstion. The bathroom was clean, no problems. Everything is tiled. When you get your key to the room it should also come with a security key that you plug into the wall that turns on the electrictity. The AC was great and no problems. The last day the hairdryer blew a fuse. I told them at the front desk at breakfast, said that it was not a problem, but they still fixed it in an hour. Remember, this is Mexico, and time is slower, that is everywhere. The beach and pool are clean. The pool is not huge, but, we never went into it anyways. We seemed to wake up early everyday, so, we went to put our towels out by 6:00am. You don't have to be this early, but it ensures that you get a cushioned lounge chair where you want. There are signs that say you can only be away from the chairs for a half hour, but that doesn't happen. We never had a problem though, and always sat where we wanted. The water on the beach was mainly clear. It is a windy location at times, and this really can cause the water to "whip up" sand to make it a little merky, but still clean. The water was also mirky in Playa del Carmen when it was windy as well. There is Tres Rios about 15 minutes up the beach, this is a natural park that has rivers running out to sea. You can walk up to the facility, and for $17 USD can use the resort for the day. We did not go, ran out of time, but were told it was a lot of fun. The smell, well, if you live on the west coast in BC, you will know what I am talking about. There is a "swampy" smell near the middle of the resort, and it is not sewage or garbage. It is the nature smell of "swamp", I can't explain it any other way. It is not bad or overwhelming. Apparently, it is the area where the Blue Hermit Crab's live, and it is a "natural" occurring smell. It basically is only when you walk by the spot, and no where else at all. Room 3606 seemed to be the furthest away from the main building, and it was less then a 5 minute walk, which we enjoyed everyday. The Mexican restaurant is at the pool bar, and is nice to sit at. They have breakfast there after 10:00am, then snacks from 3:00pm-5:00pm. Smaller selection then the main buffet, but just as good. They have fruit slushy drinks there all day, very sweet. This place then becomes the Mexican restaurant at 8:00pm, we never went, but were told that the food was great. There is a gourmet restaurant on the 2nd floor of the main facility, and it was excellent. I thought that I was back in the 50's in Europe, it was a nice atmosphere. Remember to tip the waiter, we gave him $5 USD. We also tipped the busboys in the buffet every now and then. $1 USD seems to work, also for the bartenders. Not all the time, just when you feel they do a little more then normal. We were told that everyone tips, but we saw very few people doing this. Tip Jorge in the main buffet, he was great. The main buffet was wonderful, every night there was a differant theme for food, but the main stays were always there. The food was hot, plentiful and we never got bored with it. The deserts were great, lots of fruits as well. We stayed away from the salads, but they looked great as well. The resort has purified water throughout. All the ice and drinks are made from the purified water. We just stuck to the bottle water, but drank everything else. We did not start to feel "odd" until the night before we were leaving, so no problems. You will most likely have some "changes" once you get home as I am. Fortunately, it didn't happen when we were away. We think that this is more to do with eating fruit at everymeal, drinking water all day and eating large meals 3x a day at a buffet. I think I gained 20lbs. There is no room service, no snack bar later on, but, you can ask for a take away container and get food to go. We did this with breakfast buns and deserts, just take it back to the room and keep in the fridge. We had friends who were here a few months ago, and they asked for a picnic lunch for Tulum, and they staff helped them out. Security was great. There were staff members around all the time, even late at night. There were gates at the entrance, every vehicle going in and out was noted. It was just terrific. This was a fabulous vacation for both of us. For people who never thought of going to Mexico, we would certainly return to both Playa del Carmen and Hotel El Mandarin. Oh, the guests were mostly Canadians, Americans and Europeans. It seems that on weekends Canadians arrive, then the Americans, and in the early week the Europeans. A lot of people from Quebec, lots of French spoken. There were never any problems, most people kept to themselves. We did meet several couples on the excursions, and kept bumping into them at the resort. You can see the other resorts if you go on excursions, as quite often the bus will pick other people up. You can see how nice El Mandarin is, and that being a smaller resort is great. There were families there with young children, no problems. They have a small area for the little ones, and apparently, one of the animation staff can babysit them almost all day. The kids seemed to be having fun. There were lots of older guests, retirees, families with older kids, some singles groups and young couples. We are in early 30's and loved the place. We are not party goers, so, if you want to drink, dance and be merry all the time, all day, Cancun may be more suited for you. If you want a wonderful, relaxed vacation with no worries. El Mandarin is great. As this is really, really long, I will do seperate reviews on Playa del Carmen, tours and Air Transat, which we will never fly again. Have fun and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Adventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, it was a enjoyable week at the hotel! The resort is very large and has many villas over the property. The pool and beach area and nightly enertainment was wonderful. The food was a normal buffett, but still a large variety to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “oved our first visit out of the USA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and 3 kids ages 18,16 and 11 just returned from a week at the EL Mandarin resort. We found the staff very charming and helpful. The recreation team was great at getting beach volleyball or soccer games started. My oldest can be rather picky about stuff(age related?) but expressed great pleasure in our trip. The food was good . The grounds were lovely. The staff spoke English very well.The maids and maintenance people only speak Spanish but were never rude. If you use washcloths you may want to bring your own. Be prepared with what outings you want to go on so you can reserve your first day. As far as nightlife goes they have themes each evening and a show that fits it.Our kids even were chosen to be a part of one of the shows. The negative for us were topless sunbathers. Its a great place, go and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “This excursion ended March 27, 2004”
Reviews.Author: WDinsmore
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the El Mandarin. We have been to the area at least 30 times over the last 30 years, and have had an opportunity to visit at least 20 of the properties there. This property is priced at the lower end of the offerings in the area. It is not a bad value within that price point. First the good points, the hotel grounds and rooms were clean and nice for the price. The food was slightly better than others in which we have stayed in the same price range.
