We were a party of eight and had two small children, ages six and two, and they hotel offered a children's program which would offer babysitting services at no charge during the daytime until about 6:00PM. I was pleased with the program and the staff was better than expected. The pool was large for the price, and was adequate. If you want an inexpensive vacation and expect to stay mainly around the pool, this will work for you. The bad, this hotel is a 10 minute and $ 10.00 US cab ride from Playa del Carmen. It is about 12 KM from town. The hotel offers shuttle service after 12 noon for $ 3.00 per person. You can rent a car at the hotel but the prices were 70% higher than in town. The hotel has a rental service on site, but will not allow other rental companies to deliver to the door of the hotel. I rented a Suburban for $ 120 per day including insurance in Playa and the hotel rate was $ 200 plus insurance. The gym consists of an outside area near the pool with older free weights, and the hotel would be best served by removing the equipment. The beach has an artificial reef which traps what I believe is seaweed, causing the water in front of the hotel to be brown and smell of sulfur. The front desk personnel were not eager to serve us, and although this did not cause us a great problem, I believe it could be a problem for others. The lobby bar was understaffed at times and could or did not promptly serve its customers. The hotel offers Internet service, but it was expensive and slow. The hotel charged $ 1.00 to connect you to a local telephone number. The shows were amateurish, but I have never see a great show at any of the hotels in the area. None of these were terrible problems, but I believe there are better buys in the area and I would not recommend this hotel for most travelers. If you need any help or advice, please email me. Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: wysnaa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Club Mandrin the week on March 6-13. It is a very clean and beautiful resort. The beach is not that good though. There is never anywhere to sit and the water is terrible. We only went once and we did not stay, instead someone in the lobby was telling us about Tres Rios down the beach. If you go there they give you a braclet for $12.00 a person and you can come back as much as you want while you are staying at the Mandrin. This place was GREAT. You can canoe and bike for free, and for $5.00 you can snorkle down the rivers. This place is great and worth the money. The beach is great too. You can smell the sewer smell a little once in a while. Like when you are walking around the resort. We could not smell it by our room though. This resort is beautiful and well worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fair and Balanced Look at Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: mewcom
Reviews.Content: Like many Trip Advisor readers, I was quite concerned about all the negative reviews I had been reading prior to my stay at Club El Mandarin March 6 -13. I am happy to say that most of what had been written was not, by any means, completely accurate. I am usually a very picky "Five Star" type who would rather spend the extra money and not worry about anything. But in this case, my daughter and I were very pleased. The rooms and bathrooms were a bit shopworn, and my guess is that they will probably be redecorated soon. But they are immaculate, with clean marble floors, delightful balconies or patios, Cable TV and other amenities. The gardens are just gorgeous, reminding me of some of the more beautiful resorts in South Florida. We went for the sun and not for the food, so I really can't comment on the food except to say that it was presented very nicely each evening. The ocean was a bit murky the first few days we were there, but the wind cleared it up in a few days, and by the end of the week I was swimming and kayaking in crystal clear water. We never really had trouble finding beach or pool chairs. A few were broken, but there always seemed to be plenty. The beach is beautiful and clean. As is so often the case in Mexico, the staff were extremely hardworking and friendly. The common places in the resort were always immaculate, with staff always cleaning, picking up, painting, you name it. I never felt at all uncomfortable there. Children were well behaved, and the pool seemed more than adequate for people like me who swim regularly. There is a very neat, roped-off deep area, which allows for more rigorous swimming if you want it. My only complaint is that Club El Mandarin is quite isolated, and a taxi or shuttle is required to get to Playa del Carmen. And reservations are needed for the non-buffet restaurants and the shuttle into town. The power does go out from time to time, but the staff is generally very quick to attend to that problem, so we were never really inconvienced. All in all, it is a fine place. We had a very nice time. So relax ... and enjoy Club El Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our holidays was very relaxing. We returned on March 8/04. The resort was more what we expected. The grounds and pool area were kept very clean. The staff were very friendly. Weather was hot and windy. Who cares about the wind. If it wasn't for the wind it would have been hotter. We took a couple of excursions. Xcaret and Tulum. Very interesting. Would recommend it. Walked on the beach every day. Food was very good. Shopping in Playa del Carmen was the most fun. We took the cab twice (100 pesos) each time. Met different people from Canada. When we took this holiday we wanted to relax and enjoy. That is what we did. We would recommend this resort. Just a reminder to take your sunscreen, you will need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for beaches and water recreation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought the resort was excellent, for us there was not any room problems. The grounds are kept in excelent condition. The food in the regular dining room was good with lots of choices to suit your personal choices. Yes other guests exploit the holding of shaded areas at the beach and pool by going early leaving a towel and then coming when it suited them. The staff at the pool and beach work hard to entertain you, just give them a chance and be polite just as you would in any social situation. The beach did have "murky water" due to a sea weed like material but this was cleaned up March 8 and 9, now the beach is quite clean subject to wind and rolling waves disturbing the sand. There is not very good snorkling at the beach of El Mandarin but we had a good expeience going on the tour given by Blue diving traveling to Cozumel. Apparently you need a coral reef below the water to provide the habitat for the fish, sandy bottom is nice to walk on but does not sustain the fish. I have never been to the Mayan Riveria before and found it to be a tremendous experience of lovely sandy beaches,warm water, and fabulous sun shine for water recreation. The club El Mandarin was excellent and we would recommend it to anyone. Max & Pat

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful isolated location Feb.17 to Mar.02.04 The grounds were nice and kept very clean. The staff were all courteous and friendly and the service prompt. The food was varied and you could get as much as you want. The Mexican theme night was great. The walk south on the beach was nice although somewhat cluttered with refuse (plastic is the bain of the world). The room was functional and the beds firm the way we like it, however you experienced periodic cold showers particularly late in the day when everyone was getting ready for supper. The activities could keep you busy all day or you could quietly read as we did. There were not enough beach lounges and particularly lounge pads for all guests leading to a rush in the early morning to get out and reserve your location for the day (which is against hotel policy). We took a couple of side trips to Playa Del Carmin and Tulum to break up the 2 weeks. Getting through customs was a breeze although we waited an hour to get checked in on the way back. We would go back but not before trying other places.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from us...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from Feb. 25 thru March 1st. Our rooms (we had 3) were spacious and clean. No one in our group had any difficulty with air conditioning or lights. We were able to find lounge chairs on the beach, but most of the chairs had towels on them by 7:00 am. (I don't feel the resort should be faulted for rude guests.) The 'animation' staff was very friendly and tried to get every one involved. There were activities for those who chose to get involved. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. We found the buffet enjoyable. Not everybody loved everything they took, but the presentation was lovely and there was no shortage to things to try. The guacamole was wonderful, our only complaint was there was none on the breakfast buffet the morning we left. :o) The only thing missing was wash clothes.. I would go back to Club El Mandarin, I just take a wash cloth.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, our experience at Club El Mandarin was fantastic. The dive shop is first class and all of the people involved in the diving operation are extremely helpful. The dive shop caters to divers and snorkelers of all levels and usually has plenty of reservations available. We were somewhat dissapointed with the quality of the food. While in Mexico, we would have preferred more authentic mexican food instead of the "world" flavors often offered. All of the hotel staff are extremely helpful and very nice. A few complaints of the hotel include the folowing: The resort caters to an older crowd making it very hard for younger couples to meet and have a good time; The activities are catered to an older crowd (beach walking, water aerobics); There are only two bars at the resort, making it difficult to get drinks and there is not a bar in the swimming pool; Limited activities available (most people spend the day in lounge chairs, which is nice for an older crowd, but creates boredom for a younger crowd). Overall the trip was a blast, though. The rooms are awesome and the staff is superb. I would definitely recommend the resort for my parents/grandparents. We will probably go back to Cozumel, which offers a few more activities.

Reviews.Title: “El Mandarin was great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to Kelowna after spending a wonderful 2 weeks at El Mandarin. Our only complaint was the smoking in the eating areas. Even though there was a no smoking area we still found this unacceptable and advised them of this on the comment card. other than that all the negative comments that people are whining about are just that. I heard of nobody that was unhappy while we were there. The Blue Dive Shop was excellent. The entertainment staff of about 20 were our favourites. Get to know them personally and it is even better. The cleaning staff were exceptional and the maintainence of the property is excellent. Anything that was asked for was taken care of immediately. Perhaps the whiners should change their attitude when they go to a foreign country and things will go better for them. We will return to Mexico and we will be staying at this resort. Yes it does smell like people say..... but it is not sewer related. The beach is great but the water can get dirty..... make the best of it... it's nature. Walk the beach to the south and really enjoy yourself.. Oh, before I forget fly WESTJET not Air Canada on your trip from Canada and you'll be happy. If anybody has any criticism of the entertainment staff they should be ashamed of themselves. We had a great time everyday because of their antics and hard work. WE WILL RETURN. Richard & Valerie Woolley, Kelowna

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have nothing good to say about that place. People at the reception are rude. No good service. Room inadequate facing the kitchen and the parking. If you ask to change you will wait three days or more. The ocean water is BROWN. Beach chairs are broken then not confortable. At the Mexicain restaurant you have to eat with the cats!!!!!!! The worst vacation ever since 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the El Mandrin”
Reviews.Author: AlbertacanMexicolvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have gone to the El Mandrin 2 times and plan on going back as soon as possible.The staff are very helpful and accomodating{we had trouble with the 1st room and they moved us the next day.}The food was great and no complaints over the drinks either.Buy a drink in Playa or Cancun and it's 7 bucks american.These people work very hard for not a lot of money so we tip them and your service improves all that much more.It also gets the bartender to recognize you the next time.Remember this " A BAD DAY ON HOLIDAYS IS BETTER THAN AGOOD DAY AT WORK!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Saving to go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I just returned from 2 fantastic weeks in paradise. This hotel is underrated. Should be a 5 star. The grounds alone were enough to take your breathe away. Immaculately groomed and full of colour. The beach was soft white sand and the water crystal clear. Only for a couple of days was the water murky because of a heavy rain and wind storm which only lasted 1 day. You can't blame the hotel for what Mother Nature plans. They had beach boys out everyday raking up beached seaweed. The pool is very large and has a section for small children. The food was excellent, lots of variety and nicely presented. The International restaurant was a bit disappointing. Not a great selection and the service could have been better. We did not go to the Mexican Restaurant but heard it was good. All the staff were very friendly and accommodating. A huge applause to the animation team. They kept you entertained during the day and put on great shows in the evening. If you plan a trip to Xel Ha be sure and do the full take excursion, the half day combined with Tolum is not enough. Would we go back ? You can bet your bottom peso we would. Just keep in mind this is Mexico, not the French Riviera and you will enjoy every minute of your vacation. Lynne & Ray (alias Sharon Stone & Michael Douglas)

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i red some of the comments and some of them were ridicuoous,like someone complained there wasn't any french fries on the menu on mexicain night , well, who need fries every meals anyway, second of all there were fries on mexicain night ,second of all some people said they were racist and had different bracelet for each nationality, well, everybody had a blue bracelet except for the people who went 2 days in cancun at another hotel (i checked). first the negatives; the sea was not as clear as i expected especialy on windy days which is almost everyday, second; the gourmet restaurant doesn't offer a lot of choices, if you don't like seafood you are screwed cause the only thing on the menu that is not seafood is steak or austruch,even on the cesar salad you had shrimp,but it's good,not much ambiance, nothing on the wall, and if you're only two, they seat you by the exit door in a corridor which is not very romantic . now the positives;the ground are wonderfull, clean, full of every kind of plants and flowers,the buffet is abondant you can anything, there is a station for everything,bread,pizza,dessert,salad,seafood,meat mexicain,soup,10 kind of cheeses and cold cuts,4 kind of soup,etc,if you don't find something you like well you have a problem. the mexicain restaurant was great especialy for the ambiance, you have a buffet for the entrees and then you have a menu with about 12 items on it and it's good not terrific but good. the maid was very nice and all the staff is helpfull and polite . the rude ones were the tourist, especialy with the staff, some italians who don't like to stand in line for the buffet were pushy and rude and cut you, some americains screamed at the desk clerc because he didn't have a queen size bed and some canadians we so drunk they were loud and rude at the mexicain restaurant.the animation team went out of their way to amuse you and make you participate in all kind of activities .playa del carmen is only 10 minutes away by car.but don't go in the middle of the afternoon it's too hot, go around 5pm it's a lot nicer,if you want to eat a greadt rib-eye steak , go at captain's bob and son on 5th and 4th avenue and dont forget to have a mayan coffee (the best), it's a little expensive but it's worth it. for any question please write to me.

Reviews.Title: “It was 'great'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent two weeks at El mandarin.Jan 22 till Feb 6.We had a great time,We thought the place was wonderfull,beautifull grounds,the beach was fine.You can walk a long way to the south.As for the room we had a good one close to the pool/beach nice view,and it was kept very clean.By the sound of some posts if you don`t get a good room it may ruin your whole trip.Now the food,We never had a bad meal.every thing was fresh tasting and hot food was hot.and had lots of everything.We have been to 5 and 6 star resorts that can`t compare to this quality.And for us to get two weeks vacation for the price of one week makes it even a better value.The staff and entertainment crew were very helpful and friendly. We will definitely go back to the El mandarin and will recommend this resort to everybody we know. Carl&Peggy

Reviews.Title: “i'm impressed”
Reviews.Author: ejk50
Reviews.Content: i just returned from El Mandarin, and very much enjoyed our stay. The food was excellent , i did not have to worry about what i had to eat. The service from the staff was excellent, if i had a problem they immediately sent someone to fix it. Their bar supply was o.k., but could have had more import liqour. I was still happy with what they offered. I would definitly consided returning for a second tour. Thank you to the staff at El Mandarin

Reviews.Title: “All Inclusive-Not really”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed Feb 2nd - 9th, 2004. The real estate itself is very nice. The landscaping was beautiful. The resort was lovely. My disappointment starts with a sense of being duped....this resort is all-inclusive, but many things suppose to be included, weren't. Things listed as included but actually weren't are: Snorkeling equipment (must pay $25 for an hour tour), the safe in your room will cost you $2.50 per day, and no one tells you that the "Free" shuttle to Playa del Carmen must be reserved 2 days in advance, carries 14 people max and has only 2 "free" runs (at 12:30 and 1pm). If you ride at any other time, (runs on the hour) you pay $3 per person each way (still cheaper than a taxi as long as you have a reservation). Other disappointments are: The sewer smell at a certain point along the main walk-way, watered-down alcohol, the broken TV, the "gym" is a joke and not being able to get cold bottled water in the morning or a bottle of wine at any time. This resort is clearly trying to cut corners where ever possible and it shows. We enjoyed the weather, the beach, the activities staff, the region, but we will not stay at the Club el Mandarin again. There are better values for the money to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off... DO NOT.... I repeat DO NOT use the phone service to call home internationally, the in room card states $7 per minute, what it FAILS to state is the with the minimum of a 5 minute charge + a connection fee my minute long calls home cost $40 USD EACH!!! Talk about a rip off! This is 1 mexican company who will understand the visa FRAUD laws when I am through with them!!! As a whole the resort was OK, had issues with not hot water (It was shut off) for 1 whole evening, electricity flashing, and a plugged toilet. I have been to Mexico several times but this bathroom left alot to be desired, mildew and caulk problems were a lot to take. The food all tasted the same and a "plate patrol" enforced no plates out of the dining area, could not enjoy being outdoors for a meal. Next time we will spend more money on a better resort or will skip the all inclusive together, was a bit dissappointed in it with food quality, temperature of food (causes food poisoning) etc.

Reviews.Title: “paradise !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed 11 nights at the mandarin,from Jan. 10-21,and we were very pleased.We had an upstairs room which i would recommend,some had problems with their rooms downstairs. we had a nice room, very comfy and very clean. This was our first time to the mayan, so we did not know what to excpect. What we got was great service,with a great staff always making our stay pleasant.The food was very good at the main buffet,and plenty of it! The pool bar/snack bar was very good. They had burgers n dogs, plus nacho's..etc,and slurpee machines! The grounds were very nice and the beach was to die for, very quiet and a beachfront that went on for a mile either way. Arty the bartender will make you the best drinks around,...banana mama's, pina coladas,and melon balls to name a few. I suggest you take a walk on the beach in the morning "early,like 6:30" it's like heaven! The entertainment was pretty good at night, i would have enjoyed it a little more if it were a bit more professional. They had local merchants come in every 2nd or 3rd night with jewelry and blankets...etc,..they had some nice stuff. If you head to Playa Del Carmen the shopping is very good there, t-shirts for 5 bucks,some nice hats and lots of locals willing to sell you just about anything, it's a lot of fun there. I would highly recommend the trip to chichen itza, if you enjoy history, your in for a lesson.The only beef i have with this resort is the main buffet,...it's way too hot !! They have air ducts for a.c.,... use the d*** things!! I dont like to sweat while i'm eating, lots of people complained about this! I would also like to see room service in this resort, it would be a nice added touch to an already fabulous resort. All in all, we will be returning to this resort next year with our kids, we can't wait!! .......p.s., we met some of the nicest people on this trip, new friends are always great, and i know they will be returning next year too, thanks el mandarin......Rich and Barb.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would return for two weeks!!”
Reviews.Author: Boston_MAMichelle
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Bravo El Manderin!The service, food, and entertainment was great! It was the three of us-all woman. The resort was beautiful and very clean. The room were spacious enough for all three of us. They had two buffets during the day-one near the pool and the other in the main lobby. We also exchanged our room for a night in Cancun. If you choose to do this, stay at the Crown Paradise Club instead of the Tucancun Beach Club. The beach was nice in Cancun but you were consistantly harassed to buy everything under the sun! The beach at the resort was very nice and quiet!! Get there early to get a chair under the straw huts. I will definately return for two weeks. This is a place to relax and get away from the Cancun partying but still have the option to go into Cancun. If you venture into Playa Del Carmen at night ,go to Captain Tu Tiks-It's a blast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never written a neagtive review here, but I want to warn future visitors of the problems. Room: We had an infestation of small red ants and the bedspread was so old the thread would rip when you pulled it up. No surprise we were covered in bed bug bites! Air conditioner was absolute crap. The hotel is 5 years old but looks 15 years. Food and drink: Little change in food and oversalted - stay aware if you are sodium-restricted diets. Mixed drinks were watered down. There are two a-la-carte restaurants, but have to book in advance and we could only get a reservation for 5 days later. Have to confirm reservation by 10:00 of the day of the sitting. We forgot to confirm and they wouldn"t let us in. Let another couple in a similar position in the night before - left us angry - not good when on vacation. Transportation: Free shuttle is only at 12 or 1pm , and leaving and 4:30 and 5:30 returning - otherwise it's $3US. One day the pick up spot was changed but we were informed. Waited a half hour before grabbing a taxi. Also there is no shuttle before 12:00 when most people want to go. Tours sold at the hotel are exhorbitantly priced. And forget about getting an honest answer from staff regarding local public transit or location of tour companies so you can book yourself. Staff are evasive and could not even say what the bus schedule was or how much it cost. Obviously they are trying to corner the market on their own tours. Pool and Gym - just one pool and half of it is 1 foot deep. The gym are a few rusty barbells outside near the gym - big disappointment. Beach - very murky - not good if you like clear water. Just past the hotel the litter on the beach was sad! Staff - entertainment staff were great and worked long hours. Maid was fine too, but wait staff varied depending on whether you tipped or not, and the vast majority of people did not tip. Overall the worst travel experience I had in the dozen or so times I have been south. Please do not go to this resort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeB
Reviews.Content: A Great time was had by 4 of us-53,59, 62,62. Don't know where people are coming from w/negatives about this property...will address the things we wanted-beautiful sandy beach,Yes! Do try & make it to beach or pool w/towels early 7 or 8 for shady spots, not a problem for us as we like to walk early. Food at the buffet was awesome & service was terrific (tip early in your stay at both bars & restaurants, they DO remember! The grounds are lovely, flowering shrubs everywhere! Our room was in 1 of the 8plexes, w/patio &100yds to pool/beach. It was always spotlessly taken care of, nice hi ceiling, air cond. worked great. Service everywhere was topnotch, we arr early 10 am knowing we'd have to wait til 3ish to check in. We stopped at Front Desk, were immediatley given a tropical beverage & our wristbands, told where we could safely leave our luggage(secured baggage rm), told about the changing rooms right off the lobby, in case we wanted to go directly to beach/pool, or given directions to the restaurant at the pool that was serving at that time! The music at pool/beach starts 9ish, pretty easy listening early, of course w/salsa/merengue intersperced thruout, lessons daily if you like, building up to a little louder late in the afternoon, but not earsplitting as some suggest. The animation team is outstanding, they are so full of Energy & very talented young people-boy, can they dance!

Reviews.Title: “El Mandarin - anytime!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a glorious Christmas week at the El Mandarin with our three teenagers. All they keep asking is: "when can we go back again?" Service in the dining areas was always friendly and the 'animation crew' was spectacular at keeping the guests well entertained, busy and laughing! There was always something for all age groups to do - and the guests on the whole were happy and relaxed. The service from the tour booking staff and the meal booking staff was not quite so good - they have no problem keeping you queueing up for hours while they fill in an amazing amount of paper work in order to complete their tasks. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, and kept clean at all times. Water was highly chlorinated - but we should probably be grateful for that! Food was of a very high standard with a huge amount of choice - especially at dinner time, and the biggest complaint everybody had was that they were eating (and drinking) too much and that they wouldn't be able to fit into any clothes! They have a 'fine dining' restaurant which you can only eat at with a booking - but it was quite disappointing - it lacked atmosphere, was fairly slow and had very few choices on the menu. The main dining area was a lot more fun, always lots going on, and not quite as stuffy. The dining area down at the pool was great for lunches - quick and easy break from the midday sun. Beaches were kept in pristine condition, and there was additional beach area closer to the pool where shade under the palapas was to be found. There were times of the day that a lot of music is played at the pool area - mostly the middle of the day - this is to accompany the various pool sports and activites that are taking place - and generally it just adds to the fun atmosphere. If you prefer it quieter - one can set up camp on a beach a little further south of the hotel, or choose to sunbath a little earlier in the day while its still quiet. We were dissappointed that their were no snorkels/goggles for hire at the water sports section, so take your own. The resort is just a nice size, not so big that you need transport to get back and forth from the beach, but the walk up to the main building where everything happens in the evenings - is good to help digest the food you're taking in! It's a major trek to get to the archery - but fun nonetheless. A visit to Xel Ha and Tulum is well worth it - we booked through a tour group in Play del Carmen - probably saved ourselves about $8 per person, but there were some tricky moments when we thought they had forgoten all about us as they arrived so late to pick us up. Nice thing about being as far north as El mandarin is that you are one of the last set of guests to be picked up on the route back to the airport, yet one of the first to be dropped when first arriving. The hotel does provide one or two free shuttles into Playa del Carmen a day - but again its a major process trying to book yourselves onto them. The rest of the shuttle rides during the day cost $3 per person. We discovered that a $10 taxi ride for the whole family was quicker and less frustrating. So - if we are looking for that 'club type' experience again - I would not hesitate to return to El Mandarin - but next time I would like to experience some of the REAL MEXICO and for that I think we'll have to stay in a B& B or hotel in one of the nearby villages. Really - it was a hassle free holiday that we all enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “A great place, no question.”
Reviews.Author: jimhughes2001
Reviews.Content: My girfriend and I have just returned from the Club El Mandarin and I can say without any bias that this is a great place to stay. The food in the buffett was fantastic. ( they should spring for a new toaster) Each meal gave us so many choices and there was fresh fruit at every meal. This is a great place to go to party with a group or be on your own(as we wanted). The rooms are very clean and nicly laid out. The grounds are perfect and very well taken care of. This is a hotel that is very close to being rated a 5 star. If you are looking to go to mexico, and want to be assured of a safe and beautiful place to go, Club El Mandarin will more than fulfill your needs. Thanks to all the staff there and keep up the great service. Don't be lead down the wrong path by any bad reviews listed. This is a great place, don't miss out.

Reviews.Title: “a peace of heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "the best" my husband and i went there in december of 2003..the best place there is everyone was so WONDERFUL and the place is spotless and the food soooo good..i have been to cancunmany a times but this place beats cancun..we can nit wait to go back thats how good it was..want to go some place really nice? if you are planning to go some place please try this place.its like heaven..you will never be sorry you went there..the staff is really nice to every one...do not forget try it and you will not be sorry....mrs.m.knapp

Reviews.Title: “A good time was had by all”
Reviews.Author: BNRobb
Reviews.Content: just came back from a one-week family vacation at the mandarin, and we found it outstanding. the kids hooked up with similar-aged children from europe, and everyone thoroughly enjoyed themselves. The hotel services, staff, and amenities exceeded our expectations. we found out that the "sewer smell" referred to in other reviews is due to the fact that the resort is built on a mangrove swamp, and there is a bit of natural off-gassing going on. very isolated exterior-only occurences, and easy to walk away from. the "three rivers" ecopark next door is a good deal, as your one-time entry fee is valid for your entire stay at the mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back last week . What can I say ... there are some things you probably will notice as sewage like smells or mildew spots in the shower but I think all the unpleasant stops there. Overall :great food, clean beach, nice people and will fit your budget to enjoy many deferent places as Xel Ha, Akamal, Chechen -Itsa and Xcaret where you can spend money wise (especially taking your kids to experience unforgettable adventure ....And you will see in their eyes something that never goes away... :).Oh.. another thing when you go to Chechen-Itsa (or some other places ) do not buy the tours from your hotel, it's so much cheaper at that place . If you asked me will I go back ... probably not only because there are so many other resorts I want to visit. ( and I saw a very nice one next door , brand new one , definitely 5 star, but no children -name Secrets...)

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I spent 6 days/5 nights at the Club El Mandarin and found it very nice. Ages in our group were 5 to 60 and everyone enjoyed their stay. After reading previous reviews of this resort, I was a little scared to go, but decided to make the best of it, as reservations had already been made. Much of what you read is true (intermittent strange smells, rooms not perfectly maintained) but I also found many things better than reviewed (food, exercise equipment, beach, service). True things-we did expereience either musty or seweage like smells intermittently, but never in our room, and we could easily walk away from them. Our room was large, but we did notice some mildew spots in the shower and missing or sloppily applied caulking or grout (however, it was cosmetic only). Better than I read in earlier reviews-service. We had booked a room with 2 double beds, but were pleasantly surprised when we upgraded to a jr. suite at no charge, when we arrived. Junior suite had 2 double beds PLUS 2 couches that converted to single beds. We also had a 2 person jacuzzi tub in addition to a separate shower stall. No problems with crabs or geckos in our room, although we saw alot of geckos in the exterior hallways after dark. Food-lots of good choices at buffet type restaraunt. Great for all of us, as kids could eat food they were used to (ie-chicken, turkey, steamed rice), and adults could try some new things. The El mandarin restaraunt next to the pool had a grill serving hot dogs and burgers at lunch time, and cold drinks all day long (nice to have in close proximity to the beach). We ate 1 night at the gourmet restaurant and all enjoyed the 4 course meal. Some tried the ostrich, kids mostly had shrimp or beef. Exercise equipment-not rusted, but was sparse. Was in an outdoor area-hard to concentrate on work-out when beautiful ocean is beckoning. Beach was swept at night, and all morning after stormy, windy night and morning. Courtesy of Beach boy staff (beach cleaners) beach remained easy to walk on even with windy weather stirring up the seas and sending gunk up. On good weather, calm days, seas was crystal clear and beaches incredibly beautiful. Service. We are english speaking, americans and had NO trouble with service, from front desk to concierge to grounds staff. There were 2 color wrist bands we noticed while staying at the El Mandarin-1 color for adults and another for minors (under 18). No difference was noted for different languages. Very friendly area-while walking through the resort, most people gave a greeting (Hola) to others walking nearby. When dealing w/service staff, it seemed to soften people by starting with hello, or hola, and Buenos Dias. It was a simple courtesy we saw people of all languages making. If you look for bad things, you will find them, but if you look for positive things-you will find them in abundance. This is true for most places you visit, anywhere in the world. We would return to El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Club El Mandarin - December 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Club El Mandarin and were really impressed with the hotel layout, the nice beach, the great service and the impeccable cleanliness of our room and all public areas at the hotel. The food was abundant and good quality and their non-alcoholic drinks and specialty coffees were great!!! It was a truly relaxing place to stay at and we enjoyed the entertainment crew's shows every night at 10pm. The only disadvantages that we encountered was the rather small swimming pool (compared to many other resorts) but we are ocean/sea swimmers so the beach was enough for us and the fitness room that was advertised is only a couple of weight machines in an open area on the beach. Our final comments: We would definitely return to Club El Mandarin for its very good value for our $$$!

Reviews.Title: “You make the call”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back Dec 17th. The good- The resort was very clean and beautiful. The grounds are very well kept. Rooms are large with sofa and tables. They sweep the beach every night.The bad- Front desk leaves a lot to be desired. If you complain that forget english very quickly. They left our luggage upon arriving out front of the hotel for over an hour unguarded. We finally asked them why our items were left there and they said sometimes things slip between the cracks. Our room was not ready at 3:00p, it was closer to 4pm. When our room was finally ready the bellboy led the way and I had to carry my own luggage to the room. There was a lot of stairs to go down. The staff did not speak very good english and it was hard to get answers. Food is OK at best. Not enought staff at the bars. Tip BIG if you want waited on. TV has 3 channels, one english speaking (ABC) Detriot station. They promised to send up a wine basket because our room was not ready and we never recieved it.They seemed to prefer Euro's over Americans. They waited on them first. I ordered beef at the resturant, they served the Euro's first and their portions were much larger. My girlfriends portion was much larger then mine also and we had the same thing.Rather then argue with the hotel staff we went to Playa Del Carmen everyday and salvaged the vacation. We found a great club on the beach and the beer was only $1.50 USD. Funjet said if we had any problems to let them know and they would handle it for us. They are worthless, when we explained our treatment they changed their story and said they were just liasons and couldn't do anything. I asked for a room closer to the pool because I have bad knees and it was a long walk and they told me the hotel was full. We met four girls down there, they asked for a different room and got it. They were with Apple.I would never stay there again and I will go back to Apple. Funjet was not so fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the El MAndarin and the ONLY complaint I have is that they only had Corona beer - no other type of Mexican beer. Although, in retrospect, the Corona was pretty good, but some variety would have been nice. The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous; the staff was very friendly and helpful; the beach was well cared for; the drinks were generously poured; the food had a lot of variety and was very well prepared and presented. I've seen other reviews commenting on the trepidation that people have in going to Mexico - we heard of NO ONE getting sick on the food or water or ice cubes, and we probably sampled almost everything that the El Mandarin had to offer. We both agreed that we would recommend this resort highly to our friends. The tours through the in-house tour operator were expensive and one in particular was a rip-off. You're probably better off taking a taxi and seeing the local attractions on your own.

Reviews.Title: “A decent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Dec. 7th. My wife and I had a reasonably good time. The resort was very clean and our room was very nice. No problem with the AC. We were on the second floor of one of the eight room villas. Ocean view if you stood at the end of our patio and stretched your neck.We did see them replacing the AC unit in another villa. In a day and a half they had it all done and it looked to be major job. The old unit that came out was the size of a car. The food was so so. If you want to eat upstairs at the sit down restaurant "Quetzel" you have to be at the guest services desk at 7:45 AM as the desk opens at 8:00Am and it books quickly. The drinks were OK but no fruit in them like other Riviera Maya resorts. No big deal. The beach at the resort is pretty good but if you walk south a couple hundred yards its much better. If you walk north on the beach you are at Tres Rios eco park. We acted like we belonged there and just checked out where the river meets tha ocean. It's real pretty. We did things on the cheap. We used the collectivos to get around. You have to walk up to the highway about 10 -15 minutes to catch one. If you're going south it's a pain because you go from the resort to playa de carmen, 10 minutes,15 pesos and the have to switch to go towards Tulum. Playa to Tulum is about 50 miles, only costs 20 pesos. We checked out the beach and bungalow type resorts south of the Tulum Ruins and the beach is incredible. Maybe next time. The collectivo from Playa to Cancun is 30 pesos, about an hour. We didn't care much for the nightly entertainment. After the 2nd night we stopped going. We were there for a week. It's like they bought a powerful stereo system and gave a few high school kids $100 for a budget and said put on some sort of show every night for a week. I'm not into boom boom music. The hotel staff were fine. They charge 25 pesos a day to use the safe in the room. It seemed a bit petty but what are you going to do. You need somewhere to put your travel stuff and money. We've stayed at better all inclusive Riviera Maya resorts for the same price but this was the cheapest when we could go. If the US economy gets stronger I think these places are going to get more and more expensive. For $650 you really can't go wrong. Being all inclusive is nice , not only is it more economical especially if you're a drinker, but if you stay at a place that's not it seems you spend all kinds of timefiguring out where to eat and how to get there. I'd go back , but it's not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday, and overall was satisfied. If I had paid more I would have been severely disappointed. The facility is nice, but small. The beach was a little murky. Staff friendly. Food-just ok. I have been spoiled staying at higher ranked all inclusives, but I will say you would have to be very picky to go hungry, as there is something for everyone. The drinks at the bar, very good, more so than some of the true 5 stars I have stayed at. The bartenders were an absolute blast to watch, as they seemed to be having as much fun as the patrons. Again, this was a bargain vacation, and I feel I got my monies worth. But it is not luxury by any means. It was just a relaxing, no great expectations vacation. If I got the same vacation for the same price, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have only been home from my vacation in Mexico for 2 weeks and already miss it. I went along with 10 other women and can't even begin to tell you how much fun we had at this resort. The resort was clean and beautiful. Sometimes there was an odour outside that we coulkd have done without but the workers, staff and bartenders were all nice and friendly. The inside disco was fun although our first night there it was quite packed and only one waiter so getting a drink was almost next to impossible. The entertainment was good, one of our ladies won Miss Manadarin and the staff always recognized her. There were all ages and all different nationalities but everyone was very friendly. The buffet was alright but I enjoyed the food in the upstairs restaurant the most. All in all we had a good time, no worries. They should have a different air conditioning system as a key was attached to your room key and when you left the room your A/C was shut off. When you returned to get ready it was very muggy so they need the air conditioning working at all times. All in all, we had mucho fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not 5 a star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice but not of 5 star quality. more like 3ish. The fitness equipment was a joke, outside in the open, rusty and wet on an astro turf covered wooden platform. The spa was also cold, when there was water in it. The buffet was good and the grounds were clean and well kept. The staff we checked in with were not helpful at all after we told them we were not interested in their sales pitch for time shares. The doors to the rooms were very loud when closing, so you would hear every time someone used a door in your building, this became very annoying as time went on. The tennis courts and archery 'range' were so infested with bugs, they were not even usable. One needs to be aware that different prices are offered to potential tourists, for the different excursions from the resort, depending upon what country you are from. They cater very much to Canadians and Europeans and seem to try and gouge the Americans. All in all, an OK place, but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Club El Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico so I was not sure what to expect at all. I went in with no expectations and I was pleasantly surprised. When we first got to the resort I was blown away by the entrance, the beautiful landscaping and the exotic flowers. The Lobby of this resort is a sight to see. Lots of places to sit and have a drink, with a large water fountain in the center. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help out. Our room was not ready when we checked in because we were early, so they showed us a place to change into our swimsuits and then held our luggage in a locked room until our rooms were ready. Each night they have a show in the theatre, and I thoroughly enjoyed the show we saw. Audience participation and a friendly staff made it an enjoyable experience. The Food was pretty good. The buffet had a good selection to choose from, and the restaurant by the pool was a great place to eat breakfast. they served omelets, toast, and other misc. breakfast foods. The gourmet restaurant upstairs was OK, but we preferred the buffet. The rooms were nice sized, and each had air conditioning. We had a few problems..our AC quit one day, but the repairmen came to our room and soon fixed it. The other problem was that a Gecco ( a small lizard) got into our room. The front desk sent someone over to get it right away-no big deal at all. The Geccos really don't bother you at all...they like to sit on the ceilings and walls. Overall I really enjoyed this resort and I would recommend it to anyone going to Mexico. We already plan to visit again in 2005 and I am sure we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited El Mandarin Nov. 1-5th. The visit was wonderful. The food was good and the staff was excellant. The guest service staff was always helpful. Our air conditioning broke and was fixed within an hour. Friendly little Geico's too keep everyone company. We were so exhausted from all our day trips that we didn't see many of the shows or experience the disco all that often. If you are looking for a relaxing time with a beautiful view. This is the place to go. I had a great time and I know the rest of the group that was with me did too.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am actually at Bravo Club El Mandarin and I was looking forward to a great holiday with great activities, sports and entertainment. I have been in more than 100 Clubs like Club Med, Ventaclub, Robinson, Aldiana, Garden Club, Allegro, Coralia but I never was in such a horrible Resort! First od all: The rooms are good and the food is good, but it is not 5 stars or "first class". It is average, nice decoration, smiling Mexican waiters and bar tenders but a horrible entertainment and activities team. Never saw such a poor service and people, not smiling, not greeting, no "Good morning" no "Hello" or "Hi", some of the girls smile sometimes. But how should they smile and greet if even the Manager doesn^t. No service, no chance to get some help to get a tennis partner! 25 minutes after volleyball is announced still no staff at the volleyball court. Staff is flirting with guests and not doing the job. The village is European has nothing to do with Mexico. They waste a lot of resources, use too much water and produce tons of plastic garbage. At the beach sometimes 3 different musics from 3 different spots, horrible stretching and a horrible programm. Guests are waitinhg permanently for the "primadonnas". Worst of all is the daily showtime. Sketches about gays and transvestites for more than 1 hour and the entertainment team doesn^t even stop when 50% of the guests have left. I saw programms that Club med played mor than 10 myears ago. Parts of "Cabaret" so so poor and horrible quality: the guy didn't even learn his playback! The members of the team are the ones who laugh most on stage, maybe they find it funny. Dear El Mandarin: I'D LIKE TO HAVE NICE HOLIDAYS. I'LL SPEND THE REST OF MY VACATION IN PLAYA, WILL RENT A CAR AND DRIVE TO MERIDA. No more poor and cheap programms at El Mandarin. If you continue like that, you will have to sell your Resort on the last minute market for low rates. Horrible Resort without emotions, without feelings, with arrogant and ignorant people - my ranking: 100% garbage!

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Bravo Club El Mandarin (Sept. 6 - 14) and had a great time. After reading all the negative reviews I was kind of nervous. The grounds were beautiful, our room was lovely and clean. The air conditioner with remote worked to whatever temperature you set and was very quiet. There seemed to be a lot of activity to do if you wanted. We preferred to go to the beach and we were never pestered. The water was clear and clean when we were there and no smell (other than the salt smell which I like) There is a pier out to one side but I also liked to walk out on that and see the pelicans. The other way you can walked for miles on deserted sand beach. There is a new hotel going up next door but we didn't hear any noise from it. We also thought the buffet was very good with a lot of choice and the staff were very courteous and friendly. It was rainy season when we went so we were prepared but we only had rain overnight one night. It was extremely hot and humid so I would probably go at a different time of year but nothing to do with the hotel. I loved the fact that you stepped outside your door and you were in the grounds not in a corridor. One tour we went on that I thought was great was the aquatic expedition. We went in a shuttle van with a small group. Our quide was Rauol and he was wonderful. We went to Akumel area and snorkelled in a lagoon and then out to the reef. It was also perfect visibility and calm which helped. We saw sea turtles and sting rays and tons of beautiful fish. We then went to Grand Cenote and snorkelled in the fresh water and into some caves. Very cool. We then packed up and went to a deserted beach south of Tulum and swam in the ocean there while lunch was prepared. It was wonderful sitting out under a simple hut, eating lunch, looking at the ocean. (Maybe not for the playacar set) Then after lunch we went inland and into a jungle area and snorkelled at another cenote. It was the least beautiful but filled with small fish and we saw some beautiful bright parrot like birds on the way there. All in all a great day.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the last 20 years my wife and I have spent at least one week a year in the tropics. Club El Mandarin is about as good as it gets. We rate resorts in the following criteria in this order. Clean. From the front gate to the beach this place is pristine. We have three judgments on clean. How does it look? How does it smell? How does it feel? The plants and grass are manicured each day. The beach and beach chairs are cleaned continually by people who have beach boy on their shirts. We had a house boy instead of a maid. He worked about an hour a day on our room. Not a speck of dirt or a grain of sand was left. Towels and sheets smelled and felt fresh and clean. All items in the dining rooms looked and felt super clean. No spots, no oily feel. The room. Large with beautiful marble tile. Freshly painted. Furniture looked new. The refrigerator worked well. A very comfortable king size bed. Sheets and pillows that felt very good. You adjust the air conditioner. The shower had so much water that I had to turn it down to be comfortable. The food. WOW. I could spend a whole page on freshness, presentation, variety and quality. We have been to 5 star resorts that did have food near this good. Fresh fruit and vegetables every day and we did not get sick. The Staff. They were wonderful. When we asked for anything not only did we get it right away, the person who provided it had the attitude that they had made a goal or hit a home run. The person we asked made us feel as if we had done them a favor. You should try this one before the rating goes to 5 or 6 stars and the price goes up with it.

Reviews.Title: “shocked by what we saw”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked the elmandarin because our travel agent told us it was rated as a five golden apple.we took 3 of our children and two of their friends.upon arrival we were shocked by what we saw.we had just caught the tail end of what looked like a gay convention.there were probably close to 100 men in the foyer area hugging and kissing.well to each his own but i was not going to expose my family to this resort.i immediately went to the apple rep and told him therewas no way i was going to stay.after about 4 hours and about 1700 dollars later we tranferred to another resort.i would not recommend this resort to anyone.P.S wrote apple vacations when we got back to no avail.make sure you do your homework before you book with apple.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Mandarin from July 31st til Aug 7th and had a wonderful time. We went with our 3 children, ages 15, 13 & 9. The Animation Staff kept us busy during our entire vacation. Beach Volleyball, Water Aerobics, Bocci, kids program, dance lessons, etc. kept everyone entertained. We thought the beach was beautiful and the water was clean and clear. The food was good, enough variety to keep everyone happy and the drinks were okay. The nightly entertainment was excellent and exceeded our expectations. From the price we paid for this vacation, which was very reasonable, the El Mandarin was pretty much what we expected. We expected a 4 star resort, and that's what it was. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. If you're looking for an affordable vacation with your family at a clean, friendly and fun resort, then I would recommend the El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Apples”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort should not have a 5 Apple rating - maybe a 2 would be suitable. I arrived there 07/26/03 and left the same day. A few of the staff members were friendly, but it seemed everyone knew that and went to them so they were too busy. The majority of the staff were not helpful at all - for example: I asked someone about the restaurants and activity schedules offered I was told "just go with the flow". When I asked a bar tender for a glass of water he pointed to a container and told me to get it myself. When we finally received a key to our room (after being there 5 hours) the staff member who was to take us there had our entire group walking in circles (literally) because he didn't know where to go. When we finally got in our room we were so disappointed - it was very hot and the AC could not be adjusted; no ceiling fan; there were more bugs flying in there than outside; the floor was dirty; the bathroom counter was covered in some slimy matter; the curtains were absolutely filthy; one of the patio chairs was broken... I would never advise anyone to reserve this hotel for their vacation. There are so many others to choose from that truly are worth the money and a 5 or 6 Apple rating (Gran Caribe, Iberostar Tucan, Iberostar Quetzel are a few that we've stayed at and enjoyed very much).

Reviews.Title: “this place is ****, literally”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was a joke, however we managed to make the most of our trip. We thought that we were going to be staying is a palace considering APPLE travel had given it 5 apples. The Oasis where we stayed two years ago was 3 apples and was 10 times better. Had we known that we could have transferred hotels earlier in the week we would have done so in a heartbeat. This is something that we felt APPLE travel could have mentioned when we booked this trip that cost us each over 1050.00 bucks!We arrived to the hotel and checked in rather quickly. Headed to the beach and were very disappointed in the water. Not really clear and blue like the other times we have been to Mexico. More green. Now this could have been caused by the tropical storm they had prior to our visit. The landscaping was beautiful and rooms were arranged in bungalows with about 7-8 rooms per bungalow. And of course ours was right next to the swamp or possibly the septic tank. Our room and the entire resort stunk like sewage. There were more mosquitos in our room then outside. Each night we killed at least 20 of them before falling to sleep and then waking up to even more the next morning. This is no lie, we took pictures of the mosquitos we killed to send them to APPLE. We wanted to sleep under the covers to avoid mosquito bites however, the AC was not working. It was extremely hot in our room the entire week! Calls were place by ourselves and other guests and it never got any cooler. No ceiling fans to even move the hot air around or possibly keep the mosquitos away from our bodies. The dresser was broken, along with the refrigerator and the two lamps that were in the room. Power was lost a few times we were there. One night it was out for over 4 hours. Which made the room even more hot because the AC was not even blowing out the typical warm air that it had been throughout the week. This place supposedly had a swim up bar. In past years swim up bar to me was you swim up to the bar without having to get out of the pool. At the El Mandarin you had to swim through the pool, get out and then walk to the bar. We were told that reservations to the "Gourmet" restaurant were made through guest services. After getting the run around we found out reservations were made through the place were you picked up your towels for the beach/pool. Go figure! The lobby was nicely decorated with lots of seats but it was like a sauna in there. Very, very HOT!There were four of us traveling and as of now all four have spent the day on the toilet. One got sick 2 days before leaving and the other three were at least able to make it back home. We expected the food to be not so good anyway, just because we are away from home etc. We stayed clear of the meats, seafood etc. and still got sick. Not sure if this was from the food or water. Supposedly the water was filtered. We did not drink the water but had drinks with ice i in them. We have visited the Mayan Rivera and Cancun previously and have never had an experience such as this one and have never been sick like this.The maids, waiters and other staff members were very pleasant and did their jobs excellent!If it wasn't for our sense of humor, we may have left Mexico earlier than planned. We would not recommend anyone staying at this resort, unless what we wrote above seems pleasing.One more thing, early one morning around 3:46 A.M. there was this knocking at our door, not once but many times. Almost sounded like someone trying to get in our room. We decided to get up and have a look and to our amazement it was a CRAB, yes a great big great had been scratching at our door so hard and so much that it woke us up. As silly as it sounds this truly did happen and we have footage of the CRAB!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love without saying a word”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort the week of July 26-Aug 2...and I found it to be quite lovely...the grounds were wonderful...and much to my surprise I fell in love at first site with a total stranger...being the shy type I never approached him, although our eyes did meet across a crowded lobby as he sat at a table by the bar, and I believe in my romantic heart that he felt something too. He looked totally startled as if he was awakened from some sleep...I believe he was from germany perhaps..very tall and blonde...If he is out there somewhere in the world...I would love to hear from him...Anyway the resort is worth visiting...I thought it was lovely and so was he.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Mandarin July 16-19, 2003. We were a bit worried since the hurricane, Claudette, had passed through the week before our scheduled trip, but we couldn't have asked for better weather. The resort was absolutely beautiful and the grounds were well kept. The buffet food was terrific and so much more than we both expected. The staff did a good job making sure our stay was an enjoyable experience. The resort had many great water activities to do during the day and entertaining shows and dancing in the disco at night. Thanks to the staff at Funjet who did an excellent job in helping us plan our snorkeling and shopping trips and provided transportation in a timely manner. We can't wait to visit Bravo Club El Mandarin again and we'd definitely recommend it for anyone planning a relaxing vacation on the Mayan Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say that our stay at the Club El Mandarin was very much " below Par!" Don't get me wrong. I am not a very fussy person. I like to relax with the best of them! However, it buy no means met my expectations. I must admit that Punta Cana in the D.R. is still at the top of my list! We arrived Cancun via Apple Vacations from Pittsburgh, PA. USA 300 Charter flight both too and fro were excellant! Great Service all around. Once checked in we were insturcted to go to our rooms that our luggage would be right up. Well, an hour later it did arrive only after I tracked down the bell boy at the front entrance and made a special request to have it brought to our room. The rooms are spacious but plain. However, tub is very narrow. No extra linen was provided. One towel per person. Wash clothes were not always left in the room after the maid cleaned. Our Tv had two channels and no remote. That's no biggy though we really didn't go there to watch tv anyhow. We had no hot water one entire day. Did call the front desk. Although someone came in to check our rooms water temp it still was not hot until the next day. There was a mini bar within a cupboard in the room. Was stocked with two bottles of water. That's all. All other resorts we stayed had a few bottles of the local beer, soda, etc, stocked daily. There was a safe in the closet. However, if you wanted to use it you had to pay $9.00 US dollars a day for a key. All inclusive???? That's [--]! SO much for all inclusive! I'll fill you in later. Why not now! Ok! The pamphlet you get when you check in say's snorkeling is included! Guess What? It's not! They said they have made some changes since that flyer was printed! Food: I must admit that the food was wonderful. Great selections both afternoon and evening. Overall presentation was very nice. Evening buffet was not open until 7pm or a little later on the norm. My husband is an extremely picky eater. He made out just fine though. I will say that the resorts in Punta Cana should take a few notes with respect to food preperation and presentation. But, think about it. Punta Cana is moon years behind Mexico as far as travelers. This I think is what I like. It's not built up or near as commercial as Mexico. At least not yet!!!! You get the true feel of the tropical Island atmosphere in Punta Cana. No Interstates, no Wal- Mart, No Chili's! Pool is not very attractive. Nothing special. Water was bath water warm, bottom was extremely slippery as well the water felt slimmy. You actually felt like you had a film on your skin. I am sure this is from all the tanning products. But, Can't they maintain this through chemicals or filteration systems? The beach I think was the most discouraging!!! Water had horrible odor. Not the crystal clear seas as you see in any catalog. Not by a long shot! The beach front of the hotel was groomed well. You just seemed so far from the water if you layed in the loungers. Humm, maybe that's not a bad thing because of the odor! lol Anyhow, if you read this and need more info I would love to chat about this trip. Oh, one other thing. When you check in you are given an arm band. You will find that Red is for US Folks (English). All other nationialties are given there own color code as well. Yes, that's right youa re color coded! Believe that one! This is good in one way only. And that's somewhat debatable!!!!! Most all of the staff speak a little of each lanquage. When they see the color of band they know exactly what lanquage you speak! That is if your not BI Linguial! HUMMMMMMM I had great fun with this while I was there! lol Entertianment: What's that??? Oh, they had a show at 10:00pm.....That's if you had not already retired to your room because there was nothing going on after you had dinner. I mean nothing! A small band playing american music out side of the lobby.. Hello, you are in the Islands. Something authentic would be a nice splash!!! You can only drink so much Tequilla for excitement! You know what I mean? I think the disco started up one night while we were there around 11:30pm.. It was after the show! It's funny that this bothered my husband and I. We are both very layed back people when it comes to night life. We don't go out often. But this place seemed like a retirement home not a Resort! No offense to the older croud. They had the same reaction....That comment was not directed toward the Smith's! You guys were much fun! And buy no mean's do we think your old! The two of you made our trip fun! Great People! Anyhow! I think I have touched all aspects. Like I said. It was an "OK" trip. Not a place I would recomend or ever return. I did hear wonderful reviews on my travels back that the Ibelostar (Spelling?) in PLaya Del Carmen was out of this world. Heck, it's right down the road from the CLub EL. Now They tell me.... Sue Kauffman

Reviews.Title: “Sick as dogs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Mandarin from July 13-20. It was our honeymoon, and we spent most of the time in our room or on the toilet. The beach is the WORST I have ever seen, except in Toronto harbour. There was a hidious smell coming from the beach the entire time we were there. We had to wait several hours to check in, and didn't receive our honeymoon champaigne and fruit until two days before we left, and only after I asked about it. The entertainment was ok, they were much more interested in the single women... Front desk, was not helpful or cooperative. Shuttle to Playa del Carmen was always full and then broke down, so there were no more trips. Bartenders were often annoyed when we asked for bottles of water. What few alcoholic drinks we had, they were severly watered down, and draught beer sucked. Nice grounds and the busboy in the restaurant was extremely nice. Servers in a la carte restaurant were rude and often annoyed if you didn't want to eat a course. Upon return I was immediately put on antibiotics for either FOOD POISONING OR ECOLI! BE CAREFUL WITH THIS RESORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: oohwhocancun
Reviews.Content: Visited 6/28 - 7/5. Was very pleased with the hotel. I have been to this area 9 times and the accomodations were above average to some resorts. The staff was friendly and they have a great selection of food which is good an plentiful. Water not as nice as other places on the Rivera Maya, but I was told it rained the entire week before we arrived, which has a lot to do with it. But, I believe it is on a bay which doesn't allow the water to be washed out as easily. This by far is not a Ritz Carlton, but I would rate it a 4+ resort. Have fun and enjoy!I already submitted my review for this hotel, but forgot to mention the Crabs!!!! We stayed at this resort 6/29/03 - 7/5/03 and not sure if it was mating season or if the rainy weather the week before we arrived contributed to the Crabs, but they were everywhere our first few days. Friends of ours had them climbing on their screens and patio like crazy. The kids enjoyed watching them and got a kick out of how many there were. Although, by midweek, they were down to a minimum. Just curious if anyone else has encountered them?

Reviews.Title: “The Animation Team was great!”
Reviews.Author: C14
Reviews.Content: The Animation team was great. They were very friendly an helpful at all times. They tryed to get everyone in involved in all of the activities. The team made my trip an experience I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visted Club El Mandarin June 20, 6 night stay with my son and my son's father. We had a GREAT TIME. The resort is very clean and beautiful and yes there was a sewer smell at times but it was no big deal you are in Mexico, our room as well was very clean- no leaks anywere. The staff was very good- I guess one plus is that we also speak spanish so it was a little easier to communicate. The food was good- breakfast was the best and the chesseburger and nachos at the snack bar were great- very addicting (I must say it does get little boring after a while). Drinks were a little water down- but they were are always willing to put more alcohol if you requested (I also tipped every now and then) they work really hard and they appreciate it. The pool was nice- the beach was OK- but hey its better than what we have here. My only advise to those who are single or couples with no kids and are looking to party this is diffently not the place for you it is very laid back, as (I mentioned in the beginning I went with my 7yr son so I was not into the parting mode) the resort is way in from the main road, so the only way to get around is via Taxi or shuttle. Please take my advise if you are looking for nightlife stay closer to Playa del carmen or cancun. I had read on a previous review, as far as, avoiding funjet tours-we reserved an excursion to Xel HA and I have to say I had no problem at all I was picked up on time-actually a little earlier and was dropped off on time. So overall I had a great time at Club EL mandarin and for the price I payed 1,688 for three people 6nts including air-all inclusive you cant beat that. One more thing- the animation team were good they work really really hard so give them a little credit. enjoy...............

Reviews.Title: “Security problem”
Reviews.Author: TheprofromDover
Reviews.Content: First the good news! The resort is beautiful,the food pretty good, and the entertainment excellent. The beach is nice but there is a fair amount of seaweed and the water clarity is poor. Security was our main concern. A previous review mentions money missing from a room safe. Well after dinner one evening at 9pm, we returned to our room to find a male resort employee in our room by the safe, and our luggage opened. We made a report and were told the individual caught in our room would be dealt with. What that means I dont have a clue. He could still be working there. So be very careful if you visit El Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent the week of May 25 - 31 at this all inclusive resort. We found the grounds beautiful and well maintained and the staff hardworking and accommodating. You can choose to be as active or inactive as you desire. Our tips: Stake out your lounge chairs at the beach or pool early, and I mean early, because shaded areas go fast. Take plenty small bills. Though tipping is not required, when you see the workers hustle you want to tip them and they are truly appreciative. I used #50SPF sunscreen and was glad I did. There were a lot of toasted people! It is a lot of walking between the rooms and the lobby but you get used to it. You can't reserve the shuttle or wake up calls more than a day in advance so do it while you're in the lobby, perhaps on the way to the bar or dinner. Other comments: the sewer smell people spoke of in other reviews is just the seaweed and natural decomposition. We were on the side by the construction next door and it never disturbed us. If you can't find something to eat and enjoy at the buffet you are way too picky. Check out all the food first before you start packing your plate. You'll find nice surprises further along the buffet line and off to the sides. We totally enjoyed ourselves and the El Madarin.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled all-inclusive, four-star before, and this hotel (while rated 5-star) is a low four-star. When we first arrived, we were a little disappointed. Even though the hotel is beautiful and the property is well maintained, the hotel is relatively small compared to others we had stayed in before, with what seemed like 200 people. There was always a lot of walking involved. The walk from the lobby/restaurant to the room, and the walk from the room to the beach. Our room was beautiful, but the bathroom showed signs of aging (the door frame was rotten), and after a few days I noticed a leak in the bathroom, which someone attempted to repair while we were out. (We found a removed tile later). We never heard the cleaning personnel in the mornings, and usually left a tip for them, which they thanked us for with fresh flowers and nice towel arrangements. As other people had mentioned in their reviews, I also noticed the sewage smell at the beach one day, and the row of buildings we stayed in was close to a wooded area, which also smelled strange. Other guests were from Canada, the U.S., Germany, Italy and Latin America; a nice mixture. If you are thinking of taking your small children, I noticed that there were not a lot of other kids around (I could count them on two hands). Also, there was no separate baby pool. We noticed that people with similar interests would hook up with each other after a few days. For example, a few party people who liked to drink at the beach, yell jokes at each other, and hang out, created a small group of eight and had fun this way. Several teenagers became friends after a while, and were seen together, and so forth. But, this is definitely not your Cancun party crowd. The swimming pool was relatively small, and had only one tiny, deep area for swimming. There are no swim-up bars. There was limited shade around the pool area, but more shade and straw huts at the beach. The beach had nice white sand, and the ocean was also nice, even though not what I had expected from stayhe water was murky at times, and I got a rash on my arms after a few days since I have very sensitive skin. (I don't know if it was from the water). This hotel was by itself, a few miles away from Playa del Carmen. There were no other properties next door, even though a new hotel is being built next door right now. Once I went jogging by myself around 7 p.m., and I felt a little strange running all by myself along the beach after I noticed locals in some type of shed in the wilderness following the construction area. The lights around the property were very dim in the evening, and I would not send children to explore the hotel during the evening by themselves. (I saw very limited security there). We received a separate key to turn on the A/C unit, which was a smart way to be energy-efficient, and provided an instant cold room once we returned. Our room did not have a refrigerator. The tap water was salty, and we made sure to brush our teeth with drinking water to avoid getting sick. There is fresh water all over the hotel. The telephone was very expensive, with a $7 connection fee and a rate of $5 per minute. But there is a cheaper Internet alternative at the hotel and in Playa del Carmen. (The hotel offers free buses to town). The food was buffet-style and was very good and fresh! Even though I am a picky eater, I always found something to eat. I liked the coffee, and the alcoholic drinks were not too sweet as in other resorts sometimes, but a little watered down during the day. As in other all-inclusives, there was a restaurant with hamburgers and hot dog-type of food by the beach for people who were too lazy to walk up to the main restaurant by the lobby. We had the feeling we'd get bored pretty soon, so we attempted to learn windsurfing, which we really enjoyed. The staff for non-motorized watersport was extremely nice, so was the entertainment staff who motivated people to participate in activities, such as aerobics, volleyball and salsa dancing, but wasn't pushy. Their idea was: "Go, have fun, this is hink!" There is a pool table, which is not in great condition, and a ping pong table with horrible peddles. The "gym" at the beach is very old, but I was able to use a few weight-lifting machines to keep in shape. The evening entertainment was okay. Of the three shows we saw, two times were dance evenings for which the hotel had hired dancers not belonging to the hotel, and one was a game evening for hotel guests. Some guests told us that they would go back to this hotel, which is understandable for people who usually go three star. Overall, it is a good value for the money, but from the four four-star all-inclusives I have been to before, this would be my least favorite because of its smaller size, the hotel being in the middle of no-where, the inconvenience of walking long distances, the limited entertainment options (unless you want to spend money on tours), the average beach, and the sewage smell.

Reviews.Title: “Aaaaahhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: IA_rover
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the El Mandarin. We were delighted with the resort, and had no real complaints. We were treated well, and enjoyed the resort immensely. Unless you are unusually picky, you couldn't go wrong. Keep in mind, though, that it is in the jungle in Mexico. There were geckos hanging out on the balconies, and in one spot, the scent of mangrove swamp can be detected. Our room had a few minor problems like a balcony light that didn't work, and they shut the water off for repairs for about fifteen minutes one evening. We accepted it as part of the adventure.As to the food, there was no need to go hungry. The buffet was abundant and varied, and quite good, with a number of cultures represented. It is buffet food, so don't expect the same sort of artful food as a fancy restaurant. However, it is much better than buffet food I've had elsewhere. The "gormet" meal wasn't that different, other than the service. Enjoy it, but skip the lamb chops - they only had about five bites of meat. Drinks were ever-present and generally tended to be mixed somewhat weak. I didn't travel to Mexico to spend the week plastered out of my mind, though, so I actually preferred them the way they were.Trips to town were fun - except that the air conditioning on the shuttle van was broken, so they tended to be warm. I guess that in Mexico it's pretty common for things to be broken. We spent a day at Xel-ha (loved it!) and took a tour from Alltournative that was an absolute blast.We used these reviews to decide to go to El Mandarin. It was worth it. Have fun.

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Maya Royale
HotelInfo.Address: Carretera Federal Chetumal, km. 299, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
